epitaph upon geffrey chaucer latin epitaphium galfridi chaucer per poetam laureatum stephanum surigonum mediolanenſem decretis licentiatum pyerides muſae ſi poſſint numen fletus fundere divinas atque rigare genas galfridi vatis chaucer crudelia fata plangite ſit lachrimis abſtinuiſſe nephas vos coluit vivens vos celebrate ſepultum reddatur merito gratia digna viro grande decus vobis eſt docti muſa maronis qua didicit melius lingua latina loqui grande novum que decus chaucer famam que paravit heu quantum fuerat priſca britanna rudis reddidit inſignem maternis verſibus ut jam aurea ſplendeſcat ferrea facta prius hunc latuiſſe virum nil ſi tot opuſcula vertes dixeris egregiis quae decorata modis socratis ingenium vel fontes philoſophiae quicquid arcani dogma ſacra ferunt et quaſcumque velis tenuit digniſſimus artes hic vates parvo conditus hoc tumulo ah laudis quantum praeclara britannia perdis dum rapuit tantum mors odioſa virum crudeles parcae crudelia filia ſororum non tamen extincto corpore fama perit vivet aeternum vivent dum ſcripta poetae vivent aeterno tot monumenta die si qua bonos tangit pieta ſi carmine dignus carmina qui cecinit tot cumulata modis haec ſibi marmoreo eglentine full well ſhe ſong tho ſervice devine entuned voice full ſemely french ſhe ſpake full fetou • ſchool stratford bow french paris unknow meat ſhe well ytaught withall let morſell fro lip fall broch gold full ſhene firſt writ crowned amor vincit omnia another nonne alſo ſhe chapleine prieſts three ¶the monke 5 monke fair maiſtry rider loved venery manly man abbot able full many dainty horſe gold ſpeciall ¶the wife bathe 15 good wife alſo beſide bathe ſhe ſome deale defe ſcathe cloth making ſhe ſuch haunt paſſed hem ipre gaunt pariſh wife ne none offring ſhould gone certain right wroth ſhe ſhe charitee kerchers full large fine ground durſt ſweare waiden ten pound sonday upon hedde hoſen fine ſcarlet redde full ſtraite iſtrained ſhoes full new bold face redde hew worthy woman liue husband church doore ſhe fiue withouten company youth thereof needed ſpeake nouth thriſe ſhe ieruſaleme paſſed many ſtrong ſtreme rome ſhe boloine cali ſainct iames coloine couthe moche wandring way gat tothed ſhe ſothly ſay vpon ambler eaſely ſhe ſatte iwimpled well hedde hatte brode bokeler targe foote mantell hippes large feete paire ſpurres ſharpe fellowſhip well couth ſhe laugh carpe remedy loue ſhe could perchance ſhe couth arte old dance ¶the parſone 16 good manne religioun poore parſone toun rich holy thought werke eke learned man clerke chriſtes goſpels truly would preach pariſhens devoutly would teach benigne wonder diligent adverſitie full pacient ſoch one proved oft ſithes full loth curſe tithe rather would yeuen doubt vnto poore pariſhens offring ſubſtaunce couthe little thing ſuffiſaunce wide pariſh houſes fer aſonder ne left neither raine ne thonder ſikeneſſe ne miſchiefe viſite ferdeſt pariſh moch lite vpon foot hand ſtafe noble enſample ſhepe yafe firſt wrought afterward taught goſpel word caught figure added eke thereto gold ruſt ſhould iron yef prieſt foule truſt wonder leude man ruſt ſhame prieſt take kepe ſee ſhitten ſhepherd cleane ſhepe well ought prieſt enſample yeue cleneneſſe ſhepe ſhould liue ſet benefice hire let ſhepe acomber mire renne london ſainct poules ſeken chauntrie ſoules brotherhede withold dwelt home kept well fold wolfe made hem miſcary ſhepherd mercenarie though holy vertuous ſinfull men diſpitous ne ſpeech daungerous ne digne teaching diſcrete benigne drawen folke heaven faireneſſe good enſample beſineſſe perſone obſtinate whether hie low eſtate would ſnibbe ſharply nonis better prieſt trowe none waited pompe ne reuerence ne maked ſpiced conſcience chriſtes lore apoſtles twelue taught firſt followed ſelue ¶the plowman 17 plowman brother iland dong many fother true ſwinker good living peace perfite charitee god loved beſt hart time though gained ſmart neighbour right himſelfe would threſh thereto dike delfe chriſtes ſake every poore wight withouten hire lay might tithe payed full faire well proper ſwinke cattell tabard rod upon mare alſo reue millare sompnour pardoner alſo manſiple ſelfe mo ¶the miller 18 miller ſtout carle none full bigg braune eke bone proved well came wraſtling would away ram ſhort ſhuldred thick gnarre doore would heue bar breake renning hedde beard sowe fore redde thereto brode ſpade vpon coppe right noſe hade werte thereon ſtode tufte heeres redde briſtles sowes eares noſtrels blacke wide ſwerd buckeler bare ſide mouth great furneis jangler golierdeis moſt ſinne harletriſe well couth ſteale corne toll thriſe yet thombe gold parde white coate blew hode weared bagpipe well couth blow ſoune therewithall brought u toune ¶the mancile 19 manciple temple catours might taken enſemple wiſe buying vitaile whether payed tooke taile algate waited ſo aſhate aye good eſtate god full faire grace ſoch leude mannes wit ſhould pace wiſedome heape learned men maiſters mo thriſe ten lawe expert curious doſen hous worthy ſtewards rent land lord england maken live proper good honour deptleſſe wood live ſcarſly liſt deſre able helpen ſhire caſe might fallen hap yet manciple ſet cap ¶the reue 20 reue ſlender cholerik man bearde ſhave nie ever heere eares round iſhorne top docked like prieſt beforne full long leg eke full lene like ſtaffe calfe ſeene well couth kepe garner binne none auditour coud win well wiſt drought raine yelding ſeed graine lord shepe nete deirie ſwine hors ſtore pultrie holly reuis governing covenant yaue rekening sith lord twentie yeere age could man bring arerage na bailie herde hine ne knew ſleight covine adradde death wonning full faire upon heath grene tree ſhadowed place couth better lord purchace full riche ſtored priuely lord could well pleaſe ſubtiliy yeue lene owne good thank yet coate hood youth learned good myſtere whele wright carpentere reue ſatte upon right god ſtot pomell gray height scot long ſurcote perce upon hade ſide bare ruſtie blade norfolke reue tell biſide toune men clepen baldeſwell tucked frere euer rode hindereſt route ¶the sompnour 21 sompnour u place fire red cherubins face ſaufleme iyen narow hot lecherous sparow ſcaled brow blacke pilled berde viſage child fore afferde na quickſilver litarge ne brimſtone borage ceruſe ne oile tartar none ne ointment would cleanſe bite might helpe whelk white ne knobbes ſitting chekes well loued garlike onion lekes drink ſtrong wine red blood would ſpeak cry wood well idronke wine would ſpeake word latine term coud two three learned ſome degree wonder heard daie ye knowen well eke iaie clepe watte well pope ſo couth thing grope ſpent philoſophie queſtio quid juris would crie gentill harlot kind better fellow ſhould man find would ſuffer quart wine good fellow concubine twelue month excuſe full full priuely eke finch couth pull found good fellawe would teachen none awe ſoch caſe arch deacon courſe man soul pourſe pourſe ſhould ipuniſhed pourſe arch deacon hell ſaid well wote lieth right dede curſing ought eke ſinfull man drede curſing woll ſlea aſoiling ſaveth alſo ware significav daunger giſe young girl diociſe knew counſaile red garlond ſet upon hed great aleſtake buckler maked cake ¶the pardoner 22 rode gentle pardonere rouncevall friend compere ſtrait come fro court rome full loud ſong come hider love ſone sompnour bare ſtiff burdoun never trompe half ſo great ſoun pardoner heer yellow wax ſomth hing doth ſtricke flax unces hing locke therewith ſhoulders overſprad full thinne laie culpons one one hode iolite ne weared none truſſed wallet thought rode new ſet diſhe vild ſave cappe rode bare soch glaring iyen hare vernacle ſowed upon cappe wallet beforne lappe bret full pardon come rome al hote voice ſmall hath gote berde ne never ſhould ſmoth new ſhave trow gelding mare craft fro barwike unto ware ne ſoch another pardonere male pillowhere ſaid lady vaile ſaid gobbet ſaile ſanct peter went vpon sea till ieſu chriſt hent croſs latine full ſtones glaſs pigges bone theſe relikes fond poore parſone dwelling uplond vpon day gat money parſone gat month twey thus fained flattering jape made parſone people ape truly tellen laſt church noble eccleſiaſt well couth read leſſon ſtorie alder beſt ſang offitorie full well wiſt ſong ſong muſt preach well afile tong winne ſilver full well coud therefore ſong ſo merily loud told ſothly clauſe ſtate araie eche number cauſe aſſembled companie southwerk gentell hoſtelrie hight tabard faſt bell time tell baren u like night hoſtelrie alight woll tell voiage remnaunt pilgrimage firſt pray courteſie ye ne arrete follie though plainly ſpeak matter tellen word eke chere ne though ſpeak word properly ye knowen well ſhall tellen tale man mote rehearſe nie ever everich word bee charge ſpeak never ſo rudely ne large elſe mote tellen tale untrue fein thing find word new may ſpare altho brother mote well ſay word another chriſt ſpake himſelf full brode holy writ well wotte villany eke plato ſaith ſo rede word mote coſin dede alſo pray forgive ſet folk degree tale ſhoulden ſtand wit ſhort ye may well underſtand great cheer made hoſte u verichone supper ſet u anone ſerved u vitaile beſt strong wine well drink u leſt ſeemly man hoſt marſhal lord hall large man iyen ſtepe fairer burgeis none chepe bold ſpeech wiſe well itaught manhood lacked right nought eke thereto right merry man ſupper plaien began ſpeak n •• th among thing made reckoning ſaid thus lordings truly ye welcome right heartily trouth ſhould lie ſaw year ſo merry company atones borough fain wold mirth wiſt mirth right bethought eaſe ſhall coſt nought ye gon canterbury god mote ſpede bliſsful martyr quite mede well wot ye gone way ye ſhapen talken play truly comfort ne mirth none riden way dumb ſtone therefore wold maken diſport ſaid erſt done ſome comfort liketh one aſſent ſtonden iudgment worchen ſhall ſay morrow riden way father soul deed ye merry give heed hold hand withouten ſpeech counſail long ſech v thouȝt worth make nice graunted without aviſe bad ſay verdit leſt lordings qd herkeneth beſt take nat pray disdain point ſpeak plat plain ech ſhorten others way viage ſhall tellen tale tway canterbury ward mean ſo homewards ſhall tell tale two venture whilom han befall hereth beſt ſain tellen caſe tale beſt ſentence moſt ſolace shall ſupper alder coſt place ſitting poſt comen ayen canterbury make merry ſelven goodly ride right mine coſt guide woll judgment ſay shall pay ſpend way yef ye vouchſafe ſo tell anone without word mo woll erly ſhape therefore thing granted oath ſwore glad hert praiden alſo would vouchſafe ſo would ben governour tale judge reportour ſet supper certain priſe wollen ben demed deviſe hie low thus one aſſent ben accorded judgment thereupon wine fette anone dronken reſt went ilke one withouten lenger tarying morrow day gan ſpring vp roſe hoſt alder cocke gadird u togedirs flocke forth riden little paas vnto watering ſaint thomas hoſt began horſe areſt ſaid lord herkeneth leſt ye wote forward record eve ſong morrow ſong accord let ſee ſhall tell firſt tale ever mote drink wine ale ſo rebel iudgment shall pay way ſpent draweth cut ye farther twin hath ſhorteſt ſhall begin sir knight qd maiſter lord draweth cut mine accord commeth nere qd lady prioreſs ye ſir clerk let ſhamefaſtneſs ne ſtudieth nought lay hand every man anone draw every wight began ſhortly tellen aventure chaunce caas ſothe cut fill knight blith glad every wight tell muſt tale reaſon forward compoſition ye han heard nee deth word mo good man ſaw ſo wiſe obedient keepen forward free aſſent ſaid ſithen ſhall begin game welcome cut goddeſname let u ride herkeneth ſay word riden forth way began right merry chere tale anone right ye ſhall hear ¶thus endeth prologue canterbury tale knight tale palamon arcite pair friend fellowpriſoners fight combat duke theſeus lady emely siſter queen ipolita wife theſeus tale fitting perſon knight diſcourſeth deed arm love lady whilome old ſtories tellen u duke hight theſeus athens lord governour time ſuch conquerour greater none ſon full many rich country wisdom chivalry conquered reigne feminy whilome ycleaped cithea wedded queene ipolita brought home country mikell glory ſolemnity eke young ſiſter emely thus victory melody let worthy duke athens ride hoaſt armes beſide certes nere long would told fully mannere wonnen reign feminy theſeus chivalry great battaile none betweene athens amaſones beſieged ipolita young hardy queene cithea feaſt wedding tempeſt home coming thing mote forbear god wot large field ear weked ben ox plow remnant tale long ynow letten eke none rout let every fellow tell tale let ſee ſhall ſupper win left begin duke make mencioun come almoſt toun wele moſt pride ware caſt eye aſide knee led hight wey company lady twey twey clad cloth black ſuch cry ſuch wo make world ni creature living ever heard ſuch waimenting cry nold never ſtenten till reines bridle henten folke ye mine home coming perturben ſo feaſt cry quod theſeus ye ſo great envy mine honour thus complain cry hath misbode offended telleth may amended ye clothed thus black oldeſt lady ſpake ſhe ſowned deadly chere ruth ſee ſaid lord fortune hath yeve victory conquerour live nought greeveth u glory honour beſeeke mercy ſuccour mercy wo diſtreſs drop pity thy gentilneſs vpon u wretched woman let thou fall certes lord ni none u ſhe ne hath ducheſs queen caitives well iſeen thanked fortune falſe wheel none eſtate aſſureth wele certes lord abide preſence temple goddeſs clemence waiting fourtenight helpe u lord ſith lieth thy might wretch weep wailen thus whylome wife king campaneus ſtarfe thebe curſed day aray maken lamentacioun loſten husband toun siege ſay yet old creon welaway lord thebe city fulfilled ire iniquity deſpight tyranny done dead body villany lord ben ſlaw hath body heap • raw ſuffer hem none aſſent neither buried ne brent maketh hound eat hem deſpite word without repite fallen grofly crien pitouſly u wretched woman ſome mercy let ſorrow ſinke thine hert gentle duke horſe ſtert hert pitous heard hem ſpeak thought hert would break ſaw hem ſo pitous ſo mate whylome ſo great aſtate armes hem hent hem comforted full good intent ſwore oath true knight would done ſo fer forthly might vpon tyrant creon hem wreake people greece ſhould ſpeake creon theſeus yſerved hath death full well deſerved right anon withouten abode banner diſplayed forth rode thebe ward hooſt beſide neere athens nold go ne ride ne take eaſe fully half day onward way night lay ſent anon ipolita quene emely young ſiſter ſhene vnto toune athens dwell forth rideth ni tell red ſtatue mar ſpear targe ſhineth white banner large field glyttren doun banner borne penon gold full rich ybete minotaure crete thus rideth duke conquerour hoaſt chivalry flour till came thebe alight fair field thought fight ſhortly ſpeaken thing creon thebe king fought ſlew manly knight plain battaile put folk flight ſaut wan city rent adowne wall ſpar rafter lady reſtord body husband ſlain done obſequies tho giſe long deviſe great clamour weimenting lady made brenning body great honour theſeus noble conquerour doth lady went ſhortly tellen mine intent worthy duke theſeus hath creon ſlaine wan thebe thus still field took night reſt country leſt ranſacke taas body deed hem ſtrip harneis weed pillours buſineſs cure battaile diſcomfiture ſo befell taas found though girt many grievous wound two young knight lying armes fame wrought full richely two arcite hight one hight palamon fully quick ne fully dead coat armour gere heraulds knew hem beſt ſpecial tho blood rial thebe ſiſtren two yborn taas pillours hath hem torn han hem caried ſoft tent theſeus full ſoon hem ſent athens dwellen priſon perpetuall nold hem raunſon worthy duke thus idone tooke hoaſt home goth anone iawrel crowned conquerour liveth joy honour tearm life needeth word mo toure anguiſh wo dwelleth palamon fellow arcite evermore may gold hem quite thus paſſeth yere yere day day till fell morrow may emely fairer ſeen lilly upon ſtalke green freſher may floures new roſe colour ſtrofe hew fairer two er day wont ariſen ready dight may woll ſlogardy night ſeaſon pricketh every gentell hert maketh ſleep ſtert ſaith ariſe may obſervaunce maketh emely remembrance done honour may riſe iclothed ſhe freſh deviſe yellow haire broided treſſe behind backe yard long geſſe gardyn ſunne upriſt walketh downe liſt gathereth floures party white reed make ſubtell garland heed angel heavenly ſhe ſong great toure ſo thick ſtrong caſtell chefe dungeon wherein two knight priſon told tellen ſhall even joynant gardyn wall emely playing bright ſonne clere morning palamon woful priſoner wont leave gayler riſen romed chambre high noble cite ſigh eke gardyn full braunches grene freſh emely ſhene walk romed ſorrowful priſoner palamon goth chambre roming fro himſelf complaining wo borne full oft ſaid ala ſo befell auenture caas window thick many bar yron great ſquare ſpar caſt eyen upon emilia therewith blent cried ha ha though ſtongen unto hert cry arcite anon ſtert ſaid coſin mine eyleth thee art ſo pale deadly ſee cryeſt thou hath thee offence goddes love take pacience priſon may none fortune hath yeven u adverſite wicked aſpect diſpoſition saturne ſome conſtellation hath yeven u altho ſworn ſtood heauen born mote endure ſhort plain palamon anſwered ſaid coſyn forſoth opinion thou haſt vain imaginacion priſon cauſed cry hurt right mine eye mine herte woll bane fairneſs lady ſe yond gardyn roming fro cauſe cry wo wher ſhe woman goddeſs venus ſothly gueſs therewithall knee fyll ſaid venus thy gardyn thus tranſfigure beforne ſorrowful wretched creature priſon help may ſcape deſtiny ſo iſhape eterne word dyen priſon linage ſome compaſſion ſo low ybrought tyranny word arcite gan eſpy whereas lady romed fro ſight beauty hurt ſo palamon wounded ſore arcite hurt much ſigh ſaid pitouſly freſh beauty ſleeth ſodenly rometh yonder place mercy grace may ſeen leaſt way nam dead ny ſay palamon whan theſe word herd diſpitouſly looked anſwerd whether ſayſt thou erneſt play nay quod arcite erneſt fay god help ſo liſt full yll pley palamon gan knit browes twey quod thee great honour falſe ne traytour thy coſyn thy brother iſworne full depe u never dien pain till death depart ſhall u twain neither u love hindre ne none caſe leve brother thou ſhouldeſt truly every caſe ſhould thee thine oth mine alſo certain wot well thou darſt withſain thus art thou counſell dout thou woldeſt falſly ben love lady love ſerve ever ſhall till mine hert ſterve certes falſe arcite thou ſhalt ſo loved firſt told thee wo counſell brother ſworne told beforne thou art thounden knight helpen lye thy might elſe art thou falſe dare well ſain arcite full proudly ſpake thou ſhalt quod rather falſe thou art falſe tell thee utterly paramour loved firſt thou wilt thou ſain thou wiſt whether ſhe woman goddeſs thine affection holineſs mine love creature told thee mine aventure coſin brother ſworne suppoſe thou lovedſt beforne woſt thou well old clerk ſaw ſhall give lover law love greater law pan may yeven earthly man therefore poſitive law ſuch decree broken day love eche degree man mote need love maugre head may fleen tho ſhuld dead ſhe maid widow elſe wife eke likely thy life ſtonden grace ſhall well thou woſt thy ſelfe verely thou damned priſon perpetual u gaineth raunſon ſtriven hound bone fought day yet part none ther came cur wer ſo wroth bare away bone hem therefore king court brother man himſelf none love thou liſt love aye ſhall ſoothly lefe brother priſon mote endure everich u taken aventure great ſtrife long betwixt hem twey leiſure ſey theffect happed day tell ſhortly may worthy duke hight perithous fellow duke theſeus sith thilke day child lite come athens fellow viſite play wont world loved man ſo loved tenderly well loved old book ſaine one dead ſoothly tell fellow went ſought hell ſtorie liſt write duke perithous loved well arcite know thebe yere yere finally requeſt prayere perithous withouten raunſon duke theſeus let priſon freely gone whether liſt ſuch guiſe tellen ſhall forward plainly endite betwixt duke theſeus arcite ſo arcite yfound ever life day night ſtound countrey duke theſeus caught accorded thus ſword ſhould leſe heed remedy ne reed taketh leave homeward ſped let beware neck lieth wed great ſorw ſuffereth arcite death feeleth hert ſmite weepeth waileth crieth pitouſly ſleen himſelf waiteth prively ſaid ala day borne priſon worſe beforne ſhap eternally dwell nought purgatorie hell ala ever knew perithous elſe dwelt theſeus fettered priſon evermo bliſs wo ſight ſet though never grace may deſerve would ſufficed right ynough deare couſin palamon quod thine victorie aventure full bliſſul priſon maieſt thou endure priſon nay certes paradice well hath fortune thee turned dice haſt ſight thabſence poſſible ſithens thou haſt preſence art knight worthy man able ſome caſe ſince fortune changeable thou maieſt ſometime thy deſire attain exiled barraine grace ſo great deſpair ni water earth fire ne aire ne creature hem maked may heale done comfort well ought ſterve wanhope diſtreſſe farewell life luſt gladneſſe ala playnen men ſo commune purueyance god fortune yeueth hem full oft many giſe well better hemſelfe deviſe man deſireth haue richeſſe cauſe murdre ſickneſſe ſoure man wold priſon faine houſe meyne ſlaine infinite harmes bene mattere wote thing prayen faren dronke mouſe dronken man wot well hath houſe wot right way thider dronken man way ſlider certes world ſo faren ſeken faſt felicite go wrong full oft truly thus may ſay namely wenden great opinion might ſcape fro priſon • oy perfite hele exiled fro wele sith may ſeene emely nam dead ny remedy ¶vpon ſide palamon whan wiſt arcite gon ſorrow maketh great tour reſowned yelling clamour pure fetter ſhinnes grete bitter ſalt teares wete ala quoth arcite coſyn mine ſtrife god wot frute thine thou walkeſt thebe large wo thou yeueſt little charge thou maiſt ſith thou haſt wiſdom manhed aſſemble folke kindred make warre ſo ſharpe countre ſome auenture ſome treate thou maieſt haue lady wife muſt nedes leſe life way poſſibilite sith thou art thy large priſon fre art lord great thine advantage mine ſterve cage may wepe wayle while liue wo priſon may yeue eke paine loue yeueth alſo doubleth tourment wo therewith fire jelouſie vp ſtert within breſt hent hert woodly likely behold boxe tree aſhen deed cold ſaid cruell goddes governe world word eterne written table athamant parliament eterne graunt mankind unto yhold ſhepe rouketh fold ſlain man right another beeſt dwelleth eke priſon arreſt hath ſickneſſe great adverſite oft time giltleſſe parde governance preſcience giltleſſe turmenteth innocence encreaſeth thus penance man bounden obſeruaunce god ſake leten beeſt may luſts fulfill whan beeſt dead hath pain death man mote wepe plain though world haue care wo without dout may ſtonden ſo anſwere lete diuines well wote world great pine ala ſee ſerpent thefe many true man hath miſchiefe gon large liſt may turn mote ben priſon saturn eke iuno jalous eke wood hath ſtroied well nye blood thehes waſt walles wide venus ſleeth ſide ielouſie feare arcite ſtint palamon alite let priſon ſtill dwell arcite forth woll tell ſommer paſſeth night long encreaſeth double wiſe paine ſtrong lover priſoner hath wofuller miſter ſhortly ſay palamon perpetuel damned priſon chaines fetter deed arcite exiled heed euermore countre ne neuermore ſhall lady ſe louers aſke queſtion hath worſe arcite palamon one may ſe lady day day priſon mote dwell aſway liſt may ride go ſene lady ſhall neuer mo deemeth ye liſt ye woll tell forth tale began ¶whan arcite thebe comen ful oft day ſwelt ſaid ala ſene lady ſhall neuer mo ſhortly conclude wo mikell ſorrow made neuer creature ſhal world may dure ſlepe meat drinke byraft leane waxeth drie ſhaft eyen hollow griſly behold hew pale fallow aſhen cold ſolitary ever alone wailing night making mone heard ſong inſtrument would wepe might ſtent feble ſpirits ſo low changed ſo man coud know ſpeech ne voice though men herd gyre world ferd nought comly like louers malady eros rather like manie engendred humour melancolike beforne fell fantaſtike ſhortly turned vp ſo doun habit diſpoſicioun wofull louer arcite ſhould day wo endite whan endured yere two cruell torment paine wo thebe countre ſaid vpon night ſlepe laid thought winged mercury beforne ſtood aud bad mery ſlepy yerd hand bare vpright hat weered vpon hair bright irayed god toke kepe argus tooke ſlepe ſaid thus athens ſhali thou wend ſhapen thy woe end word arcite awoke ſtert truly ſore ever ſmert quod athens right wol fare ne drede death ſhall ſpare ſee ladie loue ſerve preſence recke ſterve word caught gret mirrour ſaw chaunged colour ſaw viſage another kind right anon ran mind ſith face ſo diſfigured malady indured might well bare low live athens evermore unknow ſene ladie welnigh day day right anon chaunged aray clad poore labourer alone ſaue ſquier knew privitie caas diſguiſed poorly athens gone next way court went vpon day gate profered ſervice drugge draw men would deuiſe ſhortly matter ſaine fell office chamberlaine dwelling emelie wiſe ſoone couth eſpie euery ſeruaunt ſerued well couth hewen wood water bere yong mightie none thereto ſtrong big bone done wight gan deuiſe yere two ſervice page chamber emelie bright philoſtrate ſaid hight halfe ſo wel beloued man ne none court degre ſo gentill conditioun court renown ſaid charitie theſeus would enhauneen degre put worſhipfull ſeruice might vertue exerciſe thus within name ſprong deed good tong theſeus hath taken ſo nere chamber made ſquier yaue gold maintaine degre eke men brought countre fro yere yere full prively rent honeſtly ſlyly ſpent man wonderd three yere wiſe life lad bare ſo peace eke wer na man theſeus durſt der bliſſe let arcite ſpeake woll palamon alite darkeneſſe horrible ſtrong priſon ſeven yere hath ſitten palamon forpined woe diſtreſſe feeleth double ſore heuineſſe palamon loue diſtraineth ſo wood wit goeth wo eke thereto priſonere perpetuell onely yere coud rime engliſh properly martirdome forſooth therefore paſſe lightly may befell ſeuenth yere may third night old bookes u ſaine ſtorie tellen plaine aduenture deſtine thing ſhapen ſhal ſoone midnight palamon helping friend brake priſon fleeth citie faſt may go yeuen gailer drinke ſo clarrie made certaine wine narcotiſe opie thebe fine night though men would ſhake gailer ſlept nught awake thus fleeth faſt may night ſhort faſt day need coſt mote himſelfe hide grove faſt beſide dreadfull foot ſtalketh palamon ſhortly opinion grove would hide day night would take way thebe ward friend prie theſeus help warrie ſhortly either would leſe life win emelie unto wife effect intent plaine turne arcite againe little wiſt nie care til fortune brought ſnare merrie larke meſſenger day saleweth ſong morrow gray fierie phebus riſeth ſo bright oriſont laugheth ſight ſtremes drieth greues ſiluer drop hanging leues arcite court riall theſeus ſquire principall riſen looketh merrie day doen obſeruaunces may remembring point deſire courſer ſtartling fire riden fieldes pley court mile twey groue told aduenture way gan hold maken garlond greves woodbind hauthorn leves loud ſong ayenſt sonne ſhene may thy floures thy grene welcome thou ſaid faire freſh may hope ſome greene thing get may courſer luſty hert groue full haſtily ſtert path romed vp doun aduenture palamon buſh man might ſe ſore afraied death nothing ne knew arcite god wot would trowed full lite ſooth ſaid gone ſithen many yeres field hath iyen wood hath eres full fair man bear euin day men mete vnſet ſteuin full little wote arcite felaw ſo nigh hearken ſaw buſh ſitteth full ſtill arcite romed fill ſongen roundell luſtily ſtudie fell ſodenly doen theſe louers queint gires crop doun brires vp doune boket well right friday ſoothly tell raineth ſhineth faſt right ſo gan gerie venus ouercaſt heart folke right day gerifull right ſo chaungeth ſhe aray selde friday weeke ilike arcite ſong gan like ſet doune withouten ala qd day bore long iuno thy crueltee wilt thou warren thebe citee ala ybrought confuſion bloodriall cadmus amphion cadmus ſay firſt man thebe built firſt toune began citie firſt crowned king linage ſpring line ſtocke riall ſo caitife ſo thrall mortall enemie mought ſerue ſquire poorely yet doeth iuno well ſhame dare know mine owne name wont hight arcite hight philoſtrat worth mite ala thou fell mar ala thou iuno thus hath ire linage fordo save onely wretched palamon theſeus martireth priſon ouer ſlean vtterly loue hath fierie dart ſo brenningly ſticked thorough true carefull hert ſhapen death erſt ſhert ye ſlean eyen emelie ye cauſe wherefore die remnaunt mine care ne ſet mountaunce tare coud ought pleaſaunce word fell doun traunce long time afterward vp ſtert palamon thought thro hert felt cold ſword ſodenly glide ire quoke lenger would bide heard arcites tale wood face dead pale ſtert vp buſhes thicke ſaid arcite thou falſe traitour wicke art thou hent loveſt ladie ſo pain wo art blood counſell ſworn full oft told thee beforn haſt beyaped duke theſeus falſely haſt chaunged thy name thus dedde el thou ſhalt die thou ſhalt loue ladie emelie loue mo palamon thy mortall fo though weapon place priſon aſtert grace dred nat either thou ſhalt die thou ne ſhalt nat louen emelie theſe thou wilt thou ſhalt affert arcite full diſpitous hert hym knew tale heard fers lion pulled ſwerd ſaied god ſitteth aboue ne wer thou art ſick wood love eke thou weapen haſt place thou ſhouldeſt never grove pace thou ne ſhouldeſt dien mine hond defie ſuertie bond thou ſaiſt made thee fool think well love free love maugre thy might foraſmoche thou art knight wilneſt daren battaile truth morow fail without witting wight founden knight bringen harneis right inough thee cheſe beſt leave worſt meat drinke night bring ynough thee clothes thy bedding ſo thou ladie win ſlea wodde thou maieſt well haue thy ladie palamon anſwered grant thee thus departed till morow ech hem laid faith borow cupide charitee oreigne wouldeſt haue felow thee full ſoth ſaied loue ne lordſhip woll nat thankes haue fellowſhip find arcite palamon arcite ridden anon toun morow day light full priuely two harneis dight ſufficient mete darreigne battail field betwixt hem tweine horſe alone borne carrieth harneis beforne groue time place iſet arcite palamon met changen gan colour face right hunter reigne trace ſtandeth gappe ſpeare hunted lion beare hereth ruſhing leues breaketh bough greues thinketh cometh mortal enemy without faile muſt dedde either mote ſlea gap mote ſlea miſhap ferden chaunging hew farre euerich knew na good day ne ſaluing ſtreight without word rehearſing eueriche hem helped arme friendly owne brother ſharp ſpeares ſtrong foinen ech wonder long thou mighteſt wenen palamon fighting wood lion cruell tigre arcite wild bore gan fight ſmite frothen white ſome ixe wood vp ancle foughten blood wiſe let hem fighting dwell forth woll theſeus tell deſtinie miniſter generall executeth world ouer purveiance god hath ſaid beforne ſtrong though world ſworne contrary thing ye nay yet ſometime ſhall fall day fell never yet thouſand yere certainly appetite warre peace hate loue ruled ſight aboue meane mightie theſeus hunt ſo deſirous namely great hart may bed daweth day ni clad ready ride hunt horne hound beſide hunting hath ſoch delite ioy appetite himſelfe great hart bane mar ſerueth diane clere day haue told theſeus ioy bliſs ipolita faire quene emelie iclothed greene hunting ridden rially groue ſtood faſt ther hart men told duke theſeus ſtreight way hath hold land rideth full right thither hart wont haue flight ouer brook ſo forth wey duke woll haue courſe twey hound ſoch liſt commaund duke comeninto laund vnder ſonne looked anon warre arcite palamon foughten breme bulles two bright ſwords wenten fro hidiouſly leſt ſtroke ſemed would fellen oke nothing ne wote duke ſpors courſer ſmote ſtart betwixt hem two pulled ſword cried ho paine leſing head mightie mar ſhall anone dead ſmiteth ſtroke may ſeen telleth miſter men ye ſo hardie fighten without iudge officere though liſtes rially palamon anſwered haſtily ſaid ſir nedeth word mo haue death deſerued two two wofull wretch caitiues encombred liues thou art rightfull lord iudge ne yeue v neither mercie ne refuge ſlea firſt ſaint charite ſlea fellow well ſlea firſt though thou know lite thy mortal foe arcite fro thy ſand baniſhed head hath deſerved dead came unto thy yate ſaied hight philoſtrate thus hath iaped full many yere thou haſt made thy chief ſquiere loveth emelie ſith day come ſhall die make plainly confeſſion thilke wofull palamon hath thy priſon broke wickedly thy mortall foe loueth ſo hot emelie bright woll die preſent ſight wherefore aſke death iewiſe ſlea fellow ſame wiſe haue deſerved ſlaine worthy duke anſwered anon againe ſaied ſhort concluſion owne mouth owne confeſſion hath damned woll record needeth pine cord ye ſhall dead mighty mar redde queene anon womanhedde gan weepe ſo emelie lady companie great pitie thought hem euer ſuch chaunce ſhould befall gentleman great eſtate nothing loue debate ſaw bloudie wound wide ſore criden leſſe mercie lord upon v woman bare knee adoune fall wold haue kiſt foot ſtood till laſt aſſaked mood pitie renneth ſoone gentle hert though firſt ire quoke ſtert hath conſidered ſhortly clauſe treſpaſſes hem eke cauſe although ire gilt accuſed yet reaſon hem excuſed thus thought well euery man woll helpe himſelfe loue eke deliue • himſelfe priſon eke heart compaſſion woman weepen euer one gentle heart thought anone foft vnto himſelfe ſaied fie vpon lord woll haue mercie lion word deed hem repentaunce dreed well proud diſpitous man maintaine firſt began lord hath little diſcretion ſuch caſe diffinition weigheth pride humbleneſſe one ſhortly ire thus agone gan looken vp eyen light ſpake place theſe word hight god loue ah benedicite mightie great lord againe might gaineth obſtacles may cleaped god miracle maken owne giſe everich hart liſt deuiſe lo arcite palamon quietly priſon gon might haue liued thebe riaſly knowne mortall enemie death power alſo yet hath loue maugre eyen two brought hem hither die looketh great follie may foole loue behold god ſake ſitteth aboue see bleed well araied thus hath lord god loue hem paied wage fee ſeruice yet wenen full wiſe ſerue loue ought may befall yet beſt game ſhe 〈◊〉 haue iollite con hem therefore much thanke wot hote fare god wot cuckow hare mote aſſaied hot cold man mote foole yong old wot ſelfe full yore agone time ſeruant one therefore ſith know loues paine wot ſore man diſtraine oft hath caught iaa foryeue wholly treſpaas requeſt queen kneeleth eke emely ſiſter dere ye ſhall anon vnto ſwere ye ſhall neuer country dere ne make warre vpon night ne day friend ye may foryeue treſpaſs every dele ſware aſking fair wele lordſhip mercie praid hem graunted grace thus ſaid ſpeake worthie linage richeſſe though ſhe queen princeſſe ilke worthie doubtleſſe wed time netheleſſe ſpeake ſiſter emelie ye haue ſtrife ielouſie ye wot ſelfe ſhe may wed two one though ye fighten euermo one loth lefe mot goe pipe yuie leafe ſay ſhe may haue ye neuer ſo iealous ne ſo wroth therefore put degre ſhall haue deſtine ſhape hearken wiſe lo end ſhall deuiſe plat concluſion without replication liketh take beſt euerich ſhall goe leſt freely without ranſome daungere day fiftie weekes ferre ne nere euerich ſhall bring c knight armed liſts upon right alredy darrein battaile behote withouten faile vpon truth true knight whether hath might ſay whether thou may hundred ſpake slea contrary liſts driue ſhall yeue emely wiue fortune yeueth ſo fair grace liſts ſhall make place god ſo wiſely ſoule rew ſhall euen iudge trew ye ſhall none end make one ſhall dedde take ye thinken well iſaid saith aduiſe hold well apaid end concluſion looketh lightly palamon ſpringeth ioy arcite could tell could rightly endite great ioy made place theſeus done ſo fair grace doun knee went euery maner wight thanked hert might namely theſe thebanes full many ſith thus good hope hert blith taken leue homward gan ride thebe ward old wals wide trow men would deme negligence foryetten tell diſpence thebe goeth buſely maken vp liſts rially ſuch noble theatre dare well ſay world na circuit whereof mile walled ſtone diched round ſhape manner compas full degree hight ſixtie paas man ſet one degree letted fellow ſee eaſtward ſtood gate marble white weſtward right ſuch another thoppoſite ſhortly conclude ſuch place none yearth ſo little ſpace lond na craft man geometrie arithmetike ne purtreiture ne caruer image theſeus ne gaue meat wage theatre make deuiſe rite sacrifice eaſtward hath upon yate aboue worſhip venus goddeſſe loue doe make auter oratorie weſt ſide memorie mar maked ſuch another coſt gold largely fother northward turret wall alabaſter white red corall oratorie riche ſe worſhip diane goddes chaſtite hath theſeus doe wrought noble wiſe yet foryetten deuiſe noble caruings purtreitures ſhape countenaunce figure oratory three firſt temple venus thou maieſt ſee wrought wall full pitouſly behold broken ſleepes ſighs cold ſalt teares weimenting fire ſtrokes deſiring loues ſeruants life enduren othes couenants aſſuren pleaſaunce hope deſire foolehardineſſe beautie youth braudrie richeſſe charmes ſorcerie leaſing flatterie diſpence buſineſſe ielouſie weared yellow gold garland cuckow ſitting hand feaſts inſtruments carol daunces iuſts array circumſtaunces loue reken reken ſhall order painted wall mo make mencion ſothly mount citheron venus hath principall dwelling ſhewed wall purtreing ioy luſtineſſe nought foryetten portreſſe idleneſſe ne narciſſus faire yore agon ne yet follie king salomon ne yet great ſtrength hercules thenchauntment medea circe ne turnus hardie corage rich creſus caitife ſeruage thus may ſeen wiſdome ne richeſſe beautie ne ſlight ſtrength ne hardineſſe ne may venus hold champartie liſt world may ſhe gie lo theſe folke ſo cought laas till wo full oft ſaid ala sufficeth one example two though coud reken thouſand mo ſtatue venus glorious ſee maked fleeting large ſee fro nauell doune couered waues grene bright glas citriole right hand ſhee hedde full ſemely ſee roſe garland freſh well ſmelling aboue hedde doues flittering ſtood ſonne cupido vpon ſhoulders wing two blind oft ſene bow arrowes bright kene ſhould well tellen purgatory thereabout ouer within temple mightie mar rede painted wall length brede like eſtris griſly place hight great temple mar thrace thilke cold froſtie region mar hath ſoueraine mancion firſt wall painted forreſt wonneth nother man ne beaſt knottie knarie barrein tree old ſtubs ſharpe hidious behold romble ſwough though ſtorme ſhould break euery bough downward hill vnder bent ſtood temple mar armipotent wrought burned ſtele thentre long ſtreight gaſtly ſee thereout came ſuch rage viſe made gate riſe northern light dores ſhone window wall none throgh men might light diſcerne dores athamant eterne • lenched ouerthwart head long yron tough maken ſtrong every piller temple ſuſteine tonne great yron bright ſhene ſaw firſt dark imagining fellonie eke compaſſing cruell ire red glede pickpurſe alſo eke pale drede ſmiler knife cloke ſhepen brenning blacke ſmoke treaſon murdring bed open war wound bled conteke bloody kniues ſharp manace full chirking ſorrie place ſleer himſelfe yet ſaw heart blood hath bathed naile ydriuen ſhode hight cold death mouth gaping vpright amids temple ſate miſchaunce diſcomfort ſorrie countenaunce yet ſaw woodneſſe laughing rage armed complaint theft fierce courage carraine buſh throte ycorue thouſand ſlaine qualme iſtorue tirant prey force iraft toune deſtroied nothing ilaft yet ſaw brent ſhips hoppeſteres hunter iſtrangled wild beres sow fretting child cradle cooke iſcalded long ladle nought foryeten infortune mart carter ouerridden owne cart vnder wheele full low lay adoun alſo mart deviſion barbour botcher smith forgeth ſharpe ſwords ſtith aboue depainted tour saw conqueſt ſitting great honour ſharpe ſword right ouer head hanging ſubtill twined thread depainted ſlaughter iulius great nero antonius thilke time unborne yet death depainted beforne manacing mar right figure ſhewed portreiture depainted ſtarres aboue ſhall dead el ſlaine loue sufficeth one enſample ſtories old may reken though would ſtatue mar vpon cart ſtood armed looked grim wood ouer head ſhinen two figure ſtarres cleaped ſcriptures one puella hight rubeus god armes araied thus wolfe ſtood beforne fete eyen red man ete ſubtill penſill painted ſtorie redouting mar glorie temple diane chaſt ſhortly woll haſt tell diſcriptioun depainted wals vp doun hunting ſhamefaſt chaſtite ſaw wofull caliſtope diane greeued turned fro woman bere afterward ſhe made loadſterre thus painted ſay ferre ſonne eke ſtarre men may ſee ſaw dane turned vnto tree meane goddeſſe diane venus daughter hight dane ſaw acteon hert ymaked vengeance ſaw diane naked ſaw hound haue cought freten knew nought yet painted little furthermore athalant hunted wild bore mellager many mo diane wrought care wo ſaw many another wonder ſtorie liſt draw memorie goddeſſe full well vpon hart ſete ſmall hound abouten fete vnderneath foot ſhe moone wexing yet ſhould wane ſoone gaudie greene ſtatue clothed bow hand arrowes caas iyen aye ſhe caſt full low adoun pluto hath darke regioun woman trauelling child ſo long vnbore full pitouſly lucina gan ſhe call ſaid helpe thou maieſt beſt well coud paint liuely wrought many florein hewes bought theſe liſts made theſeus great coſt hath arayed thus temple theatre eueridele done liked wonder wele ſtint woll theſeus alite ſpeake palamon arcite day approcheth returning euerich ſhould c knight bring battaile darreine told athens couenants hold hath euerich hem brought c knight well armed warre right ſikerly trowed many man never ſithens world began ſpeak knighthood hond farre god hath made ſea lond na ſo ſo noble company every wight loued chiualry would thankes haue paſſing name hath praied might game well thereto choſen fell morrow ſuch caas ye know well euery luſty knight loueth paramour hath might england elſewhere would full faine willen fight lady ah benedicite luſtie ſight men ſe right ſo farden palamon went knight many would armed habergeon breſt plate light gippion ſome would paire plate large ſome wold haue pruce ſheld ſom • arge would armed leg wele haue axe ſome mace ſtele na none new giſe na old armed haue told euerich opinion ¶ther maiſt thou ſe comming palamon ligurge himſelfe great king trace blacke berd manly face ſercles iyen hed glouden betwixt yellow red like lion looked kemped haires browes ſtout lims great brawnes hard ſtrong ſhoulders brode armes round long guiſe countre full high upon chaire gold ſtood foure great white buls traſys inſtead coat armour ouer harnays nailes yellow bright gold hath beares skin cole blacke old long haire kempt behind backe raven feather ſhone blacke wreath gold arme great huge weight vpon head ſet full ſtones bright fine ruby clere diamands chaire went white allaunds twenty mo grete ſtere hunten lion wild bere followed moſell faſt ybound collers gold torrettes filed round hundred lordes rout armed full well heart ſterne ſtout arcite ſtories men find great emetrius king inde vpon ſteed bay trapped ſtele covered cloth gold diapred wele came riding like god armes marce coat armure cloth trace well couched perle white round gret ſaddle brent gold new ybet mantle upon ſhoulders hanging brette full ruby red fire ſparkling criſpe haire like ring yron yellow glittering ſon noſe high eyen bright cytryn lip ruddie colour ſanguyn freckle face yſpreint betwixt yellow ſomdele blacke ymeint lion eyen keſt fiue twenty yere age geſt beard well begun ſpring voice trumpet ſowning vpon head weared laurer greene garland freſh luſtie ſeene vpon hand bare delite eagle tame lilly white hundred lord armed ſaue head gere full richely manner thing truſteth well earles duke king gathered noble company loue encreaſe chiualry king ran euery part full many rame lion libart wiſe theſe lord ſome ſunday citie come prime toune light theſeꝰ duke worthy knight brought hem citee inned hem euerich degree feaſted hem doth ſo great labour eaſen hem done hem honour yet men wenen man wit none eſtate coud ne amend minſtralcie ſeruice feaſt great yefts alſo moſt leaſt rich array throughout theſeus paleis ne ſat firſt ne laſt vpon deys lady faireſt beſt dauncing hem beſt daunce ſing ne moſt feelingly ſpeaketh loue ne haukes ſitten perchen aboue ne hound liggen flour doun make mentioun effect thinketh beſt cometh point harkeneth liſt ſunday night day gan ſpring palamon larke herd ſing although day hour two yet ſong larke palamon right tho holy heart high corage roſe vp wenden pilgrimage vnto bliſfull cithera benigne mean venus honourable digne houre walketh foorth apaas vnto liſts temple doun kneleth humble chere hert full ſore ſaid ye ſhall ¶faireſt faire lady mine venus doughter ioue ſpouſe vulcanus thou glader mount citheron thilke loue thou haddeſt adon haue pity bitter teares ſmart take humble prayer thine heart ala ne haue language tell effect ne torment mine hell mine heart may mine harmes bewray ſo confuſe cannot ſay mercy lady bright woſt wele thought ſeeſt harm fele conſider rue vpon ſore wiſly ſhall euermore enforce might thy true ſeruant hold warre alway chaſtite make mine auow ſo ye helpe keepe armes ſtill yelpe ne aſke morrow haue victory ne renounce caſe ne vaine glory priſe armes blowen vp doun would haue full poſſeſſioun emely die ſervice find thou maner wiſe retch may better haue victory hem haue lady mine armes though ſo mar god armes vertue ſo great heauen aboue liſt ſhall well haue loue thy temple ſhall worſhip euer mo thine aulter ride go woll done ſacrifice fire bete woll ſo lady ſwete pray morrow ſpear arcite doe heart beare reke haue loſt life though arcite win wife effect end prayere yeue lady thou bliſfull lady dere oriſon done palamon ſacrifice anon full pitouſly circumſtaunces tell obſeruaunces laſt ſtatue venus ſhoke made ſigne whereby toke prayer accepted day though ſigne ſhewed delay yet wiſt well graunted bone glad hart went home full ſone third houre equall palamon began venus temple gon vp roſe ſunne vp roſe emelie unto temple diane gan hie maiden thider lad full readily hem fire incenſe clothes remnant ſacrifice longen ſhall horne full meeth giſe lacked nought done ſacrifiſe smoking temple full clothes faire emely heart debonaire body wiſſhe water well ſhe right dare tell thing generall yet game hear meaneth wel charge good man large bright haire vnkempt vntreſſed crown greene oke vnſeriall vpon head ſet full faire mete two fire aulter gan ſhe bete thing men may behold stace thebe theſe bookes old kindled fire pitous chere vnto diane ſhe ſpake ye may chaſt goddeſſe wood greene heauen earth ſee ſene queen reigne pluto dark low goddeſs maiden hart hath know full many yeare woſt deſire keepe fro vengeance thine ire acteon abought cruelly chaſt goddeſſe well woſt thou deſire maid life ne neuer woll loue ne wife thou woſt well thy company maid loue hunting venery walken wood wild wife child nought know company man helpe lady ſith may three formes thou haſt thee palamon hath ſuch loue eke arcite loueth ſo ſore grace pray thee withouten ſend loue peace betwixt hem two fro turn away heart ſo hote loue deſire buſie torment fire queint turned another place ſo thou wolt grace deſtiny ſhapen ſo ſhall need one hem two ſend moſt deſireth behold goddeſſe cleane chaſtite bitter tear cheekes fall since thou art maid keeper v maidenhed thou keep well conſerue liue maiden woll thee ſerue fire bren vpon aulter clere emely thus prayere ſodeinly ſhe ſaw thing queint right anon one fire queint quicked againe anon fire queint agon queint made whiſtling done theſe wet bronds brenning bronds end outran anone bloudy drop many one ſo ſore agaſt emely ſhe well nie mad gan cry ſhe ne wiſt ſignified onely feare thus ſhe cried wept pity heare therewithall diane gan appeare hond right huntereſſe ſaid doughter ſtint thine heavineſſe among god high affirmed eterne word written confirmed thou ſhalt wedded one tho thee ſo much care wo vnto hem may tell farwell may longer dwell fire mine aulter bren shall declaren ere thou gon hen auenture loue caſe word arrow caſe goddeſſe clatteren faſt ring forth ſhe went made vaniſhing emely aſtonied ſaid amounteth ala put vnder thy protection diane vnder thy diſpoſition home ſhe goth anon next way effect ſay next houre mar following arcite vnto temple walked fierce mar done ſacrifiſe might paymem wiſe pitous heart high deuotion right thus mar ſaid oriſon ſtrong god reignes cold trace honoured art lord yhold haſt euery reigne euery lond armes bridle thine hond hem fortuneſt thee liſt deuiſe accept pitous ſacrifiſe ſo thought may deſerue might worthy ſerue thy godhead may one thine pray thee thou rue pine thilke ſore paine thilke hot fire thou brenteſt whylom deſire thou vſedſt faire beaute faire young venus freſh fre haddeſt thine armes thy although thou one time miſfull vulcanus caught thee laas found thee ligging wife ala thilke ſorrow thine hart ruth well paine ſmart young uncunning thou woſt trow love offended moſt ever life creature ſhe doth wo endure ne retcheth neuer ſinke flete well wot ſhe mercy hete mote ſtrength place well wot without help grace thee ne may ſtrength auaile help lord morrow battaile thilke fire whilome brenned thee well fire brenneth mee morrow victory mine trauell thine glory thy ſoveraign temple woll moſt honouren place alway moſt labouren thy pleaſaunce thy craft ſtrong thy temple woll banner hong armes companie euermore untill day die eterne fire woll beforne thee find eke auow woll bind heard haire hongeth low adoun neuer yet felt offencioun raſour ne ſhere woll thee yeve thy true ſeuaunt liue lord ruth vpon ſorrowes ſore yeve victory aske thee praier ſtint arcite ſtrong ring temple dore rong eke dores yclattren full faſt arcite ſomewhat agaſt fire brennen upon auter bright gan temple light ſweet ſmell anon ground yafe arcite anon hond hafe inſence fire caſt rite mo laſt ſtatu mar began hautherke ring ſound heard murmuring full low dim ſaid thus victory yafe mar honor glory thus joy hope well fare arcite anon inne fare faine foule bright ſun right anon ſuch ſtrife begun thilke graunting heauen aboue betwixt venus goddeſs loue mar ſterne god armipotent iupiter buſie ſtent till pale saturnus cold knew ſo many aventures old found experience art full ſoone hath pleaſed every part ſooth ſaid elde hath great auauntage elde wiſdome uſage men may old outren outread saturne anon ſtinten ſtrife dread albeit kind ſtrife remedy find deare doughter venus qd saturne courſe hath ſo wide turne hath power wot man mine drenching ſea ſo wan mine priſon darke coat mine ſtrangling hanging throat murmure churles rebelling groning priuy enpoyſoning vengeance plaine correction dwell ſigne lion mine ruine high hals falling toures wals vpon minor carpenter ſlew sampſon ſhaking pillers mine alſo malady cold darke treaſons caſts old looking father peſtilence weep ſhall diligence palamon thine owne knight shall lady thou behight though mar ſhal help knight natheles betwixt mot ſometime pee ye one complection couſeth day ſuch deuiſion thine ayle ready thy weep woll thy luſt fulfill woll ſtenten theſe god aboue mar venus goddeſſe loue plainely woll tellen great effect began great feaſt athens day eke luſty ſeaſon may made euery wight ben ſuch pleaſaunce day iuſten daunce ſpenden venus high ſeruiſe becauſe ſhoulden ariſe early ſee great ſtrange ſight vnto reſt went quickly night morrow day gan ſpring horſe harneis noiſe clattering hoſtelries pallace rode many rout lord upon great ſteeds palfreis maieſt thou ſee deuiſing harneis vncouth ſo rich wrought ſo wele goldſmithry braudry ſtele ſhields bright teſters trapper gold hewen helm hauberk coat armers lord paraments courſers knight retinue eke ſquiers nailing ſpeares helmes bokeling gigging ſhields lamers lacing need nothing ydell foming ſteeds golden bridell gnawing faſt armurers alſo file hammer riding fro yemen foot commune many one ſhort ſtaues thicke may gone pipe trompes nakoners clariouns battaile blowne bloudie ſouns pallace full people doun three ten holding queſtioun deuining theſe theban knight two ſaid thus ſome ſaid ſhould ſo hold black berd som balled ſom thick herd ſaid looked grim would fight hath ſparth twenty pound weight thus hall full deuining long ſunne gam ſpring great theſeus ſleepe gan wake minſtralcie noiſe make held yet chamber pallace rich till theban knight ylich honoured place yfet duke theſeus window ſet arayed right god trone people preaſed thyderward full ſone ſeen done high reuerence eke heare hest ſentence herauld ſcaffold made oo till noiſe people ydo ſaw people noiſe ſtill thus ſhewed forth mighty duke lord hath high diſcretion conſidered deſtruction gentle blood fighten gise mortall battell empriſe wherefore ſhapen ſhall die woll firſt purpoſe modifie man therefore paine loſſe life manner ſhot polax ne ſhort knife liſts ſend thider bring ne ſhort ſword ſticke point biting man ne draw ne heare ſide ne man ſhall fellow ride one courſe ſharp grounden ſpere foin liſt foot ſame ſhall miſchiefe ſhall take ſlaine brought unto ſtake ſhal ben ordained either ſide thider ſhall force abide ſo fall cheefetaine take either ſide el ſleen make longer ſhall turnament laſt god ſpeed goth layeth faſt ſwords long maſes fighten fill goth way lord voice people touched heuen loud cried mery ſteuen god ſaue ſuch lord ſo good willeth deſtruction blood vp goth trompes melody liſts rideth ſo company ordinance throughout cite large hanged cloth gold ſarge full like lord noble duke gan ride theſe two theban either ſide rode queene emely another company one degree thus paſten throughout citee liſts comen time na day yet fully prime ſet theſeus full rich hie ipolita queene emelie lady degree vnto ſeats preaſeth rout weſtward yates mart arcite eke hundred part banner red entred right anon ſelue moment entred palamon venus eaſtward place banner white hardy cheare face world ſeken doun euen without variatioun na ſuch company twey none ſo wiſe coud ſey auauntage worthineſſe ne eſtate ne age euen choſen geſſe renges faire hem dreſſe name red euerichone number gile none tho gate ſhut cried loud deuoir yong knight proud heraulds left pricking doun ringen trompes loud clarioun ſay eaſt weſt goth ſharpe ſperes ſadly arreſt goth ſharpe ſpurs ſide ſee men iuſt ride ſhiueren ſhafts upon ſheilds thicke feeleth hert ſpoone pricke vp ſpringeth ſperes twenty foot hight goth ſwords ſiluer bright helmes hew ſhred burſt blood ſterne ſtremes red mighty mace bone breke thro thickeſt throng gan threke ſtumblen ſteeds ſtrong doun gon rolled foot doth ball foineth foot tronchoun hurleth horſe adoun body hurt ſith ytake maugre head brought unto ſtake forward right muſt abide another lad ſide ſometime doth hem theſeus reſt hem refreſh drinke hem leſt full oft day theſe theban two together met done ech wo vnhorſed hath ech hem twey tigre vale colaphey whelpe ſtole lite cruell hunt arcite jealous hert upon palamon ne belmarie fell lion hunted hunger wood ne prey deſireth ſo blood palamon ſlee foe arcite iealous ſtrokes helmes bite renneth blood ſides reed sometime end euery deed ere ſunne unto reſt went ſtrong king emetrius gan hent palamon fought arcite made ſword deepe fleſh bite force twenty take vnyolden drawne ſlake reſcous palamon ſtrong king ligurge borne adoun king emetrius ſtrength borne ſaddle ſwords length hurt palamon take naught brought ſtake hardy heart might helpen naught muſt abide caught force eke compoſition ſorroweth wofull palamon mote gone againe fight theſeus ſeen ſight cried ho ne none ſhall lenger fellow gon woll true iudge party arcite thebe ſhall haue emely fortune hath faire ywon anon noiſe people begon ioy ſo loud high withall ſeemed liſtes ſhoulden fall faire venus done aboue ſaith ſhe doth quene loue wepeth ſo wanting till teares adowne liſts fell ſaid aſhamed doutles saturnus ſaid fair daughter hold thy pee mar hath al wil kniȝt hath boon mine dead thou ſhait eaſed ſoon trumpes loud minſtralcie heraulds ſo loud yell crie wele loue dan arcite hearkeneth ſtinteth noiſe alite miracle befell anon fierce arcite hath helme ydon courſer ſhew face pricketh endlong large place looking vpward vpon emelie ſhe ayen caſt friendly eye woman ſpeak commune followen favour fortune chere hert ground fire infernall ſtert pluto ſent requeſt saturne horſe feare gan turne leape aſide foundred lepe ere arcite may taken kepe pight pomell head place lay dead breaſt broſten ſaddle bow blacke lay coale crow blood yroune face anon ybrought place hart full ſore theſeus paleis tho coruen harneis bed ybrought full faire bliue yet memory liue alway cry emely duke theſeus company comen home athens cite bliſſe great ſolemnite albeit auenture fall would diſcomfort hem men ſaid eke arcite ſhould die ſhould ben healed maladie another thing faine hem none iſlaine ſore hurt namely one ſpere thirled breſt bone two wound two broken arm ſalues ſome charm sundry fermaces hearbes eke ſaue dronken would liues haue noble duke well comforteth honoureth euery man made great reuell long night vnto ſtraunge lord right ne na hold diſcomforting iuſts turneying ſoothly na diſcomfiture falling hold auenture ne 〈◊〉 force unto ſtake vnyolden twenty knight take one perſon withouten mo harted forth arme foot eke ſteed driuen forth ſtaues footman yeoman knaues arretted villanie may man cleape cowardie anon duke theſeus cry ſtinten rancour enuy gre well one ſide either ſide like others brother yaue hem gyfts degree helden feaſt fully date three conueyed knight worthily toune day iourney largely home went euery man right way na farwell haue good day battel woll endite ſpeake palamon arcite swelleth breaſt arcite ſore encreaſeth heart ſtill clottered blood lee chcraft corrumped bouke laſt neither veineblood ne vent ouſing ne drinke hearbes may helping vertue expulſiue animall thilke vertue cleaped naturall ne may venim void ne expell pipe lung began ſwell euery lacerte breaſt adoun ſhent venim corruptioun gaineth neither get life vomit vpward ne downward laxatife bruſten thilke region nature hath domination certainly ther nature woll wirch farwell phyſicke go beare corſe chirch ſome arcire muſt die ſendeth emelie palamon coſyn deare ſaid thus ye ſhall heare nought may wofull ſpirit hart declare point ſorrows ſmart lady love moſt bequeath ſervice goſt abouen creature since life may lenger dure ala wo ala paine ſtrong haue ſuffered ſo long ala death ala mine emely ala departing company ala mine heart queene ala liues wife mine heart ladie ender life world aſken men haue loue cold graue alone withouten company farwell ſweet foe mine emely ſoft doe take armes twey loue god hearkeneth ſay haue couſin palamon ſtrife rancour many day agon loue iealouſie iupiter ſo wiſely ſoule gie ſpeaken ſeruant properly circumſtances truly ſay trouth honor knighthede wisdome humbleſſe eſtate high kinrede freedome longeth art iupiter ſoule part world right know non worthy loued palamon ſerueth woll doen life ſhall euer wife foryet palamon gentleman word ſpeech faile began foot vnto breaſt come cold death ouernome yet moreouer armes two vitall ſtrength loſt ago saue intellect without dwelleth heart ſicke ſore gan failen wher hart felt death dusked iyen two failed breath ladie yet caſt iye laſt word mercy emelie ſpirit chaunged went whitherward cannot tell ne therfore ſtint diuiniſtre ſoules find regiſtre ne liſt thilke opinion tell hem though writen dwel arcite cold mar ſoule gie woll ſpeake forth emelie shright emelie houlen palamon theſeus ſiſter vp tooke anon swouning bare fro corſe away helpeth tarrie forth day tellen ſhe wept euen morow ſuch caſe woman haue much ſorow husband fro hem go part ſorowen ſo el fallen ſuch maladie laſt certainely die infinit ſorow teares old folke folke tender yeares toune death theban weepeth child man great weeping certaine hector brought freſh yſſaine troy ala pitie scratching cheekes renting eke woldeſt thou dead thus woman crie haddeſt gold inough emelie man ne may gladen theſeus saving old father egeus knew world tranſmutatioun ſeene vp doun ioy wo wo gladneſſe ſhewed enſamples likeneſſe right died neuer man qd ne liued yearth ſome degree right ſo liued neuer man ſaied world ſometime ne deied world throughfare full wo pilgrimes paſſing fro death end euery world ſore yet ſaid much effect full wiſely exhort people ſhould hem recomfort duke theſeus buſie cure caſteth ſepulture good arcite ſhall beſt ymaked bee eke moſt honourable degree laſt tooke concluſion arcite palamon love battaile hem betweene ſame ſelue groue ſweet greene amorous deſires complaint loue hote fire would make fire offis funerall mighten accomplis hath anon commaunded hack hew okes old lay hem rew culpons well araied brenne officer ſwift foot renne right anon commaundement theſeus hath yſent large bere ouerſprad cloth gold richeſt ſame ſute clothed arcite vpon hand gloues white eke head croune laurell grene hand ſword full bright kene laied bare viſaged bere therewith wept pitie people ſhould ſeene day brought hall roreth cry ſoun tho come wofull theban palamon glitering beard ruddie ſhining here clothes blacke dropped teres paſſing weeping emelie rufulleſt companie much ſeruice ſhould bee noble rich degree duke theſeus let foorth ſteeds bring trapped ſteele glittering couered armes dan arcite vpon theſe ſteeds great lilly white ſaten folk one bare ſhield another ſpeare hand held third bare bow turkes brent gold caſe harnes ridden forth apace ſorie chere toward groue ye ſhall nobleſt greek vpon ſhoulders caried bere ſlacke pace eyen red wete throughout citie maiſter ſtrete ſprad black wonder hie right ſame ſtreet ywrie vpon right hand went egeus ſide duke theſeus veſſels hand gold full fine full hony milke blood wine eke palamon full great companie came wofull emelie fire hand time giſe doen office funerall ſeruice hie labour full great apparelling ſeruice fire making green top heaven raught twenty fadome bred armes ſtraught ſaine boughes ſo broad ſtraw firſt laid many load fire maken vp height eke name tree hight oke firre beech aſpe elder elme popelere willow holme plane boxe cheſten laurere maple thorne beech ewe haſell whipuitre feld ſhall told ne god runnen vp doun diſherited habitatioun wonned reſt pee nimphes faunies amadriades ne beaſts ne bird fledden feare tree fall ne ground agaſt light wont ſee ſunne bright ne fire couched firſt ſtre drie ſtickes clouen thre greene wood ſpicerie cloth gold perrie garland hanging many flour mirrhe incenſe ſweet odour ne arcite lay among ne richeſſe body ne emely guiſe put fire funerall ſervice ne ſhe ſouned made fire ne ſhe ſpake ne deſire ne iewels men fire caſt fire great brent faſt ne ſome caſt ſhield ſome ſpere veſtments cup full wine milke blood fire brent wood ne greekes huge rout thrice riden fire vpon left hand loud ſhouting thrice right ſperes clatering thrice lady gan crie ne led homeward emelie ne arcite brent aſhen cold ne liche wake yhold night long ne greek play wake play ne keepe ſay wreſtled beſt naked oile annoint ne bare beſt euery point woll tellen eke gone home athens play done ſhortly point woll wend maken long tale end proceſſe length certain yeares ſtinten mourning teares greekes one generall aſſent ſeemed parliament athens vpon certain point caas among point yſpoken haue certaine country alliance haue thebanes fully obeiſance noble theſeus anon let ſend gentle palamon vnwiſt cauſe blacke clothes ſorrowfully came commaundement hie tho ſent theſeus emelie ſet huſht place theſeus abidden hath ſpace word came wiſe breſt eyen ſet leſt ſad viſage ſiked ſtill right thus ſaied firſt mouer cauſe aboue firſt made faire chaine loue great theffect high intent well wiſt thereof ment faire chaine loue bond fire aire water lond certaine bond may flee ſame prince mouer qd hath ſtabliſht wretched world adoun certaine day duracioun engendred place ouer day may pace mow yet tho day abredge needeth none authority ledge proued experience liſt declare ſentence may men order diſcerne thilke mouer ſtable eterne well may men know foole every part deriued hoole nature hath taken beginning one part cantle thing thing perfit ſtable deſcending ſo till corrumpable therefore wiſe purueyanuce hath ſo well beſet ordinaunce ſpaces thing progreſſions shullen endure ſucceſſions eterne without lie maieſt thou vnderſtand ſee eie lo oke hath ſo long noriſhing fro time beginneth firſt ſpring hath ſo long life ye may ſee yet laſt waſted tree conſidereth eke hard ſtone vnder foot tread gone yet waſteth lieth wey broad riuer ſometime wexeth drey great tounes ſee wane wend ye ſee thing hath end man woman ſee ſhall alſo nedeth one tearmes two ſaine youth el age mote dead king well page bed ſome deepe ſee large field ye may ſee helpeth goeth ilke wey may ſee thing mote dey maketh iupiter king prince cauſe thing converting proper deriued ſooth tell creature liue degree auaileth ſtriue wiſdome thinketh make vertue neceſſite take well may eſchew namly v dew ſo grutcheth ought doth follie rebell may gie certainely man hath moſt honour dien excellence flour ſiker good name hath frends ne ſhame glader ought friend death honour iyold vp breath name apaled age foryetten vaſſellage beſt worthy fame dien beſt name contrary wilfulneſſe grutchen haue heauineſſe good arcite chiualry flour departed dutie honour foule priſon life grutchen coſin wife welfare loueth ſo wele hem thank nay god wot neuer adele ſoule eke himſelfe offend yet mow luſts amend may conclude long ſtorie ſorrow rede v merrie thanke iupiter grace ere departen place rede maken ſorrowes two one perfit ioy laſting euermo look moſt ſorrow herein woll firſt amend begin siſter qd full aſſent people parlement gentle palamon owne knight ſerueth wil hart might euer hath done ſith ye firſt knew ye ſhall grace vpon rew take huſband lord lend hand accord let ſee womanly pite king brother ſonne parde though poore batchelere since hath ſerued ſo many yere ſo great aduerſite muſt ben conſidered leueth gentle mercy ought paſſen right ſaid thus palamon knight trow need little ſermoning make aſſenten thing commeth nere take lady hond betwixt hem maked anon bond hight matrimonie mariage counſaile baronage thus bliſſe melody hath palamon iwedded emely god world hath ywrought send loue hath ſo dere bought palamon wele liuing bliſſe richeſſe hele emely loueth ſo tenderly ſerueth ſo gentilly neuer word hem betwene iealouſie tene thus endeth palamon emely god ſaue faire company miller tale nicholas scholar oxford practiſeth aliſon carpenter wife oſney deceive husband end rewarded accordingly ¶the miller prologue knight thus tale ytold company na yong ne old ne ſaid noble ſtorie worthie drawne memorie namely gentile eueriehone hoſt lough ſware ſo mote gone goeth aright vnbokeled male let ſee ſhall tell another tale truly game well begon telleth u ſit monke somewhat quite knight tale miller dronken pale vnneths vpon horſe ſat ne nold availe neither hood ne hat ne abide man courteſie pilats voice began crie ſ •• armes blood bone noble tale none woll quite knight tale hoſt ſaw dronken ale ſaid abide robin leue brother better man ſhall tell v firſt another abide let v wirch thriftely god ſoule qd woll woll ſpeake el goe way hoſt anſwered tell deuill way thou art foole thy wit ouercome hearketh qd miller ſome firſt make proteſtatioun drunke know ſoun therefore miſpeake ſay wite ale southwarke pray woll tell legend life carpenter wife clarke ſet wright cap▪ reue anſwered ſaid ſtint thy clap let thy leaud drunken harlottrie ſinne eke great follie apairen man defame eke bring wiues ſuch blame thou maieſt inough thing faine drunken miller ſpake full ſoon againe ſaied leue brother oſwold hath wife cokewold ſay therefore thou art one full good wiues many one art thou angry tale haue wife parde well thou yet ox plough take vpon inough deemen ſelfe one woll beleeue well none huſband ſhould inquiſitife god priuity ne wife ſo find god foiſon remnant needeth enquere ſhould ſay millere nold word man forbere told churles tale mannere forthinketh ſhall rehearce therefore euery gentle wight pray deemeth god loue ſay euill intent mote rehearſe tale better werſe elſe falſen ſome matere therefore ſo liſt turne ouer leafe chuſe another tale ye ſhall find ynow great ſmale hiſtoriall thing touching gentleneſſe eke moralitie holineſſe blame ye chuſe amis miller churle ye know well reue eke mo harlotrie told eke two auiſe put blame eke men ſhould make erneſt game ¶the miller tale whylome dwelling oxenford rich gnofe geſts helden bord craft carpenter dwelling poor ſcholler learned art fantaſie turned learne aſtrologie coud certaine concluſions demen interrogation men asken certain hour men ſhoulden drought ſhours men asked ſhuld befal every thing may reken clarke cleped hend nicholas berne loue coud ſolas thereto ſlie right priuee ilike maiden meeke ſee chamber hoſtelrie alone withouten companie full tetouſly dight hearbes ſote himſelfe ſweet rote licores seduwall almagiſte bookes great ſmall aſterlagour longing art augrim ſtones lying faire apart ſhelues couched bed hed preſſe icouered folding red aboue lay gay sautrie made night melodie ſweetly chamber rong angelus ad virginem ſong ſong king note full oft bleſſed merry throte thus ſweet clarke time ſpent friend finding rent carpenter wedded new wife loved life eighteene yeare geſſe ſhe age iealous kept ſtrait cage ſhe wild young old deemed himſelf cokewold knew cato wit rude bade men wed ſimilitude men ſhoulden wed eſtate youth elde often debate ſith fallen ſnare muſt enduren folke care faire young wife therewithall wiſele bodie gentle ſmall ſeinte ſhe weared barred ſilke barme cloth white morrow milke vpon lendes full many gore white ſmock embrouded eke behind colere cole blacke ſilke within eke without tape white volipere ſame ſute colere fillet broad ſilke ſet full hie ſikerly ſhe likerous eie full ſmall ypulled browes two tho bent blacke ſ • much bliſful ſee new perienet tree ſofter wool weather girdle hung purſe leather taſſed ſilke perled latoun world ſeeken ni man ſo wiſe couth thence gay popelote ſo gay wench full brighter ſhining hew toure noble forged new ſong ſo loud yerne ſwallow ſitting berne thereto ſhe couth skip make game kid calfe following dame mouth ſweet braket meth hord apple lying hay heth winſing ſhe jolly colt long maſt upright bolt brooch ſhe bare ſow collere broad boſſe bucklere ſhoes laced leg hie primroſe piggeſnie lord liggen bed yet good yoman wed ſir eft ſir ſo befell caas day hende nicholas fell yong wife rage pley husband oſeney clerkes ben full ſubtill queint priuily caught queint ſaied wi haue derne loue thee lemman ſpill held full faſt haunch bone ſaied lemman loue well one woll dien alſo god ſaue ſhe ſprong colt traue head ſhe wrieth faſt away ſaied woll kiſs thee fay▪ let qd ſhe let nicholas woll crie harrow ala doe away hand courteſie nicholas gan mercy crie ſpake ſo faire profered ſo faſt ſhe loue graunted laſt ſwore oth thomas rent ſhe would commandement ſhe may leiſure well eſpie husband ſo full jealouſie ye wait well priue wot right well nam dead qd ſhe ye mote full derne caas nay thereof care ye qd nicholas clarke litherly beſet couth carpenter beguile thus accorded • worne awaiten time haue ſaid beforne nicholas thus euery dele thacked lends wele kiſſed ſweet taketh sautrie plaieth faſt maketh melodie fell thus pariſh chirch chriſtes owne workes wirch good wife went upon holy day forehead ſhone bright day waſh ſhe lete werke chirch pariſh clerke whiche cleaped abſolon croule haire gold ſhon ſtrouted fanne large brode full ſtraight even lay jolly ſhode rode red eyen gray goo pole windowes coruen ſhoos hoſen redde went fetouſly gird full ſmall properly kirtle light waget full faire thicke point ſet thereupon gay ſurpliſe white bloſſome riſe merrie child ſo god ſaue well coud let bloud clippe ſhaue make charter lond quitaunce twenty manner coud trip daunce ſchoole oxenford tho leg caſten fro play ſongs ſmall ribible thereto ſong ſometime loud quinible well coud play geterne toune na brewhouſe ne tauerne gay girle tapſtere ne viſited ſolas ſooth ſay ſomwhat ſquaimus farting ſpeech daungerous abſolon jolly gay goeth cenſer sunday cenſing wiues pariſh faſt many louely looke hem caſt namely carpenter wife looke thought merry life ſo proper ſweet licorous dare well ſaine mous cat would haue •• anon pariſh clerke jolly abſolon hath heart ſuch loue longing wife tooke none offering courteſie ſaied would haue none moon night ful bright ſhone abſolon geterne hath ytake paramour thought wake foorth goeth jealous amorous till came carpenter hous little cockes yerow dreſſed ſhot window upon carpenter wall ſingeth voice gentle ſmall deare lady thy pray ye would rew full well according geterning carpenter awoke heard ſing ſpake unto wife ſaid anon aliſon heares thou abſolon chaunteth thus vnder boures wall ſhe anſwerd husband therewithall yes god wot heare euery dele paſſeth forth wol ye bet wele fro day day jolly abſolon woeth woe begon waketh night day kembeth lock broad made gay woeth meanes brocage ſwore would page ſingeth brokking nighttingale ſent piment methe ſpiced ale wafres piping hot glede ſhe roun profered mede ſome folke woll richeſſe ſome ſtrokes ſome gentleneſſe somtime ſhew lightneſſe maſtrie plaieth heraudes skaffold hie auaileth caas loueth ſhe hende nicholas abſolon may blow buckes horne ne labour ſcorne thus ſhe maketh abſolon ape requeſt tourneth yape forſooth proverbe lie men ſay thus alway nye ſlie still maketh ferre loue lothe though abſolon wood wrothe becauſe ferre ſight nie nicholas ſtood light beare thee well hend nicholas abſolon may waile ſing ala ſo befell saterday carpenter gone oſnay hende nicholas aliſon accorded concluſion nicholas ſhould ſhapen hem ſilly jealous carpenter beguile ſo game went aright ſhould ſleep armes night deſire alſo right anon withouten word mo nicholas longer would tarie doth full ſoft vnto chamber carie meat drinke day twey husbond ſey asked nicholas ſhould aunſwere ſhe mſt day ſhe ſaw eie trowed ſome maladie crie ſhe maid coud call nold anſwer nought might befall thus paſſeth forth like saturday nicholas ſtill chamber lay eat dranke ſlept liſt till sunday ſunne goeth reſt ſilly carpenter hath great marueile nicholas thing might eile ſaid adrad ſaint thomas ſtondeth aright nicholas god ſhilde died ſodainely world full tickle ſekerly ſaw day corſe horne cherch monday laſt ſaw werch goe qd unto knaue anone cleape dore knocke faſt ſtone looke tell boldely knaue goeth vp full ſturdely chamber dore ſtood cried knocked wood doe ye maiſter nicholay may ye ſleepen long day nought heard word hole found full low vpon bord cat wont creepe hole looked full deepe laſt ſight nicholas ſat euer gaping vpright keyked new moone adowne goeth told maiſter ſoone array ſaw ylke man carpenter bliſſen began ſaid helpe v ſaint frideſwide man wote little ſhall betide man fallen aſtronomie ſome woodneſſe ſome agonie thought aye well ſhoulden men ſhoulden know god priuite yea bleſſed alway leaud man naught beleefe right ſo ferd another clarke aſtronomy walked field pry vpon ſtarre wete ſhould befall till marlepit yfall ſaw yet ſaint thomas reweth ſore hende nicholas ſhall arated ſtudying may ieſus heauen king get ſtaffe may underſpore thou robin heaueſt vp dore ſhall ſtudying geſſe chamber dore gan dreſſe knaue ſtrong carle none haſpe bare vp dore one floore dore fell anone nicholas ſat ſtill ſtone euer gaped vpward aire carpenter wend deſpaire hent ſhoulders mightily ſhoke hard cried pitouſly nicholas looke adoun awake thinke chriſts paſſioun crouch elues wiked wight therewith night ſpell ſaid anon right foure halues houſe dreſhfold dore without ieſu chriſt ſainte benedight bliſſe houſe euery wicked wight fro night mare wite pater noſter wonneſt thou ſaint peter ſiſter laſt hende nicholas gan ſike ſore ſaid ala shall world loſt eftſoones carpenter anſwerd ſaieſt thou think god men ſwink nicholas anſwerd fetch drink woll ſpeake priuite certaine thing toucheth thee woll tell none man certaine carpenter goth doun cometh againe brought mighty ale large quart hem dranken part nicholas chamber dore faſt ſhet doune carpenter ſet ſaid iohan hoaſt mine lefe dere thou ſhalt vpon thy trouth ſwere wight thou ſhalt counſel wrey chriſts counſaile ſay thou tell man thou art forlore vengeance thou ſhalt haue therfore thou wray thou ſhalt wood nay chriſt forbid holy blood qd tho ſilly man blabbe ne though ſay nam lefe gabbe say thou wolt ſhall neuer tell child ne wife harrowed hell iohn qd nicholas woll lie haue yfounden mine aſtrologie haue looked moone bright munday next quarter night shall fall raine ſo wild wood halfe ſo great neuer no flood world ſaid leſſe houre shall orient ſo hidous ſhoure thus ſhall mankind drench leſe life carpenter anſwerd ſaid ala wife ſhall ſhe drench ala mine aliſoun ſorrow fell almoſt adoun ſaid remedy caas yes yes full good qd hende nicholas thou wolt werchafter lore rede thou maiſt werchen thine hede thus ſaith salomon full trew worke counſel thou ſhalt rew thou wilt werken good counſaile vndertake without maſt ſaile yet ſhall ſaue thee haſt thou heard ſaved noe lord warned beforne world water ſhuld lorne yes qd carpenter full yore ago haſt thou heard qd nicholas alſo ſorrow noe fellowſhip might get wife ſhip leuer dare well undertake thilke time wether blake ſhe ſhip ſelfe alone therfore woſt thou beſt done asketh haſt haſty thing men may preach ne make tarrying anon goe get v faſt inn kneding trough el kemelyn ech v looke large men mow ſwimmen barge haue therein victual ſufficiaunt day fie remnaunt water ſhall aſlake gone away abouten prime vpon next day robin may weten thy knave ne eke thy maid gille may ſave aske though thou aske woll tellen god privite sufficeth thee thy wit mad haue great grace noe thy wife ſhall well ſave doubt goe thy way ſpeed thee hereabout thou haſt thee ygetten v theſe kneading tub thre ſhalt thou hang hem roofe full hie man purueyaunce eſpie thou haſt thus haue ſaid haſt vitaile faire hem ylaid eke axe ſmite cord arwo water commeth may go breake hole high vpon gable vnto garden ward ouer ſtable may freely paſſen forth way great ſhoure gone away ſhalt thou ſwim mery vndertake doth white ducke drake woll cleape aliſon iohn merry flood woll paſſe anon thou wolt ſaine haile maiſter nicholay good morrow ſee well day ſhall lord life world noe wife one thing warne thee full right well auiſed ilke night benentred ſhips bord none u ne ſpeake word ne clepe ne crie prayere ſo done god owne heſt dere thy wife thou mote hang fer twinne betwixt ſhall ſinne looking ſhall deed ordinaunce ſaid go god thee ſpeed morow night men ben aſleepe kneading tub woll creepe ſitten abiding god grace go thy way haue longer ſpace make longer ſermoning men ſaine thus ſend wiſe ſay nothing thou art ſo wiſe needeth thee teach goe ſaue liues thee beſeech ſilly carpenter goeth forth way full oft ſaid ala welaway wife told privite ſhe ware knew bet queint caſt ſey natheles ſhe ferde ſhe would dey ſaid ala go forth thy way anone helpe v ſcape dead eachone thy true wedded wife go deare ſpouſe help ſaue life lo great thing affection men may die imagination deep may impreſſion take ſilly carpenter beginneth quake thinketh verily may ſee no flood come waltering ſee drenchen aliſon hony dere weepeth waileth maketh ſory chere ſiketh many ſorry thought goth geteth kneading trough tub kemelin priuily ſent hem hing hem roofe full priuilie hand made ladder thre climben ronges ſtalkes tub honging balkes hem vitailed trough tubbe bread cheeſe good ale iubbe sufficing right ynow day er made array ſent knaue eke weuch alſo vpon need london go munday drew night ſhut dore without candle light dreſſed thing ſhould bee ſhortly clomben vp three ſitten ſtill fully furlong way pater
