noſter clum ſaid nicholay clum qd iohan clum ſaid aliſon carpenter ſaid deuotion ſtill ſit biddeth prayere awayting raine dead ſleepe wery buſineſſe fell carpenter right geſſe curfewe time little trauaile ghoſt groneth ſore eſt routeth head miſlay doune ladder ſtalketh nicholay aliſon full loft ſhe ſped withouten word mo went bed carpenter wont lie reuell melodie thus lieth aliſon nicholas buſineſſe mirth ſolas till bell laudes gan ring freres chaunſell gone ſing pariſh clerke amorous abſolon loue alway ſo wo bygon vpon monday oſenay company diſport play aſked vpon caſe cloiſterere full priuily iohn carpentere drew apart chirch ſaid ſaw wirch sith ſaturday trow went timbre abbot hath ſent wont timbre go dwellen graunge day two el houſe certaine cannot ſorthly ſaine abſolon full iolly light thouȝt time walk night ſikerly ſaw nat ſtering dore ſith day began ſpring mote thriue ſhall cockes crow full priuily knocke window ſtant full low vpon boures wall aliſon woll tellen loue longing yet ſhall miſſe leaſt way ſhall kiſſe manner comfort ſhall haue parfay mouth hath itched long day ſigne kiſſing leaſt night mette eke feaſt therefore woll goe ſleepe houre twey night woll walke pley firſt cocke hath crow anon vp riſt iolly louer abſolon arayeth gay queint deuice firſt cheweth greins licorice ſmellen ſote kempt vnder tongue true loue bere thereby wend graciouſe cometh carpenter houſe ſtill ſtant ſhot window vnto breaſt raught ſo low ſoft knocked ſemely ſoun doe honycombe ſweet aliſoun faire bird ſweet ſinnamon awake lemman mine ſpeketh abſolon full little thinken ye upon wo loue ſwelt go wonder though ſwelt ſweat mourne doth lambe teat wi lemman haue ſuch loue longing like turtle true mourning may eaten may maid go fro window iacke fool ſhe ſaid help god ſweet ſaint iame loue another el blame well bet thee ieſu abſolon goe forth thy way woll caſt ſtone let ſleepe twenty diuell way ala qd abſolon welaway true loue euer ſo yuell beſette kiſſe ſince may bette ieſus loue loue wilt thou go thy way therewith qd ſhe ye tertes lemman qd abſolon make thee ready qd ſhe come anon vnto nicholas ſhe ſaid ſtill peace thou ſhalt laugh thy fill abſolon doun ſet knee ſaid lord degree hope commeth lemman thy grace ſweet bird thy nore window ſhe vndoth haſt haue qd ſhe come ſpeed thee faſt leaſt neighbour thee eſpie abſolon gan wipe mouth full drie darke night pitch cole window ſhe put er hole abſolon ſped neither bet ne wers mouth kiſt bare er full ſauorly ware abacke ſtert thought amis well wiſt woman berde felt thing rowe long herde ſaid fie ala haue te qd ſhe clapt window abſolon goeth forth ſorrie paas heard beard ſaid hende nicholas god corpus goeth faire wele ſilly abſolon heard every dele lip gan anger bite himſelue ſaid ſhall thee quite rubbeth froteth lip duſt ſond ſtraw chip abſolon ſaith full oft ala ſoule take sathanas lever toun qd deſpight awreken ala qd ala ne bleint hot loue cold yqueint fro time kiſt er paramour ſet kers healed maladie full oft paramour gan defie weepe doth child ybete ſoft pace went ouer ſtrete vnto ſmith men callen dan gerueys forge ſmiteth plow harneis ſharpeth ſhares culters buſily abſolon knocketh eaſily ſaid vndo gerueys anon art thou abſolon abſolon chriſts ſweet tre riſe ye ſo rath eye benedicite eileth ſome gay girle god wote hath brought thus merytote ſaint neotes ye wote wele mene abſolon ne raught bene play word againe gaffe towe vpon diſtaffe garuays knew ſaid friend ſo dere hot culter chimney lene haue therewith done woll bring thee againe full ſone geruays anſwerd certes gold poke noble vntold thou ſhouldeſt haue true ſmith eye chriſts foot wol ye therwith thereof qd abſolon may ſhall well tellen thee morrow day caught culter cold ſtele full ſoft dore gan ſtele went vnto carpenter wall coughed firſt knocked therewithall vpon window right ere aliſon anſwerd knocketh ſo warrant hee thefe nay qd god wot ſweet lefe thine abſolon thine owne derling gold qd haue thee brought ring mother yaue ſo god ſaue full fine thereto well ygraue woll yeue thee thou kiſſe nicholas riſen piſſe thought would amenden iape ſhould kiſſe er ere ſcape vp window haſtily er put full priuily buttocke haunch therwith ſpake clerke abſolon speak ſweet bird thou art nicholas anon let fleen fart great thunder dent ſtroke well nie yb • ent readie yron hote nicholas arſe ſmote goeth skin hondbrede hot cultor brend ſo tout ſmart wend die wood gan crie helpe water water god hert carpenter ſlumber ſlert heard one crie water wood thought ala commeth no flood ſet vp withouten word mo axe ſmote corde wo doun goeth found neither ſell bread ne ale doune ſhortly fell vpon floore ſwowne lay vp ſtert aliſon hende nicholay cried harrow ſtreet neighbor ſmall great ronne gauren man ſwoune lay paliſh wan fall broſten hath arme ſtonden muſt vnto owne harme ſpake yborne adoun hende nicholas aliſoun told euery man wood agaſt ſo ſore no flood fantaſie vanite getten kneading tub thre hem honged roofe aboue paried hem god loue ſitten roofe par companie folke gan laughen fantaſie roofe kyken gape turned earneſt jape ſo carpenter anſwerd nought man reaſon herd othes great yſworne adoun holden wood toun euerich clerke anon held ſaid man wood leue brother euery wight gan laughen ſtrife thus ſwiued carpenter wife keeping jealouſie abſolon hath kiſt nether eie nicholas ſcalded tout tale done god ſaue rout ¶the reues prologue folke laughed nice caas abſolon hende nicholas diuers folke hereof diuerſly ſaid part lough plaid ne tale ſaw man greue onely oſwolde reue becauſe carpenter craft little ire heart ylaft gan grutchen blame lite soothly qd full well couth thee quite blearing proud miller eie liſt ſpeake ribaudrie old luſt play age graſſe time done fodder forage white top writeth mine old yeres ſometime yelow white ben min here yet fare doth open er ilke fruit euer lenger wers till rotten molloke ſtre old men dreaden ſo fare till rotten ripe hoppen alway world wol pipe ſtiketh euer naile haue hore head greene taile hath leke though might gone deſireth folly euer one may wol ſpeken yet aſhen cold fire yreken four gledes han ſhall deuiſe auaunting lying anger couetiſe theſe foure ſparkles longen unto elde old lims mow well vnwelde ne ſhall faile ſooth yet alway colt tooth many yeare paſſed henne since tap life began renne ſikerly borne anone death drew tap life let gone euer ſince hath tap pronne till almoſt emptie tonne ſtreme life droppeth chimb ſilly tongue may well ring climb wretchedneſſe paſſed full yore old folke ſaue dotage hoſt heard ſermoning gan ſpeake lordly king ſaid amounteth wit ſhall ſpeake day holy writ diuel thinke made reue preche ſouter ſhipman leche say forth thy tale tary time lo depford halfe way prime lo greenwiche many ſhrew time thy tale begin ſirs qd oſwold reue pray ye greue anſwere ſomedele ſet houfe lefull force force ſhoufe dronken miller hath ytold v beguiled carpentere perauenture ſcorne one leaue ſhall quite anon right churles tearmes woll ſpeke pray god necke mote breke well mine eye ſeene ſtalke cannot ſeene balke denyſe simkin miller trompington deceiveth two clark schollars hall cambridge ſtealing corn ſo uſe matter revenge wrong full argument tale taken bocchace novel ¶the reues tale trompington far fro cambridge goth brook ouer bridge vpon brooke ſtant mell ſooth tell miller dwelling many day peacocke proud gay pipen couth fiſhen net bete turne cup well wraſtle ſhete aye belt bare long pauade ſword full trenchaunt blade jolly popere bare pouch ther na man perill durſt touch shefeld thwitel bare hoſe round face camiſed noſe pilled ape skull market beater full durſten wight hond ledge ne ſwore ſhould ſore abedge theefe forſooth corne mele ſlie vſaunt ſtele name hoten deynous simkyn wife comen noble kin parſon toune father yafe full many panne bra simkyn ſhould blood allie yfoſtered nunnerie simkyn would wife ſaid ſhe well ynouriſhed maid ſaue eſtate yomanrie ſhe proud pert pie full faire ſight ſee hem two holy day beforne would go tipet wounden heed ſhe came gite reed simkyn hoſen ſame durſt wight clepen dame none ſo hardy went way durſt rage play would ſlaine simkyn pauade knife bodkin jealous folkes perilous euermo algates would wiues wenden ſo eke ſhe ſomedele ſmoterliche digne water diche full hoker biſmare though ladie ſhould ſpare kinred norterly ſhe learned nonnery doughter betwixt hem two twenty yeare withouten mo sauing child halfe yeare age cradle lay proper page wench thicke well ygrowne camiſed noſe eyen gray glas buttockes broad breſts round hie right faire haire woll nat lie parſon toune ſhe faire purpoſe maken haire cattell meſuage ſtraunge made mariage purpoſe beſtowen hie ſome worthy blood auncetrie holy church good mote diſpended holy church blood deſcended therefore would holy blood honour though holy church ſhould deuour great ſoken hath miller dout wheat malt land namely great college men clepen schollers hall cambrege ther wheat eke malt iground day happed ſtound sicke lay manciple maladie men wenden wiſely ſhould die miller ſtale wheat corn hundred time biforn ſtale courteouſly theefe outragiouſly warden chid made fare thereof ſet miller tare cracked boſted ſwore na ſo yong poor ſchollers two dwelten hall ſay teſtife luſtie play mirth reuely vpon warden buſily cry yeue hem leaue little ſtound gone mill ſee corne yground hardely durſt lay neck miller ſhould ſteale hem halfe peck corne ſleight ne force hem reue laſt warden yaue hem leue iohan hight one alein hight town hight strother farre north tell alein maketh alredy gere horſe ſacke caſt anon forth goeth alein clerke alſo iohn good ſword buckeler ſide iohan knew way needeth guide mill dore ſacke layth alein ſpake firſt haile simken fayth fare thy faire doughter thy wife alein welcome qd simken life iohn alſo ye god simond qd iohn need pere behoues ſerue himſelfe ſwaine el foole clerkes ſaine manciple hope dead swa werkes aye wange head therefore come eke alein grind corne carry home agein pray ſpeed v home ye may ſhall done qd simkin fay woll done hand god right hopper woll ſtand qd iohn ſeen howgates corn goth yet ſaw neuer father kin hopper waggs fra alein anſwerd iohan wilt thou ſa woll ſtand beneath croune ſee meale falleth adoune troghe ſhall diſport qd iohn ſay may ſort ill miller ye miller ſmileth nicite thought done wile wene man may hem beguile thrift yet ſhall bleare eie ſleight philoſophie queint clerk themſelves make woll ſteale gin take inſteed flour yet woll give hem brenne greateſt clerk ben wiſeſt menne ſome wolfe ſpake mare art count tare doore goeth full priuily ſaw time ſubtilly looked doune till yfound clerkes horſe ſtood ybound behind mill vnder leſſell horſe goth faire well ſtrippeth bridle right anon horſe looſe gan gon toward fen wild mare rinne forth wehe thick thinne miller goeth againe word ſaid doth note theſe clerkes plaid till corne faire well yground meal ſacked ybound iohn goth found horſe away gan crie harrow welaway horſe loſt alein god benes step thy foot man come forth atenes ala warden paltrey lorne alein forgot meale corne mind husbandrie whilke way gone gan crie wife came leaping inward renne ſaied ala goeth fenne wild mare faſt may go vnthank come hond bound ſo better ſhould haue knit rein ala qd iohn alein chriſts pein lay doun thy ſword ſhall mine alſwa full ſwift god wete raa god fale ſhall ſcape v bathe ne hadſt thou put capel lathe ill heſte alein god thou fonne theſe • elie clerkes han full faſt ironne toward fenne alein eke iohn miller ſaw wer gon halfe buſhell flower take wife knede cake ſaid trow clerk aferde yet miller make clerk berde art yet let hem gone way lo gone let child play get ſo litely croune theſe ſelie clerk • nen vp doune kepe kepe ioſſa ioſſa warth go whiſtle thou ſhall keepe ſhortly till night couth tho might capell catch ran away ſo faſt till ditch caught laſt werie wet beaſtes rain cometh ſilly iohn cometh alein ala qd iohn day borne driven hethen skorne corne ſtole men woll u fooles call warden fellowes namely miller wallaway thus plaineth iohn goth way toward mill bayard hond miller ſitting fire fond niȝt ferther might nought love god beſought borough eaſe peny miller ſaid ayen yet ſhall ye haue part houſe ſtrait ye haue learned art ye argument make place mile broad twenty foot ſpace let ſee place may ſuffice make romer ſpeech giſe simond ſaid ihon cutherd aye thou mery faire anſwerd haue heard ſay men ſhuld take two thing swilke find ſwilke brings ſpecially pray thee hoſt dere get u ſome meat drink make v chere pay truly full empty hond men may haukes tull lo ſiluer ready ſpend miller toun doughter ſend ale bread roſted hem goo bound hors ſhuld go loo owne chamber made bed ſheetes chalons faire yſpred owne hed ten foot twelue doughter hed ſelue right ſame chamber faſt might ne bette cauſe roumer herbrough place ſoupen ſpeaken mirth ſolace dronken euer ſtrong ale beſt midnight went reſt well hath miller verniſhed hed full pale dronken nothing red gaſpeth ſpeaketh noſe quacke poſe hed goeth wife iay ſhe light iolife iolly whiſtle well ywet cradle bed fe • ſet roken yeue child ſuke dronken cruke bed went doughter right anon bed goeth alein alſo iohn uas hem needed dwale miller hath ſo wiſely bibbed ale hors ſnorteth ſteepe ne taile behind tooke keepe wife bare bordon well ſtrong men might hem heare routen furlong wench routeth eke par company alein clerke heard melody poked iohan ſaied ſleepeſt thou heardſt thou euer ſwilke ſang ere lo ſwilke coupling wixt hem wild fire vpon body fall heard euer ſwilke ferly thing ye ſhall haue floure euill ending lang night tide reſt yet naforce ſhall beſt ihon ſaied euer mote thriue may yon wench woll ſwiue eaſement hath law yſhapen v iohan law ſaieth thus man one point agreeued another ſhall releeued corne ſtolne ſoothly nay haue euill fit day ſince ſhall haue none amendement againe loſſe haue mine eaſement god ſale ſhall none bee iohan anſwered alein auiſe thee miller perillous man ſaied ſleepe abraied might doen v villanie alein anſwered count worth flie vp reſt wench crept wench ſay vpright faſt ſhe ſlept till ſo nigh ere ſhe might eſpie late crie ſhortly ſay one play alein woll ſpeake ihon ihon lay ſtill furlong way two himſelfe maketh routh wo ala qd wicked iape may ſay ape yet hath fellow ſomewhat harme hath miller doughter arme auntreth hath need yſped lie drafte ſacke bed iape told another dey ſhall hold daffe cokeney woll ariſe auntre fay vnhardie vnſely thus men ſay vp roſe ſoftly went vnto cradle arme hent bare ſoftly bed fete soone wife routing lete gan awake went piſſe came againe gan cradle miſſe groped ſhe found none ala qd ſhe almoſt miſgone almoſt gone clerkes bed eye benedicite foule yſped forth ſhe goeth till ſhe cradle fond gropeth alway hond found bed thought nat good becauſe cradle ſtood niſt ſhe derke faire well ſhe crept clerke lieth full ſtill wold haue caught ſlepe within ihon clerke vp lepe good wife laied full ſore merry fit ſhe nought full yore priked hard deepe mad iolly life haue theſe two clerkes lad till third cocke began ſing alein waxe wearie dauning ſwonken long night ſaied farewell malin ſweet wight day comen may longer bide euermo whereſo goe ride thine owne clerke ſo haue hele deare lemman qd ſhe go farwele thou go one thing woll thee tell thou wendeſt homeward mell right entre dore behind thou ſhalt cake halfe buſhell find ymaked thine owne meale helpe fire ſteale good lemman god thee ſaue keepe word ſhe gan almoſt weepe alein vpriſt thought ere daw would goe creepe felaw found cradle hand anon god thought wrong haue gon head tottie ſwinke night maketh go aright wot well cradle haue miſſe go lieth miller wife alſo forth goeth twenty deuill way vnto bed miller lay wend haue cropen fellow ihon miller crept anon caught necke ſoft ſpake ſaied ihon thou ſwineſhead awake chriſts ſoule heare noble game lord called ſaint iame haue thriſe ſhort night swiued miler doughter bolt upright whileſt thou haſt coward agaſt ye falſe harlot qd miller haſt falſe traitour thou clerke qd thou ſhalt dead god dignite durſt ſo bold diſparage doughter come ſuch linage throat boll caught alein hent diſpitouſly noſe ſmote feſt doune ran blood ſtream vpon breſt floore mouth noſe ybroke wallowen doth pig poke vp gone doune ayen anone till miller ſpurned ſtone doune fell backward vpon wife wiſt nothing nice ſtrife ſhe fall aſleepe little wight ihon clerk waked night fall ſteepe ſhe braied helpe holy croſſe bromholme ſhe ſaied manus tuas lord thee call awake simond fiend fall heart broken helpe dead lieth one wombe head helpe simkin theſe falſe clerk fight ihon ſtert vp faſt euer might graſpeth wals fro find ſtaffe ſhe ſtert vp alſo knew eftres bet ihon wall ſhe found ſtaffe anon ſaw little ſhemering light hole ſhone moone bright light ſhe ſaw hem two ſikerly ſhe niſt ſhe ſey white thing eie ſhe gan white thing eſpie wend clerke weard voluper ſtaffe ſhe drow ner ner wend haue hit alein full ſmote miller pilled ſkull doun goth cried harrow die theſe clerkes beat well let lie raieth hem tooke horſe anon eke meale way gon mill dore tooke cake halfe buſhell floure well ybake thus proud miller well ybete hath yloſt grinding whete paid ſupper euery dele alein ihon beat wele wife ſwiued doughter al lo ſuch miller fals therefore prouerbe full ſooth dare well weene euill dooth guilour ſhall himſelfe beguiled god ſit hie maieſte saue company great ſmale thus haue quit miller tale ¶the cooke prologue cooke london reue ſpake joy thought claude backe ha quoth hee chriſtes paſſioun miller hath ſharpe concluſioun vpon argument bigage well ſayd salamon language ne bring euery man thine houſe herbouring night perillous well ought man auiſed whome brought priuite pray god ſo yeue ſorrow care euer ſithen hight hodge ware heard miller bette iſett awerke iape malice derke god forbid ſtinten therefore ye vouchſafe heare tale poore man woll tell well little yape fell citee hoſt ſaied graunt thee tell rodger looke good many paſtie haſt thou letten blood many iacke douet haſt thou ſold hath twiſe hot twiſe cold many pilgrime haſt thou chriſts curſe thy perſſe yet fare worſe haue eaten thy ſtoble goo thy ſhop many flie loo tell gentle rodger thy name yet pray thee wroth game man may ſay full ſooth game play thou ſaieſt full ſooth qd roger fay ſoth play quade play fleming saith therefore henry bailly thy faith thou wroth departen though tale hoſtelere netheleſſe woll tellen yet ere part ywis thou ſhalt quit therwithall lough made cheare ſaied tale ye ſhullen heare deſcription unthriftie prentice given dice woman wine waſting thereby maſters good purchaſing newgate himſelf moſt tale loſt elſe never finiſhed author ¶the cooke tale prentiſe whylome dwelt cite craft vitailers galiard goldfinch ſhawe broune berrie proper ſhort felawe locke blacke kemt full fetouſly daunce couth full well jollily called perkin reuelour full loue paramour hiue full honey ſweet well wench might meet euery bridal would ſing hop loued bette tauernes ſhop riding cheape ſhoppe thither would leape till ſight iſein ſoothly would come agein gather meinie ſort hop ſing make ſuch diſport ſet steuin meet plaien dice ſuch ſtreet city na prentiſe fairer couth caſten paire diſe perkin couth thereto fre diſpence place priuite found maiſter well chafare oft time found boxe full bare ſikerly prentiſe reuelour haunteth diſe riot paramour maiſter ſhall ſhop abie haue part miniſtralcie theft riot conuertible play gettron rebible revel truth lowe degree ben full wroth day men may ſee iolly prentiſe maiſter abode till nigh prentiſhode ſnibbed earely late ſometime led reuel newgate laſt maiſter bethought vpon day paper ſought prouerbe ſaith ſame word well bette rotten apple hord ſhould rot remnaunt fareth roiotous ſeruaunt much leſſe harme let paſſe ſhend ſeruaunts place therefore maſter gaue quittaunce bad go ſorow miſchaunce thus iolly prentiſe leue let roiot night leue theefe without louke helpeth waſte ſouke bribe borrow may anon ſent bed array vnto compere owne ſort loued dice reuel diſport wife held countenance ſhop ſwiued ſuſtenance ¶the man lawes prologue hoſt ſaw well bright sunne arke artificial day runne fourth part eke halfe houre though deepe expert lore wiſt well eighteene day april meſſenger may ſaw well ſhadow euery tre length ſame quantite body erect cauſed therefore ſhadow tooke wit phebus ſhone clear bright degree fortie fiue clomben hight day latitude ten clocke gan conclude ſuddenly plight horſe lordings qd warne al rout fourth part day agon loue god ſaint iohn leſeth time ferfoorth ye may lordings time waſteth night day ſtealeth u priuely ſleeping negligence waking doth ſtreme turneth neuer deſcending fro mountain plain well seneke many philoſophre bewailen time gold cofre loſſe cattell may recouered loſſe time ſhendeth u qd would come ayen withouten dread woll malkins maidenhead ſhe hath loſt wantonneſſe let u mowlen thus idleneſſe sir man law qd ſo haue blis tell u tale anon forward ye ſubmitted free aſſent ſtonden caſe judgement acquiteth nowe beheſt haue done deuer leſt hoſt qd de pardeux ieo aſſent breake forward mine intent biheſt debt woll holde faine beheſt better ſaine ſuch law man yeueth another ſhould himſelfe vſen right thus woll text natheleſſe certaine wight right thrifty tale ſaine chaucer though leaudly metre rinning craftily hath ſaied hem ſuch engliſh old time knoweth many man haue ſayd hem leue brother one booke hath ſaid hem another hath told louers doun mo ouide made mentioun epiſtles full old ſhould tell hem ſithen ben told youth made ſixe alone ſithen hath ſpoken euerichone theſe noble wiues theſe louers eke ſo woll large volume ſeke cleaped ſaints liues cupide may ſee large wound wide lucreſſe babylon thiſoe ſwerd dido falſe enee tree phillis demophoon plaint deianire hermion ariadna hypſiphilee barraine ile ſtonding ſee dreint liandre hero teares helein eke wo briſeis laodomia crueltie queene medea little child honging hals iaſon loue ſo fals hipermiſtra penelope alceſt wifehood commendeth beſt certainely word ne writeth thilke wicke enſample canace loued owne brother ſinfullie ſuche curſed ſtories ſay fie el tyro appoloneus curſed kinge antiochus biraft doughter maidenhead ſo horrible tale read drew upon pament therefore full auiſement nold neuer write none ſetmons ſuch unkind abhominations ne woll none rehearſe yef may tale ſhall done day loth likened doubtles muſes men cleaped piriades methamorphoſeos wote mene natheleſſe retche bene though come haubake ſpeake proſe let rime make word ſober chere began tale ye ſhullen lady cuſtance emperours daughter rome marriage soudan surrey malice soudan mother ſuffereth great trouble miſery young child mauris yet end reſtored comfort ¶the man lawes tale hatefull harme condition pouert thirſt cold hunger confounded asken helpe thee ſhameth thine hert thou non ask need thou art ſo wounded nede vnwrappeth al thy wound hid maugrie thine head thou muſt indigence ſtele beg borow thy diſpence thou blameſt chriſt ſaieſt ful bitterly miſdeparteth richeſſe temporall thy neighbour thou witeſt ſinfully ſaieſt thou haſt little hath parfay ſaieſt thou ſometime reken ſhall taile ſhall brenne glede nought helpeth needfull nede hearken ſentence wiſe better dien haue indigence thine owne neighbour woll thee deſpiſe thou poore farwell thy reverence yet wiſe man take ſentence dayes poore men wicke beware therefore thou come pricke thou poore thy brother hateth thee thy friend fleech fro thee ala rich merchaunts full wele yee noble prudent folke caas bag fild ambes aa ciſe ſink reuneth chance chriſteninaſs mery may ye dance ye ſeeken lond ſee winning wiſe folke ye knowne ſtate reignes ye father tidings tale many peace debate right tale deſolate nere marchant gone many yeare taught tale ye ſhullen heare surrey whylome dwelt company chapman rich thereto ſad true wide ſenten ſpicery clothes gold satten rich hew chafare ſo thriftie ſo new euery wight hath deintie chafare hem eke ſellen hem ware fell maiſters ſort han ſhapen hem rome wend chapmanhood diſport none meſſenger would ſend comen hemſelf rome end ſuch place thought hem auauntage intent taken herbigage soiourned han theſe merchant toun certain time fell pleaſance ſo befell excellent renoun emperours doughter dame cuſtance reported euery circumſtance vnto theſe surrein marchants ſuch wiſe fro day day ſhall deuiſe comen voice euery man emperour rome god ſe doughter hath ſithen world began recken well goodneſſe beaute na neuer ſuch another ſhe pray god honour ſuſteine would ſhe europe quene high beautie without pride youth without grenhed follie work vertue guide humbles hath ſlaine tyrannie mirrour courteſie heart chamber holineſſe hond miniſter freedome almes al voice ſoth god true purpoſe let v turne ayen theſe marchants han fret ſhips new han bliſfull maiden ſein home surrey went agein doen need han doen yore liuen wealth ſay fell theſe marchants ſtood grace soudan surrie came ſtrange place would benigne courteſie maken hem good cheare buſily eſpie tidings ſundry realmes lere wonder might ſeen emong thing ſpecially theſe marchants haue told dame cuſtance great nobleſſe earneſt ſeriouſly soudan hath cauȝt ſo great pleſance han figure remembrance luſt buſie cure loue life may dure parauenture like large booke cleaped heauen ywritten ſtarres birth tooke loue ſhould han death ala ſtarres clearer glas written god wot ſo could read death euery man withouten dread ſtarres many winter written death hector achilles pompey iulius bore ſtrife thebe hercules sampſon turnus socrates death men wit ſo duſt wight well read full soudan priuie counſel ſent ſhortly matter pace hath hem declared intent ſaid hem certain might haue grace haue cuſtance within little ſpace na dead charged hem hie ſhapen life ſome remedie diuers men diuerſly ſaiden argument caſten vp doune many ſubtill reaſon forth laiden ſpeaken magicke abuſioun finally concluſioun cannot ſeene none auauntage ne none way ſaue mariage ſaw therein ſuch difficulty way reaſon ſpeake plain becauſe ſuch diuerſity law ſain trow chriſten prince would fain wedden child vnder lawes ſwete v tauȝt mahound prophet anſwerd rather leſe cuſtance would chriſten doubtles mote may none cheſe pray hold argument pee saueth life ye retcheles getten hath life cure woe may long endure needeth greater delatation ſay treatie embaſſadrie pope mediation church chiualrie deſtruction maumetrie encreaſe chriſts law deare accorded ye ſhall heare soudan baronage liege ſhould ychriſtened ſhall han cuſtance marriage certaine gold quantite find ſufficient ſurete ſame accord ſworne either ſide fair cuſtance almighty god thee gide woulden ſome men waiten geſſe ſhould tellen purueiance emperour nobleſſe hath ſhapen doughter dame cuſtance well may men know ſo great ordinance may man tellen little clauſe araied ſo high cauſe biſhops ſhapen wend lord lady knight renoun folke •• ow end notified throughout toun euery wight great deuotioun pray chriſt mariage receiue gree ſpeed voyage day come departing ſay wofull day naturall come may longer tarrying forward hem dreſſe ſome cuſtance ſorrow ouercome full pale ariſt dreſſed wend well ſhe ſey none end ala wonder though ſhe wept ſhall ſent ſtraunge nation fro friend ſo tenderly kept bounden vnder ſubjection one ſhe knoweth condition huſbands good han yore know ne wiues dare ſay father ſhe ſaid thy wretched child cuſtance thy young daughter foſtered vp ſo loft ye mother ſoueraigne pleaſaunce ouer thing take chriſt loft cuſtance child commendeth oft vnto grace ſhall surrie ne ſhall neuer ſee eie ala vnto barberie nation muſt anon ſithen chriſt ſtarfe redemption yeue grace heſtes fulfill wretched woman force though ſpill woman born thraldome penaunce vnder man gouernaunce trow troy thurus brake wall ilion ne brent thebe cite ne rome harme hanniball roman hath ivenqueſhed time thre na heard ſuch tender weeping pite chamber parting forth ſhe mote wheder ſhe weepe ſing firſt mouing cruel firmament thy diurnal ſwegh croudeſt aye hurrieſt fro eaſt occident naturally would hold another way thy crouding ſet heauen ſuch array beginning fierce voyage cruell mar hath ſlaine mariage infortunat aſſendent tortuous lord helpeleſſe fall ala angle derkeſt houſe mar occiſier caas feeble mone vnhappy thy paas thou knitteſt thou nart receiued ther thou wer wel fro thence art thou waiued imprudent emperour rome ala philoſopher thy toun time bette ſuch ca voiage none electioun namely folke high conditioun nat rote birth yknow ala leaud ſlow ſhip brought wofull faire maid solemnely euery circumſtance ieſus chriſt ſhe ſaid ni farwell fair cuſtance paineth make good countenance forth let ſaile mannere turne woll againe mattere explicit prima par ſequitur par ſecunda mother soudan well vice eſpied hath ſonnes plaine intent woll lete old ſacrifices right anon ſhe counſaile ſent ben comen know ſhe ment aſſembled folke feare ſet doune ſaid ye ſhall heare lord qd ſhe ye knowne euery chone ſonne point lete holy lawes alkaron yeuen god meſſenger mahomete one auow great god hete life ſhall rather body ſtart mahomet law goe hart ſhould v tiden new law thraldome body pennaunce afterward hell draw reneyed mahound creaunce lord woll ye make aſſuraunce ſhall ſay aſſenting lore ſhall make u fafe euermore ſworen aſſenten euery man liue die ſtond euerich beſt wiſe ſtrengthen ſhall friend fond ſhe hath empriſe taken hond ye ſhall heare ſhall deuiſe hem ſhe ſpake wiſe ſhal v firſt faine chriſtendom take cold water ſhall greeue u alite ſhall ſuch reuell feaſt make trow ſhall soudan quite tho wife chriſtened neuer ſo white ſhall haue need waſh away rede though ſhe font ful water lede soudonneſſe root iniquite virago thou symyram ſecound ſerpent vnder fememnete like ſerpent deepe hell ibound faigned woman may confound vertue innocence thy mallice bred thee neaſt euery vice sathan enuious ſince thilke day thou wert chaſed heritage well kneweſt thou woman old way thou madeſt eue bring u ſeruage thou wolt fordoen chriſten mariage inſtrument ſo welaway make thou woman thou wolt begile soudonneſſe blame werie let priuily counſaile gone way ſhould tale longer tarie rideth soudon day ſaied ſhe would reny lay chriſtendome prieſts hondes fong repenting ſhe heathen ſo long beſeeching doen honour ſhe might haue chriſten folke feſt pleaſen hem woll doen labour soudon ſaith woll doen al heſt kneeling thanked requeſt glad niſt ſay kiſt ſonne home ſhe goth way arriued theſe chriſten folke lond surrey great ſolemne rout haſtily soudon ſent ſond firſt mother reigne ſaied wife comen dout praiden hem riden againſt quene honour reigne ſuſtene great preſſe rich ray surreyans romanes ymet yfere mother soudon rich gay receiueth manner glad chere mother might doughter dere vnto next city beſide ſoft paas ſolemnly ride nought trow triumph iulius lucan maketh ſuch boſt roialler curious thaſſembling blisfull hoſt scorpion wicked ghoſt soudonneſſe flattering caſt vnder mortally ſting soudon cometh himſelf ſoon rially wonder tell welcometh much ioy blis thus mirth ioie let hem dwell fruit euery tale tell whan time come men thought beſt reuel ſtint men gon reſt time come old soudonneſſe ordained hath feaſt told feaſt chriſten folke hem dreſſe general yong old may men feaſt rialte behold dainty moe deuiſe dere bought riſe soudon wo euer thou art ſucceſſour worldly bliſſe ſpringed bitterneſſe end ioy worldly labour wo occupieth ende gladneſſe herken counſaile thy ſikerneſſe vpon thy glad day ha ••• thou minde vnware wo harme cometh behinde ſhortly tellen word soudon chriſten euerichone hewe ſticken boord onely dame cuſtance alone old soudonneſſe curſed crone hath friend doen curſed deed ſhe ſelfe would country lede surreien non yt conuerted counſaile soudon wot na heawe er aſterted cuſtance han taken anon fotehot ſhip ſterneleſſe god wot han ſet bidden lerne ſaile surrey ayenward itale certain treſour ſhe thither ladde ſooth ſayne vitaile great plente han yeuen clothes eke ſhe forth ſhe ſaileth ſalt ſe cuſtance full benignite emperours yong doughter ſo dere lorde fortune thy ſtere bleſſeth full pitious voice vnto croſſe chriſt tho ſaid ſhe clere welful auter holy croice reed lambes blood full pite weſh world fro old iniquite fro fende fro clawe kepe day ſhall drenchen deepe victorious tree protection trewe onely worthy bere king heauen woundes new white lambe hurt ſpere flemere feendes thy limmes faithfully extenden kepe yeue might life menden yeres day fleeteth creature ſee grece vnto ſtraite marocke auenture many ſory meale may ſhe baite death full oft may ſhe waite wilde wave would driue vnto place ſhe ſhould ariue men mighten aſken ſhe ſlayn eke feaſt might body ſaue anſwer demaund agayn ſaued daniel horrible caue euery wight maſter knaue lion frette aſterte wight god bare hert god liſt ſhew wonderfull miracle ſhe ſhould ſeen mighty werkes chriſt euery harme triacle certain mean often knowen clerkes doth thing certaine end yt full derke man wit ignorance ne nat know prudent purueyance ſhe feaſt yſlawe kepeth fro ye drenching ſee kept ionas fiſhes mawe till ſpouted niniuee wel may men know wight kept people ebrak drenching dry foot ſee paſſing hath foure ſpirits tempeſt power anoy lond ſee north ſouth alſo weſt eaſt anoyeth neither ſee ne londe ne tree southly commaunder thereof fro tempeſt aye woman kept well whan ſhe woke whan ſhe ſlept wher might woman meat drink haue thre yere laſteth vitaile fed egyptian mary caue deſert none chriſt ſans faile fiue thouſand folk great maruaile loaues fiue fiſhes two feed god ſent foyſon great need driueth forth occian throughout wide ſee till laſt vnder holde nempne ne fer northumberlond waue caſt ſand ſhip ſticked ſo faſt thence nolne tyde wil chriſt yt ſhe ſhould ther abide conſtable caſtle doun fare ſeene wrecke al ſhip ſought found weary woman full care found alſo ye treaſure ſhe brought language mercy ſhe beſought life body twin deliuer wo ſhe manner latin corrupt ſpeche algates thereby ſhe vnderſtond conſtable liſt lenger ſeche wofull woman brought lond kneleth doun thanketh god ſond ſhe ſhe would man ſey foule ne faire though ſhe ſhoulden dey ſaid ſhe ſo maſed ſee ſhe foryate mind trouth conſtable hath ſo great pite eke wife yt weepen routh ſo diligent withouten ſlouth ſerue pleaſe euerich place louen looken face conſtable dame hermegild wife painems countrey euery hermegild loued right life cuſtance hath ſo long ſoiourned oriſons many bitter tere till ieſu hath conuerted grace dame hermegild conſtableſſe yt place lond durſten chriſten rout chriſten folke fled countre painims conquered plague north lond ſee wale fled chriſtianite old breton dwelling ile refute meane yet na neuer chriſten ſo exiled na ſome priuite honoured chriſt heathen beguiled nigh caſtle ſuch dwellen three one hem blind might ſee thilke eyen mind men ſeen blind bright ſunne ſommers day conſtable wife alſo cuſtance han taken right way toward ſea furlong way two plaien roman fro walke three blind men met crooked old eyen faſt yſhet name chriſt cried blind breton dame hermegild yeue ſight lady waxe afraied ſoun leaſt huſbond ſhortly forto ſain would ieſus chriſts lore haue ſlain till cuſtance made bold bad werch chriſt doughter cherch conſtable woxe abaſhed ſight ſaied amounteth fare cuſtance anſwered ſir chriſts might helpeth folke fiend ſnare ſo ferforth ſhe gan law declare ſhe conſtable ere eue conuerted chriſt made beleeue conſtable nothing lord place ſpeake cuſtance fond kept ſtrongly many winter ſpace vnder alla king northumberlond full wiſe worthy hond againe scot men may well tourne woll againe mattere sathan euer v waiteth beguile saw cuſtance perfectioun caſt anon might quite wile made yong knight yt dwelt toun loue ſo hot foule affectioun verily thought ſhould ſpill might haue woeth auailed nought would doe manner ſinne wey deſpight compaſſed thought maken ſhamefull death dey waiteth conſtable away priuily night crept hermgilds chamber ſhe ſlept werie forwaked oriſons sleepeth cuſtance hermegilde alſo knight ſathans temptation ſoftly bed ygo cut throat hermegilde atwo laied bloody knife dame cuſtance went way ther god yeue miſchance soon cometh conſtable home eke alla king lond ſaw wife diſpitouſly yſlain wept wrong hond bed bloody knife fond dame cuſtance ala might ſhe ſay wo wit away king alla told miſchance eke ye time wiſe ſhip founden cuſtance ye han heard deuiſe king heart pity gan agriſe ſaw ſo benigne creature fall diſeaſe miſaduenture lamb toward deth brought ſtant innocent beforne king fals knight yt hath treſon wrought bereth hond yt ſhe hath thing natheleſſe great mourning emong people ſaid cannot geſſe ſhe done ſo great wickedneſſe han ſeen euer ſo vertuous louing hermegild right life bare witneſſe euerich hous saue hermegild ſlow knife gentle king hath caught great motife witneſs thought would enquere deeper caſe trouth lere ala cuſtance thou haſt champion fight canſt thou ſo welaway ſtarft redemption bond sathan yet lith lay thy ſtrong champion day chriſt thee miracle kithe without gilt thou ſhalt ſlaine aſwithe ſet doun knee thus ſhe ſaid immortall god ſauedeſt suſanne fro fals blame thou mercifull maid marie meane doughter ſaint anne beforne whoſe child angel ſing oſanne guiltleſſe felonie ſuccour el ſhall die haue ye ſeene ſometime pale face emong prees hem hath lad toward deth wheras hem get grace ſuch colour face hath men might know face yt biſtad emongs face rout ſtandeth cuſtance loketh queenes liuing proſperity dutcheſſes ye lady euerichone haue ſome routh aduerſity emperor doughter ſtant alone hath wiȝt make mone blood roiall ſtondeth drede fere thy friend thy greateſt nede alla king hath ſuche compaſſioun gentle herte full pyte eyen ran water doun nowe haſtely fette boke qd knight wol ſwere ſhe woman ſlowe yet wol u avyſe wol ſhall ben iuſtyſe breton booke written euangeles fet thereon ſwore anone guilty meane while hond ſmote vpon necke bone doune fell atones ſtone eyen bruſt face ſight euery body place voice heard generall audience ſaied thou haſt diſclandred guiltles doughter holy chirch high preſence thus haſt thou doen yet hold pee marueile agaſt prees diſmaide folke ſtonden euerichone dread wreche ſaue cuſtance alone great dread eke repentance hem hadden wrought ſuſpection vpon ſilly innocent cuſtance miracle concluſion cuſtances mediation king many another place conuerted thanked god grace fals knight ſlain vntroth judgement alla haſtily yet cuſtance death great roth ieſus mercy made alla wedden full ſolemnely holy maid ſo bright ſhene thus hath chriſt made cuſtance quene wofull ſhould lie wedding donegild mo king mother full tyrannie thought curſed hart braſt two would ſonne doe ſo thought deſpight ſhould take ſtraunge creature vnto make liſt chaffe ne ſtre make ſo long tale corne ſhould tell realte yt mariage courſe goth beforne bloweth trumpe horne fruit euery tale ſay eaten drinken daunce play gon bed skill right though wiues ful holy thing muſt take patience night manner neceſſaries pleaſings folke han wedded hem ring lay little holineſſe aſide time may none betide gat man child anone biſhop conſtable eke tooke wife keepe gone scotland ward fomen ſeke fair cuſtance yt ſo humble meke long gone child till ſtill halt chamber abiding chriſts time come man child ſhe bare mauricius fontſtone call conſtable doth forth come meſſenger wrote king cleaped alla bliſfull tiding befall tidings needfull ſay take letter forth goth way meſſenger doen auauntage vnto king mother rideth ſwithe ſalueth full faire language madame qd ye may glad blithe thanked god hundred thouſand ſith lady quaene hath child withouten dout joy bliſſe reigne lo letter ſealed thing mote beare haſt may yeue ye wol ought vnto ſonne king ſeruaunt night day donegilde anſwered time nay woll night thou take thy reſt morrow woll ſay thee leſt meſſenger dronk ſadly ale wine ſtollen lettets priuily boxe ſlept ſwine counterfeited full ſubtilly another letter wrought full ſinfully vnto king direct mattere fro conſtable ye ſhall letter ſpake queene deliuered ſo horrible fendliſhe creature caſtle none ſo hardy durſten therein endure mother elfe auenture come charmes ſorcerie euery wight hateth companie wo king yt letter ſein wight told ſorrow ſore owne hand wrote welcome ſonde chriſt euermore new learned lore lord welcome thy luſt thy pleaſance luſt put thy ordinance keepeth child foule faire eke may wife vnto mine home coming chriſt leſt may ſend heire agreeable liking letter ſealed priuily weeping meſſenger taken ſone forth goth done meſſenger fulfilled dronkeneſſe strong thy breth thy limmes faltren aie thou wraieſt ſecretneſſe thy mind ſorne thou iangliſt iaie thy face tourned new array dronkenneſſe reigneth rout ni counſaile hid withouten dout donegild ne haue non engliſh digne vnto thy malice thy tirannie therefore fende thee reſigne let enditen thy traitrie fie manniſh fie nay god lie fie fendiſhe ſpirit dare well tell though thou walke thy ſpirit hell meſſenger came fro king againe king mother houſe light ſhe meſſenger full faine pleaſed euer ſhe might dronke well girdle vnder pight ſleepeth ſnoreth guiſe night till ſumme gan ariſe eft letter ſtollen euerichone counterfeited letter wiſe king commaundeth conſtable anone vpon paine hanging high iewiſe ne ſhould ſuffren wiſe cuſtance within realme abide three day quarter tide ſame ſhip fond young ſonne gere ſhould crouden put fro lond charge ſhe neuer eft come cuſtance well may thy ghoſt haue fere ſleeping thy dreame pennance donegild caſt ordinance meſſenger ye morrow woke vnto caſtle halt next way conſtable letter tooke pitous letter ſey full oft ſaied ala welaway lord chriſt qd may world indure full ſinne many creature mighty god thy sin thou art rightful iudge may thou wolt ſuffer innocence ſpill wicked folke reigne proſperite good cuſtance ala ſo woe mote thy turmentour el dey ſhames death ni none wey weepen yong old place king curſed letter ſent cuſtance deadly pale face fourth day toward ſhip ſhe went natheleſſe ſhe taketh good intent chriſt kneeling ſtrond ſaied lord aye welcome thy ſond kept fro falſe blame while lond amongs keepe fro harme eke fro ſhame ſalt ſea although ſee ſtrong euer truſt mother dere ſaile eke ſtere little child lay weeping arme kneeling pitouſly ſhe ſaid peace little ſonne woll thee none harm kercher head ſhe braid ouer little eyen ſhe laid arme ſhe lulleth full faſt heauen eyen vp caſt mother qd ſhe maiden bright marie sooth woman eggement mankind lore damned aye die thy child croſſe yrent thy blisfull eyen ſaw turment compariſon betwene thy wo wo man may ſuſtene thou ſee thy child yſlaine thine eien yet liueth little child parfay lady bright wofull crien thou glory womanhead thou faire may thou hauen refute bright ſterre day rew child thy gentilneſſe reweſt euery rufull diſtreſſe little child ala thy guilt neuer wroughteſt ſinne yet parde woll thine hard father haue thee ſpilt mercy dear conſtable qd ſhee let little child dwell thee thou darſt ſauen fro blame kiſſe father name therwith ſhe looketh backward lond ſaid farewell husband routhleſſe vp ſhe riſt walketh doune ſtrond toward ſhip followeth prees aye ſhe praieth child hold pee taketh leaue holy entent bleſſeth ſhip ſhe went vitailed ſhip drede habundantly full long ſpace neceſſaries ſhould nede ynow hereid god grace wind weather almighty god purchace bring home better ſay ſee ſhe driueth forth way alla king cometh home ſoone vnto caſtle told asketh wife child conſtable gan heart wax cold plainely manner told ye han heard tell better ſhewed king ſeale letter ſaid lord ye commaunded paine death ſo haue done certain meſſenger turmented till muſt knowne tell plat plain fro night night place lain thus wittie ſubtill enquiring imagind harm gan ſpring hand knowen letter wrot venim curſed dede wiſe certainely effect alla drede mother ſlow may men plainly rede ſhe traitour allegeaunce thus endeth old donegild miſchaunce ſorrow alla night day maketh child wife alſo tongue tellen may woll cuſtance go fleeteth ſea paine wo fiue yeare liked chriſts ſonde ſhip approched vnto londe vnder heathen caſtle laſt name text find cuſtance eke child ſea vp caſt almighty god ſaueth mankind haue cuſtance child ſome mind fallen heathen hond eftſoone point ſpill ſhall tell ſoone doun fro caſtle cometh many wight gauren ſhip cuſtance ſhortly fro caſtle night lord ſteward god yeue miſchance theefe renied creaunce came ſhip alone ſaid ſhould lemman whether ſhe would nold wo wretched woman tho begon child ſhe cried full pittouſly blisfull mary halpe anon ſtrogling well mightily theefe fell ouer boord ſodainly ſee drenched vengeance thus hath chriſt unwemmed kept cuſtance foule luſt luxure lo thine end nat onely thou fainteſt man mind verily thou wolt body ſhend end thy werke thy luſts blind complaining many one may men find werke ſomtime thentent done ſinne either ſlaine ſhent may weak woman haue ye ſtrength defend againſt renegate golias vnmeaſurable length might dauid make thee ſo mate young armure ſo deſolate durſt looke thy dreadfull face well may men ſeene god grace yaue iudith courage hardineſſe ſlean prince holofernes tent deliuer wretchedneſſe people god ſay intent right god ſpirit vigor ſent hem ſaued hem miſchance ſent might vigor cuſtance forth goth ſhip ye narow mouth subalter sept yfleeting aie somtime weſt ſomtime north south ſometime eaſt full many wearie daie till chriſts mother ybleſſed ſhe aie hath ſhapen endleſſe goodneſſe make end heauineſſe explicit ſecunda par ſequitur par tertia let v ſtint cuſtance throw ſpeake romane emperour surrey hath letter know ſlaughter chriſtians diſhonour doen doughter falſe traitour meane curſed wicked soudonneſſe feaſt let ſtean leſſe emperour hath ſent anon ſenatour roiall ordinance lord god wote many one surreians done high vengeance brennen ſlean bring hem miſchance full many day ſhortly end homeward rome ſhapen hem wend ſenatour repaireth victory rome ward ſayling full roially met ſhip driuing ſaith ſtory cuſtance ſat full pitouſly nothing knew ſhe ne ſuch array ne ſhe nold ſey eſtate though ſhe ſhoulden dey bringeth rome wife yaue young ſonne alſo ſenatour ſhe lad life thus lady bring wo wofull cuſtance many another mo long time dwelled ſhe place holy werkes euer grace ſenatours wife aunt ſhe knew nere woll longer tarry caas king alla ſpake yore wife weepeth ſiketh ſore woll retourne let woll cuſtance vnder ſenatours gouernance king alla mother ſlain vpon day fell ſuch repentaunce ſhortly tell ſhall plain rome cometh receiue penaunce putten pope ordinaunce high low ieſu chriſt beſought foryeue wicked werks wrought fame anon rome town born alla king ſhall come pilgrimage herbegers wenten beforn ſenatour vſage rode againe many linage well ſhewen high magnificence done king reuerence great cheare doth noble ſenatour king alla alſo euerich hem doth great honour ſo befell day two ſenatour king alla go feaſt ſhortly ſhall lie cuſtances ſonne went companie som men would ſain ye requeſt cuſtance ſenatour lad child feaſt may tellen euery circumſtance may leaſt ſooth right mother heſt beforne alla meat ſpace child ſtood looking king face alla king hath child gret wonder ſenatour ſaid anon whoſe yt faire child ſtondeth yonder qd god ſaint iohn mother hath father hath non wote ſhortly ſtound told alla child yfound god wot qd senatour alſo vertuous liuer life ne ſaw neuer ſhe ne heard mo wordly woman maiden ne wife dare well ſay ſhe leuer knife breſt ben woman wicke man couth bring ye prick child like cuſtance poſſible creature alla hath face remembrance dame cuſtance thereon muſed yeue child mother aught ſhe wife priuily ſight ſped fro table might parfay thought yt fatome mine hed oughten deme skilfull judgement ſalt ſea wife ded afterward made argument wot chriſt hath hither ſent wife ſea well ſent country fro thence ſhe went anone home senatour goth alla ſee wonder chaunce senatour doth alla great honour haſtily ſent cuſtance truſteth well luſt dance ſhe wiſt wherfore ſond vnneth vpon foot might ſhe ſtond alla ſaw wife faire gret wept ruth ſee firſt looke ſet knew well verely ſhe ſorrow dombe ſtant tree heart ſhet diſtreſſe ſhe remembered vnkindneſſe twice ſhe ſouned owne ſight weepeth excuſeth pitouſly god qd hallowes bright wiſty ſoule haue mercy harme guiitleſſe mauris ſonne ſo like face el fiend fetch place long ſobbing bitter pain wofull heart mighten ceaſe great pity heare hem complain throgh plaint gan wo encreſe pray labour releaſe may tell wo till morrow ſo wearie ſpeake ſorrow finally ſooth wiſt alla guiltleſſe wo trow hundred time kiſt ſuch bliſſe betwixt hem two ſaue joy laſteth euermo like creature hath ſeen ſhall world may dure tho praied ſhe husbond meekely releaſing pitous paine would pray father ſpecially majeſtie would encline vouchſafe ſome day dine praied eke ſhould way father word ſay men would ſay yt child maurice doth meſſage vntill emperour geſſe alla ſo nice ſo ſoueraigne honour chriſten folke flour ſend child bette deeme went himſelfe ſo may well ſeeme emperour graunted full gentilly come dinner beſought ready came looked buſily vpon child doughter thought alla goeth inne ought arraied feaſt euery wiſe ferforth cunning may ſuffice morow came alla gan dreſſe eke wife emperour mete forth ride ioy gladneſſe ſhe ſaw father ſtrete light doune falleth fete father qd ſhe young child cuſtance full cleane remembrance doughter cuſtance qd ſhe whilome ye han ſent surrie father ſalt ſee put alone damned die good father mercy crie send heathenneſſe thanken lord kindneſſe pitous joy tellen betwixt hem thre ſince thus imet tale make end ſhall day goeth faſt woll longer let glad folke dinner ylet ioy bliſſe meat let hem dwell thouſand fold well tell child mauris ſithen emperour made pope liued chriſtenly chriſts church great honour let ſtorie paſſen cuſtance tale ſpecially old romane jeſtes men may find mauris life beare mind king alla time ſey cuſtance holy wife ſo ſwete englond come right wey liue joy quiete little laſteth hete ioy world fer time woll abide fro day night chaungeth tide liued euer ſuch delite day ne meued either conſcience ire talent ſome kin affray enuie pride paſſion offence ne ſay end ſentence little ioy pleaſance laſteth bliſſe alla cuſtance death taketh hie low rent paſſed yeare euen geſſe world king alla gan hent cuſtance hath full great heauines let v praien god ſoule bleſſe dame cuſtance finally ſay toward toune rome goth way rome come holy creature findeth father whole ſound ſhe ſcaped auenture ſhe father hath yfound doune knee ſhe goeth ground weeping tenderneſſe heart blithe herieth god hundred thouſand ſithe vertue holy almes dede liuen neuer aſunder wend till death departen hem life lede fareth well tale end ieſu chriſt might may ſend ioy wo gouerne v grace keepe v place ¶the squire prologue hoſt ſtirrops ſtoode anon ſaid good men hearkeneth euerichon thriftie tale none sir pariſh prieſt qd god bone tell v tale thy forward yore ſee well ye learned men lore muckle good god dignite parſon anſwerd benedicite eileth man ſo ſinfully ſwere hoſt anſwerd ienkin ye good men qd hoſt harkneth ſmell loller wind qd abideth god digne paſſion ſhall haue predication loller woll preachen v ſomewhat nay father ſoule ſhall nat saied squier ſhall nat preach ſhall goſpell gloſe ne teach leueth great god qd would ſowen ſome difficulte ſpring ſome cockle cleane corne therefore hoſt warne thee beforne jolly body ſhall tale tell ſhall ringen ſo merry bell ſhall waken companie ſhall philoſophie ne phyſicke ne tearmes queint law little latine maw king arabie ſendeth cambuſcan king sarra horſe sword rare qualitie daughter canace glaſs ring vertue whereof ſhe underſtandeth language fowl much tale either loſt elſe never finiſhed chaucer squire tale sarra lond tartarie dwelt king warred surrie ther died many doughtie man noble king called cambuſcan time ſo great renoun na regioun excellent lord thing lacked nought longeth king ſect borne kept lay ſworne thereto hardie wiſe riche pitous juſt alway yliche true word benigne honourable corage centre ſtable young freſh ſtrong armes deſirous batcheler hous faire perſon fortunate kept alway ſo roiall aſtate na ſuch another man noble king tartre cambuſcan two ſonnes eltheta wife eldeſt hight algarſife cleaped camballo doughter worthy king alſo youngeſt hight canace tell beaute lithe tong ne conning dare vndertake ſo high thing mine engliſh eke vnſufficient muſt rethor excellent couth colour longing art ſhould diſcriue every part none ſuch mote ſpeake ſo befell cambuſcan hath twenty winter borne diademe wont fro yeare yeare denie let feaſt natiuity doen crien throughout sarra city laſt idus march yere phebus sunne full jolly clere nigh exaltation marces face manſion aries collerike hote ſigne full luſtie weather benigne foules ayenſt ſunne ſhene ſeaſon yong grene full louden ſong affection hem ſeemed han getten hem protection ayen ſwerd winter kene cold cambuſcan haue told roiall veſtements ſit deis diademe full high paleis held feaſt ſo roiall ſo riche world na none liche ſhall tell array would occupie sommers day eke needeth deuiſe euery courſe order ſeruice wol tellen ſtrange ſewes ne swan ne heronſewes eke lond tellen knight old ſome meat full dainty hold lond men retch ſmall man may reporten tarie prime fruit loſſe time vnto firſt purpoſe woll haue recourſe ſo befell third courſe king ſit thus noblay hearkening minſtrals thing play beforne boord deliciouſly hall doore ſuddainely came knight ſteed braſſe hond broad mirrour glaſſe vpon thombe gold ring ſide naked ſword honging vp rideth high bord hall ne ſpoke word maruaile knight behold full buſily waiten yong old ſtraunge knight yt come thus ſodenly armed ſaue head full roially salued king queene lord order ſitten hall ſo high reuerence obeiſaunce well ſpeech countenaunce gawaine old courteſie though come ayen fairie ne could amend word high bord manly voice ſaied meſſage forme vſed language without vice ſillable letter tale ſhould ſeeme better accordant word chere teacheth art ſpeech hem lere cannot ſowne ſtile ne cannot climben ſo high ſtile yet ſay thus comen intent thus much amounteth yt euer ment ſo haue mind ſaied king araby inde liege lord ſolemne day salueth beſt may ſendeth honour feeſt readie heeſt ſteed braſſe eaſily well ſpace day naturell ſay foure twenty houres ſo ye liſt drought ſhoures beren body euery place heart willeth pace without weine foule faire ye liſt fleen aire doth eagle liſt ſore ſame ſteed ſhall beare euermore withouten harm till leſt though ye ſleepen back reſt turne writhing pin wrought could full many gin waited many conſtellation doen operation knew full many ſeale many bond mirror eke haue mine hond hath ſuch might men may ſee ſhall fallen aduerſitee vnto reigne ſelfe alſo openly ſee friend fo ouer lady bright hath ſet heart manner wight falſe ſhe ſhall treaſon ſee new loue ſubteltee openly ſhall nothing hide wherefore againe luſty summer tide mirrour ring ye may ſe hath ſent lady canace excellent doughter vertue ring ye woll ſhe liſt vpon thombe purſe bere foule fleeth heuen ſhe ne ſhall vnderſtond ſteuen know meaning openly plaine anſwere language againe euery graſſe groweth vpon root ſhall wel know wol boot wound neuer ſo deepe wide naked ſwerd hangeth ſide vertue hath yt man ſo ye ſmite throughout armure woll kerue bite thicke braunched oke man yt wounded ſtroke shall neuer hole till liſt grace ſtroken ye platte thilke place hurt much ſaine ye mote plat ſwerd againe stroken ye wound woll cloſe ſooth withouten gloſe faileth while hold kniȝt hath thus tale told rideth hall doun light ſteed ſhone sunne bright stant court ſtill ſtone knight chamber ſadde anone vnarmed meat yſette theſe preſents full rich yfette ſain ſwerd eke mirrour borne anon high tour certaine officer ordained therefore canace ring bore solemnely ſhe ſat table ſikerly without fable horſe braſſe may remeued ſtant ground yglewed may man place driue none engine windlas poliue cauſe cannot craft therefore place han laft till yt knight hath taught hem ye manere voiden ye ſhall great ye prees ſwarmed fro gauren hors ſtondeth ſo ſo high ſo broad long well proportioned ſtrong right ſteed lombardie therewith ſo horſly ſo quicke eie gentle courſer poile certes fro tale ere nature ne art coud amend degree people wend euermore moſt wonder couth gon bra fairie people ſemed diuers folke diuerſly demed many head many wit murmure doth ſwarme maden ſkils fantaſies rehearſing old poetry ſaied ylike pegaſe hors wing flee el greekes hors sinon brought troy deſtruction men theſe old bookes rede mine heart qd one euermore drede trow ſome men armes therein ſhapen hem citie win right good yt ſuch thing know rowned felaw low ſaied lied rather like apparence made ſome magike iogglours plaien theſe feaſts great ſundry thought thus iangle treat leaud people deemeth commonly thing made ſubtilly leaudneſſe comprehend demen gladly badder end ſome hem wondren mirrour born vp maiſter tour men mighten ſuch thing ſee another anſwered certes might well bee naturally compoſitions angel ſlie reflection ſaiden rome ſuch ſpeaken alhazen vitellion ariſtotle writeth liues queint mirrours proſpecttues knowen han bookes heard folk han wondred ſweard would ſo piercen euery thing fell ſpeech telephus king achilles queint ſpere couth heale dere right ſuch wiſe men may ye ſwerd right ye haue ſelue herd ſpeaken ſundry harding mettall ſpeaken medicine eke withall ſhould hardened vnknow algate tho ſpeake canaces ring ſaiden ſuch wonder thing craft ring heard neuer non saue moſes king salamon name cunning ſuch art thus ſain people drawen hem apart natheleſſe ſome ſaiden wonder make ferne aſhen glas yet glas like aſhen ferne han knowen ſo ferne therefore ceaſeth iangling wonder ſore wandren ſome cauſe thunder ebbe floud goſſomer miſt thing till cauſe wiſt thus ianglen demen deuiſe till king gan fro boord ariſe phebus hath left angle meridionall yet aſcending beeſt royall gentle lion aldrean tartre king cambuſcan roſe bord fat full hie beforne goth loud minſtralcie till came chamber paraments ſownen diuers inſtruments like heuen dauncen luſty venus child dere fiſh lady ſat full hie looketh hem friendly eie noble king ſet vpon trone ſtraunge knight fet full ſone daunce goeth canace reuell iolite able dull man deuiſe muſt han know loue ſeruiſe feeſtliche man freſh may ſhould deuiſe ſuch array couth tellen ye forme daunces vncouth ſo freſh countenaunces ſubtill looking diſſimulings dread jealous men apperceiuings ne man launcelot dead therefore paſſe ouer luſty head ſay iollineſſe lete hem till men ſupper dreſſe ſteward biddeth ſpices hie eke wine melodie vſhers ſquires ygone ſpices wine comen anone eten dronken end vnto temple reaſon wend ſeruice done ſoupen day needeth rehearſen array man wot well king feaſt plenty moſt leaſt dainty mo knowing ſupper goeth noble king ſeen horſe braſſe rout lord lady wondring horſe bra ſithen great ſiege troy men wondred horſe alſo ne ſuch wondring tho finally king asketh knight vertue horſe night praied tell gouernaunce horſe anon gan trip daunce yt knight laid hond raine ſaid ſir ſaine liſt riden ye mote trill pin ſtant ere ſhall tell betweene v two ye mote nempne place alſo country liſt ride ye come liſt abide bid diſcend trill another pin therein lieth effect gin woll downe diſcend done place woll abide ſtill though al ye world contrary ſworne ſhall thence ythrow ne yborne liſten bid thence gone trill pin woll vaniſh anone ſight euery manner wight come ayen day night liſt clepen againe ſuch guiſe ſhall ſaine betwixt full ſone ride liſt ni done enfourmed ye king y• knight hath conceiued wit aright manner forme thing full glad full blith noble king repaireth reuell beforne bridie toure yborne kept among iewels lefe dere horſe vaniſhed mannere ſight ye get thus lete luſt iolite cambuſcan lord feaſting till well nigh day began ſpring explicit prima par ſequitur par ſecunda noryce digeſtion ſleepe gan hem winke bad hem take keepe mirth drink labour woll haue reſt galping mouth hem keſt ſaid time lie adoun blood dominatioun cheriſheth blood nature friend qd hee thanken galping two three euery wight gan drawen reſt ſleepe hem bade chey tooke beſt dreames ſhul ben ytold full heed fumoſite cauſeth dreames charge ſleepen ſoundly till prime large moſt part canace full meaſurable woman father ſhe take leue gone reſt ſoone eue liſt apalled morrow vnfeſtliche ſee ſlept firſt ſlepe awoke ſuch joy ſhe heart tooke queynt ring mirrour twenty time ſhe chaunged colour ſlepe right impreſſion mirrour ſhe viſion wherfore ſunne vp gan glide cleped maiſtreſſes beſide ſaid luſt ariſe theſe old woman gladly wiſe maiſtreſſe anſwerd anon ſaid madam whider woll ye gon thus early folke reſt woll quoth ſhe ariſe leſt lenger ſlepe walken maiſtreſſe cleped woman great rout vp riſen wel ten twelue vp riſeth freſh canace ſelue ioly bright yong ſunne ram foure degree vp runne higher whan ſhe ready forth ſhe walked eaſie paas arrayed luſty ſeaſon ſote lightly playen walken foote nought fiue ſixe meyne trenche fer parke goeth ſhe vapor fro earth glode maketh ſunne ſeem ruddy brode natheleſſe ſo faire ſight made heart light ſeaſon morowning foules ſhe herde ſing right anon ſhe wiſte ment right ſong knew al entent knot euery tale tolde taried till luſt colde hem han hearkened yore ſauour paſſeth euer lenger fulſumnes prolixite ſame reaſon thinketh ſhould vnto ſame knot condiſcende make walking ſone ende amidde tre dry white chalke canace playing walke ſat falcon ouer head full hie pitious voyce gan cry wood reſouned cry beaten ſelfe ſo pitouſly wing till reed blood ran endlong tre ſhe ſtood euer one ſhe cryed ſhright becke ſeluen ſo ſhe pight na tygre ne cruell beaſt dwelleth wood neither forreſt nolde han wept wepe coud ſorrow ſhe ſhright alway ſo loud neuer yet man liue couthe falcon well diſcriue herde ſuch another fayrenes wel plumage gentilnes ſhape might irekened falcon peregryn ſeemed ſhe fremd lond euermore ſhe ſtood ſwounded lacke blood til welny ſhe fallen fro tree faire king doughter canace finger bare queint ring ſhe vnderſtood wel euery thing foule may leden ſaine coud anſwere leden againe hath vnderſtand falcon ſeyd welny routhe almoſt ſhe deyd tree ſhe goeth full haſtily falcon gan looke pitouſly held lap abroad well ſhe wiſt falcon muſt fallen twiſt whan yt ſhe ſwouned next lacke blood long waiten ſhe ſtood till laſt ſhe ſpake manere vnto hauke ye ſhallen cauſe tell ye ben furiall paine hell qd canace vnto hauke aboue ſorow death loſſe loue trow theſe ben cauſes two cauſen moſt gentil heart wo harme nedeth ſpeake ye ſelfe vpon ſelfe wreake proueth well either ire dread mote ben encheſon cruel deed syn ſe none wight chace ye loue god ſo doeth ſelfe grace may helpe weſt eaſt ne ſaw neuer er bird ne beaſt farde himſelue ſo pitouſly ye ſlea ſorrow verily haue ſo great compaſſioun god loue come fro tree adowne king daughter trew verily cauſes knew diſeaſe lay might would amend certes night wiſely help great god kind hearbes alſo ſhall right ynough find heale hurt haſtily tho ſhright falcon yet pitouſly er ſhe fell ground anone lyeth ſwoune deed ſtone til canace lappe itake vnto time ſhe gan ſwoune awake ſhe ſwoune abreyd right haukes leden thus ſhe ſeyd pity renneth ſoone gentle hert feeling ſimilitude paine ſmert proued day men may ſee well werke authorite gentle heart keepeth gentleneſſe ſee well ye haue diſtreſſe compaſſion faire canace womanly benignite nature principle hath ſet none hope fare bet obey vnto heart free make beware mee whelpe chaſtiſed lion right cauſe concluſion haue leyſure ſpace mine harme woll confeſſen pace euer one ſorrow told wept ſhe water wold till faucon bad ſtill ſike thus ſhe ſaid till bred ala ilke day foſtred roche marble gray tenderly nothing aileth ne wiſt aduerſite till coud flie full high vnder ſkie dwelt tercelet faſt ſeemed well gentleneſſe full treaſon falſeneſſe ſo wrapped vnder humble chere hew trouth ſuch manere vnder pleaſaunce vnder buſie pain wight coud haue wend coud fain deepe greyne died colour right ſerpent hideth vnder flour till may ſee time bite right ſo god loues hypocrite doth ſo ceremony obeyſaunce diſſimuling fair aſſemblaunce ſouneth vnto gentleneſſe loue tombe faire aboue vnder corſe ſuch ye wote hypocrite cold hote wiſe ſerued intent ſaue fiend non wiſt ment till ſo long weeped complained many yeare ſeruice fained till mine hert pitous nice innocent cruell mallice ferd death thought vpon othes ſurete graunted loue vpon conditioun euermore mine honour renoun ſaued preuy apert ſay deſert yaue mine hert thought god wote none wiſe nought tooke hert chaunge mine aye ſooth ſaid gone ſithen many day true wight theefe thinketh one ſaw thing ſo fer igone graunted fully loue ſuch guiſe haue ſaid aboue yeuen true heart free ſwore yafe heart mee anon tigre full doubleneſſe fell knee ſo deuout humbleſſe high reuerence eke chere like gentle louer manere rauiſhed ſeemed joy neuer troylus ne paris troy iaſon certes ne none man since lamech alder firſt began louen two writen folke beforne ne neuer ſithen adam borne ne couth man twenty thouſand part counterfeit ſophimes art ne worthy vnbocle galoche ther doubleneſſe faining ſhould approach ne ſo couth thanke wight manner heauen ſee woman ſhe neuer ſo wiſe painteth chere point deuiſe well word countenaunce ſo loued obeyſaunce trouth demed hert ſo thing ſmert neuer ſo lite wiſt thought felt death hart twiſt ſhortly ſo ferforth thing went wils inſtrument ſay obeied thing farre reaſon fill keeping bound worſhip euer ne neuer thing ſo lefe ne ſo leuer god wot ne neuer ſhall mo laſteth lenger yeare two ſuppoſed nothing good finally thus laſt ſtood fortune would muſt twin place whereof wo queſtion cannot make deſcription thing dare tell boldely know paine death thereby harme felt ne might bleue day tooke leue ſorrowfully eke wend verily felt much harme heard ſpeak ſaw hew natheles thought ſo trew eke repaire ſhould againe within little ſooth ſaine reaſon would eke muſt go honour oft happeth ſo made vertue neceſſite tooke well ſith muſt need beſt might hid fro ſorrow took hond iohn borow ſaid thus lo beth ſuch haue ben ſhall anſwerd needeth reherſe ſain bet wers hath al wel iſaid hath done therefore behoueth long ſpoone ſhal eaten fiend thus herd ſay laſt mote forth way forth fleeth till come leſt come purpoſe reſt trow thilke text mind thing repairing kind gladeth hemſelue thus ſain men geſſe men louen kind newfangleneſſe bird done men cage feed thogh thou night day take hem heed ſtraw cage faire ſoft ſilke giue hem ſugre hony bread milke yet right anon dore vp foot would ſporne adoun cup wood would wormes eat newfangle ben meat louen nouelries proper kind gentleneſſe blood may hem bind ferd tercelet ala day tho gentle borne freſh gay goodly ſee humble free ſaw vpon time kite flee ſuddainly loued kite ſo loue cleane fro go hath trouth falſed wiſe thus hath kite loue ſeruice lorne without remedy yt word faucon gan cry ſwouned oft canaces barme great ſorow hawkes harme canace woman made niſt might faucon glade canace home heareth lap ſoftly plaiſters gan wrap ſhe beck hurt ſelue cannot canace herbes delue ground make ſalues new herbes precious fine hew helen hawke fro day night doeth buſineſſe might bed head ſhe made mew couered veluets blew ſigne trouth woman ſeene without mew painted greene painted theſe falſe foules ben theſe tidefes tercelet owles right deſpight painted hem beſide pyes fele hem cry chide thus leaue canace hauke keeping woll ſpeake ring till come eft purpoſe ſain faucon got loue againe repentaunt ſtorie telleth v mediation camballus king ſonne haue told henceforth woll proceſſe hold ſpeaken auentures battails yet neuer herd ſo gret maruails firſt woll tell cambuſcan time many city wan wan thedora wife woll ſpeake algarſife full oft great perill ne ben holpen horſe bra woll ſpeake camballo fought liſts brother two canace ere might win left woll againe begin explicit ſecunda par apollo whirleth vp chare ſo hie till god mercurius houſe flie ¶there found foreſaid tale hath ſought diver place ¶here followeth word marchaunt squier word hoſt marchaunt faith squier thou haſt thee well yquit gentely praiſe well thy wit qd marchaunt conſidering thine youth feelingly thou ſpeakeſt thee alouth doome none eloquence ſhall thy pere yt thou liue god giue ye right good chaunce vertue ſend thee perſeuerance thy ſpeaking haue great deinte haue ſonne trinite leuer twenty poundſworth lond though fallen hond man ſuch diſcretion ye ben fie poſſeſſion man vertuous withall haue ſonne ſnibbed yet ſhall vertue liſteth intend play diſe ſpend leſe hath vſage leuer talke page commune gentle wight might learne gentleneſſe aright straw gentleneſſe qd hoſt marchant pardy full well thou woſt ech mote tellen leſt tale two breaken beheſt know well qd ye marchant certain pray haue diſdain though man ſpeake word two tell thy tale withouten word mo gladly ſir hoſt qd woll obey vnto hearkeneth ſey woll contrary wiſe farre wit may ſuffice pray god may pleaſen wot well good ynow marchants prologue weeping wailing care ſorrow haue ynow euen eke morrow qd marchant ſo haue mo wedded trow ſo well wot fareth ſo haue wife worſt may though fiend coupled wold ouermatch dare well ſwere ſhould rehearſe ſpeciall high malice ſhe ſhrew long large difference betwixt griſilds great patience wife paſſing cruelte vnbound ſo mote thee would neuer eft come ſnare wedded men liue ſorrow care aſſay ſo woll ſhall find ſay ſooth ſaint thomas inde part ſay god ſheild ſhould ſo befall ah good ſir hoſt haue wedded theſe moneths two parde yet trow life hath wedded though men rife heart ne couth mannere tell ſo much ſorrow coud tell wiues curſedneſſe qd hoſt marchant ſo god bleſſe since ye ben ſo much know art full heartily pray tell v part gladly qd mine owne ſore ſorry heart tell may ¶the marchants tale old january marrieth young may unequal match receiveth foul reward whylome dwelling lumbardie worthy knight born pauie liued great proſperite ſixtie yere wife leſſe man followed aye bodily delite woman appetite done theſe fooles ben ſeculeres paſt ſixtie yeres holineſſe dotage cannot ſaine ſuch great corage knight ben wedded man day night doth eſpie wedded might praying lord graunten mighten knowen blisfull life betwixt huſbond wife liuen vnder holy bond god firſt man woman bond none life ſaid worth beane wedlocke ſo eaſie ſo cleane world paradiſe thus ſaith old knight ſo wiſe certainely ſouth god king take wife glorious thing namely man old hore wife fruit treſore ſhould take yong wife faire might engendren heire lead life joy ſollace whereas theſe batchelers ſingen ala finden aduerſite loue ni child vanite truly ſit well ſo batchelers han oft paine wo brotell ground bilden brotelneſſe find freelte wenen ſecreneſſe liue liuen bird beſtes liberty vnder nice areſtes wedded man eſtate liueth life bliſfully ordinate vnder yoke mariage ybound well may heart joy bliſſe abound ſo buxome wife ſo true eke ſo tentiſe keep ſicke hole make wele wo ſhe nill forſake ni weary loue ſerue though hee lie bedred till ſterue yet ſome clerkes ſain ſo theophraſt one tho force though theophraſt liſt lie ne take wife qd huſbondrie ſpare houſhold thy diſpence true ſeruaunt doeth diligence thy good keep doth thine wife ſhe woll claime halfe part life thou ſick ſo god ſaue thy owne friend true knaue woll keepe thee better ſhe yt waiteth aye thy good hath done many day thou take thee wife vntrew full oftentime ſhall thee ſore rew ſentence hundred ſithes worſe writeth man god bone curſe take keepe ſuch vanite defieth theophraſt hearkeneth wife god yeft verely manner yefts hardely londs rent paſture commune mouables ben yefts fortune paſſen ſhaddow wall dread plainely ſpeake ſhall wife woll laſt thine houſe endure well lenger thee liſt peraduenture mariage full great ſacrament hath wife hold ſhent liueth helpleſſe deſolate ſpeake folke ſeculer eſtate herkneth ſay nought woman man helpe ywrought high god adam maked ſaw alone belly naked god great goodneſſe ſaid let v maken helpe man like himſelfe made eue may ye ſee hereby may ye preue wife man helpe comfort paradice terreſtre diſport buxome ſo vertuous ſhe muſt need liuen vnite one fleſh ben two ſoules geſſe nat one heart wele diſtreſſe wife ah ſaint mary benedicite might man haue aduerſite hath wife certes cannot ſay bliſſe betwixt hem twey may tongue tellen heart thinke poore ſhe helpeth ſwinke keepeth good waſteth neuer dell huſbond luſt liketh well ſaith nay ſaith ye ſaith ready ſir ſaith ſhe bliſfull order wedloke precious thou art ſo merry eke ſo vertuous ſo commended approued eke euery man halt worth leke vpon bare knee ought life thanken god hath ſent wife pray god dayly ſend wife laſt vnto liues end life ſet ſikerneſſe may deceiued geſſe werch wiues rede may boldly bearen vp hede beene euer ſo true alſo wiſe thou wilt werchen wiſe alway ſo woman woll thee rede lo iacob theſe clerkes rede good counſaile mother rebecke bounden kid ſkin necke father beneſon wan lo iudith ſtorie tell wiſe counſaile god people kept ſlue holofernes ſlept abigail counſaile ſhe saved huſbond naball haue ſlain looke heſter alſo good counſaile deliuered wo people god made mardochee aſſure enhaunſed ni nothing gree ſuperlatife ſaith seneck aboue humble wife suffer thy wife tongue caton bit ſhall command thou ſhalt ſuffer yet ſhe woll obey courteſie wife keeper thine huſbondrie well may ſicke man ſtill waile weep ni wife houſe keep warne thee wiſely thou wilt werch loue thy wife chriſt loueth cherch thou loue thy ſelfe thou loueſt thy wife man hateth fleſh life foſtreth therefore bid thee cheriſh thy wife thou ſhalt neuer ythee huſbond wife ſo men yape play wordly folke hold ſeker way ſo knit may none harm betide namely vpon wiues ſide ianuary told conſidred hath dayes old luſty life vertuous quiete mariage hony ſwete friend day ſent tellen hem theffect intent face ſad tale hath hem told ſaied good friend hore old almoſt god wot pit brinke vpon ſoule ſomewhat muſt thinke haue body folily diſpended bleſſed god ſhall ben amended woll ben certain wedded man anon haſt vnto ſome maid faire tender age pray ſhapeth mariage ſuddainly woll abide woll fonden eſpie ſide may wedded haſtily much ye ben ye ſhullen rather ſuch thing eſpien luſt beſt alien one thing warn friend dere woll none old wife haue mannere ſhall paſſe fifteen yere certaine old fiſh young fleſh woll haue faine better qd pike pikereell bet old beefe tender veell woll woman thirtie winter age ni beanſtraw great forage eke theſe old widdows god wote connen ſo much craft wade bote much broken harm hem leſt hem ſhould neuer liue reſt ſundry ſchooles maketh ſubtill clerkes woman many ſchooles halfe clerke certainely young thing may men gie right men may warm wax hand plie wherefore ſay plainly clauſe nill none old wife haue cauſe ſo ſuch miſchaunce couth haue pleaſaunce ſhould lead life aduoutrie ſo ſtreight devill die ne child ſhould none geten yet leuer hound eaten mine heritage ſhould fall ſtraunge honds thus tell dote wot cauſe men ſhould wedden furthermore wot ſpeaketh many man mariage wot doth page cauſes man ſhould take wife may liue chaſt life take wife great deuotion becauſe lefull procreation child honour god aboue paramour loue ſhoulden letcherie eſchue yeeld debt due man ſhould helpen miſcheefe ſuſter ſhould brother liuen chaſtity full heauenly ſirs leaue god thanked dare make auaunt feele lims hole ſufficiaunt doen man belongeth wot ſelue beſt may though hore fare doth tree bloſſometh ere fruit ywox bee bloſſomd tree neither drie ne dead feele hore head mine heart lims greene laurell yeare ſeene ſithen ye han heard mine intent pray ye woll aſſent diuers men diuerſly hem told mariage many example old blameth ſome praiſeth certaine laſt ſhortly ſaine day falleth alteration betwixt friend diſputation fell ſtrife betwixt brother two one cleaped placebo iuſtinus ſoothly called placebo ſaied ianuarie brother full little need han ye lord ſo dere counſaile aſke ye ſo full ſapience ne liketh high prudence waiue fro word salomon word ſaieth vnto euerichone worke thing counſaile thus ſaied hee ſhalt thou repent thee tho salomon ſpeake ſuch word mine owne deare brother lord wiſely god ſoul bring eaſe reſt hold owne counſaile beſt brother mine take motife haue court man life god wot though vnworthy bee haue ſtonden full great degree abouten lord full great eſtate yet neuer none hem debate neuer hem contraried truly wot well lord ſaith hold firme ſtable ſay ſame el thing ſemblable full great foole counſailour ſerueth lord high honour dare preſume thinke counſaile ſhould paſſe lord wit nay lord fooles ſweare fay ye haue ſelfe ſpoken day high ſentence ſo holy ſo well conſent confirme euery dell word opinioun god ni man toun ne italie coud better haue ſaied chriſt holdeth full well apaied truly high courage man ſtopen age take yong wife father kin heart hongeth jolly pin doth matter right leſt finally hold beſt iuſtinus aye ſtill ſat herd right wiſe placebo anſwerd brother mine patient pray sith ye haue ſaid hearkneth ſay senecke among word wiſe saith man ought well auiſe yeueth lond cattell ſithens ought auiſe right well giue good away fro well much ought auiſed giue bodie alway warne well child play take wife without auiſement men muſt inquire mine aſſent wheder ſhe ſober wiſe dronkelew proud way ſhrew chider waſter thy good rich poore el man wood ſo man find ſhall none world trotteth hole ne man ne beaſt ſuch men deuiſe natheles ought inough ſuffice wife ſo ſhe mo good thewes vice bad aſketh leiſure enquere god wot haue wept many tere full priuily ſith wife praiſe ſo woll wedded man life certaine find coſt care obſeruaunces bliſſes bare yet god wot neighbour namely woman many rout saine moſt ſtedfaſt wife eke meekeſt one beareth life wot beſt wringeth ſhoe ye may right liſt doe auiſe ye man age ye entren mariage namely yong wife faire made water earth aire yongeſt man rout buſie ynow bring haue wife alone truſteth ye ſhall pleaſen yeres thre ſain doen pleaſaunce wife aſketh full much obſeruaunce pray ye euill apaid well qd ianuary haſt thou ſaid straw thy seneck thy prouerbes count worth pannier herbes ſchoole termes wiſer men thou thou haſt heard aſſenteth right purpoſe placebo ſay ye ſay curſed man qd letteth matrimonie ſekerly word riſen ſuddainly ben aſſented fully ſhould wedded liſt would high fantaſie curiouſneſſe fro day day gan ſoule empreſſe ianuary marriage many faire ſhap many faire viſage ther paſſeth thrugh heart night night ſo tooke mirrour poliſhed bright ſet common market place ſhould ſee many figure pace mirrour ſame wiſe gan ianuary within thought deuiſe maiden dwellen beſide wiſt might beſt abide one beauty face another ſtont ſo people grace ſadneſſe benignite people greateſt voice ſhe ſome rich bad name natheleſſe betwixt earneſt game laſt appointed one let heart gone cheſe owne authoritee loue blind day may ſee bed ybrought puttreid heart thought freſh beauty age ſo tender middle ſmall armes long ſlender wiſe gouernance gentleneſſe womanly bearing ſadneſſe condiſcended thouȝt choiſe might ben amended himſelf concluded thought ech men wit ſo bad impoſſible replie ayenſt choice fantaſie friend ſent inſtaunce prayeth hem done yt pleaſaunce haſtily would come would bredgen labour ſome needeth go ne ride appointed would abide placebo came eke friend ſoone alder firſt bad hem boone none hem none argument make ayenſt purpoſe hath ytake purpoſe pleaſant god ſaid ground proſperite ſaid maiden toune beautie hath great renoune ſo ſhe ſmall degre sufficeth youth beautie maid ſaid would haue wife liuen eaſe holineſſe life thanked god yt might hauen wight bliſſe parten ſhall praieth hem labour need ſhapeth faile ſpeed ſaied ſpirit eaſe qd nothing may diſpleaſe saue thing pricketh conſcience woll rehearſe preſence haue qd heard ſay full yore ago may man haue perfite bliſſes two ſay yearth eke heauen though kept fro ſinnes ſeuen eke euery braunch thilke tree yet ſo perfit
