proſperitee ſo great eaſe luſt mariage euer agaſt mine age ſhall lead ſo mery life delicate without wo ſtrife ſhall haue mine heauen earth ſithen heauen bought ſo deere tribulation great penaunce ſhould liuing ſuch pleaſaunce wedded men doen wiues come yt bliſſe ther chriſt eterne liue drede ye brother tweie aſſoileth queſtion preie iuſtinus hated folly anſwerd anon right yaperie would long tale abrege would non authoritie allege ſaied ſir ſo non obſtacle god hie miracle mercy may ſo werch er ye han right holy cherch ye may repent wedded man life ye ſain neither wo ne ſtrife el god forbid ſent wedded man grace repent well rather ſingle man therefore ſir beſt rede deſpeireth haue memory parauenture ſhe may purgatory may god meane god whip ſhall ſoule vp heauen ſkip swifter doth arrow bow hope god hereafter ye ſhall know ni none ſo great felicite mariage ne neuer none ſhall ſhall let ſaluation ye vſe ſkil reaſon luſts wife attemperatly ye pleaſe nat amorouſly ye keep eke ſin tale done wit thin beth agaſt hereof deare brother wade fro matter another wife bathe ye vnderſtand mariage ye haue hand declareth full well litle ſpace fareth well god haue grace word iuſtine brother han take leaue ech whan ſaw muſt need wrought ſo wiſe ſlie treate ſhe faire maide may hight haſtily euer ſhe might shall wedded ianuary trow long tary told euery eſcrite bond ſhe feoſſed lond herken rich aray finally icomen day cherch tway ben went receiue holy sacrament forth cometh prieſt ſtole necke bad like sara rebeck wiſedome truth marriage ſaied oriſons vſage crouched hem bad god ſhuld hem bles made ſeker inow holines thus wedded ſolemnitie feaſt ſitteth ſhe worthy folke vpon deies full joy bliſſe palaies full inſtruments vittaile moſt deintieſt itaile beforne ſtood inſtruments ſuch ſoun orpheus ne thebe amphion ne made neuer ſuch melodie euery courſe came loude miniſtralcie neuer ioab tromped neither theodomas yet halfe ſo clere thebe whan city dout bacchus wine hem skinketh venus laugheth euery wight ianuarie become knight would aſſain corage liberte eke mariage firebrond hond daunceth bride rout certainly dare well ſay right emenius god wedding saw neuer ſo mery wedded man hold thou thy peace thou poet marcian writeſt v ilke wedding mery philologie mercurie ſongs muſes ſong ſmall thy pen eke thy tongue diſcriuen marriage whan tender youth hath wedded ſtooping age ſuch mirth may written aſſaieth ſelf may ye witten lie non matere may ſhe ſit ſo benigne chere behold ſeemed feire queen heſter looked neuer ſuch eie aſſuere ſo meeke looke hath ſhe may deuiſe beautie thus much beautie tell may ſhe like bright morow may fulfilde beautie pleſaunce ianuarie rauiſhed traunce euery time looked face heart gan manace yt night arm would ſtrein harder euer paris helein natheles yet great pittie thilke night offenden muſt thought ala tender creature would god ye might well endure corage ſo ſharpe kene agaſt ye ſhall nat ſuſtene god forbid might would god waxen night night would laſt euer mo would theſe people ago finally doth labour beſt might ſauing honour haſt hem fro meat ſubtill wiſe time came reaſon riſe men dauncen drinke faſt ſpices houſe caſt full joy bliſſe euery man squire hight damian carfe knight many day ſo rauiſht lady may paine nie wood almoſt ſwelt ſwounded ſtood ſore hath venus hurt wich brand freſh ſhe thereto ſo licand bed went haſtily time ſpeake let weep inow plaine till freſh may woll rewen paine perilous fire bedſraw bredeth familiar foe ſeruice bedeth ſeruaunt traytour falſe homely hew like adder ſlie boſome vntrue ianuary drunken pleaſaunce god ſhilde v iniquitaunce mariage ſee damian thine owne ſquire eke thy borne man entendeth doen thee villanie god graunt thee thine homely foe eſpie world ni wers peſtilence homely foe day thy preſence parformed hath ſunne arke diurne lenger may body ſoiourne oriſont latitude night mantill darke rude gan ſpred hemiſperie aboue departed luſtie rout fro ianuary thonke euery ſide home houſe luſtely ride doen thing hem leſt whan ſaw time go reſt sone luſtie ianuarie woll go bed would longer tary drinketh ipocras clarrie vernage ſpices hot encreaſe corage many lectuarie full fine curſed monke dan conſtantine hath written booke coitu eten hem al nolde nothing eſchew thus priuie friend ſaied god loue ſone may let voyd houſe curteis wiſe ſone men drinken trauers drew anon haſted ianuarie muſt done bride brought bed ſtil ſton whan bed prieſt ibleſſed chamber euery wight hem dreſſed ianuary hath faſt armes take freſh may paradiſe make lulleth kiſſeth full oft thicke briſtles beard vnſoft like skin houndfiſh ſharp brere ſhaue new manere rubbeth vpon tender face ſayed thus ala mote treſpace ſpouſe greatly offend time come woll doune diſcend natheleſſe conſidreth quoth ni workeman whatſoeuer may wirch well haſtely woll doen leiſer perfectly force long play true wedlocke coupled tway bleſſed yoke act mow ſin man may ſin wife ne yet hurt himſelf knife haue leaue play v law thus laboureth till day gan daw taketh ſoppe fine clarre vpright bed ſitteth ſingeth full loud clere kiſt wife maketh wanton chere coltiſh full ragerie full gergon flecked pie ſlacke skin necke ſhaketh yt ſang ſo chaunteth craketh god wot may thoght hert whan ſhe ſaw vp ſitting ſhert night cap necke leane prayſeth playing worth bean ſayed thus reſt woll take day come may lenger wake layed head ſlept till prime afterward ſaw time vp riſeth ianuarie freſh may holdeth chamber fourth day vſage wiues beſt euery labour ſometime mote haue reſt el long may endure ſay liues creature fiſh beaſt brid man woll ſpeake wofull damian langureth loue ye ſhall therefore ſpeake manere ſay ſely damian ala anſwer demaund caas ſhalt thou thy lady freſh may tell thy wo woll alway ſay nay eke thou ſpeake ſhe woll thy wo bewray god thine help better ſay ſicke damian venus fire brenneth dieth deſire put life aduenture lenger might wiſe endure priuily penner gan borrow letter wrote ſorrow manner complaint lay vnto faire freſh lady may purſe ſilke honging ſhert hath put layed hert moone moonetide ilke day ianuarie iwedded freſh may taure cankre gleden long hath may chamber bidden cuſtome vnto theſe noble bride ſhall eaten hall till day foure three leaſt paſſed let go feaſt fourth day complete fro noone noone whan high maſſe idoon hall ſat ianuary may freſh bright somers day ſo befell good man remembreth vpon damian ſaied saint mary may damian entendeth aie ſicke may betide ſquires ſtoden beſide excuſed becauſe ſickneſſe letted doen beſineſſe none cauſe might make tary forthinketh qd ianuary gentle ſquire trouth died harme routh wiſe diſcreet ſecree man wote degree thereto manly ſeruiceable thrifty man right able meat ſoone euer may woll ſelfe viſit eke may doen comfort word bleſſed euery man bounty gentleneſſe would ſo comforten diſtreſſe ſquire gentle deed dame qd ianuary take good heed meat ye woman whan ye haue ben chamber hall ye gone ſee damian doeth diſport gentleman tellen woll viſite haue nothing reſted alite ſpeed faſt woll abide till ſleepen faſt ſide word gan call ſquire marſhall hall told certaine thing would freſh may hath ſtreight way ihold woman vnto damian downe bed ſide ſat ſhe comforting goodly ſhe may damian whan time ſay ſecret wiſe purſe eke bill written hath put honde withouten saue ſighed wonderous deep ſore ſothly right thus ſayed mercie ye diſcouer nat dead thing kid purſe hath ſhe boſome hid went way ye get vnto ianuary icome ſhe bed ſide ſhe ſit full ſoft taketh kiſſeth full oft layed ſleep anon fained ſhe muſt gon ther ye wote euery wight need whan ſhe bill hath taken heed rent clout laſt priuie ſothly ſhe caſt ſtudieth faire freſh may downe ianuary ſhe lay ſlept till cough hath awaked anon prayed ſtrip naked would ſaid haue ſome pleaſance ſaid clothes encombrance ſhe obeieth ſhe lefe loth leſt yt precious folk wroth wrought dare nat tell wheder ſhe thought paradiſe hell let hem worch wiſe till euen ſong ring muſt ariſe deſtenie aduenture influence nature conſtellation ſuch eſtate heauen ſtood time fortunate put bill venus werkes thing hath time ſaien clerkes woman get loue cannot ſay great god aboue knoweth non act cauſeles deme woll hold pee ſoth freſh may hath take ſuch impreſſion day pittie ſicke damian fro heart ſhe driuen ne remembrance doen eaſe certain thouȝt ſhe thing diſpleaſe recke aſſure loue beſt creature though ſhert lo pittie renneth ſone gentle hert may ye ſee excellent franchiſe woman whan hem narow auiſe tyraunt many one hath heart hard ſtone would haue letten ſterue place well rather haue granted grace rejoyced cruel pride haue recked homicide gentle maie fulfilled pittie right ſo hond letter made ſhe ſhe graunted grace lacked nought onely time place ſhe might luſt ſuffice ſhall right woll deuiſe whan ſhe ſaw time vpon day viſit damian goth faire maie ſubtilly letter downe ſhe thruſt vnder pillow read luſt taketh hond hard twiſt ſecretly wight wiſt bad whole forth ſhe went ianuary ſent vp riſeth damian next morow paſſed ſickneſſe ſorowe kembeth proineth piketh doth lady luſt liketh eke ianuary goeth low euer dog bow ſo pleaſaunt euery man craft euery wight fain ſpeken good fully lady grace ſtood thus let damian need tale forth woll proceed clerkes holden felicite stont delite therefore certain hee noble ianuarie might honeſt wiſe longeth knight shope liue full deliciouſly houſing array honeſtly degree made king among honeſt thing garden walled ſtone fayre garden neuer none doubt verily ſuppoſe wrote romant roſe ne couth beautie well deuiſe ne priapus ne might ſuffiſe though god garden tell beautie garden well ſtont vnder laurer alway green full oft time king pluto queen proſerpina fayrie diſporten hem maken melodie well daunced men told noble knight ianuarie old deinte hath walke play woll ſuffer wight bear ye kay saue himſelfe ſmall wicket bare alway ſiluer clicket yt liſt ne would vnſhet would pay wife det ſummer ſeaſon thider would go maie wife wight two thing yt done bed garden perfourmed hem ſped wiſe many mery day liued ianuarie freſh may worldly joy may alway endure ianuarie ne liuing creature ſudden hap thou fortune vnſtable like scorpion diceiuable flattreſt thy head thou wolt ſting thy tale deth thrugh thine enuenoming brotell joy ſweet poyſon queint monſter ſo ſuddenly canſt peint thy gift vnder hew ſtedfaſtneſſe thou deceiueſt leſſe haſt thou ianuary thus deceiued haddeſt thy friend receiued thou haſt beraft eyen ſorow deſireth dyen ala noble ianuarie ſo free amidde luſt proſperitie woxen blind ſuddenly death therefore deſireth vtterly therewithall fire jelouſie leſt wife ſhould fall ſome folly brent heart would full faine ſome man ſlaine neuer death ne life ne would ſhe loue ne wife euer liue widdow clothes blacke sole turtle doth yt hath loſt make laſt moneth tway ſorow gan ſwage ſoth ſay whan wiſt might non paciently tooke aduerſite saue doubt may nat forgone na ielous euer one jelouſie ſo outragious neither hall ne none houſe ne none place neuer mo nolde ſuffer neither ride ne go honde alway full often wepeth freſh may loued damian ſo benignely ſhe mote either die ſodainely ſhe mote haue leſt waiteth whan heart ſhould breſt vpon ſide damian become ſorowfulleſt man euer neither night ne day ne might ſpeake word freſh may purpoſe ſuch matere ianuary muſt hand vpon euermo natheles writing fro priuie ſignes wiſt ſhe ment ſhe knew ſignes entent ianuary might thee auaile tho thou mighteſt ſee far ſhips ſaile good blind man diſceived diſceiued may ſee lo argus hundred eien euer couth pore prien yet blent god wot ſo ben mo wenen wiſely ſo paſſe ouer eaſe ſay freſh may ſpake yore warme waxe hath printed clicket ianuary bare ſmall wicket vnto garden oft went damian knew intent clicket counterfeited priuily ni ſay haſtily wonder clicket ſhall betide ye ſhall heren ye woll abide noble ouid ſooth ſayeſt thou god wote flight loue long hote nill find ſome manere pyramus thisbe may men lere thogh kept ful long ſtreit ouer ben accorded rowning wall ni wight couth find ſuch ſleight purpoſe ere day eight paſſed ere month iuly befill ianuary hath caught ſo great egging wife play garden wight tway morrow vnto may ſaid hee riſe vp wife loue lady free turtle voice heard lady ſwete winter gone raines wete come forth thine eyen columbine fairer thy breſts wine garden encloſed come forth white ſpouſe dout thou haſt wounded hert wife ſpot thee na thy life come forth let v taken diſport cheſe thee wife comfort old leaud word vſed vnto damian ſigne made ſhe ſhould go clicket damian hath opened wicket ſtert ſuch manere wight might ſee ne ſtill ſat vnder buſh anone ianuary blind ſtone may hand wight mo freſh garden go clapt wicket ſuddainly wife qd ni thou art creature beſt loue lord ſit v aboue leuer dien knife thee offend dere true wife god ſake thinke thee chees couetiſe ne good doubtles loue thee though old may ſee true woll tell certes three thing ſhall ye win thereby firſt loue chriſt ſelfe honour mine heritage toune tour giue maketh charter ye liſt ſhall done morrow ere ſunne riſt wiſely god ſoule bring bliſſe pray couenaunt ye kiſſe though jelous wite nought ye ſo deepe imprinted thought conſider beaute withall vnlikely elde may certes though ſhould die forbeare ben companie loue withouten dout kiſſe wife let v rome freſh may ſhe theſe word herd benignely ianuarie anſwerd firſt forward ſhe began weepe haue qd ſhe ſoule keepe well ye alſo mine honour wifehood ilke tender flour haue enſured hond prieſt body bond wherefore woll anſwere manere leaue lord ſo dere pray god neuer daw day ne ſterue foule woman may euer kin ſhame el empaire ſo name falſe lacke ſtrip put ſacke next riuer drench gentlewoman wench ſpeke ye thus men ben euer vntrew woman haue reproofe aye new ye none communing leue ſpeak v vntruſt repreue yt word ſhe ſaw damian sat buſh kneele began finger ſignes made ſhe damian ſhould climbe vpon tre charged fruite vp went verily knew intent euery ſigne ſhe couth make well bet ianuarie owne make letter ſhe told matter werch ſhall thus let ſit pery ianuarie maie roming full mery bright day blew firmament phebus gold doun hath ſtreames ſent gladen every flour warmeneſſe time gemini geſſe little fro declination cauſer ioues exaltation ſo befell bright morow tide garden ſide pluto king fayrie many ladie companie following wife queene proſerpine ech right line while ſhe gadred floures mead claudian ye may ſtory read griſely cart fet king fayrie adoune ſet vpon bench turues freſh greene right anon thus ſaid queene wife qd may nat ſay nay experience ſo proveth euery day treaſon woman doth man ten hundred thouſand ſtories tell notable vntrouth brotelneſſe salomon richeſt richeſſe fulfild ſapience worldly glory full worthy ben thy word memory euery wight wit reaſon thus praiſeth bounty man among thouſand men yet found one woman found neuer none thus ſaith ye king yt knoweth wickedneſſe ieſus filius sirach geſſe ne ſpeaketh ſelde reuerence wild fire corrupt peſtilence fall upon body yet night ne ſee ye honourable knight becauſe ala blind old owne man ſhall maken cuckold lo ſit letchour tree woll graunt maieſtie vnto old blind worthy knight ſhall haue eye ſight wife would done vilanie ſhall know harlotrie reprefe mo ye ſhall qd proſerpine woll ye ſo mother ſoule ſir ſwere ſhall yeuen ſufficient anſwere woman ſake though gilt ytake face bolde ſhullen hemſelue excuſe bear hem would hem accuſe lacke anſwere non hem ſhull dien ſee thing eyen yet ſhould woman ſo viſage hardely weepe ſwere chide ſubtilly ye ſhall leude gee recketh authoritees wote well iewe salomon found v woman fooles many one though ne found good woman yet hath found many man woman full true full good vertuous witnes hem dwell chriſtes houſe martyrdom preued conſtance romain ieſts eke make remembrance many true wife alſo ſir wroth ſo thogh ſaid found good woman pray take ſentence man meant thus ſoueraign bounte none god ſitteth trinite eye god ni one make ye ſo much salomon though made temple god houſe though rich glorious made temple falſe godis might thing yt fore forbod parde faire ye name emplaſter lechour idolaſter elde god forſooke god nad ſaith booke yſpared father ſake ſhould haue loſt reigne ſoner would iſet nat villanie ye woman write butterflie woman need ſpeake el ſwell till mine heart breake ſithen ſaid ianglereſſes euer mote hole broke treſſes ſhall ſpare curteſie ſpeak hem harm would v villanie dame qd pluto lenger wroth giue vp ſith ſwore mine oth would graunt ſight ayen word ſhall ſtand yt warne certeine king ſet lie quoth ſhe queen fairie anſwere ſhe ſhall haue vndertake let v mo word hereof make forſoth longer contrary let v turne againe ianuarie garden faire maie singeth merier popingay loue beſt ſhall non long alleyes gon till commen ayenſt thilke pery damian ſitteth full mery high among theſe freſh leues green freſh maie ſo bright ſhene gan ſike ſaid ala ſide ſir qd ſhe ought may betide muſt haue theſe peer ſee mote die ſo ſore longeth eten ſome ſmall peer greene help hir loue heauens queen tell well woman plite may haue fruite ſo great appetite ſhe may dyen ſhe haue ala qd ne knaue couth climbe ala ala qd blinde ye ſir force qd ſhe would ye vouchſafe god ſake pery armes take well wot ye miſtruſt would climbe well ynough qd ſhe foote might ſet vpon backe forſooth ſaid ſhall lacke might helpe mine hart blood ſtoupeth back ſhe ſtood caught twiſt vp ſhe goth lady pray ye wroth nat gloſe rude man ſodainely anon damian gan pullen vp ſmocke throng great tent thrifty long ſaid merieſt fit euer life ſhe yet lord tent ſerueth nothing thus foldeth twifold ſweet ieſus may ſwiue worth leke yet full gentill full meke leuer euenſong pluto ſaw wrong ianuary gaue againe ſight made ſee well euer might whan caught ſight againe ne neuer man thing ſo faine wife thought euer mo vp tree caſt eyen two ſaw damian wife dreſſed ſuch mannere may expreſſed would ſpeak vncurteſly vp yaf roring cry doth mother child ſhall die helpe ala harow gan cry ſorrow almoſt gan die wife ſwiued pery ſtrong lady whore doeſt thou ſhe anſwered ſir ayleth haue patience reaſon minde haue holpen eyen blinde vp peril ſoule ſhall nat lien taught help eyen nothing bet make ſee ſtrogle man vpon tree god wot full good entent strogle qd ye algate went ſtiffe round bell wonder though thy belly ſwell thy ſmocke breaſt lay ſo thech ſtil thought pointed brech god giue ſhames death dien ſwiued thee ſaw mine eyen el honged halſe qd ſhe medicine falſe certainely ye might ſee ye would ſay theſe word vnto ye haue ſome glimſing perfit ſight ſee qd well euer might thanked god mine eyen two trouth thought ſo ye maſe ye maſe good ſir quoth ſhe thanke haue made ſee ala quoth ſhe euer ſo kind dame qd let al paſſe mind come ſefe haue miſſaid god helpe ſo euill apaid father ſoule wende haue ſeyn damian thee lyen thy ſmocke lyen vpon breſt ye ſir qd ſhe ye may wene ye leſt ſir man waketh ſleep may ſuddenly well taken kepe vpon thing ne ſe perfectly till adawed verily right ſo man long hath blinde ne may ſuddainly ſo well yſee firſt ſight new comen hath day two yſain till ſight iſtabled awhile may full many ſight begile beware pray heauen king full many man weneth ſee thing another ſeemeth miſconceiueth oft misdemeth word ſhe lept fro ye tree ianuarie glad kiſſeth cleppeth full oft wombe ſtroketh full oft paleis home hath lad good men pray beth ye glad thus endeth tale ianuarie god bleſſe v mother marie wife bathe prologue experience though none authoritie world right ynow ſpeak wo mariage lordings ſith twelue yeres age thanked god eterne liue husbonds chirche dore haue fiue ſo often haue ywedded worthy men degree told long ago iwis ſithen chriſt went neuer oni wedding cane galilee thilke enſample taught ne ſhould wedded one lo ſharpe word none beſide well ieſu god man spake reprefe samaritan thou haſt fiue husbonds quoth ilke man hath thee thyn husbond thus ſaid certain meant hereby ſain aske point fift man nat husbond samaritan many might ſhe haue marriage yet herd neuer tellen mine age vpon number true definitioun men may deuine gloſen vp well wot expreſſe without lie god bad v wex multiplie gentle text well vnderſtond eke wel wot ſaid mine husbond leaue father mother take number mention made bigamie octogamie ſhould men ſpeak villany lo wiſe king dan salomon trow wiues many mo would god lefull refreſhed half ſo oft gift god wyuis man hath ſuch world liue god wot noble king wit firſt night many mery fit hem ſo well aliue bleſſed god haue wedded ſiue welcome ſixth wheneuer ſhall forſoth woll keep chaſte mine husbond fro world ygon chriſten man ſhall wed anon apoſtle ſaith fre wed godeſhalfe liketh ſaith wedded ſinne better wedded brinne recketh though folke ſay villany ſhreud lamech bigamy wot well abraham holy man iacob eke fer euer heare hem wiues mo two many another holy man alſo ſay manner age euer god defended mariage expreſſe word pray tell commaunded virginite wot well ye dread apoſtle ſpake maidenhead ſaid thereof precept none men may counſaile woman one counſailing commaundement put wholly owne judgement god commaunded maidenhead damned wedding dread certes ſeed yſow virginity whereof ſhould grow poule ne durſt commaund leſt thing maſter yafe none heſt dart ſet vp virginite catch ſo may runneth beſt let ſee word taken euery wight god liſt yeue might wot well apoſtle maid natheles though wrote ſaid would euery wight ſuch ni counſaile virginite ben wife yaue leue indulgence ſo ni repreue v • ed make die without exception bigamie good woman touch ment bed couch perill fire tow aſſemble ye know enſample may reſemble ſome held virginite perfit wedding freelte freelte clepe ſhe would lead life chaſtite graunt well haue none enuie though maidenhead preferre bigamie liketh hem clean body ghoſt mine eſtate woll make boſt wel ye know lord houſhold hath nat euery veſſell gold tre lord ſeruice god clepeth folke ſundry wiſe euerich hath god proper gift ſome liketh ſhift virginitie great perfection continence eke deuocion chriſt perfection well bad euery wight ſhould go ſell giue poore ſuch wiſe folow lore ſpake hem would liue parfectly lordings leaue nat wol beſtow floure mynage act fruit marriage tell alſo concluſion member made generation ſo perfit wiſe wight iwrought truſteth well nat made nouȝt gloſe ſo woll ſay vp made purgatioun vrine thing ſmale eke know female male none cauſe ſay ye experience wot well ſo clerk wroth ſay maked ſaien office eaſe engendrure god diſpleaſe ſhould men el bookes ſet man ſhould yeeld wife det wherwith ſhould pay payment ne vſed ſely inſtrument made vpon creature purge vrine eke engendrure ſay euery wight hold hath ſuch harneſſe told gon vſen hem engendrure ſhould men take chaſtitie cure chriſt maide ſhapen man many ſaint ſithen world began yet liued euer perfit charitie nill enuy virginitie let hem bread pure wheat fed let v wiues eat barley bread yet barley bread marke tell lord ieſu refreſhed many man ſuch ſtate god hath cleped v woll perſeuer nam precious wifehood woll vſe mine inſtrument frely maker hath ſent dangerous god giue ſorow mine husbond ſhal haue euin morow liſt come forth pay det husbond wol haue wol let ſhall debtour thrall haue tribulation withall vpon fleſh wife haue power life vpon proper body nat right thus apoſtle told bad husbonds loue v well ſentence liketh euery dell vp ſtert pardoner anon dame qd god ſaint iohn ye noble preacher caas wed wife ala ſhould bie fleſh ſo deare yet leuer wed wife yeare abide qd ſhe tale begon nay thou ſhalt drinke another ton er go ſhall ſauer worſe ale haue told forth tale tribulation marriage expert mine age ſay ſelfe hath whip maieſt thou cheſe wheder thou wolt ſip thilke ton ſhall ſet abroch beware er thou nere aproch ſhall tell enſamples mo ten ſo woll beware men ſhall men corrected theſe ſame word writeth dan ptholome read almageſt take dame woll pray said pardoner ye began tell forth tale ſpareth man teach v young men practike gladly qd ſhe may like pray company ſpeake fantaſy taketh griefe ſay mine entent play ſirs ſhall tell forth tale euer might drinke wine ale ſhall ſay ſooth tho husbonds three hem good two bad three good men rich old vnnethes might ſtature hold bounden vnto ye wot well meane parde god helpe laugh thinke pitiouſly night made hem ſwinke fay tolde ſtore yeue lond treaſore neded lenger doe diligence win loue hem reuerence loued ſo well god aboue ne tolde deinte loue wiſe woman woll beſie euer one get loue ſhe hath none ſithen hem holly mine hond giue londe ſhould take keep hem pleaſe profit mine eaſe ſet hem ſo worke fay many might ſongen well away bacon fet hem trow ſome men haue eſſex donmow gouerned hem ſo well law ech hem full blisfull faw bring gay thing home fro fayre full fain ſpake hem faire god wot chid hem ſpitouſly herkeneth bere properly ye wiſe wiues vnderſtond thus ſhul ye ſpeak bere hem hond halfe ſo boldly man swere lie woman ſay wiues wiſe miſſe auiſe wiſe wife ſhall ſhe good bere hem hond cow wood taken witneſſe owne maid aſſent herkeneth ſaid sir old keynard thine aray neighbour wife ſo gay honoured ouer ſhe goth ſit home haue thriftie cloth doſt thou ſirha neighbor houſe ſhe ſo faire art thou ſo amorous rowneſt thou maid benedicite sir old lechour let thy yapes haue goſſip friend without gilt thou chideſt fiend walke play vnto houſe thou comeſt home drunken mouſe preacheſt thy bench euill prefe thou ſayeſt great miſchiefe wed poore woman coſtage ſhe rich high parage ſaieſt thou tourmentrie ſuffer pride melancholy ſhe faire thou knaue thou ſaieſt euery holour woll haue may chaſtitie abide aſſailed euery ſide thou ſaiſt ſome folke deſiren v richeſſe ſhape ſome fairneſſe ſome ſhe either ſing dance ſome gentleneſſe daliance honds armes ſmale thus goeth deuill thy tale thou ſaiſt men may keep caſtle wall may ſo long aſſailed ouer ſhe foule thou ſaieſt ſhe coueteth euery man ſhe may ſee spaniell ſhe woll lepe til ſhe find ſome man wol chepe ne none ſo gray goſe goth lake ſaiſt thou yt woll without make ſaieſt hard thing welde wight man woll thonke helde thus ſaiſt thou lorell whan thou goeſt bed wiſe man needeth wed ne man entendeth vnto heuin wild thunder dent fire leuin mote thy wicked necke broke thou ſaiſt dropping houſes eke ſmoke chiding wiues maken men flee owne houſe ah benedicite aileth ſuch old man chide thou ſaieſt wiues woll vice hide till wedded wol hem ſhew well may prouerbe ſhrew thou ſaiſt ox horſes aſſes hound ben aſſaied diuers ſtounds baſins lauers men hem bie spones ſtooles ſuch husbondrie ſo pot clothes araies folke wiues maken non aſſaies till wedded old dotard ſhrew ſaieſt woll vice ſhew thou ſayeſt alſo diſpleaſeth thou wilt praiſe beaute thou pore alway face clepe faire dame euery place thou maken feaſt ilke day borne make freſh gay thou doen norice honour chamber within bour father folke alies thus ſaieſt thou old barell full lie againe prentiſe ienkin criſpe heer ſhining gold fine ſquireth vp haſt thou caught falſe ſuſpection woll nat tho thou wer ded morow tell hideſt thou ſorow key thy cheſt away fro good well thine parde weneſt thou make idiot dame lord called ſainct iame thou ſhalt nat althogh thou wer wood maiſter body good one thou ſhalt forgon maugre thin iyen helpeth enquere ſpien trow thou wouldeſt locke thy chiſt thou ſhouldeſt ſay wife go thou liſt take diſport woll leue tale know true wife dame ale loue man yt taketh keep charge go woll large men ibleſſed mote wiſe aſtrologien dan ptholome ſaieth prouerbe almageſt men wiſedome beſt recketh hath world hond prouerb thou ſhalt vnderſtond haue thou inow need thee recke care merely folke fare certes old dotarde leue ye ſhallen haue queint inow eue great nigard woll werne man light candle lanterne ſhall haue neuer leſſe light parde haue thou inow thou darſt plain thee thou ſaieſt alſo make v gaie clothes precious array perill chaſtitie yet ſorow thou muſt enforcen thee ſay theſe word apoſtles name habite made chaſtitie ſhame yee woman ſhould appareile qd nat treſſed heere gay peere perle ne gold ne clothes rich text ne thy rubriche nill worche much gnat thou ſaieſt alſo like cat ſo would ſenge cat skin would cat dwellen inne cat skin ſticke gay nill nat dwell houſe halfe day forth ſhe woll day dawed ſhew skin gon catrewawed thus thou ſaieſt gaie ſir ſhrew woll ren borell ſhew sir old foole helpeth thee ſpien though thou play argus c eyen wardcors beſt faith ſhall keepe leſt yet couth make beard ſo mote thee thou ſaieſt eke yt thing three greatly troublen earth wight may endure ferth lefe ſir ſhrew ieſu ſhort thy life yet preacheſt thou ſaieſt hateful wife rekened one theſe miſchaunces non reſemblaunces ye may liken parable ſely wife one tho thou likeneſt eke woman loue hell barren lond water may dwell thou likeneſt alſo wild fire brenneth hath deſire conſume thing brent would thou ſaieſt right wormes ſhenden tre right ſo wife deſtroieth husbond known ben wiues bond lordings right thus ye haue vnderſtond bare ſtiffely mine old husbond hond thus ſaiden drunkenneſſe falſe tooke witneſſe ienken neece alſo lord paine hem wo full giltles god ſweet pine horſe couth bite whine couth plain though gilt el oftentime ſpilt ſo firſt mill commeth firſt grint plained firſt ſo war iſtint full glad excuſen hem bliue thing gilt neuer life wench would beare hem hond yt ſick vnneths might ſtond yet tickled heart wend ſo great cheerte ſwore walking night eſpie wench dight vnder colour much mirth ſuch wit giuen v birth diſceipt weeping ſpinning god haue giue woman kindly liue thus thing may auaunt mee thende beſt degree ſleight force ſome manner thing continuall murmure grudging namely bed muckle miſchance would chide pleaſance would lenger bed abide felt arme ouer ſide till made raunſom vnto would ſuffer doe nicete therefore euery man tale tell wiue ſo may ſell empty honds men may hauks lure winning would luſt indure make fained appetite yet bacon neuer delite maked euer yt would hem chide though pope ſitten hem beſide would ſpare hem owne bord truth quit word word helpe god omnipotent tho right ſhould make teſtament ne owe hem word quit brought ſo wit muſt giue vp beſt el neuer reſt though looked wood lyon yet ſhould faile concluſion would ſay good lefe take keep meekly looketh wilken ſheep com neer ſpouſe let kiſſe cheek ye ſhould patient meek haue ſweet ſpiced conſcience sith ye ſo preach iobs patience suffreth alway ſith ye ſo well preach ye ſhall teach faire haue wife pee one v two mote obeien doubtles ſith man reaſonable woman ye muſt ſufferable aileth grutch thus grone ye would haue queint alone take lo haue euery del peter ſhrew ye loue wel would ſell belchoſe couth walke freſh roſe woll keep owne tooth ye blame god ſay ſooth maner word often hond ſpeake fourth husbond fourth husbond reuellour ſay paramour yong full ragarie stubburne ſtrong ioly pie well coud daunce harpe ſmale ſing iwis nightingale drunken draught ſweet wine mettellus foul churle ſwine ſtaffe bireft wife life ſhe drunk wine though wife ne ſhould haue daunted fro drinke wine venus muſt thinke ſo ſeker cold engendreth haile licorus mouth muſt hane lecherous taile woman vinolent defence know lechours experience lord chriſt remembreth vpon youth iolite tickleth hart root vnto day doth hart boot haue world time age ala woll enuenime hath bireft beauty pith let go farewell deuill goe therewith flower gon ni tell bran beſt mote ſell yet right mery woll fond forth tell fourth husbond ſay hert great diſpite delite quit god ſaint ioce made ſame wood troce body foule manere certainly made folke ſuch chere owne greace made frie anger jelouſie god earth purgatorie hope ſoule bene glorie god wote ſate full oft ſong ſhooe full bitterly wrong none ſaue god wiſt many wiſe ſore twiſt died came fro hieruſalem lyeth graue vnder rode beem ni tombe ſo curious ſepulture darius appelles wrought ſo ſubtilly waſt bury preciouſly let farewel god giue ſoul good reſt graue cheſt fifth husbond woll tell god let neuer ſoule come hell yet moſt ſhrew feele ribbes rew euer ſhall vnto mine ending day bed ſo freſh gay therewithall couth ſo well gloſe would haue belly choſe though beat euery bone couth win ayen loue anone trow loued bet loue ſo dangerous woman haue ſhall lie mattere queint fantaſie waite thing may nat lightly haue thereafter woll day cry craue forbid v thing deſiren preſe v faſt woll flee danger vttren chaffare great prees market maketh deere ware great cheap hold little priſe knoweth euery woman wiſe fifth husbonde god ſoule bleſſe tooke loue richeſſe ſometime clerke oxenford left ſchole went home borde goſſip dwelling town god haue ſoule name aliſoun knew heart eke priuite bet pariſh prieſt ſo mote thee bewrayed counſell husbond piſt againe wall done thing ſhould haue coſt life another worthy wife nece loued well would haue told counſell euery dell ſo full often god wote made face full oft red hote ſhame blamed himſelfe told ſo great priuite ſo befell one lent oft time goſſip went euer yet loued goe gaie walke march april maie fro houſe houſe hearken ſundry tale ienkin clerk goſſip dame ale ſelfe field went husbond london lent better leaſure pleie ſee eke ſeie luſtie folke wiſt grace ſhapen place therefore made viſitations village proceſſions preaching eke pilgrimage playes miracle marriage weared gaie skarlet gites theſe worm theſe moughts ne theſe mite vpon parell fret hem neuer dell woſt thou vſed well woll tell foorth happed ſay field walked till truely ſuch daliance clerke purueyance ſpeake ſaid widow ſhould wedden certainely ſay boaſtance yet neuer without purueyance marriage ne thing eke hold mouſes wit worth leke hath one hole ſterten faile idoe bare hand enchanted dame taught forſoth ſubtiltie eke ſaied met night would ſlaine lay vpright bed full blood yet hope truely ſhould doe good blood betokeneth gold taught al falſ dremed hem right nauȝt followed aye dame lore well thing ſir let ſee ſhall ſain ha god haue tale againe fourth husband wept algate made heauy chere wiues moten vſage kerchefe couered viſage purueyed make wept ſmall vndertake church husbond born morow neighbour yt maiden ſorow ienken clerke one tho helpe god ſaw go bere thought paire leg foot ſo cleane ſo faire heart yaue vnto hold trow twentie winter old fortie ſhall ſay footh yet alway colt tooth gaptothed became wele print dame venus ſeale helpe god luſtie one faire rich yong well bigone truly mine husbond told beſt queint might certes fully venerian feeling heart marcian venus yaue luſt licorouſneſſe mar yaue ſturdie hardineſſe mine aſcendent taure mar therin ala ala euer loue ſin followed aye mine inclination vertue conſtellation made couth neuer withdraw chamber venus good fellaw yet haue martes marke vpon face alſo another priuie place god ſo wiſely ſaluation loued neuer diſcretion euer followed mine appetite ſhort long blacke white tooke keepe ſo liked mee poore ne eke degree ſhould ſay ye month end jolly clerke ienken ſo hend hath wedded great ſolemnitee yaue lond fee euer yeuen afterward repented full ſore nold ſuffer nothing liſt god ſmote fiſt rent booke lefe ſtroke eares wex defe stubborne lioneſſe tongue ianglereſſe walke would doen beforn fro hous hous although ſworn full oftentime would preach old romane ieſts teach sulpitius gallus left wife forſooke tearme life open hede ſeie looking dore daie another romane told name wife summer game without weting forſooke eke would vpon bible ſeke ilke prouerbe eccleſiaſt commaundeth forbiddeth faſt man ſhall ſuffer wife roile would ſay right thus dout ſo buildeth houſe ſallowes pricketh blind hors ouer fallowes ſuffereth wife ſeche hallowes worthy honged gallowes nought ſet haw prouerbes ne old ſaw ne would corrected hate vice telleth ſo doe mo god wote made wood vtterly nold forbeare caas woll ſay ſooth thomas rent booke lefe ſmote defe booke gladly night day diſport would read alway cleped valerie theophraſt booke lough alway full faſt eke clerk ſomtime rome cardinall hight ſaint ierome made booke ayenſt iouinian booke eke tertullian criſippus trotula helowis abbeſſe ferre fro paris eke parable salomon ouids art bookes many one theſe bounden one volume euery night day cuſtome leiſure vacatioun worldly occupatioun readen booke wicked wiues knew hem mo legend liues good woman bible truſteth well impoſſible clerke would ſpeak good wiues holy ſaints liues ne none woman nere mo painteth lion tell god woman written ſtories clerkes han within oratory wold haue writ men wickedneſs marke adam may redreſſe child mercurie venus working full contrarious mercurie loueth wisdome ſcience venus loueth riot diſpence diuers diſpoſition ech falleth others exaltation thus god wote mercurie deſolate piſces venus exaltate venus falleth mercurie reiſed therefore woman clerke preiſed clerke old may nought venus werkes worth old ſho ſit downe writ dotage woman cannot keepe marriage purpoſe told thee beaten booke parde vpon night ienken ſire red vpon booke ſate fire eue firſt wickedneſſe mankind brought wretchedneſſe yt ieſu chriſt himſelfe ſlaine bought v hart blood againe lo expreſſe woman may ye find woman loſſe mankind tho rad sampſon loſt here sleping lemman cut hem ſheres treaſon loſt eyen tho rad ſhall lien hercules deianire cauſed ſet himſelfe fire nothing forgot care wo socrates wiues two xantippe caſt piſſe head ſilly man ſat ſtill dead wiped head durſt ſaine er thunder ſtint cometh raine paſiphae queene crete ſhreudneſſe thought y• tale ſwete fie ſpeake griſely thing horrible luſt liking clitemneſtra letcherie falſely made husbond die rad well good deuotion told eke occaſion amphiaraus thebe loſt life husbond legend life eriphilem ouche gold hath priuily vnto greekes told husbond hid place thebe ſorry grace lima told lucie made husbonds die one loue hate lima husbond euin late empoyſoned ſhe fo lucia iſ • erous loued husbond ſo ſhould alway vpon thinke gaue ſuch loue manner drinke dead ere morrow thus algates husbonds han ſorrow told one latumeus complained fellow arius garden growed ſuch tree ſaid wiues three honged hemſelfe hart diſpitous lefe brother qd arius yeue plant blisful tree garden planted ſhall bee latter date wiues hath red ſome han ſlain husband bed let letchour dight hem night while corſe lay floore vpright ſome driuen nailes brain while ſleep thus haue hem ſlain haue yeue hem poyſon drink ſpake harm hart may think therwithall knew mo prouerbes world groweth graſſe herbes bet qd thine habitation lion foule dragon woman vſing chide bet qd high roofe abide angry wife doun hous ben ſo wicked ſo contrarious haten husbonds louen aie ſaied woman caſt ſhame awaie ſhe caſt ſmock farther mo faire woman ſhe chaſt alſo like gold ring sowes noſe coud wen • coud ſuppoſe wo miue hart pine ſaw would neuer fine reden curſed booke night ſuddainly three leaues haue plight booke right radde eke fiſt ſo tooke cheke fire fell backward adoun vp ſtert doth wood lioun fiſt ſmote mine head floore lay dead ſeie ſtill lay agaſt would haue fled away till laſt ſwoun braied oh haſt thou ſlaine falſe theefe ſaied lond thus haſt thou murdred mee et dead yet woll kiſſe thee neere came kneeled faire adoun ſaied deere ſuſter ſweet aliſoun helpe god ſhall thee neuer ſmite haue doen thy ſelfe wite foryeue thee beſeke yet eftſoones hit cheke ſaied theefe thus much bewreke woll die may longer ſpeke laſt mokell care wo fell accorded within ſelues two yafe bridle mine hond haue gouernaunce hous lond tongue hond alſo made hem bren booke anon tho gotten vnto maiſtrie ſoueraignte ſaied mine owne true wife thou liſt tear thy life keepe thine honour eke mine eſtate day neuer debate god helpe ſo kinde wife fro denmarke vnto inde alſo true ſo pray god ſit majeſtie bliſſe ſoule mercy deare woll ſay tale ye woll heare frere lough heard dame qd ſo haue joy blis long preamble tale sompner herd frere gale lo qd sompner god armes two frere woll entermete euermo lo good men flie eke frere woll fall euery diſh eke matere ſpeakeſt thou preambulatioun amble trot either peace ſit adoun thou letteſt diſport mattere ye wolt thou ſo ſit sompner qd ye frere fay ſhall ere go tell sompner ſuch tale two folke ſhull laugh place el frere beſhrew thy face qd sompner beſhrew mee tell tale two three freres ere come sitting burne ſhall make thine hart murne well wot thy patience gone hoſt cried peace anone ſaied let woman tell tale ye faren folke dronken ale dame tell forth tale beſt ready ſir qd ſhe right leſt haue licence worthy frere yes dame tell forth tale woll batcheler king arthur court enjoined queen tell thing woman moſt deſire length taught old woman cauſe enforced marry ¶the wife bathe tale old dayes king artour breton ſpeaken great honour lond fulfilled fairie elfe queene hir iolly companie daunced full oft many greene mead old opinion read ſpeake many hundred yeare ago man ſee none elfes mo great charity prayeres limitours holy freres fearchen euery land euery ſtreame thicke mote sunne beame bliſſing hals chamber kitchen boures city boroughes caſtles hie toures thropes berne shepens dairy maketh fairy wont walke elfe walketh limitour himſelfe vndermeles morning ſaieth mattins holy thing goeth limitatioun woman may go ſafely vp doun euery buſh vnder euery tree ni none incubus hee ne doen hem diſhonour ſo fell king artour houſe luſtie batcheler day came riding fro riuer happed alone borne ſaw maid walking beforne maid anon maugre head force beraft maidenhead oppreſſion ſuch clamour ſuch purſute vnto king artour damned knight dead courſe law ſhould haue loſt head perauenture ſuch ſtatute tho queene lady mo sa long praiden king grace till life graunted place yaue queene cheſe yt ſhe would ſaue ſpill queen thanketh ye king al hir might thus ſpake ſhe knight ſhe ſey time certaine day thou ſtandeth yet qd ſhe ſuch array thy life yet haſt thou ſurete graunt thee thy life thou canſt tell thing woman moſt deſiren beware keepe thy necke bone yren thou canſt tell anon yet woll yeue thee leaue gon tweluemonth day ſeeke lere anſwere ſufficient matere ſuertie woll haue ere thou paſſe thy body yelde place wo knight ſorrowfully liketh may done liketh laſt cheſe wend come ayen right yeares end ſuch anſwer god wold puruay taketh leue wendeth forth way ſeeketh euery houſe euery place hopeth find grace learne thing woman louen moſt ne couth arriuen cooſt might find matere two creature according yfere ſaid woman loued beſt richeſſe ſaid honour ſome ſaid jollineſſe ſaid rich array ſome ſaid luſt bed oft time widdow wed ſaid heart moſt yeaſed flatered ypraiſed goeth full ſooth woll lie man ſhall win v beſt flatterie attendaunce buſineſſe ben wee ylimed leſſe ſome men ſain louen beſt free right v leſt man repreue v vice ſay wiſe nothing nice truly ni none v wight woll claw v gall nill like ſaith v footh aſſay ſhall find ſo dooth neuer ſo vicious within woll holden wiſe cleane ſin ſome men ſain great delite haue hold ſtable eke ſecre purpoſe ſtedfaſtly dwell bewray thing men v tell tale worth rake ſtele parde woman nothing hele witneſſe midas woll ye tale ouid among thing ſmale said midas vnder long haires growing head two aſſes eares vice hid beſt might full ſubtilly euery man ſight ſaue wife wiſt mo loued moſt truſted alſo praied creature nold tellen disfigure ſwore world win nold villany ne ſin maken huſbond haue ſo foule name nold tell owne ſhame natheles thought ſhe dide ſhe ſo long ſhould counſaile hide thought ſwoll ſo ſore hert needely ſome word ſhe muſt aſtert ſith ſhe durſt tellen man doun marri faſt ſhe ran till ſhe came hert fire bittour bumbeth mite laid mouth vnto water adoun bewray thou water thy ſoun qd ſhe thee tell mo mine husbond hath long aſſes eares two mine heart hole might lenger keepe dout mow ye ſee though time abide yet mote counſaile hide remnaunt tale ye readeth ouid ye may lere knight tale ſpecially ſaw might come therby ſay woman louen moſt within heart ſorrowfull ghoſt home goth might ſoiourne day come muſt home returne way happed ride care vnder forreſt ſide whereas ſaw vpon daunce go lady foure twenty yet mo toward daunce drow full yerne hope ſome wisdome ſhould lerne certainly ere came fully vaniſhed daunce niſt creature ſaw bare life saue greene ſitting old wife fouler wight may man deuiſe againe knight old wife gan ariſe ſaid ſir knight forth lieth way tell ye ſeeken fay peraduenture may better theſe old folke con much thing qd ſhe lefe mother qd knight certaine nam dead ſaine thing woman moſt deſire coud ye wiſſe wold quite wel hire plight thy troth hand qd ſhe next thing require thee thou ſhalt thy might woll tell night haue troth qd ye knight graunt qd ſhe may well auaunt thy life ſafe woll ſtond therby vpon life queene ſay let ſee proudeſt hem weareth kerchefe call dare ſay nay ſhall teach let v go forth without lenger ſpeche tho rowned ſhe piſtell eare glad haue feare ben comen ye court knight said hold day hight ready anſwere ſaid full many noble wife many maid many widdow wiſe queen ſelfe ſitting iuſtice aſſembled ben anſwere heare afterward knight bode apeare euery wight commanded ſilence knight ſhould tell audience thing worldly woman loued beſt knight ne ſtood ſtill doth beaſt queſtion anon anſwerd manly voice court herd liege lady generally qd woman deſiren haue ſoueraignte well ouer huſbonds loue ben maiſtrie hem moſt deſire though ye kill doth liſt court na wife ne maid ne widdow contraried ſaid ſaid worthy han life word vp ſtert old wife yt knight found ſitting ye green mercy qd ſhe ſoueraigne lady queen ere court depart right taught anſwere vnto knight plight trouth firſt thing would requere would lay might court pray thee ſir knight qd ſhe thou take vnto thy wife well thou woſt haue kept thy life ſay falſe ſay nay vpon thy fay knight anſwerd ala welaway wot right well ſuch beheſt god loue cheſe new requeſt take good let body go nay qd ſhe ſhrew v two though foule old pore nold mettall ne ore vnder yerth graue lithe aboue thy wife thy loue loue qd nay damnation ala nation euer ſo foule diſparaged nought end conſtrained need muſt wed taketh old wife goth bed woulden ſome men ſay perauenture negligence cure tellen ioy array feaſt ilke day thing anſwer ſhortly ſhall ſay na ioy ne feaſt na heavineſſe much ſorrow priuily wedded morrow day hid oule wo wife looked ſo foule gret ye ſorow yt kniȝt thought wife bed ybrought walloweth turneth fro old wife lay ſmiling euermo ſaid deare husbond benedicite fareth euery knight thus ye law king artours hous euery knight loue ſo daungerous owne loue eke wife ſhe ſaued hath life certes yet neuer vnright fare ye thus firſt night ye faren like man loſt wit fie gilt god loue tell ſhall amended may amended qd knight ala nay nay woll amended neuer mo thou art ſo loathly ſo old alſo thereto comen ſo low kind little wonder thogh iwallow wind would god qd mine hert would breſt qd ſhe cauſe vnreſt ye certainely qd wonder ni ſir qd ſhe couth amend liſt ere dayes three well ye might beare vnto ye ſpeake ſuch gentleneſſe diſcended old richeſſe therefore ſhullen ye gentleman errogaunce worth hen lo moſt vertuous alway preuy apert moſt intendeth aye gentle deed take greateſt gentleman chriſt wold claimed gentleneſſe elder old richeſſe though yeue v heritage claimen ben high parage yet may bequeath nothing none v vertuous living made hem gentleman ycalled bad v followen hem ſuch degre full well wiſe poet florence hight dante ſpeake ſentence lo ſuch manner rime dante tale full ſelde vp riſeth braunches ſmale proweſſe man god goodneſſe woll claime gentleneſſe elder may nothing claime temporal thing yt men may hurt maime eke euery wight wot well gentleneſſe planted naturally vnto certaine linage doun line preuy apert wold neuer fine done gentleneſſe faire office might done villany ne vice take fire beare derkeſt hous betwixt mount caucaſus let men ſhut dores go thenne yet woll fire faire lie brenne twenty thouſand men might behold office naturall aye woll hold vpon perill life till die may ye ſee well gentrie annexed poſſeſſion sithen folke operation alway doth fire lo kind god wot men may full often find lord ſonne done ſhame villany woll haue priſe gentry borne gentle hous elder noble vertuous nill himſelfe gentle deedes follow gentle auncetre dead ni gentle duke erle fie villaines ſinful deed maketh cherle gentleneſſe ni renomie thine auncetres high bountie ſtrong thing thy perſone thy gentleneſſe commeth fro god alone cometh gentleneſſe grace nothing bequeath v place thinketh noble ſaith valerius thilke tullius hoſtilius pouerty roſe high nobleſſe readeth seneck readeth eke boece ſhall ye ſeene expreſſe dread gentle doth gentle deedis therfore deare husbond thus conclude mine auncetors rude yet may high god ſo hope graunt grace liue vertuouſly gentle begin liue vertuouſly leauen ſin ye pouertie repreue high god beleue wilfull pouerte cheſe lead life certes euery man maid wife may vnderſtond ieſu heauen king ne would cheſe vicious liuing glad pouert honeſt thing certaine woll seneck clerkes ſaine ſo wold hold paid pouert hold rich ſhert coueteth full poore wight would han might yt nought hath ne coueteth haue rich although ye hold knaue pouert ſinne properly iuuenall ſaith pouert merrily poore man goeth way beforne theeues may ſing play pouert hatefull good geſſe full great bringer buſineſſe great amender eke ſapience taketh patience pouert although ſeeme elenge poſſeſſion wight woll challenge pouerte full often man low maketh god eke himſelfe know pouert ſpectacle thinketh one may friend ſee therfore ſince greue pouert repreue ſir eke elde ye repreued certes ſir though none authorite booke ye gentles honour sain men ſhould old wight honour cleape hem father gentleneſſe author ſhall find geſſe ye ſain yt foule old drede cokewold filth elthe foule ſo mote thee ben great wardeins vpon chaſtite natheles ſince know delite ſhall fulfill worldly appetite theſe qd ſhe one theſe thing twey haue foule old till dey true humble wife neuer diſpleaſe life el woll haue yong faire take auenture repaire ſhall come houſe becauſe ſome place may well cheſe ſelue whether yt liketh knight auiſeth ſore liketh laſt ſaid manere lady loue wife ſo dere put wiſe gouernaunce cheſeth ſelfe may pleaſaunce moſt honour alſo force whether two liketh ſufficeth haue got maiſtry qd ſhe since may cheſe gouerne leſt ye certes wife qd hold beſt kiſſe qd ſhe lenger wroth truth woll ſay faire good pray god mote ſterue wood alſo good trew euer wife ſithen world new morrow faire ſeene lady empreſſe queene eaſt eke weſt doth life right leſt caſt vp courtein looke knight ſaw verily ſhe ſo faire ſo young thereto ioy hent armes two hart bathed bath bliſſe thouſand time row gan kiſſe ſhe obeyed euery thing mought done pleaſure liking thus liued vnto liues end perfit joy ieſu chriſt v ſend husbonds meeke yong freſh abed grace ouerliue hem wed pray god ſhort liues gouerned wife old angry niggard diſpence god ſend hem ſoone peſtilence ¶the frier prologue worthy limitour noble frere made alway maner louring chere vpon sompner honeſte villaines word yet ſpake laſt ſaid wife dame god yeue right good life ye haue touched ſo mote ſchole matter full great difficulte ye haue ſaid much thing right well ſay dame riden way v needeth ſpeaken game let authority god name preaching ſchoole clargie like vnto companie woll sompner tell game parde ye may well know name sompner may good ſaid pray none euill apaid sompner renner vp doun maundements fornicatioun ybeat euery tounes end tho ſpake hoſt ſaid ſir ye ſhould ben hend curteis man eſtate company woll debate telleth tale let sompner nay qd sompner let ſay ſo liſt cometh lote god ſhall quite euery grote ſhall tell great honour flattering limitour eke many another manner crime needeth rehearſe time office ſhall tell ywis hoſt anſwerd peace afterward ſaid vnto frere tell forth tale mine owne maiſter dere ¶the freres tale sompner devil meeting way conference become ſworn brother hell go together covert invective againſt bribery spiritual court thoſe dayes whylome dwelling countre archdeacon man high degre boldly execution puniſhing fornication witchcraft eke baudrie defamation aduoutrie church reues teſtaments contract lacke ſacraments vſurie ſimonie alſo certes letcherours much wo ſhoulden ſing hent ſmall tythers foule yſhent perſon would vpon hem plaine might aſſert hem pecunial paine ſmall tithe ſmall offering made people pitouſly ſing ere biſhop caught hem hooke archdeacon booke jurdiction power done hem correction sompner ready hond ſ • ier boy none englond ſubtilly eſpiaile taught might auaile couth ſpare letchours one two teachen foure twenty mo thogh ſompner wood hare tell harlottry woll ſpare ben correction v juridiction ne neuer ſhullen tearme liues peter ſo ben woman ſtewes qd sompner yput cure peace miſchance miſauenture said hoſt let tell tale telleth forth let sompner gale ne ſpareth mine owne maiſter dere falſe theef ſompner qd frere alway baud ready hond hauke lure englond telleth ſecre knew acquaintance come anew approver priuely tooke himſelfe great profit thereby maiſter knew alway wan without maundement leaud man coud ſummon paine chriſts curſe glad fillen purſe maden great feaſts nale right iudas purſes ſmale theefe right ſuch theefe maiſter halfe dutie ſhall yeue laud theefe ſompner eke baud eke wench retinue whether ſir robert ſir hue iohn rafe ſo lay hem told eare thus wench one aſſent would fetch fained maundement ſummon hem chapiter two pill man let wench go would ſay friend ſhall thy ſake ſtriken thee letter blake thou dare caſe trauaile thy friend may thee auaile certaine knew bribries mo poſſible tell yeares two world ni dog hurt deere whole know bet sompner knew ſlie letchour auouter el paramour fruit rent therefore ſet intent ſo befell day sompner waiting euer pray rode ſummon old widdow ribibe faining cauſe would haue bribe happed ſaw beforne ride gay yeoman vnder forreſt ſide bow bare arrow bright ſhene vpon courtpie greene hat vpon head ſtrings blacke sir qd sompner haile well itake welcome qd euery good fellaw whider rideſt thou vnder ye green wood ſhaw said yeoman wolt thou ferre day sompner anſwerd ſaid nay faſt qd mine intent riden reyſen vp rent longeth vnto lord dutie art thou baylie yea qd durſt filth ſhame say sompner name depardieur qd yeoman lefe brother thou art bayly another vnknowne countre thine acquaintance woll pray thee eke brotherhead thou lift haue gold ſiluer chiſt ye hap come ſhire ſhall thine right thou wolt deſire grant mercy qd ſompner faith euerich truth laith ſworne brother till dey yt word riden forth wey ſompner yt ful iangles full venome ben theſe wariangles euer requiring vpon euery thing brother qd dwelling another day ſhould ſeech yeoman anſwerd ſoft ſpeech brother qd ferre north countre whereas hope ſometime ſhall thee ſee depart ſhall thee ſo well wiſſe mine houſe thou ſhalt neuer miſſe brother qd ſompner pray teach riden way sith ye ben bayly ſubteltie tell faithfully mine office may moſt win ſpare conſcience ne ſin brother tell done ye trouth brother deare ſaid ſhall tellen thee faithfull tale wage full ſtrait full ſmale lord hard daungerous mine office full laborious therefore extortion leue forſooth men woll yeue algate ſleight violence yeare yeare win diſpence better tellen faithfully certes qd sompner ſo fare ſpare taken god wote heauy hote may getten counſaile priuily manner conſcience haue nere mine extortion might liuen ſuch yapes woll ſhriuen stomacke ne conſcience know none ſhrew theſe ſhrift father euerychone well met god ſweet iame leue brother tell thy name qd sompner meane yeoman gan little ſmile brother qd wolt thou yt thee tell fiend dwelling hell ride purchaſing wete may get thing purchaſing theffect rent looke thou rideſt ſame intent win good thou reckeſt neuer right ſo fare ride woll vnto world end pray ah qd ſompner ye ſay wend ye yeoman truly ye haue man ſhape well haue ye figure determinate hell ye ben eſtate nay certainly qd haue none v liketh take v one el make ſeeme ben ſhape sometime like man like ape like angell ride go wonder thing though ſo louſie iugler deceiue thee parde craft hee qd ye sompner ride ye gone ſundry ſhape alway one qd woll v ſuch forme make moſt able preyes take maketh haue al labour full many cauſe lefe ſir sompnour said fiend thing hath time day ſhort paſſed prime yet ne got nothing day woll entend winning may entend wit declare brother mine thy wit ben bare vnderſtand though would tell thee thou askeſt labouren ſometime god inſtruments meanes done commaundments luſt creature diuers art diuers figure withouten haue might certaine liſt ſtonden againe ſometime praier haue leue body ſoule greue witneſſe iob deden wo ſometime haue might two ſaine body ſoule eke ſometime ben ſuffered ſeeke vpon man done ſoule vnreſt body beſt withſtandeth temptation cauſe ſaluation albeit intent ſhould ſafe wold hent ſometime ſeruaunts vnto man archbiſhop ſaint dunſtan apoſtle eke ſeruaunt yet tell qd sompner faithfully make ye new body thus alway element fiend anſwered nay sometime faine ſometime ariſe dead body ſundry wiſe ſpeake renably faire well phitoneſſe samuell yet would ſome men ſay force diuinite thing warne thee woll yape thou wolt algates wete ſhape thou ſhalt hereafterward brother dere come thee needeth lere thou ſhalt thine owne experience conne chare rede ſentence bet virgill liue daunt alſo let v ride bliue woll hold company thee till ſo thou forſake mee nay qd sompner yt ſhall betide yeoman knowen full wide trouth wol hold thee caas though thou deuill sathanas trouth woll hold brother ſworne ech v true brother caas brother gone purchaas take thou thy part men woll ye yeue ſhal mine thus ſhall leue v haue let true part brother graunt qd deuill fay word riden forth way right ring tounes end ye ſompner ſhope wend ſaw cart charged hay carter droue forth way deepe way cart ſtood carter ſmote ſtriued wood heit ſcot heit brok wt ſpare ye ye ſtones fiend qd fetch body bone ferforth euer ye yfoled much wo haue tholed deuill haue hors cart hay qd sompner ſhal haue pray nere y• fiend drew nought ne full priuily rouned eare hearken brother hearken thy faith heareſt thou carter ſaith hent anon hath yeue thee hay cart eke caples three nay qd deuill god wot neuer dele intent truſt wele aske thy ſelfe thou troweſt mee el ſtint thou ſhalt ſee carter thacked hors croupe begun draw ſtoupe heit qd yt ieſus chriſt bleſſe hondy werke leſſe well wight mine liard boy pray god ſaue thee ſaint loy cart ſlow parde lo brother qd fiend told thee may ye ſeene mine owne deare brother carle ſpake thing thought another let v goe forth voyage win nothing vpon cariage comen ſomwhat toun sompner brother gan roune brother qd wonneth old rebecke almoſt lefe leſe necke yeue penny good woll haue xii tho ſhe wood woll ſompne office yet god wot know vice thou canſt countre win thy coſt take enſample sompner clappeth ye widdows gate come ſaied thou old veritrate trow thou haſt ſome frere prieſt withthee clappeth ſaid wife benedicite god ſaue ſir ſweet haue qd ſummons thee bill vp paine curſing looke thou bee morrow archdeacon knee anſwere court certaine thing lord qd ſhe ieſu king king wiſely helpe ne may haue ben ſicke full many day may goe ſo ferre qd ſhe ne ride dead ſo pricketh ſide may aske libell ſir sompnour anſwere proctour ſuch thing men would appoſen yea qd sompner pay anon let ſee twelue penny thee acquite ſhall profit haue hereof lite maiſter hath profit come let ridden haſtily giue xii penny may lenger tary twelue penny qd ſhe lady ſaint mary wiſely helpe care ſin wide world though ſhould win ne haue xii within ho • ye know well poore old kith almeſſe poore wretch nay qd foule fiend fetch thee excuſe thogh thou ſhouldeſt ſpilt ala qd ſhe god wot haue guilt pay qd ſweet ſaint anne woll ſtreight beare away new panne debt thou oweſt old thou madeſt thy husbond cokold paied home thy correction thou lieſt qd ſhe ſaluation ne neuer ere widdow ne wife sompned vnto court life ne neuer na body trew vnto deuill blacke rough hew yeue thy body panne alſo deuill heard curſe ſo vpon knee ſaid manere mably mine owne mother dere earneſt ye ſey deuill qd ſhe fet ere dey panne woll repent nay old ſtotte mine intent qd sompner repent mee thing haue thee would thy ſmocke euery cloth brother qd deuill wroth thy body thy pan mine right thou ſhalt hell yet night thou ſhalt knowen priuitie maiſter diuinitie word ye foule fiend hent body ſoule deuill went yt sompners haue heritage god made image mankind ſaue guide v ſome leaue ye sompner good man become lordings coud haue told qd frere leiſure sompner text chriſt poule ihon doctours many one paine heart might agriſe albeit ſo tongue may deuiſe though might thouſand winter tell paine curſed hous hell keepe v curſed place wake pray ieſu grace keepe u temper sathanas hearkneth word beware caas lion ſitteth await alway ſlea innocent may diſpoſeth aye heart withſtond fiend would make thral bond may tempt ouer might chriſt woll champion knight prayeth sompner repent miſdeed ere fiend hent ¶the sompners prologue sompner ſtirrops high ſtood vpon frere hert ſo wood like aſpen leafe quoke ire lordings qd one thing deſire beſeech courteſie sithens ye han heard falſe frere lie ſuffereth may tale tell frere boaſteth knoweth hell god wot little wonder freres fiend ben little aſunder parde ye han oft time heard tell frere rauiſhed hell ſpirit viſioun angell led vp doun ſhewen paine place ſaw frere folke ſaw ynow wo vnto angell ſpake frere tho ſir qd han freres ſuch grace none hem ſhall come place yes qd angell many millioun vnto sathanas lad adoun hath sathanas ſuch taile broader caricke ſaile hold vp thy taile thou sathanas qd shew forth thine erſe let frere ſee whereas neaſt freres place ere halfe furlong way ſpace right bee ſwarmen hiue deuils erſe gan driue twenty thouſand freres rout throughout hell ſwarmed come ayen faſt might gone erſe crepten euerichone clapt taile ayen lay ſtill frere looked fill vpon turments ſorry place ſpirit god reſtored grace vnto body ayen awoke natheleſſe yet feare quoke deuills erſe aye mind heritage kind god ſaue ſaue curſed frere prologue woll end mannere ¶the sompners tale begging fryar coming farmer houſe lay ſick obtaineth certain legacy muſt equally divided among covent requital friar ſhewing cozenage loytering impudent begging hypocritical praying lordings yorkſhire gheſſe mariſh countrey called holderneſſe went limitour preach eke beg doubt ſo befell day frere preached church manere ſpecially abouen euery thing excited people preaching trental yeuen god ſake wherewith men mighten holy houſes make diuine ſeruice honoured waſted deuoured ne needeth yeuen poſſeſſioners mowen el leuen thonked god wele aboundance trental deliuereth qd fro pennance friend ſoules well old yong haſtily yſong hold prieſt jolly gay ſingeth one meſſe day deliuereth qd anon ſoules full hard fleſhhooke oules yclawed bren bake ſpeedeth haſtily chriſts ſake frere ſaid intent qui cum patre forth way went folk church yeue hem leſt went way lenger would reſt ſcrip tipped ſtaffe ytucked hie euery hous gan pore prie begged meale cheeſe el corne fellow ſtaffe tipped horne paire table iuory pointell ypoliſhed fetouſly wrote alway name ſtood folke yaue hem good askaunce woulden hem prey yeue v buſhell wheat malt rey god kichell trippe cheſe el ye liſt may cheſe god halfepenny maſſe peny yeue v brawne ye haue dagon blanket leue dame ſuſter deare lo write name bacon beefe ſuch thing ye find ſturdy harlot went aye behind hoſtes man bare ſacke men yaue hem laied backe dore anone plained away name euerichone written table ſerued hem nifles fable nay thou lieſt sompner qd yt frere peace qd hoſt chriſts mother dere tell forth thy tale ſpare thriue qd sompner ſo ſhall long went fro hous hous till came hous wont refreſhed hundred placis sicke lay good man whoſe place bedred vpon couch low lay deus hic qd thomas friend good day saied frere courteouſly ſoft thomas god yeeld full oft haue vpon bench faren full weale haue eaten many merry meale fro bench droue away cat laied adoune potent hat eke ſcrip ſet ſoft adoune fellow go walked toune forth knaue hoſtelrie ſhope like night lie deare maiſter qd ſicke man haue ye faren ſithen march began ſaw fourtenight god wot qd laboured haue full ſore ſpecially thy ſaluation haue ſaied many precious oriſon friend god hem bleſſe haue day ben church meſſe ſaid ſermon ſimple wit text holy writ hard ſuppoſe therfore woll teach gloſe gloſing glorious thing certain letter ſlaeth clerkes ſain haue hem taught ben charitable ſpend good reaſonable ſaw dame ah ſhe yonder yard trow ſhe saied man ſhe woll come anon eye maiſter welcome ye ſaint ihon saied wife fare ye heartily frere ariſeth vp full courteouſly imbraceth armes narrow kiſſeth ſweet chirketh ſparrow lip dame qd fare right wele ſeruaunt euery dele thanked god haue ſoul life yet ſaw day ſo faire wife whole church ſo god ſaue yea god amend fault ſir qd ſhe algates welcome ye fay graunt mercy dame yt haue found alway great goodneſſe leue woll pray ye greue woll thomas ſpeake little throw theſe curate ben full negligent ſlow gropen tenderly man conſcience ſhrift preaching diligence ſtudie peter word poules walke fiſhen chriſten men ſoules yeeld ieſu chriſt proper rent ſpread word mine intent leaue deare maiſter qd ſhe chideth well ſaint charite aye angry piſſemire though haue deſire thogh wrie night make warm ouer lay leg mine arm groneth bore lieth ſtie diſport right none haue may pleaſe manner caas thomas ie vous die thomas thomas maketh ye fiend muſt ben amended ire thing god highly defended thereof woll ſpeake word two maiſter qd wife ere go woll ye dine woll go thereabout dame qd ie vous die ſanz dout haue capon liuer white bread ſhiuer roſted pig head nold beaſt dead ynow ſuffiſaunce man little ſuſtenaunce ſpirit hath foſtring bible body aye ſo ready ſo penible wake body deſtroied pray dame ye nought annoied though ſo friendly counſaile ſhew god haue told ſir qd ſhe one word ere go child dead within theſe weekes two soone ye went toun death ſaw reuelatioun saied frere home dortour dare well ſaine ere halfe hour death ſaw borne bliſſe mine auiſion god ſo wiſſe sexten fermerere han true freres fiftie yere may god thanked loue maken iubelie walken alone vp aroſe couent eke many teare trilling cheeke withouten noiſe clattering bel te deum ſong nothing el saue chriſt ſaied oriſon thanking reuelation ſir dame truſteth right well oriſons effectuell ſeene chriſts ſecret thing borell folke although king liue pouerte abſtinence borell folke richeſſe diſpence meat drinke foule delite han worldly luſt deſpite lazar diues liueden diuerſely diuers guerdon thereby ſo woll pray muſt faſt cleane fat ſoule make body leane fare ſaieth apoſtle cloth food sufficeth v though full good cleaneneſſe faſting v freres maketh chriſt accepteth prayeres lo moiſes fortie day fortie night faſted ere high god might spake mount sinay empty wombe faſting many day receiued law written god finger hely well witten mount oreb ere ſpeech high god ſoules leech faſted long contemplaunce aaron temple gouernaunce eke prieſts euerichone temple ſhould gone praien people doen ſeruice nold drinke manner wiſe drinke dronke might hem make abſtinence pray wake leaſt deiden take heed ſay ſober people pray ware ſay ſufficeth lord ieſu holy writ deuiſeth yaue v enſample faſting prayeres therefore mendicantes ſilly freres ben wedded pouert continence charity humbleneſſe abſtinence perſecution rightwiſneſſe weeping miſericorde cleaneneſſe therefore may ye ſee prayeres ſpeake v mendicant freres ben high god acceptable feaſt table fro paradice firſt ſhall lie man chaſed gluttonie chaſt man paradice certain herken thomas ſhall ſain haue text thereof ſuppoſe find manner gloſe ſpecially ſweet lord ieſus spake freres ſaied thus bleſſed poore ſpirit ſo forth goſpell may ye ſeen whether liker perfection ſwimmen poſſeſſion fie pompe gluttonie leaudneſſe hem defie thinketh ben like iouinian fat whale walking swan vinolent bottle ſpence prayer full little reuerence ſouls ſay pſalme dauid lo bouffe ſain cor meum eructauit followeth chriſts goſpell lore humble chaſt poore worker god word auditours therefore right hauke ſours vp ſpringeth aire ſo prayeres charitable cahſt buſie freres maken ſours vp god eares two thomas thomas ſo mote ride go lord cleaped ſaint yue ne thou broder wer thou ſhouldſt thriue chapiter pray day night chriſt thee ſend health might thy body welden haſtily god wot qd nothing therof feele help chriſt within year haue ſpended vpon diuers maner freres well many pound yet fare neuer bet certain good haue almoſt beſet farewell good almoſt ago frere anſwerd thomas doſt thou ſo needeth thee diuers freres ſech needeth hath perfit lech ſechen lech town inconſtance confuſion hold ye el couent prayen inſufficient thomas iape ni worth mite maladie haue lite yeue couent halfe quarter otes yeue couent four twenty gortes yeue frere penny let go nay nay thomas may nothing ſo farthing worth parted twelue lo ech thing oned himſelue ſtrong ſo ſcattered thomas thou ſhalt iflattered thou wolſt haue labour nought hie god yt world hath wrought saith ye workman worthy hire thomas naught treaſure deſire ſelf couent pray aie ſo diligent holy builden chriſt owne chirch thomas ye woll learne wirch building vp chirches may ye ſinde good thomas life inde ye liggen full anger ire deuil ſet heart fire chiden holy innocent wife ſo good patient therfore trow thomas ye leſt ne chide thy wife beſt beare word away thy faith touching ſuch thing lo wiſe ſaith within thy houſe thou lion thy ſubjects thou none oppreſſion ne make thine acquaintance flee yet thomas eftſones charge thee beware thy boſom ſleepeth ware ſerpent ſo ſlily creepeth vnder graſſe ſtingeth full ſubtilly beware ſonne hearken patiently twenty thouſand men han loſt liues ſtriuing lemmans wiues ſince haue ſo holy meek wife nedeth thomas make ſtrife ni iwis ſerpent ſo cruell men treden taile ne halfe ſo fel woman ſhe hath caught ire vengeance deſire ire ſinne one greateſt ſeuen abhominable unto high god heven himſelf deſtruction every lewd vicar parſon ſay ire engendreth homecide ire ſooth executour pride could ire ſay ſo much ſorrow tale ſhould laſt till morrow therfore pray god day night irous man ſend little might great harme eke great pitee ſee irous man high degree whiledom ther irous poteſtate ſaith seneck eſtate vpon day riden knight two fortune would ſhould ſo one hem came home yt nought anon knight judge brought ſaid thus thou haſt thy fellow ſlain deme thee death certain another knight commanded go lead death charge thee hapned went wey toward place ther ſhould dey knight came men wend ded thought beſt reed lede hem iudge ſaiden lord knight hath ſlain fellow ſtant hole aliue ye ſhullen dead qd ſo mot thriue ſay one two three firſt knight right thus ſpake damned thee thou muſt algate dead thou muſt alſo leeſe need thyn head thou art cauſe thy fellow dieth ye third knight right thus ſayeth thou haſt yt commanded thee thus lete fle hem three irous cambiſes eke drunkelew aie delighted ſhrew ſo befell lord meine loued well vertuous moralite said day betwixt hem two right thus lord loſt aught vicious dronkenneſſe eke foule record man namely lord many ey many ear waiting lord whear god loue drinketh temperatly wine maketh man leſe wretchedly mind limbes euerichone reuers ſhalt thou ſee qd anon preue thyn experience wine ne doth folke ſuch offence ni wine bereaueth might hond foote ne mine eyeſight deſpight dronke mochell hundred time right ay curſed irous wretch let knight ſon beforne fetch commanding ſhuld beforn ſtond ſuddenly took hond vp ſtring plucked eare arrow ſlough child thear wither haue ſiker hond none qd might minde agon hath wine bereuen mine iyen ſight ſhuld tel anſwer y• knight ſonne ſlain ther ſay beware therefore lord ye play sing placebo ſhall vnto poore man poore man one ſhould vice tell lord though ſhould go hell lo irous cirus thilke percien deſtroyed riuer giſen horſe dreint therein went babilon win made riuer ſo ſmall men might ride waden ouer lo ſaid ſo well teach ne fellow none irous man ne wood man walke way leſt thou repent woll ſay thomas leue brother leaue thyn ire thou ſhalt find iuſt ſquire hold deuils knife aie thine heart thine anger doth thee ſore ſmart ſhew thy confeſſion nay qd ſicke man ſaint simon ſhriue day curate told wholy mine eſtate needeth ſpeake ſaieth liſt mine humilite yeue thy gold tomake cloiſter qd many muskle many oiſter men haue full well eaſe hath food cloiſter reaſe yet god wot vnneath foundament parformed ne pauement tile yet within wones god owen fourty pound ſtones help thomas yt harrowed hell el mote need al book ſell lacke predication goeth world deſtruction ſo woll fro world v bereue god ſaue thomas leue would bereaue world ſon techen worchen con little time qd ſith helie heliſe han freres find record charitie ithonked lord thomas help ſaint charitie anon ſitteth kne ſicke man waxeth nie wood ire would frere fire falſe diſſimulation thing poſſeſſion qd may giue none ye ſain thus yt brother ye certes qd frere truſteth wele tooke dame letter ſele qd wel ſomwhat ſhall yeue vnto holy couent liue thine hond thou ſhalt haue anone condition none depart ſo leue brother euery frere haue much another ſhalt thou ſweare thy profeſſion without fraud cauilation ſwere qd ſhe frere faith therwithall hond layth lo faith ſhall lacke put thine hond adowne backe said man grope well behind beneath buttock thou ſhalt find thing haue hid priuitie ah thought frere ſhall goe adown ſhofth hond clift hope find ſome good gift ſicke man felt frere tewell groping amid hond let frere fart ni capell drawing cart might haue let fart ſuch ſoun frere vp ſtart doth wood lioun falſe churle qd frere god bone haſt thou diſpite doe none thou ſhalt abie fart may meinie heard affray came leaping chaſed frere forth goeth full angry chere fet fellow lay ſtore looked wilde bore grinted teeth ſo wroth ſturdie pace court goth whereas wonned man great honour alway confeſſour worthy man lord village freer came rage lord ſat eating bord vnnethes might frere ſpeake word till laſt ſaid god ſee lord gan looke ſaid benedicite frere ihon maner world ſee well ſomething amis ye look though ye wood wer full theuis sit downe tell griefe ſhall amended may haue qd diſpite day god yeeld adown village world none ſo poore page nolde haue abhominatioun haue receiued town yet grieueth nothing ſo ſore old churle lock hore blaſphemed hath holy couent eke maiſter qd lord beſeke maiſter ſir qd ſeruitour though haue ſchoole honour god liketh men v rabie call neither market ne large hall force qd tell griefe sir qd frere odious miſchiefe day betide mine order ſo per conſequens degree holy church god amend ſone sir qd lord ye wot done diſtemper confeſſour ye ſalt earth ſavour god loue pacience hold telleth griefe anon told ye han heard ye wot well ladie houſe aie ſtill ſat till ſhe heard fully frere ſaid eye god mother qd ſhe blisful maid nought el tell faithfully madame qd thinketh ye therby thinketh ſo god ſpeed ſay churle hath done churles deed ſhould ſay god let neuer ſick head full vanite hold manner frenſie madam qd god ſhall lye wiſe may awreke ſhall ſlaunder ouer ſpeke falſe blaſphemour charged part might departed euery man iliche miſchance lord ſat ſtill trance heart roled vp churle imaginatioun ſhew ſuch probleme frere neuer erſt heard ſuch matere trow deuill put mind arſmetricke ſhall man find beforne day ſuch queſtion ſhould make demonſtration euery man ſhould haue ilike part ſowne fauour farte nice proud churle beſhrew thy face lo ſirs qd lord hard grace euer heard ſuch thing euery man ilike tell impoſſible may eye nice churle god let hem neuer rombling fart euery ſoun ny eyre reverberatioun euer waſteth little little away man demen fay departed equally lo churle lo ſhreudly vnto confeſſour day ſpake hold certain demoniake eteth meat let churle go play let go hongen himſelfe deuil way ſtood lord ſquire bord carf meat heard word word thing haue ſayd lord qd ye euill apaid couth tell gowne cloth ſir frere ſo ye wroth fart ſhould euen idealed amonges couent liketh thee tel qd ye lord thou ſhalt haue anon gown cloth god ſaint iohn lord qd weder faire withouten winde perturbing ayre let bring cart wheele hall looke well haue ſpokes twelue ſpokes hath cart whele commonly bring xii freres wot ye thirteene couent geſſe confeſſour worthneſſe shall performe vp number couent ſhullen knelen adoun one aſſent euery ſpokes end manere full ſadly lay noſe ſhall frere noble confeſſour god ſaue shall hold noſe vpright vnder naue ſhal churle bely ſtiffe tought tabour hither ibrought ſet whele right cart vpon naue make let fart ye ſhullen ſee vp perill life good prefe demonſtratife equally ſowne wend eke ſtinke vnto ſpokes end saue worthy man confeſſour becauſe man great honour shall haue firſt fruit reaſon noble vſage freres yet wortheſt man hem ſhul firſt ſerued certainly hath well deſerued hath day taught v ſo much good preaching pulpet ſtood may vouchſafe ſay mee firſt ſmell fart three ſo would brother hardely bereth ſo faire holyly lord ye lady man ſaue frere said ienkin ſpake matere well euclide ptholome touching churles ſayd ſubtiltie hie wit made ſpeake ſpake ni foole ne demoniake ienkin hath iwonne new gowne tale done almoſt towne ¶the clerke oxenfords prologue sir clerke oxenford hoſt ſaid ye ride ſtill coy doth maid new ſpouſed ſitting bord day ne heard mouth word trow ye ſtudie ſome ſophime salomon ſaith thing hath time god ſake beth better chere time ſtudie tell v ſome merry tale fay man entred play need mot vnto play aſſent preacheth freres done lent make v old ſinnes weep thy tale make v ſleep tell v ſome merry thing auentures termes figure colour keep hem ſtore till ſo ye endite hie ſtile men king write speake ſo plaine time pray may vnderſtond ye ſay worthy clerke beningly anſwerd hoſt qd vnder yerde ye haue v gouernance therefore obeyſance farre reaſon asketh hardely woll tell tale learned padow worthy clerke preued word werke dead nailed cheſt pray god ſend ſoule good reſt fraunces petrarke laureat poet hight ilke clerke whoſe rethorike ſweet enlumined itaile poetrie liuian philoſophy law art perticulere death wol ſuffer v dwellen twinkling eye hem hath ſlaine ſhall dye tellen worthy man taught tale firſt began ſay firſt hie ſtile enditeth body tale writeth proheme diſcriueth piemont saluce countre ſpeaketh apenniny hilles hye bound weſt lumbardie mount veſulus ſpeciall poo well ſmall taketh firſt ſpringing ſours eaſtward euer increaſeth cours emelle ward ferare veniſe long time deuiſe truly judgement thinketh thing impartinent saue liſt conueyen matere tale ye ſhullen ¶the clerke oxenfords tale walter marqueſſe saluce proveth patience wife griſill three moſt ſharp trial weſt ſide itaile downe ro • e veſulus cold luſtie plaine habundaunt vitaile wher many town tower thou maiſt behold founded time father old many another delectable ſight saluce noble countre hight marque whilom lond worthy elder obeyſant aye redy hond liege leſſe thus delite liued hath done yore beloued drad favour fortune lord commune therwith ſpeak linage gentileſt iborne lombardy faire perſon ſtrong yong age full honour curteſie diſcreet inow countre gye saue ſome thing blame walter yong lord name blame thus yt conſidered nought time comming might betide luſt preſent thought hauke hunt euery ſide welny cure let ſlide eke ne would worſt wed wife ought might befall onely point people bare ſo ſore flockmele day went one hem wiſeſt lore el lord would beſt aſſent ſhould tel wt people ment el coud well ſhew ſuch matere marque ſaid ye ſhullen noble marque humanite aſſureth v yeueth v hardineſſe oft time neceſſite may tell heuineſſe accepteth lord gentilneſſe pitous hert plaine let eares nat voice disdaine haue done matere another hath place yet much ye lord ſo dere haue alway ſhewed fauour grace dare better aske ſpace audience ſhewen requeſt ye lord done right leſt certes lord ſo well u liketh werkes euer haue
