ne could owne ſelfe deuiſen might liuen felicite saue one thing lord wedded man leſt people ſouerain herts reſt boweth necke vnder blisful yoke ſouerainte ſeruiſe men clepen ſpouſaile wedlocke thinketh lord among thouȝts wiſe though ſleepe wake ronne ride aye fleeth time wol man abide though grene youth floure yet crepeth age alway ſtill ſtone death manaſeth euery age ſmite ech eſtate eſcapeth none alſo certaine knowne echone ſhul die vncertaine ben day death ſhall v fall accepteth v true intent neuer yet refuſed heſt wol lord ye wol aſſent cheſe wife ſhort time leſt borne gentilleſt beſt lond ſo ought ſeme honour god nere deme deliuer v buſie dred take wife hie god ſake ſo befell god forbed thorogh death linage ſhould ſlake ſtrange ſucceſſour ſhould take heritage wo v liue wherefore pray haſtely wiue meeke prayer pitious chere made marque haue pite wol ye qd mine owne people dere never erſt thought conſtraine rejoyced libertie ſelden time found marriage free mote ben ſeruage natheles ſee true entent truſt vpon wit haue done aye wherfore free woll aſſent wedden ſone euer may ye haue profred day cheſe wife releaſe choice pray profer ceaſe god wot child oft vnlike worthy eldes hem bounte commeth god ſtreen engendred ibore truſt god bounte therefore marriage mine eſtate reſt take may leſt let alone cheſing wife charge vpon backe woll endure pray charge vpon life wife take ye enſure worſhip while life may dure word werke elswhere ſhe emperours doughter furthermore thus ſhul ye ſwere ye againſt choice ſhall neuer grutch neſtriue ſith ſhall forgo liberte requeſt euer mote thriue mine hert ſet wol wiue ye woll aſſent ſuch manere pray ſpeake matere hearty ſworne aſſent thing ſaid wight nay beſeeching grace ere went would hem graunt certaine day ſpouſaile ſoone euer may yet alway people ſomwhat dred leſt marque would wife wed graunted hem day ſuch leſt wold wedded ſekerly ſaid requeſt humble entent full buxumely kneeling vpon knee full reuerently thonked thus han end entent home ayen wend hereupon took officer commaunding feaſt purvay privie knight ſquires charge yaue liſt hem lay commandement obey ech hem doth diligence done feaſt reverence explicit prima par ſequitur par ſecunda nought ferre fro thilke place honorable marque ſhope marriage ſtood thrope ſight full delectable poore folke village hadden beaſts herbigage labour tooke ſuſtenance earth yaue hem haboundance among poore folke dwell man holden pooreſt hem high god ſomtime ſenden grace unto little oxe ſtall ianicola men thrope call doughter faire ynough ſight griſilde young maiden hight ſpeak vertuous beaute ſhe one faireſt ſonne full poorely ifoſtered ſhe licorous luſt heart yronne well ofter well tonne dronke ſhe would vertue pleſe knew well labour idle eaſe though maid tender age yet breſt virginite encloſed ſad ripe corage great reverence charite old pore father foſtred ſhe ſheep ſpinning field ſhe kept would ben idle till ſhe ſlept ſhe homeward came ſhe wold bring wortes herbes time full oft ſhe ſhrad ſethe living made bed full hard nothing ſoft aye ſhe kept father life loft every obeiſance diligence child might father reuerence vpon griſilde poore creature well oft hath marque ſet eye hunting went peradventure fell might eſpie wanton looking follie eyen caſt upon ſad wiſe vpon chere would oft auiſe commending hert womanhede eke vertue paſſing every wight ſo yong age well chere dede though people great inſight vertue conſidered full right bounte diſpoſed would wed ever wedden ſhould day wedding come wight tell maner woman ſhould meruaile wondred many man ſaiden priuite woll lord leaue vanite woll wed ala ala woll thus himſelf u begile natheles marque hath make iemmes ſet gold aſure broches ring griſildes ſake clothing tooke meaſure maiden like ſtature eke ornament unto ſuch wedding ſhould fall time vndren ſame day approched wedding ſhould paleis put array hall chamber ech degre houſes office ſtuffed great plente maieſt thou ſee dainteous vitaile may found ferre laſteth itaile royall marque richly araide lord lady companie feaſt praide retinue bachelerie many ſown ſondrie melodie vnto village told aray right way hath hold griſilde god wot full innocent ſhape aray fetch water well went cometh home ſone ever ſhe may well ſhe heard ſay full ilke day marque ſhould wed ſhe might would fain ſeen ſome ſight thouȝt wil maide • ſtond fellowes dore ſee marque thereto wol fond done home ſoone may labour longeth may leiſure behold way caſtle hold ſhe wold ouer dreſhold gon marque came gan call ſhe ſet downe water pot anon beſide threſhold oxe ſtall downe vpon knee ſhe gan fall ſad countenance ſhe kneeled ſtill till ſhe herd lord thouȝtful marque ſpake yt maid wel ſoberly ſaid manere father griſiilde ſaid ſhe reuerence meek chere anſwerd lord ready ſhe goeth without lenger lette marque ſhe father fette hond tooke old man ſaid thus aſide ianicola neither may ne lenger pleſance mine hert hide thou vouchſafe whatſoeuer betide thy doughter woll take wend wife vnto liues end thou loueſt wot well certaine art faithfull liegeman ibore liketh dare well ſaine liketh thee ſpecially therefore tell point haue ſaid thou wolt purpoſe draw take thy ſonne law ſudden caſe man aſtoned ſo red wext abaſhed quaking ſtood ne vnneth ſaid word mo thus qd lord willing ye woll ne ayenſt liking woll nothing ye lord ſo dere right liſt gouerne matere wol thus qd marque ſothly thy chamber ſhe haue collation woteſt thou woll aske wife rule ſhall ſhe done thy preſence woll ſpeke thine audience chamber treties ye ſhall heare people came houſe without wondred hem honeſt manere tentifly ſhe kept father dere vtterly griſild wonder might neuer erſt ſaw ſhe ſuch ſight wonder though ſhe aſtoned ſee ſo great geſt come place neuer ſuch geſtes woned ſhe looked full pale face ſhortly fro matter pace theſe word yt marque ſaid benigne faithfull maid griſilde ſaid ye ſhall well vnderſtond liketh vnto father wed eke may ſo ſtond ſuppoſe ye woll ſo theſe demaunds aske firſt qd ſithen ſhall done haſtie wiſe woll ye thereto aſſent el auiſe ſay thus ye redy good hert luſt freely may beſt liketh though ye laugh ſmert neuer ye grutch night ne day ſay yea ye ſay one nay neither word ne frowning countenance swere ſwere aliance wondring vpon theſe word quaking dred ſaid lord indigne vnworthy thilke honour ye bede right woll even ſo woll ſwere neuer willingly word werke ne thought nill diſobie deed though loth die inough griſilde mine qd forth goeth ſober chere doore came ſhe people ſaid manere wife qd ſtondeth honoureth loueth pray ſo loueth ni ſay nothing old gere ſhould bring houſe bad woman ſhould diſpoilen theſe lady nothing glad handle cloth ſhe clad natheles maiden bright hew fro foot head clothed han new heer han kembe lay vntreſſed full rudely finger ſmall crowne head han idreſſed ſet full ouches great ſmall arraie ſhould make tale vnneath people knew fairnes ſhe transformed ſuch rich marque hath ſpouſed ring bought ſame cauſe ſet vpon horſe ſnow white well ambling palais lenger let joyfull people lad met conueyed thus day ſpende reuell till ſunne gan diſcende ſhortly forth tale chace ſay new marqueſſe god hath iſent ſuch fauour grace ſeemed likelineſſe ſhe borne fed rudeneſſe cote oxe ſtall nouriſhed emperours hall euery wight ſhe woxen ſo dere worſhipful ye folke ſhe bore fro birth knew yere yere vnneth trowed durſt haue ſwore ianicola ſpake doughter na coniecture hem thought ſhe another creature though euer vertuous ſhe encreaſed ſuch excellence thewes good ſet high bounte ſo diſcrete faire eloquence benigne digne reuerence coude people heart ſo enbrace eche loued looked face onely saluce towne publiſhed bounte name eke beſide many regioun one ſaid well another ſaid ſame ſprad hie bountie fame men woman yong old gone saluces behold thus walter lowly full royally wedded hath fortunate honeſtie god peace liueth full eaſily home outward grace inough ſaw vnder low degree honeſt vertue hid people held prudent man ſeene well ſeld griſilde wit couth feate wifely humbleneſſe eke cauſe required commen profit could ſhe redreſſe na diſcord rancor ne heauineſſe lond ſhe ne couth apeſe bring hem wiſely reſt eſe though husbond abſent none gentleman countre wroth ſhe would bring hem one wiſe counſaile ripe word ſhe judgement ſo great equitie ſhe heuen ſent men wend people ſaue euery wrong mend long time faire griſilde wedded ſhe doughter ibore ſhe leuer haue borne man childe glad marque folke therfore though maide childe came may man child attaine likelyhood ſithens ſhe baraine explicit ſecunda par incipit par tertia fell befalleth oft time mo childe ſucked throwe marque heart longed ſo tempt wife ſadneſſe know ne might heart throw maruellous deſire wife aſſay needleſſe god wot thought affray aſſaied ynough found euer good needeth tempt alway though ſome man praiſe ſubtill wit ſay full euill ſit aſſay wife nede put anguiſh drede marque wrouȝt manere came alone night ſhe lay full ſterne face right vgly chere ſaied thus griſilde qd day tooke thee thy poore aray put thee eſtate high nobleſſe thou haſt forgotten geſſe ſay griſilde preſent dignite haue put thee trow maketh thee foryetfull thee tooke poore eſtate full low wele thou muſt thy ſelfe know take heed euery word ſay wight hereth tway thou woteſt thy ſelf yt thou came houſe long ago though thou lefe dere vnto gentile thou art nothing ſo ſay hem great ſhame wo ſubiect ſeruage thee borne art ſo ſmall village namely ſith thy doughter ybore theſe word often haue ſpoken doutles deſire haue doen lead life hem reſt pee may caſe recheles mote doen thy doughter beſt wold gentils leſt yet god wote full loth natheles without thy witting woll nought woll qd thou aſſent thing shew thy pacience werking thou hight ſwore village day maked marriage ſhe heard ſhe ameued neither word chere ne countenance ſeemed ſhe agreeued ſaied lord lyeth pleaſance child heartely obeiſance ye may ſaue ſpill therfore worketh owne may nothing ſo god ſoule ſaue liken may diſpleaſe ne deſire nothing haue ne drede leſe ſaue onely ye heart aye ſhall length time death may deface neither change corage another place glad marque anſwering yet fained ſo drery chere looking ſhould chamber go sone furlong way two priuily told intent vnto man wife ſent maner ſergeant priuy man faithfull often found thing great eke ſuch folke well doen execution thing bad lord knew well loued drad ſergeant wiſt lord chamber ſtalked full ſtill madame ſaied ye mote foryeue though thing conſtrained ye full wiſe full well know ye great lord heſtes may fained may well wailed complained men muſt need unto luſt obey ſo woll ni ſay child commanded take ſpake vp child hent diſpitouſly gan chere make though would haue ſlain went griſilde muſt ſuffer conſent lambe ſhe ſitteth meeke ſtill let cruell sergeant doe suſpect fame ilke man suſpect face ſuſpect word alſo suſpect time began ala doughter ſhe loued ſo wende would haue ſlain right tho natheles ſhe neither wept ne liked confirming marque liked laſt ſpeake ſhe began full meekely ſhe ſergeant praid worthy gentell man ſhe might kiſſe child ere deid arme little child ſhe leid full ſad face gan child bliſſe lulled gan kiſſe thus ſhe ſaied benigne voyce farwell child ſhall thee neuer ſee ſithen haue marked thee ye croice th • lke father ibleſſed mote thou v died vpon roode tree thy ſoule little child betake night ſhalt thou dien ſake trow norice caas hard routh ſee well might mother cry ala natheles ſo ſad ſtedfaſt ſhe ſhe endured aduerſite ſergeant meekely ſhee ſaid haue ayen little yong maid goth qd ſhe doth lord heſt thing would pray grace lord forbid leſt burieth little bodie ſome place beaſts ne bird race word purpoſe would ſaie tooke y• childe went anon waie ſergeant came lord againe griſilds word chere told word word ſhort plaine preſented daughter dere somwhat lord routh maner natheles purpoſe held ſtill lord doen woll haue bad ſergeant full priuily ſhould child wel ſoft wind wrap circumſtance tenderly carry cofer lap paine hed ſwap man ſhould know entent ne whens came ne whither went boleine ſuſter dere thilke time pauie counteſſe ſhould take ſhew matere beſeeching doen buſineſſe child foſtre gentleneſſe whoſe child bad hide euery wight ought yt might betide ſergeant goth hath fulfilde thing marque returne goeth full oft imagining wiues chere might ought ſee el word peceiue ſhe changed neuer could finde euer one ilike ſad kinde glad humble buſie ſeruice eke loue ſhe wont ſhe every manner wiſe ne doughter one word ſpake ſhe none accedent none adverſite ſeen ne never doughters name nempned ſhe erneſt ne game explicit tertia par incipit par quarta eſtate paſſed ben four yere er ſhe child god would man child ſhe bare waltere well gracious faire behold folke father told onely countrey mery child god thonke hery two yere old breſt departed norice day marque cought yet another leſt tempten wife eftſones may needle ſhe tempted dare ſay wedded men ne conne meaſure find patient creature wife qd marque ye heard people heauily bereth mariage namely ſithen ſonne borne worſe ever age murmure ſlaieth heart corage eares commeth voice ſo ſmart well nie deſtroyed hath hart ſay thus walter agon ſhall blood ianicola ſuccede ben lord non word ſay people drede well ought ſuch murmure take hede certainly dread ſuch ſentence though plainly ſpeke myne audience would live peace might wherefore diſpoſed vtterly ſuſter ſerved night right ſo think ſerve priuily thus warn ye ſodainly ſelf wo ſhould outraie beth patient thereof pray qd ſhe ſaied ever ſhall woll ne nill nothing certain liſt nought greueth though doughter ſon ſlain commandement ſain part child twain firſt ſickeneſſe wo pain ye ben lord doth thing right liſt taketh reed left home clothing came firſt right ſo qd ſhe left liberty toke clothing wherfore pray doe woll obey certes preſcience know ere ye luſt told would doen without negligence wote luſt ye would pleaſance firm ſtable hold wiſt death would doen eſe gladly would ſuffer pleſe death may make compariſoun vnto loue marque ſeie conſtance wife caſt adown iyen two wondred ſhe may ſuch patience ſuffer arraie foorth goth drery countenaunce hert full great pleaſaunce eiger ſergeant ſame wiſe doughter caught right ſo worſe coud wers deuiſe hath hent ſonne full beaute euer one ſo patient ſhe ſhe chere made heauineſſe kiſſeth child gan bleſſe saue ſhe praied yt might little ſonne would earth graue tender limmes delicate ſight fro foules fro noyſom beaſts ſaue ſhe none anſwer might haue went way nothing rought boleine tenderly brought marque wondred euer lenger vpon pacience ſoothly knowen perfectly child loued ſhe would haue wend ſome ſubtilte malice cruell corage ſuffered ſad viſage knew wel next himſelf certain loued child beſt euery wiſe woman would aske fain theſe aſſaies mighten ſuffiſe coud ſturdie husbond deuiſe preue wifehood ſtedfaſtneſſe continuing ever ſturdineſſe folke condition han certain purpoſe take couth ſtint entention bounden ſtake woll purpoſe ſtake right ſo marque hath fully purpoſed tempt wife firſt diſpoſed waiteth word countenance changed corage never could find variance aie one heart viſage euer ſhe age truer poſſible love penible ſemeth thus hem two na one walter leſt ſame luſt pleaſance alſo god thonked fell beſt ſhewed well worldly vnreſt wife ſelfe nothing ſhould willen effect husbond would ſclander walter wonder wide ſpread cruel heart full wretchedly poore woman wedded hath murdred child privily murmure emong hem comonly wonder people ere ther came word murdred whereas people ther loved well ſlander fame made hem hated therefore murtherer hateful name natheles earneſt ne game cruel purpoſe would ſ • ent tempt wife entent whan doughter twelve yere age court rome ſubtil wiſe enformed ſent meſſage comanding hem ſuch billes deviſe cruel purpoſe may ſuffiſe pope people reſt bad wed another leſt ſay bad ſhould counterfete pope bull making mention hath leave firſt wife lete pope diſpenſacion ſtint rancor diſcencion betwixt people thus ſpake bull han publiſhed full rude people wonder ni wenden full fell right ſo theſe tidings come griſildis deeme heart full wo ſhe ſtill lech ſad evermo diſpoſed humble creature adverſite fortune endure abiding ever liſt pleaſaunce ſhe yeuen heart worldly ſuffiſaunce certainly ſtorie tell ſhall marque iwritten hath ſpeciall letter ſhewed intent prively boloine hath ſent erle pauie tho wedden ſuffer prayed ſpecially bringen ayen child two honourable eſtate openly one thing prayed vtterly wiȝt thouȝ men wold enquere tell whoſe child ſay maiden ſhould wedded vnto marque saluce anon earle prayed ſo day ſet way gon toward saluce lord many one rich araie maiden gide yong brother riding ſide arayed toward hyr marriage maiden freſh full gemmes clere brother ſeuen yeer age arayed eke freſhly manere thus great noble glad chere toward saluce ſhapen iournay fro day day riding forth way explicit quarta par ſequitur par quinta among wicked vſage marque wife yet tempted vttereſt proof corage fully experience ſore ſhe ſtedfaſt day open audience full boiſtrouſly hath ſaid ſentence certes griſilde inough pleaſance han wife goodneſs trouth obeyſance linage ne rich know ſoothfaſtneſſe great lordſhip well auiſe great ſeruitude ſondry wiſe may done every ploughman may people conſtraineth take another wife cryen day day eke pope rancor ſ • ake conſenteth dare vndertake truely thus much woll ſay new wife comming way ſtrong hert void anon place thilke dowery ye brought take ayen grant grace returneth father houſe qd man may alway proſperite euen heart read endure ſtroke fortune aventure ſhe ayen anſwerd patience lord qd ſhe wote wiſt alway betwixt magnificence pouert man ne may maken compariſon nay held never digne manere wife ne yet chamberere houſe ye lady made hie god take witneſſe ſo wiſely ſoule glad held neither lady ne maiſtreſſe humble ſervant worthineſſe ever ſhall life may endure abouen euery worldly creature ye ſo long benignite hold honour nobley worthy thonke god prey yeld ſey vnto father gladly wol wende dwell life ende foſtred childe full ſmall till deed life woll lead widow cleane heart body ſithen yave maidenhead true wife dread god ſhilde ſuch lord wife take another man husbond make new wife god grace graunt wealth high proſperite woll gladly yeue place blisful wont ſithen liketh lord qd ſhe whilome heart reſt ſhall gone ſhall goe leſt ye profred ſuch dowaire firſt brought well mind wretched clothes nothing faire full hard find oh good god gentle kind ye ſeemed ſpeech viſage day maked mariage ſooth ſaid algate find trew effect proved love old new certes lord none adverſite dien caſe ſhall never ever word worke ſhall repent yave mine heart good intent lord ye wote father place ye ſtrip poore wede richely ye clad grace brought nought el drede faith nakedneſſe maidenhede ayen clothing reſtore eke wedding ring evermore remnaunt iewels ready within chamber dare ſafely ſaine naked father houſe qd ſhe came naked mote turne againe pleaſaunce would follow faine yet hope entent ſmockeleſſe paleis went ye could doe ſo diſhoneſt thing ilke wombe child lay people walking ſeene bare wherefore pray let like worme goe way remembreth mine owne lord ſo dere wife though vnworthy wherefore reward maidenhede brought ayen bere vouchſafe yeue mede ſuch ſmock wont therewith may wrie ye wombe wife take leue mine owne lord leaſt greue ſmock qd yt thou haſt thy bake let ſtill beare forth thee well vnneth word ſpake went way routh pitee folke ſelfe ſtrippeth ſhe ſmock foot head bare toward father houſe forth ſhe fare folke followed weeping wey fortune euer curſed gone ſhe fro weeping kept eyen drey ne time word ſpake ſhe none father tidings heard anone curſed day time nature shope liues creature doubt poore old man euer ſuſpect marriage euer deemed ſithen began lord filled corage would thinke diſparage eſtate ſo low alight voiden ſoone euer might ayenſt doughter haſtily goeth ye noiſe folk knew comming old coat might couered full ſore weeping body might bring rude cloth ſhe age day fele ſhe marriage thus father certaine ſpace dwelleth floure wifely patience never word face folke ne eke abſence ne ſhewed ſhe done offence ne high eſtate remembraunce ne ſhe coutenaunce wonder great eſtate ghoſt euer plaine humilitie tender mouth ne heart delicate ne pompe ne ſemblance roialtie full patience benignite diſcreet prideleſſe aye honorable husband euer meek ſtable men ſpeak iob moſt humbleſſe clerkes hem liſt well endite namely men ſoothfaſtneſſe though clerkes praiſen woman lite man humbleſſe hem acquite woman ne halfe ſo trew woman befall new explicit quinta par ſequitur par ſexta fro boloine earle pauie come fame ſprong leſſe people eares ſome couth eke new marqueſeſſe brought pomp ſuch richeſſe neuer ſeene man eie noble aray weſt lumbardie marque ſhope knew er erle come ſent meſſage thilke poore ſilly griſildis ſhe humble heart glad viſage ſwelling heart corage came heſt knee ſet reuerently wiſely ſhe gret griſilde qd vtterly maid wedded ſhall vnto receiued morrow ſo royally poſſible houſe bee eke euery wight degree haue eſtate ſitting ſeruice alſo pleaſaunt ye beſt deuiſe haue woman ſufficient certaine chamber array ordinaunce luſt therefore woll faine thine ſuch gouernaunce thou knoweſt eke old pleaſaunce though thine array bad euill beſey doe thou thy deuer leaſt wey onely lord glad qd ſhe doen luſt deſire alſo pleaſe ſerue degree withouten faining ſhall euermo ne neuer weale ne wo ne ſhall ghoſt within heart ſtent loue beſt true entent yt word ſhe gan ye hous dight table ſet bed make pained doen ſhe might praying chamberers god ſake haſten hem faſt ſweepe ſhake ſhe moſt ſeruiceable hem hath euery chamber arraied hall abouten vndren gan earle alight yt brought theſe noble child twey people ran ſee ſight array ſo richely beſey erſt amongs hem ſey walter foole though leſt chaunge wife beſt ſhe fairer deemen griſild tender age fairer fruit hem ſhall fall pleaſant high linage brother eke ſo fair age ſeen ye people cauȝt pleſance commending marque governance ſterne people unſad untrue aye undiſcreet changing fane delighting ever rumer new like moone ever waxe ye wane full clapping deare ynough iane dome fals conſtance ill preveth full great foole leveth thus ſaiden ſad folke citie people gaſed vp glad right noueltie haue new lady toun make mentioun griſilde ayen woll dreſſe tellen conſtance buſineſſe well buſie griſilde euery thing feaſt appertinent right nauȝt ſhe abaſhed clothing though wer rude ſomwhat rent glad cheare yate went folke greet marqueſeſſe doth ſhe forth buſineſſe right glad chere ye geſts ſhe receiueth buxomely eueriche degree man defaut perceiueth euer wondren ſhe might bee ſo poore array ſee coud ſuch honour reuerence worthyly praiſen prudence meane ſhe neuer ſtent maiden eke brother commend heart benigne intent well man coud priſe amend laſt theſe lord wend ſitten doune meat gan call griſilde ſhe buſie hall griſilde qd play liketh thee wife beaute right well lord qd ſhe good fay fairer ſaw neuer none ſhe pray god ſo yeue proſperite ſo hope woll ſend pleaſaunce ynough vnto liues end one thing beſeech warne alſo ye pricke ſuch turmenting tender maiden ye han mo ſhe foſtered nouriſhing tenderly ſuppoſing could aduerſitie endure could poore foſtred creature walter ſaw patience glad cheare mallice ſo oft hath done offence ſhe aye conſtant ſtable wall continuing euer innocence ouer ſturdie marque gan heart dreſſe rue vpon wifely ſtedfaſtneſſe ynough griſilde mine qd gaſt ne euill apaid haue thy faith thy benignite well euer woman aſſaid great eſtate poorely araid know deare wife thy ſtedfaſtneſſe armes tooke gan keſſe ſhe wonder tooke thereof keepe heard thing ſaid fared ſhe ſtert ſleepe till ſhe maſedneſſe abraid griſilde qd god v deid thou art wife none haue ne neuer god ſoule ſaue thy doughter thou ſuppoſed wife none faithfully ſhall mine heir haue diſpoſed thou bare hem thy body truly boloine haue kept hem ſikerly take hem ayen maiſt thou ſay thou haſt lorn thy child tway folke otherwiſe han ſaid warne hem wel haue done dede malice ne cruelte aſſay thee thy womanhede ſley child god forbede keepen hem priuely ſtill till thy purpoſe knew thy ſhe herd ſwoune doun ſhe falleth pitous joy ſwouning yong child calleth armes pitouſly weeping embraced hem tenderly kiſſing full like mother ſalt teares bathed viſage haires pitous thing ſee ſwouning pitous voice heare graunt mercy lord god thonk qd ſhe ye haue ſaued child deare recke neuer dead right sithen ſtond loue grace force death ne ſpirit pace tender deare yong child mine wofull mother wend ſtedfaſtly cruell hound ſome foule vermine eaten god mercy benigne father ſo tenderly hath done keep yt ſame ſtound ſuddainly ſhe ſwapt doune ground ſwouning ſo ſadly held ſhe child two ſhe gan hem embrace great ſleight difficulte child hir arm gan race many teare many pitous face doune ran hem tht ſtooden beſide vnneth might man abide walter gladdeth ſorow ſlaketh riſeth abaſhed traunce every wight ioy feaſt maketh till ſhe hath caught ayen countenance walter doth ſo faithfully pleaſaunce deintie ſeene chere betwixt hem two met ifere theſe lady time ſey han taken chamber gone ſtrippen rude arrey cloth gold bright ſhone croune many rich ſtone vpon head hall brought ſhe honoured ſhe ought thus hath pitous day blisful end every man woman doth might day mirth revel diſpend till welkin ſhone ſterres bright ſolemne every man ſight feaſt greater co •• age revell mariage well many year high proſperite liven theſe two concord reſt richly doughter maried vnto lord one worthieſt itaile peace reſt wiues father court kept till ſoule body crept ſonne ſucceedeth heritage reſt peace father day fortunate eke mariage put wife great aſſay world ſo ſtrong nay hath old time yore kneth autour ſaith therfore ſtory ſaid wiues ſhould followen griſild humilite importable tho would every wight degre conſtant adverſite griſild wherefore petrarke writeth ſtory high ſtile enditeth ſith woman ſo patient vnto mortal man well ought receive gree god u ſent great skill preueth wrought ne tempteth man bought ſaith ſaint iame ye piſtell read preueth folke aſſay dread ſuffereth v exerciſe ſharpe ſcourges adverſite well oft beaten ſondry wiſe know certes borne knew freelte beſt governaunce let u live vertuous ſuffraunce one word herkeneth lordings ye go full hard find adayes countrey griſilds three two put ſuch aſſays gold hem hath ſo bad alayes braſſe though faire eie rather braſt two plie wiues loue bath whoſe life ſect mighty god maintene high maiſtry elſe skath iuſtie hert freſh greene say ſong glad wene let u ſtint earneſt mattere herkneth ſong ſaith manere lenuoye de chaucer à le mariz de noſtre temp griſilde dead eke hir patience buried itaile cry open audience wedded wan ſo hardy aſſaile wiues patience truſt find griſildes certaine ſhall faile noble wiues full high prudence let humility tongue naile ne let clerke cauſe ne diligence write ſtorie ſuch maruaile griſild patient kinde leſt chechiface ſwallow entraile followeth ecco holdeth ſilence euer anſwereth contretaile beth addaſſed innocence ſharpely taketh gouernaile enprinteth well leſſon minde common profit ſith may auaile ne dredeth hem doth hem reverence though thine husbond armed maile arrow thy crabbed eloquence shal perce breſt eke adventaile iealouſie eke looke thou binde yt ſhall make couch doth quaile thou faire folke ben preſence shew thou thy viſage thine apparaile thou foule free thy diſpence get thee friend aye thy travaile aye cheare light lefe linde let care weepen wring waile ye arch wiues ſtondeth aye defence sith ye ſtrong great camaile ne ſuffreth men offence ye ſclendre wife feeble battaile beth eygre tygre inde aye clappeth mill counſail ¶here endeth clerk oxenfords tale ¶here follow word hoſt worthy clerke ended tale hoſt ſaid ſworen cockes bone leuer barrel af ale wife home heard legend one gentle tale none purpoſe wiſt ye thing woll let ſtill ¶the frankeleins prologue theſe old gentle briton dayes diver auentures maden layes rimed firſt mother tong layes inſtruments ſong elſe readen hem pleaſaunce one hem remembraunce ſhall ſay willing ſirs becauſe borell man beginning firſt beſeech haue excuſed rude ſpeech learned never rhetoricke certaine thing ſpeke mote bare plaine ſlept neuer mount pernaſo ne learned marcus tullius cicero colour ne know none withouten dread ſuch colour growen mead el ſuch men dien paint colour rhetoricke quaint ny ſpirit feeleth ſuch mattere tale ye woll ¶the frankeleins tale aurelius much labour coſt beſtowed win love dorigen another man wife content end good dealing husband loſe labour coſt ſcope tale ſeemeth contention courteſie armorike called britaine knight loved paine ſerven lady beſt wiſe many labour many great empriſe lady wrought ere ſhe ſhe one faireſt vnder ſon eke thereto commen high kinrede well vnneth durſt knight drede tell wo pain diſtreſſe laſt ſhe worthineſſe namely meek obeyſaunce hath ſuch pity caught pennaunce prively ſhe fell accord take husbond lord ſuch lordſhip men wife lead bliſſe life free ſwore knight never life day ne night ne ſhould take upon maiſtry ne kithe iealouſie obey follow louer lady ſhall save name ſoveraignete would ſhame degree thonked full great humbleſs ſaid ſir ſith gentleneſs ye profred ſo large raine ne would god never betwixt v twaine gilt either werre ſtrife sir woll true humble wife haue trouth till hert breſt thus ben quiet reſt one thing ſirs ſafely dare ſeine friend everich muſt obeine woll long holden company love woll conſtrained maiſtry maiſtry come god loue anone beateth wing farewell gone loue thing ſpirit free woman kind deſiren libertee conſtrained thraſſ ſo done men ſooth ſay ſhall looke moſt pacient loue auantage aboue patience high vertue certain venquiſheth theſe clerkes ſain thing rigour ſhall never attain every word men may chide plain learneth ſuffer elſe ſo mote gone ye ſhall learne whether ye woll none world certain wight ne doth ſaieth ſometime amis ire ſickneſs conſtellation wine wo chaunging complexion cauſeth full oft done amiſſe ſpeaken every wrong man may wreken time muſt temperaunce every wight governaunce therefore hath worthy wiſe knight liven eaſe ſuffraunce hight ſhe full wiſely gan ſwere never ſhould default may men ſee humble wiſe accord thus hath ſhe take ſervant lord servaunt loue lord marriage lordſhip ſeruage servage nay lordſhip aboue sithen hath lady loue lady certes wife alſo law lond accordeth proſperity home wife goth country fer fro denmarke dwelling liueth ioy ſolas coud tell wedded ioy eaſe proſperity betwixt husbond wife evermore laſted blisful life till knight ſpeake thus caere iuda cleped aruiragus shope dwellen yeare twaine englond cleped britaine ſeeken armes worſhip honour luſt ſet ſuch labour dwelt two year ye booke faith thus woll ſtint aruiragus ſpeake woll dorigen wife loueth husbond heart life abſence weepeth ſhe ſiketh done theſe noble wiues hem liketh mourneth waileth faſteth plaineth deſire preſence ſo conſtraineth wide world ſet ſhe nought friend knew heauy thought comforten euer may preachen hir tellen night day cauſeleſſe ſhe ſlew ſelfe ala euery comfort poſſible caas done buſineſſe maken leaue heauineſſe proceſſe ye knowen euerychone men mowen ſo long grauen ſtone till ſome figure therein printed long han comforted till ſhe receiued hath hope reaſon enprinting conſtellation gret ſorrow gan aſſuage may alway enduren ſuch rage eke aruiragus care hath ſent letter home welfare woll come haſtily againe el ſorrow heart ſlaine friend ſaw ſorrow gan ſlake praiden knee god ſake come roman companie away driuen derke fantaſie finally ſhe graunted requeſt well ſhe ſaw beſt ſtood caſtle faſt ſee often friend walked ſhee diſporten bankes hie ſhe may ſhips barge ſie sailing courſe liſt go yet parcell wo felfe full oft ala ſaid ſhee ſhip ſo many ſee wol bring home lord hert wariſhed theſe bitter paine ſmert another time would ſhe ſit thinke caſt eyen downward fro brinke ſhe ſaw griſly rockes blake feare ſo would hert quake foot ſhe might ſuſtene would ſhe ſit adoune vpon grene pitouſly ſea behold ſay right thus ſorrowfull ſikes cold eterne god yt thy purueiaunce • eadeſt world certaine gouernaunce idle men ſain doſt thou nothing make lord theſe griſly fiendly rockes blake ſeemen rather foule confuſion werke faire creation ſuch perfit god wiſe ſtable haue ye wrouȝt werk vnreſonable werke north ſouth weſt ne eaſt ni foſtred ne man bird ne beaſt doth good annoyeth see ye lord mankind deſtroyeth hundred thouſand body mankind haue rockes iſlaine mind sin mankind ſo faire part thy werke thou madeſt like thy owne werke ſeemed ye great cherte toward mankind may ye ſuch meanes maken diſtroyen mean good euer anoyen wote well clerkes woll ſaine hem leſt argument beſt though ne cannot cauſes well know thilke god made wind blow keepe lord concluſion clerkes lete diſputation would god theſe rockes blake ſonken hell ſake theſe rockes doe ſlee mine heart feare thus would ſhe ſay many pitous tear friend ſaw diſport roman ſea diſcomfort ſhapen hem plaine ſome el leaden riuers wels eke place delectables dauncen plaien table day right morrow tide vnto garden beſide yt made ordinaunce vitailes purueyaunce gone plaien hem long day ſixt morrow may may hath painted ſoft ſhours garden full leaues flour craft man hond ſo curiouſly arrayed garden truly neuer na garden ſuch priſe paradiſe odour flour freſh ſight would made living hert light ever great ſickneſſe great ſorrow held diſtreſſe full beauty pleaſaunce dinner gone daunce ſing alſo ſave dorigene alone yet unto ſelfe made mone ſhe ne ſeie daunce go husbond love alſo natheleſſe ſhe muſt time abide good hope let ſorrow ſlide vpon daunce among men daunced ſquier dorigen freſher iollier array dome month may ſingeth daunceth paſſing euery man ſithen world began therewith men ſhould diſcriue one beſt faring men liue yong ſtrong vertuous rich wiſe well beloued holden great priſe ſhortly ſooth tell ſhall vnwitting dorigen luſty ſquier ſeruaunt venus ycleaped aurelius loved beſt creature two yeare auenture never durſt tell greuance withouten cup dronke pennance diſpaired nothing durſt ſay saue ſongs ſomewhat would wray wo generall complaining ſaid loued beloued nothing mattere made many layes song complaint roundel verilayes durſt ſorrow tell languiſh doth furie hell die muſt ſaid ecco narciſſus durſt tell wo manner ye heard ſay ne durſt wo bewray saue perauenture ſometime daunces young folke keepen obſeruaunces may well looked face ſuch wiſe men asken grace nothing wiſt ſhe entent natheleſſe happed ere thence went becauſe yt neere neighbour man worſhip honour ſhe yknowne time yore fell ſpeech ſo forth vnto purpoſe drow aurelius ſaw time ſaid thus madame qd god yt world made yt wiſt might hert glade would day aruyragus went ouer ſea aurelius went yt ſhould neuer come well wot ſeruice vain guerdon ni breſting mine hert madam rueth vpon paine ſmert one word ye may ſlee ſaue foot god would yt graue haue leiſure ſey haue mercy ſweet ye woll doe dey gan looke vpon aurelius qd ſhe ſay ye thus neuer erſt qd ſhe ne wiſt ye ment know aurelius entent thilke god yaue ſoule life ne ſhall neuer vntrew wife word ne werke far haue wit woll ben knit take final anſwere play thus ſaid ſhe aurelius qd ſhe god aboue yet woll graunt loue sithen ſee ſo pitouſly complaine looke day endlong britaine ye remeue rock ſtone ſtone ne let ſhip ne boat gone ſay ye haue made theſe coaſts ſo clene rockes ni ſtone yſeen woll loue beſt man haue trouth euer none grace qd lord qd ſhe maked well wote ſhall never betide let ſuch follie heart glide deintie ſhould man haue life goe loue another man wife hath body ſo liketh aurelius full often ſore ſiketh wo aurely herd ſorowfull chere thus anſwerd madame qd impoſſible mote die ſuddaine death horrible word turned anone tho come friend everichone aleyes romeden doun nothing wiſt concluſioun ſuddainely began revell new till bright ſonne loſt hew orizont hath reft ſunne light much ſay night home gone ioy ſolas save onely wretched aurelius ala houſe gone ſorrowfull hert ſaid might death aſtert ſeemed felt heart cold heaven honds gan hold knee bare ſet adoun raving ſaid oriſoun wo wit braied ne wiſt ſpake thus ſaid pitous heart hath complaint begon vnto goddes firſt unto ſon ſaid god apollo governour every plant hearbe tree flour yeueſt thy declination ilke hem time ſeaſon thine herberow chaungeth low hie lord phebus caſt thy merciable eie wretched aurelius lorne lo lord lady hath death yſworne without guilt thy benignity vpon deadly heart haue ſome pity well wot lord phebus ye leſt ye may helpe ſaue lady beſt vouch ye ſaue deuiſe yt may holpen wiſe blisfull ſuſter lucina ſhene ſea goddeſſe queene though neptunus hath deitie ſee yet empreſſe abouen ſhe ye knowen well lord right deſire quickened lighted ſire ſhe followeth full beſily right ſea deſireth naturally followen ſhe goddeſſe ſea riuers leſſe wherefore lord phebus requeſt doe miracle doe mine heart breſt next oppſition ſigne ſhall lion prayeth ſo great flood bring fiue fadome leaſt ouerſpring highieſt rocke armorike britaine let floud duren yeares twaine certes lady may ſay holdeth heſt rockes away thing may ye lightly done pray gone faſter courſe ye ſay thus prayeth ſuſter ſhe go faſter courſe ye yeares two ſhall ſhe full alway ſpring flood laſting night day ſhe vouchſafe ſuch manere graunt ſoveraigne lady dere pray ſinken every rocke adoun owne derke regioun vnder ground pluto dwelleth nevermore ſhall lady win thy temple delphos wol barefoot ſeek lord phebus ſee teares cheek paine haue ſome compaſſioun yt word ſwoune fell adoun long time lay traunce brother yt knew pennaunce vp caught bed brought diſpaired turnment thought let wofull creature lie cheſe whether woll liue die aruiragus heale great honour chiualrie flour comen home worthy men blisfull art thou dorigen haſt thy luſty husbond thine armes freſh knight worthy man arm loueth thee heart life nothing liſt imaginatife wight ſpoken loue thereof dout entendeth ſuch matere danceth juſteth maketh good chere thus joy bliſs let hem dwell wofull aurelius woll tell langour turment deſpitous two yeare lay wretched aurelius ere foot earth might gone ne comfort time none saue brother clerke knew wo werke none creature certaine mattere durſt word ſaine vnder breaſt bare ſecre euer pamphilus galathe breaſt whole without ſeene heart aye arrow keene well ye knowen ſurſanure ſurgerie per ••• ous cure men might touch arrow come thereby brother weepeth waileth prively till laſt fell remembraunce orleaunce fraunce theſe clerkes yong likerous readen art curious seeken euery halke euery herne particular ſcience lerne remembred upon deie orleaunce ſtudie booke ſeie magicke naturall felaw time batcheler law learne another craft prively upon dexe ylaft booke ſpake mochell operation touching eight twentie manſions longen moone ſuch follie dayes worth flie holy church ſaieth beleeue ne ſuffereth none illuſion u greeue book remembrance anon ioy heart gan dance himſelfe ſaied prively brother ſhall wariſhed sikerly siker ſciences men maken diuers apparences theſe ſubtill tregetores play oft • eaſts haue well heard ſay tragetors within hall large haue made come water barge hall rowen doun sometime hath ſeemed grim lioun ſometime floures ſpring mede sometime vine grape white rede sometime caſtle lime ſtone hem liked voiden hem anone thus ſeemed every man ſight conclude thus yt might orleaunce ſome old felaw find moones manſions mind magicke natural aboue ſhould wel make brother haue loue apparaunce clerke may make man ſight rockes blake britaine yuoided euerichone ſhips brinke comen gone ſuch forme enduren yeare two brother wariſhed wo muſt ſhe need holden beheſt el ſhall ſhame leſt ſhould make lenger tale vnto brother bed commen ſuch comfort yaue gone orleaunce ſtert anone way forth yfare hope leſſed care comen almoſt y• citee two furlong three yong clerke roming himſelfe met latine thriftily hem gret afterward ſaied wonder thing know whole cauſe comming ere farther foot went told hem intent briton clerke asked fellowes knowen old day anſwerd dead wept oft full many tere doune horſe aurelius light anon magician forth gon home houſe made well eſe hem lacked vitaile hem might pleſe well araied houſe one aurelius life ſaw neuer none ſhewed went ſuppere forreſts parkes full wild dere ſaw hart horne hie greateſt euer ſeene eie ſee hem hundred ſlaine hound ſome arows bled bitter wound ſaw voided wild dere theſe fauconers upon faire riuere haukes han heron ſlaine tho ſaw knight iuſting plaine ſuch pleaſaunce ſhewed lady daunce himſelf daunced thought maſter yt magike wrouȝt saw time clapped honds farewell revel ago remeued neuer hous ſaw ſight maruellous ſtudie bookes bee ſaten ſtill wight three maiſter called ſquier ſaied thus ready ſupper almoſt hour vndertake sithen bad ſupper ready make theſe worthy men went ſtudie bookes sir qd ſquier liketh ready though ye woll right goe ſup qd beſt theſe amorous folk ſomtime mote haue reſt ſupper fell treate ſum ſhould maiſters guerdon remeue rockes britaine eke girond mouth saine made ſtrange ſwore ſo god ſaue leſſe thouſand pound would haue ne gladly yt ſum nold done aurelius bliſfull heart anone anſwerd thus fie thouſand pound wide world men ſay round would yeue lord bargaine full driue knit ye ſhall paied truely trouth looke negligence ſlouth ne tarien v lenger morow nay qd clerk trouth borow bed gone aurelius leſt well nigh night reſt labour hope bliſſe wofull heart pennaunce liſſe vpon morrow day home britaine tooke right way aurelius magicine beſide diſcended would abide booke doth remember cold froſtie ſeaſon december phebus waxed old hewed like laton afore hot declination shone brenning gold ſtreames bright capricorne adoune light whereas ſhone full pale dare well ſaine bitter froſt ſlidder raine deſtroyed hath greene euery yerd ianus ſit fire double berd drinketh bugle horne wine beforn ſtout brawne ye tusked ſwine nowell crieth euery luſtie man aurelius euer doeth maiſter chere reuerence praieth doen deligence bringen paine ſmart ſwerd would ſlit hart clerke ſuch routh hath man night day ſpeedeth wt wait time concluſion ſay make illuſion ſuch apparence iogglerie ne termes aſtrologie ſhe every wight ſhould wene ſay britaine rockes away el ſonken vnder ground till laſt hath time yfound make yapes wretchedneſſe ſuch ſuperſtitious curſedneſſe tollitan table forth brought full well corrected lacked nought neither collect ne expans yeres ne root ne yet geres centris argumentes proportionell conuenientes equation euery thing eight ſperes werking knew full well far alnath ſhoue fro head thilke fixt aries aboue ninth ſpere conſidered full ſubtilly calked found firſt manſion knew remnaunt proportion knew riſing moone wele ſuch face terme euery dele knew alſo obſeruaunces ſuch illuſions ſuch miſchaunces heathen folke vſed thilke day ne maked lenger delay magick weeke tway ſeemed rockes away aurelius diſpaired whether ſhall haue loue fare amis awaiteth night day miracle knew none obſtacle yt voided theſe rock euerichone doune maiſters foot fell anone ſaied wofull wretch aurelius thanke lord lady mine venus hath holpen fro care cold ye temple way forth hath hold whereas knew ſhould lady ſee ſaw time anon right hee dreadfull hart humble chere salued hath ſoueraigne lady dere rightfull lady qd wofull man ſerue loue beſt lotheſt world diſpleaſe nere haue ſuch diſeaſe muſt die foot anon nought would tell wo begon certes either muſt die plaine ye ſlea guiltleſſe paine death though ye haue routh auiſen ere ye breake trouth repenteth like god aboue ye ſlea becauſe loue madame well ye wot ye haue hight nut chalenge thing right ſoueraigne lady grace garden yonde ſuch place ye wote right well ye behight hond trouth plight ye loue beſt god wote ye ſaied ſo albeit vnworthy thereto madame ſpeake honour ſaue heart life haue doen right ye commaunded mee ye vouchſafe ye may goe ſee doeth liſt haueth heſt mind quick dead right ye ſhall find lieth doe liue dey well wote rockes awey tooke leaue ſhe aſtonied ſtood face na drop blood wend neuer han come ſuch trap ala qd ſhe euer ſhould hap wend neuer poſſibilite ſuch miſter maruaile might againſt proceſſe nature home ſhe goeth ſorrowfull creature feare vnneths may ſhe go weepeth waileth day two ſwouneth routh ſee wight told ſhe toune gone aruiragus ſelfe ſhe ſpake ſaied thus complaint ye ſhall heare face pale ſorrowfull cheare ala qd ſhe thee fortune plain vnware haſt wrapped thy chain fro eſcape wot ſuccour saue onely death el diſhonour one theſe two behoueth cheſe natheles yet leuer leſe life body haue ſhame know ſelfe falſe leſe name death may quit ywis hath full many wife ere many maid yſlaine ſelfe ala rather body doen treſpas certes lo theſe ſtories witneſſe thirtie tyrant full curſedneſſe ſlain phidon athens feaſt commaunded doughters arreſt bringen hem beforne hem diſpite naked fulfill foule delite father blood hem dance vpon ye pauement god yeue miſchance theſe wofull maiden ful dread rather would leſen maidenhead priuily ſtert well drenched hemſelfe bookes tell meſſene let enquire ſeeke lacedemony fiftie maiden eke would haue doen lechery none company ſhe na ſlaine glad intent cheſe rather dien aſſent oppreſſed maidenhead ſhould die dread lo eke tyrant ariſtoclides loued maid hight simphalides father ſlaine night vnto dianes temple goth ſhe non right hent image armes two fro image would ſhe neuer go wight might fro honds race till ſhe ſlaine right ſelfe place ſithens y• maiden ſuch deſpight defouled man foule delight well ought wife rather ſelfe ſle defouled thinketh ſhall ſay haſdrubals wife carthage beraft ſelfe life ſhe ſaw roman wan toun tooke child lept adoun fire cheſe rather die romane villanie hath lucrece yſlaine ſelfe ala rome ſhe oppreſſed tarquine thought ſhame liue ſhe loſt name eight maiden meleſie alſo han ſlaine hemſelue dread wo rather folk gaule ſhould hem oppreſſe thouſand ſtories geſſe couth tell touching matere abradas ſlain wife ſo dere ſelfe ſlow let blood glide abradas wound broad wide ſaied body leaſt way ſhall wight defoule may ſhould mo enſamples hereof ſain sithens ſo many han hem ſlain well rather would defouled woll conclude beſt well rather ſlea ſelfe ſome manere demotius doughter dere becauſe ſhe nolde defouled sedaſus full great pite readen thy doughters diden ala ſlowen hemſelfe ſuch maner caas great pity well theban maid nichanore one macedony oppreſſed death maidenhead ſhe redreſſed ſhall ſaine nicerates wife ſuch caſe beraft ſelfe life true eke alcibades loue dien rather chees ſuffren body vnburied lo wife alceſte qd ſhe ſaieth homere good penelope greece knoweth chaſtite parde laodomia written thus troy ſlain protheſelaus lenger nolde ſhe liue day ſame noble portia tell may withouten brutus couth ſhe liue ſhe heart ygiue perfit wifehood artemiſie honoured throughout barbarie oh thenta queene thy wifely chaſtite wiues liuing may mirrour ſame thing ſay bilia rodogone eke valeria thus plained dorigene day twey purpoſing euer ſhe would dey natheles vpon third night home came aruiragus worthy knight asked ſhe wept ſo ſore ſhe gan weepen euer lenger ala qd ſhe euer borne thus haue ſaid qd ſhe thus haue ſworn told ye haue heard needeth rehearſe husbond glad chere ſundry wiſe anſwerd ſaied ſhall deuiſe ought el dorigene nay nay qd ſhe god helpe ſo wi much god yea wife qd let ſleepe may ſtill may well yet parauenture day ye ſhall trouth hold fay god ſo wiſ • haue mercy well leuer ſticked loue haue ye ſhould trouth keepe ſaue trouth ye hieſt thing men may kepe word braſt anone weepe ſaied forbid paine death never while laſteth life breath wight tell miſauenture beſt woll wo endure ne make countenance heavineſſe folk may deeme harme ne geſſe forth cleped ſquier maid goth forth anone dorigene ſaid bringeth ſuch place anone took leue wey gone ne wiſt ſhe thider went nolde wight tellen intent ſquier hight aurelius dorigene ſo amorous auenture happed meet amid toune right high ſtreet ſhe would haue gone way forthright toward garden ſhe hight went gardenward alſo well ſpied ſhe would go houſe manner place thus met auenture grace ſalueth glad intent asſked whi • er ſhe went ſhe anſwerd halfe ſhe mad vnto garden husbond bad trouth hold ala ala aurelius gan wondren caas heart great compaſſion chere lamentation aruiragus worthy knight bad hold ſhe hight loth yt ſhe ſhould breke trouth heart caught great routh conſidering heſt euery ſide fro luſt better abide doe ſo high churliſh wretchedneſſe ayenſt fraunchiſe gentleneſſe word ſaied thus madame ſaieth lord aruiragus ſithen ſee great gentleneſſe eke ſee well diſtreſſe ye ſhoulden hold trouth certes thinketh great routh haue well leuer euer ſuffer wo depart loue betwixt two releaſe madame hond quite every ſurement every bond ye haue made beforne sithens thilk time ye born trouth plight ſhall neuer repreve beheſt take leve trueſt beſt wife euer yet knew life euery wight beware beheſt dorigene remembreth leaſt thus ſquier doen gentle dede well knight withouten drede thonked vpon knee bare home vnto husbond ſhe fare told ye han heard ſaied ye ſiker ſo well apaied vnpoſſible write ſhould lenger caſe endite aruiragus dorigene wife ſoueraigne bliſſe leaden forth life neuer anger hem betweene cheriſhed hir though ſhe queene ſhe true euermore theſe two folkes ye get aurelius coſt hath forlorne curſed time euer borne ala qd ala euer beheight pured gold thouſand pound weight vnto philoſopher ſhall doe ſee fordoe mine heritage mote need goe ſell bin begger may lenger dwell ſhame kinrede place may get better grace natheleſſe woll aſſay certaine day yeare yeare pay thonke great courteſie trouth woll keepe woll lie heart ſore goth vnto cofer brought gold vnto philoſopher value fiue hundred pound geſſe beſeecheth gentleneſſe graunt day remnaunt ſaid maiſter dare mell make auaunt failed never trouth yet ſikerly debt ſhall quit towards ever fare gone begging kirtle bare would ye vouchſafe upon ſuerte two yeare three reſpite well el mote ſell mine heritage tell philoſopher ſoberly anſwerd ſaied thus word herd hold covenaunt unto thee yes certes well truly qd haſt thou thy lady thee liketh qd ſorily ſiketh cauſe tell thou aurelius anon tale began told ye han heard needeth rehearce ſaied aruiragus gentleneſſe leuer die ſorow diſtreſſe wife trouth fals ſorrow dorigene told al loth ſhe wicked wife ſhe leuer loſt life yt trouth ſhe ſwore innocence erſt heard ſpeake apparence made ſo great pite right freely ſent freely ſent ſome ni ſain philoſopher anſwerd leue brother everych gently thou art ſquier knight god forbid blisful might clerke could doen gentle deed well dreed sir releaſe thee thy thouſand pound thou crope ground ne never ere haddeſt thou knowen mee ſir woll taken penny thee craft ne nought trauaile thou haſt ypaied right well • vitaile ynough farwell haue good day tooke horſe rode forth way lordings queſtion would aske moſt free thinketh telleth ere wend tale end ¶the second nonnes prologue miniſter norice vnto vice yt men clepen engliſh idleneſſe porter ye gate delices eſchue contrary oppreſſe ſaine lefull buſineſſe well ought doen intent leaſt ye fiend idleneſſe v hent thouſand cord ſlie continually v waiteth clap may man idleneſſe eſpie ſo lightly catch trap till man hent right lap ni ware fiend hath hond well ought v werch idleneſſe withſtond though men dreaden neuer die yet ſee men well reaſon doubtles idleneſſe root ſluggardie commeth neuer good encrees ſoothly ſloth holdeth hem lee onely ſleepe eat drinke deuouren ſwinke put v ſuch idleneſſe cauſe ſo great confuſion haue doen faithfull buſineſſe legend tranſlation right thy glorious life paſſion thou thy garlond wrought roſe lilly thee meane maid martir ſaint cecily thou art floure virgin bernard liſt ſo well write thee beginning firſt call thou comfort v wretch doe endite thy maiden death yt wan hir merite eterne life fiend victory men may read ſtory thou maiden mother doughter thy ſon thou well mercy ſinfull ſoules cure god bounty cheſe thou humble high ouer euery creature thou nobleſt ſo farre ouer nature diſdaine maker kind ſon bloud fleſh cloth wind within cloyſter thy bliſfull ſidis tooke man ſhape eterne loue pee true compas lord guide heauen earth ſea withouten le aye herien thou virgine wemles bare thy body dwelleſt maiden pure creator euery creature aſſembled magnificence mercy goodneſſe ſuch pitee thou art ſonne excellence onely helpeſt praien thee oftentime thy benignitee full freely men thine helpe beſeech thou goeſt beforne art liues leech helpe thou bliſfull meekefaire maid flemed wretch deſert gall thinke woman canane ſaid whelpes eaten ſome ye crums ſmall lord table yfall though yt vnworthy doughter eue ſinfull yet accepteth beleeue faith ded withouten werkis werch yeue witte ſpace quit place yt moſt derkis thou art ſo faire full grace mine aduocate hie place without ende ſong oſanna thou chriſtes mother doughter anna thy light ſoule priſon light troubled contagion body alſo wight earthly luſt falſe affection heauen refute ſaluation hem ſorow diſtreſſe help werke woll dreſſe yet pray reden write foryeueth doe diligence ilke ſtorie ſubtilly endite hoth haue word ſentence ſaints reuerence ſtorie wrote followen legende pray ye woll werke amende firſt woll name ſaint cecily expoune men may ſtorie ſee ſay engliſh heauens lilly pure chaſtneſſe virginitie ſhe witnes honeſtie greene conſcience good ſame ſote ſauoured lilly name cecily ſay way blinde ſhe enſample good teaching elſe cecily written finde joyned manner conioining heauen lia figuring heauen ſet thought holineſſe lia laſting beſineſſe cecily may eke ſaied manere wanting blindneſſe great light ſapience thewes clere el lo maiden name ſo bright heuen leo cometh right men might heauen people call enſample good wiſe werkes leo people engliſh ſay right men may heauen ſee ſunne moon ſterres euery way right ſo men ghoſtly maiden free sawen faith great magnanimitie eke clereneſſe hole ſapience ſundrie werkes bright excellence right ſo theſe philoſophers write heauen ſwift round eke brenning right ſo faire cecily white full ſwift buſie euery good working round whole good perſeuering brenning euer charitie full bright haue declared ſhe hight ¶the ſecond nonnes tale life death saint cecily maiden bright cecile life ſaith comen romanes noble kind ſo foorth foſtered vp faith chriſt bare goſpell mind neuer ceaſed written find prayer god loue dread beſeeching keepe maidenhead maid ſhould vnto man wedded full yong age ycleped valerian day come mariage full deuout humble corage vnder robe gold ſat full faire next fleſh yclad haire while organ made melodie god alone thus hert ſong ſhe lord ſoule eke bodie gie vnwemmed leſt confounded loue died vpon tree euery ſecond third day ſhe faſt aye biding oriſon full faſt night came bed muſt ſhe gone husbond manere priuily ſhe ſaid vnto anone ſweet well beloued ſpouſe dere counſaile ye woll right faine would ſaine ye enſure bewraine valerian gan faſt vnto ſwere caſe ne thing might ſhould neuer none bewraien erſt thus ſaid ſhe haue angell loueth great loue ſo wake ſleepe ready aye body keepe may felen drede ye touch loue vilonie right anon ſlee dede youth thus ſhall ye die ye clene loue gie woll loue cleaneſſe ſhew joy brightneſſe valerian corrected god wold anſwerd ayen ſhall truſt thee let angell ſee behold angell woll done thou haſt prayed thou loue another man forſoth right ſword woll ſlee cecile anſwerd anon wiſe ye luſt angel ſhul ſee ye trow chriſt baptiſe goth forth via apia qd ſhe toun ne ſtant mile three poore folke doe dwell say hem right thus ſhall tell tell hem cecile hem ſent ſhewen good vrban old ſecret need good entent ye ſaint vrban han behold tell word told hath purged ſin ſhall ye ſee angell ere ye twinne valerian place igon right taught lerning found holy vrban anon among theſe ſaints burial louting anon without tareing meſſage tolde vrban joy gan honds vp hold teres eyen let fall almightie god ieſu chriſt qd sower chaſte counſell hierde v fruit thilke ſeed chaſtite thou haſt ſow cecile take thee lo like beſy bee withouten gile thee ſerueth aye thine owne thrall cecile thilke ſpouſe ſhe tooke newe full like fierce lion ſhe ſendeth meeke lambe ewe word anon ther gan apere old man iclad white clothes clere book letter gold hond gan biforne valerian ſtond valerian deed fell downe drede old man ſaw ſtanding ſo forthwith anon herd rede lord faith god withouten mo chriſtendome father alſo abouen ouer euery theſe word gold iwritten rad ſaid old man leueſt thou thing none ſay ye nay leue thing qd valerian vnder heauen • ight ne thinke may sother thing dare well ſay tho vaniſhed old man niſt pope vrban chriſtned right valerian goeth home findeth cecile within chamber angell ſtonde angell roſe lillye crownes two bare honde firſt cecile vnderſtonde yaue one gan take valerian make body clean vnwemmed thought keepeth aye well theſe crownes two qd paradiſe haue hem brought ne neuer ſhullen rotten ne leſe ſweet ſauour truſteth ne neuer wight ſhall ſeene hem eye chaſte hate vilonie thou valerian thou ſo ſonne aſſentedeſt good counſell alſo say thou liſt thou ſhalt thy boone haue brother qd valerian tho world loue man ſo pray brother may haue grace know trouth place angel anſwerd god liketh requeſt palme martirdome shall ye come vnto blisfull feaſt yt word tiburce brother come ſauour • idernome roſes lillie caſt within hert gan wonder faſt ſaid wonder time yere whence ſote ſauour commeth ſo roſes lillie ſmell though hem mine hand two ſauour might deeper goe ſweet ſmell mine hert find hath changed another kind valerian ſaid two crownes snow white roſe red ſhineth clere thine eyen han might ſee thou ſmelleſt hem praier ſhalt thou ſeen hem leue brother dere ſo thou wilt without ſlouth beleeue aright know trouth tiburce anſwerd ſaieſt thou ſoothneſſe dreme herken dremes qd valerian han vnto time brother mine iwis erſt dwelling trouth woſt qd tiburce wiſe qd valerian yt ſhall thee deuiſe angell god hath y• trouth taught thou ſhalt ſeene thou wilt reney idol cleane el naught miracle theſe crownes twey saint ambroſe preface luſt ſey solemnely noble doctour dere commendeth ſaith manere palme martirdome receiue saint cecile fulfilled god ye • world eke chamber gan weiue witneſſe tiburces ceciles ſhrift god bounty would ſhift crownes two floures well ſmelling made ye angell hem tho crownes bring maid hath brought hem bliſſe aboue world hath wiſt worth certain deuotion chaſtity well loue tho ſhewed cecile open plaine idol ben thing vaine ben dumbe therto ben defe charged idol lefe troweth beaſt qd tiburce ſhall lie kiſſed breaſt ſhe heard full glad couth trouth eſpie day take thee mine allie said blisfull maiden faire deare ſhe ſaid ye may heare lo right ſo loue chriſt qd ſhe made thy brother wife right yt wiſe anon mine allie take thee sithens thou wolt thine idol deſpiſe goth thy brother thee baptiſe make thee clean ſo yt thou maiſt behold angel face thy brother told tiburce anſwerd ſaid brother deare firſt tell whither ſhal wt man ſaid come forth good chere woll thee lead vnto pope vrban vrban brother mine valerian qd tiburce wilt thou thider lede thinketh wonder dede ne meaneſt thou vrban qd tho ſo oft damned dead wonneth hal • e fro dare putten forth head men ſhould bren fire ſo red found men might ſpie alſo beare companie ſeeken thilke diuinitie yh • heauen priuely algate ybrent world ſhould cecile anſwerd boldely men might dread well skilfully life le • e mine dere brother liuing onely none better liuing place neuer ſhall loſt ne drede thee nought god ſon v told throgh grace father ſon hath al thing wroght iwrought skilfull thought ghoſt father gan procede hath ſouled withouten drede word miracle lo god ſon world declared life men may anſwerd tiburce ſu • ter dere ne ſaideſt thou right manere na one god ſoothfattneſſe three may thou bere witneſſe ſhall tell qd ſhe go right man hath ſapiences three memory engine intellect alſo ſuch diuinitie three perſons may full right well tho gan ſhe full buſily preach chriſts ſonne paine teach many point paſſion god ſon world withhold doe mankind plaine remiſſion b • und ſinnes care cold theſe thing vnto tiburce told tiburce good intent valerian pope vrban went thonked god glad hert light chriſtened made yt place perfite learning god knight tiburce got ſuch grace euery day ſaw time ſpace angell god euery boone god asked ſped full ſoone full hard order ſaine many wonder ieſu wrought laſt tell ſhort plaine ſergeaunt •• e hem ſought hem almache ye prouoſt brought hem apoſed knew intent image iupiter hem ſent ſaid ſo woll doe ſacrifice swap head ſentence anon theſe martyr deuiſe one maximus officere prefectes councelere hem hent forth ſaints lad himſelfe wept pity maximus herd theſe ſaints lore gote hem turmentours leue hem houſe withouten preaching ere yt eue gan turmentour reue maximus folke echone falſe faith trowen god alone cecile came woxen night prieſts hem chriſtened fere afterward day woxen light cecile hem ſaid ſober chere chriſts knight leue dere caſteth away werkes derkeneſſe armeth armour brightneſſe ye han forſooth idone great bataile courſe done faith hath conſerued goth croune life may faile rightfull iudge ye han ſerued shall yeue ye deſerued thing ſaid deuiſe men led hem forth done ſacrifice unto place ibrought tell ſhortly concluſioun • old enſence ne ſacrifice right nought knee ſaten hem adoun humble heart ſad deuotioun l • ſſen head place ſo •• e wenten king grace maximus ſaw thing betide 〈◊〉 teares told anone right ſoules ſaw heauen glide angel full cleareneſſe light word conuerted many wight almachius ſo bete wh •• lead till life gan lete cecile tooke buried anone tiburce valerian ſoothly within durying place vnder ſtone almachius haſtily bad miniſters fetchen openly cecile ſo yt ſhe might preſence doe ſacrfide iupiter encence conuerted wi • e lore weptenfull ſore yaue full credence vnto word criden chriſt god ſonne withouten difference god ſentence hath ſe •• aunt ſo good ſerue thus voice trow though ſterue almachius heard bad fetch cecile might ſee alderfirſt asking manner woman art thou qd gentlewoman borne qd ſhe aske thee qd thought thee greeue thy religion thy beleeue ye haue begun queſtion fondly qd ſhe would two anſwers conclude one demaund ye asken leaudly almachius anſwerd ſimilitude whence commeth thine anſwere ſo rude whence qd ſhe yt ſhe frained conſcience good faith vnfained almachius ſaid ne takeſt thou none hede power ſhe anſwerd might qd ſhe full little drede euery mortall man power ni ylike bladder full wind ywis needle point yblow may boaſt laid full low full wrongfully beganſt thou qd yet wrong thy perſeueraunce woſt thou mighty prince free haue thus commanded made ordinance euery chriſten wight ſhal haue penance chriſtendome withſey gone quite woll reney prince erren noble dooth qd tho cecile wood ſentence ye make u guilty ſooth ye knowen well innocence foraſmuch done reverence chriſt heare chriſten name ye put u crime eke blame well knowen thi • ke name ſo vertuous may withſey almachius anſwerd cheſe one theſe two doe ſacrifice chriſtendome reney thou mow eſca • en 〈◊〉 word holy blisful maid gan laugh iudge ſhe ſaid iudge confuſed 〈…〉 wolt thou reney innocene • make wicked wight qd ſhe lo diſſimuleth audience ſtareth woddeth adv •• ence almachius ſaid ſilly wretch thou woſt far might may ſtretch hath mighty prince 〈◊〉 power eke authorite make folke dien liuen ſpeakeſt thou ſo proudly ne ſpeake ſtedfaſtly qd ſhe proudely ſay ſide hate deadly thilke vice pride thou drede ſooth hear woll ſhewen openly right thou haſt made full great leſing thou ſaiſt thy prince han yeven thee might ſlee eke quite wight thou ne maiſt life bereve thou haſt none power ne leve thou maiſt ſay thy prince han thee maked miniſter death thou ſpeake mo thou lieſt thy power full naked way thy boldneſs ſaid almachius tho doe ſacrifice god ere thou go recke wrong thou proffer ſuffer philoſopher thilke wrong may endure thou ſpeakeſt god qd cecile anſwerd nice creature thou ſaidſt word ſithens thou ſpakeſt ne knew therewith thy nicete thou every manner wiſe leaud officer vaine iuſtice thee lacketh nothing thine utter eien thou nart blind thing yt ſeen ſtone men well may aſpien ilke ſtone god thou wolt call rede thee let thine hond upon fall taſt well ſtone thou ſhalt find sen yt thou ſeeſt thine eyen blind ſhame people ſhall ſcorne thee laugh thy follie commonly men wot well mighty god heaven hie theſe image well maiſt thou eſpie thee ne hemſelfe may profite effect worth mite theſe ſuch word ſaiden ſhe woxe wroth bad ſhe ſhould lede home houſe houſe qd br • n bathe flame rede bad right ſo done dede bathe gan faſt ſheten night day great fire beten long night eke day alſo fire eke bathe hete ſat cold felt wo made drop ſwete hath life ſhe mote lete almachie full wicked intent ſleen bathe ſonde ſent three ſtrokes necke ſmote tho turmentour manner chaunce might ſmite necke atwo yt time ordinaunce man doe perſon ſuch pennaunce fourth ſtroke ſmiten ſoft ſore turmentour durſt ſmite halfe dead necke ycorven left lie way went chriſten folke ſhetes home full faire hent three dayes lived ſhe turment never ceaſed faith teach ſhe foſtred hem ſhe gan preach hem ſhe yave moveables thing pope vrban betook hem tho ſaid asked heaven king reſpite three dayes mo recommaund ere go theſe ſoules might werch mine houſe perpetuelliche cherch saint vrban deacon priuely body fette buried night among ſaints honeſtly houſe church ſaint cecile hight saint vrban hallowed well might vnto day noble wiſe men done chriſt ſaints ſerviſe ¶the chanons yeoman prologue ended life ſaint cecile ere fully ridden five mile boughten vnder blee v gan take man clothed clothes blake vnder white ſurplice hackney pomely griſe ſweat wonder ſee ſeemed pricked mile three horſe eke yeoman rode vpon ſweateth vnneth might gone paytrell ſtood fome full hie fome flecked pie male twifolde croper lay ſemed carried little aray light ſommer rode worthy man heart wondren began till underſtood cloke ſewed hood long auiſed demed ſome chanon hat hing back lace ridden trot pace rode aye pricking wode clote lefe laid hode ſwette keep head fro ioy ſee ſwete forehead dropped ſtillutory full plantaine peritory come gan cry god ſave qd ioly company faſt pricked qd ſake becauſe would overtake riden mery company yoman eke full curteſie ſaid ſirs morow tide hoſtrie ſaw ride warned lord ſoveraine ridden full faine diſport loveth daliance friend thy warning god yeue thee good chance ſaid hoſt certaine would ſeeme thy lord wiſe ſo may well deme full ioconde alſo dare ſay ought tell mery tale twaie glad may companie ſir lord ye without lye mirth eke iolite inough alſo ſir truſteth ye knew ſo well doe ye would wonder well thriftely couth werke ſondry wiſe hath taken many great empriſe full harde bring lere homely rideth among ye knew wold prowe ye would forgon acquaintaunce mochell good dare lay balaunce haue poſſeſſion man high diſcreſſion warne well paſſing wiſe man well qd hoſte pray thee tell clerke non tell clerke nay greater clerke iwis said yoman word hoſte craft ſomwhat woll ſhew ſay lord ſuch ſubtelte craft ye may wete ſomewhat help yet werching ground riding till come canterbury towne could clene turnen vp downe paue ſiluer gold yoman thus itolde vnto hoſte ſaid benedicite thing wonder meruailous sen thy lord ſo hie prudence becauſe men ſhuld reuerence worſhip wreketh lite ouereſt ſloppe worthy mite effect ſo mote go baudy tore alſo thy lord ſo ſlothliche thee prey power better clothes bey deed acorde thy ſpeech tell thee beſeech qd yeman wherto aske ye god helpe ſo ſhall neuer ythe woll auowe ſay therefore keep ſecret pray wiſe fay beleeue ouerdone nill preue right clerkes ſaine vice wherfore hold leude nice man hath ouergreat wit full oft happeth miſuſen doth lord greeueth ſore god amend ſay thereof force good yeman qd hoſt sen conning thy lord thou woſt tell doth pray thee heartily sen ſo crafty ſo ſly dwellen ye tell subbarbs towne qd lurking hernes lane blind whereas theſe robber theues kind holden priuy fearefull reſidence dare ſhewen preſence fare ſhall ſay • othe yet qd hoſt let talke thee art thou ſo diſcoloured thy face peter qd god yeue harde grace ſo vſed hote fire blow hath chaunged colour trow wont mirrour prie ſwinke ſore lerne multiplie blondren euer poren fire failen deſire euer lacken concluſion much folke illuſion borow gold pound two ten twelue many ſummes mo make hem wenen leaſt way pound could maken tway yet falſe aye han good hope done grope ſcience ſo ferre v beforne mowe although ſworne ouertake ſlyt away ſo faſt wol v make beggers laſt while yeman thus taking chanon drew neere herd thing yeman ſpake ſuſpection mennes ſpech euer chanon cato ſaieth gilty demeth thing ſpoken iwis becauſe gan ſo nigh draw yeman herken ſawe thus ſaid vnto yeman tho hold thy peace ſpeake word mo thou thou ſhalt ſore abie thou ſlaundreſt companie eke diſcouereſt thou ſhouldeſt hide ye qd hoſt tell whatſoeuer betide threting recke thee mite faith qd lite chanon ſaw would yeman would tell priuite fled away ſorow ſhame qd yemon ſhall riſe game anon woll tell sen gon foule tende quell neuer hereafter woll mete peny ne pound behete brought firſt unto game er die ſorow haue ſhame erneſt faith fele well ſo man ſaith yet ſmert greue ſorow labour miſchiefe couth neuer leaue wiſe would god wit might ſuffice tellen longeth art natheleſſe yet woll tell part sen lord gon woll ſpare thing know woll declare ¶the thanons yeoman tale prieſt london covetous wiſe deceived chanon profeſſing art alchimy chanon dwelt ſeuen yere ſcience neuer nere haue loſt thereby god wot ſo hath many mo wont right freſh gay clothing eke good aray may weare hoſe vpon mine hedde colour freſh redde wanne leaden hew ſo vſeth ſore ſhall rue ſwinke yet blered mine eye lo auantage multiplie ſliding ſcience hath made ſo bare haue good yt euer fare yet amendetted ſo thereby gold haue borowed truly liue ſhall quite neuer let euery man beware euer maner man caſteth thereto continue hold thrift ido help god thereby ſhall neuer win empte purſe make wit thin madneſſe folie hath loſt good ieopardie exiteth men thereto leſe good himſelfe hath vnto ſhrewes ioy eſe haue felawes pain diſeſe thus lerned clerke yt charge woll ſpeak werke ſhall exerciſe eluiſh craft ſemen wonder wiſe termes ſo clergiall ſo quaint blow fire till hert faint ſhould tell eche proportion thing werchen vpon fiue ſixe ounce may well ſiluer ſome quantite beſie tellen name orpiment brent bone yron ſquames pouder grounden full ſmall earthen pot put ſalt iput alſo papere theſe pouders ſpeake wel icouered lampe glas much thing pottes glas engluting aire might paſſe nothing elle fire ſmart alſo made care wo matter ſubliming amalgaming calſening quicke ſiluer icleped mercurie crude flight cannot conclude orpiment ſublimed mercurie ground litarge eke porphirie theſe ounce certaine helpeth u labour vaine ne eke ſpirites aſſentioun ne matter lien fire adoun mowe werking nothing auaile loſt labour trauaile coſt twentie deuil way loſt alſo vpon lay alſo full many another thing craft appertaining though order hem ne rehearce becauſe leude man yet wol tellen hem come minde though ne ſet hem kinde bole armoniake verdegrece borace ſundry veſſels made earth glas vrinals diſcenſories viol croſſettes ſublimatories concurbites alembekes eke ſuch deare inough leke nedeth rehearce hem water • ubiſiyng bole gall arſneke ſal armoniake brimſtone herbes cold tell eke many one egremonie valerian lunarie ſuch liſt tarie lamp eke brenning night day bring abo •• craft may fournice eke calcination water albification vnſ • eked lime chalke gleire eye pounder diuers aſhes doung piſſe cleie sered pokettes ſalt peter vitriole diuers fire made wood cole sal tartre alcaly sal preparate combuſt matter coagulate cley made horſe dung man oile tartre alim glas berme wort argoile reſagor matter enbibing eke matter encorporing ſiluer citrination ſementing eke fermentation yngottes teſtes many thing mo woll tell taught alſo foure ſpirits body ſeuen order oft heard lord nemen firſt ſpirit quickeſiluer cleped ſecond orpiment third iwis sal armoniake fourth brimſtone body ſeuen eke lo hem anone sol gold luna ſiluer threpe mar yron mercurie quicke ſiluer clepe saturnus leade iupiter tinne venus coper father kinne curſed craft ſo woll exerciſe ſhall good haue may ſuffice good ſpendeth thereabout leſe ſhall thereof haue doubt ſo liſten vtter foly let come forth learne multiplie euery man hath ought cofer let appere wex philoſopher askaunce craft ſo light lere nay nay god wot monke frere prieſt chanon wight though ſit booke day night learning eluiſh nice lore vaine parde much lere leude man ſubtilte fie ſpeke thereof woll could lettcure could none effect ſhall finde one two ſaluation concluden multiplication iliche well haue ido ſaine failen two yet forgate much rehearſaile water coroſife limaile body mollification alſo induration oiles abluſions mettall fuſible tellen would paſſe bible wherefore beſt theſe name would reſt trow haue told ynow reiſe fiende looke neuer ſo row naie let philoſophers ſtone elixer cleped ſiken faſt echone ſiker inow vnto god heauen make auow craft han ido ſleight woll come v hath made v ſpenden much good ſorow almoſt waxen wood good hope creepeth hart suppoſing euer though ſore ſmart relieued afterward suppoſing hope ſharpe hard warne well ſiken euer future temp hath made men diſceuer truſt thereof euer yet arte could waxe ſad vnto hem bitter ſweet ſeemeth ne ſheet yt might wrappen hem night bratte towalken day light would hem ſell ſpend craft conne ſtint till nothing ilaft euermore euer gone men may hem ken ſmell brimſtone world ſtinken gote ſauour ſo rammiſh ſo hote though man mile hem ſauour woll infect truſteth lo thus ſmelling thredbare array men liſt folke know may man woll aske priuely clothed ſo unthriftily right anon woll rowne ere ſaien aſpied men woll hem ſlea becauſe ſcience lo thus theſe folke betraien innocence paſſe ouer go tale unto er potte fire ido mettals certaine quantite lord hem tempereth man gon dare ſay boldly men ſain doen craftly algate wote well hath ſuch name yet full oft renneth blame wote ye full oft happeth ſo pot breaketh farewell go theſe mettales beene ſo great violence walles may make hem reſiſtence wrought lime ſtone percen ſo throgh wall gone ſome hem ſinken ground thus loſt time many pound ſome ſcattered flore lepen roofe withouten doubt tho yt fende ſight ſhew trow u like ſhrew hell lord fire ne wo ne angre ne ire yt pot broke ſaied euery man chite holte evill apuied ſaied long fire making ſaied naie blowing ferde mine office straw qd third ye leude nice tempred ought nay qd fourth ſtint herken becauſe fire made bech cauſe none ſo theche tell whereon along well wot great ſtrife v among qd lord ni doen theſe peril woll beware eftſone right ſiker pot craſed may ye amaſed uſage let ſwepe floore ſwithe plucke vp heart glad blithe mullocke heape iſwept floore yeaſt canuas mullocke siue ithrow ſifted plucked many throwe parde qd one ſomewhat metall yet though tho thing miſhapped hath another time may well inow mote put good auenture marchant parde may aie endure truſteth well proſperitee sometime good drowned ſee ſometime cometh ſafe unto lond peace qd lord ye next time woll fond bring craft another plite doe ſirs let wite default ſomewhat wel wote another ſaid fire ouer hote hote cold dare ſay concluden euer amis failen would haue madneſſe evermore raue together everychone every man ſeemeth wiſe salomon thing yt ſhineth gold gold haue heard told ne euery apple faire eie ni good ſo men clap crie right ſo lo fareth emong v ſeemeth wiſeſt ieſus moſt foole commeth ye prefe ſeemeth trueſt thefe ſhal ye know er yt ye wende tale haue made ende chanon religioun emongs v would enfect town though great niniue rome aliſaundre troie three ſleight infinite falſeneſſe couth man written geſſe though might liue thouſand yere world falſeneſſe ni pere termes woll ſo wind ſpeake word ſo ſlie kind comune ſhall wight woll make dote anon right fiende himſelfe full many man hath begiled er mo woll may liue yet men riden gone full many mile ſeeke haue acquaintance knowing falſe gouernance ye luſt giue audience woll tellen preſence worſhipfull chanons religious ne demeth ſlander houſe although tale chanon euery order ſome ſhrew parde god forbid company rue ſingular man folly ſlander mine entent correct amiſſe ment tale onely told eke mo ye wote well emong chriſtes apoſtles twelue traitour iudas himſelue ſhould ye remnant haue blame guiltleſſe ſay ſame saue onely ye woll hearken iudas couent remeueth betime rede ſhame loſſe may cauſen drede nothing diſpleaſed pray caſe herketh ſay london prieſt annuellere therein dwelt many yere ſo pleaſant ſo ſeruiſable vnto wife table ſhe would ſuffer nothing pay borde ne clothing went never ſo gay ſpending ſiluer right ynow thereof force woll proceed tell forth tale chanon brought prieſt confuſion falſe chanon came vpon day vnto prieſts chamber lay beſeeching lene certain gold would quite ayen leneth marke qd dayes three day woll quite thee ſo thou finde falſe another day hang halſe prieſt took marke ſwith chanon oft thanked ſith took leue went foorth wey third day brought money prieſt took gold ayen whereof prieſt full glad fain certes qd nothing anoieth lene man noble two three thing poſſeſſion ſo true condition wiſe break woll day ſuch man never ſay nay qd chanon ſhould vntrue nay thing fallen new trouth thing woll euer kepe vnto day ſhall crepe graue elſe god forbede beleueth ſiker crede god thanke good time ſaied na neuer man yet euill apayed gold ne ſiluer lent ne neuer falſhede mine hert ment ſir qd priuite sen ye ſo goodliche haue kith ſo great gentleneſſe somwhat quite kindneſſe woll ſhew ye woll lere ſhall ſhew anon right werche philoſophy take good heed ye ſhall ſee eye woll maiſtrie go ye ſir qd prieſt woll ye ſo mary thereof pray heartily commaundement ſir truly qd chanon elſe god forbede lo theefe couth ſeruice bede full ſoth ſuch profered ſervice stinketh witneſſeth old wiſe full ſoone woll verefie chanon root trecherie evermore delight hath gladneſſe fendly thought hert empreſſe chriſts people may miſchief bring god keep u falſe diſſimuling wiſt prieſt yt delt ne harme comming nothing felt ſely prieſt ſely innocent couetiſe anon thou ſhalt blent graceleſſe full blind thy conceite nothing art thou ware diſceite foxe hath ſhapen thee wily wrench thou maieſt flee wherfore go concluſion referreth thy confuſion vnhappy man anon woll hie tyll thine unwitte thy folie eke falſeneſſe wretch ferforth conning woll ſtretch chanon lord ye wold wene sir hoſt faith heaven queene another chanon hundred fold ſubtilte hath betraied folke many time falſeneſſe doleth rime ever ſpeke falſhede ſhame cheekes waxen rede algates beginnen glow redneſſe none right well know viſage fume diuerce mettals ye haue heard reherce conſumed waſhed hath redneſſe take hede chanons curſedneſſe sir qd prieſt let man gone quickſiluer anone let bring ounce two three commeth faſt ſhul ſee wonder thing ye ſaw neuer er sir qd prieſt ſhall done iwis ſeruant fetch thing ready bidding went forth came anon quickſiluer ſhortly ſain took theſe vnces three chanoun hem laid well faire adown add ſeruant cole bring anon might go werking cole right anon ifet chanon tooke croſſelet boſome ſhewed prieſt inſtrument qd yt thou ſeeſt take thy hond put thy ſelfe therein quickſilver vnce begin name chriſt wex philoſopher full would profer ſhew hem ſo much ſcience ſhul ye ſee experience quickſiluer woll mortifie right ſight anon withouten lie make good ſiluer fine purſe mine el make malliable el hold falſe vnſtable emonges folke euer appeare haue pouder coſt deare shall make good cauſe cunning ſhew ſhall voideth man let thereout ſhet doore while priuitie man v eſpie while werken philoſophie fulfilled dede like ſeruant anon yede maiſter ſhet
