make couch ſilke let ſee mouſe go wall anon ſhe weiueth fleſh couch euery deintie hous appetite hath ſhe eat mous lo hath luſt domination appetite flemeth diſcretion ſhee wolfe hath alſo ſo villanous kind leudeſt wolfe euer ſhe may find leaſt reputation ſhe woll take time luſt haue make theſe enſamples ſpeake thoſe men vntrue nothing woman men haue euer licorous appetite lower thing performe delite wiues neuer ſo faire ne neuer ſo true ne ſo debonaire fleſh ſo newfangle miſchaunce ne con nothing haue pleaſaunce ſouneth vnto vertue phebus thought gile diſceiued iolite vnder another ſhe man little reputation nought worth phebus compariſon harme happeth oft ſo commeth much harme wo ſo befell phebus abſent wife anon hath lemman ſent lemman certes knauiſh ſpeech foryeue beſeech wiſe plato ſaieth ye mow rede word muſt need accord ye dede men ſhould tell properly thing word muſt couſin working boiſtous man right thus ſay little difference truely betwixt wife high degree body diſhoneſt ſhe poore wench ſo werke amis gentill eſtate aboue ſhal called lady love tother poore woman ſhal called wench lemman god wote mine owne dere brother men lay low one right ſo betwixt titleleſſe tiraunt outlaw theefe erraunt ſame ſay difference alexander told ſentence tyrant greater might force meine ſlea doune right bren houſe home make plain lo therfore called captain outlaw hath ſmale meine maie doe ſo great harme ne bring countrey ſo great miſchiefe men callen outlawe thiefe man textuele woll tell textes neuer dele woll goe tale began phebus wife ſent lemman anon wrought luſt volage white crowe yt hing aie cage beheld werke ſaied neuer word home come phebus lord crowe ſong cuckow cuckow cuckow bird qd phebus wt ſingeſt thou thou wont ſo merily ſing hart reioyſing heare thy voice ala ſong god qd ſing amis phebus qd thy worthineſſe thy beaute thy gentilneſſe thy ſong thy minſtralcie thy waiting blered thine iye one little reputation worth thee compariſon mountenance gnat ſo mote thriue bedde thy wife ſaw ſwiue wol ye crow anon told full ſad token word bold wife doen lecherie great ſhame great villanie told eft ſawe iyen phebus gan awayward wryen thought wofull hart braſt two bowe bent ſet therein flo ire hath wife ſlain effect ſain ſorrow whereof brake minſtralſie harp lute getern sautrie eke brake arrowes bowe thus ſpake crowe traitour qd tong scorpion thou haſt brought confuſion ala wrought nere dedde dere wife gemme luſtie hedde ſo ſad eke ſo true lyeſt thou dedde face pale hewe full giltleſſe durſt ſweare iwis rakell hond ſo foule amis troubled wit yre retcheleſſe vnauiſed ſmiteſt guiltleſſe wantruſt full falſe ſuſpection thy wit thy diſcretion oh euerie man beware rekilneſſe ne trowe nothing without ſtrong witneſſe smite ſone er thou wete auiſed well ſikerly ye doe execution vpon yre ſuſpection ala thouſand folke hath rekell ire fully fordoen brought hem mire ala ſorowe woll ſelfe ſle crowe falſe thefe ſaid woll thee quite anon thy falſe tale thou ſong whilom nitingale ſhalt thou falſe thefe thy ſong forgone eke thy white fethers euerychone ne neuer thy life ſhalt thou ſpeake thus ſhull men traitour wreake thou thine ofſpring euer ſhall blake ne neuer ſweet noiſe ſhall ye make euer crie ayenſt tempeſt raine token thee wife ſlaine crow ſtert anon pulled white fethers euerychon made black reft ſong eke ſpeech doore ſlong vnto deuill betake cauſe crowes blake lordings enſample wol pray beware take kepe ſay ne telleth neuer man life another man hath dight wife woll hate mortally certain dan salomon wiſe clerkes ſain teacheth man keepe tong well ſaied textuell natheleſſe thus taught dame ſonne thinke crowe god name ſonne kepe wel thy tong kepe thy frend wicked tong worſe fend ſonne fende men may hem bleſſe ſonne god endleſſe goodneſſe walled tong teeth lippes eke man ſhould auiſe ſpeke ſonne full oft mikell ſpeach hath many man ſpilt clerkes teach little ſpeech ſpoken auiſedly man ſhent ſpeake generally ſonne thy tong ſhouldeſt thou reſtrain time thou doeſt thy pain ſpeake god honour prayere firſt vertue ſonne thou wolt lere reſtrain kepe well thy tong thus learne child yong ſonne mikell ſpeaking vnauiſed leſſe ſpeaking inough ſuffiſed cometh mikell harme thus taught much ſpeech ſinne wanteth naught woſte thou wherefore rakell tong ſerueth right ſword forcutteth forkerueth arme two dere ſonne right ſo tongue cutteth friendſhip atwo iangler god abhominable rede salomon ſo wiſe honourable rede david pſalmes rede seneck ſonne ſpeake ne thy head beck diſſimule thou deafe yt thou janglour ſpeaketh perlous mattere flemming ſaieth learn thou leſt little jangling cauſeth much reſt ſonne thou wicked word haſt ſaid thee dare drede bewraid hath miſſaied dare well ſaine may way clepe word againe thing ſaied ſayed forth goth though repent never ſo loth thrall hath ſaied tale evill apaied ſonne beware none authour new tidings whether fals trew ſo thou come among high low keepe well thy tong thinke crow ¶the plowman prologue plowman plucked plowe midſummer moone comen ſayed beaſtes ſhould eat ynowe lieg graſſe chin feeble oxe cowe hem ni left bone skin ſhoke ſhere coulter drowe honged harneis pin tooke tabard ſtaffe eke head ſet hat ſaied would ſaint thomas ſeeke pilgrimage goth forth plat ſcrippe bare bread leekes forſwonke forſwat men might ſeene chekes euery wang tooth ſat hoſte beheld well ſaw man sonne ybrent knew well ſenged ſnout clothes rent man wont walke alway cloyſter ypent could religiouſliche lout therefore fully ſhent hoſte asked man art thou sir quoth hine wont goe plow earne meat ere dine ſwette ſwinke make auow wife child therewith find ſerve god wiſt leaud men full blind clerkes ſay ſhullen faine livelod ſwette ſwinke right nought v giue againe neither eat ne yet drinke mowe law ſaine v curſe damne hell brinke thus putten u paine candle queint bell clinke make u thrals luſt ſaine mow el ſaued haue corne duſt ſpeaks thereagaine ſay raued man qd hoſt canſt thou preach come neere tell u ſome holy thing sir quoth heard one teach prieſt pulpit good preaching say quoth hoſt thee beſeech sir ready bidding pray man reproch tale telling ¶the plowman tale complaint againſt pride covetouſneſs clergy made doubt chaucer reſt tale ſeen written hand john stowe library book ſuch antiquity ſeemeth written near chaucer time asterne ſtrife ſtirred newe many ſteedes ſtound ſundry ſeeds ſewe ſeemeth ſome unſound ſome great growne ground ſoukle ſimple ſmall whether hem falſer found falſer foule mote befall one ſide tell pope cardinal prelate parſons monkes freres fell priours abbot great eſtates heauen hell keep yates peter ſucceſſours deemed old date falſhed foule mote befall ſide ben poore pale people put preaſe ſeeme caitiues ſore cale euer one without encreaſe icleped lollers londleſe toteth hem ben vntall ben araied peace falſhed foule mote befall many countrey ſought know falſer theſe two euer travaile nought ſo ferre go wandred wro wood beſide wall two foules ſaw ſitten tho falſer foule mote befall one plete pope ſide griffon grimme ſtature pellicane withouten pride theſe lollers laied lure muſed matter meaſure counſaile chriſt ever gan call griffon ſhewed ſharpe fuyre falſhed foule mote befall pellicane began preach mercie meekeneſſe ſaied chriſt ſo gan u teach meeke merciable gan bleſſe euangely beareth witneſſe lambe likeneth chriſt ouer tokening meekeſt sith pride heauen fall ſo ſhould euery chriſtened prieſtes peter ſucceſſours beth lowliche low degree vſen none earthly honour neither croune ne curious couetours ne pillour ne proud pall ne nought cofren vp great treaſours falſhed foule mote befall prieſtes ſhould cattell plede chaſten hem charite ne battaile ſhould men lede inhaunſing owne degree nat wilne firting high ſee ne ſoueraignty hous ne hall wordly worſhip defie flee willeth highnes foule ſhal fall ala may ſuch ſaints call wilneth welde earthly honour low lucifere ſuch ſhal fall balefull blackneſſe builden boure eggeth people errour maketh hem thrall chriſt hold ſuch one traitour low lucifer ſuch one ſhall fall willeth king peeres higher emperour ſome poore freres wollen waxe warriour god gouernour holdeth man permagall couetiſe counſailour ſuch falſhed mote need fall high horſe willeth ride glitterande gold great array ipainted portred pride common knight may go ſo gay chaunge clothing euery day golden girdle great ſmall boiſtous beare bay ſuch falſhed mote need fall pride puniſheth poore ſome ſuſtaine ſale holy church make hore filleth wombe wine ale money fill many male chaffren church fall telleth people leaud tale falſe faitours foule hem befall chaunge many manner meates ſong ſolas ſitting long filleth wombe faſt fretes meat gong meat harpe ſong ech man mote hem lord call hote ſpices euer among falſe faitours foule hem fall miter mo one two ipearled queenes head ſtaffe gold perrie lo heauie made lead cloth gold new redde glitterande gold greene gall dome damne men dedde ſuch faitours foule hem fall chriſts people proudly curſe broad boke braying bell put penny purſe wol fell heauen hell ſentence thou wilt dwell willen geſſe gay hall thou ſooth hem tell great curſing ſhalt thou fall bleſſed bleſſe curſed curſe woll thus people oppreſſe haue lordſhips full many marchaunts wull purſe penny woll come thrall poore people pull falſe faitours foule hem fall lord alſo mote hem loute obeyſaunt brode bleſſing riden royall route courſer king ſaddle gold glittering curious harneſs quaintly crall stirrops gay gold maſtling ſuch falſhed foule befall chriſtes miniſters clepen beene rulen robberie antichriſt ſeruen clene attired tyrannie witneſſe iohns prophecie antichriſt admirall tiffelers attired trecherie ſuch faitours foule hem fall ſaith ſome hem may ſinne ſhall dome ded hem woll gladly winne ayenſt god forbed holieſt clepen head rule regall ala euer eaten bread ſuch falſhed wol foule fall head loueth honour worſhiped word dede king mote hem kneele coure apoſtles chriſt forbede pope heſtes ſuch taketh hede keepe chriſts commaundement gold ſilver mote wede holdeth hole omnipotent ordaineth ordinaunce pariſh prieſtes powere another greater auaunce greater point miſtere higheſt earth reſerves many point chriſt hath pere reſerves neither pin ne point ſeemeth chriſt nothing ſitteth ſtall damneth ſaveth thinke pride tofore god doth ſtinke angel iohn kneele onely god doe bowing willers worſhip muſt need evil feele ne clepen chriſt ſanctus deus clepen head sanctiſſimus ſuch ſect ſewis trowe taken hem amiſſe earth bliſſe high maiſter beliall chriſtes people hem wiſſe ſuch falſe foule fall mowe binde loſe holy life ſave damne mow choſe betweene hem great ſtrife many man killed knife wete hem haue lordſhip ſhall ſuch chriſt ſuffred wound five ſuch falſhed foule fall chriſt ſaid qui gladio percutit ſwerd ſurely ſhall die prieſts peace grith bad hem drede die bad ſimple ſlie carke cattell truſteth god ſitteth hie falſe ſhall full foule fall theſe wollen make men ſwere ayenſt chriſtes commaundement chriſtes member tere roode new yrent lawes maken common aſſent one throweth ball thus poore fully ſhent euer falſhed foule befall vſen ſimonie ſellen church priory ne uſen enuie curſen hem contrary hireth men day yeares ſtrength hold hem ſtall culleth adverſaries therefore falſhed foule thou fall purſe purchaſe perſonage purſe paynen hem plede men warre woll wage bring enemy dede lord liues woll lede much take giue ſmall ſo get ſhall ſhede make ſuch falſe right foule fall halow nothing hire church ne font ne veſtement make order every ſhire prieſtes pay parchment riotours taken rent therewith ſmere ſhepes skall many church ben oft ſuſpent ſuch falſhed foule fall liueth lecherie haunt wench widowes wiues puniſheth poore putree ſelfe vſeth liues man ſhrives heuen come neuer ſhall ſhall curſed caitiues hell ſaine ſhall fall mercy maximien nero neuer good ſome hath furred hood follow chriſt ſhed blood heauen buckette wall wretch ben worſe wood ſuch faitours foule hem fall give almes riche mainteynours men lawe lord well liche harlot ſonne worth hawe sothfaſtneſſe ſuch han ſlawe kembe crokettes chriſtall drede god haue doun drawe ſuch faitours foule hem fall maken parſons penny canon cardinal vnnethes amonges hem ne hath gloſed goſpell fals chriſt made never cathedral ne cardinall redde hatte vſen minſtrals falſhede foule mote befall tithing offering clemeth poſſeſſion thereof nill none forgo robben men raunſome tithing turpe lucrum theſe maiſters vrniall tithing brybry larſon make falſhood full foule fall taken ferme ſompnours harme people may pardoner falſe faitours sell ſeales dare well ſay holden great aray multiply hem metall drede full little dome day ſuch falſhed ſhall foule fall harlottes ſhul men diſclaunder ſhullen maken hem gree ben proude alexander ſaine poore woe ye yere eche prieſt ſhal pay fee encreaſe lemmans call heerdes ſhul wel iuel thee al ſuch falſe ſhul foule fall man falſely famed wol make purgatioun woll officer agramed aſſigne fro toune toun need muſt pay raunſome though clene chriſtall abſolution al ſuch falſe ſhull foule fall though giltie dede may money paie al purſe wol blede may vſe fro day day biſhops officer gone ful gay game vſen ouer poore pill pray al ſuch falſe ſhull foule fall ala god ordained never ſuch lawe ne ſuch craft couetiſe forbad ſawe gouernours mowen god agriſe al rule right wiſe theſe new point ben papall god law diſpiſe ſuch faitours ſhull foule fall ſaine peter key heuen hel haue hold trowe peter tooke money ſinnes ſold ſucceſſours ben bold winning al wit wral conſcience waxen cold al ſuch faitours foule hem fal peter never ſo great fole leaue key ſuch lorell take ſuch curſed tole adviſed nothing well trowe key hell maiſter place marſhall dreſſen hem dwell falſe lucifer fall proud lucifarre angry enuious good faith ben ful farre couetiſe ben curious catch cattle couetous hound hunger woll yall vngodly vngracious needly ſuch falſhed ſhall foule fall pope peter heire thinke erreth caſe choſe biſhops deſpaire choſen hem diuers place lord ſhall write grace clerke anone pray ſhall ſhall ſpeed purchaſe ſuch falſe foule hem fall though good lord prayer ſhall ſped though wild wood underſtanding men han red leud boſter god forbed good biſhop horſe ball pope foule beſted laſt woll foule fall maketh biſhops earthly thanke nothing chriſts ſake full fat ranke ſoule heale none heed take well done whateuer make ſhall anſwere one world thanke ſuch worch wake ſuch falſe ſhall foule fall cannot ſay crede prayer ſhall made prelate nother goſpell rede ſhull weld high eſtates high god friendſhip hem make toteth ſumme totall bere keyes hell yates ſuch falſe ſhall foule fall forſake chriſtes loue travaile hunger thirſt cold ben ordred ouer aboue youth till ben old dore go fold helpe ſheepe nought trauall hired men ſuch hold ſuch falſe foule hem fall chriſt king woll forſake know nought pouerte chriſts loue woll wake drinke piement ale aparte god ſeeme nothing aferd luſty liueth lamual driuen ſheepe deſert ſuch faitours ſhul foule fal chriſt hath xii apoſtles ſay may one may erre manere leueth ben loſt echone peter erred ſo ihon cleped principal chriſt cleped peter himſelfe y• ſtone falſe faitours foule hem fall curſen croiſery chriſts chriſten creature betweene hem enuy enhaunſed honour chriſten liuers labour leuin man mortal death diſhonours al ſuch falſe foule hem fal knoweth tillour plow pope name hate crede ſuffiſeth inow knoweth cardinall hatte thus poore vnrightly latte knoweth chriſt god royal matter worth gnatte ſuch falſe faitours foule hem fal king ſhall kneele kiſſe ſhow chriſt ſuffered ſinful kiſſe fete thinketh holdeth high ynow lucifer high ſet one thinketh himſelfe foryet either trouth cal chriſt ſuffered wound wete shal make ſuch falſhed foule fal laieth large nettes take ſiluer gold fillen coffer ſackes fettes ſoules catch ſhold ſeruants vnhold doublin rentall bigge hem caſtles bigge hem hold ſuch falſe foule hem fall ¶here endeth firſt part tale ſecond part followeth accorde worde fall engliſh finde shewe another ſhall haue much ſay behinde prieſts han people pinde curteis chriſt hath kende put matter minde make theſe manner men amend shortly ſhend hem ſhew wrongfully werch walke high god nothing tell ne god word tilleth many balke hernes hold hem halke prechen tithe offrend vntruly goſpel talke mercy god amend antichriſt ſay euen chriſts aduerſarie hath ben many day chriſts bidding ful contrarie truth cleane vary way ben wend chriſts people vntruly carry god pitie amend liuen contrary chriſts life high pride againſt meekeneſſe againſt ſuffraunce vſen ſtrife anger ayenſt ſoberneſſe againſt wisdome wilfulneſſe chriſts tale little tend againſt meaſure outrageouſneſſe god wol may amend lordly life ayenſt lowlineſſe demin al without mercie couetiſe ayenſt largeſſe againſt treweth trecherie againſt almeſſe enuie againſt chriſt comprehend chaſtitie maintaine lecherie god grace amend againſt pennaunce vſe delight againſt ſuffraunce ſtrong defence ayenſt god vſen euil right ayenſt pitie puniſhments open euil ayenſt continence wicked winning worſe diſpend soberneſſe ſette diſpence god goodneſſe amend claimen wholly powere wranglen ayenſt al heſts liuing folow nothing liuen worſe witleſſe beeſts fiſh fleſh louen feeſts lord ben brode ykend god poore haten geſts god mercy amend diues ſuch ſhal haue dome ſaine chriſtes friendes nothing ſhould done ſuch falſer ben fiend people ley ſuch bendes god earth han offend succour fro ſuch chriſt ſend v mercy amend token antichriſt careckes ben wide iknow receiued preach ſhall man without token trow ech chriſten prieſt preachen owe god aboue ben ſend god word al folke ſhow sinful man amend chriſt ſent poore preach royall rich ſo dare poore people teach antichriſt ouer foe among people mote go hath bidden ſuch ſuſpend hath hent thinketh yet mo al god may wel amend han world forſake liuen lowly god bad priſon ſhullen take betin bounden forth lad hereof rede man drad chriſt ſaid ſhould ſhend ech man ought hereof glad god ful wel woll amend take hem royall powere ſay haue ſwerds two one curſe hel one ſlee men taking chriſt mo yet peter one tho chriſt peter ſmite gan defend ſheath bad put tho ſuch miſcheues god amend chriſt bad peter keepe ſheepe ſword forbade ſmite swerd toole ſheepe keepe ſhepheards ſheepe woll bite thinketh ſuch ſhepheards ben wite ayen ſheepe ſwerde contend driue ſheepe great deſpite god may well amend ſucceſſours peter noght chriſt made cheefe paſture ſwerd ſhepheard vſen ought would flea butchoure ſo peter ſucceſſoure bere ſhepe til back bend ſhaddow hem euery ſhoure al god may wel amend succeſſours peter ben theſe peter chriſt forſooke leuer loue god leſe ſhepheard leſe hooke culleth ſheepe doth cooke hem ſeeken woll rend falſely gloſe goſpell booke god mercy amend chriſt take peter kay chriſt ſaid muſt die man peter chriſt gan withſay chriſt bad go behind sathan counſailours many theſe men han world wele god offend peter ſucceſſours ben al ſuch god may wele amend sathan ſay contrary chriſt learne peter lore ſewen miſſe follow peter forſooth chriſt would peter reprehend longeth heuen bliſſe god mercy hem amend apoſtles ſewen caſe ought vnderſtond betrayed chriſt iudas bare purſe euery lond al might ſet hond hidde ſtale miſpend rule theſe traitours han hond almightie god hem amend laſt lord gan tray curſedly falſe couetiſe would theſe traine money wiſten wiſe ſeker ſelfe enſiſe ſoothneſſe ben friend couetiſe chaungen queintiſe almighty god ſuch amend chriſt earth eftſoone theſe would damne die heſtes han fordone ſaine ſawes ben hereſie ayenſt commaundements crie damne brend liketh hem ſuch loſengerie god almighty hem amend theſe han might england hath king lawe han purchaſed hem ſuch powere taken hem liſt knawe ſay hereſie ſawe ſo priſon wol hem ſend ſo elder dawe god mercy amend king law wol man deme angerliche without anſwere man theſe miſqueme ſhall baighteth bere yet wel worſe wol tere priſon woll pende giues gere god woll may amend king taxeth men aſſent comminalte theſe ech yeare woll raunſome hem maiſterfully doth ſeales yeare better king extend officer han greater fee miſcheefe god amend ſo woll pruve teſtament worth tenne pound ſhall pay parchement third money round thus people raunſound ſay ſuch part hem ſhould apend gripen goeth ground god mercy amend ſimple fornication twenty ſhillings ſhall pay haue abſolution al yere vſen forth may thus letten hem go aſtray recke though ſoule brend theſe keepen euill peter kay ſuch ſhepheards god amend wonder parliament lord lond taken ſo little entent helpe people hond ben harder bond worſe beat bitter brend king vnderſtond god helpe amend biſhops religion lordſhippes poſſeſſions lordes ſemeth maketh hem leſe charite mowe god attende earth haue ſo high degre god mercie amende emperour yafe pope ſomtime high lordeſhip laſt ſilly kime proude pope put realme dout lordes beware defende theſe folkes wonder ſtout king lordes amende thus endeth ſecond part tale hereafter followeth third moyſes lawe forbode tho prieſtes ſhould lordſhips welde chriſtes goſpell biddeth alſo ſhould lordſhippes held ne chriſtes apoſtles neuer ſo bold ſuch lordſhippes hem enbrace ſmeren ſhepe kepe fold god amend hem grace ne ben conterfete men may know hem fruite greatneſſe maketh hem god foryete take mekeneſſe diſpite wer pore lite nold demen face nouriſh ſhepe hem bite god amend grace griffon canſt thou preach ayenſt chanons men clepen ſeculere peli ben curate many tounes earth haue great powere haue great prebendes dere two three ſome mo perſonage ben playing fere yet ſerue king alſo let ferme fare woll moſt giue therefore woll ſpend ſome woll ſpare ſome woll lay vp ſtore cure ſoule care fore mowe much money take whether ſoules wonne lore profites woll forſake gadering procuratour poore people enplede robben hem rauinour lord money lede catch quicke eke dede richen lord eke robbe giue good rede olde yonge hole ſicke therewith purchaſe hem lay fee londe hem liketh beſt builde alſo brode cite eaſt eke weſt purchaſe thus ben full preſt poore woll nought ſpende ne good giue goddes geſt ne ſende ſome hath ſende ſeruice ſuch woll liue truſſe treaſure though pariſh die vnſhriue woll nat giue roſe floure life ſhould mirrour lered leude alſo teach people lele labour soche miſter men miſgo hard nigges ſome hem proude gaie ſpende goodes vpon gigges finden hem great araie ala thinke theſe men ſaie thus diſpenden goddes good dreadfull dome daie soche wreches ſhull worſe wood church neuer ne ſie ne neuer pennie thider ne ſend though poore pariſhens hunger die pennie hem woll ſpend haue receiuing rent recke neuer remenaunt ala deuill hath cleane hem blent soche one ſathanas ſoiournaunt vſen horedome harlottrie couetiſe pompe pride slothe wrath eke enuie ſewen ſinne euerie ſide ala thinke ſuch tabide woll accomptes yelde high god mowe hem hide soche willers witte worth nelde ben ſo rooted richeſſes chriſtes pouert foryet serued ſo many meſſes hem thinketh munna mea • ▪ good mowen geat wene liue euermore god dome ſeat treſure feble ſtore vnneth mote matins ſaie counting courtholding yet iangleth iaie vnderſtont himſelfe nothing woll ſerve erle king finding fee hide tithing offring feble charite proude couetous hard hungrie ben liberall lecherous el medlers marchandry mainteiners men maſtry ſtewardes countours pleadours ſerue god ypocriſie soch prieſts chriſtes falſe traitours falſe vengeable begilen men chriſts name vnſtedfaſt vnſtable traie lord hem thinketh ſhame ſerue god full lame god theeues falſely ſteale falſely god worde defame winning worldes weale antichriſt theſe ſerue praie thee may ſay naie antichriſt ſoch ſhull fall followen deede faie ſeruen rich arraie ſerue chriſt ſuch falſely fain dreadfull dome day shull folowe paine knowen hem ſelfe doen ill ayenſt chriſtes commaundement amend hem neuer ne ſerue ſathan one aſſent ſaieth ſothe ſhall ſhent ſpeaketh ayenſt falſe liuing ſo well liueth ſhall brent ſoch greater king pope biſhops cardinal chanons parſons vicare goddes ſeruice trowe fals sacrament ſellen proude lucifere eche man looke whether lie ſo ſpeketh ayenſt powere ſhall holden hereſie loke many order take onely chriſt ſeruice worldes goodes forſake ſo taketh order otherwiſe trow ſhall ſore agriſe gloſe conne ſewen 〈◊〉 euill time thus begonne loke many emong hem holden hie waie antichriſt ſhullen fall wullen god betraie god amende beſt maie many men maken ſhende weten well ſothe ſay deuill hath foule hem blende church dwell apparailled poorely proude port ſeuen ſacraments doen ſell cattell catching comfort ech matter wollen mell doen hem wrong diſport afraie people fell hold hem lower doeth lord tithing ducke apple aie make men ſwere vpon boke thus foulen chriſtes faie soche bearen euill heauen kaie mowen aſſoile mowe ſhriue mennes wiues ſtrongly plaie true tiller ſturte ſtriue wraſtling wake chiefe chauntours nale market beater medling make hoppen houten heue hale faire freſh wine ſtale dine drinke make debate ſeuen ſacraments ſet ſaile kepe ſoche kaies heauen gate mennes wiues wollen hold though right ſorye ſpeake ſhull ſo bold ſompning conſiſtorye make hem ſaie mouth lie though ſawe iye lemman holden openly man ſo hardy aske woll haue tithing offring maugre whoſoeuer grutch twiſe day woll ſing goddes prieſtes nere none ſoche mote hunting dogge bitch blowen horne crien hey ſorcerie vſen witch soche kepen euill peter key yet mote haue ſome ſtocke ſtone gaily painted proudly dight maken men leuen vpon ſaie full might ſuch men ſet vp great light ſoche ſtockes ſhull ſtande thereby darke midnight • e make maſtrie leud people ſee mow thou mary thou worcheſt wonder thing men offren hongen broches ouches ring prieſt purchaſeth offering nill offer none image woe ſoule ſings preacheth ſoche pilgrimage men woman poore chriſtes owne likeneſſe men ſhullen offer doore ſuffer hunger diſtreſſe ſoche image offer leſſe mow feele thurſt ne cold poore ſpirite gan chriſt bleſſe therefore offreth feble old buckler brode ſweardes long baudrike baſelardes kene soche tole necke hong antichriſt ſoche prieſtes vpon deedes well ſeen whome ſerven honouren antichriſtes clene goddes goodes falſely devouren ſcarlet grene gaie gounes mote ſhape newe clippen kiſſen counten tounes damoſeles daunce ſewe cutted clothes ſhewe hewe long pike ſhone goddes goſpell true either ſerven devill none prieſtes poke ſo wide men muſt enlarge veſtiment holy goſpell doen hide contrarien raiment soche prieſtes lucifer ſent like conquerours araied proude pendaunts ar ipent falſely truth han betraied shrift ſilver ſoche wollen aske woll men crepe crouche none sacrament ſave aske without mede ſhall man touch biſhop warant vouch lawe decre mede money thus mouch ſain charite middes maſſe nill man hire full ſhortly let forth paſſe ſhull men find ſhire perſonages profite deſire live liking luſts dare ſaine sans oſe ie dire ſuch antichriſts prieſts yef biſhops mote ſervice holden forth harlottry prelate feeble empriſe god graine ſuch men agriſe ſuch matter taken mede excuſe hem wiſe thinketh ought greatly drede ſ • ine man longeth reprove though erre falſely goddes goodes fongeth therewith meintein wo warre deedes ſhould bright ſterre living leud mannes • ight ſay pope may erre nede muſt paſſe mannes might though prieſt lye lemman night tellen felowe goth maſſe anon right ſaieth ſingeth ſinne birde abideth inne dighteth diner meane ſingeth maſſe would winne ſo weneth god begile hem thinketh long till met uſen forth yere emong folke whan ſet holdeth man halfe pere biſhop hath powere ſoile men el lore abſolution may skere wo ſoule ſingeth griffon began threte ſaied monkes canſt thou ought pellican ſaid full grete world much wo hath wrought saint benet order brought ne made hem neuer ſuch mannere trowe came never thought ſhould uſe ſo great powere man ſhould monke lord call ne ſerve knee king proud prince pall meat drinke thing wearen mitre ring double worſted well ydight royall meat rich drinke rideth courſer knight hauke hound eke brooch ouches hood ſay maſſe weeke deinties moſt food lordſhips bondman royall religion saint benet made never none hem lordſhip man ne toun ben queint curious fine cloth clad ſerved cleane proud angrie envious mallice much meane catching craftie covetous lordly liven great liking living religious according benet living ben clerkes court overſee poore tenaunce fully ſlite higher man amerced gladlier woll write farre chriſtes poverty covetiſe endite poore pity ne never hem cheriſh ever hem bite commonly ſuch comen poore people hem begete perfection han inomen father riden fete travailen ſore eate povert liveth yong old father ſuffreth drought weate many hungrie meales thurſt cold theſe monkes han forſake chriſtes love ſaint benete pride eaſe hem take religion evill beſeate religion muſt hanged plowe threſhing diking fro toune toune ſorrie meat half ynowe therefore han forſake taken rich pride eaſe full god woll monkes hem make little ſuch order praiſe saint benet ordained ſo bad hem churchliche churchliche manner live go boiſtous earth lordliche diſclaunder ſaint benet therefore holy curſe saint benet hem never met thought robbe purſe hereof tell ben like tho cleane ſerve devill hell ben treaſure ſtore ſuch counterfaitours chanons canon ſuch diſguiſed god enemy traitours true religion han foule deſpiſed freres told making crede yet could tell worſe men would werien rede god goodneſſe man tell might write ne ſpeake ne thinke thought falſhed unright may man tell ever god wrought griffon ſaied thou canſt good thou came never gentle kind trowe thou waxeſt wood el thou haſt loſt thy mind holy church hedde ſhould governaile ſhould rule ſhould redde ſhould forthren ſhould availe ech man ſhall live travaile beſt doeth ſhall moſt mede ſtrength men church aſſaile ſtrength men muſt defend nede pope purely poore needie nothing ne ſhould driven doore doore wicked nolde drad ſuch head men would ſad ſinfully liven hem luſt ſtrength amend ſuch made wepen wolf ſheep wuſt pope prelate would begge bid bow borrow holy church ſhould ſtand full cold ſervaunts ſit ſoupe ſorrow noughtie foule horow worſhip god men would wlate even morow harlottrie men would hate therefore men holy church honeſt thing worſhipfully god workes werch ſeemeth ſerve chriſt king honeſt cleane clothing veſſels gold clothes rich god honeſtly make offring lordſhip none liche pellican caſt huge crie ſaied ala ſaieſt thou ſo chriſt head ſitteth hie head ne ought mo ben member alſo father taught u call al maiſters called defended tho maiſters ben wicked fals taketh maiſterie name ghoſtly earthly good king lord ſhould lordſhips rule people mild mood chriſt u ſhed blood bad prieſts maiſterſhip ne carke cloth ne food every miſcheefe hem ſave rich clothing ſhall rightwiſneſſe treaſure true life ſhall charity ſhall richeſſe lordſhip ſhall unite hope god honeſte veſſel cleane conſcience poore ſpirit humilite shall holy church defence ſaied griffon may thee greve folkes faren wele haſt thou doen live thy falſhed ech man may fele thou canſt cattle gete liveſt lond lorell gloſing getteſt thou thy mete fareth devill wonneth hell would ech man ſhould dwell liveth cleane envie tale thou doeſt tell thou wouldeſt people deſtrie gloſe hereſie ye live better life cleane hypocriſie bringeſt thee woe ſtrife therewith doen ye ne cure ye ſerve devill neither god ne man ſhall pay hire ye woll fare well feaſtes warme clothed cold therefore ye gloſe goddes heeſtes begile people yong old ſeaven sacrament ye ſpeake ayenſt ye ſlie ayenſt tithinges offringes entents lordes bodie falſely lie ye doen live eaſe ſaieth ne ſoche ſain pope worth peaſe make people ayen groche commeth fendes bring chriſten diſtaunce would man frendes leave thy chattring miſchaunce thou live well wilt thou let men live hem liſt spende good keepe ſtore men conſcience never thou niſt ye han cure anſwere fore meddle ye han doen let men live han doen yore thou ſhalt anſwere man pellican ſayd ſir naie diſpiſed pope ne sacrament ſoth ſaie ſpeake charite good hope diſpiſe hye pride richeſſe ſhould poore ſpirite wickedneſſe known ſo wide ſerve god falſe habite tournen mekeneſſe pride lowlineſſe high degree goddes wordes tourne hide moved charite let men live ſo cunning might warne men wo tellen hem trouth right sacrament ſoule heale uſed good uſe ayenſt ſpeake never deale nothing wiſe uſen hem miſſe manere ſet hem ſale trow ſhall abie hem dere reaſon tale ſo taketh hem unrightfulliche ayenſt ten commaundements gloſe wrechedliche selleth sacrament trow doe devill homage weten doe wrong thereto dare well wage ſerven sathan ſong tithen offren holeſome life done due manere man houſelin ſhrive wedding fere nother ſold ne bought ne take ne give covertiſe ſo taken nought ſelleth hem ſo may ſore agriſe lord body doe lie ſay ſooth true rede fleſh blood miſterie forme brede needeth ſtrive whether ſunget accident chriſt live verament pope cardinal live good live chriſt commaunded goſpell ayenſt woll ſtrive methinketh live well pope lived god bedde pride highneſſe ſhould diſpiſe richeſſe covetiſe croune hedde meekneſſe poverte ſhould uſe griffon ſaied ſhould abie thou ſhalt brent balefull fire thy ſect ſhall deſtrie ye ſhall hanged ſwire ye ſhullen hanged draw giveth leave preach ſpeake againſt god law people thus falſely teach thou ſhalt curſed booke bell diſcevered holy church cleane ydamned hell otherwiſe ye woll worch pellican ſaied ne drede curſing little value god hope mede falſhed ye ſewe ye charite wilneth vengeaunce nero ſuffren woll ready drede thou canſt chriſt bad one ſuffer love ſo taught ſervaunts thou amend ſake drede thy maintenaunce drede world hate thinketh little praiſe drede nothing high eſtate ne drede diſeaſe woll ye tourne leave pride high port richeſſe curſing ſhould go ſo wide god bring rightwiſeneſſe drede tyrannie nothing ye done ſuffer readie siker recke never ſoone griffon grinned wood loked lovely owle ſwore cock heart blood would teare every doule holy church thou diſclaundreſt foule thy reaſons woll thee race make thy fleſh rot moule loſell thou ſhalt hard grace griffon fiew forth way pellican ſit weepe himſelfe gan ſay god would chriſts ſheepe heard ytaken keepe word ſaied would write well keepe god would grace plowman anſwerd ſaied would travaile man would pey pelli ſaied yes theſe god han ſold han ſtore money plowman ſaied tell thou may telleſt thou men treſpas pellican ſaid amend hem good fay god woll give grace chriſt himſelfe likned people died rood fare right ſo fareth feedeth bird blood theſe doen evill ayenſt good ben foen friend face told hem living ſtood god amend hem grace plowman aileth griffon tell holdeth ſide pelli two likely kind roven wide foule betokeneth pride lucifer high flew ſith evill hide agilted god grace bird flieth aire liveth bird meke theſe flow deſpaire ſhenden ſilly foules eke ſoules ſinnes ſeke culieth hem kneele therefore ala briberie god forbode breke god amend grace hinder part lioun robber ravinere robbeth people earth doun earth holdeth none pere fareth foule ferre nere temporell ſtrength ye people chaſe lion proud earth god amend grace pellican flew forth wing twaine droping daſed dull ſoone griffon came againe foules earth full pellican caſt pull great number never ſeene manner foules tellen woll god woll give grace griffon comen foules fele ravins rokes crowes pie gray foules agadred wele gurde would hie gledes buzzard hem white mole puttockes token place lapwing well conneth lie fellowſhip han forgard grace long pellican laſt commeth againe brought phenix ſtout griffon would flow full faine foules flewen thicke raine phenix tho began hem chace flie vaine vengeaunce grace ſlew hem downe without mercie ſtart neither free ne thrall caſt rufull crie griffon fall beat hem ſlew hem whither hem drove man may trace vnder earth thought yall ala feeble grace pellican asked right writing blame woll fight flight ſhall ſheld ſhame maid dame lambe ſlaine shall ſheld ghoſtly blame earthly harme god grace therefore pray every man writting excuſed writing writeth pellican thus theſe people hath diſpiſed freſh fully adviſed nill maintaine manace devill often diſguiſed bring man evill grace witeth pellican hereof nill avow high ne low ne degree fable take ye mowe holy church bow ech man amend chriſt ſend ſpace writing allow almighty grace ¶the parſons prologue plowman tale ended ſunne fro ye ſouth ſide deſcended low ſight degree five twenty hight two clocke ſo geſſe eleven foot lite leſſe ſhadow time ſuch foot length parted ſixe foot equall proportion therewith moones exaltation meane taurus alway gan aſcend entring thropes end hoſte wont gie aye caſe jolly companie said wiſe lordings everichone lacketh u tale one fullfilled ſentence decree woll tell u tale let ſee almoſt fulfilled ordinance pray god ſo yeve right good chance telleth tale u luſtely sir prieſt qd art thou vicary art thou parſon ſay ſooth thy fay thou breke thou play every man ſave thou hath told tale vnbokell ſhew u thy male truly thinketh thy chere thou ſhouldeſt knit well great matere tell u fable anon cockes bone parſon answerd one thou getteſt fable none told poule writeth timothe repreveth hem waiven ſoothfaſtneſſe teachen fable ſuch wretchedneſſe ſhould ſow draffe fiſt may ſow wheat liſt ſay ye liſt morality vertuous matere ye wol yeve audience would full faine chriſts reverence done pleaſaunce lefull truſteth well ſotherne man cannot jeaſt rum ram ruf letter god wote rime hold little better therefore ye liſt woll gloſe woll tell little tale proſe knit feaſt make end ieſu grace wit ſend ſhew way voyage thilke perfite glorious pilgrimage hight hieruſalem celeſtial vouchſafe anon ſhall begin upon tale pray tell adviſe cannot better ſay natheleſſe meditation put aye correction clerkes textuell take ſentence truſteth well therefore make proteſtation woll ſtand correction vpon word aſſented ſone ſeemed done end ſome vertuous ſentence yeve ſpace audience bad hoſt ſhould ſay tell tale pray hoſt word u sir prieſt qd faire mote befall say y• ye liſt ſhall gladly word ſaid manere telleth qd meditatioun haſteth ſunne woll adoun beth fructuous little ſpace well god ſend grace ¶the parſons tale sermon againſt diver grievous sin remedy ſame perſuading men penitence ieremie vi state ſuper vias videte interrogate de ſemitis antiquis quae ſit via bona ambulate ea invenietis refrigerium animabus veſtris ovr ſweet lord god heaven man woll periſh woll turne knoweledge blisfull life perdurable admoniſheth u prophet ieremie ſayeth wiſe stondeth upon wayes ſeeth asketh old pathes ſaie olde ſentences good way walketh way yee ſhall finde refreſhing ſoules c many wayes eſpirituels leade folke lord ieſu chriſt reigne glory wayes full noble way full covenable may faile man ne woman ſinne hath miſgone fro right way hieruſalem celeſtiall way called penitence manne ſhould gladly hearken enquire hert wete penitence called penitence many manner action werkinges penitence manie ſpeces penitence thinges appertain behoove penitence thinges diſtourbe penitence saint ambroſe ſaith penitence plaining man guilt hath done thing ought playne ſome doctours ſayth penitence waymenting man ſorroweth ſume paineth ſelf hath misdone penitence certain circumſtaunces repentance man holt himſelf ſorrow paine guiltes ſhall penitent ſhall firſt bewaile ſinnes hee hath done ſtedfaſtly purpoſe heart ſhrift mouth ſatisfaction never doe thing ought bewayle complaine continue good work el repentaunce may availe saint iſiodor ſaith yaper lyer repentaunt yt e • tſoone doth thing ought repent weeping ſtint doe ſinne may auaile natheleſſe men ſhall hope euery time man falleth bee neuer ſo oft hee may ariſe pennaunce haue grace certaine great doubt ſaith ſaint gregorie vnnethes ariſeth ſin yt charged y• charge euill vſage therefore repentaunt folke ſtint ſinne leue ſinne ſinne leaue holy church holdeth ſiker ſaluation ſinneth verely repenteth laſt end holy church yet hopeth ſaluation great mercy lord ieſus chriſt repentaunce take ſiker way ſith haue declared thing penitence ye ſhall vnderſtond beene three action penitence firſt manne baptiſed hath ſinned saint auguſtine ſayth penitent old ſinnefull life hee may biginne new cleane life certes baptiſed without penitence old guilt retaineth ye marke baptiſme ye grace ne ye remiſſion ſins till hee haue repentaunce another default yt men doe deadly ſinne haue receiued baptiſme third default yt men fall veniall ſinnes baptiſme fro day day thereof ſayeth saint auguſtine penitence good humble folk penitence euery day ſpeces penitence ben three one hem ſolemne another commune third priuie pennaunce yt ſolemne two manner put holy church lent ſlaughter child ſuch manner thing another man hath ſinned openly ſinne fame openly ſpoken country holy church judgement diſtrayneth open pennaunce common pennaunce yt prieſts enioyn men certaine caſe go perauenture naked pilgrimage bare foot priuie pennaunce yt men doe day priuie ſins ſhriue v priuily receiue priuie pennaunce ſhalt thou vnderſtond behoueful neceſſary perfit penitence ſtont three thing contrition hart confeſſion mouth ſatiſfaction ſayth ſaint iohn chriſoſtome penitence diſſtraineth man accept benignely every paine y• enioined contrition hert ſhrift mouth ſatiſfaction werking manner humility fruitfull penitence ayenſt three thing wee wrath lord ieſus chriſt ſay delite thinking retchleſſe ſpeaking wicked ſinfull werking ayenſt theſe wicked guilt penitence may likened vnto tree root tree contrition y• hideth heart repentaunt right root tree hideth earth roote contrition ſpringeth ſtalke bereth braunches leaues confeſſion fruit ſatiſfaction chriſt ſayth goſpell doth digne fruite penitence fruite men may knowe tree root hid heart manne ne braunches ne leaues confeſſion therefore lord ieſu chriſt ſaith thus fruit hem ſhall ye knowe hem root alſo ſpringeth ſeede grace ſeed mother ſikerneſſe ſeed eager hote grace ſeed ſpringeth god remembraunce y• day doome paine hell matter ſaith salomon ye drede god man forletteth ſinne heat ſeed ye loue god deſiring joy perdurable heat draweth heart man god doth hate ſinne ſoothly nothing ſauoureth ſo wel child ye milke nurce ne nothing abhominable milke meddled meate right ſo ſinfull man y• loueth ſinne ſeemeth moſt ſweete thing fro yt time hee loueth ſadly lord ieſu chriſt deſireth ye life perdurable nothing abhominable ſoothly law god ye loue god dauid prophet ſayth haue loued thy law hated wickedneſſe loueth god keepeth lawe word tree ſaw prophet daniel ſpirit ye viſion nabuchodonoſor counſayled doe penitence pennaunce tree life hem receyue holdeth penitence bleſſed ſentence salomon penitence contrition man ſhall vnderſtond foure thing ſay contrition beene ye cauſes moove man contrition hee ſhould contrite contrition auayleth ſoule thus contrition y• ſorrow yt man receiueth heart ſinnes ſad purpoſe ſhriue doe pennaunce neuer doe ſinne ſorrow ſhal manner ſayeth saint bernard ſhall heauie greeuous full ſharpe poinant heart firſt man hath agilted lord creator ſharpe poinaunt hath agilted father celeſtiall yet ſharpe poynaunt hee hath wrathed agilted boughte precious bloud hath deliuered v fro bondes ſinne fro ye cruelte deuill paine hell cauſes yt ought moue man contricion bene fixe firſt man ſhall remembre ſinnes loke remembraunce ne bee delite waye greate ſhame ſorowe ſinnes iob ſayth ſinfull men done werkes worthie confeſſion therefore ſayeth ezechiell woll remember ye yeres life bitterneſſe herte god ſaieth apocalipſe remember ye whence ye fall time ye ſinned ye child god limmes reigne god ſinne ye ben waren thral foule membres ye fende hate angel ſlaunder holye churche foode falſe serpent perpetuall matter fire hell yet foule abhominable ye treſpaſſe ſo oft time doeth hounde returneth ayen eate owne ſpewing yet ye fouler long continuing ſinne ſinfull vſage ye bee roted ſinne beeſte donge suche manner thoughtes make manne ſhame ſinne delite god ſaith ye prophet ezechiel ye ſhall remembre way ſhull diſpleſe ſothly sinnes ben way lede folke hell ſecond cauſe ought make man disdaine ſinne ſaith ſaint peter ſo doth ſinne thrall ſinne ſinne putteth manne great thraldome therefore ſaieth prophet ezechiell went ſorrowfull diſdaine ſelfe certes well ought man disdaine ſinne withdrawe fro thraldome villany lo wt ſaieth seneke matter ſaith thus though wiſt neither god ne manne ſhould neuer know yet would diſdaine doe ſinne ſame seneke alſo ſayeth borne greater thinge thrall body make body thrall ne fouler thrall may man ne woman make bodie yeue body ſinne fouleſt churle fouleſt woman liueth leaſt value yet foule ſeruitude euer fro higher degree yt man falleth thrall god world vile abhominable good god well ought man great diſdaine ſinne ſith yt ſinne hee free made bond therefore ſaieth ſaint auguſtine thou haſt diſdaine thy ſeruaunt hee offend ſinne thou diſdaine thou thy ſelfe ſhouldeſt ſinne take regard thine value thou ne bee foule thy ſelfe ala well ought diſdaine bee ſeruaunts thralles ſinne ſore aſhamed themſelf god endleſſe goodneſſe hath ſette high eſtate yeue hem witte ſtrength bodye heale beautie proſperitie bought hem fro death hert blood ſo vnkindly ayenſt gentleneſſe quite ſo villanouſly ſlaughter owne ſoules oh good god ye woman great beautie remembreth prouerbe salomon ſaieth likeneth faire woman foole bodie ring gold worne groine ſow right ſowe wroteth euery ordure ſo wroteth ſhe beautie ſtinking ordure ſinne third cauſe ought meue man contrition dread day doome horrible pain hell ſaint ierome ſayeth euery time remembreth day doome quake eate drinke ſo euer ſeemeth y• trompe ſowneth mine eare riſeth ye vp ded cometh judgement good god muche ought manne drede ſuch judgment ſhall saint poule ſayeth ſeat oure lorde ieſu chriſt whereas ſhal make generall congregation whereas man may bee abſent certes auaileth none eſſoyne ne excuſation onely default ſhall judged alſo werkes ſhall openly knowne ſayeth ſaint bernard ne ſhall pleading auaile ne ſleight ſhall yeue reckoning euerie idle word ſhall haue judge may bee deceiued ne corrupt certes thought diſcouered ne prayer ne mede ſhall corrupt therefore ſaith salomon wrath god ne woll ſpare wight prayer ne yeft therefore day doome hope eſcape wherfore ſaith ſaint anſelme full great anguiſh ſhall ye ſinnefull folke haue yt time ſhall ye fiers wroth iudge ſitte aboue vnder horrible pitte hell open deſtroy yt muſt knowe ſinnes ſinnes openly beene ſhewed god euery creature left ſide mo diuels anie heart may thinke hale drawe ſinfull ſoules paine hell within heart folke ſhall biting conſcience without forth ſhall bee world brenning whither ſhall wretched ſinful man flie hide certes may hide muſt come forth ſhewe certes ſaith ierom earth ſhall caſt ſee alſo y• ayre ſhall ful thonder clappes lightning ſothly ſo well remembreth theſe thinges geſſe ſinne ſhall turne delite great ſorrowe drede paine hell therefore ſaith iob god ſuffer lord yt may bewaile wepe er goe without returning darke londe couered derkeneſſe death londe miſeſe derkeneſſe whereas ſhadowe death none order ordinaunce fearfull drede ever ſhall laſt lo may ſee iob prayed reſpite bewepe waile treſpaſſe ſothely one day reſpite better treaſure world much man may acquite himſelfe god penitence world treaſure therefore ſhould pray god yeue reſpite bewepe waile treſpaſſe certes ſorow man might make fro y• beginning world ni little thing regarde ſorrow hell cauſe iob calleth hell londe derkeneſſe underſtondeth calleth londe earth ſtable never ſhall faile derke hell hath defaute light materiall certes derke light ſhall come fire ever ſhall brenne ſhall turn pain ye hell ſheweth horrible diuels turmenteth covered ye derkeneſſe death ſay hee hell ſhall defaut ye ſight god certes ſight god ye life perdurable derknes death y• ſins ye wretched man hath diſturb ſee ye face god right derke cloud betwixt u y• ſunne londe miſeſe becauſe yt three maner defautes ayenſt three thing folke world preſent life ſay honour delices richeſſe ayenſt honour hell ſhame confuſion well ye wote men call honour ye reverence y• man doth man hell none honour ne reverence certes reverence ſhal king knave god ſayth prophet ieremie thoſe folke diſpiſe ſhal diſpite honour alſo called great lordeſhip ſhall wight ſerve harme turment honour alſo called great dignitie highneſſe hell ſhall fortroden divels god ſaith horrible devil ſhall goe come upon heddes damned folke much higher preſent life y• ſhall abated defoiled hell ayenſte richeſſe world ſhall miſeſe poverte ſhall four thinges defaut treaſure david ſaith rich folk embrace knit hert treaſour world ſhall ſleep ſleeping death nothing ne ſhull find hondes treſour moreover ye miſeaſe hell ſhall defaut meat drinke god ſayeth thus moyſes ſhall bee waſted hunger byrdes hell ſhall devour hem bitter death ye gall dragon ſhall drinke y• venum dragon morſels alſo miſeaſe ſhall defaut clothing ſhall naked bodie clothing ſaue fire brenne filthes naked ſhall ſoule manner vertues ye clothing ſoule gay robe ye ſoft ſhetes ye ſmall ſherts lo ſayth god hem prophet eſaie hem ſhall bee ſtrewed moughtes covertures ſhall bee worm hell alſo miſeaſe ſhall defaut friend poor ye hath good frends ther frend neither god ne creature ſhall frend hem ech hem ſhall hate deadly hate ſonnes doughters ſhall rebell ayenſt father mother kinred ayenſt kinred chide diſpiſe day night god ſayeth prophet micheas y• loving child whilom loved ſo fleſhly ech would ech hem eat might ſhould love together paine hell hated eche proſperity life truſt well fleſhly love deedly hate ſaith y• prophet david whoſo loveth wickedneſſe hateth ſoul ſo hateth ſoul certes may love none wight maner therefore hel ſolace ne frendſhip ever ye kinredes ben hell y• curſinges chidinges ye deadly hate among hem alſo ſhall defaut manner delices certes delices ben appetite ye five wittes ſight hearing ſmelling favouring touching hell ſight ſhall full derkeneſſe ſmoke therefore full teares hearing full wailing grinting teeth ſaith ieſu chriſt noſthrilles ſhall bee full ſtinking ſaith eſay ye prophet ſavouring ſhall full bitter gall touching body icovered fire never ſhall quench wormes never ſhall die god ſayth y• mouth eſay much ſhall wene may die pain death flye fro pain may underſtond wordes iob ſaieth ſhadow death certes ſhadow hath likeneſſe thing ſhadowed ſhadow ſame thing ſhadowed right ſo fareth pain hell like death ye horrible anguiſh paineth hem ever though ſhold die anon certes ſhall die ſaith ſaint greg wretched caitiffes ſhall death without death end without end defaut without fayling death ſhall alway live end ſhall ever begin defaut ſhall faile therefore ſayth ſaint iohn evangeliſt ſhall follow death ſhall find ſhall deſire die death ſhall flie hem alſo iob ſaith hell order rule ſo y• god hath create thing right order nothing without order thing ordred numbred yet natheleſſe dampned nothing order ne hold none order ye earth ne ſhall bere hem fruit prophet david ſayth god ſhall deſtroy ye fruit earth hem ne water ne ſhall yeve hem moiſture ne ayre refreſhing ne fire light ſaith ſaint baſilie brenning y• fire world ſhall god yeve hell hem dampned ye light clearneſſe ſhall yeve heaven child right good men yeve fleſh child bone hound ſhall none hope eſcape ſayeth ſainct iob laſt ſhall terrour greſly drede dwell without end horrour alway drede come drede ſhall alway dwell heart hem bee dampned therfore loſt hope ſeven cauſes firſt god judge ſhall without mercy hem may pleaſe ne none ſaints ne may yeve nothing raunſome ne ſhall voice ſpeake ne may fly fro pain ne goodneſſe hem yt may ſhew deliver hem fro pain therefore ſaith salomon wicked man dyeth dead ſhall hope eſcape fro paine ſo would well underſtond paine bethinke well hee hath deſerved thoſe paine ſinnes certes ſhould talent ſighe weepe ſinge playe ſaith salomon ſo ye ſcience know paine ben ordained ſinne would make ſorowe ſcience ſaith saint auſtin maketh man weiment heart fourth pointe oughte make man contrition ſorowfull remembraunce good hee hath left doe heare earthe alſo good hath loſt sothly good werkes hee hath lefte either good werkes hee wrought er hee fell deadly ſinne elſe y• good werkes hee wrought hee laie ſinne sothly good werkes fell ſinne mortified aſtoned dull oft ſinning werkes hee hee lay ſin dead ye life perdurable heaven good werkes mortified oft ſinning charite may quick ayen without penitence ſayth god mouth ezechiel ye rightfull man retourn ayen fro rightwiſeneſſe wickednes ſhall live nay y• good werkes hee hath ne ſhall neuer remembrance ſhall die ſinne upon y• chapter ſayth ſaint gregory thus wee ſhall underſtond principally y• done deadly ſinne nought rehearſe draw memory good werkes wee wrought certes werking deadly ſinne truſt ta good werke yt doen ſay thereby life perdurable heaven natheleſſe ye good werks quicken come againe helpe availe life perdurable heaven contricion ſoothly y• good werkes men deedly ſinne much doen deedly ſinne may never quicke certes thing never life may never quick natheleſſe albeit avail life perdurable yet availe abredge y• pain hell el get temporall richeſſes el god woll y• rather enlumine light heart y• ſinfull man repentaunce eke availe uſe manne good werkes feende leſſe power ſoul thus curteis lord ieſu chriſt ne woll good work bee loſte ſomewhat ſhall availe much good werkes menne doen good life amortiſed ſinne following alſo ſithe ye good werkes men doon bee dedly ſinne utterly dead life perdurable well may manne good werke ne doeth ſing new freſh ſong lay tout pardu mon temp et mon labure certes ſinne bereaveth man goodneſſe nature alſo goodneſſe grace ſoothly grace holy ghoſt fareth like fire may idle fire faileth anon foreletteth werking right ſo grace fayleth anon foreletteth werking leſeth ſinfull man goodneſſe glory beheight good men labour werk well may ſory oweth life god long hath lived alſo long ſhall live goodneſſe ne hath paie debt god oweth life truſt well ſhall yeve accompts ſayth saint bernard goodes yeve preſent life hath hem diſpended ſo much ſhall periſhe heere hedde ne moment houre ne ſhall periſhe time hee ne ſhall yeve reckoning fifthe thinge ought moove man contricion remembraunce paſſion lorde ieſu chriſt ſuffered ſinnes ſaieth ſaint bernarde live ſhall remembraunce travailes lord ieſu chriſt ſuffered preaching wearineſſe travailing temptation faſted long waking praied veares wept pite good people woe ye ſhame filthe men ſaid foule ſpitting menne ſpitte face buffettes men yave foule mowes reproves men ſaid nailes hee nailed croſſe ye remnaunt paſſion ſuffred ſinnes nothing gilte ye ſhall underſtond yt man ſinne every manner order ordinance tourned ſo doune ſoth yt god reaſon ſenſualite bodie man ordained eche theſe four thing ſhould lordſhip thus god ſhould lordſhip reaſon reaſon ſenſualite ſenſualite body man ſothly man ſinneth order ordinance turned ſo doun therefore moche reaſon man ne woll ſubject ne obeyſaunt god lord right therefore leſeth worſhip ſhould ſenſualite alſo bodie manne ſenſualite rebelleth ayenſt reaſon way leeſeth reaſon lordſhip ſenſualite body right reaſon rebell god right ſo ſenſualite rebell reaſon body alſo certes diſordinaunce rebellion lord ieſu chriſt bought upon precious body full deere herkeneth wiſe much reaſon rebell god therefore man worthy ſorow dede ſuffred lord ieſu chriſt manne betraied diſciple diſtrained bound ſo blood braſt every naile hondes ſaith auguſtin ferthermore much reaſon manne woll daunt ſenſualite may therefore manne worthy ſhame ſuffered lord ieſu chriſt man ſpit viſage ferthermore muche caitiffe body man rebell reaſon ſenſualite therefore worthy death ſuffered lord ieſu chriſt upon ye croſſe whereas part body free without great paine bitter paſſion ſuffred lord ieſu chriſt never forfaited therefore reaſonably may ſaid ieſu maner much pained thing never deſerved much defouled ſhame man worthy therefore may ſinfull man well ſay ſayth ſaint bernard accurſed bitterneſſe ſinne whiche muſt bee ſuffered ſo much bitterneſſe certes diver diſcordance wickedneſſe paſſion ieſu chriſt ordained diver thing thus certes ſinfull mannes ſoul betraied divell covetiſe temporall proſperite ſcorned deceit cheſeth fleſhly delices yet turmented impatience adverſity beſpet ſervage ſubjection ſinne laſt ſlain finally diſordinaunce ſinfull man ieſus chriſt firſt betraid hee bound came unbind u ſinne paine beſcorned ſhould bee honoured thing viſage ought deſired bee ſeen mankind viſage angel deſire look villainouſly beſpet ſcourged nothing treſpaſſed finally crucified ſlain accompliſhed word eſaie wounded misdeed defoiled felony ſith ieſu chriſt took pain wickedneſſes moche ought ſinfull man wepe bewaile ſinnes god ſonne heaven ſhould pain endure sixt thing ſhould meve man contricion hope thre thing ſay forye veneſſe ſinne gift grace doe well glory heaven whiche god ſhall rewarde manne good deed much ieſu chriſt yeveth u theſe gift largeneſſe sovereigne bountie therefore hee called ieſus nazarenus rex iudeorum ieſus ſay ſaviour ſalvation men ſhal hope foryeveneſſe ſinnes properly ſalvation ſinnes therefore ſayd angell ioſeph thou ſhalt call name ieſus ſhall ſave people ſinnes hereof ſaith saint peter none name heaven yeve man man may ſaved onely ieſus nazarenus much ſay flouriſhing man ſhall hope hee yeveth remiſſion ſinnes ſhall yeve alſo grace well doe doore thine herte ſayth ieſus called enter openeth ſhall foryeveneſſe ſinne woll enter grace ſup good werkes hee ſhall doe werkes food ſoule ſhall ſuppe great joye ſhall yeve thus ſhall man hope werkes penaunce god ſhall yeve reign behight goſpell ſhall man underſtonde manner ſhall contricion ſay ſhall univerſall totall ſay man ſhall repentant ſinnes hee hath dooen delite thought right perillous two manner conſentings one hem called conſenting affection man moved ſin deliteth longe think ſinne reaſon apperceiveth wel ſinne ayenſt law god yet reaſon refraineth foule delite talent though ſee well apertly yt ayenſt reverence god although reaſon conſent yt ſinne indeed yet ſay ſome doctours ſoche delite dwelleth longe full perillous albeit never ſo little alſo man ſhould ſorrow namely ever hath deſired ayenſt law god perfite conſenting reaſon thereof doubte deadly ſinne conſenting certes deadly ſinne firſt man thought delite ſo forth conſenting deed wherfore ſay many men ne repent hem never ſuch thought delices ne never ſhrive hem deed great ſinnes outward wherefore ſay ſoche wicked delites ſubtill begilers hem ſhall dampned moreover man ought ſorowe wicked word well wicked deed certes repentance ſinguler ſinne repentant ſins elſe repent ſinnes ſinguler ſinne may availe certes god almighty good therefore either foryeveth elſe right nought therefore ſaith ſaint auguſtin wote certainly god enemy every ſinner hee obſerveth one ſinne ſhall hee foryeveneſſe thoſe ſinnes nay moreover contricion ſhould bee wonder ſorowfull anguiſhous therefore yeveth god plainly mercy therefore ſoul anguiſhed ſorowful within remembrance god yt prayer might come ferthermore contricion muſt continuall manne ſtedfaſt purpoſe ſhrive amend life ſothly contricion laſteth man may ever hope foryevenes cometh hate ſinne deſtroyeth ſinne himſelf alſo folke power ſaith david love god hate wickedneſſe love god love loveth hate hateth laſt thing yt men ſhall underſtand wherefore availeth contrition ſay yt contricion ſometime delivereth man fro ſinne david ſaith ſay ſaid david purpoſed firmely ſhrive thou lord releaſedeſt ſin right ſo contricion availeth without ſad purpoſe ſhrift man oppertunity right ſo little worth ſhrift ſatisfaction without contrition moreover contricion deſtroyeth priſon hell maketh weak feeble ſtrengths devil reſtoreth yeftes holy ghoſt good vertues cleanſeth ſoule ſinne delivereth fro paine hell fro company devill fro ſervage ſinne reſtoreth good ſpirituals company communion holy church ferthermore maketh whilome ſonne yre ſonne grace theſe thing prooved holy writ therefore would ſet entent theſe thing full wiſe truly ne ſhould life courage ſinne yeve heart body ſerve chriſt thereof doe homage truly lord hath ſpared u ſo meekly foilies ne pity man ſoule ſorry ſong might ſing explicit prima par poenitentiae incipit par ſecunda ſecond part penitence confeſſion ſigne contricion ſhull yee underſtond confeſſion ought need bee doen thinges covenable confeſſion firſt ſhalt thou underſtonde confeſſion ſhewing ſinnes prieſt ſay hee muſt confeſſe condition belong ſin ferforthe hee muſt bee ſayed nothing excuſed ne hid avaunt thee thy good werkes alſo neceſſarie underſtonde whence ſinnes ſpringe howe entere beene ſpring ſins ſaith saint poule wiſe right one man ſinne entred firſt world ſin death right ſo death entreth men ſinne man adam ſin entred world broke commandment god therfore firſt ſo mighty hee ne ſhuld died became ſo muſt need die whether would progenie world ſayed man ſinned look eſtate innocency adam eve naked paradiſe ſhamed hereof ſerpent wilyeſt beaſis y• god made ſaid woman commanded god ye ſhould eate every tree paradiſe woman answered fruit ſaid ſhe tree paradiſe feed u fruit middle tree paradiſe god forbode u eate touch leaſt wee ſhould die serpent ſayd woman nay nay ye ſhall die death ſooth god wotte day ye eate thereof eyen ſhall open ye ſhall god knowing good harme woman ſaw tree good feeding fair eyen delectable ſight ſhe took fruit tree eat yave husbond eat anon eyen hem opened knewe naked ſowed figg leaf manner breches hide member may ye ſee deadly ſin hath firſt ſuggeſtion ſende ſheweth adder afterward delight fleſh ſheweth eve conſenting reaſon ſheweth adam truſt well though ſo fende tempted eve ſay fleſh fleſh delight beauty fruit defended yet certes till reaſon ſay adam conſented eating fruit yet ſtoode hee ſtate innocency ſayd adam tooke wee ſayd originall ſinne fleſhly diſcended bee wee engendred vile corrupt matter ſoule put body right anon contract originall ſinne erſt onely pain concupiſcence afterward paine ſinne therefore wee borne ſonnes wrath dampnation perdurable nere baptiſme wee receive benimmeth u coulpe forſoth pine dwelleth u temptation pine hight concupiſcence concupiſcence wrongfully diſpoſed ordained man maketh covet covetiſe fleſh fleſhly ſin ſight eyen yerthly thinges alſo covetiſe highneſſe pride heart ſpeake firſt covetiſe concupiſcence law member lawfully made rightfull judgment god ſay much man obeiſant god lorde therefore fleſh diſobeiſaunt concupiſcence whiche called nouriſhing ſinne occaſion ſinne therefore manne hath within pine concupiſcence impoſſible bee tempted ſometime moved fleſh ſin thing may faile long liveth may well wax feeble vertue baptiſme grace god penitence fully ne ſhall never quench hee ne ſhall ſometime mooved himſelf refrained ſickneſſe malice ſorcery cold drink lo ſaith poule fleſh coveteth ayenſt ſpirite ſpirite ayenſt fleſh ſo contrary ſo ſtriven manne may alway would ſame poule great pennance water lond water night day great peril great paine londe famine thurſt cold clothleſſe one ſtoned almoſt death yet ſaid ala caitiffe manne ſhall deliver fro priſon caitiffe body ſaint ierom hee long time dwelled deſert whereas hee company wilde beaſtes hee meate herbes water drinke ne bed naked earth wherefore fleſh blacke ethyopian heat nie deſtroyed cold yet ſaid brenning lechery boyled body wherefore wot well bee deceived ſay tempted body witnes iames ſaith every wight tempted owne conſcience y• ſay ech u hath matter occaſion tempted noriſhing ſinne body therfore ſaith ſaint iohn evangeliſt wee ſay without ſinne wee deceive ſelfe truth u ſhall ye underſtond ſin waxeth increaſeth man firſt thing ſame nouriſhing ſinne ſpake fleſhly concupiſcence commeth ſuggeſtion devill ſay ye devil belous bloweth man fire concupiſence man bethinketh whether hee woll doe thing tempted man withſtond weive firſt intiſing fleſh fiend ſinne ſo doe feeleth anon flame delight good beware keep well el woll fall anone conſenting ſinne woll hee may time place matter ſayth moyſes devill manner fiend ſayth woll chace purſue man wicked ſuggeſtion woll take mooving •• irring ſinne woll depart priſe preie deliberation luſt ſhall accompliſhed delight woll draw ſwerd conſenting certes right ſwerde departeth thing two peeces right ſo conſenting departeth god fro manne woll ſlea honde deede ſinne thus ſayth fiend certes man dead ſoule thus ſinne accompliſhed temptation delite conſenting ſin actuall forſooth ſinne two maners either veniall deadly ſin sothly man loveth creature ieſu chriſt creatour deadly ſin veniall ſin man love ieſu chriſt leſſe ought forſooth deed veniall ſin full perillous miniſheth love man ſhould god therefore man charge himſelfe many ſuch veniall ſins certes ſo yt ſometime diſcharge hem ſhrift may full lightly miniſh love hath ieſu chriſt wiſe skippeth veniall ſinne deadly ſinne certes man chargeth ſoule veniall ſinnes hee enclined fall deadly ſin therefore let u negligent charge u veniall ſinnes proverb ſaith many ſmall make great hearken enſample great wave ſea commeth ſometime ſo great violence yt drouneth ſhippe ſame harme dooth ſometime ſmall drop water entereth little creveis timber bottom ſhip men ſo negligent diſcharge hem time therefore although difference betwixt theſe two cauſes drowning algates ſhip drouned right ſo fareth ſometime deadly ſin annoious veniall ſinnes multiplie man ſo greatly thoſe worldly thinges hee loueth hee ſinneth venially great heart ye loue god therefore loue euery thing yt beſet god ne done principally god ſake although man loue leſſe god yet veniall ſinne deadly ſin loue thing weigheth heart man much ye loue god deadly ſinne ſaith ſaint auguſtine man turneth heart fro god whiche ſoueraigne bounty may chaunge yeueth heart thing may chaunge flit certes euerie thing ſaue god heauen ſooth yt man yeue loue oweth god heart vnto creature certes much loue yeueth ſame creature ſo muche bireaueth fro god therefore doth ſinne debitour god ne yeldeth god debt yt ſay loue heart nowe ſith man vnderſtondeth generallye veniall ſinne couenable tell ſpecially ſin many man peraduenture deemeth hem ſinnes ſhriueth ſame thing yet natheleſſe ſins ſoothly theſe clerkes write ſay euery tyme manne eateth drinketh ſufficeth ſuſtenance body certain doth ſinne alſo ſpeaketh needeth ſinne alſo hearkeneth benignely complainte poore alſo hee heale bodie woll faſt folk faſt without cauſe reaſonable alſo ſleepeth needeth cometh perchance late church werkes charitie alſo vſeth wife without ſoueraigne deſire engendrure honour god entent yeeld wife debte bodie alſo woll viſite ſicke priſoner may alſo loue wife child worldly thing reaſon requireth alſo flatter blandiſe ought neceſſitie alſo miniſh withdrawe almoſe poore alſo apparaile meat deliciouſly need eat haſtily lickorouſnes alſo talke vanity church god ſeruice talker idle word folly villanie ſhall yeeld accompts day doome alſo hee behighteth aſſureth doe thinges hee maie perfourme alſo hee lightneſſe folly miſſayeth ſcorneth neighbour alſo hath wicked ſuſpection thing hee ne wote ſothfaſtneſſe theſe thing mo without number ſinnes ſayth auguſtine nowe ſhall men vnderſtonde ſo none earthly manne may eſchewe veniall ſins yet may refrain hem brenning loue hath lord ieſu chriſt prayer confeſſion good workes ſo ſhall little grief ſaith auguſtine man loue god ſuch manner euer doth loue god loue god verily brenneth loue god looke much one droppe water doth fall great furnace full fire annoieth greueth brenning fire like manner annoieth greueth venial ſin vnto man ſtedfaſt perfite loue sauiour ieſu chriſt ferthermore men may alſo refraine put awaie veniall ſinne commening receiuing worthely ye body sauiour ieſu chriſt alſo taking holy water almoſedeed generall confeſſion confite maſſe complin bleſſings biſhops prieſts good workes de ſeptem peccatis mortalibus de eorum dependentiis circumſtantiis ſpeciebus expedient tell whiche ſeauen deadly ſinnes ſay chiefetaines ſinnes ren lee diuers manner called ſeauen ſinnes auaunting ipocriſie diſpite errogance impudence ſwelling hert inſolence elation impatience ſtrife contumacie preſumption irreuerence pertinacie vaineglorie many twig cannot declare inobedience diſobeyeth diſpite commaundements god ſoueraignes ghoſtly father auaunter boaſteth harme bounty y• hath done ipocrite hideth ſhew ſuch ſheweth ſeme ſuch diſpitous hath diſdain neibour ſaie euin chriſten hath diſpite ought errogance hee thinketh hee hath thoſe bounty hee hath weneth hee ſhoulde haue hem deſerts elſe deemeth impudent pride hath ſhame pride ne ſinne swelling heart man rejoyceth harme hath done inſolence diſpiſeth judgement folke regarde value cunning ſpeaking bering elation hee ne may neither ſuffer haue maiſter ne fellowe impatience woll taught ne rebuked vice ſtrife denyeth truth wittingly defendeth folly contumacie indignation ayenſt euerie aucthoritie power hem y• soueraines preſumption manne vndertaketh empriſe ought el may doe called ſurquidie irreuerence man doth honour ought looke reuerenced pertinacie men defende folly truſt much wit vaineglorie haue pomp delight temporall highneſſe glorye worldly eſtates iangling men ſpeak muche folke clappeth mill heaven certes till done amendment right god yaue bleſſing pharao ſeruice ioſeph laban ſeruice iacob right god yeue curſe ſuch lordeſhippes ſuſtaine wickedneſſe ſeruaunts come amendment pride table appeareth alſo full oft certes riche menne bee called feaſts poore folke put away rebuked alſo exceſſe diuers meates drinkes namely ſuch manner bake meates diſhe meates brenning wilde fire peinted
