body truely paſſeth full lightly alſo full oft occaſion ſickneſſe ſoul god wote fleſh great enemy ſoul therfore body whole peril fall alſo haue pride ſtrength body hie folly certes ye fleſh coueteth ayenſt ſpirite ſtrong fleſh ſorrier may ſoule ouer ſtrength body worldly hardineſſe cauſeth full ofte many man perill miſchaunce alſo pride gentry right great folly oft time gentry body taketh away gentry ſoule alſo father mother ben nature rotten corrupt rich poore forſooth manner gentry praiſe apparelleth mannes courage wit vertue morality maketh chriſts child truſt well ouer man ſinne hath mayſtry churle ſinne generall ſignes gentleneſſe eſchewing vice ribaudrye ſeruage ſinne word werke continuance vſing vertue courteſie cleaneneſſe bee liberall ſay large meaſure paſſeth meaſure folly ſin another remember bounty folk hath receiued another benigne good ſubjects wherefore ſaith senecke nothing couenable manne high eſtate debonairtie pity therefore theſe fly men call bee make king cheſe one hath pricke wherewith may ſting another manne haue noble heart dilligent attaine high vertuous thing certes manne haue pride y• good grace alſo outragious folly thoſe gift grace ſhould haue tourned goodneſſe medicine tourneth venome confuſion ſaith ſaint gregorie certes alſo ſo hath pride goodneſſe fortune full great foole ſometime manne great lord morne caitiffe wretche bee night ſometime rich man cauſe death sometime delices manne cauſe greeuous maladie dieth certes commendation ye people ſometime full falſe brotell truſt day praiſe morrow blame god wote deſire haue commendation people hath cauſed death manie buſie manne ſith ſo yee vnderſtond pride bee ſpeces whence ſourdeth ſpringeth yee ſhall vnderſtond remedie ayenſt humility meekeneſſe remedy ayenſt pride vertue thorow manne hath knowledge himſelfe holdeth himſelfe price ne daintie regard deſertes conſidering euer freelte three manner humility humility heart another humility mouth third work humility hert foure manner one man holdeth himſelfe nought worth god heauen ſecond deſpiſeth none man third hee ne recketh nat though men holde nought worth fourth ſorry humiliation alſo humility mouth four thing temperate ſpeech humility ſpeech confeſſeth mouth ſuch thinketh heart another praiſeth bounty another man nothing thereof miniſheth humilitie alſo werke four maners firſt putteth men ſecond theſe loweſt place ouer al third gladly aſſent good counſail fourth ſtond gladly award ſouereigns hier degre certain great werke humilitie ¶de invidia pride woll ſpeak foul ſin enuye worde philoſopher ſorowe men proſperitie worde saint auguſtine ſorow men weal ioy men harme foule ſinne platly ayenſt holy ghoſt ſo euerie ſinne ayenſt holy ghoſte yet natheleſſe much bountie appertaineth properly holy ghoſt enuy cometh properly malice therefore properly ayenſt bountie holye ghoſt hath malice two ſpeces ſay hardnes hart wickednes elſe fleſh manne ſo blind conſidreth ſinne recketh ſinne hardineſſe diuell ſpece enuie man dennieth trouth knoweth trouth alſo repenteth grace god hath yeue neighbour enuie certes enuie worſt ſin ſoothly ſins ſometime onely ayenſt ſpecial vertue certes enuy ayenſt vertues goodneſſe ſory ayenſt bounty neighbour manner diuers ſins ala ne ſin ne hath ſome delight ſelf ſaue enuy euer hath ſelf anguiſh ſorrow ſpeces enuy ben theſe firſt ſorrow mennes goodneſſe proſperitie proſperitie kindly matter joy enuy ſinne ayenſt kind ſecond ſpece enuy ioy mennes harme properly like ye diuell euer reioyſeth mannes harme theſe two backbiting detracting hath certain ſpeces thus manne praiſeth neighbor wicked entent maketh alway wicked knot laſt end alway maketh laſt end digne blame worth praiſing ſecond ſpece man good doth ſayth thing good intent ye backbiter woll turn goodneſſe vp ſo doun ſhrewd entent third amoniſh bountie neyghbour fourth ſpece backbiting menne ſpeak goodneſſe manne wol backbiter ſay perfay ſuch manne yet better diſpraiſing menne prayſe fifth ſpece conſent gladly herk gladly harm men ſpeak folk ſinne full great aye encreaſeth wicked entent ye backbiter backbiting commeth grutching murmuration ſometime ſpringeth impatience ayenſt god ſometime ayenſt manne ayenſt god man grutcheth ayenſt ye pain hel ayenſt pouertie loſſe cattel ayenſt rain tempeſt el grutcheth ſhrews haue proſperitie elſe good menne haue aduerſitie theſe thing ſhould menne ſuffer patiently come rightful judgment ordinaunce god sometime cometh grutching auarice iudas grutched ayenſt maudelein ſhe annointed head lord ieſu chriſt precious oyntment manner murmuring ſuch man grutcheth goodneſſe himſelf doth folk doen cattel sometime cometh murmure pride simon phariſee grutched ayenſt maudelein ſhe approched ieſu chriſt wept foot ſins ſometime ſourdeth enuie men diſcouer man harm priuy beareth hond thing falſe murmure alſo ofte among ſervaunts grutch ſouereigns bid hem lefull thinges much dare openly withſaye commaundment ſouereigns yet wol ſay harme grutche murmure priuely ſpight word call diuels pater noſter though ſo diuel neuer pater noſter lewd folke yeueth ſuch name sometime cometh yre priuie hate noriſheth rancour ye heart afterward ſhall declare cometh alſo bitterneſſe heart thorow bitterneſſe euery good deed neighbor ſemeth bitter unſauery cometh diſcord yt vnbindeth maner friendſhip commeth ſcorning neighbour doe neuer ſo well commeth accuſing man ſeeketh occaſion annoy neighbor like craft diuel waiteth daye night accuſe v cometh malignity manne annoieth neighbour priuily may maye algate wicked ſhall let brenne houſe priuily enpoiſon ſ • ea beaſtes ſemblable thing woll ſpeak remedie ayenſt foul ſin enuie firſt loue god principally louing neighbour himſelfe ſoothly one ne may without truſt well name thy neighbour thou ſhalt underſtand name thy brother certes haue one father fleſhly one mother ſay adam eue alſo one father ſpirituel god heauen thy neighbor art thou bound loue goodneſſe therefore ſayth god loue thy neighbor thy ſelf ſay ſaluation life ſoul moreouer thou ſhalt loue word benig • e admoniſhing chaſtiſing comfort noyaunces praye withal thy heart deede thou ſhalt loue ſuch wiſe thou ſhalt charitie thou woldeſt thine perſon therefore thou ne ſhalt damage wicked worde ne harm body ne cattel ne ſoul entiſing wicked enſample thou ſhalt deſire wife ne none thing vnderſtond alſo name neighbour comprehended enemy certes man ſhal loue enemy commandment god ſoothly thy friend thou ſhalt loue god ſay thine enemy ſhalt thou loue god ſake commandment reaſon man ſhould hate enemy forſoth god nold receiue v loue enemyes ayenſt three manner wrong enemy doth ſhall three thing thus ayenſt hate rancour heart ſhall loue heart ayenſt chiding wicked word ſhall pray enemy ayenſt wicked deed ſhal bounty chriſt ſayth loue enemy pray hem ſpeke harm hem chaſe purſue bounty hem hate lo thus commaundeth v lord ieſu chriſt enemy forſooth nature driueth v loue freends perfay enemy haue need loue freends need haue certes hem ſhall men goodneſſe certes deed haue remembraunce loue ieſus chriſte y• died enemy much loue greuous perfourm ſo much great merit therfore louing enemy hath confounded diuels venim right deuil confounded humilitie right ſo wounded death loue enemie certes loue medicine caſteth venim enuie fro man heart ſpeces place ſhall largely declared chapter following ¶de ira enuy woll diſcriue ſinne ire ſoothly ſo hath enuy upon neighbour anon woll commonly find matter wrath word deed ayenſt hath enuie well commeth ire pride enuie ſoothly proud enuious lightly wroth ſin ire diſriuing auſtin wicked auenged word deed ire philoſopher feruent blood man iquicked heart would harm hateth certes hart man eſchauſing moouing blood waxeth ſo troubled yt manner iudgment reaſon ye ſhall vnderſtond ire two manner one hem good wicked good ire jealouſie goodnes man wroth wickedneſſe ayenſt wickedneſſe therefore ſaith wiſe man yre bet play ire debonairte wrath without bitterneſſe wroth ayenſt man wroth miſdeed manne ſaith prophet dauid iraſcimini nolite peccare underſtond wicked ire two manner ſay ſodain yre haſty yre without auiſement conſenting reaſon meaning ſence ye reaſon manne ne conſent ſodain yre venial another yre ful wicked cometh felony heart auiſed caſt wicked vengeaunce thereto reaſon conſenteth ſoothly deadly ſinne yre ſo diſpleaſant god yt troubleth houſe chaſeth holy ghoſt man ſoul waſteth deſtroyeth likeneſſe god ſay ye vertue man ſoul putteth likeneſſe deuill taketh man fro god rightful lord ful great pleaſaunce deuil ye deuils forance eſchauſed y• fire hell certes right ſo fire mightie deſtroy earthly thing element right ſo ire mightie deſtroie ſpiritual thing look fire ſmall cole almoſt dead aſhen wol reuiue quick ayen ben touchen brimſtone right ſo yre woll euermore quick ayen touched pride couered man heart certes fire ne may come nothing firſt ſame thing naturally fire drawn flint ſteele right ſo pride many time matter yre right ſo rancour norice keeper ire manner tree ſayth ſaint iſodore man maketh fire ſaid tree couer coal aſhen ſoothly fire laſt yeer right ſo fareth rancour one conceiued y• heart ſome men certes woll laſt peraduenture one eaſter day another eaſter day certes ſame man full ferre mercie god foreſaid deuils fournace forge three ſhrewes pride aye bloweth encreaſeth fire chiding wicked word ſtondeth enuy holdeth hot yron fire vpon y• heart man payre long tongs long rancour ſtondeth ſin contumelie ſtrife cheſte battereth forgeth vilainous repreuings certes curſed ſin annoyeth man himſelf alſo neighbour ſoothly almoſt harm damage man doth neighbor cometh wrath certes outragious wrathe doth euer foule fend willeth commandeth ne ſpareth neither lord ieſu chriſt neither ſweet mother outragious anger yre ala ala full many diuers time feleth heart full wickedly chriſt alſo hallowes curſed vice yes certes ala taketh fro man wit reaſon debonaire life ſpirituel ſhould keep ſoul certes withdraweth alſo goddes due lordſhip man ſoul loue neighbor ſtriueth alſo day ayenſt trouth reaueth quiet heart ſubverteth ſoul ire cometh theſe ſtinking engendrures firſt hate old wrath diſcord thorow manne forſaketh old friend hath loued full long commeth war euery manner wrong man doth neighbour body cattel curſed ſin yre commeth alſo manſlaughter underſtond well homicide manſlaughter diuers wiſe manner homicide ſpirituell ſome bodily spirituell manſlaughter vi thing firſt hate ſayth saint iohn hateth brother homicide homicide alſo backbiting backbiting ſayth salomon haue two ſwerds ſlay neighbour ſoothly wicked take fro good name life homicide alſo yeuing wicked counſail fraud yeue counſayle areiſe wrongful cuſtoms talages ſayth salomon lion roring bear hungrie like cruel lord withholding abridging ſhepe hire wage seruaunts elſe vſurie withdrawing alms poore folke whiche wiſe manne ſayeth feedeth almoſt dyeth honger ſoothly feed ſlay theſe ben deadly ſins bodily manſlaughter thou ſleeſt thy tongue another manner thou commaundeſt ſlea man elſe yeueſt counſail ſlea man mauſlaughter indeed four manner one law right iuſtice dampueth culpable death let iuſtice beware doe rightfully delight ſpill blood keeping rightwiſeneſſe another homicide done neceſſitie man ſlayeth another defence ne may none otherwiſe eſcape without ſlaughter aduerſarie doth ſin ſhall bear pennaunce deadly ſin alſo man caſe aduenture ſhoot arrow caſt ſtone ſlaieth man homicide woman negligence ouerlyeth child ſleeping homicide deadly ſin alſo man diſturbleth conception child maketh woman either barren drinking venemous herbes ſhe may conceiue ſlaieth child drink elſe putteth certain material thing ſecret place ſlaie child elſe doth unkindly ſin man woman ſheddeth nature manner place child may conceiued elſe ſo woman hath conceiued hurteth ſelf miſhap childe ſlain yet homicide ſay thoſe woman murderen child becauſe eſchewing worldly ſhame certes horrible homicide homicide alſo manne approche woman deſire letchery thorow ye child periſhed el ſmiteth woman wittingly ſhe leſeth child theſe homicide horrible deadly ſinnes yet come ire mo ſinnes well worde thought deede arreteth upon god blameth god thing himſelf guilty deſpiſeth god hallows done curſed haſardors diuers country curſed ſin done fele hert full wickedly god halowes alſo treat unreuerently ſacrament aulter ſin ſo great y• vnneth may releaced mercy god paſſeth werks ſo great ſo benign commeth ire atterly anger man ſharply amoneſted ſhrift leaue ſin woll angrie aunſwere hokerly angerly defend excuſe ſin unſtedfaſtneſſe fleſhe elſe hold companie fellow el ſayth fiend enticed el doth youth el complexion ſo courageous may forbear el deſtinie ſayth unto certain age el ſayth cometh gentleneſſe aunceſtors ſemblable thing theſe manner folke ſo wrappe hem ſins ne woll deliver hemſelf ſoothly wight excuſeth himſelf wilfully ſinne may deliuered ſin till meekly beknoweth ſin commeth ſwearing expreſſe ayenſte commandment god befalleth often anger ire god ſayeth thou ſhalt take name thy lord god vaine idle alſo lord ieſu chriſt ſayeth word saint mathew ne ſhal ye ſwere manner nether heauen god trone ne yearth bence foot ne hieruſalem y• city great king ne thine head thou mayeſt make hayre neyther white ne black ſay word yea yea nay nay euil thus ſayeth chriſt chriſts ſake ſweare ſo ſinnefully diſmembring chriſt ſoul heart bone body certes ſeemeth ye thinke curſed iewes ne diſmembred ynough y• precious perſon chriſt ye diſmember ſo law compell ſwear ruleth y• law god ſwearing ſayeth ieremie iiii cap thou ſhalt keep three condition thou ſhalt ſwear trouth doome rightwiſenes ſay thou ſhalt ſwear ſooth euery leſing ayenſt chriſt chriſt trouth think well euery great ſwearer compelled lawfully ſwear y• plague ſhal depart fro hous uſeth ſuch unleful ſwearing thou ſhalt ſwear alſo dome thou art conſtrained thy doms man witnes trouth alſo thou ſhalt ſwear enuie neyther fauour neither mede reward rightwiſeneſſe declaring honour worſhip god ayding help thine euin chriſten therefore euery man taketh god name idle falſely ſweareth mouth el taketh name chriſt called chriſten man liueth ayenſt chriſts liuing teaching take god name idle look alſo ſayth ſaint peter actuum iiii capitu non eſt aliud nomen ſub coelo c none name ſayth ſaint peter heauen yeue men may ſaued ſay name ieſu chriſt take heed eke precious name ieſu chriſt ſayth poule ad philipenſes ii nomine jeſu c name ieſu euery knee heauenly creature earthly hell ſhould bow ſo high ſo worſhipful curſed fiend hell ſhould tremble hear named ſeemeth men ſwear ſo horribly bleſſed name deſpiſe boldly curſed iews el diuel trembleth heareth name certes ſith y• ſwearing lawfully done ſo highly defended much forſwearing falſely yet needleſſe ſay alſo hem delight hem ſwearing hold gentery manly deed ſwear great othes hem uſage ne ceaſe ſwear great othes cauſe worth ſtraw certes horrible ſin swearing ſuddainly alſo great ſin let u go horrible ſin ſwearing adiuration conjuration done theſe falſe enchauntours nigromanters baſins full water bright ſwerd circle fire ſhoulder bone ſheep cannot ſay doe curſedly damnably ayenſt chriſt faith holy church ſay hem beleeue deuinales flight noiſe bird beaſts ſorte geomancie dream chirking dores cracking houſes gnawing rat ſuch manner wretchedneſſe certes theſe thing defended god holy church accurſed till come amendment ſuch filth ſet beleeue charm wound maladie men beaſts take effect may peraduenture y• god ſuffereth folk ſhould yeue faith reuerence name woll ſpeak leaſings generally falſe ſignifiaunce word entent deceiue euin chriſtien leaſing commeth none aduantage wight ſome leaſing turneth profite eaſe man dammage another man another leaſing ſaue life cattel commeth delight lie delight woll forge long tale paint circumſtances tale ground falſe leaſing commeth woll ſuſtain word leaſing commeth retchleſneſſe without auiſement ſemblable thing let u touch vice flatterie ne cometh gladly dread couetiſe flatterie generally wrongful praiſing flatterer deuils nourices nouriſh child milk loſengerie forſooth salomon ſayth flatterie worſe detraction ſometime detraction maketh hautein man humble dreadeth detraction certes flattery maketh man enhaunce heart countenaunce flatterer deuils enchauntours make man wene himſelf like like thoſe like iudas betray man ſell enemy flatterer deuils chapleins ever ſing placebo reckon flattery vice ire oft time man wroth another woll flatter ſome wight ſuſtain quarrel speak ſuch curſing cometh irous hart maliſon generally may ſaid euery manner power harm ſuch curſing bereaueth man fro reign god ſayth poule oft time ſuch curſing wrongfully returneth ayen curſeth bird turneth neaſt ouer thing men ought eſchew curſe child yeue deuil engendrure ferre forth hem certes great peril great ſin let u ſpeak chiding reproch beene full great woundes mannes heart unſow ſeams friendſhip man heart certes vnneth may man plainly accorded openly hath reuiled repreued diſclaundred full ghoſtly ſin chriſt ſayth goſpel take heed repreueth neighbour either repreueth ſome harm pain hee hath upon bodie meſell crooked harlot ſome ſin doth yee repreue harm pain turneth repreue ieſu chriſt pain ſend rightwiſe ſond god ſufferaunce meſelrie maim maladie repreue uncharitably ſinne thou holour thou dronkelewe harlot ſo foorth pertaineth reioycing deuil euer hath ioy men doen ſin certes chiding may come villanous heart haboundance heart ſpeaketh mouth full oft ye ſhall underſtond look way man ſhall chaſtiſe correct another beware chiding repreuing truly beware may ful lightly quicken fire anger wrath ſhould quench peraduenture ſlaeth might chaſtiſe benignity ſaith salomon amiable tong tree life y• ſay life ſpirituel ſoothly diſſolute tong ſlaeth ſpirits repreueth alſo repreued lo ſayeth ſaint auguſtine nothing ſo like deuiis child oft chideth ſeruant god behoueth chide though chiding villanous thing betwixt maner folk yet certes moſt uncouenable man wife neuer reſt therefore ſaieth salomon houſe uncouered drooping chiding wife ben alike man dropping hous many place though eſchew dropping place droppeth another place fareth chiding wife ſhe chide one place ſhe wol chide another therefore better greatly pleaſant morſel little gobbet bread ioy houſe ſilled full delices chiding gnerring ſayeth salomon saint poule ſayth ye woman beth ye ſubiect husband behoueth ought god ye men loue wiues ad colonicences iii afterward ſpeak scorning wicked ſin namely ſcorneth man good werks certes ſuch ſcorners fare like foul tode may endure ſmell ſweet ſauour vine flouriſheth theſe ſcorners parting fellow deuil haue ioy deuil winneth ſorrow leſeth aduerſaries ieſu chriſt hate loueth ſay ſaluation ſoul speak wicked counſail traitour deceiueth truſteth vt achitophel ad salomonem natheleſſe yet wicked counſail firſt ayenſt himſelf ſayth wiſe man euery falſe liuing hath property himſelfe y• woll annoy another man annoyeth firſt himſelf men ſhall underſtond man ſhall take counſail falſe folk ne angry folk greuous folk ne folk loue ſpecially much worldly folk namely counſailing soul commeth ſin hem ſow make diſcord among folk ſin chriſt hateth utterly wonder died make concord ſhame chriſt crucified god loueth better friendſhip amongs folk body gaue vnitie therefore ben likened deuil euer make diſcord cometh ſin double tongue ſuch ſpeake fair folk wickedly behind elſe make ſemblaunt though ſpake good entention el game play yet ſpeak wicked entent commeth bewraying counſayle man defamed certes unneth may reſtore dammage commeth menace y• open folly oft menaceth threateth may perform full oft time commeth idle word without profite ſpeaketh word alſo hearkeneth word el idle wordes thoſe needleſſe without entent natural profite albeit idle word ſometime venial ſinne yet ſhould menne doubt hem ſhall yeue reckoning hem god cometh iangling may without ſinne ſayth salomon ſign apert folly therefore philoſopher ſaied men asked ſhould pleaſe people anſwered many good werkes ſpeak vanity cometh ſin yaperies deuils ape make folk laugh yaperie folk gaudes ape yapes defendeth ſaint poule look vertuous word holy comfort hem trauail ſeruice chriſt right ſo comforteth villainous word knack yapers hem trauail ſeruice deuil theſe ben ſins tongue come ire ſins ¶the remedie ayenſt ire remedy ayenſt ire vertue men call manſuetude debonairtie alſo another vertue men clepe patience ſufferaunce debonairtie withdraweth refraineth ſtirrings moouings man courage heart ſuch manner ne skip anger ne ire sufferaunce ſuffereth ſweetly annoyance wronges menne done man outward saint ierome ſayeth debonairte dooth harme wight ne ſayeth ne harme men doe ne ſay ne chafeth ayenſt reaſon vertue ſometime commeth nature ſayeth philoſopher manne quicke thinge nature debonaire treatable goodneſſe debonairty enformed grace worth patience another remedy ayenſt ire vertue y• ſuffereth ſweetly euery man goodneſſe wroth harm done philoſopher ſayth patience vertue ſuffreth debonairly outrage aduerſity euery wicked word vertue maketh man like god maketh god owne childe ſayeth chriſt vertue diſcomfiteth thine enemy therefore ſayeth wiſe man thou would vanquiſh thine enemie learn ſuffer thou ſhalt underſtond man ſuffereth four manner greeuances outward thing ayenſt four muſt haue four manner patience firſt greeuaunce wicked word ſuffereth ieſus chriſt without grutching full patiently iews deſpiſed full oft suffet thou therefore patiently wiſeman ſayth thou ſtriue foole though fool wroth though laugh alway thou ſhalt haue reſte greeuaunce outward haue dommage thy cattel ayenſt ſuffered chriſt full patiently deſpoyled life clothes third greeuaunce man haue harme body ſuffred chriſt full patiently paſſion fourth greeuaunce outragious labour werks wherefore ſay folk make ſeruaunts trauaile greeuouſly time holy day ſoothly doe great ſinne ayenſt ſuffred chriſt full patiently taught u patience bare upon bleſſed ſhoulders croſſe upon ſhould ſuffer deſpitous death may men learn patient certes chriſten patient loue ieſu chriſt reward bleſſed life perdurable certes old painems neuer chriſtened commended uſed vertue patience phyloſopher upon time would haue beate diſciple great treſpace moued brought rod beat childe child ſawe rod ſayd mayſter think ye woll beat thee ſayed mayſter thy correction forſooth ſayed child ye ought firſt correct ſelfe haue loſt patience offence child forſooth ſayd mayſter weeping thou ſayeſt ſooth haue thou rodde deare child correct mine impatience patience commeth obedience man obedient chriſt hem ought obedient chriſt underſtand well obedience perfite man dooth gladly haſtely good heart entirely ſhould doe obedience generally perform doctrine god ſoueraignes ought obeyſaunt rightwiſeneſſe ¶de accidia ſinnes enuy ire woll ſpeake ſinne accidie tor enuy blindeth heart man ire troubleth man accidie maketh heauy thoughtful penſife enuy ire maken bitterneſſe heart birterneſſe mother accidie taketh fro loue goodnes accidie anguiſh trouble heart auguſtine ſayth annoy goodneſſe annoy harme certes damnable ſinne dooth wrong ieſu chriſt much benummeth ſeruice y• men ought chriſt ſayth salomon accidie doth ſuch diligence doth thing annoy wrawneſſe ſlackneſſe excuſation idleneſſe unluſt book ſayth accurſed doth ſeruice god negligently accidie enemy euery eſtate man certes eſtate man three manner either eſtate innocency eſtate adam fell ſin eſtate hold work praiſing lauding god another eſtate eſtate ſinful men eſtate men ben holden labour praying god amendment ſins would grant hem riſe ſins another eſtate eſtate grace eſtate holden work penitence certes theſe thinges accidie contrary loueth buſineſſe certes foul ſin accidie alſo full great enemy liuelode body ne hath purueiaunce ayenſt temporel neceſſity forſloweth forſlogeth deſtroieth good temporel retchleſneſſe fourth thing accidie like hem paine hell becauſe ſloth heauines damned ben ſo bound may neyther well doe ne think accidie cometh firſt man annoied encombred goodnes maketh god hath abhomination ſuch accidie ſayth saint iohn commeth sloth woll ſuffer hardneſſe ne pennance ſoothly ſ • oth ſo tender ſo delicate ſayeth salomon woll ſuffer hardneſſe ne pennaunce therefore marreth doth ayenſt rotten ſin accidie ſloth ſhould men exerciſe hemſelfe uſe hem good workes manly vertuouſly catch courage thinking lord ieſu chriſt quiteth euery good deed neuer ſo lite vſage labour great thing maketh ſayeth bernard labourer haue ſtrong armes hard ſenewes ſloth maketh heeuy feeble tender commeth dread beginne worke good workes certes enclineth ſin thinketh ſo great empriſe undertake work goodneſſe caſteth heart circumſtances goodneſſe ſo greeuous weighty ſuffer dare undertake doe workes goodneſſe ſayeth saint gregorie commeth wanhope y• diſpair mercy god y• commeth ſometime much outragious ſorow ſometime much dread imagining hath doe ſo much ſinne woll auayle tho woud repent forſake ſinne deſpair dread abandonneth heart euery manner ſinne ſayth saint auguſtine dampnable ſinne continue unto end called ſinning holy ghoſt horrible ſin ſo perillous yt deſpaired ni fellonie ne ſinne doubteth ſheweth well iudas certes aboue ſinnes ſinne moſt diſpleaſaunt chriſt moſt aduerſarie sothly yt diſpaireth like coward champion recreaunt flieth without need ala ala needleſſe recreant needleſſe deſpaired certes mercy god euer ready y• penitent perſon aboue werks ala cannot man bethink y• goſpel luke xv whereas chriſt ſayeth well ſhall ioy heauen upon ſinful manne doeth penitence upon xcix rightful men need penitence look ſame goſpel ioy feaſt good man loſt ſonne ſonne retourned repentaunce father remember hem alſo ſayth saint luke chapi xx theefe hanged beſide ieſu chriſt ſayd lord remember thou commeſt thy reign forſooth ſaid chriſt ſay thee day ſhalt thou paradiſe certes none ſo horrible ſinne manne ne may life deſtroyed penitence vertue paſſion death chriſt ala need men deſpaired ſith mercy ſo ready large ask haue cometh sompnolence ſluggie ſlumbring maketh man heauie dull body ſoul ſinne commeth ſloth certes time way reaſon man ſhould ſleep morrow cauſe reaſonable ſoothly morrow tide moſt couenable man ſay prayer thank god honour god yeue almoſe poor commeth firſt name ieſu chriſt lo ſayeth salomon ſo woll morow awake ſeek ſhall find commeth negligence retchleſnes recketh nothing though y• ignorance mother harm certes negligence norice negligence ne doth force ſhall thing whether well euil remedie theſe two ſinnes ſayth wiſe man dreadeth god ſpareth ought loueth god woll doe dilligence pleaſe god werkes abandon himſelfe might well doe cometh idleneſſe yate harm idle manne like place hath wals deuil may enter euery ſide ſhoot diſcouerte temptation euery ſide idleneſſe thorruke wicked villainous thought ordure certes heauen yeue hem labour idle folk alſo dauid ſayeth ne labour men ne ſhall whipped men ſay purgatorie certes ſeemeth ſhall tormented deuils hell pennaunce commeth ſinne men call tarditas man ſo latered tarrying woll tourn god certes great folly like falleth ditch woll ariſe vice commeth falſe hope thinketh ſhall liue long hope fayleth full oft commeth locheſſe beginneth good work anone woll leaue ſtint done haue perſon gouern ne take heed anon find contrary annoy theſe ben new ſheepheards let ſheepe wittingly goe ren wolfe breres force gouernaunce commeth pouerte deſtruction ſpirituel temporel thing commeth manner coldneſſe freeſeth hart man commeth undeuotion man ſo blont ſayeth bernard hath ſuch langour ſoul may neyther read ne ſing holy church ne hear ne think deuotion ne trauail honds good work ni unſauory apalled wexeth ſlow slombry ſoon woll wroth ſoon enclined hate enuy commeth ſinne worldly ſorrow ſuch called triſtitia ſtaeth man ſayth saint poule certes ſuch ſorrow worketh death ſoul body alſo thereof commeth man annoyed life wherefore ſuch ſorrow ſhorteth full oft life man ere time come way kind remedium contra peccatum accidiae ayenſt horrible ſinne accidie braunches ſame vertue yt called fortitudo ſtrength man deſpiſeth annoyous thing vertue ſo mightie ſo rigorous dare withſtond mightily wiſely keep himſelfe fro peril wicked wraſtle ayenſt aſſaults deuill enchaunceth enforceth ſoule right accidie abateth maketh feeble fortitude may endure long ſufferaunce trauails ben couenable vertue hath many ſpeces firſt called magnanimitie ſay great courage certes behoueth great courage ayenſt accidie leaſt ne ſwallow ſoule ſin ſorrow deſtroy wanhope certes vertue maketh folke undertake hard greeuous thinges wiſely reaſonably much deuill fighteth ayenſt manne ſubtilty ſleight ſtrength therefore ſhall man withſtand wit reaſon diſcretion vertues fayth hope god ſaints follow accompliſh good workes purpoſeth fermely continue commeth ſuretie ſikerneſſe manne ne doubteth trauail time comming good workes hath begun commeth magnificence ſay man doeth performeth great work goodneſſe hath begun end menne ſhould doe good workes accompliſhing good workes lyeth great guerdon conſtaunce ſtablenes courage ſhould heart ſtedfaſt faith mouth bearing chere deed mo ſpeciall remedy ayenſt accidie diuers work conſideration paine hell ioyes heauen truſt grace holy ghoſt yeue might performe good entent ¶de avaricia accidie woll ſpeak auarice couetiſe ſin saint poule ſayth root harmes couetiſe ad timoth vi ſoothly heart man confounded ſelf troubled ſoul hath loſt comfort god ſeketh ſole ſollace worldly thing auarice deſcription auguſtine licorouſneſſe heart haue earthly thing folke ſay auarice purchaſe many yearthly thing nothing yeue hem haue need underſtand auarice ſtandeth land ne cattel ſometime ſcience glory euery manner outragious thing auarice couetiſe couetiſe couet ſuch thing thou haſt auarice withhold keep ſuch thing thou haſt without right soothly auarice ſin full dampnable holy writ curſeth ſpeaketh ayenſt yt vice doth wrong ieſu chriſt taketh fro loue men owe tourneth backward ayenſt reaſon maketh auaricious man hath hope cattel ieſu chriſt doth obſeruaunce keeping treaſour doth ſeruice ieſu chriſt therefore ſayeth saint poule ad epheſios quinto auaricious man thraldom idolatrie difference betwixt idolater auaricious man idolaſter peraduenture ne hath maumet two auaricious man hath many certes euery florein cofer maumet certes ſin maumetrie firſt god defended x commaundment beareth witneſſe exodi capi xx thou ſhalt haue falſe goddes ne thou ſhalt make thee grauen thing thus auaricious man loueth treaſure god idolaſter curſed ſin auarice couetiſe commeth theſe hard lordſhips ben ſtrained tallages cuſtoms cariages dutie reaſon elſe take bondman amerciaments might reaſonably called extortion merciamentes amerciaments raunſoming bondman ſome lord ſtewards ſay rightful much churl hath temporel thing ne lord ſay certes theſe lordſhips wrong bereaue bondman thing neuer yaue hem auguſtinus de ciuitate dei libro ix sooth condition thraldom firſt cauſe thraldom ſin thus may ye ſee offence deſerued thraldome nature wherefore theſe lord ne ſhould much glorifie hem lordſhips ſith natural condition lord ouer thrals thraldome came firſt deſert ſin ouer law ſayth temporal good bondfolk good lord yea underſtond good emperour defend hem right rob hem ne reue hem therefore ſayeth seneca thy prudence ſhould liue benignely thrals thoſe thou calleſt thy thrals god people humble people chriſts friend contubernial lord think alſo ſuch ſeed churl ſpring ſuch ſeed ſpring lord well may y• churl ſaued lord ſame death taketh churl ſuch death taketh lord wherefore rede right ſo churle thou wouldſt yt thy lord thee thou plight euery ſinful man churl ſin rede lord certes yt thou werk ſuch wiſe thy churl rather loue thee dread thee wote well degree aboue degree reaſon skill men deuoir due certes extortion deſpight underling damnable furthermore underſtand well theſe conqueror tyrant make full oft thrals hem born royal blood hem conquere name thraldome neuer erſt know till noe ſaied ſon cham ſhould thral brother ſin ſay hem pill doe extortion holy church certes ſwerd men yeue firſt knight new dubbed ſignifieth ſhould defend holy church robbe pill ſo doeth traitour chriſt ſaith auguſtine deuils wolues ſtrangle ſheepe ieſu chriſt done worſe wolues ſoothly wolfe hath full womb ſtinteth ſtrangle ſheep ſoothly pillours deſtroyers holy church good ne doe ſo ne ſtint neuer pill haue ſaied ſith ſo ſin firſt cauſe thraldome thus time world ſin world thraldome ſubjection certes ſith time grace came god ordained ſome folk ſhould high eſtate degree ſome folk low ech ſhould ſerued eſtate therefore ſome country thrals haue tourned hem fayth make thrals free thraldome therefore certes lord oweth man man oweth lord pope calleth himſelf ſeruaunt ſeruants god eſtate holy church ne might haue ne common profite might haue kept ne peace ne reſt earth god ordained ſome man haue higher degre ſome men lower therefore ſoueraignty ordained keep maintain defend underling ſubiects reaſon fer forth lyeth power deſtroy ne confound hem wherefore ſay thoſe lord like wolues deuoure poſſeſſions cattel poor folk wrongfully without mercy meaſure ſhall receiue ſame meaſure haue meaſured poor folk y• meaſure ieſu chriſt amended commeth deceit betwixt marchaunt marchaunt thou ſhalt underſtond yt marchaundiſe two manner one bodily ghoſtly one honeſt leful diſhoneſt unleful bodily marchaundiſe leful honeſt god hath ordained reigne countrey ſuffiſaunt himſelfe honeſt lefull haboundance countrey menne helpe another countrey needy therefore muſt marchaunts bring fro one countrey marchaundiſe marchaundiſe menne haunten fraude trecherie deceit leaſinges falſe othes right curſed dampnable eſpirituell marchaundiſe properly simonie ententiue deſire buy thing eſpirituell thing appertayneth ſanctuarie god cure ſoule deſire ſo manne diligence perfourme deſire ne take none effect yet deadly ſin ordered irregular certes simonie called simon magus would haue bought temporel cattel yeſt god yeue holyghoſt saint peter apoſtles therefore vnderſtond ſelleth buyeth thing eſpirituell ben called simoniackes cattell procuring fleſhly praier frends fleſhly frends eſpirituell frends fleſhly two manner kinred frends soothly pray worthy able simonie take benefice worthy able none manner man woman prayeth folke auaunce hem wicked fleſhly affection haue vnto perſons foul simonie certes ſeruice menne yeuen thing eſpirituell vnto ſeruaunts muſt vnderſtond y• ſeruice muſt honeſt el alſo without bargaining perſon able ſaith saint damaſen ſinnes world regard ſinne thing nought greateſt ſinne may ſin lucifer antichriſt ſinne god forleſeth church soule hee bought precious blood hem yt yeue church hem worthy put theeues honds ſteale ſoules ieſu chriſt deſtroy patrimonie ſuch vnworthy prieſts curate haue leaud menne leſſe reuerence sacrament holy church ſuch yeuers church put child chriſt put y• church diuels owne ſonnes ſell ſoules lamb ſhould keep wolf ſtrangleth hem therfore ſhall neuer haue part paſture lambes bliſſe heauen cometh haſardry apertenaunces table rafles cometh deceit falſe oths chiding rauenous blaſphemings renyings god hate neyghbours waſt good miſpending time ſometime manſlaughter certes haſardours ne mow bee without greate ſinne auarice commeth alſo leaſinges theft falſe witneſſe falſe othes ye ſhall vnderſtond theſe bee great ſinnes expreſſe ayenſt commaundements god haue ſayd falſe witneſſe word alſo deede worde bereaue thy neighbour good name thy falſe witneſſe bereaue cattell heritage thy falſe witneſſing thou ire meede enuie beareſt falſe witneſſe accuſeſt excuſeth thy ſelf falſely ware ye queſtmongers notary certes falſe witneſſing suſan full great ſorrowe paine many another mo ſinne theft alſo expreſſe ayenſt god heſt two manner corporell ſpirituell temporell theft take thy neighbour cattell ayenſt force ſleight mette meaſure ſtealing alſo falſe enditements vpon borrowing thy neighbour cattell entent neuer pay ayen ſemblable thing eſpirituell theft ſacrilege ſay hurting holy thing ſacred chriſt two manner reaſon holy place church churchyard euery villainous ſinne men done ſuch place may called ſacrilege euery violence ſemblable place alſo withdrawe falſely rightes long holy church pleaſing generally ſacriledge reue holy thing fro holy place vnholy thing holy place holy thing vnholy place revelatio contra peccatum avaritiae ſhall ye vnderſtond releeuing auarice miſericorde pitty largely taken men might aske miſericorde pitty releeuing auarice certes auaricious man ſheweth pitty ne miſericorde needfull man delighteth keping treaſure reſcuing ne releeuing euin chriſten therefore ſpeake firſt miſericorde miſericorde ſaith phyloſopher vertue courage man ſtirred miſeaſe diſeaſed vpon miſericorde followeth pity performing fulfiling charitable workes mercie helping comforting miſeaſed certes theſe thing moue ſtir man miſericorde ieſu chriſt yaue himſelfe offence ſuffered death miſericorde foryaue v original ſins thereby releaſed v fro pain hell miniſhed y• pain purgatory penitence yeueth grace well laſt bliſſe heauen ſpeces miſericorde ben lene alſo yeue foryeue releaſe haue pity heart compaſſion miſcheef euin chriſten alſo chaſtiſe need another manner remedy ayenſt auarice reaſonable largeſſe ſoothly behooueth conſideration grace ieſu chriſt temporell goodes alſo goodes perdurable ieſu chriſt yaue v haue remembrance death ſhall receiue knoweth ne alſo ſhall forgo hath ſaue onely hath expended good werkes much ſome folk ben vnmeaſurable men ought auoyd eſchewe fooliſh largeſſe whiche ſome people call waſte certes foole large yeueth cattell leſeth cattell soothly thing yeueth vaineglory minſtrels folke beare renome world hath ſinne thereof none almeſſe certes leſeth foule good ne ſeeketh yeft good nothing ſinne like horſe ſeeketh rather drink drouy troubled water drink water cleare well hem appertainen ſaid curſing chriſt ſhall yeue day doome hem ſhall damned ¶sequitur de gula auarice cometh glotenie expreſſe ayenſt commandement god glotenie vnmeaſurable appetite eate drinke el ynough vnmeaſurable appetite diſordained couetiſe eat drink ſinne corrupteth world well ſhewed ſinne adam eue looke alſo ſaith ſaint poul glotenie many ſaith gone haue often ſaid ſay weeping enemy croſſe chriſt end death womb god glory confuſion hem ſo deuour earthly thinges vſed ſin glotenie ne may ſin withſtond muſt ſeruage vice deuils hourd hideth reſteth ſinne hath many ſpeces firſt dronkenneſſe horrible ſepulture man reaſon therefore manne dronke hath loſt reaſon deadly ſinne ſoothly man wont ſtrong drinke peraduenture ne knoweth ſtrength drinke hath feebleſſe head hath trauayled drinketh ſuddainely caught drinke deadly ſinne veniall ſecond ſpece glotenie ſpirit manne wexeth troubled dronkenneſſe bireaueth diſcretion wit third manner ſpece glotonie man deuoureth meat hath rightfull manner eating fourth great abundance meat humour body diſtempered fifth foryetfulneſſe much drinking ſometime man forgetteth ere morning euening manner diſtinct ſpeces glotonie gregorie firſt eat time eat ſecond man giueth delicate meat drink third men take much ouer meaſure fourth curioſitie great entent make appareill meat fift eat greedily theſe ben fiue finger deuils hond draweth folke ſinne ¶the remedie ayenſt glotenie ayenſt glotenie remedie abſtinence ſaith galiene hold meritorious heale body saint auguſtine woll abſtinence done vertue patience abſtinence ſaith little worth man haue good thereto enforced patience charitie men god ſake hope haue bliſſe heauen fellowes abſtinence bee attemperaunce holdeth meane thing alſo shame eſcheweth diſhoneſtie suffiſaunce ſeeketh rich meates ne drinkes ne doth force outragious appaireling meat meaſure alſo reſtraineth reaſon vnmeaſurable appetite eating soberneſſe alſo reſtrayneth outrage drinke sparing alſo reſtrayneth delicate eaſe ſit long meat wherefore ſome folke ſtanden owne eate becauſe woll eate leſſe leaſure ¶de luxutia glotenie commeth letcherie theſe two ſins ſo nigh couſins oft time woll depart god wot ſin full diſpleaſant god forſaid himſelfe letcherie therefore putteth great paine ayenſt ſin old law woman thrall take ſin ſhe ſhould beat ſtaues death ſhe gentlewoman ſhe ſhould ſlaine ſtones ſhe biſhops doughter ſhe ſhould brent god commaundement moreouer ſin lechery god drowned world brent fiue city thunder lightning ſanke hem hell let v ſpeak ſaid ſtinking ſin lecherie men call auoutrie wedded folk ſay one hem ben wedded el saint iohn ſaith auouterers ſhall hell ſtacke bre • ning fire brimſtone ſtenche ordure certes breaking ſacrament horrible thing made god himſelf paradiſe confirmed ieſus chriſt witneſſeth saint mathew goſpell man ſhall leue father mother take wife ſhall two one fleſh sacrament betokeneth knitting together chriſt holye church onely god forbade auoutrie indeede alſo commaunded thou ſhouldeſt couet thy neighbour wife heſte ſaith saint auguſtine forbode manner couetiſe letcherie lo ſaith saint mathew goſpell ſo ſeeth woman couetiſe luſt hath done lecherie heart may ye ſee onely deed ſinne forboden alſo deſire ſin curſed ſin annoyeth greeuouſly hem haunt firſt ſoule obligeth ſin pain death perdurable body annoyeth greeuouſly alſo drieth waſteth ſhenteth blood maketh ſacrifice fiend hell waſteth cattell ſubſtaunce certes foule thing man waſte cattell woman yet fouler thing ſuch ordure woman diſpend vpon men cattell ſubſtaunce ſin ſaith prophet taketh man woman good fame honour full delectable pleaſant deuill thereby winneth part wretched world right marchant delighteth moſt chaffare hath moſt aduauntage profite right ſo delighteth fiend ordure hond deuil fiue finger catch people villanie firſt fooliſh looking fooliſh woman fooliſh man ſ • aeth right baſilicocke cocatrice ſtingeth ſodenly ſleeth enueniming ſo toucheth warme pitch blemiſheth finger third foule word fareth like fire right anone brenneth heart fourth finger kiſſing truely great foole would kiſſe mouthe brenning ouen fournace fooles ben kiſſe villainy mouth mouth hell namely theſe old dotardes holours woll kiſſe flicker buſie hemſelfe tho may nought certes like hound hound cometh nye roſer bench thoughe ſo bee maye piſſe yet woll heaue vp leg make countenaunce piſſe manie man weeneth hee maye ſinne licorouſneſſe doth wife truely opinion falſe god wote man maye ſlee himſelfe owne knife make himſelfe drunke owne tunne certes wife childe worldly thing yt loueth god maumette idolaſter man ſhould loue wife diſcretion patiently attemperately ſhee though ſuſter fifth finger ye diuels hond ſtinking deed lecherie truly fiue finger gluttonie diuel putteth womb man fiue finger lecherie hee grypeth rein throw furnace hell ſhall haue fire wormes euer ſhall laſt weping wayling ſharpe hunger thurſt grimneſſe diuels ſhall tread hem withouten end lechery ſayd ſourdeth ſpringeth diuers ſpeces fornication man woman bee married deadly ſinne ayenſt nature enemie diſtruction nature ayenſt nature perfay reaſon man telleth well alſo deadly ſinne much god forbad lecherie saint paule yeueth hem reigne ni dewe wight hem done deadly ſinne another ſinne lecherie bereaue maid maidenhead y• ſo doth certes caſteth mayden y• higheſt degre preſent life bereaueth precious fruicte boke calleth hundreth fruit ne ſaye none otherwiſe engliſh latine hight centeſimus fructus certes ſo doth y• cauſe many damage villanies mo man recken right cauſe many damage ſometime beaſtes field breake hedge ye cloſure deſtroyeth may reſtored certes may maydenhead reſtored arme ſmitte fro bodie may returne ayen waxe may haue mercy wote well ſhe haue penitence neuer ſhall ſhe na corrupt ſo haue ſpoke ſomewhat auoutrie alſo good ſhew perilles long auoutrie eſchew foul ſinne auoutrie latine ſay approaching another mannes bedde whiche thoſe ſometime one fleſh abandone body perſons ſinne ſayeth wiſe man follow many harmes firſt breaking fayth certes fayth key chriſtendome fayth broke loſt ſoothly chriſtendom ioſeph lordes wife prayed villainy ſayde lo lady lord hath take vnder warde hath world ne nothing thing power onely ye wife ſhould doe wickedneſſe ſin ſo horrible ayenſt god ayenſt lord god forbede ala little ſuche trouth nowe found third harm ſilth breake commaundement god defoyle auter matrimonie chriſt certes ſo much sacrament marriage ſo noble ſo digne ſo much greater ſin break god made mariage paradiſe eſtate innocencie multiplie mankinde ſeruice god therefore breaking therof greeuous breaking come falſe heir oft time wrongfully occupie folk heritage therefore woll chriſt put hem reign heauen heritage good folk breaking commeth alſo oft time folk vnware wed ſinne kinrede namely theſe harlot haunt brodels theſe foul woman may likened commune gong whereas men purge ordure ſay alſo putours liue horrible ſinne putrie conſtrain woman yeue hem certain rent bodely puterie yea ſometime wife childe done theſe baud certes theſe curſed ſins vnderſtond alſo aduoutrie ſet gladly ten commaundements theft manſlaughter greateſt theft may theft body ſoul like homicide kerueth atwo breaketh atwo hem firſt made one fleſh therefore old law god ſhould ſlaine natheleſſe law ieſu chriſt fare woman right one free bull ynough town right ſo wicked prieſt corruption ynough pariſh countrey theſe prieſts ſayth booke ne cannot miniſter myſtery prieſthood people ne knowe god ne held hem apayed ſaith book ſodden fleſh hem offered took force y• fleſh raw certes ſo theſe ſhrews ne held hem apayed roſted ſodde fleſh people fedde hem great reuerence woll haue raw fleſh folkes wiues doughters certes theſe woman conſent harlottrie done great wrong chriſt holy church hallowes soules bireaue theſe hem ſhould worſhip chriſte holye church pray chriſtian soul therefore haue ſuch prieſts lemmans alſo conſent lecherie curſing court chriſtian till come amendment third ſpece auoutrie ſometime betwixt manne wife take regard aſſembling onely fleſhly delight ſaith saint ierom ne reckon nothing ben aſſembled becauſe ben married good ynough thinke ſuch folke hath diuell power ſaid angel raphael tobie aſſembling put ieſu chriſt heart yeue hemſelfe ordure fourth ſpece aſſembly hem ben one affinity elſe hem father kinred dealed ſin lechery ſinne maketh hem like houndes take kepe kinrede certes parentele two manner either ghoſtly fleſhly ghoſtly deal godſib right ſo engendreth child fleſhly father right ſo godfather father eſpirituell woman may leſſe ſinne aſſemble godſib owne fleſhly father fifth ſpece abhominable ſinne abhominable ſinne man vnneth ought ſpeake ne write natheleſſe openly rehearſed holy writ curſed ſin doen men woman diverſe entent diver manner though holy writ ſpeake horrible ſinne certes holy writ may defoyled ſunne ſhineth dunghill another ſinne appertaineth lechery commeth ſleeping ſin commeth often hem maiden alſo hem corrupt ſinne men call pollution commeth three manner sometime languiſhing body humour rank habundant body man ſometime infirmity feblenes ye vertue retentife phyſicke maketh mention sometime ſurfet meat drink ſometime villainous thought encloſed mannes mind goeth ſleepe may without ſinne whiche men muſt keepe hem wiſely elſe may men ſin full greevouſly ¶remedium contra peccatum luxuriae cometh remedy ayenſt lechery general chaſtite continence reſtrain diſordinate mevings come fleſhly talent euer greater merite ſhall moſt reſtraineth wicked chauſinges ordour ſin two manner ſay chaſtite mariage chaſtite widdowhood ſhalt thou vnderſtonde matrimony leful aſſembling man woman receiuen vertue sacrament bonde whiche may departed life yt ſay live ſaith book full great ſacrament god made ſaid paradiſe wold himſelfe borne mariage hallow mariage wedding whereas tourned water wine firſt miracle wrought earth diſciples true effecte marriage clenſeth fornication repleniſheth holy church good linage end mariage chaungeth deadly ſin veniall ſin hem wedded maketh heart one hem wedded well body mariage eſtabliſhed god ere ſinne began natural lawe right point paradice ordained man ſhould haue woman woman man ſayeth ſaint auguſtine many reaſons firſt mariage figured betwixt chriſt holy church another man head woman alway ordinaunce ſhould ſo woman moe men one ſhould ſhe haue moe head one right horrible ſinne god alſo woman mighte pleaſe ſo many folke one alſo ſhould neuer reſt ne quiet among hem hem would aske owne right furthermore manne ſhould know engendrure ne ſhould haue heritage woman ſhould leſſe beloued cometh man ſhould bere wife namely two thing ſay ſufferaunce reuerence ſhewed chriſt firſt made woman ne made head adam ſhe ſhould claim great lordſhippe woman hath maiſtry ſhe maketh much variaunce need mo enſamples experience day ought inough ſuffice alſo certes god ne made woman foot adam ſhe ſhould hold lowe ſhe cannot patiently ſuffer god made woman rib adam woman ſhould fellow unto man man ſhould bear wife faith trouth loue ſayth ſaint poul man ſhold loue wife chriſt loveth holy church loued ſo wel dyed ſo ſhould man wife neede woman ſhould ſubiect husband telleth ſaint peter firſt obedience alſo ſayth decree woman wife long ſhe wife ſhe hath none authority ſwear ne bear witneſſe without leaue husband lord alway ſhould ſo reaſon ſhould alſo ſerue honeſtie attemperate array woll well ſhould ſet entent pleaſe husbonds queintiſe array saint ierom ſayth wiues apparelled like precious purple ne mow cloth hem ieſu chriſt gregorie ſayth alſo yt wight ſeeketh precious aray vainglory honoured people great folly woman haue great aray outward ſelf foul inward wife ſhould alſo meaſurable looking bearing laughing diſcreet wordes deed worldly thing ſhe ſhould loue husbonde heart true body ſo ſhould husbond wife ſith body husbonds ſo ſhould heart el betwixt hem two perfit mariage ſhall men underſtond three thing man wife fleſhly may aſſemble firſt entent engendrure child ſervice god certes cauſe final matrimony another cauſe yeeld hem debt body neither hem hath power owne body third eſchew lechery villany fourth ſooth deadly ſinne firſt meritorie ſecond alſo ſaith decree ſhe hath merit chaſtitie yeeldeth husbond debt body yea though ayenſt liking luſt heart third manner venial ſin truly ſcarcely may theſe without venial ſin corruption y• delight fourth maner underſtond aſſemble onely amorous love none foreſaid cauſes accompliſh brenning delight recke oft ſoothly deadly ſin ſorrow ſome folke woll paine hem appetite ſuffiſeth ſecond manner chaſtity clean widow eſchew embracing man deſire embracing ieſu chriſt theſe ben thoſe ben wife forgot husbonds alſo woman yt done lechery received penitence certes wife could kepe chaſt licence husband ſo y• ſhe yeve never none occaſion yt offend great merit manner woman obſerveth chaſtity clothing countenance abſtinent eating drinking ſpeaking dead ſhe veſſel bore bleſſed magdelain yt fulfilleth holy church good odour third maner chaſtitie virginity behooveth ſhe holy heart clean body ſhe ſpouſe ieſu chriſt ſhe life angel ſhe praiſing world ſhe theſe martyr egallity ſhe hath tongue may tell ne heart think virginity bare lord ieſu chriſt virgin himſelfe another remedy againſt lechery ſpecially withdraw ſuch thing yeve occaſion villany eaſe eating drinking certes pot boyleth ſtrongly beſt remedy withdraw fire sleping long great quiet alſo great nourice lechery another remedy ayenſt lechery man woman eſchew company hem doubteth tempted al ſo deed withſtond yet great temptation soothly white wall although ne bren fully ſticking candle yet wall black flame full oft time rede man truſt perfection ſtronger sampſon holier daniel wiſer salomon declared ſeven deadly ſinnes ſome braunches remedy soothly could would tell ten commaundements ſo high doctrine put divine natheleſſe hope god ben touched treatiſe hem ¶sequitur ſecunda par poenitentiae much ſecond part penitence ſtont confeſſion mouth began firſt chap ſay auguſtine ſaith sin every word every deed men conject againſt law ieſu chriſt ſinne heart mouth deed fiue wit ben ſight hearing ſmelling taſting ſavour feeling good vnderſtand agregeth much every ſinne thou ſhalt conſider thou art doeſt ſinne whether thou male female young old gentle thrall free ſeruaunt whole ſick wedded ſingle ordred vnordred wiſe foole clerke ſeculer ſhe thy kindred bodily ghoſtly thy kindred ſinned many mo thing another circumſtaunce whether doen fornication advoutry manner homicide horrible great ſinnes ſmall long thou haſt continued ſinne third circumſtaunce place thou haſt done ſin whether mennes houſes thine field church churchyard church dedicate church hallowed man woman ſpili kinde within place way ſinne wicked temptation church enterdicted prieſt ſuch villany tearme life ſhould ſing maſſe ſhould deadly ſin every time ſo ſung maſſe fourth circumſtaunce whiche mediatours meſſengers enticement conſentment beare companie fellowſhippe many wretch bear companie woll goe diuel hell wherefore egge conſent ſin ben partner ſinne temptation ſinner fifth circumſtaunce many time hath ſinned minde oft hath fallen hee oft falleth ſin diſpiſeth mercy god encreaſeth ſin unkind chriſte hee waxeth feeble withſtand ſin ſinneth lightly latter riſeth ſlow ſhriue namely confeſſor folke fall ayen old folly either leaue old confeſſor elſe depart ſhrift diuers partes ſoothly ſuche departed ſhrift deſerueth mercie god ſins ſixt circumſtance man ſinneth temptation himſelfe procure temptation exciting folk ſinne woman force aſſent woman maugre head haue aforced none ſhall ſhe tell wheder couetiſe pouerty procurement ſuch thing ſeventh circumſtance manner hath doe ſinne ſhe hath ſuffered folke doe ſame ſhall man tell plainly circumſtaunces wheder hath ſinned common bordell woman non doen ſin holy time non faſting time non ſhrift latter ſhrift hath peradventure broke thereby penance enjoyned whoſe helpe whoſe counſaile ſorcery craft muſt told theſe thing great ſmale grudge y• conſcience man woman eke prieſt thy judge may better adviſed judgement yeuing penaunce thy contrition underſtond well time man hath defoyled baptime ſinne woll come ſaluation none way pennaunce ſhrifte ſatisfaction namely two confeſſour may ſhriue third life performe ſhall man loke conſider woll make true profitable confeſſion muſt four condition firſt muſt ſorrowfulneſſe hert ſaith king ezechiell god woll remember year life bitterneſſe heart condition bitterneſſe hath fiue ſignes firſt confeſſion muſt ſhamefaſt cover ne hide ſinne hath offended lord god defoyled ſoule hereof ſaith auguſtin heart travaileth ſhame ſinne hath great ſhamefaſtneſſe worthy haue great mercy god confeſſion publican would heave eyen heaven offended god heaven ſhamefaſtneſſe anon mercy god thereof ſaith ſaint auguſtine ſuch ſhamefull folk next foryeueneſſe mercy another ſigne humility confeſſion ſayth ſaint peter humbleth vnder might god hond god ſtrong inconfeſſion therby god foryeueth thee thy ſinnes alone hath power humility ſhall hert outward ſignes right hath humility god hert right ſo ſhould humble body outward prieſt ſitteth god ſtead manner ſith chriſt ſoueraigne prieſt mean mediatour betwixt chriſt ſinner ſinner loſt way reaſon ſhould ſinner ſitte hye confeſſour kneel foot ſickneſſe cauſe ſhall take heed ſitteth whoſe place ſitteth manne hath treſpaſſed lord commeth ask mercy make accord ſitteth men would hould outragious worthy ſo ſoone remiſſion treſpaſſe third ſigne thy ſhrifte ſhould full teares thou may thou may weepe thy bodily eyen weepe thine heart confeſſion ſaint peter forſake ieſus chriſt went wept full bitterly fourth ſigne thou ne lette ſhame ſhew thy confeſſion confeſſion magdalein ne ſpared ſhame hein feaſt go lord ieſu chriſt beknow ſinnes fifth ſigne manne woman obeyſaunt receive pennaunce yt hem injoyned certes ieſu chriſt offence man obedient death ſecond condition confeſſion haſtily done certes man deadly wound euer lenger taryeth heale himſelf would corrupt haſte death alſo wound would y• worſe hele right ſo fareth ſinne longe time man unſhewed certes man ought haſtely ſhew ſins manie cauſes dread death commeth oft ſodainely certain time ſhall ne place alſo drenching ſinne draweth another alſo lenger tarrieth farther fro chriſt abide laſt day ſcarcely may ſhriue remember ſins repent greeuous maladie death much ne hath life hearkened ieſu chriſt hath ſpoken ſhall crie ieſus chriſt laſt daie ſcarcely woll hearken underſtonde condition muſte haue foure thinges thy ſhrift muſt prouided aduiſed wicked haſt doth profit man ſhrive ſins pride enuye ſo forth ſpeces circumſtaunces ſin hee haue comprehended minde number greatneſſe ſins long hath lyen ſinne alſo hath contrite ſins ſtedfaſt purpoſe grace god neuer ayen fall ſin alſo dread counterfaite himſelf fly occaſion ſinne whiche inclined alſo thou ſhalt ſhriue thee thy ſinnes manne part manne part another vnderſtond entent depart thy confeſſion ſhame dread ſtrangling thy ſoul certes ieſus chriſt entierly good none imperfection therefore either foryeueth perfectly el neuer deal ſay aſſigned thy penitencer certain ſin thou art bounde ſhewe remenaunt thy ſinnes thou haſte ſhriuen thy curat like thee thy humility part thy ſhrift ne ſay ſpeak diviſion confeſſion thou haue licence ſhriue thee liketh licence thy curate thou ne maiſt well ſhriue thee thy ſins let ſin vntold ferre thou haſt remembraunce thou ſhalt ſhriuen thy curat tell thy ſinnes thou haſt ſith thou laſt ſhriuen wicked entent diuiſion ſhrift alſo ſhrift asketh certaine condition firſt thou ſhriue thee thy free conſtrained ſhame folke ſickneſſe ne ſuch thing reaſon treſpaſſeth free free confeſſe treſpaſſe none man tell ſin himſelf ne ſhall nay ne deny ſin ne wrath ayenſt prieſt admoniſhing leaue ſin ſecond condition thy ſhrift lawfull ſay thou ſhriueſt thee alſo prieſt heareth thy confeſſion verely fayth holy church man ne diſpeired mercie ieſu chriſt cain iudas alſo man muſt accuſe himſelf treſpaſſe another ſhall blame wite himſelfe owne malice ſinne none natheleſſe another man occaſion enticer ſinne eſtate perſon ſuch ſin agredged elſe may plainly ſhriue tell perſon hath ſined may tell ſo entent ne backbite perſon onely declare confeſſion thou ne ſhalt alſo make leaſinges thy confeſſion humilitie peraduenture ſay thou haſt committed done ſuch ſinnes thou ne neuer giltie ſaint auguſtine ſaith thou becauſe thine humilitie makeſt leſings thy ſelf though thou ſin yet art thou ſinne thy leaſing thou muſt alſo ſhew thy ſinne thine proper mouth thou dombe letter ſor thou haſt done ſinne ſhalt haue ſhame therefore thou ſhalt eke paint thy confeſſion fayr ſubtill wordes couer thy ſinne begileſt thou thy ſelf prieſt thou muſt tell plain neuer ſo foul ne horrible thou ſhalt alſo ſhriue thee prieſt diſcreet counſail thee alſo thou ſhalt ſhriue thee vaine glorie ne ypocriſie ne cauſe loue fear ieſus chriſt heal thy ſoul thou ſhalt alſo ren prieſt ſodainly tell lightly thy ſin ſaith tell yape tale auiſedly good deuotion generally ſhriue thee oft thou oft fall oft ariſe confeſſion though thou ſhriue ofter one ſin thou haſt ſhriuen merite ſaith ſaint auguſtine thou ſhalt haue lightly foryeueneſſe grace god ſinne pain certes one yere leaſt lawfull houſeled ſurely one year thing renouellen haue told confeſſion ſecond part penitence explicit ſecunda par penitentiae et ſequitur tertia par third part penitence satiſfaction ſtont moſt generally almoſe deed holy pain three manner almoſe contrition heart man offreth himſelf god another haue pitie defaute neighbour third giuing good counſell ghoſtly bodily men haue need namely ſuſtenaunce man foode take kepe man hath need theſe thing generally hath need food clothing herborow hath need charitable counſail viſiting priſon ſickneſſe ſepulture body thou maiſt viſit needfull priſon thy perſon viſit hem thy meſſage yefts theſe ben generally almoſe workes charitie hem haue temporell rich diſcretion counſailing theſe workes ſhalt thou hear day dome theſe almoſe ſhalt thou thine proper thing haſtely priuely thou maiſt natheleſſe thou maiſt priuily thou ſhalt forbear almoſe though men ſee ſo doe thank world thank ieſu chriſt witneſſeth faint mathew capi v citie may hid ſet mountain ne men light lantern put vnder buſhell ſet vpon candleſtick yeue light menne houſe right ſo ſhull light light menne may ſee good work glorifie father heauen ſpeak bodyly pain ſtont praiers waking faſting vertuous teaching oriſons ye ſhall underſtond y• oriſons prayer ſay pitous heart ſetteth god expreſſeth word outward remeeue harm haue thing ſpirituel perdurable ſometime temporel thing oriſons certes oriſon paternoſter hath ieſus chriſt encloſed moſt thing certes priuiledged three thing dignity digne prayer ieſu chriſt himſelfe made ſhort ſhold learned lightly hold eaſie heart help himſelfe ofter oriſon man ſhould leſſe weary ſay excuſe learn ſo ſhort eaſie comprehendeth ſelfe good prayer expoſition holie prayer ſo excellent digne referre maiſter theologie ſaue thus much woll ſay thou prayeſt god ſhould foryeue thee thine offence thou foryeueſt hem haue offended thee well ware thou charitie holy oriſon aminiſheth alſo venial ſin therefore apperteineth ſpecially penitence prayer muſt truely ſayed perfect fayth men pray god ordinately diſcreetly deuoutly alway manne ſhall put ſubiect god oriſon muſt alſo ſayd great humbleneſſe ful pure honeſtly annoyaunce man woman muſt alſo continued work charitie auaileth alſo ayenſt vice ſoul ſayth irom faſting ſaued vice fleſh prayer vice ſoule thou ſhalt underſtond bodyly prayer ſtont waking ieſu chriſt ſayeth wake ye pray ye ne enter wicked temptaion ye ſhull underſtond alſo faſting ſtont three thing forbearing bodyly meat drink forbearing worldly iollitye forbearing deadly ſinne ſaye man ſhall keep fro deadly ſinne might thou ſhalt underſtond alſo god ordayned faſting faſting partayneth foure thinges largeneſſe poore folke gladneſſe heart ſpirituel angrie ne annoyed ne grutch faſteth alſo reaſonable hour eate meaſure ſaye man ſhall eat untime ne ſit longer table faſteth ſhalt thou underſtond bodyly pain ſtont diſcipline teaching word writing enſample alſo wearing heer ſtamin harbergeons naked fleſh chriſtes ſake ſuch maner penaunces ne make thine heart bitter angrie ne annoyed thy ſelfe better caſt away thine heer caſt away ſweetneſſe ieſus chriſt therefore ſayeth ſaint poule clothe choſen god heart miſericorde debonairte ſuffraunce ſuch manner clothing whiche ieſu chriſt pleaſed heers herbergeons diſcipline alſo knocking thy breaſt ſcourging roddes kneeling tribulation ſuffring patiently wrong doen thee alſo patient ſuffring ſickneſſe leſing worldly goodes cattel wife child frends ſhalt thou nnderſtond thing diſturbe pennaunce foure manner drrade ſhame hope wanhope deſperation ſpeak firſt dreade weneth may ſuffer penaunce ayenſt remedie think bodyly penaunce ſhort little regard pain hell ſo cruel ſo long laſteth without end ayenſt ſhame man hath ſhriue namely theſe ipocrites would hold ſo perfect haue need ſhriue hem ayenſt ſhame would man think way reaſon hath aſhamed foul thing certes ought aſhamed doe faire thinges confeſſions man ſhould alſo think god ſeeth knoweth al thought werks maie nothing hid ne couered men ſhould alſo remember hem ſhame come daye dome hem penitent ſhriuen preſent life creature yearth hell ſhall ſee apertly hidde world ſpeak hope hem ſo negligent ſlowe ſhriue hem ſtondeth two manner one hopeth liue long purchaſe much rich delight woll ſhriue ſayeth ſemeth timely ynough come ſhrift another ſurquidrie hath chriſtes mercie ayenſt firſt vice ſhall thenk life ſikerneſſe alſo rich worlde aduenture paſſe ſhadow wall ſayeth ſaint gregorie appartayneth great righteouſnes god neuer ſhall paine ſtinte hem neuer would withdrewe hem ſinne thankes euer continued ſinne perpetual ſinne ſhall haue perpetual pain wanhope two manner firſt wanhope mercie god think ne might long perſeuer goodnes firſt wanhope commeth demeth hath ſinned ſo greatly ſo oft ſo long lyen ſinne ſhall ſaued certes ayenſt curſed wanhope ſhould thinke paſſion ieſu chriſt ſtronge unbinde ſinne ſtrong binde ayenſt ſecond wanhope ſhall thinke often falleth may riſe againe penitence though neuer ſo longe hath lyen ſinne mercie chriſt alway ready receiue mercie ayenſt wanhope deemeth ſhould longe perſeuer goodneſſe ſhall think feebleneſſe deuil maye nothing doe men woll ſuffer alſo ſhall haue ſtrength help ieſu chriſt holy church protection angel liſt ſhall men underſtonde fruite penaunce wordes ieſu chriſt endleſſe bliſſe heauen ioye hath neuer ende contrarie woe ne greuaunce harm ben paſſed preſent life ſikerneſſe fro pain hell blisful companie rejoyce hem euermo euerich others ioye body man ſometime foule darke clere sunne body ſometime ſicke freile feble mortal immortall ſo ſtrong hole ne may nothing appeire neither hunger thurſte ne colde euery ſoule repleniſhed ſight perfite knowing god blisfull raigne may men purchaſe pouertie eſpirituel glorie lowlines plentie ioy hunger thurſt reſt trauaile life death mortification ſinne life u bring bought u precious blood amen ¶here endeth parſons tale ¶thus endeth booke canterbury tale romaunt roſe book begun french verſe william de lorris finiſhed forty year john clopinell alias john moone born mewen upon river loyer far paris appeareth molinet french author morality upon romaunt afterward tranſlated moſt part engliſh metre geffrey chaucer finiſhed entituled romaunt roſe art love wherein ſhewed help furtherance alſo let impediment lover suit book authour hath many glaunces hypocriſie clergy whereby got himſelf ſuch hatred amongſt gerſon chancellour paris writeth thus ſaith one called johannes meldinenſis wrote book called romaunt roſe book world might five hundred pound ſame would rather burn take money ſayeth thought authour thereof repent book dyed would vouchſafe pray would juda betrayed chriſt many men ſain ſweueninges ni fable leſinges men may ſome ſweuen ſeene hardely falſe ne afterward ben apparaunt may draw warraunt authour hight macrobes halt dreames falſe ne lee undoth u auiſioun whilom mette king cipioun ſo ſayth weneth yape elſe nicete wene dreames fall let ſo liſte foole call trow ſay dreames ſignifiaunce good harme many wightes dreamen ſleep nightes full many thinges couertly fallen openly within twentie yeere age loue taketh courage young folke went ſoone bed wont doone faſt ſlept ſleeping mette ſuch ſweuening liked wondrous wele ſweuen neuer dele ni afterward befall right dreame woll tell u dreame woll rime right make heart gay light loue prayeth alſo commaundeth ſo aske whether ſhe booke shall hight rede romaunt roſe art loue cloſe matter faire make god graunt gree ſhe take begonnen ſhe hath iwis mokel priſe thereto ſhe worthie beloued ſhe well ought priſe right cleped roſe euerie wight mey thought tho fiue yere ago mey thus dreamed time loue iolitie thing ginneth waxen gay neither buske hay mey nill ſhrouded bene new leues wrene theſe woodes eke recoueren grene drie winter ben ſene earth waxeth proud withall ſwote dewes fall poore eſtate forget winter ſet become ground ſo proude woll haue newe ſhroude maketh ſo queint robe faire hewes hundred paire graſſe floures inde pers many hewes full diuers robe mean iwis ground praiſen birdes han left ſong han ſuffred cold full ſtrong wether grille derke ſight ben mey ſunne bright glad ſhew ſinging heart ſuch liking mote ſingen ben light doth nightingale might maken noyſe ſingen blith blisfull many ſith chelaundre popingaye young folke entenden aye ben gay amorous time ſo ſauorous hard heart loueth nought mey mirth wrought may theſe braunches ſmall birdes ſingen clere blisfull ſweete ſong piteous ſeaſon delitous loue affirmeth thing thought one night ſleeping right bed full readyly morrow early roſe gan cloth anone wiſh mine hondes ſiluer needle forth drow aguiler queint inow gan needle thread anone toune liſt gone ſound birdes heare buskes ſingen cleare ſweete ſeaſon lefe thred baſting ſleuis alone went playing ſmall foules ſong hearkening payned hem full many paire ſing bowes bloſſomed faire iolife gay full gladneſſe toward riuer gan dreſſe heard ren faſt fairer playen none ſaw playen riuere hill ſtood nere come doune ſtream full ſtiffe bold clere water cold well ſooth ſaine ſomedele laſſe saine ſtraiter weleaway neuer ſaw er day water ſo wele liked wonder glad ſe luſty place riuere water ran ſo clere face wiſh tho ſaw wele bottome ypaued eueridele grauel full ſtones ſhene meadowes ſoft ſote grene beet right water ſide full clere morowe tide full attempre drede tho gan walken thorow mede dounward aye playing riuers ſide coaſting igone ſaw garden right anone full long broad eueridele encloſed walled wele high walles enbatailed portrayed without well entayled many rich portraiture yet image peintures gan beholde beſely woll tell readyly thilke image ſemblaunce farre haue remembraunce amidde ſaw hate ſtonde wrath yre onde seemed mynoreſſe angry wight childereſſe full gile fell courage ſemblaunt like image ſhe nothing wele araide like wode woman afraide ifrounced foule viſage grinning diſpitous rage noſe ſnorted tene full hidous ſhe ſene full foule ruſtie ſhe head iwrithen iwis full grimly great towaile image another entaile lifte halfe faſt name aboue head ſaw ſhe called felony another image villany icleped ſaw fonde vpon wall right honde villany like ſomedele image truſteth wele ſeemed wicked creature countenaunce portreiture ſeemed full deſpitous eke full proude outragious well coud paint undertake ſuch image coud make full foule churliſh ſeemed ſhe eke villainous little coulde nurture worſhip creature next painted couetiſe eggeth folke many giſe take yeue right nought againe great treaſours laine ſhe uſure leneth many creature laſſe winning couetous brenning ſhe penny fele teacheth robbe ſtele theſe theeues theſe ſmale harlotes routh throtes full many one hongeth laſt maketh folke compaſſe caſt taken folkes thing robberie miſcoueting ſhe maketh treachours ſhe maketh falſe pleadours termes dome done maiden child eke gromes heritage forgo full crooked honds two couetiſe euer wood gripen folkes good couetiſe winning full lefe hath mennes thing another image ſet ſaw next couetiſe faſt ſhe cleped auarice full foule painting vice full ſad caitife ſhe eke alſo grene leke euil hewed colour ſeemed haue liued langour like thing hunger dead lad life onely bread kneden eiſell ſtrong egre thereto ſhe lene megre ſhe clad full poorely old torne courtpy ſhe dogges torne behind eke beforne clouted beggerly mantle honge faſte vpon bench weake ſmall burnette cote hong withall furred mineuere furre rough heere lambe skinnes heauy blacke ſo old vndertake auarice cloath wele ne haſteth neuer dele certainly loth wearen ilke cloth forweared ſhe would haue full great nicete clothing er ſhe bought newe bad woll hewe auarice held hand purſe hong band hid bond ſo ſtrong men muſt abide wonder long purſe er come ought ne commeth thought certaine entent fro purſe peny went image nigh inough painted enuie neuer lough neuer well heart feard ſhe either ſaw heard great miſchaunce great diſeaſe nothing may ſo much pleaſe miſcheife miſauenture ſhe ſeeth diſcomfiture vpon worthy man fall liketh well withall full glad courage ſhe ſee great linage brought naught ſhamefull wife man honour riſe wit proweſſe hath ſhe great heauineſſe truſteth well ſhe goeth nie wood chaunce happeth good enuy ſuch cruelte fayth ne trouth holdeth ſhe friend ne fellow bad good ne ſhe hath kinne none blood ſhe ni full enemie nolde dare ſaine hardely owne father fared wele ſore abieth ſhe euerie dele malice male talent ſhe ſo great turment hate ſuch folke doth good nye ſhe melteth pure wood heart kerueth ſo breaketh god people well awreaketh enuy iwis ſhall neuer let blame vpon folke ſet trow enuie iwis knew beſt man ſide beyond ſee yet ſomewhat lacken would ſhe ſo hende wiſe ſhe ne might abate priſe yet would ſhe blame worthineſſe wordes make leſſe ſaw envy painting wonderfull looking ſhe ne looked awrie overwhart baggingly ſhe foule uſage might looke viſage man ne woman forth right plaine ſhette one eye disdaine envie brenned ſhee ſhe might man ſee faire worthy wiſe elſe ſtood folkes priſe sorow painted next envie vpon wall maſonrie well ſeene colour ſhe lived languour ſeemed jaundice halfe ſo pale avarice ne nothing like leanneſſe ſorowe thought great diſtreſſe ſhe ſuffred daie night made yellow nothing bright full ſad pale megre alſo never wight yet halfe ſo wo ſeemed ſo fulfilled yre ſhe trow wight might pleaſe doe thing might eaſe ſhe ne would ſorow ſtake comfort none unto take depe wo begonne eke heart anger ronne ſorowfull thing well ſeemed ſhe ſhe nothing ſlow ſcratchen face rent many place clothes teare ſwire ſhe fulfilled yre torne lay eke heere ſhoulders ſhe rent anger male talent eke tell certainly ſhe wept full tenderly world ni wight ſo hard heart ſeene ſorowes ſmart nolde pite wo begon thing ſhe daſht ſelfe wo ſmote togider hand two ſorrow ſhe full ententife wofull retcheleſſe caitife wrought little playing clipping kiſſing ſo ſorrowfull heart luſt play ne ſtart dauncen ne ſing ne may heart temper bring make joy even morrow joy contrarie unto ſorrow elde painted ſhorter foot iwis ſhe wont yonghede • nneth ſelfe ſhe might fede feeble eke ſo old ſhe faded beaute full ſalow waxen colour head hore white flour iwis great qua • ne none ne ſinne although life gone woxen body vnwelde drie dwined elde foule forw • lked thing ſhe whilom round ſoft heeres ſhoken faſt withall head would fall face frounced forpined honds lorne fordwined old ſhe ſhe ne went foot potent time paſſed night daye reſtleſſe trauayleth aye ſtealeth v ſo priuyly v ſeemeth ſikerly one point dwelleth euer certes ne reſteth neuer goeth ſo faſt paſſeth aye ni man thinke maye time preſent asketh theſe cleres men thinke readily three time paſſed time may ſoiourne goth may neuer retourne water doun runneth aye neuer droppe returne may may nothing time endure metall yearthly creature thing frette ſhall time eke chaungeth doth waxe foſtred thing deſtroyeth time eldeth aunceſtours eldeth kinges emperours v ſhall ouercommen er death v ſhall haue nommen time hath welde elden folke made elde inly weting might helpe ſelfe nothing tourned ayen vnto childhede nothing ſelfe lede ne wit ne pith hold childe two yere old natheleſſe trow ſhe faire ſometime freſh ſe ſhe rightfull age ſhe paſt paſſage doted thing becommen furred cappe ſhe nommen well ſhe clad ſelfe warme cold might el doen harme theſe old folke haue alway cold kind ſuch old another thing doen write ſeemed like ipocrite cleped pope holy ilke ſhe priuily ne ſpared never wr • ked deed men taken none heed maketh outward precious pale viſage piteous ſeemeth ſimple creature ni miſaduenture ſhe ne thinketh courage full like thilke image maked like ſemblaunce full ſimple countenaunce ſhe clothed eke ſhod ſhe loue god yolden religion soch ſeemed deuotion pſalter held ſhe faſt hond buſily ſhe gan fond make many faint prayere god saint dere ne ſhe gay freſh ne iolife ſeemed full ententife good work faire thereto ſhe haire ne certes ſhe fatte nothing ſeemed wearie faſting colour pale dead ſhe gate aie warned paradiſe blisfull place ſuch folke maken leane grace chriſt ſayth euangile get hem priſe toune little glorie vaine leſen god eke raigne alderlaſt euerichone painted pouert alone peny hold although ſhe clothes ſold though ſhe ſhould honged naked worme ſhe weather ſtormie cold ſhe ſhould haue died ne ſtraite old ſacke many cloute ſtacke cote mantele neuer dele cloath vndertake great leaſer ſhe quake ſhe put talke ferre fro theſe vp halke lurked coured ſhe poore thing ſo ſhamefaſt diſpiſed aie accurſed may well daie poore man conceiued god wote ſeld iwis poore man well ifed well arrayed icled well beloued ſuch wiſe honour may ariſe theſe thing well auiſed haue er deuiſed gold azure ouer depainted vpon wall square wall high ſomde • e encloſed ibarred wele ſtead hedge gardin come neuer ſhepheard therein gardin well wrought ſo coud haue brought ladder elſe degree would well haue liked mee ſuch ſolace ſuch joy pleie trow neuer man ne ſeie place delicious gardin daungerous herborow birdes many one rich yere neuer none birdes ſong braunches grene therein birdes mo wene realme fraunce full blisfull accordaunce ſweet pitous ſong made world ought glade ſelfe ſo merry feard blisfull ſonges heard hundred pound would paſſage openly vnto free nolde entren ſee thaſſemble god keepe fro care birdes therein ware ſongen merry throtes daunces loue merry note thus heard foules ſing fell faſt waymenting art engin might come gardin way couth finde none gardin gone ne nought wiſt either hole place might haue entre ne none teach alone iwis woe anguiſh till laſt bethought mee way ne might bee na ladder ne way pace hole ſo faire place tho gan go full great paas enuiron euen compas cloſing ſquare wall till found wicket ſmall ſhette ne might gone entre none vpon doore gan ſmite fetis ſo lite waye coud ſeke full longe ſhote knocked eke ſtode full long herkening heard wight comming till doore thilke entre maiden curteis opened haire yellowe hewe baſon ſcoured newe fleſh tender chicke bent browes ſmooth ſlicke meaſure large opening eyen clere noſe good proportion eyen graie faucon ſweete breath well fauoured face white well coloured little mouth round ſee cloue chinne eke ſhe necke good faſhion length greatneſſe reaſon without bleine ſcabbe roine fro ieruſalem vnto burgoine ni fairer necke iwis fele ſmooth ſoft throte alſo white hewe snowe braunce ſnowed newe bodie full well wrought ſhe men neden countre fairer bodie ſeke fine orfrais ſhe eke chapelet ſo ſemely ne neuer wered maide vpon faire aboue chapelet roſe garlond ſhe ſet gay mirrour rich gold treaſour head treſſed queintly ſleeues ſewed fetouſly keepe hondes faire gloues white ſhe paire ſhe coate grene cloth gaunt withouten wene well ſeemed apparaile wont great trauaile ſhee kempt feteouſly well araied richly ſhe doen iournee merrye well begon ſhe led luſtie life may thought night ne day nothing onely grayeth well vncouthly dore opened may ſeemely ſee thonked beſt might asked ſhe hight ſhe asked eke ſhe nought vnmeke ne anſweare daungerous faire anſwerde ſayed thus lo ſir name idleneſſe clepe men leſſe full mightie full rich one thinge namely entende nothing joye playing kembe treſſe acquainted priue mirthe lord gardin fro londe alexandrin made tree hither fet gardin iſet tree woxen hight wall ſtant thy ſight mirth encloſen theſe image without hem entaile paint neither jolife ne quaint full ſorowe wo thou haſt ſee ne ago oft time ſolace sir mirth commeth place eke commeth meine liuen luſt iolite mirth therein birdes ſingen clere maui nightingale jolly birdes ſmale thus walked ſolace folke ſweeter place playen may finde although ſought one till inde alther faireſt folke ſee world may found bee hath mirth rout followen alwaies idleneſſe told herkened well ywis ſaied dame idleneſſe alſo wiſely god bleſſe sith mirth ſo faire fre yerd meine fro thilke aſſemble may shall man werne day night ne mote ſee well wene bee faire jolly companie fulfilled courteſie forth word mo wicked went tho idleneſſe opened mee garden faire ſee ywis mine heart full glad well wend full ſikerly haue paradice earthly faire truſteth well ſeemed place eſpirituell certes deuiſe place paradice good dwell garden thought many bird ſinging throughout yerde thringing many place nightingale alpes finch wodwales ſweet ſong delighten thilke place habiten might men ſee many flockes turtle lauerockes chalaundres fele ſaw nigh forſongen thruſtles terins mauiſe ſongen win hem priſe eke ſermount ſong bird hem emong note made faire ſeruiſe theſe birdes deuiſe ſong ſong faire well angel done eſpirituell truſteth hem heard full luſtie well feard neuer yet ſuch melodie heard man might die ſweet ſong hem emong thought bird ſong wonder like bee song meremaidens ſee ſinging ſo clere though meremaidens clepe hem engliſh vſaunce men clepe hem sereins fraunce ententiue ſing theſe bird vnkonning craft prentiſe ſong ſubtill wiſe certes heard ſong ſaw green place emong heart wext ſo wonder gay neuer erſt ere day iolife ſo well bigo ne merry heart tho wiſt ſaw full well idleneſſe ſerued well put ſuch iolite friend well ought sith ſhe dore gardin opened let henceforth wrought ſhall tell thought firſt whereof mirth ſerued eke
