folke without fable woll diſcriue garden eke bliue woll tellen faire faſhion ywis well wrought none may tell atones may ſhall order tellen full faire ſeruice eke full ſwete theſe bird maden ſete lay loue ful well ſouning ſongen iargoning high ſome eke low ſong vpon braunches greene iſprong ſweetneſſe melodie made mine heart reuelrie heard trowe theſe bird ſinging rowe might withhold mee ne went ſee sir mirth deſiring ſeene ouer thing countenaunce manere ſight full dere tho went forth right hond downe little path fond mint full fennell greene faſt without wene sir mirth found right anone vnto sir mirth gan gone ſolace luſtie place faire folke ſo freſh ſaw wondred fro whence ſuch folke might come faire ſome like ſight angel ben fethered bright theſe folke tell ſo vpon karole wenten tho ladie karoled hem hight gladneſſe blisfull light well could ſhe ſing luſtely none halfe ſo well ſeemely coth make ſong ſuch refraining ſate wonder well ſing voice full clere full ſwete rude ne unmete couth ynough ſuch longeth unto karolling ſhe wont every place ſingen firſt folke ſol • ace ſinging moſt ſhe gave craft ſhe ſo lefe tho mighteſt thou karols ſeene folke daunce merry beene made many faire tourning vpon greene graſſe ſpringing mighteſt thou ſee theſe flutours minſtrals eke joglours well ſing paine ſong ſongs loraine loraine note full ſweeter countre many timbeſtere ſaliours dare well ſwere couth craft full perfitly timbre full ſubtelly caſt hent full oft vpon finger faire ſoft failed never mo full fetis damoſels two right yong full ſemelyhede kirtle none wede faire treſſed every treſſe mirth doen nobleſſe amid carole daunce hereof lieth remembraunce daunced queintly one would come prively ayen togither almoſt threw ifere mouthes ſo play ſeemed kiſt alway dauncen well couth guiſe ſhould deviſe ne bode never thence go while ſaw hem daunce ſo vpon caroll wonder faſt gan behold till laſt ladie gan eſpie ſhe cleped courteſie worſhipfull debonaire pray god ever fall faire full courteſſy ſhe called doe ye beau ſire qd ſhe come like daunce daunceth u without tarrying went carolling abaſhed never adele liked right wele courteſie cleped ſo bade daunce go durſt certaine would carolled right faine man daunce right blithe gan looken oft ſithe ſhape body cheres countenaunce maneres folke daunced ſhall tell full faire mirth full long high fairer man never ſigh round apple face full roddie white every place fetis well beſey meetly mouth eyen gray noſe meaſure wrought full right criſpe haire eke full bright ſhoulders large brede ſmalliſh girdle ſtede ſeemed like purtreiture noble ſtature faire ſo jolly ſo fetiſe lims wrought point deviſe deliver ſmert great might ne ſaw thou never man ſo light berd unneth nothing firſt ſpring full yong merry thought ſamette bird wrought gold beaten full fetouſ • bodie clad full richely wrought robe ſtraunge egiſe ſlittered queintiſe many place low hie ſhode great maiſtrie ſhoone decoped lace drurie ſolace leefe roſen chapelet made head ſet wete ye lefe dame gladneſſe ſo lefe ſingeth ſo well glad courage ſhe twelve yeare age love graunt made sir mirth finger hade dauncing ſhe alſo great love atwixt hem two faire bright hew ſeemed like roſe new colour fleſh ſo tender brere ſmall tender men might cleve dare well ſay forhead frounceles play bent browes two eyen gray glad alſo laughden aye ſemblaunt firſt mouth covenaunt wot noſe ſhall diſcrive faire hath woman alive haire yellow clere ſhining wote lady ſo liking orfraies freſh garland ſeene thouſand saw never ywis garland yet well wrought ſilke gilt ſamite clad ſhe great delite leefe robe werde merrier ſhe heart ferde next went ſide god love divide love liketh cherles daunten many folkes pride fallen well theſe lord thrallen lady put low degree may hem proud ſee god love faſhion like knave ne quiſtron beautie greatly priſe robe deviſe dreade encombred yelad ſilke floures flourettes painted amorettes loſenges ſcochons bird liberdes lion beaſts wrought full wele garment every dele purtraied ywrought flour diver medling colour floures ther many giſe iſet compaſſe ſiſe lacked floure dome ne ſo much floure brome ne violet ne eke peruinke ne floure none men thinke many roſe lefe full long entermedled emong alſo head ſet roſes redde chapelet nightingale full great rout flien head leaf felden flien bird wrien popinjay nightingale chalaundre wodewale finch larke archangell ſeemed angell comen fro heaven clere love bachelere made alwayes sweet looking cleped batcheler ſtood beholding daunce hond holding turke bow two full well deviſed hee one hem tree beareth fruit ſavour wicke full crooked foule ſticke knottie alſo blacke berrie ſlo bow plant without wemme dare warrant full even proportion trectes long full good faſhion painted well thwitten diapred written lady bacheleres full lightſome glad cheres theſe bowes two held sweet looking ſeemed like gadling ten brode arrowes held ſive hond ſhaven well dight nocked feathered aright gold begon ſtrong pointed everichon ſharpe kerven wele yron none ne ſtele gold men might ſee take feather tree ſwifteſt theſe arrowes five bow drive beſt feathered flie faireſt eke cleped beautie arrow hurteth leſſe cleped trow simpleſſe third cleped fraunchiſe feathered noble wiſe valour courteſie fourth cleped companie heavie ſhooten ſo ſhooteth right ywis may therewith doen great harme wo fift theſe laſt alſo faire semblaunt men arrow call leaſt greevous hem yet make full great wound may hope ſores ſound hurt arrowe ywis wo bette beſtowed may ſooner gladneſſe langour ought leſſe five arrowes giſe full foule deviſe ſhaft end ſooth tell alſo blacke fiend hell firſt hem called pride arrow next beſide cleped villanie arrow fellonie envenimed ſpitous blame third hem cleped shame fourth wanhope cleped fift new thought ywis theſe arrowes ſpeake five one mannere reſemblable hem well ſitting able foule crooked bow hidous knottie roinous bow ſeemed well ſhete arrowes five unmete contrary five though tell blive power ne might hereafter ſhall tellen right ſooth eke ſignifiaunce ferre remembraunce ſhall ſaied undertake ere booke end make come tale againe alderſirſt woll ſaine faſhion countenaunces folke daunce god love jolife light led hond ladie bright high priſe great degre ladie called beaute arrow told full well thewed ſhe hold ne ſhe derke ne browne bright cleare moone light againe starres ſemen ſmall candle demen fleſh tender dewe floure cheare ſimple bird boure white lilly roſe riſe face gentle treatiſe fetis ſhe ſmall ſee wintred browes ſhee ne popped needed nought winder paint ought treſſes yellow long ſtraughten vnto heeles downe raughten noſe mouth eye cheke well wrought remnaunt eke full great ſauour ſwote thought mine heart rote helpe god remember faſhion euery member world none ſo faire wight young ſhe hewed bright sore pleaſant fetis gent middle ſmall beſide beauty yede richeſſe high ladie great nobleſſe great price euery place ſo durſt treſpace till folke werke dede full hardie drede ſhe helpe hinder may yeſterday rich folke haue full great might helpe eke greue wight beſt greateſt valour didden richeſſe full great honour buſie ſerue would loue deſerue cleped ladie great ſmall wide world dredeth world daungere court hath many loſengere many traitour enuious ben full buſie curious diſpraiſe blame beſt deſeruen loue name forne folke hem begilen theſe loſenge hem preiſe ſmilen thus world word annointen afterward prill pointen folke right bare bone behind backe ben gone foule abaten folkes priſe full many worthy man wiſe han hindred idoen die theſe loſengeours flatterie maketh folke full ſtraunge hem ought ben priue well euill mote thriue thee euill ariued mote bee theſe loſengeours full enuie good man loueth companie richeſſe robe purple ne trow lie mad world none liche ne thouſand deale ſo riche ne none ſo faire full wele orfreis laied euery dele purtraid ribanings duke ſtories king bend gold taſſiled knops fine gold amiled necke gentle entaile ſhet rich cheueſaile full great plente ſtones clere faire ſe richeſſe girdle vpon bokell ſton vertue great mokell might ſo bare ſtone ſo bright venim durſt nothing doubt ſtone ſtone greatly loue till rich man behoue worth gold rome friſe mourdant wrought noble giſe ſtone full precious ſo fine vertuous whole man couth make palſie toothake yet ſtone ſuch grace ſeker euery place thilke day blind beene faſting might ſtone ſeene barres gold full fine vpon tiſſue sattine full heauie great nothing light eueriche beſaunt wight vpon treſſes richeſſe ſet circle nobleſſe brend gold full light ſhone faire trow neuer none cunning none could deuiſe ſtones circle ſhewen clere wonder thing man could preiſe geſſe hem value richeſſe ruby saphirs ragounces emeraudes two vnces full ſubtilly fine carbuncle ſet ſaw ſtone ſo cleare ſo bright ſo ſoone night men might ſeene go nede mile two length brede light ſprang ſtone richeſſe wonder bright ſhone head face eke place dame richeſſe hond gan lede yong man full ſemely hede ſhe beſt loued thing luſt much houſholding clothing full fetiſe loued well haue hors priſe wend haue reproued theft murder ſtable hacknay therefore deſired aye acquainted richeſſe purpoſe geſſe make great diſpence withouten warning defence richeſſe might well ſuſtaine diſpences wele maintaine alway ſuch plentie ſend gold ſiluer ſpend without lacking daungere pourde garnere daunce went largeſſe ſet entent ben honorable free alexander kinne ſhee moſt joy ywis ſhe yafe ſaied haue auarice foule caitife halfe gripe ſo ententife largeſſe yeue ſpend god alway ynowe ſend ſhe yaue away iwis ſhe alway great loo hath largeſſe great priſe wiſe folke vnwiſe wholly bandon brought well yefts hath ſhe wrought ſhe enemy trowe ſhe couth craftely make full ſoone friend large yefts wiſe ſhe therefore ſhe ſtood loue grace rich poore euery place full great foole ywis rich poore niggard lord may haue manner vice greeueth auarice niggard neuer ſtrength hand may win great lordſhip land friend hath doen performed ſo woll friend may hold treaſure dere enſample tell right adamant ywis drawen ſubtelly yron laied thereby draweth folkes heart ywis siluer gold yeuen largeſſe robe freſh rich purpure sarliniſh well formed face clere opened ſhe colere ſhe right preſent vnto lady made preſent gold brooch full well wrought certes miſſate nought ſmocke wrought ſilke fleſh ſeene white milke largeſſe worthy wiſe held hond knight priſe ſibbe arthour breteigne bare enſeigne worſhip gousfaucoun yet ſuch renoun men ſay faire thing baron earles ring knight commen newly fro tourneying faſt done great chiualrie vertue maiſirie loue lemman caſt doune many doughty man next daunced dame fraunchiſe arrayed full noble giſe broune ne dunne hew white ſnow ifallen new noſe wrought point deuiſe gentle tretiſe eyen glad browes bent haire downe heel went ſhe ſimple doue tree full debonaire hert ſhee durſt neither ſay ne longeth man diſtreſſe loue heauineſſe heart would full great pitee ſo amiable free man beſtad would ben right ſore adrad ſhe ouergreat outrage ſhe holpe harme taſwage thought villany ſhe ſuckeny hempe herdes faire none arras lord riddled fetiſly na point truly na right aſſiſe full well yclothed fraunchiſe ni cloth ſitteth bette damoſell doth rokette woman well fetiſe rokette cote ywis white rokette riddeled faire betokeneth full debonaire ſweet ſhe bere daunced bachelere cannot tellen hight faire good height ben ſay lord ſonne windſore next daunced courteſie preiſed low hie neither proud ne foole ſhe daunce called pray god giue good grace came firſt place na nice ne outrageous wiſe ware vertuous faire ſpeech faire anſwer neuer wight miſſaid bare rancour wight clere broune ſhe thereto bright face body auenaunt wote lady ſo pleaſaunt worthy bene empreſſe crowned quene went knight dauncing worthy well ſpeaking full well coud done honour knight faire ſtiffe ſtour armure ſeemely man well beloued lemman faire idleneſſe ſaw alway faſt haue without faile cold ſhape apparaile ſaid lo ſhe ſo great bounte gate gardin vndid let paſſen daunced geſſe ſhe fulfilled luſtineſſe na yet xii yeare age heart wild thought volage nice ſhe ſhe ne ment none harme ne ſleight entent onely luſt iolite yong folke well weten ye haue little thought play lemman beſide alway ſuch giſe kiſt time liſt daunce might ſee make force priuetee ſo ſpake hem euill wele aſhamed neuer adele men might ſeene hem kiſſe two yong doues yong thilke bachelere beauty wot non pere right ſuch age youth lefe ſuch courage luſty folke daunced alſo meinee full hend folke wiſe free folke faire port truly comenly ſeene countenaunces hem ladden thus theſe daunces goe ſee garden ſo liked mee looken theſe faire laureres pine tree cedrres olmeres daunces ended many hem daunced loues went away vnder tree haue play lord liued luſtely great foole ſikerly nold thankes ſuch life lede dare ſaine drede ſo might ſo well fare better life durſt care ni ſo good paradiſe haue loue deuiſe place went tho garden gan go playing along full merely god loue full haſtely vnto sweet looking clept lenger would ſhe kept gold ſhone ſo bright bent anon right full ſoone ſet end braide gan bend tooke arrowes fiue full ſharpe ready driue god ſitteth maieſte fro deadly wound keepe ſo ſhete arrow mete greeued ſore ywis nothing wiſt went vp downe full many way followed faſt alway would reſt till garden garden meaſuring right euen ſquare compaſſing long large fruit euery tree charge hidous tree two three wote full wele pomgranettes full great dele fruit full well like namely folke ben ſike tree great foiſon baren nut ſeaſon men nutmeg call ſwote ſavour withall almandres great plentee figges many date tree men nede gardin length brede eke wexing many ſpice clowe gilofre licorice gingere grein de paris canell setewale pris many ſpice delitable eaten men riſe fro table many homely tree peach coines apple bere medlers plommes peeres theſteinis cheriſe many one faine nut aleis bola ſeene ſolas many high laurer pine renged clene gardine cipres oliueris nigh plenty elmes great ſtrong maple aſhe oke alpes plane long fine ewe popler lindes faire tree full many paire ſhould tell ſo many tree yet ſhould encombred bee cre reckoned euery tree theſe tree ſet deuiſe one another aſſiſe fiue fadome ſixe trow ſo high great alſo keepe well sunne croppes ſo thicke irunne euery braunch knitte full greene leaues ſitte sunne might none deſcend leaſt tender graſſes ſhend might men roe iſee squirrel full great plentee bough bough alway leping connis alſo playing comen clapers ſundry colour maners maden many tourneying vpon freſh graſie ſpringing place ſaw wels frog faire ſhaddow euery well ne number tell ſtremis ſmall deuiſe mirth done come condiſe water renning gan make noiſe full liking brinkes theſe wels ſtreames ouer el sprang vp graſſe thicke iſet ſoft veluet men might lemman ley featherbed pley earth full ſoft ſwete moiſture well wete sprong vp ſote greene gras faire thicke miſter much amended place therth ſuch grace floures hath plente ſummer winter ſprang violet new freſh peruinke rich hew floures yellow white rede plenty grew neuer mede full gay ground queint poudred men peint many freſh ſundry flour caſten vp full good ſauour woll long hold fable garden dilectable mote tongue ſtinten nede ne may withouten drede naught tellen beautie ne halfe bountie therewithall went right hond left place left till garden beene eſters men might ſeene thus went playe god loue followed aye right hunter abide beaſt till ſeeth tide ſhooten goodneſſe deere needeth go neere ſo befell reſted mee beſides well vnder tree tree fraunce men call pine ſith time king pepine ne grew tree man ſight faire ne ſo well woxe hight yard ſo high none ſpringing marble ſtone nature ſet ſooth tell vnder pine tree well border without written ſtone letter ſmall ſaiden thus ſtarfe faire narciſſus narciſſus bachelere loue caught daungere nette gan ſo ſtraine ſo weepe plaine need muſt life forgo faire lady hight echo loued ouer creature gan ſuch paine endure time ſhe tolde louen nolde behoued need die lay none remedie natheleſſe beaute fierce daungerous nolde graunten asking weeping ne faire praying ſhe heard werne ſo heart ſo great wo tooke ſo great deſpite ſhe without reſpite dead anon ere ſhe deide full pitouſly god ſhe preide proud hearted narciſſus loue ſo daungerous might day ben hampered ſo loue ben ſo hote wo neuer might joy attaine ſhould fele vaine ſorrow true louers maken ben ſo villainouſly forſaken prayer reaſonable therefore god held ferme ſtable narciſſus ſhortly tell auenture came well reſt ſhaddowing day came hunting narciſſus ſuffred paine renning day plaines thurſt great diſtreſſe heart wearineſſe breath almoſt benomen well icomen ſhaddowed braunches grene thought thilke water ſhene drinke freſh wele withall downe knee gan fall forth necke head outſtraught drinke well draught water anon ſene noſe mouth even ſhene thereof abaſhed owne ſhaddow betraſhed well wend forme ſee child great beautee well couth loue wreke tho daungere pride alſo narciſſus ſometime bere quite well guerdon muſed ſo well ſhortly ſooth tell loued owne ſhaddow ſo laſt ſtarfe wo ſaw might manner way fulfill ſo faſt caught couth comfort naught loſt wit right place deid within little ſpace thus wariſon tooke lady forſooke lady praye enſample taketh ye ayenſt loue miſtaketh death wite god full well wile quite letter tell taught well narciſſus beaute gan anon withdraw fell remembraunce betide ſuch miſchaunce laſt thought ſcathleſſe full ſikerly might vnto well go whereof ſhull abaſhen ſo vnto well went mee downe louted ſee clere water ſtone eke grauell ſhone downe bottome ſiluer fine well fine world none ſo clere hew water euer freſh new welmeth vp waues bright mountenaunce two finger hight graſſe ſpringing moiſt ſo thicke well liking ne may winter die may ſee drie downe bottome ſet ſaw two chriſtall ſtones craftely thilke freſh faire well thing ſoothly dare tell ye woll hold great meruaile told withouten faile ſunne clere ſight caſt well beames bright heat deſcended taketh chriſtall ſtone iwis againe ſunne hundred hewis blew yellow red freſh new yet hath meruailous chriſtall ſtrength place ouer foule tree leaues greene yerd ſee ne done vnderſtond make enſample woll fond right mirrour openly sheweth thing ſtondeth thereby well colour figure withouten couerture right ſo chriſtall ſtone ſhining withouten deceiuing entree yerd accuſeth water muſeth euer halfe ye bee ye may well halfe garden ſee turne may right wele seene remnaunt euery dele none ſo little thing hid ne cloſed ſhitting ne ſeene though painted chriſtall mirrour perillus proud narciſſus sey faire face bright made ſith lie vpright ſo looke mirrour may nothing ben ſuccour ne ſhall ſee ſomething ſhall lede laughing full many worthy man hath yblent folke greateſt wit ben ſoone caught waited withouten reſpite ben baited commeth folke new rage chaungeth many wight courage lithe rede ne thereto venus ſonne dan cupido hath ſowen loue ſede helpe ne lithe none ne rede cercleth well ginnes hath ſet without right catch panters theſe damoſels bachelers loue none bird catch though ſet either nette latch ſeed ſowen well cleped well knowen well loue right hath full many wight spoken bookes diuerſly ſhull neuer ſo verily deſcription well ne eke ſooth matere ye ſhull haue vndo craft belongeth alway liked dwell ſeene chriſtall well ſhewed full openly thouſand thing faſt may ſay ſorry houre stode looken poure ſithen ſore ſighed mirrour hath entriked firſt knowen wit vertue ſtrengthes nolde haue muſed bette ben elswhere ſnare fell anone bitreſhed many one thilke mirrour ſaw tho among thouſand thing mo roſer charged full roſis hedge encloſis tho ſuch luſt enuie paris ne pauie nolde haue left gone ſee greateſt heape roſes bee rage hent caught hath many man ſhent toward roſer gan go ferre therefro ſauer roſes ſwote mote right heart rote enbaumed ne endouted haue ben hated aſſailed thankes woll failed pull roſe rout beare mine hond ſmellen went ever drede repent leaſt greved forthought lord thilke gardin wrought roſes great wone faire never rone knops cloſe ſome ſaw ſome well better woxen ſome moiſon drowe nigh ſeaſon ſped hem faſt ſpred love well ſuch roſes red brode roſes open alſo ben paſſed day two knoppes freſh bee two dayes leaſt el three knoppes greatly liked mee fairer may man ſee ſo might one ought full lefe withall might garlond hem getten richeſſe would letten amongs knoppes cheſe one faire remnaunt none ne preiſe halfe ſo well aviſe wit ſo well enlumined colour red well fined nature couth make faire hath leaf well foure paire kind hath ſet knowing red roſes ſpringing ſtalke riſhe right thereon ſtood knoppe upright ne bowed upon ſide ſwore ſmell ſprung ſo wide died place ſmelled ſavour ſwote fro thence yet go ſomedele nere went tho take mine hond drede ne durſt roſe bede thiſtles ſharpe many manner nettle thornes hooked brier much diſtourbled ſore drad harmed god love bow bent day ſet talent purſue ſpien mee ſtonding figge tree ſaw choſen ſo ententiſely bothum unto pey ſey tooke arrow full ſharpely whet bowe ſet ſtreight eare drough ſtrong bowe ſo tough ſhot ſo wonder ſmert mine eye unto mine hert takell ſinote deepe went therewithall ſuch cold hent clothes warme ſoft sithen day chivered oft hurt thus ſtound fell plat unto ground mine heart failed fainted aye long time ſwoune lay came ſwouning wit feeling mate wend full wele blood lorne full great dele certes arrow ſtood ne drew drop blood found wound drey tooke mine honds twey arrow full faſt plight pulling ſore ſight laſt ſhaft tree drough feather three yet hooked head ywis beauty called gan ſo deepe mine heart pace might arace mine heart ſtill ſtood bled drop blood anguiſhous trouble perill ſaw double niſt ſay ne get leach wound neither graſſe ne rote ne helpe hope ne bote bothum evermo mine hert drew wo thought none thing keeping would brought life againe certes evenly dare well ſame ſight ſavour alegged much langour gan draw mee toward bothum faire ſee love gette throwe another arrowe bowe ſhoot gan dreſſe arrowes name simpleſſe love gan nigh nere drowe withouten ſhot might arrow anon right throughout eigh found mine heart hath made wound anon craft drawen ſhaft therewithall ſighed eft mine heart head left aye increaſed deſire vnto bothum drow nere evermo wo deſire go vnto roſer grew freſh bothum ſo bright hew better letten behoved need doen right mine heart bad ever body muſt lad heart wele wo force together muſt go never archer would fine ſhoot pine make mete third arrow gan ſhete beſt time might eſpie named courteſie mine heart avale ſwoune fell dead pale long time lay ſtirred nought till abraied thought faſt aviſed mee draw ſhaft tree ever head leſt behind ought couth pull wind ſore ſticked hit craft might flit anguiſhous full thought felt ſuch wo wound aye wrought ſummoned alway go toward roſe pleaſed ſo ne durſt manere becauſe archer ſo nere evermore gladly rede brent child fire hath much drede certes yet pein though ſigh yet arrowes rein ground quarels ſharpe ſtele ne paine might fele yet might ſelfe withhold faire roſer behold love yave ſuch hardement fulfill commaundement vpon foot roſe feeble forwounded man forth gone might ſet archer nold let toward roſer faſt drow thornes ſharpe mo ynow alſo thiſtles thicke breres brimme pricke ne might get grace rough thornes pace ſeene roſes freſh hew muſt abide though rew hedge ſo thicke cloſed roſes compas thing liked right wele ſo nigh might fele bothum ſwote odour alſo ſee freſh colour right greatly liked mee ſo nere might ſee joy anon thereof forgat malady ſeene ſuch delite ſorrow anger quite wound thore nothing liken might dwellen roſer aye thence never paſſe awaye thare god love ſhare mine heart arrowes kene caſteth yeve wound grene ſhot full haſtely arrow named company takell full able make theſe lady merciable anone gan chaungen hew greevaunce wound new againe fell ſwouning ſighed ſore complaining sore complained ſore gan greven none hope allegiaunce nigh drow diſperaunce rought death ne life whether love would drife martir would make might power forſake anger thus woke god love arrow toke full ſharpe pugnaunt called faire ſemblaunt wiſe would conſent lover repent ſerve love heart perill may befall thought arrow kene ground raſour found cut kerve point god love annoint precious oyntment somedele yeve allegement vpon wound hade body heart made helpe ſores cure may bette endure yet arrow without made mine heart large ſore full greate paine abode aye ointment went abrode throughout wound large wide ſprede every ſide whoſe vertue whoſe might mine heart joyfull light ben dead ſhent precious ointment ſhaft drow arrow looking wo right wonder narrow head made ſmart left behind mine heart fower dare well ſay never woll take away ointment halpe wele yet ſuch ſorrow fele day chaunged hew wound freſh new men might ſee viſage arrowes ſo full rage variaunt diverſitee men everiche might ſee great annoy eke ſweetneſſe joy meint bitterneſſe eaſie wood hem felt harme good ſore without alleggement ſofting ointment ſoftened pricked thus eaſe anger together god love deliverly come lepande haſtely ſaied great yape yeeld thee thou may eſcape may defence availe thee therefore rede make daungere thou wolt yeeld thee haſtely thou ſhalt rather mercy foole ſikerneſſe daunger ſtoutneſſe rebelleth ſhould pleaſe ſuch folly little eaſe meeke thou muſt need bowe ſtrive ayen thy prowe come one ido woll ſo yeeld thee debonairly answered full humbly gladly ſit bidding woll yeeld thing ſervice woll take god defend ſhould make ayen bidding reſiſtence woll doen ſo great offence skill ye may doe ye save ſpill alſo ſlo fro wiſe may go life death hond may laſt bond plaine liſt yeeld hoping heart ſometime ye comfort eaſe ſhull ſend el ſhortly end withouten health mote aye dure ye take cure comfort health ſhould sithe ye hurt ye ſave health love mote found whereas tooken firſt wound ye liſt make priſoner woll take heart fully gree holy plaine yeeld mee without feining feintiſe governed empriſe heare ſo much priſe woll whole deviſe fulfill liking repent nothing hoping yet ſome tide mercy abide covenaunt yeeld mee anon downe kneeling upon knee profering kiſſe fete nothing would lete ſaid love thee preiſe sen thine anſwere doth eſe thou anſwered ſo curteſly wote well utterly thou art gentle thy ſpeech thou man ferre would ſeech ſhould finden certaine ſuch anſwere villaine ſuch word ne might nought iſſue villaines thought thou ſhalt leſen thy ſpeche thy helping woll eche eke encreaſen may firſt woll thou obay fully thine avauntage anone doe homage ſithe kiſſe thou ſhalt mouth villaine never couth approch ne touch ſaufe cherles ne vouch ſhall never neigh nere curteis faire manere well taught full gentleneſſe muſt ſhall kiſſe alſo full high fraunchiſe ſhall attaine empriſe firſt thing warne thee paine great adverſitee mote endure eke travaile ſhall ſerve without faile againſt thee comfort thy ſervice diſport thou maieſt full glad joyfull bee good maiſter mee lord ſo high renoune beare love gonfenoune curteſie banere ſelfe manere gentle courteous meeke free ever ententive bee honour dout ſerve alſo obſerve fro treſpaſſe fro villanie governe courteſie entention firſt priſon caught muſt utterly fro thenceforth full buſily caſt gentle deſire helpe anon without delay withouten daunger affray become man anone gave thankes many one kneled doune honds joint made port full queint joy went heart rote kiſſed mouth ſo ſwote ſuch mixth ſuch liking cured languiſhing asked hoſtages ſayd taken fele homage one bene diſtreined oft withouten wene theſe felon full falſite many ſithes beguiled falſhed luſt atchieved whereof repent agreeved hem get daungere falſhed ſhall bie full dere love thee ſay thee plaine woll thee certaine thee ſore woll binde thou away ne ſhalt winde denien thy covenaunt done avenaunt thou falſe great ruth sith thou ſeemeſt ſo full truth sir thee liſt underſtand marvaile thee asking demaund wherefore ſhould ye hoſtages borowes aske ſikerneſſe sith ye wote ſothfaſtneſſe ye ſurpriſed ſo hole mine heart taken fro woll doe nothing bidding mine heart mine right nought behoveth deede thought ready worke whether ſo tourne good ill ſore luſteth pleaſe man thereof may diſeaſe ye thereon ſet ſuch juſtice werried many wiſe ye doubt nolde obaie ye may thereof doe make kaie hold hoſtage certes none outrage quoth love fully accord bodie full lord hath heart treaſore outrage asken aumener drough little keie fetiſe inough gold poliſhed clere ſayed keye thine heart woll ſhet joyfull looke knet binde little kay wight may carie away keye full great poſte anone touched vnder ſide full ſoftely mine heart ſodainely without ſpeered yet right nought hath deered doen put doubt sir ſayd right great luſt pleaſure fulfill looke ye ſervice take gree thilke fayth ye owe ſay nought recreaundiſe nought doubt ſervice ſervaunt travaileth vaine ſerven doeth paine vnto lord wiſe conne thanke ſervice love ſayd diſmay thee nought sith thou ſuccour haſt ſought thanke thy ſervice woll take high degree woll thee make wickedneſſe ne hinder thee hope ſhall nouht bee worſhip wight aventure may come paine endure abide ſuffer thy diſtreſſe hurteth ſhall leſſe wote ſelfe may thee ſave medicine thou wouldeſt thy truth thou keepe ſhall unto thine helping eke cure thy woundes make hem clene ſo old grene thou ſhalt holpen wordes certainly thou ſhalt well ſhew thou ſerveſt good accompliſhen fulfill commaundements day night lover yeve right ah ſir god love ſayd er ye paſſe hence enterntifely commaundements ye ſay ſhall keepe hem may hem keepen thought ſo wote hem nought may unwittingly wherefore pray entierly mine heart lere treſpace manere god love charged anon ye ſhall ſee word word right empriſe romaunt ſhall deviſe maiſter leſeth time lere diſciple woll vaine ſwinke learning woll thinke ſo luſt love let entend romance beginneth amend good heare fay ſay point reaſon set gate iwis ſhall nat well thing brought good underſtanding reader pointeth ill good ſentence may oft ſpill booke good ending made newe luſtie thing ſo woll ending craft love ſhall lere woll ſo long abide till romance maie unhide undoe ſignifiaunce dreame romaunce ſoothfaſtneſſe hid without coverture ſhall kid undoen haue dreaming wherein word leaſing villanie beginning woll ſay love thing thou leave thou wolt falſe treſpace ayenſt curſe blame generally loven villany villanie maketh villeine deed chorle ſeine theſe villaines ar ne without pitie friendſhip love bountie nill receive unto ſerviſe hem villaines empriſe underſtond thine entent mine entendement clepe wight age onely gentle linage ſo vertuous port outrageous ſuch one thou ſeeſt thee beforne though gentle borne thou maieſt well ſeine ſooth gentle becauſe doth longeth gentleman hem none deme certainly withouten dreede churle demed deede hye lowe ye may ſee kinred bee ne ſay nought none euill thing holden ſtill worſhip miſſaie thou mayeſt enſample take kaie ſometime miſſayeng hated old yeng ferre gawein worthie prayſed courteſie kaie hated fell word diſpitous cruell wherefore wiſe acqueintable goodly word reaſonable leſſe eke mare thou commeſt men looke thou haue cuſtome ay firſt ſalue hem thou may fall hem ſomme salue firſt domme quite courteſly anone without abiding ere gone nothing eke thy tongue applie ſpeake word ribauldrie villaine ſpeech degree let neuer thy lippe unbounden bee nought hold good faith curteis foule word ſaith woman ſerue preiſe thy power honour reiſe miſſayere deſpiſe woman thou maiſt blame bid hold ſtill ſet thy might thy woman lady pleaſe doe thing may hem eaſe euer ſpeake good thee ſo thou maieſt beſt praiſed bee looke fro pride thou keepe thee wele thou maieſt perceiue feele pride folly ſin pride hath within ne may heart wiſe meken ne ſouplen ſeruice pride found euerie part contrarie vnto loues art loueth truely conteine iollily without pride ſundrie wiſe diſguiſen queintiſe queint array without drede nothing proude taketh hede freſh array men may ſee without pride may oft bee maintaine thy ſelfe thy rent robe eke garment many ſith faire clothing man amendeth much thing looke alway ſhape garment thou ſhalt make beſt partaineth thereto pointes ſleeues well ſittand right ſtreight hand ſhone bootes new faire looke leaſt haue paire ſit ſo fetouſly theſe rude may vtterly maruaile ſith ſit ſo plaine come againe weare ſtreight gloues aumere ſilke alway good chere thou yeue thou haue richeſſe thou haue nought ſpend leſſe alway merry thou may waſt thy good alway haue hatte floures freſh may chapelet roſes witſunday ſuch arrie ne coſtneth lite thine hondes waſh thy teeth make white let filth upon thee bee thy nayles blacke thou maieſt ſee voide awaie deliuerly kembe thine head right iollily farce thy viſage wiſe loue nat thempriſe loue doth haten finde beautie commeth kinde alway heart read thee glad merry ioyfull thou loue hath ioy ſorrowfull man euill full curteſie knoweth maladie euer loue ſickneſſe meint ſweete bitterneſſe ſore loue maruailous louer ioyous plaine grone ſingen maken mone day plaineth heauineſſe morow plaineth iolyneſſe life loue full contrarie ſtoundemeale oft varie thou canſt mirthes make men gre woll gladly take doe goodly command thee men ſhould whereſoeuer doe thing hem fitting thereof commeth good loo pris whereof thou vertuous ne nat ſtraunge ne daungerous thou good rider pricke gladly men may ſee armes alſo thou conne purſue till thou name haſt wonne thy voice faire clere thou ſhalt maken great daungere ſing goodly pray thy worſhip obay alſo longeth aye harpe gitterne daunce playe well foot daunce may greatly doe auaunce emong eke thy lady ſake songes complaintes thou make woll meuen hart readen thy ſmart looke man ſcarce thee hold may greeue thee manifold reaſon woll louer yeftes large free churles louing thereof thing ſhall lefe aie yeue londes lore ſo woll leue ſodain ſight kiſſing anon right yaue hole heart thought himſelfe keepeth right nought ſwift good reaſon yeue good abandon woll ſhortly reherſe haue ſayd verſe ſentence wordes fewe compendiouſly thou better mayeſt hem thinke whether ſo thou wake winke wordes little greeue man keepe breeue ſo loue woll gone ride mote courteous voide pride merry full jollite largeſſe loſed firſt joyne thee penaunce euer without repentaunce thou ſet thy thought thy louing laſt without repenting thinke vpon thy mirthes ſweet ſhall follow ye meet thou true love ſhalt commaund thee one place thou ſet hole thine heart without halfen dole trecherie ſikerneſſe loued neuer doubleneſſe many heart woll depart euerich ſhall haue little part hem drede right nought one place ſetteth thought therefore place ſet let neuer thence flet thou yeueſt lening hold wretched thing therefore yeue whole quite thou ſhalt haue merite lent ſone bountie thankes done love free yeuen thing requireth great guerdoning yeue yeft quite fully make thy gift devonairly men yeft hold dere yeuen gladſome chere gift nought prayſen man yeueth maugre thou haſt yeuen thine heart haue ſayd thee openly aduentures ſhull thee fall hard heauie withall oft thou bethinkeſt thee thy louing ſo thou fro folke thou muſt depart hie none perceiue thy maladie hide thine harme thou muſt alone go forth ſole make thy mone thou ſhalt ſtate whilom cold whilom hate redde roſe yellow fade ſorow trow thou neuer hade cotidien ne quarteine ſo full peine often time ſhall fall loue among thy paine thou thy ſelfe holy yetten ſhalt ſo vtterly many time thou ſhalt bee still image tree domme ſtone without ſtirring foote honde without ſpeaking ſoone thy paine memorie ſhalt thou come againe man abaſhed wonder ſore ſighen wit thou wele withouten wene ſuch ſtate full oft haue bene haue euill loue aſſaide thou art ſo diſmaide thought ſhall take thee ſo thy loue ferre fro thou ſhalt ſay god may ne may ladie ſee mine heart alone goe abide ſole woe departed fro mine owne thought mine eien ſe right nought ala mine eyen ſene ne may carefull heart conuay mine heart guide praiſe nothing euer ſe shull abide nay gone viſiten without delay mine heart deſireth ſo certainly go foole ſelfe may well hold ne ſe mine hart wold wherefore woll gone ſene eaſed ſhall neuer bene ſo tokenning goeſt thou forth without dwelling oft thou fayleſt thy deſire er thou mayeſt come nere waſteſt vaine thy paſſage falleſt thou new rage want ſight thou ginneſt murne homeward penſiue thou doeſt returne great miſchiefe ſhalt thou bee againe ſhall come thee sighes plaintes new wo itching pricketh ſo wote nought may goe lere hem buyen loue ſo dere nothing thine heart appeaſen may oft thou wolt gone aſſay thou maieſt ſeene adventure thy life joy thine heart cure grace thou might attaine ſight ſhalt thou done none deed ſight thine eyen feed faire freſh thou mayſt ſee thine heart ſhall ſo raviſhed bee never thou wouldeſt thy thankes lete ne remove ſee ſwete thou ſeeſt ſooth faſtneſſe thou coveteſt ſweetneſſe thine heart brenneth fire thine heart deſire conſidreth euerie dele may likened wonder wele paine love unto fere evermore thou neigheſt nere thought ſo verie ſooth tell thee hotter ever ſhalt thou brenne experience ſhall thee kenne ſo commeſt coſt next fire brenneth moſt yet forſooth thine heat though thou love ſwelt ſweat ne thing thou felen may thou ſhalt willen paſſe away though thou goe yet muſt thou nede thinke day faire hede whome thou held ſo good hold thy ſelfe beguiled ill thou ne hadſt ne hardiment ſhew ought thine entent thine heart full ſore thou wolt diſpiſe eke repreue cowardiſe thou ſo dull every thing domme drede without ſpeaking thou ſhalt eke thinke thou didſt folly thou ſo faſt durſt aventure thee ſay thing er thou came away thou hadſt wonne ſpeake thou begonne yet ſhe would thy ſake armes goodly thee haue take ſhould haue worth thee treaſour great plente thus ſhalt thou mourne eke complain yet encheſon gone vnto thy walke thy place thou beheld fleſhly face never falſe ſuſpection thou wouldeſt finde occaſion gone unto houſe art thou deſirouſe ſight thou thine honour mighteſt ſave errand mighteſt make thider thy love ſake full faine thou woulde dreede thou goeſt leaſt men take heede wherefore read thy going alſo thine againe comming thou well ware men ne wit feine thee cauſe goe way faſt bie heale well follie ſo happe thee thou thy love mayſt ſee ſiker wiſe thou ſalewe wherewith thy colour woll tranſmewe eke thy bloud ſhall quake thy hewe eke chaungen ſake word wit chere full pale shull want tell thy tale thou mayeſt ſo ferre forth winne thou reaſon durſt beginne wouldeſt ſaine three thing mo thou ſhalt full ſcarcely ſaine two though thou bethinke thee never ſo wele thou ſhalt foryete yet ſomedele bvt thou deale trechery falſe lover mowe fouly sain hem luſt withouten dred ſo double falſhed heart thinke thing ſaine another ſpeaking thy ſpeech ended right thus thee ſhall befall word come minde thou ſay haſt left behinde thou ſhalt brenne great martire thou ſhalt brenne fire ſtrife eke affraie battaile laſteth aie bargaine end may never take ſhe thy peace make night commen anon thouſand angres ſhall come upon bed faſt thou wolt thee dight thou ſhalt ſmall delight thou weneſt ſleepe full paine ſhalt thou creepe stert thy bed full wide turne full oft everie ſide downeward groffe upright wallow woe long night thine armes ſhalt thou ſprede brede man warre forwerede ſhall thee come remembraunce ſhape ſemblaunce none may pere wete thou well without thee ſhall ſee ſometime night thou haſt ſo bright naked betweene thine armes ſooth faſtneſſe though thou ſhalt make caſtles spaine dreame joy vaine thee delighten right nought thou ſo ſiumbreſt thought ſo ſweete delitable ſooth ni fable ne ſhall laſt ſhalt thou ſigh weepe faſt ſay deere god thing dreame turned amis full ſweet apparent wake ſhent yede merry thought away twentie time upon day would thought would come againe alleggeth well paine maketh full joyfull thought ſleeth laſteth nought ah lord nill ye ſuccour joy trow langour death would ſhould ſio lye armes two mine harme hard withouten wene great uneaſe full oft mene bvt would love ſo might fully joy ſo bright paine quit richly ala great thing aske folly wrong wening aske ſo outragious thing ſo asketh follily mote warned haſtely ne wote may ſay ſo ferre way would full great liking full great joy laſſe thing would ſhe gentleneſſe withouten one keſſe great guerdon releaſe paſſion hard come thereto folly high mine heart ſet may comfort get wote ſay well nought wote well thought bette alone ſlint woe mone looke caſt goodly utterly another hole play ah lord ſhall bide day ever ſhe ſhall ladie full cured may ſee god ſhall dauning ſpring leggen thus angrie thing joy thus ly love man lyen hath great diſeaſe may ſleepe ne reſt eaſe would dawed day night went away day would riſe ah ſlow ſunne ſhew thine enpriſe speede thee ſpread thy beames bright chaſe darkneſſe night put away ſtoundes ſtrong laſten long night ſhalt thou continue ſo without reſt paine wo ever thou knew love diſtreſſe thou ſhalt mowe learne ſickneſſe thus enduring ſhalt thou lye riſe morow earlye thy bed harneis thee er ever dawning thou maieſt ſee privily ſhalt thou gone whider thy ſelfe alone raine haile ſnow ſlete theder ſhe dwelleth ſo ſwete may fall ſleepe bee thinketh little upon thee ſhalt thou goe full foule aferde looke gate unſperde waite without woe paine full evill cold wind raine ſhalt thou goe dore thou mayeſt finde ſhore hole reft ever ſhalt thou ſtoupe lay eare within ſleepe meane ſave thy ladie free waking thou mayeſt aſpie goe put thy ſelfe jeopardie aske grace thee bimene ſhe may wete without wene thou night reſt haſt ſore thou beſtad woman well ought pitie take hem ſorrowen ſake looke love relike thou thinke none like thou haſt ſo great anney shall kiſſe thee er thou goe awey hold full great deinte man ſhall thee ſee houſe ne way looke thou gon againe er day comming ſuch going heavineſſe ſuch walking maketh lover withouten wene vnder clothes pale lene love leaveth colour ne clearneſſe loveth trew hath fatneſſe thou ſhalt well thy ſelfe ſee thou muſt need aſſaied bee men ſhape hem way falſely lady betray wonder though fatte falſe othes love gatte oft ſee ſuch loengeours fatter abbot priours yet thing thee charge ſay thou large vnto maid doth ſerve beſt thanke thou ſhalt deſerve yeue giftes get grace ſo thou may thanke purchace ſhe thee worthy hold free thy ladie may thee ſee alſo ſervaunts worſhip aie pleaſe much thou maie great good hem may come thee becauſe prive ſhall tell thee fand curteous wiſe well ſhe ſhall preiſe well thee looke lond thou fore ſuch cauſe thou thee behoveth gone countree leave hole thine heart hoſtage till thou againe make thy paſſage thinke long ſee ſweet thing hath thine heart keeping told thee wiſe lover ſhall doe ſerviſe thou wolt haue mede thou craue loue boden ſaid ſir may louers may ſuch manere endure paine ye haue ſayd maruaile wonder faſt man may liue laſt ſuch paine ſuch brenning ſorrow thought ſuch ſighing aie vnreleaſed woe make whether ſo ſleepe wake ſuch annoy continually helpe god maruaile man made ſteele might liue moneth ſuch pain feele god loue ſayd friend bye faith owe thee may man haue good buy man loueth tenderly thing hath bought moſt dere thou well without thanke thing taken man hath ſuffred ſore certes woe ne may attaine vnto ſore loues paine none euill thereto ne may amount man count drop water bee drie well great ſee thou mighteſt harmes tell hem loue dwell ſeruice paine hem ſleeth would flee death trow ſhould neuer eſcape nere hope couth hem make glad man priſon ſete may getten ete barly bread water pure lyeth vermin ordure yet liue good hope ſuch comfort hath yeue maketh wene ſhall deliuered come libertie fortune full truſt though lye ſtraw duſt hope ſuſtaining ſo faire louers wening loue hath ſet priſon good hope ſaluation good hope ſore ſmart yeueth hem hart profer body martire hope ſo ſore doth hem deſire ſuffer harme men deuiſe joy afterward ſhall ariſe hope deſire catch victorie hope loue glorie hope loue may yeue nere hope ſhould lenger liue bleſſed hope deſire auaunceth louers ſuch manire good hope curteis pleaſe keepe louers diſeaſe hope keepeth lond woll abide perill may betide hope louers moſt chiefe doth hem endure miſchiefe hope helpe miſter ſhall yeue thee eke iwis three thinges great ſollace doth hem lace firſt good may found hem lace bound sweet thought record thing wherewith thou canſt accord beſt thine heart ſhe thinking abſence good thee louer doth complaine liueth diſtreſſe paine sweet thought ſhall come bliue away anger driue maketh louers haue remembraunce comfort high pleaſaunce hope hath hight winne thought anone ſhall beginne farre god wote finde make mirrour minde behold woll let perſon ſhall afore ſet laughing eyen perſaunt clere ſhape form goodly chere mouth ſo gracious ſweete eke ſo ſauourous feiters ſhall take heed eyen limmes feed thus sweet thinking ſhall aſwage paine louers rage thy joy ſhall double without geſſe thou thinkeſt ſeemelineſſe laughing chere thee made thy lady dere comfort woll thou take next thou wolt forſake leſſe ſauerous thou ſhouldeſt ben daungerous ſecond ſhall sweet ſpeech hath many one leech bring hem woe helpe many bachelere many ladie ſent ſuccour haue loued paramour ſpeaking might heare louers hem ſo deare voideth ſmart cloſed hart heart maketh hem glad light speech mowe ſight therefore commeth mind old dawes find clerkes written knew ladie freſh hew love made ſong remember among ſhe ſayd heare speaken ſo deare voideth ſmart iwis ſitteth ſo nere mine hart ſpeake eve morrow cureth ſorrow none ſo high pleaſaunce perſon daliaunce wiſt full well sweet ſpeaking comforteth full much thing ſhe full well aſſaide ſhe full well apaide ſpeake joy ſet therefore read thee thou get fellow well counſele keepe thy counſaile welhele goe ſhew wholly thine hart well woe joy ſmart get comfort thou go priuely two ye ſhall ſpeake goodly thing hath thine heart keeping beaute ſemblaunce goodly countenaunce thy ſtate thou ſhalt ſay aske counſaile thou may thing may pleaſe thee ſhall doe great eaſe may wete thou truſt ſo thy wele thy wo heart loue ſet companie much bet reaſon woll ſhew thee vtterly priuite ſhe loueth ſo thee plainly ſhall vndo without drede ſhame tell renome name ſhall farre nere namely thy ladie dere ſiker wiſe ye euery shall helpen owne brother trouth without doubleneſſe keepen cloſe ſikerneſſe noble thing fay haue man thou darſt ſay thy priuie counſaile euerie dele woll comfort thee right wele thou ſhalt hold thee well apaide ſuch friend thou haſt aſſaide third good great comfort yeueth louers moſt diſport commeth ſight beholding cleped sweet looking may none eaſe thou art ferre thy ladie fro wherefore thou preſe alway place thou mayeſt ſee thing moſt amerous moſt delectable fauerous aſſwage mannes ſorrow ſeen ladie morrow full noble thing thine eyen meeting relike precious whereof ſo deſirous day ſooth drede faren amis dreden neither winde ne raine ne none manner paine thine eyen thus bliſſe yet courteſie iwiſſe alone cannot haue joy heart conuoy part bliſſe thou ſend harme make end eye good meſſenger heart ſuch manner tidings ſend hath ſene voide paine clene whereof heart rejoyſeth ſo great partie wo voided put away flight right darkeneſſe night chaſed clereneſſe moone right ſo woe full ſoone deuoided cleane ſight beholden may freſh wight heart deſireth ſo darkneſſe ago heart eaſe ſeen may hem pleaſe haue declared thee thou dread dout haue told thee faithfully thee may curen vtterly louers woll faithfull full ſtabilite good hope alway keepe thy ſide ſweet thought make eke abide sweet looking ſweet ſpech thine harmes ſhall lech euerie thou ſhalt haue great pleaſaunce thou canſt bide ſuffraunce ſerue well without fantiſe thou ſhalt quite thine empriſe guerdoun thou liue time thee yeue god loue day taught ye haue heard ſay enformed compendouſly vaniſhed away ſodainly alone left ſoole full complaint doole ſaw man woundes greeued wonderſly curen nothing knewe saue bothum bright hewe whereon ſette holly thought comfort knew nought god loue knew nat elſe behoue might eaſe comfort gette would entermette roſer withouten dout cloſed hedge without ye toforne haue heard ſaine faſt beſied would faine haue paſſed haie might haue getten ſleight vnto bothum ſo faire ſee euer dradde blamed bee men would haue ſuſpection would entention haue ſtole roſes therefore enter fere laſt bethought whether ſhould paſſe nought ſawe come glad chere luſtly bachelere good ſlature good height bialacoil forſooth height sonne curteſie graunted full gladly paſſage vtter hay ſayd ſir may paſſe bee freſh roſer ſee ye ſweet ſavour fele warrans may right wele thou thee keepe fro folly shall man doe thee villany may helpe ought ſhall faine dredeth nought bound ſeruiſe fully deuoid feintiſe vnto bialacoil ſayd thanke ſir full hartely beheſt take gree ye ſo goodly profer mee commeth great fraunchiſe ye profer ſeruiſe full deliuerly breres anon went whereof encombred haie well pleaſed ſoth ſaie ſe bothum faire ſwote freſh ſprong rote bialacoil ſerued wele ſo nigh might fele bothum ſweet odour ſo luſty hewed colour churle foule betide beſide roſes gan hide keepe roſes roſere name daungere churle hid greues couered graſſe leues ſpie take fond vnto roſer put hond ſoole mo two wicked manner euill fame one cleped name wicked tongue god yeve ſorrow neither eue ne morrow man good ſpeake many iuſt man doth wreake woman eke hight shame reckon right treſpaſſe father name mother reaſon thus shame brought theſe like two yet treſpaſſe neuer ado reaſon ne neuer leie hidous ſo vgly meane treſpaſſe hight reaſon conceiueth ſight shame ſpake aforne shame thus borne ordained chaſtite roſer ladie bothums la ſundrie folkes aſſailed ſhe ne wiſt venus aſſaileth ſo night day ſhe ſtall bothoms roſes reaſon prayeth chaſtite venus hath flemed ouer ſee ſhe daughter would lene keepe roſer freſh grene anon reaſon chaſtite fully aſſented graunted requeſt shame becauſe ſhe honeſt shall keeper roſer thus keepe three none ſhould hardy ne bold young old againe away bere bothoms ne roſes were▪ well ſped awaited theſe three ſeen bialacoil ſo faire gracious debonaire quitte full courteouſly pleaſe bad draw bothom nere preaſe touch roſere bare roſes yave leue graunt ne might little greue ſaw liked right nigh bothom pulled leafe grene yaue •• full nigh bothom ſat • ade leafe full queint felt acqueint bialacoil ſo priue wende wext hardy tell bialacoil befell loue tooke wounded ſayd ſir ſo mote thee may joy haue wiſe vpon ſide ariſe ſith ſhall faine heart haue ſo great paine great annoy ſuch affraie ne wotte ſhall ſaie drede wroth deſerue leuer kniues kerue bodie ſhould peces ſmall wiſe ſhould fall ye wrothed ſhould say boldly thy quoth nill wroth may nought thou ſhalt ſay ſayd ſir diſpleaſe knowen great uneaſe loue hath brought paine great diſeaſe thought fro day day doth drie suppoſeth ſir lie fiue woundes make ſore ſhall neuer ſlake ye bothom graunt moſt paſſaunt beaute life death martire treaſour moſt deſire bialacoil affraied sayd ſir may fall ye deſire may ariſe would ye ſhend wiſe mokell foole ſuffred away beare freſh bothom ſo faire ſight neither skill ne right roſer ye broke rinde take roſe aforne kinde ye courteous aske let ſtill roſer ſit let grow till amended perfectly come beaute nolde pulled fro roſer bere ſo lefe dere anon ſtart daungere place hidde malice chere kidde full great blacke hewe sturdy hidous ſo knewe like ſharpe vrchons haire grow eye red ſparkling fire glow noſe frounced full kirked ſtood come criand wood ſayd bialacoil tell thou bringeſt hider ſo boldly ſo nigh roſere thou worcheſt wrong manere thinketh diſhonour thee thou art well worthy haue maugre let roſere witte ſerueth felon euill quitte thou wouldeſt haue done great bounte ſhame would quite thee flye hence fellow rede thee go wanteth little woll thee ſlo bialacoil ne knew thee nought thee ſerue ſet thought thou wolt ſhame thou might againe reaſon right woll thee affie commeſt ſo ſlightly teſpie prooueth wonder wele thy ſleight treaſon euerie dele durſt make abode churle ſo wode gan threat manace throught haie chace feare trembled quoke churliſh head ſhoke ſayd eft might take ſhould hand ſcape bialacoil fled mate ſoole diſconſolate left alone paine thought fro ſhame death nigh brought thought high folly bodie vtterly yeue paine martire thereto ſo great deſire ne durſt hay paſſe hope grace trow neuer man wiſt paine laced loues chaine ne man ſooth loue anger loue holdeth heſt right wele paine ſayd ſhould fele heart may thinke tongue ſaine quarter woe paine might anger laſt mine heart point braſt thought roſe ſo daunger caſt fro long ſtoode ſtate till ſawe ſo madde mate ladie high ward tower looked thiderward reaſon men clepe lady tower deliuerly come downe without ſhe neither young ne hore ne high ne low ne fat ne leane beſt meane eyen two clere light candle brenneth bright head ſhe croune ſee mede well high perſoune round enuiron crounet full rich ſtones fret goodly ſemblaunt deuiſe trow made paradiſe nature neuer ſuch grace forge worke ſuch compace certain letter lye god himſelfe ſo hye made image yafe ſith ſuch auantage ſhe hath might ſeignory keepe men folly ſo woll trowe lore ne may offenden neuermore ſtoode darke pale reaſon began tale ſaied alhaile ſweete frend folly childhood woll thee ſhend thee haue put great affraie thou haſt bought dere time maie made thine heart merrie euill time thou wenteſt ſee gardin whereof idleneſſe bare key maiſtreſſe thou yedeſt daunce acquaintaunce acquaintance perillous firſt ſoft noyous hath thee traſhed without wene god loue thee ſene ne idleneſſe thee conuaid verge mirth pleid folly haue ſurpriſed thee ſo recouered well ware take counſaile greeueth ſore wiſe woll himſelfe chaſtiſe though young man wiſe treſpaſſe emong follie let tarie haſtelie let amend ſo mi eke counſaile thee iwis god love holly foryete hath thee ſuch paine ſete thee heart tormenteth ſo cannot ſeen thou maiſt go way thee gariſoun daunger ſo feloun fellie purpoſeth thee werreie full cruell ſooth ſeie yet daunger cometh blame reward daughter ſhame hath roſes ward ſhe may muſard wicked tongue theſe two ſuffreth man thider goe er thing doe ſhall commeth fortie place ſought saie thing never done ne wrought much treaſon male falſeneſſe faine tale thou dealeſt angrie folke iwis wherefore thee better theſe folke away fare woll make thee live care evill love call wherein folly love folly everie dell loveth wiſe may well ne ſet thought good werke ſchoole leſeth clerke craft eke ſhall thrive therein love ſhall paſſioun monke hermite chanoun paine heard meaſure joy may eke endure poſſeſſion much tribulation joy ſo ſhort laſting hap getting ſee many travaile laſt foule faile nothing thy counſailer thou made homager god love ſo haſtely wiſedome folly thine heart jolly ſage thou brought ſuch rage yeeld thee ſo readyly love great maiſtrie rede thee love away drive maketh retch thy live folly fro day day shall growe thou put away take thy teeth bridle faſt daunt thy heart eke caſt thou mayeſt get defence redreſſe thy firſt offence ſo heart alway woll leve shall finde emong ſhall greve heard thus chaſtiſe anſweard full angrie wife prayed ceſſe ſpeach either chaſtiſe teach bidde thought refrein love hath caught demein wene ye love woll conſent aſſaieth bowe bent draw mine heart hond ſo quickly bond ye counſaile may never bee firſt areſted mee tooke mine heart ſo ſore till nothing tought ſo obey ſparred key pray let ſtill ye may well ye wordes waſt idleneſſe utterly withouten geſſe ye ſaine vaine lever die paine love ward ſhould arette falſhed treaſon ſette woll get pris blame love true ſave name chaſtiſeth hate word reaſon went gate ſhe ſaw ſermoning might fro folly bring diſmayed left ſoole forwearie forwandred foole ne knew ne cheriſaunce fell remembraunce love bad purvey fellow whome might ſey counſaile privite ſhould much auaile bethought fellow faſt true ſiker courteous hend called name frend true fellow none haſt went anone woe told fro right nought would withhold told without made complaint daungere ſey hidous ward contrarious cruelte point meimed bialacoil ſey within gardin walke pley fro made goe left alone woe durſt longer ſpeake daunger ſayd would wreake ſaw went freſh bothum hent hardie come nere betweene haie roſere friend wiſt thought diſcomforted right nought ſaied fellow nat ſo madde ne ſo abaſhed beſtadde ſelfe know full well daungere fierce chere prime temp love manace full oft beene caſe felon firſt though thou ſhalt ſouple ſee long paſſed knew wele vngodly firſt though men fele woll meeke bearing ſeruice obeiſſing ſhall thee tell thou ſhalt meekely rede thou go heart pray ſpecially thy treſpace haue mercy hote well pleaſe thou ſhalt neuer diſpleaſe beſt ſerue flattery shall pleaſe daunger moſt vtterly friend hath ſaied ſo wele eaſeli hath ſomedele eke allegged tourment hardement againe daunger go preue might meeke ſo daunger came aſhamed aforne blamed deſiring peaſe wo ouer hedge durſt go forbode paſſage found cruell rage hond great bourdoun kneeled low adoun full meeke port ſimple chere ſaied ſir comen onely aske mercy greeueth full greatly euer life wrathed amend come might loud ſtill doen right owne loue made haue treſpaſſed hiderto fro ne may withdraw mine hart yet ſhall neuer ioy ne ſmart ſo befall good ill offend againe leuer haue endure diſeaſe doe ſhould diſpleaſe iyou require pray ye haue mercy pite ſtint ire greueth ſo woll ſweare euermo redreſſed liking treſpace thing saue pray thee graunt thing may nat warned may loue onely none thing aske ſhall doen ywis grace ye graunt ye may letten mee well wote ye loue free ſhall louen ſuch euer like well ill yet ne would fraunce doe thing doe diſpleaſaunce daunger fell entent foryeue male talent wrath yet laſt hath releaſed praide ſo faſt shortly ſaied thy requeſt mockell diſhoneſt ne woll werne thee yet nothing engreeueth mee though thou loue thus euermore neither ſoft ne ſore loue thee liſt retcheth ferre fro roſes truſt none aſſaie time paſſe haie thus hath graunted prayere went forth withouten vnto friend told right ioyfull tale ſaied goeth well thine affaire ſhall thee debonaire though aforne diſpitous ſhall hereafter gracious touched ſome good veine ſhould yet rewen thy peine suffer rede boaſt make till thou good me maiſt take ſuffraunce word ſoft man may ouercome oft aforne drede bookes ſoothly rede thus hath friend great comfort auaunced high diſport would good much anon full ſodainely tooke leave ſtreight went vnto hay great talent ſeene freſh bothom wherein lay ſaluation daunger tooke keepe keepe couenaunt truely ſore drede manaſing durſt breake bidding leaſt ſhent brake commaundement purchaſe good come till mercy ferre behind kept ne might find complained ſighed ſore languiſhed euermore durſt nat ouergo vnto roſe loued ſo throughout deming vtterly knowledge certainly loue ladde ſuch wiſe feintiſe falſhood ne trecherie yet full villanie diſdaine crueltie ne would haue pitie cruell refraine tho wept alway complaine turment come grace god ſent fraunchiſe pity fulfilde bothum bounty go daunger anon right ferther might helpe word deed well ſaw need firſt grace dame fraunchiſe hath taken empriſe ſaied daunger great wrong ye worche man ſo much wo pinen ſo angerly great villauy cannot ſee ne hath treſpaſſed againe saue loveth wherefore ye ſhold charitie hold force love maketh would blame amis leueth may paine hard ye may ſee lo love wiſe would conſent ye power repent though quicke ye would ſlo fro love heart may nat go ſweet ſir eaſe anger diſeaſe ala may auaunce doen ſo great greauaunce worſhip againe take man werre make sith ſo lowly euery wiſe ready ye luſt deuiſe love caught laas beie euery caas ſubject ye therefore willen ill ye ſhould ſpare proud ſtout courteſie would ye ſuccoure hem meeke vnder cure hart hard woll meeke men meekeneſſe beſeeke certaine ſaied pitie ſee oft humilitie ire alſo felonie venquiſheth alſo malanchollie ſtond forth ſuch dureſſe crueltie wickedneſſe wherefore pray ſir daungere maintaine lenger cruell warre againe man wholly euer ye worchen wo vpon caitife languiſheth ſo woll treſpace put wholly grace offence ne lite god love wite thrall ſo greatly ye harme ye doen amis hath full hard pennaunce sith ye reft thaquaintaunce bialacoil moſt joy paine might acoy annoyed ſore ye doubled well bliſſe hath full bare sith bialacoil fro fare love hath great diſtreſſe hath need dureſſe voided ire rede ye may winnen dede maketh bialacoil repaire againe haveth pitie vpon paine fraunchiſe woll pite mercifull ye ſith ſhe accorde vpon miſericorde pray eke moneſte nought refuſen requeſte hard fell thought v two woll doe right nought daunger ne might endure meeked vnto meaſure woll wiſe ſaieth daungere denie ye asked great vncourteſie woll ye companie bialacoil ye deuiſe woll let wiſe bialacoil went hie fraunchiſe ſaied full curteſlie ye long deignous vnto lover daungerous withdraw preſence hath great offence ye would vpon ſee wherefore ſorrowfull man hee shape ye pay pleaſe love ye woll eaſe fulfill ſith ye know daunger daunted brought low helpe pite dare afterde ſhall doe right ye saieth bialacoil skill sith daunger woll ſo fraunchiſe hath ſent bialacoil beginning salued comming ſtraungeneſſe ſeene ne wrathed faire ſemblaunt ſhewed goodly aforne hond without dout within haie right lad right good chere enuiron vergere daungere chaſed fro leave ouer go raiſed deuiſe fro hell vnto paradiſe thus bialacoil gentleneſſe paine buſineſſe hath ſhewed onely grace efters ſwote place ſaw roſe nigh greater woxen high freſh roddy faire hew colour euer iliche new long ſeene ſaw leaues greene roſe ſpread ſpanniſhing ſeene goodly thing ne ſo ſprede brede men within might know ſede couert cloſe leaf roſe ſtalke euen grene vpright thereon goodly ſight well better without wene ſeed ſene full faire ſprad god bleſſe ſuch another geſſe aforne ne ne vermaile abawed maruaile euer fairer bounden loues laas long abode ſooth ſay till bialacoil gan pray ſaw wiſe warnen ſeruiſe would graunt thing remember well ſitting ſaine grace would yeue leiſure ſpace ſo deſirous haue kiſſing precious goodly freſh roſe ſo ſweetly ſmelleth noſe diſpleaſed nought woll gladly haue ſought haue kiſſe thereof freely yeft certainely woll none haue leue loth greue ſaied friend ſo god ſpede chaſtitie haue ſuch drede thou ſhouldeſt warned dare chaſtite againe dare mi alway biddeth ſhe ſo yeue louer leaue kiſſe thereto may winnen iwiſſe ſurplus praie may liue hope get ſome day ſo kiſſing may attaine loues paine hath ſooth ſaine beſt moſt auenaunt earneſt remenaunt anſwere ſighed ſore durſt aſſay tho ſuch drede greve aye man ſhould much aſſaye chafe friend meaſure put life auenture man firſt ſtroke ne may fell downe oke reiſins haue wine till grape ripe well fine empreſſed enſure drawen preſſure forpeined wonder ſtrong though abode right long kiſſe paine wo sith kiſſe deſired ſo till renning diſtreſſe come venus goddeſſe aye werrieth chaſtite came grace ſuccour whoſe might know ferre wide ſhe mother cupide god loue blind ſtone helpeth louers many one lady brought right hond brenning fire blaſing brond whereof flame hote fire hath many lady deſire loue brought ſore hette ſeruice heart ſette lady good entaile right wonderfull apparaile attire ſo bright ſhene men might perceiue well ſene religioun nill make mentioun robe treaſour broche neither rich attour ne girdle ſide nill long abide knoweth well certainely arraied richely deuoid pride certaine ſhe bialacoil ſhe went apaas ſhortely clauſe ſaid ſir cauſe ye ben port ſo daungerous vnto louer dainous graunt nothing kiſſe warne ye done amiſſe sith well ye wot hee loues ſeruaunt ye may ſee hath beautie worthy loue haue blis ſeemely behold ſee faire free ſwote debonaire age young luſty faire lady ſo hautaine ducheſſe counteſſe ne chaſtelaine nolde hold vngodly refuſe vtterly breath alſo good ſwete eke lip roddy mete onely plaine kiſſe graunt kiſſe gentleniſſe teeth arne alſo white clene thinketh wrong withouten wene ye warne truſteth graunt kiſſe haue laſſe ye helpe ye haſt time ſhull ye waſt flame brond venus brought right hond bialacoil hete ſmete anone withouten lete graunt roſe kiſſe paine gan liſſe roſe anon went kiſſed full faithfully need man aske blith ſauour ſoft lith stroke mine heart without allegged ſore full joy bliſſe faire ſuch floure kiſſe ſo ſwote ſauerous might ſo anguiſhous mote glad jolly remembre yet euer among ſoothly ſaine ſuffer noie much paine ſee may neuer ſo ſtill little wind ouer whelme tourne alſo wood wawes go calme trouble ſoone mote follow chaunge moone right ſo fareth love ſelde one holdeth anker right anone eaſe wene beſt live ben tempeſt fordriue ſerueth loue tell wo ſtoundmele joy mote ouergo hurteth cureth ſelde point love endureth right proceed shame gan meddle take heed fell anger hade ſtrong wall made caſtle brede length god love wan ſtrength romance ſet thing ne let liking floure beaute ſhe may beſt labour quite love ſhall endite wicked tongue couine euery lover deuine worſt addeth ſomdele wicked tongue ſaith neuer wele ward bare right great hate eſpying early late till hath ſeene great chere bialacoil ifere might tongue withſtond worſe report fond ſo full curſed rage ſat wele linage irous woman bare tongue filed ſharpe ſquare poiguaunt right keruing wonder bitter ſpeaking gan eſpy ſwore affirming ſikerly betweene bialacoil euill acquaintaunce priue ſpake thereof ſo folilie awaked ielouſie afraied riſing heard iangling ran anon wood bialacoil ſtood leuer caas haue ben reines amia fote hote fellonie thus ſaid ielouſie haſt thou ben ſo negligent keepen abſent verger left thy ward thou haddeſt regard truſt thy confuſion thus ſuſpection haue right great nede well ſhewed dede great fault thee found god anon thou ſhalt bound faſt locken toure without refuite ſuccoure shame long hath thee fro ouerſoone ſhe ago thou haſt loſt drede fere ſeemed well ſhe buſie wiſe keepe thee chaſtiſe helpen chaſtite keepe roſer thinketh boy knaue ſo boldly ne ſhould hardy verge ſuch game turneth great ſhame bialacoil niſt ſay full faine would fled away feare hid nere ſuddainly tooke ſaw ſo ielouſie take v two aſtonied knew rede fied away drede shame came forth full ſimply wend treſpaced full greatly humble port made ſimple wearing vaile ſtede wimple nonnes done abbey becauſe heart affray gan ſpeake within throw ielouſie right wonder low firſt grace ſhe beſought ſaid ſir ne leueth nought wicked tongue falſe eſpie ſo glad faine lie hath made flattering bialacoil falſe leaſing falſeneſſe anew long knew firſt daie wicked tongue hath cuſtome aie young folkes bewrie falſe leſings hem lie yet neuertheleſſe ſee among ſoigne ſo long bialacoil heart lure love ſeruice endure drawing ſuch folke hath nothing foothneſſe trow nought bialacoil euer thought treſpace villanie mother curteſie hath taught euer good acquaintaunce priue loveth none heauineſſe mirth play gladneſſe hateth trechous soleine folke enuious ye weten woll euer glad joyfull honeſtly folke pley negligent good fey chaſtiſe therefore heart crie mercy haue ben ſo recheles tamen withouten lee folly repent woll hole ſet mine entent keepe low ſtill bialacoil shame shame ſaid ielouſy bitraſhed great drede haue lecherie hath clombe ſo hie almoſt bleared mine eie wonder drede haue ouer reigneth lechery whoſe might groweth night dey cloyſter abbey chaſtitie werried ouer therefore woll ſiker wall cloſe roſes roſere long manere left hem vncloſed wilfully wherefore right inwardly sorrowfull repent ſhall lenger vncloſed yet drede ſore ſhall repent ferthermore game goeth amis counſaile muſt new ywis haue long truſted thee ſhall lenger bee may beſt euery coſt deceiue men treſten moſt ſee well nigh ſhent ſet full entent remedy puruey wherefore cloſe ſhall wey hem woll roſe eſpie come wait villonie good faith trouth woll let ſlouth liue ſikerneſſe make anon fortreſſe cloſe roſes good ſauour middes ſhall make tour put bialacoil priſon forever drede treaſon trow ſhall keepe ſo ſhall might go make companie hem thinke villanie ne ſuch hath ben aforne found good chere han aſſailed ſhend trowandiſe blend foole eith beguile may liue little ſhall forthinke faire ſemblaunt word came drede auaunt abaſhed great fere wiſt ielouſie drede ſuch affray word durſt ſay quaking ſtood full ſtill alone till ielouſie way gone saue shame forſoke drede ſhe full ſore quoke laſt drede abraide couſin shame ſaide shame ſaid ſoothfaſtneſſe great heauineſſe noiſe ſo ferre go ſlaunder v two ſith befall may againe call ſprung fame many yeare withouten blame haue ben many day many aprill many may han paſſed aſhamed till ielouſie hath v blamed miſtruſt ſuſpection cauſeleſſe without encheſon go daunger haſtely let v ſhew openly hath aright wrought ſet thought keepe better purpriſe wiſe hath v great wrong hath ſuffred ſo long bialacoil luſtes fulfill muſt amend vtterly el ſhall villanouſly exiled lond warre may withſtond ielouſie greefe sith bialacoil miſcheefe daunger shame drede anon right way ben gon chorle found hem aforne ligging vnder hawthorne vnder head pillow ſtede truſſe gras ſlombred nappe toke till shame pitouſly ſhoke great manace gan make ſleepeſt thou thou ſhould wake qd shame thou doſt v villanie truſteth thee doth follie keepe roſes bothums faire ſeaſons thou art woxe familiere thou ſhould ſtraunge chere stout thy port ready greue thou doeſt great folly leue bialacoil call yonger man ſhenden v though thou ſleepe may ielouſie great noiſe art thou late riſe vp hye ſtop ſoone deliuerlye gap hay fauour thee pray falleth nothing thy name make fair ſemblant thou maiſt blame bialacoil ſweet free dogged fell thou ſhouldeſt bee froward outragious iwis chorle chaungeth curteis haue heard oft ſaying man may daunting make ſperhauke boſarde men hold thee muſarde debonaire haue founden thee ſitteth thee nought curteis bee doe men pleaſaunce ſeruiſe thee recreaundiſe let thy werkes ferre nere like thy name daungere akaſhed ſhewing anon ſpake drede right thus ſaying ſaid daunger drede thou ne wolt beſie keepe thou haſt keepe thou ſhouldeſt wake thou art aſleepe thou ſhalt greeued certainely thee aſpie ielouſy find thee blame hath aſſailed shame chaſed away great manace bialacoil place ſweareth ſhortly ſhall encloſe ſturdy wall thy wickedneſſe thee faileth ſtraungeneſſe thine heart trow failed thou ſhalt repent ſpeciall ielouſie ſooth knew thou ſhalt forthinke ſore rew chorle clubbe gan ſhake frouning eyen gan make hidous chere man rage ire brent viſage heard blamed ſo ſaid witte go diſcomfite haue great wrong certes haue liued long sith may cloſer keepe quicke would doluen deepe man ſhall repaire garden foule faire mine heart ire gothe afere let entre haue doe folly ſee ſhall amended ſetteth foot truly ſhall repent ſore man place enter ſhall haue grace lever ſwerds twaine throughout mine heart every vaine perced many wound ſlouth ſhould ſound henceforth night day ſhall defend may withouten exception manner condition man graunt holdeth recreaunt daunger foot gan ſtond hent burdon hond wroth ire ne left nought verger hath ſought might find hole trace mote forth pace gappe cloſe man might touch roſe roſer ſhetteth euery man without thus day day daunger wers wonderfull diuers feller eke euer full oft ſing ala ne may nought ire recouer moſt deſire mine heart ala woil breſt two bialacoil wrathed ſo certainly euery member quake remember bothum would full oft day ſeene behold thinke vpon kiſſe much ioy bliſſe ſauour ſwete want grone grete thinketh fele yet noſe ſweet ſauour roſe wote mote go ferre freſh floures fro full welcome death abſence thereof ala ſleath whylome roſe ala touched noſe mouth face death muſt abide loue conſent another tide one touch may kiſſe trow paine ſhall neuer liſſe thereon couetiſe brent heart many wiſe ſhall repaire againe ſighing long watch night ſleeping thought wiſhing turment wo many turning fro halfe paine cannot tell fallen hell paradiſe wealth turment greueth annoyeth bitterneſſe toforne haue felt ſweetneſſe wicked tongue falſhede cauſeth wo drede lieth pitous charge becauſe tongue large time ſhortly tell ſomething ielouſie great ſuſpection left maſon ſtone could lay ne querrour hired hem make tour firſt roſes keepe hem made ditch deepe right wonder large alſo brode vpon alſo ſtode ſquared ſtone ſturdy wall cragge founded right great thickneſſe eke bare founded ſquare hundred fadome euery ſide liche long wide leaſt time aſſailed full well battailed round enuiron eke ſet full many rich faire tournet euery corner wall ſet tour full principall eueriche without fable portculliſe defenſable keepe enemy greue force would preue eke amidde purpriſe made tour great maiſtriſe fairer ſaugh man ſight large wide great might dradde none aſſaut ginne gonne skaffaut temprure mortere made liquour wonder dere quicke lime perſaunt egre tempred vinegre ſtone hard adamaunt whereof made foundemaunt toure round made compas world richer ne better ordained therewithall tour made wall betwixt tour roſes ſet ſweet ſauour many roſes bere eke within caſtle springolds gonne bowes archer eke corner men ſeine ouer wall ſtond great engins nere hond kernel arblaſters great plentie none armour might ſtroke withſtond folly preaſe hond without ditch liſtes made wall battaited large brade men horſe ſhould attaine nigh ditche ouer plaine thus ielouſie hath enuiron sette garniſon wals round diche deepe onely roſer keepe daunger early late keyes kept vtter gate opened toward eaſt leaſt thirtie ſeruaunts echone name gate kept shame opened couth toward part south sergeaunts aſſigned full many drede baillie keeping conſtablerie toward north vnderſtond opened vpon left hond nothing may ſure ſhe doe buſie cure early morrow alſo late strongly ſhette barre gate euery thing ſhe may ſee drede aferde ſo ſhe bee puffe little wind drede aſtonied mind therefore ſtealing roſe rede nat yate vncloſe foules flight would make flee eke ſhaddow ſhe ſee wicked tongue full enuie ſouldiers normandie cauſeth debate keeper fourth gate alſo tother three went full oft ſee lotte walke night inſtruments would dight blow make ſoune ofter hath encheſoune walken oft vpon wall corner wickettes ouer full narrow ſearchen eſpie though nought fond yet would lie diſcordaunt euer fro armonie diſſoned melodie controue would foule faile hornepipes cornewaile floites made diſcordaunce muſicke miſchaunce would ſeine note new fond woman trew ne ſaw neuer life vnto husbond trew wife ne none ſo full honeſte ſhe nill laugh merry ſhe heareth may eſpie man ſpeaken lecherie eueriche hem hath ſome vice one diſhoneſt another nice one full villanie another hath licorous eie one full wantonneſſe another chidereſſe thus wicked tong god yeue ſhame put hem euerichone blame without deſert cauſeleſſe lieth though ben guiltleſſe pity ſeene ſorrow waketh euen morrow innocent doth ſuch greuaunce pray god yeue euill chaunce euer ſo buſie woman ſeine amis eke ielouſie god confound hath made toure ſo round made gariſon ſette bialacoil priſon ſhette tour full long hold ſoiour liue pennaunce greuaunce hath ordained ielouſie old vecke ſpie manner gouernaunce deuill enfaunce learned loues art plais tooke part except ſeruiſe knew wrenche euery giſe loue euery wile hard beguile bialacoil ſhe tooke aye hede euer liueth wo drede kept coy eke priue leaſt ſhe ſee folly countenance ſhe knew old daunce ielouſie bialacoil baillie ſhette vp ſo free ſure would bee truſteth ſore caſtell ſtrong werke liketh well dradde nat glotons ſteale roſes bothoms roſes aſſured defenced ſtrong wall iealouſie full well may drede deuoid liberte whether ſleepe wake roſes may none take bvt ala mourne ſhall becauſe without wall full much dole mone made wiſt wo hade trow would haue pite loue deare ſold good loue went queintly doubling paine ſee woll ſell againe new bargaine lere dere ſollace haue lorne neuer aforne certaine full like indeed caſt earth ſeed hath ioy new ſpringing greeneth ginning alſo faire freſh flour luſtie ſeene ſwote odour ere ſheues ſhere may fall weather ſhall dere make fade fall ſtalke greine floures tiller fordone hope ſoone drede certaine ſo fare hope trauaile ſikerly ben beraft ſtorme floure nill ſeden corne loue hath ſo auaunced began priuite bialacoil tell ne found froward ne fell tooke agree whole play loue ſo hard aſſay one reued weent beſt abouen haue loue fortune chaungeth oft nill contune whylome woll folke ſmile glombe hem another friend foe ſhalt feele twinckling tourneth wheele writhe head away concourſe play areiſe doeth mourne whirle adoune ouertourne ſitteth higheſt luſt foole woll truſt come doun charge reuolutioun sith bialacoil mote fro twin shette priſon yonde within abſence mine heart fele ioy mine hele roſe doeth cloſe open may ſee loue woll cured bee paine endure cruell auenture ah bialacoil mine owne dere though thou priſonere keepe leaſt thine heart ſuffer daunted ne let iealouſie rage putten thine heart ſeruage although chaſtice thee without make thy bodie vnto lout haue heart hard diamaunt stedfaſt naught pliaunt priſon though thy bodie bee large keepe thine heart free true heart plie mannace may drie ielouſie doeth thee paine quite thus againe venge thee leaſt thought way thou maieſt nought wiſe ſubtelly worch winne maiſtrie yet great affray leaſt thou doe nat ſay drede thou canſt great maugre thou empriſoned art nat treſpas neuer diſcouered yet thing ought ſecre well annoy thee miſchaunce endure hard pennaunce ſaine thinke ſorrow almoſt ſinke remember wo full nigh witte go inward mine heart feele blede comfortleſſe death drede owe nat well haue diſtreſſe falſe wickedneſſe traitours arne enviours noien ſo coragious ah bialacoil full well ſee hem ſhape deceiue thee make thee buxum law cord thee draw ſo hem luſt right drede haue thee brought theretill without comfort thought ſleath game would bring death good leſe mote dead may cheſe thou foryete mine heart ſhall neuer liking elswhere find ſollace put grace ſhall neuer ben hope ſhould fall wanhope ala wanhope nay parde woll neuer diſpaired hope faile vngracious vnworthy hope woll comforted loue betaught saied hope ſo go aye relees wo ſhe bale bete curteis ſwete nothing full certaine louers ſhe put full great paine maketh hem wo dele faire beheſte deceiueth fele ſhe woll behote ſikerly failen vtterly ah full noyous thing many louer louing hangeth upon truſteth faſt leſe trauaile laſt thing commen ſhe wot right nought therefore wiſely ſought counſaile follie take many time ſhe woll make full good ſillogiſme drede afterward ſhall indede follow euill concluſion put confuſion many time haue ſeene many haue beguiled beene truſt haue ſet hope fell hem afterward ſlope bvt natheleſſe yet gladly ſhe would woll hold time purpoſe clere without deceit ſhe deſireth ſikerly blamed folly auaileth good ſhe ne may ſtaunch ſtound ill helpeth little ſhe may take beheſt vnto wo heſte certaine wiſe without ifete preiſe heſte deed aſunder vary doen great contrary thus poſted vp doun dole thought confuſioun diſeaſe number daunger shame encumber drede alſo ielouſie wicked tongue full enuie ſharpe cruell ire full oft put great martire haue ioy fully let sith bialacoil haue beſhet fro priſon wickedly loue ſo entierly woll bane bee ſooner may ſee yet moreouer worſt ſet keepe foule befall rimpled vecke ferre ronne rage frouning yellow viſage await lieth day night none may haue ſight mote ſorrow enforced full ſooth loue yafe three wonder yefts grace haue lorne place sith ne may without drede helpen little taketh hede auaileth sweet thought sweet ſpeech helpeth right nought third called sweet looking lorne without leſing yefts faire nat thy helpe ſimply bialacoil looſed bee gone large free life lieth dout come rather ala trow woll nat beene ſhould euermore ſeene may nat wrong becauſe toure ſo ſtrong ſhould whoſe proweſſe ſo ſtrong fortereſſe certaine nill god wote haue thereto well wote rage
