loue homage cauſe ſoothfaſtneſſe ſelfe dame idleneſſe conueide faire praiers enter faire vergere blame leue doeth ſore greue fooles word nought trow ne worth apple low men ſhould hem ſnibbe bitterly prime temp folly foole ſhe leued right nought releued accompliſhed greueth wonder ill reaſon ſaied ſhould fall foole ſelfe may well call loue aſide laied trowed dame reaſon ſaied reaſon skill right ſhe blamed might meddle loue hath ſhent certaine woll repent ſhould repent nay parde falſe traitour ſhould deuils engins would take love would forſake bialacoil falſly betray miſcheefe hate nay sith courteſie priſon ielouſie courteſie certaine much may yolden haie paſſen lete kiſſe roſe faire ſwete therefore conne maugre nay certainely ſhall nat love ſhall neuer yeue god word offence complaint leſſe neither hope idleneſſe certes wrong hated hem courteſie el ſuffer thinke waken ſhould winke abide hope till loue chaunce send ſuccour allegeaunce expectaunt aye till may mete getten mercie ſwete whilome thinke love mee saied would take gree ſeruice vnpatience cauſed doen offence ſaied thanke ſhall take high maiſter eke thee make wickedneſſe ne reue thee ſoone trow ſhall nat bee theſe word ſeemed loved truely ſerue wele thinke thanke fele good mine harme lithe hole love may defaut true love ne failed neuer man soothly faute mote need god forbide found commeth cannot ſee let gone may go whether love woll ſuccour ſlo may hole ſo ſore bound till ſeruice may flene life death withouten wene hand may nat cheſe may doe winne leſe ſith ſo ſore doth greue yet luſt would acheue bialacoil goodly yeue force fell though die mote nede pray love goodlyhede bialacoil doe gentleneſſe liue ſuch diſtreſſe mote dien penaunce firſt without repentaunce woll confeſſe good entent make haſt teſtament louers doen feelen ſmart bialacoil leaue mine heart hole without departing doubleneſſe repenting ¶coment raiſon vient lamant thus made paſſage complaint cruell rage finde leche couth vnto mine helping eche suddainely againe comen doun toure ſaw reaſoun diſcreet wiſe full pleaſaunt port full auenaunt right way ſhe tooke ſtood great perplexite poſhed euery ſide niſt might abide till ſhe demurely ſad chere saied ſhe came nere mine owne friend art thou greued quarrell yet atcheued love ſide anone tell haſt thou yet love thy fill art thou nat wearie thy ſeruice thee hath ſuch wiſe joy haſt thou thy louing ſweet bitter thing canſt thou yet cheſe let ſee beſt thy ſuccour might bee thou ſerueſt full noble lord maketh thee thrall thy reward aye reneweth thy tourment folly ſo hath thee blent thou fell miſcheefe thilke day thou diddeſt ſooth ſay obeiſaunce eke homage thou wroughteſt nothing ſage thou became liege man thou diddeſt great follie thou wiſteſt nat fell thereto lord thou haddeſt thou haddeſt well know thou haddeſt nought brought ſo low thou wiſt thou noldeſt ſerue halfe yere nat weeke halfe day ne yet houre without delay ne neuer iloved paramour lordſhip ſo full ſhours knoweſt ought lamaunt ye dame parde raiſoun nay nay lamaunt yes raiſoun wherefore let ſee lamaunt ſaied ſhould glad haue ſuch lord maiſter ſuch ſeignorie raiſoun knoweſt lamaunt nay certes saue yafe rule went way niſt abode bound ballaunce lo noble cogniſaunce ¶raiſoun bvt woll thou know ginning end ſith thou art ſo anguiſhous mate diſfigured aſtate may wreche haue wo ne caitife none enduren ſo euery man ſitting lord haue knowledging thou knew dout lightly thou ſhouldeſt ſcapen thy priſon marreth thee ¶lamaunt yea dame ſith lord hee man made mine hond would right faine vnderſtond know kind would enforme ¶raiſoun would ſaied reaſon thee lere sith thou learne haſt ſuch deſire ſhew thee withouten fable thing demonſtrable thou ſhalt withouten ſcience know withouten experience thing may knowen bee ne wiſt ne ſhewed degree thou maieſt ſooth witten though thee written thou ſhalt know thereof thou art ruled lore vnto loue woll flie knotte may vnloſed hath thee found long knitte unbound ſet well thine entention heare loue deſcription loue hatefull pee free acquitaunce without relees fret full falſhede ſikerneſſe ſet drede heart deſpairing hope full hope wanhope wiſe woodneſſe void reaſoun sweet perill droun heauie burthen light beare wicked wawe away weare caribdes perillous diſagreeable gracious diſcordaunce accord accordaunce diſcord conning without ſcience wiſedome without ſapience witte without diſcretion hauoire without poſſeſſion like heale hole ſickeneſſe truſt drowned dronkenneſſe health full maladie charitie full enuie anger full aboundance greedie ſuffiſaunce delight right full heauineſſe dreried full gladneſſe bitter ſweetneſſe ſweet errour right euill ſauoured good ſauour sin pardon hath within pardon ſpotted without ſin palne alſo ioyous fellonie right pitous alſo play ſelde ſtable ſtedfaſt right meuable ſtrength weiked ſtond vpright feebleneſſe full might witte unauiſed ſage follie ioy full tourmentrie laughter weeping aie reſt trauaileth night daie alſo ſweete hell ſorrowfull paradis pleaſaunt gaile eaſie priſoun full froſt summer ſeaſoun prime temp full froſtes white maie deuoid delite ſeer braunches bloſſoms vngrene new fruit filled winter tene ſlowe may nat forbeare ragges ribaned gold weare alſo well woll loue ſette vnder ragges rich rotchette eke well amorettes mourning blacke bright burnettes none ſo mokell priſe ne man founden ſo wiſe ne none ſo high parage ne manne found witte ſo ſage man ſo hardie ne ſo wight ne man ſo mokell might none ſo fulfilled bounte loue may daunted world holdeth way loue maketh gone miſway euill life genius curſed man wife wrongly werke againe nature none ſuch loue ne haue cure ſuch loues ſeruaunts beene woll nat counſaile fleene ne preiſe louing wherethrough man laſt ending shall call hem wretch full wo loue greueth hem ſhendeth ſo thou wolt well loue eſchew eſcape mew make whole ſorrow ſlake better counſaile maieſt thou take thinke fleen well iwis may nought helpe el wit thou thou flye ſhall flye thee follow followen ſhall thee ¶lamaunt heard reaſon ſain ſpilt ſpeech vain dame ſayd dare well ſay auaunt well may ſchoole ſo deuiaunt neuer auaunt right nought doctrine dull vnder diſcipline wote wiſt euer ſo contrarie ſo fer euerie thing ye lere yet partuere mine heart foyeteth thereof right nought ſo writen thought deepe grauen ſo tender heart render rede ouer communely ſelfe lewdeſt bvt ſith ye love diſcriuen ſo lacke preiſe two defineth letter may thinke better heard neuer defined wilfully would lere love ſearched well ſought ſickeneſſe thought annexed knedde betwixt tweine male female cheine freely bindeth y• nill twinne wheder ſo thereof leſe winne roote ſpringeth hot brenning diſordinate deſiring kiſſen embrace luſt ſolace thing love retcheth nought ſetteth heart thought delectatioun procreatioun fruit engendrure love god pleaſure body fruit get yeue force ſo ſet vpon delight play fere ſome alſo manere fainen hem love ſeke love preiſe leke paramour doe faine love truely diſdaine falſen lady traitorouſly ſwerne hem othes vtterly many leaſing many fable finden deceiuable han luſt getten hote erne foryetten woman harme buyen full ſore men thus thinke • euermore laſſe harme ſo mote thee deceiue deceiued namely ne may find none meane way wote well ſoothfaſtneſſe doeth buſineſſe woman dele luſt may fele engendru • e doth treſpaſſe enſure ſhould ſetten getten likely thing till ſuſtaine might keepe forth kindes right owne likeneſſe ſemblable becauſe corrumpable faile ſhould ſucceſſion ne generation ſectes ſterne ſaue father mother arne graue child ſhould dead full diligent ſtead vſe worke ſuch wiſe one may another riſe therefore ſet kinde therein delight men therein ſhould hem delight deed erke oft ſithes haunt werke none would draw thereof draught ne delight hath hem caught ſubtill dame nature none goeth right thee enſure ne hath entent hoole ne perfite deſire delite fortened creaſe eke play love oft ſeeke thrall hem ſelfe ſo nice vnto prince euerie vice ſinne roote vnlefull luſt though ſoote euill racine tullius determine time full ſage booke made age praiſeth elde though crooked vnwelde commendatioun youth diſcriptioun youth ſet man wife perill ſoule life perill men grace perill youth pace without death diſtreſſe ſo full wildneſſe oft doeth ſhame domage linage leadeth man vp doun mokell diſſolutioun maketh love euill companie lead life diſrulilie halt payd none eſtate within himſelfe ſuch debate chaungeth purpoſe entent yalt ſome couent liuen empriſe leeſeth freedome fraunchiſe nature ſet againe may get make manſion abide profeſſion though time heart abſent may faile ſhall repent eke abide thilke day leaue abite gone way leaſeth worſhip name dare come againe ſhame life doth ſo mourne becauſe dare home retourne freedome kinde ſo loſt hath neuer may recured god graunt grace may er hence pace conteine vnder obedience vertue patience youth ſet man follie vnthrift ribaudrie lecherie outrage oft chaungeth courage youth ginneth oft ſuch bargaine may end without paine great perill ſet youth hede delight ſo doeth bridell lede delight hangeth drede thee nought mannes bodie thought onely youthes chambere doen evill cuſtomere naught elſe taketh hede onely folly lede diſport wildeneſſe froward ſadneſſe elde draweth hem therefro wote may well go mo arne old whilom youth hold yet remembreth tender age brought many rage many follie therein wrought y• elde hath ſought repent hem follie youth hem put jeopardie perill much woe made hem oft amiſſe doe ſewen evill companie riot advoutrie bvt elde gan againe reſtraine ſuch follie refraine ſet men ordinaunce good rule governaunce evil ſhe ſpendeth ſerviſe man woll love neither preiſe hated wote wele acquaintance would man fele ne han elde companie men hate alie man would becommen old ne die young bold elde maruaileth right greatly remember hem inwardly many perillous empriſe wrought ſundry wiſe however might without blame eſcape away without ſhame youth without domage reprefe linage loſſe member ſhedding blood perill death loſſe good woſt thou nat youth abit men ſo preiſen wit delight ſhe halt ſojour dwellen tour long youth ſeaſon dwellen one manſion delight youth woll ſerviſe doe ſo woll deviſe youth readie evermore obey ſmert ſore vnto delight yeve ſerviſe ſhe may live elde abitte woll thee tell shortly dwell thider behoveth thee go death youth thee ſlo journey thou mayſt faile labour trauaile lodged keen ſorrow wo never court go paine diſtreſſe ſickeneſſe ire melancholly angrie ſire ben pale ſenatours groning grutching herbegeours day night tourment cruell death preſent tellen erltch late death ſtondeth armed gate bring remembraunce folly deedes enfaunce cauſen mourne wo youth hath beguiled ſo ſodainly away ha • ted weeped time ſhe hath waſted complaining preteritte preſent nat abitte old vanitee aforne ſhe may ſee future ſome ſuccour leggen dolour graunt time repentaunce ſinnes doe penaunce laſt ſo gouerne winne joy eterne fro goe backeward youth made vanitie drowne wade preſent time abideth nought ſwift thought little doth endure ni compt ne meaſure ever game go liſt love joy mirth alſo love ſhe hie low fruite ſhould hem delite part may elſe quite ſave hem ſelfe honeſte yet full many one ſee woman ſoothly ſaine deſire would faine play love ſo wilde covet go childe childe perchaunce woll hold great miſchaunce whatſoever woe fele woll plaine concele foole nice whome ſhame hath juſtice delight eachone draw haunt worke hie law save ſuch arne worth right nought money woll bought love preiſe wiſe given covetiſe praiſe woman though ſhe wood yeveth ſelfe good little ſhould man tell bodie ſell ſhe maid ſhe wife quicke woll ſell life faire chere ever ſhe make wretch undertake loved ſuch one ſweete ſoure though ſhe called paramoure laugheth maketh feaſt certainly ſuch beaſt loved worthy beare name drury none ſhould pleaſe wer wood woll diſpoile good yet natheleſſe woll ſay ſhe ſolace play may iewell thing take love free yeving ſhe aske wiſe drede ſhame covetiſe ſhe may certaine without ſlaunder yeven againe joyne heart togither ſo love take yeve alſo trow hem twinne love ſinne woll together go done han ado curtes ſhould debonaire love beren hem faire without vice ſhe alway honeſte fro folly love keepe hem clere brenneth herts fere love wiſe devoide covetiſe good love ſhould engendred true heart juſt ſecree ſuch ſet thought luſt elſe nought caught love lace truly bodily ſolace fleſhly delight ſo preſent thee ſet thine entent without ſhould gloſe get roſe maketh thee ſo mate wood thou deſireſt none good thou art inch nerre ever abideſt ſorrow werre thy face ſeene maketh thee pale leene thy might thy vertue goeth away ſorry gueſt good fay thou harboureſt thine inne god love thou let inne wherefore read thou ſhette ſhall greve thee dout thy profite woll tourne thee ſojourne great miſchiefe ſorrow ſonken ben heart love arne dronken thou peraventure knowen ſhall thou haſt loſt time ſpent thy thought idleneſſe waſt wofull luſtineſſe thou maieſt live time ſee love delivered bee thy time thou ſhalt beweepe ſore never thou mayeſt reſtore time loſt men may ſee nothing may recovered bee thou ſcape yet laſt fro love hath thee ſo faſt knitte bounden lace certaine hold grace many one ſeine loſt ſpent alſo veine ſerviſe without ſuccour bodie ſoule good treaſour wit ſtrength eke richeſſe never redreſſe ¶lamant thus taught preached hath reaſon love ſpilt sermon ſo imped thought doctrine ſet nought yet ne ſayd ſhe never dele ne underſtood wele word word matter unto love ſo thrall calleth praie chaſeth ſo thought aie holdeth mine heart ſele truſtie true ſtele devotion ne sermon dame reaſon ne rede tooke ſoiour mine hede yede one ere ſhe lere fully ſhe loſt lore ſpeech greeved wonder ſore unto ire ſaid anger abraid dame algate love hate men ye teach doe ſpeach sith ſeine love good muſt need ſay mood leve hatred aie liven void love awaie ſinfull wretch hated tetch may go none gate either muſt love hate hate men new love woll rew preching ſeemeth mee love nothing ne praiſeth thee ye yeve good counſaile ſikerly precheth day loues lore alowe foole woulde trowe speech alſo ye han taught another love knowne naught heard repreve love leve ye would diffine mee would gladly ſee leaſt may lere ſundrie love manere ¶raiſon certes friend foole art thou thou nothing wilt allow thy profite ſay yet woll ſay thee fay readie leeſt accompliſh thy requeſt woll auaile vaine perauenture ſhall trauaile loue ſundrie wiſe ſhall thee deuiſe ſome loue lefull good meane maketh thee wood bringeth thee many fitte rauiſheth fro thee thy witte ſo maruailous queint ſuch loue aquaint ¶comment raiſon diffiniſt aunſete loue frendſhip alſo maketh man done amis knitte betwixt two woll breake wele ne wo long likely continue good commune grounded god ordinaunce hoole without diſcordaunce hem holding commaunce good charite none exceptioun chaunging ententioun helpe need wiſely hele word dede true meaning deuoide slouth wit nought without trouth tone dare thought saine friend ſpare nought himſelfe without dreding diſcouered wreiyng glad coniunction none ſuſpection would proue true perfite loue man may amiable ſo firme ſtable fortune change ne blinde friend alway finde poore rich ſtate friend gate w • complaine pouerte ſhould bide ſo long till helping require good deed done praiere ſold bought deere iwis heart great valour heart fulfilled gentleneſſe euill demeane diſtreſſe man worthy name asken often hath great ſhame good man brenneth thought ſhame asketh ought hath great thought dredeth aie diſeaſe ſhall praie friend leaſt warned till preue ſtabilitie hath founden one truſtie true ſtone aſſayed found ſtedfaſt wall frendſhip certaine ſhall ſhew ioy paine dare thinke ſay without ſhame may ſhould aſhamed ſuch one told thee wote ſecret thought third ſhall know thereof right nought twey number • et three euerie counſaile ſecree repreue dredeth neuer dele beſet wordes wele euerie wiſe man drede keepe tongue till ſee nede fooles cannot hold tongue fooles bell ſoone ronge yet ſhall true friend doe helpe fellow ſore ſuccour hath need may done indeed gladder pleaſeth fellow eaſeth doe requeſt ſhall much moleſt fellow maie fulfill volunte fully hath required heart loue hath fired ioy woe ſhall depart take euenly part halfe annoy ſhall haue aie comfort may bliſſe part ſhall loue woll departed whilom vnitie spake tullius ditie ſhould maken requeſt vnto friend honeſt goodly ſhould fulfill skill otherwiſe graunt thereto except onely cauſes two men friend death would driue let buſie ſaue liue alſo men wollen hem aſſaile worſhip make faile hindren renoun let full ententioun deuer done degree friend ne ſhamed two caſe might taking keepe skill right farre loue may excuſe ought man refuſe loue haue told thee nothing contrarie mee woll thou follow wele leaue euerie dele loue vertue attendeth tother fooles blent ſhendeth another love alſo contrarie vnto deſire ſo conſtrained fained away fro trouth doth ſo varie good love contrarie maymeth wiſe sicke heart couetiſe winning profite love ſetteth delite love ſo hangeth balaunce leſe hope perchaunce lucre ſet vpon woll falle quench anon man may amorous ne liuing vertuous love mood men hem ſelfe good loue profite doth abide falſe bideth tide love commeth dame fortune little woll contune ſhall chaungen wonder ſoone take eclips moone v let earth betwixt ſet ſunne may fall partie ſhadow maketh beames merke horne ſhew derke part ſhe hath loſt light phebus fully ſight till ſhadow ouerpaſt enlumined againe faſt brightneſſe ſun beames yeueth hem againe leames love right ſuch nature faire obſcure bright clipſy manere whilom dimme whilom clere aſſoone pouerte ginneth take mantell weedes blake hideth love light away night tourneth day may ſee richeſſe ſhine till blacke ſhadowes fine richeſſe ſhineth bright love recouereth ayen light faileth woll flit ſhe greeueth ſo greeueth love heare ſaie rich men loved aie namely tho ſparand beene woll waſh heart cleene filth 〈◊〉 •• ice greedy brenning auarice rich man full fond iwis weneth loved heart vnderſtood good may well weten thought good loved right nought niggard eke men would ſet leke haten ſooth lo profite cattell dooth euerie man may ſee getteth nought enmitee amend himſelfe vice know himſelfe wiſe certes ſhould aye friendly get love alſo free elſe wiſe ne ſage gote ramage loueth deede proueth richeſſe ſo well loueth woll hide aie ſpare poore friend ſeene forfare keepen aie purpoſe till drede eyen cloſe till wicked death take leuer aſunder ſhake let limmes aſunder riue leaue richeſſe liue thinketh part man certaine love ſhould love heart pite treſpaſſeth well wate man knoweth eſtate well ought reproued loveth nought ne loved ſith arne fortune comen hath sermon nomen wonder tell thee thou hardeſt neuer ſuch one trow thou leuen ſhall though ſoothfaſtneſſe written ſooth vnto men profite dooth froward fortune contraire ſwote debonaire thinke doutable argument prouable debonaire ſoft falſeth beguileth oft lich mother ſhe cheriſh milken doth norice good deles yeueth part iweles great rich dignitie hem ſhe hoteth ſtabilitie ſtate ſtable changing aie variable feedeth glorie vaine worldly bliſſe none certaine ſhe ſetteth whele wene right wele ſo ſtable ſtate withall neuer wene fall ſet ſo high wene certainte heartly friend great numbre nothing might ſtate encombre truſt hem ſo euerie ſide wening hem would abide euerie perill miſchaunce without chaunge variaunce cattell good alſo ſpend blood member ſpill onely fulfill maken whole many wiſe hoten hem full ſerviſe ſore doe hem ſmert naked ſhert heart alſo hole yeve time may live flatterie maken fooles glorifie wordes ſpeaking han rejoyſing trow hem evangile falſhede gile ſhall afterward ſee arne full poverte ben good cattell bare ſhould ſeene friend ware hundred certainly thouſand full ſcarcely ne ſhall finde unnethes one povertie commen upon thus fortune tell men luſt dwell maketh hem leſe coniſaunce nouriſheth hem ignoraunce froward fortune perverſe high eſtates ſhe doth reverſe maketh hem tumble doune whele ſodaine tourne richeſſe doth hem flie plungeth hem povertie ſtepmother envious layeth plaiſter dolorous vnto heart wounded egre tempered vinegre povertie indigence ſhew experience ſhe fortune verilie whome man ſhould affie yeftes fiaunce ſo full variaunce thus ſhe maken hye lowe richeſſe arne throwe fully knowen without friend effect friend chere love true ſtable alſo variable fortune goddeſſe povertie either richeſſe yeveth drede vnhappe beareth indeede infortune let one friend fortune gone meane tho friend woll fle anone entreth poverte yet woll leave hem ſo place go call hem wretch ſcorne blame miſhappe hem diffame namely ſuch richeſſe pretendeth moſt ſtableneſſe ſaw ſet loft hem ſuccoured oft moſt iholpe need take maner heed ſaine voice flatterie appeareth follie ſo fare ſing go farewell felde fare ſuch friend beſhrew true ſoothfaſt friend ſo betide every fortune wollen abide han heart ſuch bleſſe nill love richeſſe fortune may hem ſend wollen hem ſuccour defend chaunge ſoft ne ſore friend loveth evermore though men draw ſword ſlo may hew love two caſe ſhall ſay pride ire leſe may reproove nicete diſcovering privite tongue wounding felon venemous detraction friend caſe gone way nothing grieve ne may nought elſe woll fle love ſtabilitie certaine well begone among thouſand findeth one may richeſſe ayenſt friendſhip worthineſſe ne may ſo high attaine may valour ſooth ſaine loveth true well friendſhip cattell friend court aie better penny purſe certis fortune miſhaping upon men ſhe fabling miſturning chaunce caſt hem balaunce maketh adverſite men full clerely ſee friend exiſtence appearence infortune maketh anone know thy friend fro thy fone experience right praiſe iwis much richeſſe treaſour deepe profite valour povertie ſuch adverſitie doth proſperitie one yeveth coniſaunce tother ignoraunce thus povertie indeed trouth declared fro falſhede faint friend woll declare true alſo way fare richeſſe theſe friend full doubleneſſe offred many wiſe heart body ſervice wold bought knowen openly thought hath ſo clerely ſeen laſſe beguiled ſhould perceived richeſſe nolde let wit well avauntage doeth sith maketh wiſe man great miſchiefe perceiveth doeth richeſſe deceiveth richeſſe rich ne maketh nought treaſour ſet thought richeſſe ſtont ſuffiſaunce nothing aboundaunce ſuffiſaunce onely maketh men live richly hath mitches tweine ne value demeine liveth eaſe rich doeth chich barne hath ſooth ſaine hundred mavis wheat graine though chapman marchaunt gold many beſaunt getting hath ſuch wo keeping drede alſo ſet evermore buſineſſe encreaſe leſſe augment multiply though heapes lye yet never ſhall make richeſſe aſſeth unto greedineſſe poore retcheth nought save livelode thought getteth travaile dredeth nought ſhall faile though little worldes good meate drinke eaſie food vpon travaile living alſo ſuffiſaunt clothing ſickeneſſe fall loath meat drinke withall though meat buy ſhall bethinke haſtely put daungere meat hath miſtere may little eke founden ſeke men ſhull berne haſt live till ſickeneſſe paſt ſome maiſondewe beſide caſt nought ſhall betide thinketh nought ever ſhall ſickeneſſe fall though fall may time ſpare ſhall mokell ſhall ſuffice ſicke wiſe doeth woll content poverte without neede man much little apaide fortune nill importune vnto wight ne onerous goodneſſe covetous therefore ſpareth may well poore eſtate ſuſteen luſt ſpare ſuffereth forth yet laſt happeneth may right unto laſt day take world would ever heart thinketh ſooner death ſlo paradiſe ſooner go ſhall live bliſſe ſhall good miſſe thider hopeth god ſhall ſend wretched liues end pythagoras himſelfe rehearſes booke gold verſes cleped nobilite honourable dite thou goeſt thy body fro free ayre thou ſhalt go leaven humanitie purely live deitie foole withouten troweth countrey yearth countrey may theſe clarkes ſeine ſey boece conſolation maked mention countrey plaine eie teaching philoſophie lewd men might lere wit ſo would tranſlaten ſuch well live rent may yeve deſireth may fro povertie ſave wiſe man ſaied may ſeen man wretched ween king knight ribaude many ribaud merrie baude ſwinketh beareth day night many burthen great might doeth laſſe offence ſuffreth patience laugh daunce trippe ſing lay nought living taverne diſpendeth winning god hem ſendeth goeth fardel beare good chere eare ſwinke travaile faineth robben diſdaineth right anon ſwinke goeth taverne drinke theſe rich aboundance thus ſuffiſance well uſurere god well knoweth without uſurer ſo god ſee shall never richeſſe rich hee evermore poore indigent scarce greedy entent ſooth diſpleaſe may marchaunt live eaſe heart ſuch ſet quicke brenneth get ne never ſhall though hath getten though gould garner yeten needy dredeth ſore wherefore getten ſet heart deſire hote brenneth fire covetiſe maketh wood purchaſe men good vnderfongeth great paine vndertaketh drinke vp saine drinketh aie leaveth ſooth ſay thus thurſt falſe getting laſt ever coveting anguiſh diſtreſſe fire greedineſſe fighteth aie ſtriveth heart aſunder riveth greedineſſe aſſaileth moſt hath moſt faileth phiſitions advocate gone right ſame yates ſell ſcience winning haunt craft great getting winning ſuch ſweetneſſe man fall ſickneſſe full glad encreaſe without leaſe everich man ſhould beſeeke though die ſet leeke gould take full little care hem make would fortie ſicke one yea two hundred fleſh bone yet two thouſand geſſe encreaſen richeſſe woll worchen wiſe lucre couetiſe phiſicke ginneth firſt phi phiſition alſo ſoothly ſithen goeth fro fie fie truſt hem follie nill manner gree doe right nought charitee eke ſame ſect ſet tho preachen get worſhips honour richeſſe heart arne great diſtreſſe folke live holyly aboven ſpecially preachen vaine glorie toward god memorie forth ipocrites trace ſoules death purchace outward ſhewing holyneſſe though full curſedneſſe lich apoſtles twelve deceiue hem ſelve beguilded guiler preaching curſed man though may profite himſelf availeth mite oft good predicatioun commeth evil ententioun vaileth preaching helpe teaching good example take vaine glory ſhake let u leaven theſe preachours ſpeake hem tour heape vp gould faſt ſhet ſore thereon heart ſet neither love god ne drede keepe nede bagges ſore bind sunne wind put vp need ware ſeen poore folke forfare hunger die cold quake god wel vengeance therof take great miſchiefes hem aſſaileth thus gadering ay travaileth much paine winne richeſſe drede hem holdeth diſtreſſe keepe gather faſt ſorrow leave laſt ſorrow die live unto richeſſe heart yeve defaute love ſheweth full well iwis theſe greedy ſooth ſaine loveden loved againe good love raigned wickedneſſe ne ſhould fall ſhould yeve moſt good hem neede beſtad live without falſe vſure charitie full cleane pure hem yeve goodneſſe defending hem idleneſſe world poore none ſhould finde trow one chaunged world vnſtable love vendable ſee man loveth winning prow love thralled ſervage ſold advantage yet woman woll body ſell ſoules goeth divell hell love told hem entent baronage counſaile went many ſentences fill diverſly ſaid diſcord accorded accord love recorded sir ſayden one even accord everichone take richeſſe onely ſworne hath full hauteinly ſhe caſtle nill aſſaile ne ſmite ſtroke battaile dart ne mace ſpeare ne knife man ſpeaketh beareth life blameth empriſe iwis hoſt departed leaſt waie plite hath ſhe man diſpite ſhe ſayth ne loved never therefore ſhe woll hate ever woll gather treaſore hath wrathe evermore agilte never caas lo holly treſpas ſayeth well day asked leave gone way cleped much yeving ſpake full faire praying prayed poore therefore ſhe warned entre ne yet thriven ſo thar hath getten pennie two quietly owne hold thus hath richeſſe u ali told richeſſe u recorded withouten accorded finde accordaunce falſe semblaunt abſtinaunce folke battaile shull hinder gate aſſaile wicked tongue hath keeping norman full jangling hem courteſie largeſſe ſhull ſhew hardyneſſe old wife kept ſo hard faire welcomming within ward ſhall delight well heling fond shame adoune bring hoſt early late ſhull aſſaylen like gate againſt drede ſhall hardyneſſe aſſaile alſo sikerneſſe folke leading never wiſt ſtaying fraunchiſe ſhall fight eke pite daunger full cruelte thus hoſt ordained weale downe ſhall caſtle every •• le everiche doe entent venus preſent mother full veſſelage inough ſuch uſage withouten may wight ſpeed worke neither word ne deed therefore good ye ſend may worke amend lordinges mother gooddes ladie miſtres ni nat willing ne doth deſiring yet ſhe ſometime doen labour luſt ſuccour neede atchieve thinke grieve mother ſhe childhede worſhip eke drede dredeth ſire ne dame shall abie bodie name natheleſſe yet send need ſhe nigh ſhe commen would trow nothing might hold mother great proweſſe hath tane many fortereſſe coſt hath many pound er na preſent iwis yet men ſayd deede come never ſteede ne ne liketh ſo mote thee ſuch tower take mee thinketh wiſe may cleped marchaundiſe go courſer blacke white pay therefore art thou quite marchaunt oweth thee right nought ne thou thou bought woll ſelling clepe yeving ſelling asketh guerdoning lithe thanke ne merite one goeth quite ſelling ſemblable horſe ſtable may ſell againe parde winnen ſuch happe may may manne leſe iwis leaſt skinne elſe ſo betide woll keepe horſe ride yet lord aie horſe thilke chafare well worſe venus entermeteth ought ſo ſuch chaffare hath bought ſhall worchen ſo wiſely ne ſhall leſe utterly monney chaffare ſeller ware priſe profite ſhall certaine buyer ſhall leſe ne ſo dere buy lordſhip full maiſtry ne power make letting neither yeft ne preaching chaffare maugre another ſhall much iwis woll yeve much countrey ſo right nought ſo happe may flatter pay ſuch marchaunts wiſe fooles everie wiſe buy ſuch thing wilfully leſe good follily natheleſſe dare ſay mother wont pay ſhe neither ſo foole ne nice entremete ſuch vice truſt well ſhall pay repent bargaine ſhall poverte put diſtreſſe ſchooller richeſſe great yerning vvhen ſhe aſſenteth willing bvt mother ſaint venus father saturnus engendred life nat upon wedded wife yet woll unto ſwere make thing ſurere faith beautee owe brother free ni wight hevin father name nevin diver ſo many mother prive yet woll ſweare ſikerneſſe pole hell witneſſe drinke yeare clarre lye forſworne goddes uſage ſo forſweareth amis shall yeere drinke clarre ſworne inough parde forſweare lorne woll never forſworne sith richeſſe hath failed ſhall abie treſpaſſe full dere leaſt way harme ſweard ſparth giſarme certes ſith ſhe loveth fro thilke time ſhe may ſee caſtle tower ſhake ſorrie time ſhe ſhall awake may gripe rich man ſhall ſo pull ſhall fewe ſtoundes leſe markes poundes ſhall make penny ſting garner ſpring maiden ſhall eke plucke ſo ſhall needen feather mo make ſell lond ſpend bet defend poore men han made lord although ſo mightie may feede delite woll diſpite good man hateth hem geſſe chinch feloun richeſſe ſo chaſe hem diſpiſe hem defoule ſundrie wiſe loven full bette ſo god ſpede doeth rich chinchy grede good faith ſtable truer ſerviable therefore ſuffiſeth good heart beaute han ſet thought therefore foryete hem nought woll hem bring great nobleſſe god richeſſe god love ſoothly ruth upon plaint therefore muſt ſuccour paineth ſerven dyed love ſeemeth love sir ſayd ſooth everie dele ye rehearſe wote wele thilke oath hold reaſonable good covenable ye rich men han ſworne ſir wote well beforne rich men doen homage fooles doen outrage ye ſhull forſworne ne let therefore drinke clarre piment maked freſh new lady ſhull hem ſuch pepir brew fall laas woe mow ſaine ala lady ſhullen ever ſo courteous ſhall quite oath free ne ſeeketh never vicaire ſhall ſpeake ſo faire ye ſhall hold payd full well though ye meddle never deale let lady worch thinges ſhall hem tell ſo fele tidinges moove hem eke ſo many requeſtes flatterie honeſt thereto yeve hem ſuch thankinges kiſſing talkinges certes trowed shall never leave hem lond ne fee nill moeble fare firſt delivered may tell u heſtes ſhall fulfill bvt falſe semblaunt dare drede ſir meddle dede ſayth ye foe ye worch woe wherefore pray beau ſire ye foryeve ire may dwell man abſtinence deere lemman accord parfey ſayd love graunt woll well hold man let come forth ran falſe semblant qd love wiſe take thee ſervice thou friend helpe alwaie hindreth hem neither night ne daie doe thy might hem relieve eke enemy thou grieve thine might graunt thee king harlotes ſhalt thou bee woll thou ſuch honour certaine thou art falſe traitour eke theefe ſith thou borne thouſand time thou art forſworne natheleſſe hearing put folke doubting bidde thee teach hem woſt thou how▪ ſome generall ſigne place thou ſhalt founden men miſter thee men ſhall thee beſt eſpie thee know great maiſtrie tell place thine haunting sir full diver wonning keepe rehearſed ye would reſpiten tell ſooth may harme ſhame fellowes wiſten tale ſhoulden quit certaine would hate ever knew cruelte would hold hem ſtill troth againe tale keepen might eftſoone buy full dere ſaied hem thing ought diſpleaſeth hearing word hem pricketh biteth word none hem deliteth goſpell euangile would reproue hem guile cruell hautain thing wote well certain ſpeake ought paire loo court ſhall ſo well cloos ne ſhall wite laſt good men nought agaſt woll taken hem nothing know meaning woll take woll himſelfe ſuſpecious make life let couertly guile hypocriſie engendred yave foſtring made full good engendring qd love ſo ſoothly tell engendred diuell hell needely howſoeuer bee qd love charge thee tell anon thy wonning placis hearing wight place life thou liveſt alſo hide lenger whereto thou muſt diſcouer thy worching thou ſerueſt thing though thou ſhouldeſt thy ſothſaw ben beaten draw yet art thou wont parde natheleſſe though thou beaten thou ſhalt firſt ſo hath ſoothſaw ſuffred wo sir ſith may liken though ſhould ſlaine right ſhall doen commaundement thereto great talent withouten word mo right falſe semblaunt ſermon began ſaied hem thus audience baron take heed ſentence wight liſt knowing falſe semblant full flattering muſt worldly folke ſeke certes cloyſters eke hem tway like euen ſooth ſay shortly woll herborow hope beſt hulſtred certainely ſikereſt hiding vnderneath humbleſt clothing religious folke ben full couert seculer folke ben apert natheleſſe woll blame religious folke ne hem diffame habite euer go religion humble true alſo woll blame ne diſpiſe nill love wiſe meane falſe religious dout malicious wollen habite go ſetten heart thereto religious folke pitous thou ſhalt ſeene one diſpitous loven pride ne ſtrife humbly woll lede life folke woll neuer dwell faine may well habite go leuer necke atwo let purpoſe take couenaunt euer make dwell hem proud full wile ſubtelte worſhip world coueiten great nede connen expleiten gone gadren great pitaunces purchaſe hem acquaintaunces men mightie life may leden faine hem poore himſelfe feden good morſels delicious drinken good wine precious preach v pouert diſtreſſe fiſhen hemſelfe great richeſſe wily nettes caſt woll come foule laſt ben fro cleane religion went make world argument hath foule concluſion robe religion religious argument roignous worth crooked brere habite ne maketh neither monke ne frere cleane life deuotion maketh men good religion natheleſſe none anſwere high euer head • raſour whetted neuer ſo kene guile braunches cutte thurtene wight diſtinct ſo dare ſay word thereto herborow euer take ſemblaunt euer make meane guile follow right gibbe cat awaiteth mouse rattes killen ne entend beguilen ne wight may clothing wete folke dwelling ne word yet parde ſoft ſo pleaſaunt behold deed thou blind thou oughteſt ſo varie word fro deed thinke guile withouten dreed manner clothing eſtate euer bere lered leud lord ladie knight squire burgeis bailie right thus fals semblant ſermoneth eftſoones love areſoneth brake tale ſpeaking though told leaſing ſaied deuill heare folke haſt thou v nempned may men find religioun worldly habitatioun yea ſir followeth nat lead wicked life parfey ne therefore ſoules leſe hem worldly clothes cheſe certes great pitee men may ſecular clothes ſee floriſhen holy religiouns full many ſaint field toun many virgine glorious deuout full religious han died common cloth aye beren yet ſaintes neuertheleſſe could recken may ten yea welnigh theſe holy woman men church herry ſeke maiden theſe wiues eke baren full many faire child weared alway clothes ſeculere ſame diden ſaints ben alway ix thouſand maiden dere beren heauen cierges clere men rede church ſing take ſecular clothing receiued martirdome wonnen heauen vnto home good heart maketh good thought clothing yeueth ne reueth nought good thought worching maketh religion flouring lieth good religioun right ententioun ſo tooke weather skin wrapped greedy wolfe therein ſhould go lambes white weneſt thou would hem bite yes neuertheleſſe wood would hem wirry drinke blood well rather hem deceiue ſith coud nat perceiue tregette crueltie would follow altho flie wolues ſuch hew amongs theſe apoſtles new thou holy church thou maiſt wailed sith thy citie aſſailed knight thine owne table god wot thy lordſhip doutable enforce win ſhould defend fro within might defence ayenſt hem make without ſtroke mote take trepeget mangonell without diſplaying penſell god nill done ſuccour let renne colour thou muſt thy heſtes letten bee nought yeeld thee yeue tribute doutles hold hem pee greater harme betide thee maiſter bee well con ſcorne thee withall day ſtuffen wall night minen nay thou planten muſt el thine impes thou wolt fruit abide thy ſelfe ſave bvt peace turne againe woll thing faine might maken weary woll heten alway helpe friend may wollen company ſhent vtterly ſo fall oft hem eke lemman mote ſerue ſhull love deſerue forſooth falſe traitour god iudged theefe trechour forſworne well nigh none wote guile till done hath many one deth receiued treget neuer aperceiued yet receiueth ſhall receiue falſeneſſe ſhall neuer apperceiue ſo doth wiſe right good beware ſo ſligh aperceiuing late commeth knowing protheus coud chaunge euery ſhape homely ſtraunge coud neuer ſuch guile ne treaſoun come neuer toun might knowen though men might ſee full well clothes chaunge take one make another ſtraunge knight chaſtelaine prelate chaplaine prieſt clerke foſtere maiſter schollere monke chanon baily euer miſter man prince page heart euery language sometime hoore old young ſtout bold robert robin frere minor iacobin followeth loteby done ſollace company hight dame abſtinence raigned many queint array faigned right commeth liking fulfill deſiring sometime woman cloth take maid lady sometime religious like anker hous sometime prioreſſe nonne abbeſſe go regiouns seeking religiouns order ſworne take ſtraw beat corne jolly folke enhabite aske habite woll ye every wiſe right liſt diſguiſe well beare wede vnlike word dede thus make trappes fall people priviledges ben chriſtendome alive may aſſoile may ſhrive prelate may let folke ever found prelate may done ſo pope mo made thilke eſtabliſhing proper thing ſleights apperceiued wont woll thou hem tregetry yeue little tale ſiluer male preached eke ſhriuen take ſo yeuen folly husbond wife lede right jolly life ſimpleſſe prelacie know tregettrie bvt much man wife ſhew pariſh prieſt life one yeare ſayth booke ere wight houſel tooke priviledges large may much thing diſcharge may ſay right thus pardee sir prieſt ſhrift tell thee ſhriven hath aſſoyled yeven pennaunce ſoothly ſin found guilty ne ne haue never entencion make double confeſſion ne rehearſe eft ſhrift thee ſhrift right ynough mee ought thee ſuffice wele ne rebell never adele certes though thou haddeſt ſworne wote prieſt ne prelate borne may ſhrift eft conſtraine done woll plaine wote plaine wele thou ſhalt ſtrein adele ne enforce ne trouble make confeſſion double ne none affection double abſolution firſt right ynough mee latter aſſoyling quite thee unbound maiſt thou find ſinnes unbind might hath hond ſinnes unbond thou wolt thus conſtraine mote need thee plaine ſhall judge imperiall ne biſhop ne officiall done judgment shall gone plaine openly vnto ſhriftfather new hight frere wolfe untrew ſhall chuſe mee trow hamper thee lord would wroth withall men would frere wolfe call would patience done cruell vengience would might done leeſt nothing ſpare god heeſt god ſo wiſe ſuccour thou yeve ſaviour eaſter liketh mee without preaſing thee woll forth gone ſhall houſell anone thy grutching keepe deale thee nothing thus may ſhrive forſaketh pariſh prieſt taketh prieſt woll refuſe full ready accuſe puniſh hamper ſo church ſhall forgo ſo hath feeling conſequence ſuch ſhriving shall ſeene yt prieſt may never might know conſcience aright cure ayenſt holy ſcripture biddeth every herde honeſt knowing beeſt poore folke gone ſtrete gold ne ſums grete hem would let prelate let prieſts know ſtates right nought yeve ne may ben ſo bare take keepe woll fat ſheepe let pariſh prieſts lene yeve harme bene prelate grutch oughten wroth wit leſe fat beaſts ſo ſhall yeve hem ſtroke two ſhall leſen force yea mitre croce thus yape hem long priviledges ben ſo ſtrong falſe semblant would ſ • inted love ne made ſuch chere weary ſaw make glad faw ſaid tell ſpecially thou ſerveſt untruly tell forth ſhame thee never adele thine habit ſheweth wele thou ſerveſt holy hermite sooth hypocrite thou goeſt preacheſt poverte yea ſir richeſſe hath poſte thou preacheſt abſtinence alſo sir woll fillen ſo mote go paunch good meat wine ſhould maiſter divine poore faine yet poore folke diſdaine love better acquaintaunce ten time king fraunce poore man mild mood though ſoule alſo good ſee beggers quaking naked mixins ſtinking hunger crie eke care entremet fare ben ſo poore full pine might one yeve dine nothing life ſhould yeve yt licketh knife folly entremete te ſeeke hound neſt fat mete let beare ſpittle anone comfort get none rich ſicke uſurere would viſite draw nere would comfort rehete hope gold gete wicked death woll go grave reprove let poore woſt thou aſcape ſay ſweare full rape rich men han tetches ſinne han poore wretch han counſaile miſtere therefore would draw hem nere great hurt may ſo hath ſoule right great poverte ſoule great richeſſe forſooth albeit hurten richeſſe mendicity ben cleped two extreamities meane cleped suffiſaunce lieth vertue aboundaunce salomon full well wote parable u wrote knowen many wight thirteene chapiter right god thou keepe thy poſte fro richeſſe mendicite rich man dreſſe thinke much richeſſe heart ſo ferre ſette creator doth foryette beggeth woll aye greve ſhould word leve vnneth ni micher forſworne el god lier thus ſayth salomon ſawes ne find written lawes namely chriſten lay ſaith ye dare ſay nay chriſt ne apoſtles dere walked earth never ſeene herbred begging nolden beggen nothing right thus men wont teach wiſe would preach maiſters divinitie sometime paris citie men would gaine appoſe naked text let gloſe might ſoone aſſoiled bee men may well ſooth ſee parde might aske thing plainely forth without begging god heerdes dere cure ſoules hadden nolde nothing begge food chriſt done rood proper honds wrought travaile el nought wonnen ſuſtenaunce liueden forth pennaunce remenaunt yafe away poore folkes alway neither builden toure ne halle houſes ſmall alle mighty man may hond body alway winne food labouring ne rent ſuch thing although religious god ſerven curious thus mote done treſpaas certaine caas rehearſe miſter bee right well time ſee seeke booke ſaint auguſtine paper perchemene writte theſe worchings thou ſhalt ſeene none excuſings perfit man ne ſhould ſeeke word ne deed eke although religious god ſerven curious ne ſhall ſo mote go proper honds body alſo get food labouring ne properte thing yet ſhould ſell ſubſtaunce ſwinke ſuſtenaunce perfite bounte thus han bookes told woll gone idelly uſeth aye buſily haunten men table trechour full fable ne ne may good reaſon excuſe oriſon men behoveth ſome giſe ben ſometime god ſervice gone purchaſen nede men mote eaten drede ſleepe eke thing long may leave praying may eke prayer blinne werke meat winne saint auſtine woll thereto accord thilke booke record iuſtinian eke made lawes hath thus forboden old ſawes man vp paine dead mighty body beg bread may ſwinke gete men ſhould rather maine bete done aperte iuſtice ſuffren ſuch mallice done well ſo mote go taken ſuch almeſſe ſo ſome priviledge paine hem woll alledge ſee prince deceived bee ne ne wene ſikerly may rightfully woll determine prince power ne define ne word comprehend ywis ſo ferre may ſtretch woll entremete dele trow booke ſayth wele taketh almeſſes bee dew folke men may ſee lame feeble weary bare poore ſuch manner care con winne hem nevermo power thereto eateth owne dampning lie made thing ye ſuch truant find chaſtiſe well ye kind would hate parcaas ye fillen laas would eftſoones ſcathe might late rathe full patient han world thus foule blent weteth well god bad good man ſell follow poore yeve would therefore live ſerven mendience never ſentence bad werken need follow good deedis saint poule loved holy church bade apoſtles wurch winnen live lode wiſe hem defended truandiſe ſaid werketh honden thus ſhould thing vnderſtonden nolde iwis bid hem begging ne ſellen goſpell ne preaching leaſt beraft asking folke cattell thing world many man yeveth good ne werne ſhame el would asker delivered encombreth ſo yeveth good let go nothing profite leſe yeſt merite good folke poule preached profred oft hem teached good charite thereof right nothing tooke hond would gette clothes wrine mete tell man may liven good poore hath yeven woll onely bidde bede never honds labour nedes may ſo yea ſir sir woll gladly tell saint auſten faith man may houſes han properte templers hoſpitelers theſe chanons regulers white monkes theſe blake woll mo enſamples make take thereof ſuſteining therein lithe begging otherwaies iwis yet auſten gabbeth yet full many monke laboureth god holy church honoureth ſwinking agone rede ſing church anone hath ben great diſcord many wight may beare record vpon eſtate mendicience woll ſhortely preſence tell man may begge need hath wherewith feed maugre fellowes ianglings ſoothfaſtneſſe woll none hiding yet percaſe may abey ſoothly thus ſey lo caſe eſpeciall man ſo beſtiall craft hath ſcience nought deſireth ignorence may go begging yerne till ſome craft lerne without truanding may trouth living may done labour elde ſickneſſe langour tender age alſo may yet begging go peraventure vſage noriture lived deliciouſly oughten good folke comenly han miſcheefe ſome pite ſuffren alſo may gone begge bread honger dead craft conning ſtrength alſo deſiring worchen find neither ne may begge till getten neceſſite winning ſo lite labour woll aquite sufficiauntly living yet may go brede begging fro dore dore may go trace till remnaunt may purchaſe man would vndertake empriſe make reſcous lay defenden may armes lettrure convenable cure ſo poore may begge till may find trouth ſwinke get cloth meat drinke swinke honds corporell hondes eſpirituell caſe ſemblables ben mo reaſonables may begge tell el manere william ſaint amour would preach oft would diſpute teach matter openly paris full ſolemnely alſo god ſoule bleſſe ſtedfaſtneſſe accord vniverſite people ſeemeth good man ought refuſe ne ought thereof excuſe wrothe blithe ſo woll ſpeake tell thee ſhould die put doun ſaint poule derke priſoun exiled caas wrong maiſter william mother hypocriſie baniſhed great envie mother flemed ſaint amour noble ſuch labour ſuſtaine ever loyalte hee much agilte made booke let write wherein life write would eche remed begging live travelling ne rent ne good weneth wood labour might never pleaſe ben eaſe well lever ſooth ſay people patter pray wrie foxerie vnder cope papelardie qd love divell word telleſt thou ſir falſeneſſe apert dredeſt thou god certes ſelde great thing ſhall ſpede world god woll drede folke hem vertue yeven truely owne liven hem goodneſſe aye content hem little thrift iſent folke drinken great miſeaſe life may never pleaſe ſee gold han vſerers ſilver eke garner tailagiers theſe moniours bailiffes beadle provoſt countours theſe liven well nigh ravine ſmall people hem mote encline aud wolf woll hem eten vpon poore folke geten full much ſpend kepe ni none hem nill ſtrepe wrine hem ſelfe well full without ſcalding hem pull ſtrong feeble overgothe weare ſimple clothe robbe robbed robbours guile guiling guilours treget gather threſte great treaſour cheſte lieth ſo faſt bound mine high paleis doe found delight fulfill wine feaſtes table full entremees woll life eaſe pee winne gold ſpend alſo great bagge go commeth right yapes make well tomble mine ape winnen alway mine entent purchaſe better rent though ſhould beaten entremete without may wight dure walke ſoules cure world cure brede length boldly woll preach eke counſailen honds woll travailen pope bull ne hold wittes dull woll ſtinten live theſe emperours ſhrive king duke lord grete poore folke quite lete love ſuch ſhriving parde cauſe recke poore men eſtate worth ben findeſt thou ſwinker labour confeſſour empreſſes ducheſſes theſe queenes eke counteſſes theſe abbeſſes eke bigins theſe great lady palaſins theſe iolly knight bailives theſe nonnes theſe burgeis wife rich eke pleaſing theſe maiden welfaring ſo clad naked vncounſailed goeth none fro ſoules ſafete lord lady meine aske hem ſhrive propertie live make hem trow moſt leaſt pariſh prieſt beaſt ayenſt company ſhrewes great woll hide hold privete told word ſigne iwis ne woll make hem know wollen alſo tellen hele fro privite make hem perceiven vſen folke thus deceiven woll ſaine withouten drede men may goſpell rede ſaint mathew goſpellere ſaieth ſhall ſay vpon chaire moſes thus gloſed doubtles old teſtament thereby chaire ment sitte scribe phariſen ſaine curſed men ipocrites call doeth preach rede doeth doen adele weary ſay wele doe well would bind folke alway beguiled able burdons importable folkes ſhoulders thing couchen nill finger touchen woll touch hem ne liſt nat ſikerly ſadde burdons men taken make folkes ſhoulders aken ought good bee folke ſhould ſee burdons larger maken maken hemmes wide alwey loven ſeates table firſt moſt honourable han firſt chairis synagogue hem full dere willen folke hem lout grete paſſen ſtrete wollen cleped maiſter alſo ne ſhould willen ſo goſpell ayenſt geſſe ſheweth well wickedneſſe another cuſtome vſe hem woll ayenſt v hate hem deadly everychone woll werrey one one hateth hate coniect doen fall ſeene winne honour richeſſe preiſe valour provende rent dignite full faſt iwis compaſſen ladder clomben ſo maken downe go treaſon woll defame doen leſe good name thus ladder take thus frends foe make word ne wete ſhall none till friendes fone openly might blame readily wiſt mallice kept nice another fall one among v doeth good tourne drede ſaine alder dede yea ſikerly though fained liſt dained man avaunced thereof parteners tellen folke ſo go man v ſprongen ſo men praiſing purchaſe flattering rich men great poſte letter witneſſe bounte man weeneth may v ſee vertue v bee alway poore v faine ſo begge plaine ben folke without leaſing thing without thus dradde people iwis gladly purpoſe deale wight gold treaſour great plente acquaintaunce well love much deſire ſhortly entremete brocages make peace mariages gladly executour many time procuratour ſometime meſſangere falleth miſtere many time make enqueſt office nat honeſt deale men thing great liking ye ought place repaire ſhall ſpeden wit ſoone ye told ye ſerve pay ſervice ſhall alway ſo woll chaſtice anone love loſt hath love man giſe woll reprove chaſtiſe woll folke vndertake wight teaching take folke chaſtie woll taught fro follie love none hermitage deſerts holtes hoore great wood everychon let hem baptiſt iohn queth quite releſſe egipt wilderneſſe ferre manſiouns fro city good touns paleis mine houſe make men may renne openly ſay world forſake amidde build make houſe ſwim play therein bette fiſh doeth ſinne antichriſtes men chriſt ſayeth openly habite holineſſe liven ſuch wickedneſſe copie talent tooke evangeliſtes booke might ſee great traiſoun full many falſe compariſoun much great might heat light sunne ſurmounteth moone troubler chaungeth ſoone nutte kernell ſhell ſcorne nat tell right ſo withouten gile surmounteth noble evangile word evangeliſt title tooken chriſt many ſuch compariſoun make mentioun might men booke find ſo could hem mind vniverſitie tho aſleepe gan braied taken keepe noiſe head vp caſt ne never ſithen ſlept faſt vp ſtert armes tooke ayenſt falſe horrible booke ready battaile make iudge booke take broughten booke hent anone away feare nolde ſhew adele kept keepen wele till ſuch time may ſee ſo ſtrong woxen bee wight may hem well withſtond booke durſt ſtond away gonne ne durſt anſwere expoſition gloſe clerkes woll appoſe ayenſt curſedneſſe iwis booke written wote nat ne nat ſee manner end ſhall bee hide yet algate ſhall abide till may bette defend trow beſt woll end thus antechriſt abiden meine man woll ſo right ſoone ſhall life forgo outward lamben ſeemen full goodneſſe pite inward withouten fable greedy wolf raviſable enviroun lond ſee world werrien wee woll ordaine thing folkes good living caſtell cite within bougerons although millaine thereof blamed wight meaſure would lene gold take vſure ſo covetous lecherous theſe haunten simonie provoſt full trecherie prelate living iollily prieſt halt quein old hoores hoſtillers baudes bordellers el blamed vice men ſhoulden doen iuſtice ſaints prey defend lamprey luce elis ſamons tender geeſe capon tartes cheffes fat daintie flaunes brode flat caleweis pullaile coninges fine vitaile vnder clothes wide maken gollet glide woll doe come haſt rae veniſon bake paſt whether loure groine ſhall corde loigne men ſhall bind lede brenne ſinfull dede men ſhull heare crie rore mile way el ſhall priſon die woll friendſhip buy ſmerten hath guilt amounteth couth ſleight doe maken vp toure height nought rought whether ſtone tree yearth turf though though vounde ſtone wrought ſquier ſcantilone toure ſtuffed well rich temporell would vp dreſſe engine leſſe caſt v every ſide beare good name wide ſleights ſhall yeven barrel wine ſixe ſeven gold ſackes great plente ſhould ſoone delivered ſuch pitences let ſtudie equipolences let lie fallaces would deſerve grace ſhall beare ſuch witneſſe ſinne wretchedneſſe doen loſe ſo wide renne quicke ſhould brenne el yeve ſoch pennaunce well worſe pitaunce thou ſhalt never nothing con knowen aright clothing traitours full trecherie thou werkes eſpie ne good keeping whylome vniverſite keepeth key chriſtendome tourmented ſome ſtinking prophetis ni none hem good prophet wicked entention yeare incarnation thouſand two hundred yere five fiftie ferther ne nere broughten booke ſorrie grace yeven enſample common place ſaied thus though fable goſpell perdurable fro holy ghoſt ſent well worth brent entitled ſuch manere booke tell na wight paris beforne ladie parvis ne might booke ſentence pleaſed hem well truely woll ſtint matere wonder long ilke booke endured better eſtate enſured friend yet pardee han ſet great degree world emperour guile father trechour empreſſe mother maugre holy ghoſt iwis mightie linage rout reigneth every reigne well worthy miniſters world governe folke ſo well deceive none guile perceive though doen dare ſay ſooth dare wight bewray chriſtes wrath leadeth chriſt brother dredeth ni full good champion dreadeth ſuch ſimilation paine woll refuſen v correct accuſen woll entremete right ne god eyeſight therefore god ſhall punice ne recketh vice sithen men v loven communably holden v ſo worthy may folke repreve echone nill reprefe none ſhoulden folke worſhippen ſo v ſtinten never mo patren folke may v ſee though ſo behind hem wood follie enhaunce chivalrie love noble men gay iolly clothes wearen alway ſuch folke ſeemen cleane men clothes demen wordes follow dede great pitie drede woll none hypocritis hem thinketh great ſpight cannot love hem ſide beggers theſe hood wide ſleigh pale face leane gray clothes nat full cleane fretted full tatarwagges high ſhoes knopped dagges frouncen like quale pipe bootes riveling gipe ſuch folke deviſe prince theſe lord wiſe take land thing warre peace governing ſuch folke ſhould prince yeve would life honour live nat ſeme ſerven thus world queme would dwell deceive folke ſhall nat perceive ne ſpeake ſuch wiſe men ſhould humble habite diſpiſe pride vnder man ſhould hate thinketh poore man ſuch clothing god ne preiſeth nothing ſaieth hath world forſake hath worldly glory take woll ſuch delices vſe may begger well excuſe papelarde yeeldeth ſo woll worldly eaſe go ſaieth world hath left greedily gripeth eft hound ſhame ſaine caſting goeth againe bvt vnto dare lie might feelen eſpie ye perceived nothing ye ſhould ſtarke leaſing right hond thus beginne nolde let ſinne god lough wonder tho every wight gan lough alſo ſaied lo man right truſtie every wight falſe semblant qd love ſay mee sith thus avaunced thee court thy dwelling ribaudes ſhalt king wolt thou well holden forwardes yea ſir hence forwardes woll people vpon areiſe guile doen ceiſe ſharpe ſpeares riue way bring fro liue woll follow ywis booke written thus much woll booke ſignifie peter maiſtrie may never iohn ſhew well might declared right meaning barke rinde maketh entencions blinde erſt woll begin expoune pith within ſeculers comprehend chriſts law woll defend ſhould kepen maintainen ayenſt hem ſuſtenen falſly people teachen iohn betokeneth hem preachen ni law couenable thilke goſpell perdurable fro holy ghoſt ſent turne folke ben miſwent ſtrength iohn vnderſtond grace ſay ſtond doeth ſinfull folke conuert hem ieſu chriſt reuert full many another horriblee may men booke ſee commaunded doubtleſſe ayenſt law rome expreſſe antichriſt holden men may booke beholden commaunden ſleen tho peter ſhall never might god toforne ſtrife fight ne ſhall ynough find peter law ſhall mind euer hold ſo mainteen laſt ſhall ſeen ſhall come thereto aught ſpeake thilke law ſhall ſtond iohn vnderſtond maugre hem ſhall adoun brought confuſioun never father beforne seruaunt ſo true ſith borne ayenſt nature sir put auenture though ye borowes take ſikerer ſhall ye never hoſtages ne ſikerneſſe chartres beare witneſſe take ſelfe record men ne may manere tearen wolfe hide till ſlaine backe ſide though men beat defile wene ye woll beguile clothed meekely vnder trechery mine heart chaungeth never mo none habite go though chere ſimpleneſſe wearie ſhreudneſſe lemman ſtrained abſtenaunce hath miſter purueiaunce full long ago ded nere counſaile red let alone mee love anſwerd truſt thee without borow woll none falſe semblant theefe anone right ilke ſame place treaſon face right blacke within white without thanking gan knee lout nought euery man aſſaute ſailen qd love full hardely armed hem comenly ſuch armour hem fell armed fiers fell went hem forth rout ſet caſtle away dread till ſo ben dead till caſtle take foure battels gan make patted hem foure anone tooke way forth gone foure gate aſſaile keeper woll faile ben neither ſicke ne dede hardie folke ſtrong dede woll ſaine countenaunce falſe semblant abſtinaunce ben wicked tongue went firſt held parliament whether doen maken hem knowen el walken forth diſguiſed laſt deuiſed would gone tapinage pilgrimage like good holy folke vnfeined dame abſtinence ſtreined tooke robe cameline gan gratche bigine large couerchief thread wrapped head ſhe forgate pſaltere paire bead eke ſhe bere vpon lace white thread ſhe bead bede ſhe ne bought hem never adele given wote wele god wote full holy frere ſaied father dere ſhe went frere couent viſited alſo many ſermon ſaied nolde let men liue ne would oft ſhriue ſo great deuotion made confeſſion oft none two head one hood one faire ſhape deuiſed thee pale face ſometime ſhee falſe tratoureſſe vntrew like ſallow horſe hew apocalips ſhewed ſignifieth tho folke beſhrewed full trecherie pale hypocriſie horſe colour onely dead pale iwis ſuch colour enlangoured abſtinence iwis coloured eſtate ſhe repented viſage repreſented burdoune theft guile yeue yeft ſcrippe faint diſtreſſe full elengeneſſe forth ſhe walked ſoberlie falſe semblant ſaint ievous die ſuch miſtere doen cope frere cheare ſimple full pitous looking disdeinous ne proud meeke full peaſible necke bare bible squierly gan gon reſt limmes vpon treaſon potent feeble way went ſleue gan thring raſour ſharpe well biting forged forge men clepen coupe gorge long forth way nomen till wicked tongue comen gate ſitting ſaw folke way paſſing pilgrimes ſaw faſt bearen hem full meekely humbly hem mette dame abſtinence firſt grette ſith falſe semblant ſalued hem remeued ne drede adele ſaw face wele alway heart thought ſo ſhould know hem two well knew dame abſtinaunce ne knew conſtrainaunce knew nat ſhe conſtrained ne theeues life fained wend ſhe come free ſhe come another degree good ſhe began failed falſe semblant ſeine alſe knew nat faiſe yet falſe falſeneſſe ne coud eſpie geſſe semblant ſo ſlie wrought falſeneſſe ne eſpyed nought haddeſt thou knowen beforne thou wouldeſt booke ſworne thou ſaw thilke arraie whilom ſo gaie daunce iolly robin tho become iacobin ſoothly ſo men call frere preachours good men order wickedly bearen minſtrels wearen auguſtins cordileers carmes eke ſacked freers freers ſhode bare though ſome hem ben great ſquare full holy men hem deme everich hem would good man ſeme ſhalt thou neuer apparence seene conclude good conſequence none argument iwis exiſtence failed men may finde alway ſopheme conſequence enueneme ſo hath ſobtiltee double ſentence ſee pilgrimes commen wicked tongue dwelled harneis nigh hem algate wicked tongue adoune ſate hem nere come tidinges tell ſome ſayd hem caſe maketh come place sir ſayd ſtrained abſtinance drie penance heart pitous deuout commen pilgrimes gone well nigh foote alway go full doughtie heeles two thus ſent throughout world miſwent yeve enſample preach alſo fiſhen ſinfull men go fiſhing ne fiſh ſir charite wont herborow craue life amenne chriſt ſaue ſo ſhould diſpleaſe woulden eaſe ſhort sermon vnto ſain wicked tongue anſwered houſe qd ſuch ye ſee shall warned saie liſt woll heare graunt mercie ſweet ſir deare qd alderfirſt dame abſtinence thus began ſhe ſentence sir firſt vertue certaine greateſt moſt ſoueraigne may found man wit tongue refraine thereto ought euerie wight paine better ſtill ſpeaken harme parde hearkeneth gladly good man ſikerly ſir abouen ſinne art thou moſt guiltie ninne thou ſpeake yape long agoe ſir right euill doe young man repaired never yet place repaired thou ſaideſt awaited nothing deceiue faire welcomming ye ſayd nothing ſooth ſir ye lye tell ye plat ne commeth ne goeth parde trow ye ſhall never ſee faire welcomming priſon oft hath played er faireſt game coude without filth ſtill loude dare ſhe ſelfe ſolace ye han alſo man doe chaſe dare neither come ne go mooveth hate ſo properly wicked thought many falſe leſing hath thought mooveth foule eloquence iangleth ever audience folke ariſeth blame doth hem diſhonour ſhame thing may preuing likelineſſe contriuing dare ſaine reaſon deemeth ſooth thing ſeemeth ſinne controue thing reproue wote ye wele ſir therefore ye arne blame natheleſſe recketh lite yeueth thereof mite thought harme parfaie would come gone daie coud himſelfe abſteine commeth ſene ne taketh cure aventure laſſe folke algate thou watcheſt gate ſpeare thine areſt alwaie muſe muſard daie thou wakeſt night day thought iwis thy trauaile nought iealouſie withouten faile shall never quite thee thy trauaile skath faire welcoming without treſpaſſing shall wrongfully priſon weepeth languiſheth though thou never yet iwis gilteſt man take greefe worthy put thee baily afterward priſon lie fettred thee till thou die thou ſhalt ſinne dwell right diuels arſe hell thou repent thee maifaie thou lyeſt falſely qd welcome miſchaunce therefore herboured ſay ſhame eke reproue ſorrie happe behoue day herbegere go herber elſewhere han lyer called two tregetours art thou mine houſe doe ſhame ſoothſaw ye blame sermon ye make diuels take elſe god thou confound er men didden caſtle found paſſeth ten dayes twelue told right ſelue ſayd right ſo told kiſt roſe priuily thus ſayd ſayd yore ſhould men ſay ſuch thing gabbing right ſo ſaide woll ſay yet trow lyed bemes woll blow neighbour arrow hath commen gone tho ſpake falſe semblant right anone goſpell dout men ſaine towne lay defe eare ſpeaking ſwere ſir gabbing trow wote well certainly man loveth tenderly ſayth harme wote never ſo poore wit ſooth alſo ſikerly know ye ſir well lover gladly woll viſiten place love habiten man loveth eke honoureth man ſerve laboureth clepeth freind ſo deere man maketh good cheere euerie man meeteth ſaleweth greeteth preſeth ſo oft ye ought comming encombred preſen folke full ofter doeth heart ſtrained ſo vnto roſe go ye ſhould ſeene ſo oft need ye ſhould take deed coud comming forbeare though ye thrilled ſpeare nere truſteth well ſweare cleane thought sir certes ne thinketh nought ne doth faire welcomming ſore abieth thing one aſſent full ſoone roſe hent maugre would ſir thing hearkeneth sith ye man loveth han ſayd ſuch harme ſhame witteth well geſſed ye may well demen wit nolde nothing love ſo ne callen friend alſo night day woll wake caſtle deſtroy take ſooth ye de viſe ſome man ſome manner wiſe might warne everidele himſelfe perceive wele ſith might come gone whilom wont done might ſoone wite ſee otherwiſe wote hee ſir vtterly deſerved hell iollyly death hell doubtleſſe thrallen folke ſo guiltleſſe falſe semblant ſo prooveth thing none anſwering ſeeth alwaie ſuch apparaunce nigh fell repentaunce ſayd ſir may well semblant good man ſeemen ye abſtinence full wiſe ye ſeeme talent deeme counſaile woll ye yeven right anon thou ſhalt ſhriven ſay thy ſinne without ſhalt thou repent ſore prieſt poſte ſhrive folke moſt dignite ben wide world may dure world cure yet never perſoun ne vicarie manner toun god wote thee thouſand time pitee hath thy prieſt parochiall though thy friend ſpeciall avauntage wife prieſts ſo wiſe ne halfe ſo lettred licenſed boldly divinitie read confeſſen dread ye woll confeſſe leave ſinnes leſſe without abode kneele doune anon ſhall abſolution ¶here followeth booke troilus creſeide excellent book ſhewed fervent love troylus creiſeid enjoyed time great untruth giving herſelf diomedes end ſo caſt ſhe came great miſery diſcourſe chaucer liberally treateth divine purveyance double ſorrow troilus tellen kinge priamus sonne troy loving aventures fellen woe wele ioy purpoſe er part froy thou theſiphone thou helpe tendite theſe wofull verſes wepen write thee clepe thou goddeſſe tourment thou cruell furie ſorrowing ever paine helpe ſorrowfull inſtrument helpeth lover complaine well ſit ſooth ſaine wofull wight drery feare ſorrowfull tale ſorie cheare god love ſervaunts ſerve ne dare love mine vnlikelyneſſe prayen ſpeed ſhould therefore ſterve farre fro helpe derkeneſſe natheleſſe may done gladneſſe lover cauſe availe thanke mine travaile ye lover bathen gladneſſe droppe pite remembreth paſſed heavineſſe ye felt adverſite folke thinketh ye han felt love durſt diſpleaſe elſe ye han great eaſe prayeth hem caſe troilus ye may heare hem bring heaven ſolace eke prayeth god ſo deare might ſhew ſome manere paine woe love folke endure troilus vnſely aventure biddeth eke hem ben diſpeired love never recovered eke hem falſely ben apeired wicked tongue ſhe thus biddeth god benignite grant hem ſone world pace ben diſpaired love grace biddeth eke hem ben eaſe god hem graunt aie good perſeverance ſend hem grace love pleaſe love worſhip pleaſance ſo hope ſelfe beſt avance pray hem love ſervaunts write woe live charite hem compaſſioun though owne brother dere hearkeneth good ententioun woll go ſtraight matere ye may double ſorrowes troilus loving creſeide ſhe forſoke er ſhe deide well wiſt y• greekes ſtrong armes thouſand ſhips went troie wardes citie long beſiegeden nigh ten yeres ere ſtent diver wiſe one entent raviſhing wreake queene heleine paris wroughten peine fell ſo y• toune dwelling lord great authorite great divine cleped calcas ſcience ſo expert knew well troie ſhould deſtroyed anſweare god hight thus dan phebus apollo delphicus calcus knew calculing eke y• anſweare god apollo greekes ſhould ſuch people bring thorow troy muſt fordo caſt anone toune goe well wiſt ſort troie ſholde deſtroyed ye would ſo nolde wherefore departen ſoftly tooke purpoſe full forknowing wiſe greekes hoſt full prively ſtale anone courteous wiſe worſhip ſerviſe truſt hath cunning hem rede every perill dread great rumour roſe firſt eſpied toune openly ſpoken calcus traitour fled alied hem grece caſt wroken falſely hath faith broken ſayd kinne atones worthy brent fell bone calcas left miſchaunce vnwiſt falſe wicked dede daughter great penaunce life ſhe full ſore drede wiſt never beſt rede widdow ſhe alone niſt whome ſhe might make mone creſeide lady name aright dome troy citie moſt faireſt ladie far paſſing every wight angellike ſhone native beaute mortall thing ſeemed ſhe therewith ſhe ſo perfect creature ſhe made ſcorning nature ladie day heard eare father ſhame falſhede treaſoun full nigh wit ſorrow feare widdowes habite large ſamite broun hector knee ſhe fell adoun mercy bad ſelfe excuſing pitous voice tenderly weeping hector pitous nature ſaw ſhe ſorrowfull begone ſhe ſo faire creature goodneſſe gladed anone ſaid let father traiſon gone forth miſchance ye ſelfe joy dwelleth u liſt troy y• honour men may ye ferforth though father dwelt ye ſhull haue body ſhull men ſave ferre may ought enquire ſhe thanked full good chere ofter would took leve went home held ſtill houſe ſhe abode ſuch meine till honour need hold ſhe dwelling cite kept eſtate yong old full well beloved men well told whether ſhe child none rede nat therefore let gone thing fellen werre betwixen hem troy greekes oft ſometime boughten troy derre eſte greekes founden nothing ſoft folke troy thus fortune aloft efte gan hem whelmen courſe aie yt wroth toune came deſtruction ne falleth purpoſe tell long digreſſion fro matter long dwell troyan ieſtes fell omer dare dite ſo yt may reden hem write thogh greekes hem troy ſhetten citie beſieged old uſages nolde letten honouren god full devout aldermoſt honour dout relike hight palladion truſt aboven everychon ſo befell comen time aprill clothed mede new grene luſtie veer prime ſweet ſmelling floures white rede ſundrie wiſe ſhewed rede folke troie obſervances old palladions feaſt went hold vnto temple beſt wiſe generally went many wight hearken palladions ſerviſe namely many luſtie knight many lady freſh maiden bright full well arraied moſt leaſt ſeaſon high feaſt among theſe folke creſeida widdowes habite blacke natheles right firſt letter beautie firſt ſo ſtood ſhe makeles goodly looking gladed prees na neuer ſeene thing praiſed ſo derre n • r cloude blacke ſo bright ſterre creſeide ſayden everichone behelden blacke wede yet ſhe ſtood full lowe ſtill alone behinde folke little bread nie dore ſhames dread simple attire debonaire chere full aſſured looking manere troilus wont guide yong knight lad hem doune thilke large temple every ſide beholding aie lady toune devotioune none reven reſt gan praiſe lacke whome leſt walk full faſt gan waiten knight ſquier companie gan ſike let eyen baiten woman coud eſpie would ſmile hold follie ſay hem thus lord ſhe ſleepeth ſoft love thee thou turneſt full oft heard tell pardieux living ye lover eke lewd obſervaunces labour folke winning love keeping ſuch doutaunces pray loſt wo penaunces fooles blinde nice ye one ware another y• word gan caſt brow aſcaunces lo well iſpoken god love gan looken low right diſpite ſhope wroken kidde anone bow broken ſodainly hitte full yet proude peacocke gan pull blinde world blind entention often falleth effect contraire ſequedrie foule preſumption caught proud caught debonaire troilus clomben ſtaire little weneth mote deſcenden day faileth fooles wenden proud bayard beginneth skippe way ſo pricketh corne till laſh long whippe thinketh tho praunce beforn firſt traiſe full fat new iſhorne yet horſe horſes law muſt endure feeres draw fared fiers proud knight though worthy kinges ſonne wend nothing ſuch might ayenſt ſhould heart ſtere yet looke heart woxe fire moſt pride woxe ſodainly moſt ſubject unto love thy enſample taketh man ye wiſe proud worthy folkes ſcornen love ſo ſoone freedome heart thraſt ever ever ſhall love thing may bind man may fordo law kind ſooth hath preved doth yet trow ye know ſome men reden folke han greater wit y• han ben moſt love inome ſtrengeſt folk therewith overcome worthyeſt greateſt degree yet man ſhall ſee trueliche ſitte well ſo alderwiſeſt han therewith ben pleaſed han ben aldermoſt wo love han ben comforted moſt eaſed oft hath cruell heart appeaſed worthy folke made worthier name cauſeth moſt dreden vice ſhame ſith may nat goodly withſtond thing ſo vertuous kind refuſeth nought love ne ben bond sith ſelven liſt may bind yerde bette bowen woll wind breſt therefore rede followeth yt ſo well lede tellen forth ſpeciall king ſonne told leven thing collaterall thinke tale forth hold joy care cold werke touching matere gan woll thereto refere within ye temple went forth playing trouilus every wight lady looking ſo ſhe toune without upon caſe befell rout eye peirced ſo deepe went till creſeide ſmote ſtent ſodainly wonder wext aſtoned gan bet behold thrifty wiſe god thouȝt wher haſt thou woned art ſo faire goodly deviſe therewith heart gan ſpread riſe ſoft ſighed leaſt men might caught ayen firſt playing chere na nat moſt ſtature limmes ſo well anſwearing womanhood creature never laſſe manniſh ſeeming eke pure wiſe meaning shewed well men might geſſe honour eſtate womanly nobleſſe tho troilus right wonder well withall gan like meaning chere ſomdele deignous ſhe let fall looke little aſide ſuch manere aſcaunces may ſtonden looking gan ſhe light never thought ſeen ſo good ſight looke gan quicken great deſire ſuch affection heart bottome gan ſticken ſixe deepe impreſſion though earſt pored vp doun glad horne ſhrinke vnnethes wiſt looke winke lo lete ſelven ſo cunning ſcorned hem love paine drien full vnware love dwelling within ſubtill ſtreames eyen ſodainely thought felt dyen right looke ſpirite heart bleſſed love thus folke convert thus blacke liking troilus thing ſtood behold deſire ne wherefore ſtood thus neither chere made ne word thereof told ferre manner hold thing ſometime looke caſt eft ſervice laſt nat fulliſh awhaped temple eſelich went repenting ever iaped love folke leaſt fully diſcent ſcorne fill himſelfe ment leaſt wiſt manner ſide woe gan diſſimulen hide fro yt temple thus departed ſtraight anone unto pallaice turneth right loke ſhotten darted faineth luſt ſoiourneth chere ſpeech alſo burneth aie love ſervaunts every ſelfe wrie hem gan ſmile ſayd lord ſo live luſt ye lover cunningeſt ſerveſt moſt ententifelich beſt tite often harme thereof prow hire quit ayen ye god wote well well ſcorne good ſerviſe faith order ruled good wiſe certaine obſervaunces onely ſely point ne nothing asketh ſo great attendaunces doth laie know ye worſt mote thee told worſt point leve ſayd ſooth ye woulden greve take ye lover oft eſchew elſe done good entention full oft thy ladie woll miſſe conſtrew deeme harme opinion yet ſhe encheſon wroth ſhalt thou groin anon lord well may one yt ſeeth time held peace none bote gained love began feather ſo lime well vnneth vnto folke fained buſie need diſtrained woe done niſt folke gon hem liſt chamber alone doune vpon bed foot ſet firſt gan ſike eft grone thought aie ſo withouten let ſate woke ſpirit met ſaw temple wiſe right looke gan new aviſe thus gan make mirrour mind ſaw wholy figure well coud heart find right good aventure love ſuch one cure ſerven yet might fall grace elſe one ſervants pace imagining travaile grame ne might ſo goodly one lorne ſhe ne deſire ſhame wiſt priſe vp borne lover well beforne thus argumented ginning full vnaviſed wo comming thus took purpoſe love craft ſewe thought would worken privily firſt hide deſire mewe everie wight iborne overly might ought recovered thereby remembring y• love wide iblowe yelt bitter fruite though ſweet ſeed ſowe full mokell thought ſpeake holden inne arten er love ſought ſong anone right beginne gan loude ſorrow winne good hope gan fully aſſent creſeide love nought repent ſong onely ſentence write mine authour called lolius plainely ſave tongue difference dare well ſay troilus sayed ſong lo every word right thus ſhall ſaine ſo liſt heare lo next verſe may finde ¶the ſong troilus love god feele ſo love thing love good whence cometh wo wicke wonder thinketh every torment adverſite cometh may ſavery think foraie thurſt iche drinke mine owne luſt brenne whence cometh wailing plaint harme agree whereto plaine thenne ne unwery feint quicke death ſweet harme ſo queint may thee ſuch quantite conſent ſo conſent wrongfully comylaine iwis thus poſſed fro ſtereleſſe within bote amidde ſea atwixen windes two contrary ſtonden ever mo ala wonder maladie heat cold cold heat die god love thus ſayd pitous voice lord ſpirite oughten thank lord yt han brought whether goddeſſe woman iwis ye ſerve man woll aie live ſterve ye ſtonden eyen mightily place vertue digne wherefore lord ſerviſe may liken ſo beth benigne mine eſtate royall reſigne honde full humble chere become man lady dere ne deigned ſparen blood royall fire love wherefro god bleſſe ne forbare degree vertue excellent proweſſe held thrall lowe diſtreſſe brend ſo ſundry wiſe aie newe ſixty time day loſt hewe muchell day fro day thought luſt gan quicken encreaſe everiche charge ſet nought thy full oft hot fire ceaſe ſeen goodly looke gan preaſe thereby ben eaſed well wend aie nere brend aie nere fire hotter trow knoweth companie ferre nere dare ſay night day wiſedome follie heart breſtes eie aie fairer ſeene ever helein polixene eke day paſſed hour himſelfe thouſand time ſayd god goodly whome ſerve labour beſt would god creſeide ye woulden rue er deide dere heart ala mine hele hew life loſt ye woll rew dredes fled thaſſiege ſalvation ne deſire none founes bred argument concluſion ſhe would compaſſion ben man may dure lo life death cure ſharpe ſhowers fell armes preve hector brother didden ne made onely therefore one meve yet ſo men went ridden found one beſt lengeſt time abiden perill eke ſuch travaile armes thinke marvaile none hate greekes ne alſo reſcous toun ne made thus armes mad onely lo concluſioun liken bet renoun fro day day armes ſo ſped greekes y• death dred fro forth tho reſt love ſlepe made meate foe eke ſorrow gan multiply ſo tooke keepe ſhewed hew even morow therefore title gan borow ſickeneſſe leaſt men wend hot fire love brend ſayd fever fared amis certaine cannot ſey lady underſtood fained ſhe niſt one twey well rede manner wey ne ſeemed ſhe rought paine ſo ever thought felt troilus ſuch wo welnigh wood aie drede ſhe ſome wight loved ſo never ſhe would han take heed thought felt hart bleed ne woe ne durſt nought begin tellen world win ſpace left care thus himſelfe full oft gan plaine ſayd foole art thou ſnare whilom yapedeſt lover pain art thou hent gnaw thine chain thou wert aie woned ech lover reprehend thing fro wch thou canſt thee defend woll every lover ſaine thee wiſt ever thine abſence laughen ſcorn ſaine lo goeth man great ſapience held u lover leaſt reverence thanked god may gon daunce hem love lift feebly avaunce thou wofull troilus god would sith thou muſt loven thy deſtine thou beſet wer ſoch one ſhould know thy wo lacked pitee cold love towards thee thy ladie froſt winter moone thou fordo snow fire ſoone god would arrived port death ſorow woll lede ah lord great comfort quite languiſhing drede hidde ſorow iblowe brede ſhall beiaped thouſand time foole whoſe folly men rime help god ye ſweet plaine icought ye never wight ſo faſt mercie deare hart helpe death life may laſt ſelfe woll love laſt ſome frendly look gladeth
