ſwete though nevermore thing ye behete theſe word full many another mo ſpake called ever compleint name tellen wo till nigh ſalt teares dreint nought ſhe heard nat pleint bethought follie thouſand fold woe gan multiplie bewailing chamber thus alone friend called pandare came one vnware heard grone ſaw friend ſuch diſtreſſe care ala qd cauſeth fare mercy god vnhappe may mene han thus ſone y• greek made lene haſt thou ſome remorſe conſcience art fall ſome devotion waileſt thy ſinne thine offence haſt ferde cought contrition god ſave hem beſieged han toun ſo laie iollitie preſſe bring luſtie folke holyneſſe theſe word ſaid y• none ſuch thing might angry maken anger done ſorrow fall time courage awaken well wiſt far tongue ſpeaken na man greater hardineſſe ne deſired worthineſſe ca qd troilus aventure hath guided thee ſeen languiſhing refuſe everie creature love god praying goe hence away certes dying woll thee diſeaſe mote need deie therefore goe way ni ſeie thou wene thus ſick drede ſo therefore ſcorne nought thing take hede wel ought y• grekes han yet wrouȝt cauſe deth ſorow thouȝt though tell thee ne leſt thou wroth hide beſt pandare yt nigh malt wo routh full often ſayed ala may friend qd ever love trouth hath er betwiren thee ne doe thou never ſuch cruelte hiden fro thy friend ſo great care woſt thou well pandare woll parten thee thy paine ſo doe thee comfort friend right ſooth ſaine enterparten woe glad diſport ſhall true falſe report wrong right loved thee live hide thy woe fro tell blive gan ſorrowfull troilus ſike layd thus god leve beſt tellen thee ſith may thee like yet woll tell though heart breſt well wote thou maieſt reſt leaſt thou deeme truſt thee heark friend thus ſtant love ayenſt ſo defendeth ſelven moſt alder leſt availeth diſpaire ſo ſorrowfully offendeth ſtraight vnto yt death hart faileth thereto deſire ſo b • enningly aſſaileth ſlaine greater ioy king grece troy suffiſeth full friend pandare ſaid woteſt thou wo love god cold care hide well told never mo harmes mighten followen mo two wiſt thou gladneſſe let ſterve unknowne diſtreſſe haſt thou thus vnkindly long hid fro thou fool qd pandarus peraventure thou maiſt ſuch one long mine viſe anone may helpen v wonder thing qd troilus thou couldeſt never love thy ſelfen wiſſe divell maieſt thou bringen bliſſe ye troilus hearken qd pandare though nice happeth often ſo one are doeth full evil fare good counſail keep frend therfro ſelfe ſeen blinde man go fell could looken wide foole may eke wiſe man oft guide whetſtone carving inſtrument yet maketh ſharpe kerving tolis thou woſt yt aught miſwent eſchue thou ſuch thing ſchole thus often wiſe men bewaren foolis thou ſo doe thy wit well bewared contrarie everie thing declared might ever ſweetneſſe know never taſted bitterneſſe man wot gladneſſe trow never ſorrow ſome diſtreſſe eke white blacke ſhame eke worthines ſet ſeemeth men may ſeen ſo wiſe deemeth sith thus two contrary lore love ſo oft aſſayed greuaunces ought connen well counſailen thee thou art diſmayed eke ne ought euill apaied though deſire thee beare thine heauie charge ſhall thee laſſe deare wote well fared thus thy brother paris hierdeſſe icleped oenone wrote complaint heauineſſe ye ſaw letter ſhe wrote geſſe nay never yet iwis qd troilus qd pandare hearkeneth thus phebus firſt found art medicine qd ſhe coud euerie wightes care remedie rede herbes knew fine yet himſelfe cunning full bare love ſo bounden ſnare daughter king admete craft ne coud ſorrow bete right ſo fare vnhappie love one beſt ſmerteth ſore yet peraventure reden thee nat ſelfe repreue cauſe wote well ſore doeth hauke liſteth play thine helpe yet ſomewhat ſay thing right ſiker mayeſt thou certaine dyen paine ſhall never mo diſcover thee ne trouth keepe nat reſtraine thee fro thy love although helleine thy brother wife iche wiſt ſhe love thee liſt therefore friendfullich aſſure tell platte thine encheſon finall cauſe woe ye endure doubteth nothing mine entention na reprehenſion ſpeake wight may bereue man love till liſt leue weteth well two vicis miſtruſten elſe beleue well wote meane vice truſten ſome wight preue trouth thy would faine remeue thy wrong conceit ſome wight truſt thy woe tell tell thou luſt wiſe eke ſayth woe y• alone fall hath • one helpe riſe ſith thou haſt fellow tell thy mone ni nought certaine next wiſe winnen love teachen v wiſe wallow weep niobe ye queene whoſe teares yet marble iſeene let thy weeping thy drerineſſe let v leſen woe ſpeech may thy wofull time ſeeme leſſe delight nought woe thy woe ſeech doen theſe fooles ſorrowes eche ſorrowe han miſaventure luſten nought ſechen cure men ſaine wretch conſolation another fellow paine ought well opinion thou love doe plaine full ſorrow ſooth ſaine certainly hard grace may ſit ſpace god woll thou art nought agaſt leaſt would thy ladie thee beguile thou woſt thy ſelfe love parde beſt gone ſithen long ſithen thou woſt doe wile ſith thou truſteth moſt tell ſomwhat ſince woe thou woſt yet troilus word ſaid long lay ſtill dead ſiking abraid pandarus voice lent eare vp eyen caſt feare pandarus leaſt frenſeye ſhould either fall elſe ſoone deye ſayd awake full wonderlich ſharpe ſlumbreſt thou litergie art thou like aſſe harpe heareth ſound men y• ſtrings ply mind melodie may ſinke gladen dull beaſtialite pandare word ſtent troilus nothing anſwerde tell nought entent never man whome yt ſo ferde ſayd men maken oft yerde maker himſelfe ibeten ſundrie manner theſe wiſe men treten nameliche counſaile telling toucheth love ought ſecre himſelfe woll inough ſpring bet gouerned eke ſometime craft ſeeme flee fro thing effect men hunten faſt gan troilus heart caſt natheles heard crie awake gan ſike wonder ſore ſayd friend though ſtill lie deefe peace crie heard thy wordes thy lore ſuffer fortune bewailen thy proverb may nought availen cure canſt thou none eke nill cured woll die know queene niobe let thine old enſamples thee prey friend qd pandarus therfore ſey delight fooles beweepe woe ſeeken bote ne keepe know reaſon thee faileth tell wiſt ſhe whome thee miſaventure aileth durſt thou told eare thy woe ſith thou darſt thy ſelf fear beſought thee han ſome routh nay qd god trouth buſily qd pandarus though mine owne life lay need parde ſir qd troilus thou ſhouldeſt never ſpeed woſt thou well ye dreed qd troilus ever ye conne woll ſuch wretch wonne qd pandarus ala may thou diſpaired art thus cauſeleſſe liveth nat thy ladie benedicite woſt thou ſo thou art graceleſſe evill alway boteleſſe put impoſſible thus thy cure sith thing come oft aventure graunt well thou endureſt wo ſharpe doth teſiphus hell whoſe ſtomacke foules tiren evermo highten vulture bookes tell may endure thou dwell ſo unskilfull opinion thy woe ni curation one nill thou thy coward heart thine yre fooliſh wilfulneſſe wantruſt tellen thy ſorrowes ſmert ne thine owne helpe buſineſſe much ſpeake word yea leſſe lyeſt life nothing retch woman living coud love ſuch wretch may ſhe demen thy death thou thus die ſhe feare yolden vp thy breath greekes han beſieged v iwis lord thank ſhalt thou thus woll ſhe ſaine toun atones wretch deed divel bone thou mayeſt alone weep cry knele love woman yt ſhe wote nought ſhe quite thou ſhalt feel vnknow vnkiſt loſt vnſought many man hath love full dere ibouȝt twentie winter ladie ne wiſt never yet lady mouth kiſt ſhould therfore fallen diſpair receaunt owne tene ſlaine himſelfe ladie faire nay nay ever one freſh green ſerve love dere heart queen thinke guerdone ſerve thouſand part deſerve word tooke heede troilus thought anon folly ſooth ſayd pandarus toſlaien himſelfe might win doen vnmanhood ſinne death ladie nought wite woe god wote ſhe knew full lite thought gan full ſore ſike ſayd ala beſt doe whome pandare ſayed thee like beſt thou tell thy woe trouth thou finde ſo thy boote full long peeces doe drawe ſithen hong yea ſo ſayeſt thou qd troilus ala god wote nought rather ſo full hard helpen caas well finde fortune fo ne men ride con go may cruell whele harme withſtond liſt ſhe playeth free bond qd pandarus blameſt thou fortune thou art wroth ye earſt ſee woſt thou well y• fortune commune everie manner wight ſome degree yet thou haſt comfort lo parde ioyes moten overgone mote ſorrowes paſſen everichone whele ſtint thing tourne ceſſeth ſhe fortune anone ſith whele way may ſoiourn woſt thou mutabilitie whether thy ſelf luſt ſhe woll thee ſhe nought ferre fro thine helping peraventure thou haſt cauſe ſing therfore woſt thou thee beſeech let thy woe tourning ground ſo liſt healing leech behooveth firſt vnwrie wound cerberus hell aie bound wer ſuſter thy ſorrow ſhe ſhould thine morrow looke vp ſay tell ſhe anone may gone thy need know ich aught love tell would hope rather ſpeed tho gan veine troilus bleed hit woxe redde ſhame aha qd pandara beginneth game word gan ſhake ſayd thus thou ſhalt name tell tho gan ſely troilus quake though men ſhould han hell ſayed ala woe well ſweet foe called creſeide well nigh y• word feare deide y• pandare herd name neven lord glad ſaied friend ſo deere fare right ioves name heaven love hath beſet thee well good cheere good name wisdome manere hath inough eke gentleneſſe ſhe faire thou woſt thy ſelfe geſſe ne never ſeie bounteous eſtate ne gladder ne ſpeech friendlyer ne gracious doe well ne laſſe ned ſeech doen bet ech honour farre ſhe may ſtretch kinges heart ſeemeth wretch thy look good comfort thou certainely firſt point noble courage well ordaine man peace within himſelfe iwis oughteſt thou nought good loven well worthy place thee ought clepe happe grace alſo thinke therewith glad thee ſith ladie vertuous followeth ſome pitee amonges theſe generall ſee thou ſpeciall require nought ayen name vertue ſtretcheth himſelf ſhame well ever born thou beſet art ſo good place trouth love durſt ſworn thee ſhould never tidde ſo fair grace woſt thou thou wont chace love ſcorne diſpite call saint idiote lord theſe fooles often haſt thou made thy nice yapes ſaied love ſervaunts overichone nicete ben verie goddes ape ſome would monche meat alone ligging bed make hem grone ſome thou ſaideſt blaunch fevere praideſt god ſhould never kevere ſome hem took hem cold inough ſo ſaydeſt thou full oft ſome han fained oft time told waken ſleepe ſoft thus would ſet hem ſelf loft natheleſſe vnder laſt thus ſaydeſt thou yapedeſt full faſt yet ſaydeſt thou part theſe lover would ſpeake generall thoughten ſiker art ſailing aſſayen may yape thee ſhall natheleſſe though ſhould deie thou art none tho dare well ſeie bete thy breſt ſay god love thy grace lord repent miſſpake ſelfe love thus ſay thine heart good entent qd troilus ah lord conſent pray thee yapes thou foryeve ſhall never live thou ſayſt wel qd pandare hope thou y• goddes wrath haſt appeaſed ſith thou haſt wepten many drop ſaid ſuch thing wherwith thy god pleſed would never god thou eaſed think well ſhe reſt thy wo may thy comfort alſo thilk ground y• beareth y• wedes wick beareth eke theſe holſome herb full oft next foule nettle rough thick roſe wexeth ſoote ſmooth ſoft next valey hill loft next derke night glad morowe alſo ioy next fine ſorrow looke attempre thy bridell beſt aie ſuffer tide elſe labour idell haſteth well wiſely abide diligent true aie well hide luſtie free perſever thy ſerviſe well thou worke wiſe departed everie place hole writen clerkes wiſe wonder ſuch one grace eke woſt thou fareth ſome ſervice plant tree herbe ſondrie wiſe morrow pull vp blive wonder though may never thrive ſith y• god love hath thee beſtowed place digne vnto thy worthineſſe stond faſt good port haſt thou rowed thy ſelfe heavineſſe hope alwaie well drerineſſe haſt labour ſhend hope maken good end woſt thou laſſe afered matter nece trete heard ſay wiſe lered never man woman yet beyete vnapt ſuffer love hete celeſtiall el love kind thy ſome grace hope find ſpeake ſpeciall beautie bethinken youth ſit nought celeſtiall yet though liſt kouth truely ſit well right nouth worthy knight loven cherice ſhe doe hold vice wherefore woll aye ready paine doe ſervice pleaſe hope ye wiſe con counſaile keepe ſuch wiſe man ſhall wiſer bee ſo may ben gladded three trouth right thee good conceit wit geſſe woll thou ſee thinke ſith love goodneſſe hath thee conuerted wickedneſſe thou ſhalt beſt poſt leue lay moſt foe greue enſample ſee theſe great clerkes erren aldermoſt ayen law ben conuerted wicked werkes throgh grace god y• leſt hem withdraw arne folke y• han god moſt aw ſtrengeſt faithed vnderſtond con errour alder beſt withſtond troilus herd pandare aſſented ben helpe loving creſeide wext wo ſaith vnturmented hotter wext love ſaid ſober chere though hart plaid bliſfull venus helpe ere ſterue thee pandare mow ſome thank deſerue dere friend ſhall wo leſſe till done good eke tell wilt thou ſaine diſtreſſe leaſt ſhe wroth drede moſt iwis woll heren drede eke manere thee eme ſhe nill ſuch thing qd pandarus thou haſt full great care leſt chorle may fall moone lord hate thee nice fare entremete thou haſt doone god love bid thee boone let alone ſhall thy beſt frend qd done right thee leſt herke pandare word nolde thou wendeſt ſo great follie lady deſiren ſhould toucheth harme villanie dredeleſſe leuer die ſhe ought el vnderſtood might ſownen good tho lough pandarus anon anſwerd thy borow fie wight doth ſo raught though ſhe ſtood herd thou ſaieſt farwell woll go adieu glad god ſpeed v two yeue labour buſineſſe ſpeed thine ſweetneſſe tho troilus gan doune knee fall pandare armes hent faſt ſaid fie greekes yet parde god ſhall helpen laſt dredeleſſe life may laſt god toforne lo ſome hem ſhall ſmerte yet thinketh yt auaunt maſterte pandare ſay thou wiſe thou woſt thou maiſt thou art life death hole thine hond ſay help qd yes trouth ſhal god yeeld thee friend ſpeciall qd troilus thou recommaund may y• death commaund pandarus tho deſirous ſerve full friend ſaid manere farwell think wol thy thanke deſerve trouth thou ſhalt went way thinking matere beſt might beſeechen grace find time thereto place every wight yt hath houſe found renneth nat werke begin rakel hond woll biden ſtound ſend heart line fro within alder firſt purpoſe win thus pandare heart thought caſt werke full wiſely ere wrought troilus lay tho lenger doun anone gat vpon ſtede baie field played lioun wo ye greek met y• daye toune manner tho forth aye goodly gat ſo grace eche loved looked face became friendlieſt wight gentileſt eke moſt free thriftieſt one beſt knight time el might dead yapes cruelte high port manner ſtraunge hem gan vertue chaunge let v ſtint troilus ſtound fareth like man hurt ſore ſome dele king wound yleſſed well healed dele eaſie patient lore abite goeth cure thus driueth forth aventure explicit liber primus ovt theſe black wawes let v ſail wind weather ginneth clere ſea boate hath ſuch trauaile conning vnneth ſtere ſea clepe tempeſtous matere deepe diſpaire troilus hope kalends begin lady mine called art cleo thou ſpede fro forth muſe rime well booke till needeth none art vſe every lover excuſe ſentement endite latine tongue write wherefore nil neither thank ne blame worke pray mekely disblameth word lame mine authour ſaid ſo ſay eke though ſpeake love vnfeelingly wonder nothing new blind man cannot judgen well hewis know y• forme ſpeech change within thouſand yere word tho hadden priſe wonder nice ſtrange thinketh hem yet ſpake hem ſo ſpedde well love men eke winnen love ſundry age ſundry londs ſundry ben vſages thy happe wiſe lover place herkeneth ſtory woll deviſe troilus came lady grace thinketh ſo nolde love purchaſe wondreth ſpeech wondring every wight y• rome went halt nat pathe ne alway manere eke ſome lond gamen ſhent men farde love men done thus open chere viſiting forme ſaid ſaws thy men ſain ech country hath law eke ſcarſely ben place three love ſaid like done purpoſe may liken thee thee right nought yet done ſhall eke ſome men graue intre ſom ſtone wall betide ſith begonne mine authour ſhall follow konne explicit prohemium may y• mother moneths glade y• freſh floures blew white rede ben quick ayen winter dead made full baume fleting every mede phebus doth bright beam ſpred right white bole ſo betidde ſhall ſing may day thridde pandarus wiſe ſpeach felt eke part love ſhottes kene coud never ſo well loving preach made hew day full oft grene ſhope fill day tene love wo bed went made ere day full many went ſwallow progne ſorowfull lay morow come gan make hir waimenting ſhe forſhapen ever lay pandare bed halfe ſlombering till ſhe ſo nigh made waimenting tereus gan forth ſuſter take noiſe gan awake call dreſſe vp riſe remembring arrand done troilus eke great empriſe caſt knew good plite y• moone done voiage tooke way full ſoone vnto neces paleis beſide ianus god entre thou guide come vnto neces place lady folke qd told forth gan pace found two lady ſit ſhee within paued parlour three herden maiden hem reden geſte ſiege thebe hem leſte qd pandarus madame god ſee booke companie eigh vncle mine welcome iwis qd ſhee vp ſhe roſe hond hie tooke faſt ſaid night thrie good mote turne met ye word ſhe downe bench ſet yea nece ye ſhull faren well bet god woll yeare qd pandarus ſorry let hearken booke ye praiſen thus god love ſaith tell v love ſome good ye lere vncle qd ſhe maiſtreſſe nat yt gonnen laugh tho ſhe ſeide romaunce thebe rede heard y• king laius deide edippus ſonne al dede ſtinten theſe letter rede biſhop booke tell amphiorax fell ground hell qd pandarus know ſelue thaſſiege thebe care hereof ben maked bookes twelue let tell ye fare way barbe ſhew face bare way book riſe vp let v daunce let v done may ſome obſeruaunce eighe god forbid qd ſhe ye mad widdowes life ſo god ſave god ye maken right ſore adrad ye ben ſo wild ſeemeth ye raue ſat well bet aye caue bide rede holy ſaints liues let maiden gon daunce yong wiues ever thriue qd pandarus yet could tell thing done play vncle dere qd ſhe tell v god love thaſſiege awey greekes ferde ſo dey nay nay qd ever mote thriue thing well bet ſuch fiue ye holy god qd ſhe thing bet ſuch five eighe nay iwis world ne reden ſhould ben ſome iape trow ſelven tell u wit arede leane helpe god ye meane borow ne never ſhall qd thing told mote thrive uncle mine ſo qd ſhe god qd woll tell blive prouder woman none live ye wiſt toune troy iape nat ſo ever joy tho gan ſhe wondren thouſand fold downe eyen caſt never ſith time ſhe bore knowen thing deſired ſhe ſo faſt ſike ſhe ſaid laſt uncle mine nill diſpleaſe asken may diſeaſe many word glade friendly tale merry chere ſpeake gonnen wade many unkouth glad deepe matere friend done bethe ifere till ſhe gan asken hector ferde tounes wall greekes yerde full wel thanke god ſaid pandarus save arme hath little wound eke freſh brother troilus wiſe worthy hector ſecound every vertue liſt habound firſt trouth gentleneſſe wiſedom honour freedom worthineſſe good faith eme qd ſhe liketh faren well god ſave hem two trewliche hold great deintie kinges ſonne armes well good condition thereto great power morall vertue ſelde iſeene one perſone ifere good faith ſooth qd pandarus trouth ye king hath ſonnes twey meane hector troilus certainly though ſhould dey ben void vice dare ſey men liven ſunne might wide iknow conne hector needeth tell world ni better knight worthineſſe well well vertue hath might knoweth many wiſe worthy knight ſame priſe troilus ſey god helpe ſo know ſuch twey god qd ſhe hector ſooth troilus ſame thing trow dredeleſſe men telleth dooth armes day day ſo worthely beareth home ſo gently every wight priſe hath hem leveſt praiſed ye ſay right ſooth iwis qd pandarus yeſterday ſo mighten wondred upon troilus never yet ſo thicke ſwarme ne flew greekes gan fleen field every wight eare crie troilus hunted hem ſo faſt na greekes blood troilus hurt doun caſt aye went arraied thus death ſhield life u yt day ther durſt none withſtond yt held bloody ſwerd hond thereto friendlieſt man great eſtate ever ſaw live liſt beſt fellowſhip ſuch thinketh able thrive word tho pandarus blive tooke leave ſaid woll gon hen nay blame uncle qd ſhe eileth weary thus ſoone nameliche woman woll ye ſo nay ſitteth doune god haue done ſpeake wiſedom er ye go every wight hem tho heard gan ferre away ſtond two yt hem liſt hond yt tale brought end eſtate governaunce qd pandarus time wend yet ſay ariſeth let u daunce caſt widdows habit miſchaunce liſt thus ſelfe disfigure sith tidde ſo glad aventure well bethought love god qd ſhe shal weten ye meane thing asketh leaſer tho qd eke would full much greve iwis told ye tooke amis yet bette tongue hold ſtill ſay ſooth ayenſt nece mine goddeſſe minerve iupiter maketh thunderring blisfull venus ſerve ye ben woman world living withouten paramour weting beſt love lotheſt greve ye weten well ſelfe leve iwis mine uncle qd ſhe graunt mercy friendſhip founden ever yet man beholden truely much ſo little quit grace god emforth wit guilt ſhall never offend ere woll amend love god beſeech ye love moſt triſt let fremed manner ſpeech ſay nece liſt word uncle anon kiſt ſaid gladly leve nece ſo dere take good ſhall ſay ſhe gan eien doune caſt pandarus cough gan lite ſaid nece alway lo laſt ſo ſome men hem delite ſubtle art tale tendite yet entention tale ſome concluſion ſith end every tale ſtrength matter ſo behovely ſhould paint drawen length ben friend ſo faithfully word gan right inwardly beholden looken face ſaid ſuch mirrour much good grace thought thus tale endite ought hard make proceſſe ſhall ſavour therein lite trow would beguile tender wittes wenen wile whereas con nat plainliche underſtond thy wit ſerven woll fond looked buſie wiſe ſhe ware beheld ſo ah lord qd ſhe ſo faſt ye aviſe saw ye never ere ſay ye yes yes qd bet woll ere go trouth thought ye fortunate men ſhall ſee every wight ſome goodly aventure sometime ſhape receiven nill take cure cometh wilfully weiven lo neither caſe fortune deceiven right ſlouth wretchedneſſe ſuch wight blame geſſe good aventure belie nece ye full lightly founden ye conne take love god eke catch anone leaſt aventure ſlake ſhould lenger proceſſe make yeve hond world non liſt wight ſo well begon ſith ſpeake good ententioun told well beforne love well honour renoun creature world iborne othes ſworne ye wroth therefore wene lie ne ſhall never ſeene eft eie beth nat agaſt ne quaketh nat whereto ne chaunge nat fere ſo hew hardely worſt though tale new yet truſt alway ye ſhall find true thing thought unfitting would ſuch tale bring good eme god love prey qd ſhe come tell agaſt ye woll ſay eke longeth wit iwis whether well amis say let feare dwell woll done hearkeneth ſhall tell nece mine ye king dere ſonne good wiſe worthy freſh free alway done well wonne noble troilus ſo loveth thee ye helpe woll bane lo ſhould ſey doth liſt make live dey ye let die woll ſterven trouth nece nill lien ſhould knife throte kerven teares burſt eien ſaid ye done u dien thus guiltleſſe ye fiſhed faire mend ye though yt apaire ala lord ſo dere trew man noble gentle knight nought deſireth frendly chere ſee dien goeth upright haſteth full might ben ſlaine fortune aſſent ala god ſuch beautie ſent ſo ye ſo cruell death liſteth nought retch ſo trew worthy ſee yaper wretch ye ſuch beaute may nat ſtretch make amends ſo cruell dede aviſement good nede wo worth faire gemme vertuleſſe wo worth hearbe alſo yt doth bote wo worth beauty routhleſſe wo worth wight y• trede ech fote ye ben beautie croppe rote therewithall ne routh harme ye liven trouth alſo thinke well gaud lever thou honged ſhould ben baud high men might u iſee thine eme ſhame mee well thee ſhould aſſent mine abet yt thine honour ſhent underſtond nought requere bind beheſt save onely ye make better chere ye han done ere feaſt life ſaved leaſt ſome plainly entent god help ſo never ment lo requeſt nought skill iwis ne doubt reaſon parde none ſet worſt ye dreden men would wonder ſeen come gone ayenſt anſwere thus anone every wight foole kind woll deeme love frendſhip mind woll demen tho ſee man temple gone image eateth thinke eke well wiſely govern himſelfe nothing foryetteth wher cometh pris thonk geteth eke thereto ſhal come ſo ſeld force thogh y• toun beheld love frends reigneth thorow al toun wrie mantle ever mo god ſo wi ſalvatioun ſayd beſt ſo good nece alway ſtint wo let daunger ſugred ben alite death ye wite creſeide herd wiſe thought ſhall felen wt meaneth iwis eme qd ſhe would ye deviſe rede ſhould done well ſaid qd certaine beſt ye love ayen loving love love skilfull guerdoning thinke eke elde waſteth every hour part beaute therefore ere age thee devour go love old woll wight thee let proverbe lore unto bee late iware qd beaute paſt elde daunteth daunger laſt king foole wont cry aloud yt thinketh woman bereth hie long mote ye liven proud till crowes foot growen eie ſend mirrour prie ye may ſee face morow nece bid wiſh ſorow ſtint caſt y• head ſhe began breſt wepe anone ſaid ala wo nere dead world faith agone ala ſhoulden ſtraunge unto done beſt friend wend rate love ſhould defend ala would truſted doubtles diſaventure loved either achilles hector creature ye nolde mercy ne meaſure alway repreve falſe world ala may leve y• joy feaſt rede blisfull caas mede beheſt painted proceſſe ſaid ala right fine lady mine pallas thou dredefull caſe purvey ſo aſtonied dey ſhe gan full ſorrowfully ſike ne may bet qd pandarus god ſhall come weke god toforne yt miſtruſted thus ſee well ye ſetten light u death ala wofull wretch might yet live nought retch cruell god diſpitous marte fury three hell crie let never houſe depart meant harme villanie ſith ſee lord mote need die ſhrive ſey wickedly ye done u dey ſith liketh dead neptunus god ſee fro forth ſhall never eaten bread till mine owne heart blood may ſee certaine woll die ſoone hee ſtert way raught till ſhe againe lappe caught creſeide y• well nigh ſtarf feare ſhe fearfulleſt wight might heard eke eare ſaw ſorowfull earneſt knight praier ſaw eke none unright harme eke might fall gan rew dread wonder ſore thought thus unhaps fallen thicke alday love ſuch manner caas men ben cruell hemſelfe wicke man ſlee himſelfe ala preſence nill ſollas men would deme nat ſay needeth full ſlighly play ſorowfull ſigh ſhe ſaid thrie ah lord tidde ſorry chaunce mine eſtate lieth jeopardie eke mine emes life lieth ballaunce natheleſſe god governaunce ſhall ſo done mine honour ſhall keepe eke life ſtint weepe harmes two leſſe cheſe yet lever maken good chere honour emes life leſe ye ſaine ye nothing el requere wi qd mine owne nece ſo dere well qd ſhe woll done paine ſhall mine heart ayen luſt conſtraine nill nat holden hond ne love man naught ne may ayenſt el woll fonde mine honour ſave pleſen fro day day thereto nolde one ſaid nay dredde fantaſie ceſſe cauſe aie ceſſeth maladie make proteſtacion proceſſe ye deper go certainly ſalvacion though ye ſterven two though world day fo ne ſhall never routhe graunt wel qd pandare trouthe may truſt well qd thing yt ye han hight ye woll holde truely unto ye doubtleſſe qd ſhe mine uncle dere ne ſhall cauſe matere qd plain ofter preach parde nedeth ſpeach tho fill tale glade till laſt good eme qd ſhe tho love god u made tell firſt ye wiſten wo wot none ye ſaid well ſpeake love qd ſhe preie tell bet ſhall purveie tho pandarus litel gan ſmile ſaied trouth ſhall tell daie nat gon full long within paleis gardin well gan well halfe day dwell right ſpeaken ordinaunce grekes mighten diſavaunce sone gone lepe caſten dartes fro till laſt ſaied would ſlepe graſſe adoune laied tho gan roman fro till heard walked alone began full wofully grone tho gan ſtalke ſoftly behind ſikerly ſothe ſaine clepe ayen mind right thus love gan plain ſaied lorde routh vpon pain rebell mine entent mea culpa lord repent god thy diſpoſicion ledeſt • ine juſt purveiaunce every wight lowe confeſſion accept gree ſende ſoche penaunce liketh thee put diſperaunce may ghoſt departe alway fro thou ſhilde thy benignite certes lord ſo ſore hath ſhe wounded ſtode blacke loking iyen mine harte botome ifounded wot yt muſt nedes dien worſt dare nouȝt bewrien well hoter beene gledes rede men wrien aſhen pale dede ſmote hede adoune anone gan muttre nat truely gan ſtill waie gone lete thereof nothing wiſt come anon ſtode ſaied awake ye ſlepen long ſemeth nought yt love doth wrong ſtepen ſo yt man may wake ſeie ever er ſo dull man ye frende qd doe ye heddes ake love let liven lorde wo pale wan yet made tho freſhe countenaunce though ſhould led ye newe daunce paſſed forth till daie fell come roming alone chambre found laie vpon bedde man ſo ſore grone ne heard never mone ne wiſt nought comming ſodainly left complaining toke ſomwhat ſuſpection nere come found wepe ſore god ſo wiſe ſaluacion never thing routh neither engine ne lore vnnethes might fro death kepe yet fele mine harte wepe god wote never ſith borne ſo buſie man preach ne never wight ſo depe ſworne er told might leach rehearſen ſpeach wofull wordes ſowne ne bid nought ye woll ſe ſwone ſave life el nought non harme thus driven love god v hath wrouȝt soche chere doth may liven plat mine hart ſhriven ſith ye wote mine entent cleane take heede thereof none evill meane right good thrift pray god ye han ſoch one icaught withouten net ye wiſe ye faire ſe well ring rubie ſet never two ſo well imet whan ye hole mighty god yet grant v ſe hour nay thereof ſpake ha qd ſhe helpe god ye ſhenden every dele mercy dere nece anon qd • ſpake ment nought wele mar god helmed ſtele beth wroth blood nece dere well qd ſhe foryeven toke leave home went ye lord glad well bigon creſeide aroſe lenger ſhe ne ſtent ſtreight cloſet went anon ſet doune ſtill ſtone every worde gan vp doune wind ſaied came mind woxe ſomdele aſtonied thought right new caſe whan ſhe full aviſed tho found ſhe right nought perill ſhe ought aferde man may love poſſibilite woman ſo harte may breſt ſhe nat love ayen leſt ſhe ſat alone thought thus thaſcrie aroſe skarmoch without men cried ſtrete ſe troilus hath right put flight y• grekes rout gonne meine ſhout go ſe caſt vp gate wide throuȝ ſtrete mote paleis ride waie fro yates none dardanus open cheine come folke anone eaſie pace riding route tweine right happy day ſothe ſeine men ſaith may diſtourbed ſhall betiden neceſſite troilus ſat baie ſtede armed ſave hedde full richely wounded horſe gan blede rode pace full ſoftly ſoch knightly ſight truely nat withouten faile loke mar god battaile like man armes knight ſeen fulfilled high proweſſe body might doen thing well hardineſſe eke ſeen geare dreſſe freſhe ſo yong ſo weldy ſemed heaven vpon ſe helme hewen twenty place tiſſue hong backe behind ſhelde daſhed ſwerds mace men might many arowe find thirled horn nerf rind aie y• people cried cometh ioie next brother holder vp troie wext little redde ſhame ſo heard ye people vpon crien behold noble game ſoberliche caſt adoune iyen creſeide anon gan chere eſpien let ſo ſoft hart ſinke ſelf ſhe ſaid yave drinke thought ſhe woxe redde remembring right thus lo mine vncle ſwereth mote dedde mercy pite thought pure aſhamed 〈◊〉 gan hedde pull faſt people forth paſt gan caſt rollen vp doun within thought excellent proweſſe eſtate alſo renoun witte ſhape eke gentilneſſe moſt favour diſtreſſe thought routh ſlaen ſoch one ment trouth might ſome envious iangle thus ſodain love might ſhe ſo lightly loved troilous right firſt ſight ye parde whoſo ſaied ſo mote never thee every thing ginning hath nede er wrought withouten drede ſaie nat ſhe ſo ſodainly yafe love ſhe gan encline liken tho told manhode pine made love within gan mine proceſſe good ſervice wanne love ſodain wiſe ſo bliſfull venus wele araied satte ſeventh houſe heven tho diſpoſed wele aſpectes payed helpe ſely troilus wo ſothe ſayne ſhe na nat foe troilus nativite god wote wele ſooner ſped let v ſtente troilus throw rideth forth let v tourne faſt vnto creſeide heng hedde full low ſhe ſatte alone gan caſt whereon ſhe would appoint laſt ſo eme ne would ceſſe troilus vpon preſſe lorde ſo ſhe gan thought argue matter told doen beſt eſchue plited ſhe full oft many fold hart warme cold ſhe thought ſomwhat ſhall write mine authour liſteth tendite thought firſt troilus perſon knewe ſight eke gentelneſſe thus ſhe ſaid nought doen graunt love yet worthineſſe honor plaie gladneſſe honeſte ſoch lorde deale mine eſtate alſo heale eke well wote kinges ſonne ſith hath ſee ſoch delite would vtterliche ſight flie paraventure might diſpite might ſtond wors plite wiſe hate purchaſe without nede may ſtande grace every thing wot lieth meaſure though man forbid dronkenneſſe nought forbiddeth every creature drinkeleſſe alway geſſe eke ſithe wot diſtreſſe ne ought thing diſpiſe sith ſo meaneth good wiſe eke know long time agone thewes good ni nice vauntour ſaine men certain none wiſe doen ſo great vice ne al nill never ſo cherice ſhall make avaunt iuſt cauſe ſhall never binde ſoche clauſe ſet caſe hardeſt iwis men might demen loveth diſhonour vnto maie iche let naie parde know alſo alway heare ſe men loven woman toune wers naie withouten dout thinke eke worthie noble toune thriftieſt woman ſhe honour ſave worthieſt save onely hector beſt yet life lieth cure ſoche love eke mine aventure ne love wonder nought well wote ſelf ſo god ſpede woll man wiſt thought one faireſt drede goodlieſt ſo taketh hede ſo men ſaine toune troie wonder though ioie mine owne woman well eaſe thanke god mine eſtate right yong ſtond vntied luſtie leaſe withouten ielouſie ſuch debate shall husbonde ſaine checke mate either full ielouſie maiſterfull loven novelrie ſhal doen fine live thus shall love caſe leſt pardieux religious though mine harte ſet reſt vpon knight worthieſt kepe alway mine honor name right may doe ſhame right whan ſun ſhineth brigh • march chaungeth oft time face cloud put winde flight overſprat sunne ſpace cloudy thought gan ſoul pace overſpradde bright thought feare almoſt ſhe gan fall thouȝt ala ſith free love put ieopardie ſikerneſſe thrallen libertie ala durſt thinken folie may well folke aſpie dredfull ioie conſtreint pain ther loveth none yt ſhe ne hath plain love yet moſte ſtormie life right himſelf ever begonne ever ſome miſtruſt nice ſtrife love ſome cloud sunne thereto wretched woman nothing conne whan v wo wepe ſit thinke wretch wo drinke alſo wicked tongue ay ſo preſt ſpeake v harme eke men ben ſo vntrue right anon ceſſed leſt ceſſeth love forth love newe harm idoe doen ſo rue thouȝ theſe men love hem firſt rende full ſharp beginning breaketh oft ende oft time maie men rede ſeen treaſon woman hath doe fine ſoche love ſeen becometh whan go wight wote trowe ſo wher becometh lo wight ſporneth erſt nothing naught turneth buſie love eke muſt pleaſen hem iangle love demen coyen hem thei ſaie harm though cauſe yet hem ſemen al harm folk frendes quemen maie ſtoppen every wicked tong ſoune belle rong thought gan clere ſaied nothing vndertaketh nothing acheveth loth dere thought hart quaketh ſlepeth hope drede awaketh hote cold thus bitwixen twey riſt vp went pley adoune ſtaire anon right tho ſhe went gardine neces three vp doun maden many went flexippe ſhe tarbe antigone plaien ioie ſee woman great rout folowed gardine yerde large railed al alies ſhadowed wel bloſomy bow grene benched newe ſonded way ſhe walketh arme arme betwene till laſt antigone ſhene gan troian ſong ſingen clere heven voier ſaied love ſhall humble ſubiect true mine entent beſt lorde yeve iche euermore mine harte luſt rent never yet thy grace wight ſent blisfull cauſe life lede ioie ſuretie drede blisfull god hath ſo well beſet love iwis beareth life imaginen ne could bet lorde withouten jelouſie ſtrife love one moſte ententife ſerven well vnwerily vnfained ever leſt harme diſtained well worthineſſe trouth ground mirrour goodlihedde wit apollo ſtone ſikerneſſe vertue roote luſtie finder hedde whiche ſorrowe fro dedde iwis love beſt ſo doeth good thrift ſo ever ſhould ithanken god love bliſſe bath ginne thanked ye lorde love right life inne flemen maner vice ſinne doeth ſo vertue entende daie daie amende ſo yt ſaieth love vice thraldome though fele diſtreſſe either enuious right nice vnmightie ſhreudneſſe loven ſoch maner folke geſſe diffamen love nothing know ſpeaken bent never bowe ye sunne worſe kind right though man febleneſſe iyen maie endure ſe bright love worſt wretch crien wele worth yt may ſorowe drien thy hath hedde verre fro caſt ſtones ware werre mine harte might ſaied woll love vnto laſt owne dere harte mine owne knight whiche mine harte growen ſo faſt ſhall ever laſt dredde firſt love begin wote well perill ſong right y• word ſhe ſtent therewithall nece qd creſeide made ſong ſo good entent antigone anſwerde anon ſaide madame iwis goodlieſt maide great eſtate toune troie led life moſte honour ioie forſothe ſo ſemeth ſong qd tho creſeide gan therewith ſike ſaied lorde ſoche bliſſe emong theſe lover faire endite ye wiſſe qd freſhe antigone white folke live ne con well bliſſe love diſcrive wene ye every wretche wote parfite bliſſe love naie iwis wenen love one hote waie waie wote nothing men mote asken ſainctes ought faire heven tell aske fendes foule hell creſeide vnto y• purpoſe naught anſwerde ſaied iwis woll night faſt every worde yt ſhe herde gan printen harte faſt aie gan love laſſe agaſt erſt ſinken harte ſhe waxe ſomewhat able conuarte day honour heaven iye night foe clepe thee ſonne gan weſtren faſt dounward wrie day courſe ironne white thing woxen al dimme donne lacke light ſterres apere ſhe folke went ifere liked gon reſt voided voiden ought ſaied ſlepen well leſte woman ſone till hedde brought whan al huſt lay ſhe ſtill thought thing maner wiſe rehearce needeth ye wiſe nightingale vpon cedre grene vnder chamber wall ſhe laie full loude ſong ayen mone ſhene paraventure birdes wiſe laie love made harte freſhe gaie herkened ſhe ſo long good entent till laſt dedde ſleepe hent ſhe ſlept anon right tho met egle fethered white bone vnder breſt long clawes iſet harte rent anon harte breſt gon ſhe nouȝt agroſe ne nothing ſmart forth flieth hart left hart let ſlepe tale holde troilus paleis ridden fro ſcarmiſhe tolde chamber ſate hath abidden till two thre meſſengers yeden pandarus ſoughten full faſt til found brought ye laſt pandarus came leaping one ſaied thus hath well ibete day ſwerdes ſlong ſtones troilus hath caught hete gan yape ſaied lord ye ſwete riſe let v ſoupe go reſte anſwerde thee leſte haſt goodly might ſped hem fro ſouper bedde every wight doore dight whider liſt vpon waie ſped troilus thought harte bledde wo till heard ſome tiding ſaied frende ſhall wepe ſing qd pandarus ſtill let ſlepe doe thy hoode thine nedes ſpedde choſe thou wolt ſing daunce lepe ſhort wordes thou ſhalt trowe sir nece woll doen well thee love thee beſt god trothe lacke purſute marre thy ſlothe thus ferforth thy werk begon fro daie daie till daie morow love frendſhip thee therfore hath ſhe laid faith borow algate foote hameled thy ſorow ſhould lenger ſermon holde ye heard tolde right flour ye cold night icloſed ſtoupen ſtalkes lowe redreſſen hem ayen sunne bright ſpreden kinde courſe rowe right ſo gan tho iyen vp throwe troilus ſaid venus dere thy might thy grace iheried pandarus held vp honds ſaid lorde thine hole broken bond thouſande troy ſo yave eche god ſo wi ſave ne might ſo gladen lo mine harte ſpredeth ſo ioye woll ſtarte lord ſhal doen ſhal liven ſhall next dere harte ſe ſhall long time away driven till thou ayen fro thou maieſt anſwere abide abide hangeth necke ſothe ſaine great diſeaſe abideth paine eaſily love marte qd pandarus every thing hath time long abide till night departe alſo ſiker thou lieſt god toforne woll prime thy werke ſomewhat ſhall ſay ſome wight charge lay parde god wot ever yet ben ready thee ſerve night fained emforthe wit doen thy luſt ſhal al might doe ſhall ſaine fare aright thou nilte wite thy ſelfe care nought along thine evill fare wote well thou wiſer art thouſand fold thou god helpe ſo would vtterly right mine owne hond write letter would tellen farde amiſſe beſeech routh help thy ſelf leave ſlouth ſelfe ſhall therewith gone thou woſt worthe thou vpon courſer right anone ye hardely right thy beſt gere ride forth y• place naught ne thou ſhalt find v may ſitting ſome window ſtreet looking thee liſt mayeſt thou v ſalve vpon make thou thy countenaunce thy life beware faſt eſchue tarien ought god ſhild v fro miſchaunce ride forth thy way hold thy governaunce ſhall ſpeake thee ſomewhat trow thou art gone doe thine ear glow touching thy letter thou art wiſe inough wot thou nilte deigneliche endite make theſe argument tough ne ſcriveiniſhe craftely thou write beblotte thy teares eke alite thou write goodly word ſoft though good rehearſe oft though beſt harpour vpon live would beſt ſouned iolly harpe ever finger five touch aye ſtrong aye warble harpe nailes pointed never ſo ſharpe ſhould make every wight dull heare glee ſtrokes full ne iombre eke diſcordaunt thing ifere thus vſen tearmes phiſicke love tearmes hold thy matere forme alway doe like painter would paint pike aſſes foot headed ape cordeth ſo yape counſaile liked well vnto troilus dredefull lover ſaied ala dere brother pandarus aſhamed write amis leaſt mine innocence ſaied amis ſhe nolde diſpite receive dead might nothing weive pandare anſwerde thee leſt ſay let therewith gone lord formed eaſt weſt hope bring anſwere anone right hond thou nilte none let ſorrie mote live ayenſt thy luſt helpeth thee thrive qd troilus depardieux iche aſſent sith thee liſt woll ariſe write bliſfull god pray iche good entent voiage letter ſhall endite ſpeed thou minerva white yeve thou witte letter deviſe ſet doun wrote right wiſe firſt gan right ladie call heart life luſt ſorowes leche bliſſe eche theſe tearmes ſuch caſe ye lover ſeche full humble wiſe ſpeche gan recommaund vnto grace tell asketh mokell ſpace full lowly praied nought wroth though follie hardie write ſaied love made el muſt die pitouſly gan mercie crie ſaied lied full loud himſelfe little worth laſſe coud yt ſhe would conning excuſed little eke dradde ſo vnworthineſſe aye accuſed gan tell wo endleſſe withouten ho ſaid would trouth alway hold redde gan letter fold ſalt teares gan bathe rubie ſignet ſette vpon wexe deliverliche rathe therewith thouſand time er lette kiſt tho letter ſhette ſayd letter bliſfull deſtine thee ſhapen ladie ſhall thee ſee pandare tooke letter betime morrow neecis pallaice ſtert faſt ſwore paſſed prime gan yape ſayd iwis hert freſh although ſore ſmert may ſleepe never mayes morrow iollie woe luſtie ſorrow creſeide ſhe vncle heard dreadfull heart deſirous heare cauſe comming thus anſweard faith mine vncle qd ſhe deare manner wind guideth tell v iolly woe penaunce farre forth ye put love daunce god qd hop alway behinde laugh thought heart breſt qd pandarus looke alway ye finde game mine hood herkeneth leſt right come y• toun geſt greeke • ſpie telleth new thinges come tell new tidinges garden go ye ſhall heare privily long ſermoun wenten arm arm ifere gardin fro chamber doun ſo farre ſoun ſpake man heren might ſayd thus letter plight lo holly free recommaundeth lowly grace ſent letter aviſeth ye han ſpace ſome goodly anſweare purchace helpe god ſo plainely ſaine may long liven paine full dredefully tho gan ſhe ſtonde ſtill tooke humble chere gan chaunge ſayd ſcripe bill love god toucheth ſuch matere ne bring none alſo vncle dere mine eſtate regard pray luſt ſhould ſay looketh reaſonable letteth favour ne ſlouth ſain ſooth covenable mine eſtate god trouth take routh harming ſelfe repreve beare ayen ye leve pandarus gan ſtare ſayd greateſt wonder ever ſaw let nice fare death mote ſmiten thunder citie ſtondeth yonder would letter vnto bring take harm liſt thus make thus ye faren well nigh ſome moſt deſireth ſerve ye retch leaſt become whether live elſe ſterve ever may deſerve refuſe qd hent faſt boſome letter doune thraſt ſaid caſt away anon folk may ſeen gauren v twey qd ſhe abide till gon gan ſmile ſaid eme pray anſwere liſt ſelfe purvey truely woll letter write woll qd ſo ye endite therewith ſhe lough ſaid go dine gan himſelfe yapen faſt ſayd nece ſo great pine love everich day faſt gan beſt yapes forth caſt made ſo laugh follie ſhe laughter weent die ſhe comen y• hall eme qd ſhe woll go dine anon gan ſome woman call ſtreight chamber gan ſhe gone buſineſſe one amongs thing drede full prively letter rede aviſed word word every line found lacke ſhe thoght coud good vp put went dine pandarus ſtudie ſtood ere ware ſhe tooke hood ſaid ye caught ere ye wiſt vouchſafe qd liſt tho weſhen ſet doun ete noone fall ſlighly pandarus gan draw window nye ſtrete ſaid nece hath araied thus yonder houſe ſtant aforeyene v houſe qd ſhe gan behold knew well whoſe told fellen forth ſpeech thing ſmale ſaten window twey pandarus ſaw time vnto tale ſaw well folke awey nece mine tell qd prey liketh letter ye wot thereon trouth therewith roſy hewed tho woxe ſhe gan hum ſaid ſo trow aquite well god love qd ſelfe medes woll letter ſow held honds vp ſat know good nece never ſo lite yeue labour ſow plite ye ſo writen qd ſhe tho eke ſhould ſay nay nece qd pandare ſay ſo yet leaſt thonketh pray good doth dey love nece dere refuſeth time praiere depardieux qd ſhe god leve wele god helpe ſo firſt letter ever wrote ye dele cloſet aviſe better went alone gan heart vnfetter disdaines priſon lite ſet doune gan letter write tell ſhort mine entent theffect ferre vnderſtond thonked well ment towards holden hond nolde ne make ſeluen bond love ſuſter pleaſe would aye faine done hart eaſe ſhette pandare gone ſat looked ſtrete doune ſhe ſet ſtone iaſper vpon quiſſhen gold ibete ſaid wiſely helpe god grete never thing paine write ye reſtraine tooke thonked ſeide god wot thing full often lothe begonne commeth end good nece mine creſeide ye hard ben iwonne ought glad god yonder ſonne men ſaith impreſſions light full lightly ben aye readie flight ye han plaied tiraunt long hard hart grave ſtint ye lenger hong woulden ye forme daunger ſave haſteth done joy truſteth well long idone hardneſſe cauſeth diſpite full often diſtreſſe right declared matere lo troilus right ſtretes end came riding tenth ſomme ifere ſoftely thiderward gan bend ſate way wend paleis ward pandare aſpide ſaid nece iſee commeth ride flie ſeeth v ſuppoſe leaſt may thinken ye eſchue nay nay qd ſhe woxe red roſe gan humbly ſalue dredefull chere oft hewes mue vp looke debonairely caſt becked pandare forth paſt god wot ſat horſe aright goodly beſeene like day god wot like manly knight ſhould dretche tell array creſeide theſe thing ſey tell ſhort liked ifere perſon aray looke chere goodly manner gentilleſſe well never ſith ſhe borne ne ſhe ſuch routh diſtreſſe ſo ſhe hath hard ben beforne god hope ſhe hath caught thorn ſhall nat pull next wike god ſend mo ſuch thornes pike pandare ſtood faſt felt iron hot began ſmite ſaid nece pray heartely tell ſhall asken alite woman death wite withouten gilt lack routh well done qd ſhe nay trouth god helpe ſo qd ye ſay ſooth ye feelen well ſelfe nought lie lo yonde rideth qd ſhe ye ſo dooth well qd pandare told thrie let nice ſhame follie ſpeake eaſing hert let nicete nat ſmert theron heauen done conſidering thing may nat ſhame eke ſoone graunten ſo great liberte plainly entent ſaid ſhe love vnwiſt ſhe might guerdon himwith nothing ſight pandare thought ſhall nat ſo may nice opinion shall nat ben holden fully yeares two ſhould make long ſermon muſt aſſent concluſion time eve well roſe tooke leve way faſt homeward ſpedde right ioy felt heart daunce troilus found alone abedde lay done theſe lover traunce betwixen hope derke deſperaunce pandare right comming ſong ſaith lo ſomewhat bring ſaid bedde ſo ſoone yburied thus friend qd troilus nay help ſo moone q pandarus thou ſhalt vp riſe ſee charme ſent right thee healen thee thine acceſſe thou forthwith thy buſineſſe ye might god qd troilus pandarus gan letter take ſaid parde god hath holpen v light look theſe blake often gan heart glad quake troilus gan rede word yave hope drede finally tooke beſt ſhe wrote ſomewhat beheld thought might heart reſt covered ſhe word vnder ſheld thus worthy part held hope pandarus beheſt great wo foryede leſt may day ſelven ſee wood cole kindleth fire right ſo encreaſe hope therewith full oft encreaſeth eke deſire oke commeth little ſpire letter y• ſhe ſent encreaſen gan deſire brent wherfore ſay alway day night troilus gan deſiren erſt hope might preſen pandarus lore writen ſorowes ſore fro day day let nought refreide pandare ſomewhat wrot ſeide alſo obſervaunces till lover longeth caas dice turned chaunces either glad ſaid ala held geſtes aye paas ſuch anſwers day ſorry either glad pandare alway recours pitouſly gan aye plaine beſought rede ſome ſocours pandarus ſaw wood paine wext well nigh dead routh ſooth ſaine buſily heart caſt wo ſleen faſt ſaid lord friend brother dere god wot thy diſeaſe doth wo wolt thou ſtinten wofull chere trouth ere day two god toforne yet ſhall ſhape ſo thou ſhalt come certaine place thou maiſt thy ſelf praien grace certainly thou woſt ben expert love ſay one theſe thing forthereth moſt man le • ſer pray ſiker place wo bewray good heart mote ſome routh impreſſe heare ſee guiltleſſe diſtreſſe peraventure thinkeſt thou though ſo kind would done begin manner routh vpon wo saith daunger nay thou ſhalt never win ruleth heart ghoſt within though ſhe bend yet ſhe ſtont rote effect vnto hote think ayen y• ſturdy oke men hacketh oft none received hath happy falling ſtroke great ſweight doth come one done theſe great rock theſe miln ſtones ſwifter courſe cometh thing y• wight diſcendeth done thing light rede boweth doun every blaſt full lightly ceſſe wind woll ariſe ſo nill oke caſt needeth nought long thee forviſe men ſhall reioyſen great empriſe atchieved well ſtant withouten dout men ben lenger thereabout troilus tell thee leſt thing ſhall asken thee thy brother thou loveſt beſt thy heart privite iwis brother deiphebus tho qd qd pandare ere houres twiſe twelve ſhall eaſe vnwiſt himſelve let alone worken may qd deiphebus went tho lord great friend ben aye save troilus man loved ſo tell ſort withouten word mo qd pandarus pray ye friend cauſe toucheth yes parde qd deiphebus welthou woteſt ever may god tofore nere man love moſt brother troilus ſay wherefore ſith day bore na ne never mo ben thinke ayenſt thing might thee forthinke pandare gan thank ſeide lo ſir lady toun nece called creſeide ſome men would done oppreſſioun wrongfully poſſeſſioun wherefore lordſhip beſeech ben friend withouten ſpeech deiphebus anſwerd nat thou ſpeakeſt thus ſtraungly creſeide friend ſaid yes needeth qd deiphebus hardely ſpeke truſteth well y• woll champion ſpore yerde ne raught nat though foe herde tel thou woſt matere might beſt availen lette ſee qd pandarus ye lord ſo dere woulden honour praien morrow lo ſhe came unto plaint deviſe adverſaries would agriſe durſt praien chargen ſo great travaile ſome brother mighten cauſe bet availe wore well ſhe might never faile ben holpen inſtaunce friend governaunce deiphebus y• comen kind honour bounty conſent anſwerd ſhall done find yet greater helpe mine entent woldeſt thou ſaine heleine ſent ſpeake trow beſt ſhe may leden paris leſt hector y• lord brother needeth nat praien friend heard time eke speaken creſeide ſuch honour may ſaine bet ſuch hap hath ſhe needeth nat helpes crave ſhall ſuch right woll speake thou thy ſelfe alſo troilus behalfe pray u dine sit ſhall done qd pandarus tooke leave never gan fine neces houſe ſtreight line came found fro meat ariſe ſet doun ſpake right wiſe ſaid god ſo ronne lo nece mine ſee ye nat ſwete whete ye thanke conne ye ware falſe poliphete eftſoones plete bring advocacy new qd ſhe chaunged hew dretche done wrong ſhall done ala yet himſelfe nothing would retche nere antenor eneas ben friend ſuch manner caas love god mine uncle dere force let ifere withouten ynough u nay qd pandare ſhall nothing ſo ben right deiphebus hector mine lord mo ſhortly maked hem fo thrift ſhall never win aught ſo begin caſten beſt done deiphebus owne courteſie came pray proper perſone hold morrow companie dinner ſhe nolde denie goodly gan prayer obey thonked went upon wey done pandare anone tell ſhort forth gan wend troilus ſtill ſtone thing told word end deiphebus gan blend ſaid time ye conne bere thee well morow wonne ſpeke pray pitouſly complain let nat nice ſhame drede ſlouth sometime man mote tell owne pain beleeve ſhe woll thee routh thou ſhalt ben ſaved thy faith trouth well wot thou art drede lay arede thou thinkeſt ſhould cheres moſten folke eſpie love fare amis yet lever unwiſt ſorrow die thinke nat ſo thou doſt great follie right founden manere ſleight coveren thy chere thou ſhalt gone overnight blive vnto deiphebus houſe thee play thy maladie away bet drive thou ſeemeth ſicke ſooth ſay soone thy bed thee lay ſay thou maiſt lenger endure lie right bide thine aventure say thy fever wont thee take ſame time laſt till morow let ſee well thou canſt make parde ſicke ſorrow go farwell venus borow hope thou purpoſe hold ferme thy grace ſhe ſhall fully conferme qd troilus iwis thou needleſſe counſaileſt ſickeliche faine ſicke earneſt doubtleſſe well nigh ſterve paine qd pandarus thou ſhalt better plaine haſt leſſe need counterfete demeth men hot yt ſeeth ſwete lo hold thee thy triſte cloſe shall well deere vnto bow drive therewith tooke leave ſoftly troilus paleis went blive glad ne never live pandarus rede gan aſſent deiphebus houſe night went nedeth tellen chere deiphebus vnto brother made axis ſickeliche manere men gone clothes lade laid men would glade nought held forth aye wiſe ye han heard pandare ere deviſe certaine ere troilus leide deiphebus praied night ben friend helping creſeide god wot graunted anon right ben full friend might ſuch need praien thenne bidden wood man renne morow came nighen gan time mealtide faire queene heleine shope ben houre prime deiphebus ſhe nolde faine ſuſter homely ſooth ſaine came dinner plaine entent god pandare wiſt ment came eke creſeide innocent antigone nece tarbe alſo flie prolixitie beſt love god let v faſt go right theffect withouten tale mo folke aſſembled place let v ſalvings pace great honour hem deiphebus certaine fedde hem well might like evermo ala refraine good brother troilus ſike lithe yet therewithall gan ſike pained glade hem might chere good made complained eke heleine ſickneſſe faithfully pitie every wight gan wexen ax leche anon ſaid manere men curen folke charme wol thee lere ſate one liſt nat teche thought yet beſt could ben leche complaint gonnen preiſe folk yet ſome wight hath begon preiſe man preiſe reiſe thouſand fold yet higher ſonne lord conne pandarus would afferme nought forgate praiſing conferme herd thing fair creſeid well inough every word gan notifie ſober chere heart lough ne would glorifie mowen ſuch knight done live die paſſe leaſt ye long idwell fine ever tell time came fro dinner riſe hem ought ariſen everychone gane deviſe pandarus brake ſpeech anone ſaid deiphebus woll ye gone erſt preide ſpeaken nedes creſeide heleine hond held tooke firſt tale ſaid go blive goodly creſeide ſhe beheld ſaid ioves let never thrive doth harm reve ſone live yeve ſorrow ſhall rue may folke true tell thou thy nice caſe qd deiphebus pandarus thou canſt beſt tell lord lady ſtant thus ſhould lenger qd dwell rong hem proces like bell vpon foe hight poliphete hainous men might ſpete anſwerd ech worſe hem poliphete gonnen thus warien honged ſuch one brother ſo ſhall ne may nought varien ſhould lenger tale tarien plaineliche one highten ben frend yt ever mighten spake heleine ſaid pandarus wot aught lord brother mater meane hector wote troilus ſaid ye woll ye thinketh thus ſith troilus good ye would aſſent told ſelfe ere ſhe went wol y• grefe hart becauſe lo ſhe lady woll right ſtart wete anone iwis ſleepe woll aught lept ſaid ere god thy ſoul brought thy bere ſmilen gan tho troilus pandarus without reckoning went anon heleine deiphebus ſaid hem ſo tarying ne preaſe woll well ye bring creſeide lady may enduren woll well ye wote chamber lite folke may lightly make warme looketh ye woll wite bring preaſe y• might done harme diſeaſen better arme yet bette ſhe bid till oft ſoonis looke ye knowen donis ſay beſt know wight ne wend ye twey cannot throw rehearſe caſe vnlike ſhe ſey ſhe may one prey ben good lord ſhort take leve may mokell eaſe reve eke ſhe ſtraunge woll forbere eaſe dare nat eke thing toucheth nat woll tell wote well right ſecret townes prow knew nothing entent without croilus went heleine goodly ſoft wiſe gan ſalve womanly play ſaied iwis ye mote algate ariſe faire brother hole pray gan arme right ſhoulder lay wit recomfort ſhe beſt could ſhe gan diſport qd ſhe beſeke dere brother deiphebus love god ſo doeth pandare eke good lord friend right hartely vnto creſeide certainly received wrong wot well pandare caſe well bet declare pandarus gan new tong affile caſe rehearſe anone ſaied ſoone qd troilus ſoone may gone wol right faint might ben one god trouth cauſe ſuſtene good thrift ye qd helein ye quene qd pandarus ſhe may take leave ere ſhe go el god forbid tho qd ſhe vouchſafe ſo word qd troilus ye two deiphebus ſuſter lefe dere ſpeake matere aviſed rede better found hap bed hedde copie treatiſe letter hector ſent asken rede ſuch man worthy ben dede wote naught griſly wiſe praied hem anone aviſe deiphebus gan letter vnfold earneſt great ſo heleine queene roming outward faſt gonne behold dounward ſteire herbor greene ilke thing redden hem betwene largely mountenaunce houre goone reden poure let hem rede tourne anone pandarus gan full ſoft prie well gan gone great chamber hie ſaied god ſave companie come nece mine lady queene heleine abideth eke lord tweine riſe take nece antigone liſt force hardely laſſe preaſe bet come forth looke ye thonken humbly hem three ye may goodly time iſee taketh hem leave leaſt long reſtes bireave innocent pandarus entent qd tho creſeide go vncle dere arme arme inward ſhe went aviſing well word chere pandarus earneſtfull manere saied folke god love pray stinteth right ſoftly play aviſeth folke ben within plite one god amend inward thus full ſoftely begin nece coniure highly defend halfe ſoule v ſend vertue corounes twaine slea nat man yt hath paine fie deuill thinke plite lieth come anone think ſuch taried tide loſt ni woll ye ſaine ye one secondly yet deuineth none vpon two come ye conne folke blent lo y• time wonne titering purſute delay folke devine wegging ſtre though ye would han merry day dare ye nat ſhe ſhe spake ſuch word thus looked leaſt time loſt dare nat deale come therfore bringeth heale ye lover ben troilus nat cankedort lay might wiſpring hem thoght lord right renneth ſort fully die anone comforte firſt time ſhould pray love mightie god ſhall ſay explicit liber secundus blisfull light bemes clere adorneth third heaven faire ſonnes lefe ioues doughter dere pleaſaunce love goodly debonaire gentle heart aye ready repaire cauſe heale gladneſſe iheried thy might thy goodneſſe heaven hell earth ſalt ſee felt thy might well diſcerne man▪ beaſt fiſh herbe grene tree fele time vapour eterne god loveth love woll naught werne world life creature withouten love worth may endure ye ioues firſt thilke affect glade thing liven commenden amorous hem made mortall thing liſt aye ye yeve hem love eaſe aduerſite thouſand formes doune hem ſent love yearth liſt hent ye fiers mar appeaſen ire liſt ye maken heart digne algates hem ye woll ſet fire dreden ſhame vice reſigne ye doen curteis freſh benigne high low wight entendeth ioies yt hath might ſendeth ye holden reigne houſe vnitie ye ſoothfaſt cauſe friendſhip ben alſo ye knowen thilke couered qualitie thing folke wondren ſo nat conſtrue may go loveth loveth fiſh nat y• commeth ye folke law ſet vniuerſe know hem lover ſo ſtriveth hath y• werſe ladie bright thy benignite reuerence hem ſerven thee whoſe clerke ſo teacheth deviſe joy felt thy ſerviſe yea naked heart ſentement hilde ſhew thy ſweetneſſe caliope thy voice preſent need ſeeſt thou nat diſtreſſe mote tell anon right gladneſſe troilus venus herying nede hath god bring incipit liber tertius lay meane troilus recording leſſon manere mafey thought thus woll ſay thus thus woll plaine vnto lady dere word good ſhall chere nill nat foryetten wiſe god leve werken deviſe lord ſo hart gan quappe hearing come ſhort ſike pandarus ledde lappe came nere gan curtein pike ſaied god doe bote ſike see comen viſite lo ſhe death wite therewith ſeemed wept almoſt qd troilus ſo routhfully whether wo mighty god thou woſt ſee nat truely sir qd creſeide pandare ye ſweet hart ala may nat riſe kneele honour ſome wiſe dreſſed vpward ſhe right tho gan honds ſoft vpon ley love god doe ye ſo qd ſhe eye ſey sir comen cauſes twey firſt thonke lordſhip eke continuaunce would beſeke troilus heard ladie pray lordſhip wox neither quick ne dedde ne might word ſhame ſay although men ſhoulden ſmiten hedde lord ſo wox ſodaineliche redde ſir leſſon wende conne praien wit ironne creſeide aſpied well ynough ſhe wiſe loved never ye laſſe nere apert made tough bold ſing foole maſſe ſhame gan ſomwhat paſſe reaſons may rime hold woll tell teachen bookes old chaunged voice right drede voice eke quoke thereto manere goodly abaſht hewes rede pale vnto creſeide ladie dere looke doun caſt humble iyolden chere lo alder firſt word aſtart twice mercy mercy ſweet hart ſtint might bring next word god wote faithfully konning ben god ſo ſoule ſave ſhall till wofull wight grave though dare ne vnto plaine wi ſuffer laſſe paine thus much ah womanliche wife may bring diſpleaſe ſhall wreke vpon mine owne life right ſoone trow hart eaſe death heart may appeaſe ſens y• ye han heard ſomewhat ſey retch never ſoone dey therewith manly ſorrow behold might made hart ſtone rew pandare wept water would poked ever nece new new ſaied wo begon heart true love god make thing end ſlea u one ere ye wend qd ſhe god trouth nat ye wilne ſey eye qd yt ye routh god love doeth nat dey thus qd ſhe woll prey tell fine entent yet wiſt never well ment mean ſweet hart dere qd troilus goodly freſh free ſtreames eyen ſo clere ye ſhoulden ſometime friendly ſee agreen may ben hee withouten braunch vice wiſe trouth alway ſerviſe lady right cheefe reſort witte diligence right liſt comfort vnder yerde egall mine offence death breake defence ye digne ſo much honour commaunden aught hour ben humble true secret paine patient ever deſiren freſhly new ſerven ben aye like diligent good heart holly talent receiven well ſore ſmart lo meane mine owne ſweet hart qd pandarus lo hard requeſt reaſonable lady werne nece mine natall ioves feeſt god ye ſhould ſterve yerne heren wel man wol nothing yerne honour ſeene almoſt ſterve ben ſo loth ſuffer ſerve ſhe gan eyen caſt full eaſily full debonairely aviſing hied faſt never word ſaied ſoftely mine honour ſafe woll well truely ſuch forme deviſe receiven fully ſerviſe beſeeching god love would honour trouth gentilleſſe well meane eke meanen well mine honour wit buſineſſe aye kepe may doen gladneſſe henceforth iwis nill faine beth hole lenger ye ne plaine natheleſſe warne qd ſhe king ſonne although ye iwis ye ſhall ſoverainte love right caſe ne nill forbeare ye doen amis wrath ye ſerve cheriſhen right ye deſerve ſhortly dere hart knight beth glad draweth luſtineſſe ſhall truely withall full might bitter tournen ſweetneſſe ſhe may doe gladneſſe every wo ye ſhall recover bliſſe armes tooke gan kiſſe fell pandarus knee eyen heaven threw held honds hie immortall god qd maieſt dien cupide meane maieſt glorifie venus thou maieſt maken melodie withouten hond ſeemeth yt toune miracle iche eche bell ſoune ho mattere folke woll comen anone letter redde lo hem conjure thee creſeide one two thou troilus thou maiſt gone mine houſe ye ben warning full well ſhall ſhapen comming eaſeth hart right ynough let ſee ſhall beare bell ſpeak love aright therwith lough leiſer tell qd troilus long ſhall dwell ere doen qd thou maieſt riſe thing ſhall right liſt deviſe heleine alſo deiphebus tho comen upward right y• ſtaires end lord ſo tho gan gronen troilus brother ſuffer blend qd pandarus time wend take nece mine leave hem three let hem ſpeak commeth forth tooke leave hem full thriftely ſhe well could reverence vnto full didden hartely wonder well ſpeaken abſence praiſing excellence governaunce wit manere commendeden joy let wend unto owne place tourne unto troilus againe gan full lightly letter pace deiphebus garden ſeine heleine would feine delivered ben ſaied leſt ſlepe tale reſt heleine kiſt tooke leave blive deiphebus eke home went every wight pandarus faſt may drive troilus tho came line right paillet glad night troilus lay merry chere tale well hem ifere every wight voided two dores faſt iſhet tell ſhort withouten word mo pandarus without let vp roſe beddes ſide ſet gan ſpeaken ſober wiſe troilus ſhall deviſe mine alderleveſt lord brother dere god wot thou ſate ſo ſore thee ſaw ſo languiſhing love thy wo woxe alway might lore ever ſithen doen buſineſſe bring thee joy diſtreſſe brought ſuch plite thou woſt y• thou ſtondeſt way faren well ſay boſt woſt thou ſhame ſay thee begon gamen play never doen ſhall eft tho thouſand fold brother ſay thee becomen betwixen game earneſt ſuch meane maken woman unto men comen ſay nat thou woſt well meane thee nece vice cleane fully made thy gentilleſſe triſt ſhall ben right thy ſelfe liſt god y• woteth take witneſſe never covetiſe wrought abredge diſtreſſe wch welnie thou dideſt thought good brother thee ought god love kepe blame sin thou art wiſe ſave alway name well thou woſt name yet emongs y• people ſaith halowed man unbore dare well ſwere ever wiſt ſhe amis wo cauſe may thinken ſhe nece dere eme traitour eke ifere wer wiſt yt mine engine mine nece iput fantaſie doen thy luſt holly thine world would upon crie ſay worſt trecherie caſe ever begon ſhe fordone thou right nought iwon wherfore ere woll gone paas yet eft thee beſeech fully ſay privete go u caas ſaine thou u never wray wroth though thee oft pray holden ſecre ſuch high mattere skilfull thou woſt well praiere thinke wt wo hath betid ere making avauntes men rede miſchaunce world yet fro day day right wicked dede theſe wiſe clerkes ben dede ever proverbed u young firſt vertue kepe toung nere wilne abredge diffuſion ſpeech could almoſt thouſand old ſtories thee alledge woman loſt falſe fooles boſt proverbes canſt thy ſelfe inow woſt ayenſt vice blabbe ſaied men ſooth often gabbe tongue ala ſo often beforne haſt thou made many lady bright hew saied welaway day borne many maiden ſorrow new part untrew men yelpe brought preve kind none avauntour leve avauntour lier one thus poſe woman graunt love ſaieth woll ſhe none ſworne holden ſecree tell two three iwis vauntour leſt lier eke breake beheſt looke blame maner folk wt ſhall clepe hem hem avaunt woman name yet behight hem never ne ne know hem mine old hat wonder ſo god ſend hele though woman dreden u men dele ſay miſtruſt ne wiſe men fooles nice harme world well follie oft mallice well wote wiſe folke vice woman dredeth ſhe well aviſed wiſe fooles harme chaſtiſed purpoſe leve brother dere thing ſaied mind keep thee cloſe good chere thy day thou ſhalt true find ſhall thy proceſſe ſet ſuch kind god toforne ſhall thee ſuffiſe ſhall right thou wolt deviſe well wote thou meaneſt well parde therefore dare fully undertake thou woſt eke thy lady graunted thee day ſet charter make good night may lenger wake bid ſith thou art bliſſe god ſend death ſome liſſe might tellen halfe joy feſte ſoule troilus tho felt hearing theffect pandarus beheſte old wo made heart ſwelt gan tho joy waſten melt richeſſe ſighes ſore one fled felt hem right ſo theſe holts theſe hayis han winter dead ben dry reveſten hem grene may every luſty liſteth pley right ſelfe wiſe ſooth ſey woxe ſuddainly heart full joy gladder never man troy gan looke pandarus caſt full ſoberly friendly ſee ſaied friend aprill laſt well thou woſt remember thee nigh death wo thou found thou diddeſt thy buſineſſe know cauſe diſtreſſe thou woſt long forbare ſay thee art man beſt triſt perill none thee bewray wiſt well tell thee liſt sith ſo loth thy ſelfe wiſt durſt mo tellen matere quake wight may u natheleſſe god thee ſwere liſt may world governe lye achilles ſpere mine heart cleave life eterne mortall late yerne would bewray durſt ſhould conne good god made ſonne rather die would determine thinketh ſtocked priſon wretchedneſſe filth vermine captive cruell king agamenmon temple toun vpon god woll thee ſwere morow day thee liketh thou haſt ſo much idoen ne may nevermore deſerve know well might thee thouſand time morow ſterve woll thee ſerve right thy ſlave whether ſo thou wend evermore unto life end mine hart thee beſeech never thou deme ſuch folly ſhall ſaine thought thy ſpeech thou doſt companie ſhould wenen baudrie wood leud ſo wote well parde goeth gold richeſſe ſuch meſſages call ye liſt thou doſt call gentleneſſe compaſſion fellowſhip triſt depart ſo wide wiſt diverſitie required betwixen thing like lered thou know thinke ne wene ſervice ſhame iape faire ſiſter polexene caſſandre helein frape ſhe never ſo faire well iſhape tell thou wilt everychone thine let alone ſith yt thou haſt done ſervice life ſave none hope mede love god great empriſe performe moſt nede high low withouten drede woll alway thine heſtes kepe good night let u ſlepe thus held hem ech well apaied world ne might bet amend morrow araied ech owne need gan entend troilus though fire brend ſharpe deſire hope pleaſaunce forgate good governaunce himſelf manhood gan reſtrain ech rakell deed ech unbridled chere liven ſooth ſaine ne ſhould wiſt word manere yt ment touching matere every wight ferre cloud ſo wiſe well diſſimulen coud deviſe life full might day martes high ſerviſe ſaine armes knight part long night lay thought might ſerve lady beſt thanke deſerve nill ſweare although lay ſoft thought na ſomwhat diſeaſed ne tourned pillowes oft would miſſed ben eaſed ſuch caſe men nat alway pleaſed naught wote deeme poſſibilite certaine purpoſe go written geſte ſaw lady ſometime alſo ſpake yt ſhe durſt leſte aviſe beſt appointeden full warely need durſt would proceed ſpoken ſo ſhort wiſe ſuch awaite alway ſuch feare leaſt wight divinen deviſe would hem two lay eare world ſo lefe hem ne cupide would hem grace ſend maken ſpeech right end thilke little yt ſpake wrought wiſe ghoſt tooke aye ſuch hede ſeemed wiſt ſhe thought withouten word ſo nede bid aught doen aught forbede ſhe thought yt love come late joy opened yate ſhortly proceſſe pace well werke word beſet ſo full ſtood lady grace twenty thouſand time ere ſhe let thonked god ſhe ever met could governe ſuch ſerviſe world ne might bet deviſe ſhe found ſo diſcreet ſecret ſuch obeiſaunce well ſhe felt wall ſteel ſhield every diſpleaſaunce good governaunce wiſe ſhe afered meane ferre aught ben requered pandarus quicke alway fire ever ilike preſt diligent eaſe friend ſet deſire ſhone aye fro ſent letter bare troilus abſent never man friendes nede ne bare bet withouten drede peraventure ſome man waiten would every word ſond looke chere troilus rehearcen ſhould unto lady dere trow long thing wight ſtant ſuch disjoint word every looke point forſooth herd done ere ſtory none ne man wene though would could iwis ſome epiſtle hem betwene would ſaith mine autor wel contene ny half boke liſt write ſhould line endite great effect ſay thus ſtonden concord quiete ilke two creſeide troilus told time ſwete save onely often might mete ne leiſure ſpeeches fulfell befell right ſhall tell pandarus ever might right fine ſhall ſpeake bringen houſe ſome night faire nece troilus ifere leiſer high matere touching love y• full bound doubt time found great deliberation every thing thereto might availe forne caſt put execution nether left coſt ne travaile come hem liſt hem ſhould nothing faile ben aught aſpied wiſt well impoſſible dredeleſſe clere wind every pie every let game well world blind matter fremed tame timber ready frame v lacketh naught yt weten wouldd▪ certaine houre ſhe comen ſhoul troilus purveyaunce knew full waited aye hereupon eke made great ordinaunce found cauſe therwith arraye miſſed night day thought ſerviſe gone done ſacrifice muſt ſoch temple alone wake anſwered apollo firſt ſene holy laurer quake er apollo ſpake tree tellen next whan greek ſhould flie thy let man god forbede pray apollo helpe nede litell done pandare ſhortly ſaine right ſone upon chaunging ye mone whan lightleſſe ye world night twaine welken ſhope raine ſtreight morow unto nece went ye well herde fine entent comen gan anon play wont himſelfe yape finally ſwore gan ſay ſhe ſhould eſcape lenger done gape certainly ſhe muſt leve come ſoupen houſe eve ſhe lough gan firſt excuſe ſaid raineth lo ſhould gone let qd ne ſtonde thus muſe mote ye ſhal come anone laſt hereof fell one el faſt ſwore eere nolde never comen ſhe sone ſhe gan rowne asked troilus ſwore nay towne ſaid nece ſuppoſe durſt never thereof fere rather men might aſpie lever thouſand folde die naught liſt mine auctour fully declare ſhe thought whan ſaid ſo troilus towne ifare ſaid thereof ſoth withouten awaite go graunted ſith beſought nece obeyed ought natheleſſe yet gan ſhe beſech although gone fere beware gofiſſhe people ſpech dremen thing never wel aviſe brought ſaid eme ſens muſt triſt loke al wel liſt ſwore ſtockes ſtones goddes heven dwell el leaver ſoule bone pluto king depe ben hell tantalus ſhould tell whan al wel roſe toke leve ſhe ſouper came whan eve certaine number men faire nece antigone woman nine ten glad trowe yee troilus ſtode might ſee throughout litel window ſtewe ther beſhet ſith midnight mewe vnwiſt every wight pandare point yt ſhe come al ioy al frendes fare eme anon armes hath nome ſouper al ſome whan time full ſofte hem ſet god wot deinte ferre fet ſouper gonnen riſe eaſe well hart full freſh glade wel coude beſt deviſe liken laughen made ſonge ſhe plaide told tale wade laſt every thing hath end toke leave neds would thence wend fortune executrice wierdes influence theſe hevens hie soth vnder god ben hierdes though v beeſtes ben cauſes wrie mene ſhe gan homward hie execute beſide leve goddes wil ſhe muſt bleve bente mone horne pale saturnus iove cancro ioyned ſuch raine heven gan availe every maner woman ſmoky raine feere pandare tho lough ſaid thenne time lady go henne good nece might ever pleaſe thing pray qd mine hart ſo great eaſe dwell al night owne houſe parde trouth ſay nat game wende ſhame creſeide yt could much good halfe world toke hede praire ſens rained al flode thouȝt good chepe may dwel graunt gladly frendes chere thonk grutch abide home go may nat well betide wol qd ſhe mine vncle liefe dere sen liſt skill ſo right glad dwellen ſaid againe would go iwis graunt mercy nece qd tho agame ſothe tell glad ſens liſt dwel thus al wel tho began aright new ioy al feſt againe pandarus goodly might would hied bedde full faine ſaid lord huge raine wether ſleepen rede v ſoone begin nece wote ye woll lay ſhul liggen ferre ſonder ye neither ſhullen dare ſay noiſe raine ne yet thonder god right cloſet yonder wol vtter houſe alone ben wardain woman everichone middle chambre ye ſe shal woman ſlepen wel ſoft ſaid ſhal ſelven ye liggen wel night come oft careth wether aloft wine anone ſo leſt go ſlepe trowe beſt ni hereafter ſone voide dronke travers draw anone gan every wight hath nought done place chambre gone ever ſo ſtereliche rone blewe therwith ſo wonderliche loude wel nigh man heren coude tho pandarus eme right ought woman ſuch moſt ful glad vnto beddes ſide brought toke leave gan ful lowe lout ſaid cloſet dore without right overtwhart woman liggen ye liſt hem ye may ſone call lo ſhe cloſet laid al woman forth ordinaunce bedde ſaid na ſkippen praunce boden go bedde miſchaunce wight ſtering let hem ſlepen abedde pandarus yt wel couth eche adele old daunce every point therin ſaw thing wele thought wold vpon werke begin gan ſtewe dore al ſoft vnpin ſtill ſtone without lenger let troilus adoun right ſet ſhortly point right gone al werke told worde end ſaid make thee redy right anone thou ſhalt heven bliſſe wend blisfull venus thou grace ſend qd troilus never yet dede er ne halfendele drede qd pandarus ne drede thee never dele ſhal right thou wolt deſire thriue night ſhall make • e caſten gruel fire yet bliſful venus night thou enſpire qd troilus wi ſerve ever bet bet ſhall till ſterve venus ful mirth aſpectes badde mar saturne thou combuſte let birth thy father pray al thilke harme diſturne grace glad ayen may turne love thou lovedſt ſhawe mean adon y• bore ſlawe iove eke love faire europe forme bulle away thou fet help mar thou thy blody cope love cipria thou naught ne let phebus think daphne herſelven ſhet vnder ye barke laurer woxe drede yet love help nede mercurie love eke pallas aglauros wroth helpe eke diane beſeke viage nat loth fatall ſuſtren cloth ſhapen deſtine ſponne helpeth werke begonne qd pandarus thou wretched mouces hert art thou agaſt ſo ſhe bite furred cloke thy ſherte folow wol wite bide let gon alite gan vndone trappe troilus brought lappe ſterne winde ſo loude gan rout wight noiſe might laien dore without ful ſikerly ſlepten al ifere pandarus ful ſobre chere goth dore anon withouten lette lay ſoftly ſhette came ayen prively nece awoke asketh goeth owne dere nece qd ne wondreth ne fere nere came ſaid eere worde love god beſech let wight ariſe ſpech way ye comen benedicite qd ſhe vnwiſte hem ſecrete trap dore qd qd tho creſeide let ſome wight call eigh god forbid ſhould ſo fall qd pandarus ye ſuch foly wrought might dementhing never erthoust nat good ſleping hound wake ne yeve wight cauſe devine woman ſlepen al vndertake hem houſe men might mine ſlepen wollen till ſunne ſhine tale brought end vnwiſt right came ſo wol wende nece mine ye ſhul well vnderſtonde qd ſo ye woman demen hold love man honde lefe dere hart call maken howne call mene love mene doth ſelfe ſhame gile wherby tel al ye wote ſelfe wel wight love al fully graunted troilus worthieſt wight one world thereto trouth iplight alone ye nold never falſen ye liven ſhould ſtonte thus yt ſith fro went troilus right platly ſeine gutter privy went chambre come al reine vnwiſt every maner wight certaine save ſelfe wiſely joy faith owe priam troy come ſuch paine diſtreſſe al fully wood ſodainly mote fal woodneſſe god helpe cauſe ſaith tolde frende yt ye ſhould loven one hight horaſt ſorow night ſhal laſt creſeide al wonder herde gan ſodainly hart cold ſighe ſhe ſorowfully anſwerd ala wende ſo ever tale told dere hart woulden nat hold lightly faulſe ala conceites wrong harm done live long horaſte ala falſen troilus know god helpe ſo qd ſhe ala wicked ſpirite told thus certes eme morow ſe ſhal therof full excuſen ever woman like word ſhe gan ful ſore ſike god qd ſhe ſo worldy ſelineſſe clerkes callen falſe felicite ymedled many bitterneſſe ful anguiſhous god wote qd ſhe condicion veine proſperite either joyes comen nat ifere el wight hath hem alway brotil wele mannes joy vnſtable wt wight ſo thou thou play either wote thou joy art mutable wote nat mote ben one tway wot nat may ſay hath joy ſilineſſe ignorance aie derkeneſſe wote ioy tranſitory every joy worldly thing mote flee every time hath memory drede leſing maketh may parfite ſikerneſſe leſe joy ſet mite ſemeth joy worth ful lite wherefore wol define matere truely aught eſpie wele world thou wicked ſerpent ialouſie thou misbeleved enuious folie haſt thou troilus made vntriſt never yet agilte wiſt qd pandarus thus fallen caas vncle mine qd ſhe told doth dere herte thus ala ye wote ye nece mine qd hope al ſhal wel amis ye may quenche al leſt doeth right ſo hold beſt ſhal morow iwis qd ſhe god toforne ſo ſhall ſuffice morow ala faire qd nay nay may nat ſtonden wiſe nece mine writen clerkes wiſe peril dretching drawe nay ſoche abode ben nat worth hawe nece thing hath time dare avow chambre fire hall well nede ſodainly reſcow diſputen aske amongs candle ſtrawe fall ah benedicite al among fare harme done farwel feldefare nece mine ne take nat grefe ye ſuffre al night wo god helpe ſo ye never lefe date ſain two wel wote ye wol nat ſo ye ben wiſe done ſo great folie put life al
