night jeopardie never lefe god wene ye never thing ſo lefe qd ſhe thrifte qd ſhall ſene ſith ye make enſample iche al night would ſorow ſe al treaſour tonne troie bidde god never mote joie loke ye ben love put life al night jeopardie thing nought y• god nat onely delay cometh folie malice ſhould nat lie platly ye ſuffre diſtreſſe ye neither bounte done ne gentilneſſe qd tho creſeide wol ye done thing ye therwith ſhal ſtinte al diſeaſe bere blew ring nothing might better pleſe save ſelfe ne hart apeſe ſay dere harte ſorow cauſeleſſe ſhal ſene morow ring qd ye haſel wodes ſhaken ye nece mine ring muſt ſtone might deed men live maken ſuch ring trowe yee none diſcrecion heed gone fele qd routh time iloſt wel maiſt thou curſen ſlouth wote ye wel noble hie corage ne ſoroweth nat ne ſtinteth eke lite foole jalous rage nolde ſetten ſorow mite feſſe fewe wordes white another day might find thing ſtant al another kind ſo gentle ſo tender hart death wol ſorows wreke truſt well ſore ſmart woll jealous wordes ſpeke thy nece er hart breke ſpeke ſelfe matere worde ye may hart ſtere told peril coming vnwiſt every wight ne parde harme may none ne ſin wol ſelf night ye know eke owne knight right ye muſt vpon triſte al preſt fetch liſte accident ſo pitous eke ſo like ſothe prime face troilus knight ſo dere priue comming liker place though ſhe grace conſidred thing ſtood wonder ſens al good creſeide anſwerde wiſely god reſt ſoule bring wo eme iwis faine would beſt grace ſo whether ye dwell go till god better minde ſend dulcarnon right wittes end qd pandarus ye nece wol ye dulcarnon called fleming wretch ſemeth herd wretch wol nought lere ſlouth wilfull • etches ſaid hem y• worth two fetch ye ben wiſe y• ye han hond ni neither harde ne skilfull withſtond eme qd ſhe doeth liſt ere come wol vp firſt ariſe love god ſens triſt two ye beth bothe wiſe werketh ſo diſcrete wiſe honour may pleſaunce al gouernaunce wel ſaid qd nece dere good thrifte wiſe gentill hart liggeth ſtill taketh right nedeth nat ferther ſtart eche eaſeth ſorowes ſmart love god venus herie ſone hope ſhall ben merie troilus full ſone knee ſette ful ſobrely right beddes heed beſte wiſe lady grette lord ſo ſhe woxe ſodainliche reed ne though men ſhould ſmiten heed could word right bring ſodainly ſodaine coming pandarus ſo wel could fele every thing play anon began ſaid nece ſe lord gan knele trouth ſe gentil man worde quiſhen ran ſaied kneleth thou leſt god hart bring ſone reſt naught ſain forſhe bad nat riſe ſorow put remembraunce el ſhe toke wiſe duetie obſervaunce well find ſhe pleaſaunce ſhe kiſt although ſhe ſiked ſore bad ſit adoun withouten qd pandarus wol ye well begin doth ſitte downe good nece dere vpon beddes ſide al within ech bet may worde drew ye fiere toke light founde countenaunce loke vpon olde romaunce creſeide troilus lady right clere ſtode ground ſikerneſſe thought ſhe ſeruaunt knight ne ſhould none vntrouth geſſe natheleſſe conſidred diſtreſſe love cauſe ſuch folie thus ſpake ſhe jalouſie lo hert mine would excellence love ayenſt man may ne ought eke goodly maken reſiſtence eke bicauſe felte wel ſay great trouth ſervice every day yt hart al mine ſoth ſaine droue rewe vpon paine goodnes founden alway yet may dere hert al knight thanke ferre wit al nat much right emforth conning might aie ſhal ſore ye ſmert ben trew hole mine hert dredeleſſe yt ſhal founden preue hert mine al ſain shall well told ſo yt nouȝt greue though right ſelf complain meane finally pain halte harte mine heauineſſe fully ſlaine every wrong redreſſe good mine ne jelouſie ala wicked wivere thus cauſeleſſe cropen harme would faine delivere ala hole ſome ſlivere refute ſo digne place iove ſone hart race thou auctour nature honour thy dignite folke vngilty ſuffren iniure gilty al quite goeth lefull plaine vndeſerved ſuffereſt jalouſie would vpon thee plaine crie eke al wo folke vſen ſaine right thus ye jalouſie love would buſhel venim al excuſen grane love ſhove wote high iove ſit liker love hate grame ought beare name certaine ſome maner jalouſie excuſable ſome iwis whan cauſe ſome ſuch fantaſie pite ſo well expreſſed vnneth doeth ſaith amis goodly drinketh vp al diſtreſſe excuſe gentilneſſe ſome ſo full fury deſpite ſurmounteth repreſſion hart mine ye plite thonke god paſſion nat call illuſion haboundance love beſte cure doth hart diſeaſe endure ſory wrothe deuoir hart reſt ſo liſt ordal othe ſorte wiſe ſo leſt love god ſet preue beſt gilty die ala might done ſeie bright teeres new eien fel thus ſhe ſeid god thou woſt thought ne dede untrew troilus never yet creſeid heed doun bed ſhe leid ſhete wrigh ſighed ſore held pece nat word ſpake ſhe help god quench al ſorow hope ſhall beſt may ſene ful miſty morow folowen ful oft mery ſomers day winter foloweth grene may men ſene day reden eke ſtories ſharpe ſhoures ben victory troilus wordes herde ye care liſt nat ſlepe thought ſtrokes yerde ſee creſeide lady wepe well felt harte crepe every teare creſeide aſtert crampe death ſtraine ye hert minde gan time accurſe came borne wicke tourned worſe labour hath doen beforne wendeit loſt thought na lorne pandarus thought ala thy wile serveth nought ſo welaway therwithall hing adoun hedde fell knee ſorowfully ſight might ſain felt na dedde wroth ſhe yt ſhould ſorows light natheleſſe ſpeaken might ſaid thus god wote yt game wiſt blame therwith ſorow hart ſhet iyen fell nat tere every ſpirite vigour knet aſtonied oppreſſed feling ſorow fere aught el fledde toune doune fell ſodainly ſwoune little ſorow ſe huſht pandare faſt nece peace loſt qd bethe nat agaſt certain laſt bedde caſt ſaied thefe man herte rent bare ſherte ſaied nece ye helpe u ala owne troilus forlorne iwis ſo would wiſt full fain qd ſhe ala borne ye nece woll ye pullen thorne ſticketh hart qd pandare say foryeve ſtint fare ye qd ſhe full lever good sunne goeth therwithall ſhe ſwore eare iwis dere hart wrothe trouth many othe ſpeake creſeide naught yet might nat abreide therwith poulce paums hondes gan frote wete temple twain deliver fro bitter bondes oft kiſt ſhortly ſain rewaken ſhe pain laſt gan breath drawe ſwough ſone adawe gan bet minde reaſon take wonder ſore abaſhed iwis ſigh gan bet awake ſaid mercy god thing ye ſelven thus amis qd tho creſeide man game troilus woll ye thus ſhame therwithal arm ſhe laied foryave oftime keſt thonked ſpake ſaied fill purpoſe harte reſt ſhe anſwerde leſt goodly wordes diſport gan oft ſorowes comfort qd pandarus ought aſpies light ne ſe • ven naught light nat good ſike folkes iyes y• love god ſens ye brought good plite let none hevy thought hanged harte twey bare candle chimney soone though nede ſhe ſoche othes liſt deviſe hem take thought tho fere ne cauſe eke none bid then riſe yet leſſe thing othes may ſuffice many caſe every wight geſſe loveth well meaneth gentilneſſe effect ſhe would wete anon man eke alſo jalous ſens cauſe non eke ſigne toke bade tell buſily el certain ſhe bare honde doen malice fonde withouten ſhortly ſain muſt obey unto lady heſt ye laſſe harme muſt ſomwhat fain ſaied whan ſhe ſoche feſt might loked leſt nat dere inough riſhe nedes muſt cauſe fiſh ſhe anſwerde ſwete ſo harme yt ſens non evill meane god bought u two maner thing mine entent cleane soch argument ne nat worth beane woll ye childiſh ialous counterfete worthy ye ibete tho troilus gan ſorowfully ſike leſt ſhe wroth thouȝt hart deide ſaied ala upon ſorowes ſike mercy ſwete hart mine creſeide tho wordes ſeide wrong woll treſpace doeth liſt grace ſhe anſwerde gilt miſericorde ſaine foryeve evermore night recorde bethe well ware ye amis nay dere harte mine qd iwis qd ſhe ſmart foryeve mine owne ſwete hart troilus bliſſe ſurpriſed put goddes hand ment nothing well ſodainly aviſed armes faſt hent pandarus full good entent laied ſlepe ſaied ye wiſe sweveneth leſt folke ariſe might may ſely larke ſay yt ſparhauke hath fote theſe ilke tway tale ſugre ſote though tary yeere ſometime mote mine aucthour tellen gladneſſe well tolde hevineſſe creſeide felt thus itake writen clerkes bokes old right aſpen lefe ſhe gan quake whan ſhe felt armes fold troilus hole care cold gan thanken tho y• blisfull goddes ſeven ſondry pain bring folk heven troilus armes gan ſtraine ſaied ſwete ever mote gone ye caught twaine yeldeth boote none creſeide anſwerde thus anone ne er ſwete harte dere yolde iwis ſoth ſaied healed fever great ſickneſſe men muſt drinken often ſe full bitter drinke gladneſſe men drinken oft pain great diſtreſſe meane aventure pain hath founden al cure ſwetneſſe ſemeth far ſwete bitterneſſe aſſaied biforne wo bliſſe flete non ſoch felten ſeus borne bet bothe two lorne love god take every woman hede werken thus come nede creſeide quite every drede tene ſhe juſt cauſe triſt made ſoche feaſt joy ſene ſhe trouth cleane entent wiſt tree many twiſt bitrent writhe ſwete wodbinde eche hem armes winde newe abaſhed nightingale ſtinteth firſt whan ſhe beginneth ſing ſhe heareth heerdes tale hedge wight ſtearing ſiker doeth voice ring right ſo creſeide whan drede ſtent opened hart told entent right yt ſeeth death iſhapen dien mote aught may geſſe ſodainly reſcous doeth hem eſcapen death brought ſikerneſſe world ſoche preſent gladneſſe troilus hath lady ſwete worſe hap god let u never mete armes ſmal ſtreight backe ſoft ſides long fleſhy ſmooth white gan ſtroke good thrift bad full oft ſnowiſſe throte breſts round lite thus heaven gan delite therwithall thouſand time kiſt doen ioy unneth wiſt ſaied thus love charite thy mother eke citheria ſwete thy ſelfe next heried ſhe venus meane well willy planete next imeneus thee grete never man goddes hold ye brought fro care cold benigne love thou holy bond thingen ſo woll grace liſt thee honouren lo deſire woll fly withouten wingen noldeſt thou bounte hem ſocouren ſerven beſt moſt alway labouren yet loſt y• dare well ſain certes thy grace paſſed deſertes thou y• leſt thonke coud deſerve nombred unto thy grace haſt holpen likely ſterve beſtowed ſo high place thilke bound may bliſſe ſurpace la • de reverence thy bounte thine excellence therwithall creſeide anon kiſt certain ſhe felt diſeaſe thus ſaied would god wiſt mine hart ſwete beſt might pleaſe man qd ever thus eaſe faireſt beſt ever ſey deineth reſt may men ſeen y• mercy paſſeth right experience felt unworthy ſo ſwete wight harte mine benignite thinke though unworthy yet mote nede amenden ſome wiſe right vertue hie ſervice love god lady dere sith hath wrouȝt ſhal ſerve thus meane woll ye fere doe live liſt ſterve teacheth may deſerve thonk ſo y• mine ignoraunce ne doe nothing diſpleaſaunce certes freſhe womanliche wife dare ſay trouth diligence ſhall ye finden life ne woll certain breaken defence doe preſent abſence love god let ſlea dede like unto womanhede iwis qd ſhe mine owne harte luſt ground eaſe al mine harte dere graunt mercy truſt let u fall away fro matere ſuffiſeth ſaid worde without repentaunce welcome kniȝt peace ſuffiſaunce delite ioies one leaſt impoſſible wit ſay judgeth ye feaſt ſoche gladneſſe liſt play thus theſe ilke tway night betwixen drede ſikerneſſe felten love great worthineſſe blisfull night hem ſo long iſought blithe unto hem bothe two thou ne ſoch feaſt ſoule ibouȝt ye leaſt joy away thou foule daunger thou fere let heaven bliſſe dwell ſo high ne tell ſothe though tellen mine aucthour excellence yet ſaied god toforne ſhall every thing holly ſentence love reverence worde eched beſt doeth therwithall right ſelven leſt word every part ſpeake hem correction feling love art put diſcrecion encreaſe make diminicion language beſeech purpoſe rather ſpeech theſe ilke two armes laft lothe hem ſonder gon eche wenden biraft el lo moſt fere thing nice dreames ful oft ech hem ſaid ſwete clippe thus el doe mete lord ſo gan goodly ſe never loke ne blent face ſaied dere harte may ſoth ye beene place ye harte mine god thanke grace qd tho creſeide therwithall kiſt ſpirite joy ſhe niſt troilus full often iyen two gan kiſſe ſaied iyen clere ye wrought ſoche wo ye humble nettes lady dere tho mercy written chere god wote text full harde find coud ye withouten bonde bind therwith gan faſt armes take well hundred time gan ſike ſuch ſorrowfull ſighes men make wo el folke ſike eaſie ſighes ſoche like ſhewed affection within ſoche maner ſighes could blin sone ſpake ſondry thing fill purpoſe aventure plaiyng enterchaungeden ring tellen ſcripture well wot broche gold azure rubbie ſet like herte creſeide yave ſtacke ſherte lord trowe ye coveitous wretch blameth love halte diſpite tho pen muckre ketch ever yet yave ſoche delite love poinct ſome plite nay doubteleſſe al ſo god ſave parfite joy may nigard woll ſay yes lord ſo lie tho buſie wretch full wo drede callen love woodneſſe follie ſhall fall hem ſhall rede ſhal forgon y• white eke rede live wo ther god yeve hem miſchaunce every lover trouth avaunce would god tho wretch diſpiſe service love eares alſo long mida full covetiſe thereto dronken hotte ſtrong creſus affectes wrong teachen hem vice lover although hold hem nice theſe ilke two ſay whan harte well aſſured tho gonnen ſpeake play eke rehearcen knew firſt every wo fere paſſed ſuch heavineſſe thonke god tourned gladneſſe evermore yt hem fell ſpeake thing ſoche time agone kiſſing tale ſhould breake fallen new ioy anone didden might ſens one recoveren bliſſe eaſe paiſed wo ioyes counterpaiſe reaſon woll ſpeake ſlepe accordeth mattere god wote toke full little kepe leſt night hem ſo dere ne ſhould vaine eſcape manere biſet ioy buſineſſe al ſouneth vnto gentilneſſe cock commune aſtrologer gan breſt heate crowe lucifer day meſſanger gan riſe beames throwe eſtward roſe could know fortuna maior anone creſeide harte ſore troilus thus ſeide mine hart life truſt pleaſaunce borne ala wo day v mote make diſceveraunce time riſe hence go el loſt ever mo night ala nilt thou v hove long alcmena lay iove blacke night folke boke rede ſhapen art god world hide certain time thy derke wede vnder men might reſt abide wel oughten beaſts plain folk chide day labor would v breſt thou thus flieſt deineſt v reſt thou doeſt ala ſhortly thine office tho rakle night god maker kinde thee thine haſt thine vnkind vice faſt • e hemiſperie binde nevermore vnder ye ground thou wind thou ſo higheſt troie forgone thus haſtely ioie troilus tho wordes felt thought tho pitous diſtreſſe bloodie teares harte melt yet never ſoche hevineſſe aſſaied ſo great gladneſſe gan therewithall creſeide lady dere armes ſtrain hold lovely manere cruell day accuſer ioy night love ſtole faſt iwrien accurſed thy comming troie every bowre hath one thy bright iyen envious day liſt thee ſo ſpien haſt thou loſt ſeekeſt thou place god thy light ſo quench grace ala theſe lover thee agilt diſpitous day thine paine hell many lover haſt thou ſlain wilt thy poring woll let hem dwell profreſt thou thy light ſell go ſell hem ſmale ſeales grave woll thee v nedeth day eke ſonne titan gan chide ſaid foole well may men thee diſpiſe haſt night dauning thy ſide ſuffreſt ſo ſone vp fro thee riſe diſeaſe v lover wiſe hold bed thou thy morow god ſo yeve ſorow therwith ful ſore ſighed thus ſeide lady right weale wo well roote goodly mine creſeide ſhall riſe ala ſhall ſo fele mine harte mote two ſhould life houre ſave sen life ſhall doen certes ne ala ſhall time ſee plite may eft life god wote ſhall sen deſire right ſo biteth dedde anon retourne ſhould long ala fro ſoiourne natheleſſe mine owne lady bright ſo wiſt vtterly humble ſervaunt knight harte iſet ſo fermely ye mine truely leaver theſe world twaine yet ſhould bet enduren paine creſeide anſwerde right anon ſigh ſhe ſaied harte dere game iwis ſo ferforth gon firſt ſhall phebus fallen ſphere everiche egle douues fere every rocke place ſterte er troilus go creſeides herte ye ſo depe within mine hart grave tho would turn thought wiſely god ſoule ſave dien pain could nought love god y• v hath wrought let brain none fantaſie crepen cauſe die ye mewould faſt mind would beſeche wiſt forhly find god nught apoint ioies ech harte mine withouten ſpech bethe true el routh thine god trouth bethe glad thy live ſikerneſſe thus ſaied never er ne ſhall mo great gladneſſe tourne ayen ſone ye ga faine would ye ſo wiſely god mine harte bring reſte armes toke oft keſte ayenſt ſithe mote nedes bee troilus vp roſe faſt cled armes toke ladie free hundred time way ſped ſoche wordes harte bled ſaied fare well dere harte ſwece god v graunt ſound ſone mete word ſorow ſhe anſwerd ſore gan parting diſtrain troilus vnto paleis ferd wo bigon ſhe ſothe ſain hard wrong ſharp deſire pain efte pleaſaunce may never remembraunce retourned roiall paleis ſone ſoft vnto bedde gan ſinke ſlepe long wont doen nauȝt may well ligge winke ſlepe may none harte ſinke thinking ſhe deſire brend folde worth wend thought gan vp doun wind wordes every countenaunce fermely impreſſen mind leſt pointe pleaſaunce verely thilke remembraunce deſire al newe brende luſt brede gan erſt yet toke non hede creſeide alſo right ſame wiſe troilus gan harte ſhet worthineſſe luſt dedes wiſe gentilneſſe ſhe met thonking love ſo well beſet deſiring oft harte dere ſoche place ſhe durſt make chere pandare morow y• commen vnto nece gan faire grete ſaied night ſo rained ala drede ye nece ſwete little leiſer ſlepe mete al night qd hath rain ſo wake ſome v trowe heddes ake nere came ſaid ſtant merie morow nece ye fare creſeide anſwerde never bet foxe ye god yeve hart care god helpe ſo ye cauſed fare trowe qd ſhe wordes white ſo ſeeth knoweth full lite ſhe gan face wrie ſhete woxe ſhame redde pandarus gan vnder prie ſaied nece ſhall dedde ſword ſmiteth hedde arme ſodainly thriſt vnder necke laſt kiſt paſſe yt chargeth naught ſay god foryave death ſhe alſo foryave vncle gan play cauſe none ſo thing right theffect go time home houſe ſhe went pandarus hath fully entent tourne ayen troilus reſtleſſe full long bedde lay prively ſent pandarus come haſ • may come anon one ſaied nay troilus full ſoberly grete doune vpon beddes ſides ſete troilus thaffectioun friendly love harte may deviſe pandarus knee fill adoun er would place ariſe gan thanken beſt wiſe hundred time gan time bleſſe born bring fro diſtreſſe ſaid frend frendes alderbeſt ever ſothe tell thou haſt heaven brought ſoul reſt fro phlegeton firie flood hell though might thouſand time ſell vpon day life thy ſervice might mote ſuffice ſonne y• world may ſe sawe never yet life dare lete ioily faire goodly ſhe whoſe ſhall till deie thus dare ſeie thanked high worthineſſe love eke thy kinde buſineſſe thus haſt thou little thing iyeve thee obliged aie life thine help live el dedde ago many day worde doun bed lay pandarus full ſoberly herde till ſaid anſwerde dere frende doen thee caſe god wote lefe glad man may god helpe ſo take agrife ſhall ſaine beware miſchiefe ther thou broght art thy blis thou thy ſelfe ne cauſe mi fortune ſharpe adverſite worſt kind infortune man hath proſperite remember paſſed thou art wiſe inough thy doe amis rakell though thou ſit warme thou certain woll thee harme thou art eaſe hold thee well therin al ſo ſure redde every fire great crafte kepe well win bridle alway well thy ſpeach thy deſire worldly ioy holdeth wire preveth well breſt alday ſo ofte thy neede werken ſofte qd troilus hope god forne dere frende ſhall ſo bere gilt ther ſhall nothing lorne ne nill rakle greven nedeth matter often tere wiſteſt thou mine harte wel pandare god wote thou wouldeſt lite care tho gan tell glad night whereof firſt hart dradde ſaied frende true knight faith owe god never halfe ſo hote aie deſire biteth love beſt deliteth ſelfe wiſely feele newe qualite ye another er pandare anſwerd ſaied thus one may heaven bliſſe feeleth way dare lay thilke time firſt heard ſay worde troilus never ful ſpeke matere praiſen vnto pandarus bounte right lady dere pandarus thanke maken chere tale aie ſpan newe begin til night departed hem twinne soone fortune would icomen bliſfull time ſwete troilus warned ſhould erſt creſeide lady mete felt herte ioy flete faithfully gan goddes hery let ſee mery holden forme al giſe comming alſo erſt nedeth nought deviſe plainly theffect right go ioy ſurete pandarus hem two abedde brought hem leſt thus ben quiet reſt naught nedeth ſith ben met aske blithe erſt well tho bet thouſand folde nedeth enquere go every ſorow every fere iwis ſo wend much ioy harte may comprehend ni litel thing ſey paſſeth every wit deviſe eche hem gan others luſt obey felicite theſe clerkes wiſe commenden ſo ne may ſuffiſe ioy ne may iwritten inke paſſeth al hart may bethinke cruel day ſo welaway ſtound gan aproche ſignes knew hem thought felen dethes wound wo hem chaungen gan hew day gonnen diſpiſe al new calling traitour envious worſe bitterly day light corſe qd troilus ala ware pirous tho ſwifte ſtedes thre drawen forth ſunnes chare han gon ſome pathe diſpite maketh ſo ſone day ſunne haſten thus riſe ne ſhall never ſacrifice nedes day departe hem muſt fone whan ſpeech done chere twin anon wont done ſetten time meting eft ifere many niȝt wroght manere thus fortune time ladde ioie creſeide eke kinges ſon troie ſuffiſaunce bliſſe ſingings troilus gan life lede ſpendeth juſteth maketh feeſtings geveth frely oft chaungeth wede helde alway drede world folke come well kind freſheſt beſt coulde find ſuch voice ſteven throughout world honour largeſſe vp ronge vnto yate heven love ſuch gladneſſe hart demed geſſe ni lover world eaſe wel thus gan love pleaſe goodlihede beaute kind lady iſette y• mountenaunce gnat vnbind hert al creſeides nette ſo narowe imasked iknette vndon maner ſide nil nat ben aught may betide honde ful ofte would take pandarus gardin lede ſuch feeſt ſuch proceſſe make creſeide womanhede beaute withouten drede heven wordes would ſing manere love erth ſea hath governaunce love heeſtes hath heven hie love holſome aliaunce halte people ioyned liſt hem gie love knitteth lawe companie couple doth vertue dwell binde accord told tell y• world faith yt ſtable diverſeth ſo ſtoundes according element diſcordable holden bonde perpetually phebus mote roſy day forth bring y• mone hath lordſhip y• night al doeth love aie heried might ſea yt greedy flowen conſtraineth certaine ende ſo flood ſo fiercely ne growen drenchen earth evermo love aught let bridle go loveth aſunder ſhould lepe loſt love halt hepe would god authour kind bond love vertue liſt ſearchen heart faſt bind bond wight y• wey wiſt heart cold hem would hem twiſt maken hem love liſt hem aie rew heart ſore keep hem ben trew need townes werre aye firſt armes dight certainely bookes erre save hector moſt idradde wight encreaſe hardineſſe might come love lady thanke win altered ſpirit ſo within time truce hauking would ride el hunt bore beare lioun ſmall beaſts let gon beſide y• come riding toun full oft lady window doun freſh faucon comen mue full redely goodly ſalue moſt love vertue ſpeech diſpite wretchedneſſe doubtleſſe need beſeech honouren hem worthineſſe eaſen hem diſtreſſe glad wight well ferde lover wiſt herde ſooth ſaine loſt held every wight love high ſerviſe meane folke aught ben right ſo well could deviſe ſentement ſo vncouth wiſe array every lover thought al wel ſo ſaid wrought though come blood roiall liſt pride wight chace benigne ech generall gate thank every place thus wolde love iheried grace pride ire envie avarice gan flie every vice thou lady bright doughter diane thy blind winged ſon eke dan cupide ye ſuſtren nine eke helicone hill pernaſo liſten abide ye thus ferre han deined gide ſens ye woll wend ye heried ben aye withouten end ſaid fully ſong theffect ioy troilus ſerviſe ſome diſeaſe among mine authour liſteth deviſe third booke end wiſe trolius luſt quiete creſeide owne heart ſwete explicit liber tertius bvt little welaway laſteth ſuch ioy ithonked bee fortune ſeemeth trueſt ſhe woll begile fooles ſong entune ſhe hem hent y• blent traitor commune wight whele ithrow laugheth ſhe maketh mowe troilus ſhe gan bright face away writhe tooke none hede caſt clene lady grace whele ſhe ſet vp diomede wch mine hert right ginneth blede pen ala write quaketh drede muſt endite creſeide troilus forſooke leaſt ſhe vnkind mote henceforth ben matter booke writen folk mind ala ſhould ever cauſe find ſpeake harme lie iwis hemſelfe ſhould villanie ye herines nightes doughters three endleſſe complaine ever paine megera alecto eke teſiphonee thou cruell mar eke father quirine ilke fourth booke helpe fine loo love life ifere troilus fully ſhewed incipit liber quartus ligging hoſt ſaid ere greekes ſtrong troy toun befell phebus ſhining vpon breaſt hercules lion hector many bold baron caſt day greekes fight wont greve hem miȝt long ſhort bitwene purpoſe day fighten ment day well armed bright ſhene hector many worthy knight went ſpeare hond big bowes bent berde withouten lenger lette fomen field anone hem mette long day ſpeares ſharpe iground arrow dart ſwerds mace fell fight bringen horſe man ground ax braines quell laſt ſhoure ſooth tell folke troy hem ſelven ſo miſleden y• worſe night home fleden day taken anthenor maugre polimidas moneſteo xantippe sarpedon paleſtinor polite eke troyan dan rupheo laſſe folke phebuſeo harm day folk troy dreden leſe great part ioy priamus yeve grekes requeſt time truce tho gonnen trete priſoners chaungen moſt leſt ſurplus yeven ſommes grete thing anon couth every ſtrete thaſſiege toune every firſt came calcas ere calcas knew tretiſe ſhould hold conſiſtorie among greekes ſoone gan thringe forth lord old ſet wont done chaunged face hem bade boone love god done reverence ſtinten noiſe yeve audience ſaid thus lo lord mine troyan knowen drede remember calcas alderfirſt yave comfort nede told well ſhould ſpede dredeleſſe ſhall ſtound ben troy ibrent beaten doun ground forme wt manner wiſe toun ſhend luſt atcheve ye ere well herde deviſe know ye lordes leve greekes ſo leve came ſelfe proper perſone reach beſt done vnto treaſour ne rent right regard reſpect eaſe thus good left went wening lordes pleaſe loſſe ne doth diſeaſe vouchſafe wiſely ioy leſe troy save doughter left ala sleeping home troy ſtert ſterne cruell father might ſo hard hert ala ne brought ſhert ſorow wol nat live morow ye lordes rew vpon ſorow becauſe ſaw time ere deliver iche holden pee never like may right doubtlees helpe grace among prees rew old caitife diſtreſſe sith hevineſſe ye caught fettred priſon troyans inow willes child one may redemption love god bounte one ſo fele ala ſo yefe need praier werne sith ye ſhull folk toun yerne perill life ſhall nat lie apollo hath told full faithfully eke found aſtronomie ſort augurie truely dare well ſay time faſt fire flambe toun ſhall ſprede thus ſhall troy turne aſhen dede certaine phebus neptunus makeden walles toun ben folke troy alway ſo wroth woll bring confuſioun right deſpite king laomedoun becauſe nolde paien hem hire toune troy ſhall ben ſet fire telling tale alway old grey humble ſpeech looking eke ſalt teares eyen twey full faſt ronnen doune either cheke long gan ſuccour hem beſeke heale ſorowes ſore gave antenor withouten glad inough calcas tho thing full ſoone nedes leide hem ſhoulden treatiſe go hem antenor full ofte preide bringen home king thoas creſeide priam ſafegard ſent thembaſſadours troy ſtreight went cauſe ytold comming old priam king full ſoone generall let vpon parliment hold theffect rehearſen ſhall thembaſſadours ben anſwerde finall eſchaunge priſoners nede hem liketh well forth procede troilus preſent place asked antenor creſeide full ſone chaungen gan face tho wordes well nigh deide natheleſſe word ſeide leſt men ſhould affection eſpie mannes hert gan ſorowes drie full anguiſh greſly drede abode lord would ſey would graunt god forbede theſchange thought thing twey firſt ſave honour wt wey might beſt theſchaunge ſtond full faſt caſt might ſtond love made preſt done bide rather dien ſhe ſhould go reaſon ſaid ſide withouten aſſent nat ſo leſt thy werke ſhe would thy ſo ſaine y• thy medling yblow brother love noterſt know gan deliberen beſt though lord would ſhe went would let hem graunt hem leſt tell lady firſt ment ſhe ſaid entent thereafter would worken alſo blive tho world ayen wolde ſtrive hector well greekes herd antenor would creſeide gan withſtond ſoberly anſwerd sir ſhe ni priſoner ſeide charge leide part ye may eſtſoones hem tell uſeli woman ſell noiſe people ſiert • ne brimme blaſe ſtraw iſet fire infortune would none ſhoulden confuſion deſire hector qd wt ghoſt may enſpire woman thus ſhild done u • eſe dan antenore wrong way ye cheſe ſo wiſe eke ſo bold baroun need folke men may ſee one greateſt toun hector lette thy fantaſies bee king priam qd thus ſegge wee voice forgone creſeide delive antenor preide iuvenall lord true thy ſentence little wenen folke yerue ne finden deſire offence cloud errour ne lette hem diſcerne beſt lo enſample yerne theſe folke deſiren deliverance antenor y• brought hem miſchaunce traitour toun troy ala quitte rathe nice world lo thy diſcretioun creſeide never hem ſcathe shall lenger bliſſe bathe antenor ſhall come home toun ſhe ſhall thus ſaid heere houn delibered parliment antenor yeelden creſeide pronounced preſident though hector nay full oft praid finally wight withſaid naught muſt ben ſhould ſubſtaunce parliment would departed parliment echone troilus without word mo vnto chamber ſpedde faſt alone man two bad faſte go becauſe would ſlepen ſaid haſtely upon bedde laid winter leaf ben biraſt ech till tree hare ni barke branch ilaſt lithe troilus biraft ech welfare ibounden blacke barke care diſpoſed wode witte breide ſore ſate chaunging creſeide riſt every dore ſhette window eke tho ſorowfull man vpon beddes ſide doune ſette full like dead image pale wan breaſt heaped wo began bruſt worken wiſe woodneſſe ſhall deviſe right wild bull beginneth ſpring idarted hert death roreth complaining right ſo gan chamber ſtert smiring breaſt aye fiſtes ſmert head wall body y• ground foll oft ſwapt himſelven confound eyen two pity hert ſtremeden ſwift welles twey high ſobs ſorrowes ſmert ſpeech reft unnethes might ſey death ala nilt thou dey accurſed day nature shope ben life creature fury rage heart twiſt faſt threſt length time ſomewhat gan aſſuage vpon bed laid doun reſt tho begon teares breſt wonder body may ſuffiſe halfe wo deviſe ſaid thus fortune ala y• done thee agilt mighteſt thou routhe begile grace ſhall thus ſpilt shall thus creſeide away y• thou wilt ala mighteſt thou thine hart find ben thus cruell unkind thee nat honoured live thou well woteſt god wilt thou fro ioy thus deprive troilus may men thee call wretch wretch honour fall miſery woll bewaile creſeide ala till breath faile ala fortune life joy diſpleaſed unto thy foule envie ne haddeſt thou father king troy biraft life done brother die ſlaine ſelfe y• thus complaine crie combre world may nothing ſerve ever dye never fully ſterve creſeide alone laft naughtrauȝt whider thou woldſt ſtere ala haſt thou byraft evermore lo thy manere reve wight moſt dere preve thy gierfull violence thus loſt helpeth defence lord love god ala knowest beſt mine hert al thought ſhal ſorowfull life done caas go ſo dere bought sen ye creſeide fully brought grace heart ſealed may ye ſuffer ala repealed may done ſhal may dure live turment cruell paine infortune diſaventure alone borne woll complaine ne never woll ſeene ſhine raine end woll edippe derkeneſſe ſorrowfull life dien diſtreſſe wery ghoſt erreſt fro 〈◊〉 thou flien wofulleſt body ever might ground go ſoule lurking wofull neſte fly forthout mine hart let breſte follow alway creſeide thy lady dere thy right place lenger wofull eien two ſens diſport ſeene creſeides eyen bright ſhall ye done diſcomfort stoden naught wepen ſight sen ſhe queint y• wont light veine forth eyen twey formed ſens vertue awey creſeide lady ſoveraine wofull ſoule thus crieth ſhall yeven comfort thy paine ala wight mine hert dieth ſpirit ſo unto hieth recei • e gree ſhall aye ſerve thy force though body ſterve ye lover high upon whele ben ſette fortune good aventure god lene ye finden aye love ſtele long life joy endure ye comen ſepulture remembreth fellow reſteth loved eke though unworthy old unholſome miſlived man calcas meane ala eiled thee 〈◊〉 greek ſens thou art borne trojan calcas wolt bane curſed time thou borne would blisfull iove joy thee would troy thouſand ſighes hotter glede breaſt went medled plaint new wo fede wofull teares never ſtent ſhortly ſo ſorowes rent wore ſo mate joy pennaunce feeleth none heth traunce panoare parliment heatd wt every lord burgeis ſeid full graunted one aſſent antenor yelden • creſeid gan well nigh wood wit breid wo niſte ment 〈…〉 went certaine knight 〈…〉 chamber dore undid anone pandare full tenderly wept derke chamber ſtill ſtone toward bedde gan ſoftly goue confuſe •• ſt ſay wo wit nigh away chere leeking torne ſorow armes folden ſtood wofull troilus beforne pitous face gan beholden ſo oft gan heart colden seeing friend wo whoſe heavineſſe heart ſlough thought diſtreſſe wofull wight troilus y• felt friend pandare icomen ſee gan ſnow ayenſt ſunne melt wofull pandare pite gan weepe tenderly ſpeechleſſe thus ben theſe ilke twey neither might ſorow word ſey laſt wofull troilus nigh dead ſmert gan breſten rore ſorowfull noiſe ſaid thus among ſobs ſighes ſore lo pandare dead withouten haſt thou nat heard parliment ſeide antenor loſt creſeide pandare full dead pale hew full pitouſly anſwerde ſaid yes wiſely falſe trew heard wote mercy god would trowed would wend y• ſo little throw fortune joy would overthrow world creature dome ever ſaw ruine stranger caſe aventure may eſchue devine world thy thus define ne truſt wight find fortune aye property yeftes ben commune tell thou art ſo mad ſorrowen thus liſt thou wiſe sen thy deſire holly haſt thou right ought inough ſuffiſe never felt ſerviſe friendly chere looking eie let thus wepe wailen till die al thou wel woſt thy ſelve toune full lady dome falcer ſuch twelve ever ſhe ſhal finden ſome rout ye one twey withouten dout thy glade mine owne dere brother ſhe loſt ſhall recover another god forbid alway y• ech pleaſaunce thing none wight one ſing another well daunce goodly ſhe glad light faire good aright ech vertue holden dere herones faucon rivere eke writ zanſis full wiſe new love chaſeth oft old vpon new caſe lieth new aviſe thinke eke thy ſelfe ſaven art thou hold fire proceſſe ſhall kind cold ſens caſuell pleaſaunce caſe ſhall put remembraunce alſo ſure day commeth night new love labour wo el ſelde ſeeing wight done old affection overgo thy part thou ſhalt haue one tho abredgs thy bitter pain ſmart abſence ſhall driue hart theſe word ſaied none helpe friend leaſt ſorow deide doubtleſſe doen wo fall raught nat vnthrift ſeide troilus nigh ſorow deide tooke little hede ever ment one eare heard went y• laſt anſwerd ſaid friend lechcraft dealed thus well fitting fiend traien wight true vnto pray god let counſaile never ithee doe rather ſterue anon right ere thus doen thou wouldeſt lere ſerue iwis ſo thou ſey mine hart enhabite right shall holly till dey pandarus ſens trouth hight woll nat ben vntrue wight man woll aye live ſterve never none creature ſerve thou ſaieſt thou ſhalt fair find ſhe let make compariſon creature iformed kind leve pandare concluſion woll nat thine opinion touching thee beſeech hold thy peace thou ſlaeſt thy ſpeech thou biddeſt ſhould love another freſhly new let creſeide go lithe nat power leve brother though might yet would nat ſo canſt thou plaien raket fro nettle dock y• pandare foule fall thy wo y• care thou fareſt eke pandarus wight wo bigon commeth apace ſaith right thus thinke ſmart thou ſhalt feele none thou maieſt firſt tranſmewen ſtone reve paſſions thou ſo lightly doe wo fall death may well breſt depart life ſo long may ſorow mine fro ſoule ſhall creſeides dart nevermore doune proſerpine dead woll pine woll eternally complain wo twinned twain thou haſt made argument full fine ſhould laſſe paine creſeide forgone ſhe mine lived eaſe felicite gabbeſt thou ſaideſt vnto wors fro wele ithrow erſt none wele know tel ſen y• thee thinketh ſo light chaungen ſo love aye fro haſt thou nat doen buſily thy might chaungen y• doth thee thy wo nilt thou let fro thine heart go nilt thou love another lady ſwete may thine heart ſetten quiete thou haſt love aye yet miſchance canſt thine hart drive lived luſt pleaſance much creature live would foryet ſo blive haſt thou ben hid ſo long mew thou canſt ſo well formeliche agrew nay god wot naught worth al thy rede ever may befall withouten word mo woll ben dede death ender art ſorrowes come ſens ſo oft thee call ſely death ſooth ſor ſaine oft icleped commeth endeth paine well wote life quiete ere thou ſlue would yeven hire thy comming ſo ſwete world nothing ſo deſire death ſens ſorow fire thou either anon teares drench thy cold ſtroke mine heart quench sen y• thou ſlaeſt ſo fele ſundry wiſe ayenſt vnpraied day night doe requeſt ſerviſe deliver world ſo doeſt thou right wofulleſt wight ever time ſterve sen world right nauȝt ſerve troilus teares gan diſtill licour allambike full faſt pandarus gan hold tongue ſtill ground eyen downe caſt natheleſſe thus thought laſt parde rather fellow dey yet ſhall ſomewhat vnto ſey ſaid friend ſens thou haſt ſuch diſtreſſe ſens thee liſt mine argumentes blame nilt thy ſelven helpe doen redreſſe thy manhood letten game rauiſh ne cauſt thou ſhame either let toune fare hold ſtill leave thy nice fare art thou troy haſt non hardiment take wight loveth thee would ſelven thine aſſent nat nice vanite riſe vp anon let weeping ſith thou art man hour woll dead ſhe ſhall ben anſwerde troilus full ſoft ſaied iwis leve brother dere ſelfe yet thought full oft thing thou deviſeſt thing laft thou ſhalt wel thou haſt yeven audience thereafter mayſt thou tell thy ſentence firſt ſin thou woſt toun hath al werre raviſhing woman ſo might ſhould ſuffced erre ſtont ne done ſo great vnright ſhould alſo blame every wight father graunt ſo withſtood sen ſhe chaunged tounes good eke thought ſo aſſent aske father grace thinke accuſement sen well wot may nat purchace ſens father ſo high place parliment hath eſchaunge enſealed nill letter repealed yet drede moſt heart perturbe violence doe ſuch game would openly diſturbe muſt diſclaunder name lever die diffame nolde god ſhould honour lever life ſave thus loſt aught ſee certaine knight muſt honour lever every caſe lover ought right thus deſire reaſon twight deſire diſturben redeth reaſon nill ſo mine heart dredeth thus weeping could never ceaſe ſaid ala ſhall wretche fare well fele alway love encreaſe hope laſſe laſſe pandare encreaſen eke cauſes care welaway nill mine hart breſt love little reſt pandare anſwerde friend thou mayſt done thee liſt ſo hote thine eſtate ſhe ſhould go tho toun cried thing note nolde ſet noiſe grote men cried wol roun eke wonder laſt ix deies never toun devine reaſon aye ſo deepe ne curteſly helpe thy ſelfe anone bet thy ſelven wepe namely ſens ye two ben al one riſe vp mine head ſhe ſhall gone rather ben blame little ifound ſterve gnat withouten wound ſhame vnto ne vice withholden ye loveth moſt peraventure ſhe might hold thee nice letten go thus vnto grekes hoſte think eke fortune well thy ſelven woſte helpeth hardie man vnto empriſe weiueth wretch cowardiſe though thy lady would alite greve thou ſhalt thy ſelf thy peace hereafter make certaine cannot leve ſhe would evill take ſhould feare thine hart quake thinke paris hath y• thy brother love ſhal thou another troilus thing dare thee ſwere creſeide thy lefe loveth thee well thou doſt god helpe ſo ſhe nill take grefe though thou bote anon miſchefe ſhe wilneth fro thee paſſe ſhe falſe ſo love well laſſe thy take hart think right knight love broken alday every law kith ſomwhat thy courage thy might mercie thy ſelfe awe let wretched wo thine hart gnawe manly ſet world ſixe ſeven thou die martir go heaven woll ſelfe ben thee dede though kin vpon ſtound ſtrete dog liggen dede girt many bloodie wound every caſe woll friend found thee liſteth ſterven wretch adieu devill ſpeede retch troilus gan word quicken ſaied friend graunt mercie aſſent certainly thou mayſt nat ſo pricken ne paine none ne may ſo torment caſe mine entent ſhorte wordes though dien ſhould raviſhen ſelfe would ſo mean qd pandarus al day tell haſt thou well aſſaid ſoroweſt thus anſwerde nay wherofart thou qd pandare diſmaid noſte ſhe woll ben evill apaid raviſhen ſens thou haſt ben iove told thine eare thy riſe vp naught ne anone waſh thy face king thou wend may wondren whider thou art gone thou muſt wisdome blend vpon caſe may thee ſend thou beware ſhortly brother dere glad let werke mattere ſhall ſhape ſo ſikerly thou ſhalt niȝt ſomtime ſome manere come ſpeaken thy ladie prively wordes eke chere thou ſhalt full ſoone aperceive well entent caſe beſt fare well point reſt ſwifte fame fals thing equall reporteth like thing true throghout troy ifled preſt wing fro man man made tale new calcas doughter bright hew parliment without word graunted chaunge antenore tale anon right creſeide heard ſhe y• father rought caſe right naught ne deide full buſily iupiter beſought yeve miſchance tretis brought ſhortly leaſt theſe tale ſooth durſt wight asken fere ſhe hart mind troylus yſet ſo wonder faſt al world ne might love vnbind ne troylus heart caſt would y• life may laſt ſhe thus brenneth love drede ſhe niſt beſt rede men ſeene toune woman vſen friend viſite creſeide woman came rout pitous ioy wenden delite tale dere ynough mite theſe woman citie dwell ſet hem doune ſayd ſhall tell qd firſt one glad truely becauſe ſhall father ſee another ſayd iwis ſo little hath ſhe v qd tho third hope iwis ſhe shall bringen v peace every ſide ſhe goth almighty god gide tho wordes tho womanniſh thinges herd hem right thogh ſhe thencewere god wote hart thing although body ſat emong hem advertence alway el troilus full faſt ſoule ſought withouten word alway ſhe thought theſe woman y• thus wenden pleaſe naught gan tale ſpend vanitie ne done none eaſe ſhe meane brend paſſion wend ſhe felt almoſt heart die wo werie companie might ſhe lenger reſtraine teares gan ſo vp well gave ſignes bitter paine ſpirit muſt dwell remembering heaven vnto hell fallen ſens ſhe forgo ſight troilus ſorrowfully ſhe ſight thilke fooles ſitting wende ſhe wept ſighed ſore becauſe ſhe ſhould rout departen never play hem knowen yore see ſo wepe thought kindneſſe ech hem wept eke diſtreſſe buſtly gonnen comforten thing god wot ſhe little thought tale wenden diſporten glad ofte beſought ſuch eaſe therwith wrought right man eaſed fele ache head clawen hele nice vanitie took leve home wenten creſeide full ſorrowfull pitie chamber vp went hall bedde ſhe gan dead fall purpoſe never thence riſe thus ſhe wrought ſhall deviſe ownded hair ſonniſh hew rent eke finger long ſmale wrong full oft bad god rew death bote bale hewe whylom bright tho pale bare witneſſe wo conſtreint thus ſhe ſpake ſobbing compleint ala qd ſhe religioun wofull wretch infortuned wight borne curſed conſtellatioun mote gon thus departen fro knight wo worth ala ilke day light ſaw firſt eyen twaine cauſeth paine therewith teares eyen two doune fell ſhoure aprill ſwithe white breaſt ſhe bet wo death ſhe cried thouſand ſithe sen wont wo lithe mote forgone diſaventure held ſelfe forloſt creature ſaid ſhall done alſo ſhould live twin dere heart eke love ſo ſhall ſorow ſlaen ye ben calcas father thine ſin mother mine cleped wert argive wo worth day yt thou bare live wt fine ſhould live ſorowen thus ſhould fiſh withouten water dure creſeide worth troilus ſhould plant life creatur • live withouten kind noriture full oft word ſey rootleſſe mote greene ſoone dey ſhal done thus ſens neither ſword ne dart dare none handle cruelte like day fro depart ſorow nill nat bane ſhall meat ne drinke come till ſoule breſt vnſheath thus ſelven woll done death troilus clothes everychone shull blacke ben tokening hart ſwete world agone wont ſet quiete mine order aye till death mete obſervaunce ever abſence shall ſorrow ben complaint abſtinence mine hart eke woful ghoſt therein bequeath ſpirit complaine eternally ſhall never twin though yearth twinned twaine yet field pitie paine hight eliſos ſhall ben ifere orpheus erudice fere thus heart mine antenor ala ſoone ſhall chaunged wene ſhull ye done ſorowfull caas ſhall tender hart ſuſtene hart mine foryet ſorow tene alſo ſoothly ſey ye well fare retche dey might ever redde ben iſong plaint ſhe made diſtreſſe little tong diſcriven would heavineſſe ſhould make ſorrow ſeeme leſſe childiſhly deface high complaint therefore pace pandare ſent troilus vnto creſeide ye heard deviſe beſt recorded thus full glad done ſerviſe vnto creſeide full ſecret wiſe ſhe lay tourment rage came tell holly meſſage fond ſhe ſelven gan grete full pitouſly ſalte teres breaſt face ibathed full wete mightie treſſes ſonniſh here vnbroiden hangen eares yave ſigne mattire death hart gan deſire ſhe ſaw ſhe gan ſorrow anon tearie face atwixt armes hide pandare ſo wo bigon hous might vnneth abide felt ſorrow every ſide creſeide erſt complained ſore tho gan ſhe plaine thouſand time aſpre plaint thus ſhe ſeide pandare firſt joy two cauſe cauſing vnto creſeide tranſmued ben cruell wo whether ſhall ſay welcome alderfirſt brought vnto ſerviſe love ala endeth ſuch wiſe endeth love wo ye men lieth worldly bliſſe thinketh end bliſſe aye ſorrow occupieth troweth ſo let vpon wofull wretche ſee ſelfe hate aye birth curſe feeling alway fro wicke go worſe ſo ſeeth ſeeth ſorow atonis paine tourment plaint wo diſtreſſe wofull body harme none langour anguiſh cruell bitterneſſe annoy ſmart drede furie eke ſickneſſe trow iwis heaven teares raine pitie aſpre cruell paine thou ſuſter full diſcomfort qd pandarus thinkeſt thou ne haſt thou thy ſelven ſome reſport wilt thou thus thy ſelfe ala fordo leave werke take heed ſhall ſaine herken good entent meſſage y• troilus ſent tourned tho creſeide wo making great death ſee ala qd ſhe wordes may ye bring woll dere hert ſaine mee drede nevermore ſee woll plaint teares ere wend ynough thereafter ſend right ſuch ſeene viſage wight men beare bind face like paradis image ichaunged another kind play y• laughter men wont find eke joyes everichone ben fled thus lieth creſeide alone eyen two purpre ring bitrent ſoothfaſt tokening paine behold deadly thing pandare might nat reſtraine teares eyen raine natheleſſe beſt might ſeide troilus theſe wordes creſeide lo nece trow ye han heard king lordes beſt hath made eſchaunge antenor cauſe ſorow vnreſt caſe doth troilus moleſt may none yearthly man tongue ſay wo wit away ſo ſorowed little v ſlaw counſaile day finally ſomewhat fro weeping withdraw ſeemeth deſireth faw ben might deviſe remedie wiſe ſhort plain theffect meſſage ferforth wit comprehend ye ben tourment ſuch rage may long prologue entend herevpon ye may anſwere ſend love god nece dere leave wo troilus great wo qd ſhe ſighed ſore ſhe feeleth deadly ſharpe diſtreſſe yet ſorrow mokell love bet himſelfe geſſe ala hath ſuch hevineſſe ſo pitouſly complaine iwis ſorow doubleth paine greuous god wot twin qd ſhe yet harder ſeene ſorrow well wot woll bane die woll certaine tho qd ſhe bid come er deth y• thus threteth drive y• ghoſt mine hart beteth theſe wordes ſaid ſhe armes two fill gruffe gan weepen pitouſly qd pandarus ala doe ye ſo sen ye well wote time faſt ſhall come ariſe vp haſtely nat biwopen thus ne find ye woll wode mind wiſt ye farde manere would himſelfe ſlea wend fare ſhould come good priam may diſpend fine would anon pretend know well thy yet ſey leave ſorow plainly woll dey ſhapeth ſorow abredge nat encreaſe lefe nece ſwete bethrather cauſe plat edge ſome wiſdome ye ſorrowes bete helpeth weepen full ſtrete though ye ſalt teares dreint bet time cure aye pleint meane thus hither bring sen ye wiſe one aſſent ſhapeth diſtour going come ayen ſoone ye went woman wiſe ſhort aviſement let ſeene wit ſhall availe may helpe ſhall nat faile go qd creſeide vncle truely ſhall done might reſtraine weeping ſight buſily fo • glad ſhall done paine herte ſeeken every vaine ſore may ben founden ſalve ſhall nat lacke certaine mine halve goth pandarus troilus ſought till temple found alone life lenger rought pitous goddes everichone full tenderly praid made mone done ſoone world pace wel thought none grace ſhortly ſoothe ſey ſo fallen diſpaire day vtterly ſhope dey right thus argument alway ſaied na lorne welaway yt commeth commeth neceſſitie thus ben lorne deſtinie certainly wote well ſaid foreſight devine purveiaunce ſeen alway forgone creſeide sen god ſee thing doutance hem diſpoſeth ordinance merites ſoothly ſhull comen predeſtine natheleſſe ala ſhall leve ben great clerkes many one deſtinie argumentes preve ſome ſaine nedely none free choice yeven v everychone welaway ſo ſigh arne clerkes old whoſe opinion may hold ſome men ſain yt god ſeeth biforne ne god may nat deceived ben parde mote fallen though men ſworn purveiaunce hath ſeene beforne wherefore ſay eterne hath wiſt beforn thought eke dede free choice theſe clerk rede thought deed alſo might never ſuch purueyaunce may nat deceived never mo hath feled biforne withouten ignoraunce might ben variaunce writhen fro god purveying nere preſcience thing comming rather opinion vncertaine ſtedfaſt foreſeeing certes abuſion god ſhould perfite clere weting men yt doutous wening ſuch errour vpon god geſſe falſe foule wicked curſedneſſe eke opinion ſome top ful high ſmooth iſhore ſaine right thus yt thing nat come preſcience hath ſeene ſhall come ſain yt therfore ſhall come therefore ye purveyaunce wote beforne withouten ignoraunce manner neceſſite retourneth part contrary againe needfully behoueth nat thilke thing fallen certaine ben purveied needfully ſaine behoueth thinges fall certaine ben purveyed meane though laboured inquire wch thing cauſe wch thing whether preſcience god certaine cauſe neceſſite thing comen parde neceſſitie thing comming becauſe certaine purveying ne enforce ſhewing ye order ye cauſes ſtant well wot behoueth befalling thing wiſt certainly neceſſarie ſeeme thereby preſcience put falling neceſſaire thing come fall foule faire ſit man yond ſee neceſſitie behoueth certes thine opinion ſooth weneſt conjecteſt ſit ayenward yet lo right ſo part contrarie thus hearken woll nat tarie ſay opinion thee ſooth ſit ſay mote ſitten neceſſitee thus neceſſitie either nede ſitting iwis nede ſooth thus forſoth mote neceſſitie ben thou maiſt ſaine yt man ſit nat therfore thine opinion ſitting ſooth rather man ſate therefore thine opinion ſooth iwis ſay though cauſe ſooth commeth ſitting yet neceſſitee enterchaunged thee thus ſame wiſe doutaunce may well maken ſeemeth reaſoning goddes purveyaunce thinges comen whiche reaſon men may well iſee thilke thinges earth yfall neceſſitie comen although forthing ſhall come iwis therefore purveyed certainely nat comnieth purveyed yet natheleſſe behoueth needfully thing come purveyed truly el thing purveyed betiden neceſſite ſuffiſeth right ynough certaine deſtroy free choiſe everydell abuſion ſaine falling thinges temporell cauſe god preſcience eternell truely falſe ſentence thing com ſhuld cauſe preſcience might wene ſuch thought god purveieth thing yt come come el nought might wene thing ſome whylome ben befall overcome ben cauſe thilke ſoveraine purveyaunce forwote withouten ignoraunce yet ſay thereto right wote thing iwis thing mote needfully ſo eke right ſo wot thing comming mote come thus befalling thing ben wiſt tide mowe ben eſchewed ſide ſaid thus almighty iove trone woteſt thing ye ſoothfaſtneſſe rew ſorrow dien ſone bring creſeide fro diſtreſſe heavineſſe diſputing himſelfe matere came pandare ſaid ye may mighty god qd pandarus trone eigh ſaw ever wiſe man faren ſo troilus thinkeſt thou done haſt thou ſuch luſt ben thine owne fo parde yet nat creſeide ago liſt theé ſo thy ſelfe fordone drede thine head thine eyen ſemen dede haſt thou nat lived many yere beforne withouten farde full well eaſe art thou none borne hath kind thee wrought al pleaſe let thinke right thus thy diſeaſe y• dice right ther fallen chaunces right ſo love come gon pleſaunces yet wonder moſt thou thus ſoroweſt ſith thou woſt nat yet touching going ſhall fall ne ſhe ſelfe diſtourben thou haſt nat yet aſſaied wit man may betime necke bede ſhall ſorowen nede thy take hede ſhall ſay iſpoke long ibe accorded betwixe v twey evermore thinketh thus ſhe hath ſomewhat heart privite wherewith ſhe ſhall aright rede diſturbe thou art drede counſell night thou go make end bliſfull iuno great might shall hope grace vnto v ſend mine hart ſeith certaine ſhe ſhall nat wend thy put thine heart reſt hold thy purpoſe beſt troilus anſwerde ſighed ſore thou ſaiſt right well right ſo liſt ſaid vnto time go full prively himſelfe withouten mo vnto came wont done wrought ſhall tell ſoone sooth gon firſt mete gan paine heart twiſt neither hem might grete hem armes tooke kiſt laſſe wofull hem niſt y• ne might word outbring ſaid erſt wo ſobbing wofull teares leten fall bitter teares kind paine ligne aloe gall bitter teares wept find wofull mirra barke rind world ni ſo hard hart nolde rewed paine ſmart wofull wery ghoſts twaine returned ben hem ought dwell ſomewhat weken gan paine length plaint ebben gan well teares heart vnſwell broken voice al horſe ſhright creſeid troilus theſe ilke word ſeid iove die mercy thee beſech helpe troilus therewithal face vpon breſt ſhe laid loſt ſpeech wofull ſpirite proper place right worde away point pace thus ſhe lith hewes pale grene whilom freſh faireſt ſene troilus gan behold cleping name ſhe lay deed withouten anſwere felt ſimmes cold eien throwen vpward heed ſorowful man non rede oft time colde mouth kiſt wo god himſelf wiſt riſeth vp long ſtraite leide ſigne life aught may none finde nothing creſeide ſong full oft welaway ſaw ſpechleſſe ſhe lay ſorowful voice hart bliſſe al bare ſaid ſhe fro world ifare long complained hondes wrong ſaid ſey teeres ſalt breſt berained gan tho teeres wipen full drey pitouſly gan ſoule prey ſaid lord ſet art thy trone rewe eke ſhall folow ſone cold without ſentement ought wote brethe felt none preignant argument ſhe forth world agone ſaw non wonne gan limmes dreſſe ſuch manere men hem ſhall ben laide bere ſterne cruel hart ſwerde anon ſheth twight ſelfe ſleen ſore ſmart ſoule ſoule folowen might y• dome minos would dight sith love cruel fortune ne would world lenger liven ſhould ſaid thus fulfilde high diſdaine cruel iove thou fortune adverſe ſome falſly ye ſlaine creſeide ſith ye may ne werſe fie might werkes ſo diverſe thus cowardly ye ſhull never winne ſhall deth fro lady twinne world ſith ye ſlain thus woll let folow ſpirite low hie shal never lover ſaine troilus dare nat feare lady die certaine woll beare companie ſithe ye wol nat ſuffre v liven yet ſuffreth ſoules ben ifere thou citie live wo thou priam brother al ifere thou mother farewell go attropoſe make redy thou bere thou creſeide ſwete hart dere receive ſpirite would ſey ſwerde hart redy dey god would ſwough ſhe abraide gan ſighe troilus ſhe cride anſwerde lady mine creſeide live ye yet let ſwerde doun glide ye hart mine thanked cupide qd ſhe therewithal ſhe ſore ſight began glade might toke armes two kiſt oft glad al entent goſt flikered aie loft wofull hart ayen went laſt eye glent aſide anon ſhe gan ſworde aſpie lay bare gan feare crie asked draw troilus anon cauſe told himſelf therwith wold ſlaw creſeide vpon gan behold gan armes faſt fold ſaid mercy god lo dede ala nigh dede nadde ſpoken grace ye would ſlain ſelfe anon qd ſhe ye doutleſſe ſhe anſwerde ala ilke lorde made nolde forlong way live deth ben crouned quene al londe ſunne ſhineth ſhene ſelve ſword yt ſelfe would ſlain qd ſhe tho ho right inough let v riſe ſtraite bedde go let v ſpeken wo morter ſee brenne know ful well day nat farre henne wer bed armes fold naught like tho night beforne petouſly ech gan behold hadden al bliſſe ilorne bewailing aie day borne til laſt ſorowful wight creſeide troilus theſe ilke word ſeide lo hart mine wel wote ye qd ſhe wight alway wo complaine ſeketh nat holpen ni folie encreace paine ſens aſſembled twaine find bote wo ben time al ſone begin woman ful wel ye wotte aviſed ſodainly wol tel hotte thinketh thus neyther ye ought halfe wo maken skilfully art inough redreſſe yet miſſe ſleen hevineſſe soth wo ben inne aught wote nothing el cauſe ſhould twinne conſidred al ni amis remedy vnto ſhape v ſone mete al ſome dere hart ſwete ſhall wel bringen comen ayen ſone go thereof maner thing dout dredeleſſe within weke two ſhal ben may ſo right word ſhal wel heape way ſhew woll nat maken long ſermon time iloſt may recovered go concluſion beſt aught ſee love god foryeve ſpeake aught ayenſt hart reſt trewly ſpeake beſt making alway proteſtacion theſe word ſhal ſay ni ſhew mocion find vnto helpe beſt way take otherwiſe pray effect ſo ye commaund wol done demaund herkeneth ye wel vnderſtond going graunted parliment ferforth may ben withſtond al world judgement ſithe helpeth none aviſement letten lette paſſe mind let v ſhape better way find ſothe twinning v twaine wol v diſeaſe cruelly anoie behoveth ſometime paine ſerveth love woll joie ſith ſhall farther troie may ride ayen halfe morow ought laſſe cauſen v ſorow ſhal nat ſo ben hid mew day day mine owne hart dere sen well ye wote trew ye ſhal ful wel al mine eſtate aud er truce done ſhal ben ye antenor iwonne alſo bethe glad ye conne think right thus creſeid agon ſhe ſhal come haſtely ayen ala god lo right anon er day ten dare ſafely ſaine erſt ſhal ſo faine ſhal togithers ever dwell al world ne might bliſſe tell ſee oft time ben beſt counſaile hide ye ſpeke nat fourtenight ne ſee go ne ride may ye nat ten day abide mine honour ſuch aventure iwis ye mowe el lite endure ye know eke kin onely father eke mine thinges al ifere namely dere herte ye nolde leaven ſee al world wide hath ſpace el ſee never ioves face trowe ye father wiſe coveiteth ſo ſee drede leſt toune folkes diſpiſe bicauſe vnhappy dede wote father life lede wiſt troie wel fare v neded wending nat care ye every day eke men treate peace ſuppoſed men quene heleine ſhall reſtore grekes v reſtore mi though nere comfort none men purpoſen peace every ſide ye may better eaſe hart abide peace mine hart dere nature peace mote nedes drive men muſt entrecomune ifere fro eke ride gone blive al day thicke flien hive every wight liberty bleve liſt bet withouten leve tho ſo yt peace ther may bene none yet hither though ther never peace ne muſt come whider ſhould gone miſchaunce ſhould dwell among tho men armes ever fere wiſely god ſoule rede nat ſene wherof ye ſhould drede another way ſo al thing ne may ſuffice father ye knowen well parde olde eke full covetiſe right founden al giſe withouten nette wherwith ſhal hent herkeneth ye woll aſſent lo troilus men ſaine ful hard wolfe ful wedder hole ſaine men full oft iwis mote ſpenden parte remnant ſave aie gold men may harte grave ſet vpon covetiſe meane ſhal deviſe moveable yt toun vnto father ſhal take ſay right truſt ſalvatioun ſent frende tway frendes fervently pray ſende hie toun ſtant thus ieopardie ſhal gold huge quantite thus ſhal ſain leſt folke aſpide may ſent wight ſhal eke ſhewen peace betide frends every ſide toward court wrath pace priamus ſtonde grace thing ſwete ſhal ſo enchaunten ſawes right heven ſoule ſhal mete apollo clerkes lawes calculing availeth three hawes deſire gold ſhall ſo ſoule blend liſt ſhall wel make end would aught ſort preve lie certaine ſhall fond diſturben plucke ſleve making ſort bearen hond hath nat well goddes vnderſtond goddes ſpeke amphibology ſothe tellen twenty lie eke drede fond firſt goddes ſuppoſe thus ſhall ſaine coward hert made amis goddes text gloſe ferde delphos ſtert make ſone convert done rede within day twey wol oblige dey trewly written wel find al thing ſaid good entent hart trewe kind towardes ſpake right ſhe ment ſhe ſtarfe wo nigh ſhe went purpoſe ever trewe thus writen werkes knew troilus hart eeres ſprad herde al thing deviſed fro verily ſeemed ſelve witte yet let go hart miſyave evermo finally gan herte wreſt truſten toke beſt great fury penaunce queint hope therewith hem betwene began joy amorous daunce birdes ſunne ſhene deliten ſonge leves greene right ſo wordes ſpake ifere deliten hem made hertes chere natheleſſe wending creſeide al world may nat mind ful oft pitouſly preide heſte might trewe find ſaid certes ye kind ye come day ſet troie ne ſhal never heale honor ne joie alſo ſothe ſunne vpriſt morow god ſo wiſely thou woful wretch reſt bring cruel ſorow wol ſelven ſlee ye dretch death though little retch yet er ye cauſen ſo ſmart dwel rather owne ſwete hart trewly mine owne lady dere ſleights yet herd ſtere ful ſhapely ben fallen ifere thus men ſaith yt one thinketh bere al another thinketh ledere ſire wiſe ſaid drede men may wiſe renne rede full harde halten vneſpied crepil craft father ſleight argus eied al movable biraft old ſleight yet ſo laft ye ſhal nat blende womanhede ne faine aright drede peace ſhal evermo betide peace erneſt ne game wote ſith calcas grekes ſide hath one ben loſt ſo foule name dare come ayen ſhame ought eſpie truſten ni fantaſie ye ſhal eke ſeen father ſhall gloſe ben wife well prech ſhal ſome greke ſo preiſe wel aloſe raviſhen ſhal ſpech done force ſhall tech troilus ye nil routh shall cauſeleſſe ſo ſterven trouth al father ſhall diſpiſe v al ſaine cite lorne thaſſege never ſhall ariſe grekes al ſworne til ben ſlaine doun walles torne thus ſhal word fere aie drede ye wol bleven ye ſhall eke ſene ſo many luſty knight among grekes ful worthineſſe ech hem hart wit might pleaſen done al buſineſſe ye ſhull dullen rudeneſſe lely troians routhe remorde vertue trouthe ſo grevouſe thinke fro breſt wol ſoule rende ne dredeleſſe may nat ſinke good opinion ye wende father ſleight woll v ſhende ye gone tolde yore thinke nam deed withouten humble true pitous hart thouſand time mercy pray reweth mine aſpre paine ſmart doth ſomwhat ſhall ſay let v ſteale away betwixt v tway thinke yt foly man may cheſe accident ſubſtaunce leſe meane thus ſens mowe day wel ſteale away ben togither ſo wit putten aſſay caſe ye ſhoulden father go ye mighten come ayen thus meane great follie put ſikerneſſe jeopardie vulgarly ſpeken ſubſtaunce treaſour may v lede ynough live honour pleaſaunce til vnto time ſhall ben dede thus may eſchewen drede every waie ye record mine hart iwis may therewith nat acord hardely ne dredeth poverte kin frendes el though comen bare ſherte v ſhould never lacke golde ne geere ben honoured dwelten go anone mine entent beſt ye woll aſſent creſeide ſigh right wiſe anſwerde iwis dere hart trew may well ſteale away ye deviſe finden ſuch vnthrifty way new afterward full ſore woll v rew helpe god ſo moſt nede cauſeleſſe ye ſuffren al drede thilke day cheriſhing drede father wight eſtate delite wedding falſe troilus knight saturnus doughter iuno miȝt wood achamante dwell eternally stix pit hell every god celeſtiall ſwere eke eche goddeſſe every nimphe deite infernall satiry fauny leſſe halve goddes ben wilderneſſe attropos threde life breſt falſe trowe leſt thou simois arowe clere throgh troy renneſt aie dounward y• ſee witneſſe word ſaid thilke day vntrewe troilus mine owne hart fre thou return backwarde thy well body ſoule ſinke hell ye ſpeake away thus go letten frendes god forbede woman ye ſhoulden ſo namely ſens troy hath ſuch nede helpe eke thing taketh hede wiſt life lay ballaunce honor god ſhild v fro miſchaunce ſo peace hereafter take day happeth anger game lord ſorow wo ye wolden make ye ne durſt come ayen ſhame ere ye ieoparden ſo name beth nat haſty hotte fare haſty man ne wanteth never care trowe ye people eke would ſay full light arede woulden ſay ſwere dout love ne drave nat done dede luſt voluptuous coward drede thus loſt iwis mine herte dere honour whiche ſhineth clere alſo thinketh mine honeſte floureth yet foul ſhould ſhend filth ſpotted ſhulde forme ſhould wend ne though lived unto world end name ſhould never ayenward win thus loſt routh ſin thy ſlee reaſon hete men ſain ſuffraunt overcommeth parde eke whoſo woll lefe lefe mote lete thus maketh vertue neceſſite patience thinke lord fortune aye naught woll retch ſhe ne daunteth wight wretch truſteth certes herte ſwete phebus ſuſter lucina ſhene lion paſſe arite woll withouten wene meane help iuno heaven quene tenth day death • aſſaile woll ſeene withouten faile ſo ſooth qd troilus ſhall well ſuffer unto tenth day sen ſee nede mote ben thus love god may let u ſtealen prively away ever one live reſt mine hert ſaieth woll beſt mercy god life qd ſhe ala ye ſlea thus tene ſee well ye miſtruſten wordes well iſene love scinthia ſhene miſtruſt nat thus cauſeleſſe routh sen true plight trouth thinketh well ſometime wit ſpend time time win ne parde lorne nat fro yet though ben day two atwin drive tho fantaſies within truſteth leaveth eke ſorow trouth wol nat live til morow ye wiſt ſore doth ſmart ye would ceſſe god thou woſt pure ſpirit weepeth mine hart ſeen weepen love moſt mote gone unto greekes hoſt ye nere wiſt remedy come ayen right wolde dy certes ſo nice wight ne imaginen way come ayen day hight may holden thing woll away father naught queint play thrift wending troy another day ſhall tourne u joy thy mine heart beſeke liſt done aught prayere love love eke ere departe fro ſo good comfort chere may ſeen ye may bring reſt hart point breſt pray qd ſhe tho herts ſoothfaſt ſuffiſaunce sith thine hole withouten mo abſent pleaſaunce fro remembraunce ever agaſt men rede love thing aye full buſie drede world liveth lady none ye vntrue god defend ſo betrayed wo begon trouth entend doubtleſſe iche wend nere dead ere ye cauſe find goddes love ſo beth ye nat unkind anſwered troilus ſeide god ni cauſe iwrie glad wi never unto creſeide sith thilke day ſaw firſt eye falſe ne never ſhall till die ſhort wordes well ye may leue ſhall found preue graunt mercy good hert mine iwis qd ſhe blisful venus let never ſterve er may ſtonde pleaſaunce degre quite well ſo well deſerve god wit conſerve ſhall ſo done ſo true found aie honour ward ſhall rebound truſteth well eſtate royall ne vaine delite onely worthineſſe werre turnay marciall ne pompe array nobley eke richeſſe ne made rue diſtreſſe moral vertue grounded upon trouth cauſe firſt routh eke gentle hart manhood ye ye thought diſpite every thing ſowned bad rudeneſſe peopliſh appetite reaſon bridled delite made aboven every creature ſhall may dure may length yeres itat fordoe ne remuableſt fortune deface iupiter might may doe ſorowfull glad ſo yeve v grace er night tenne meten place may harte mine ſuffiſe fareth well time ye riſe long yplained oft ikiſt ſtraite armes fold day gan riſe troilus clad rufully lady gan behold felt death care cold grace gan recommaund wo hold demaund man hedde imaginen ne ne entendement conſider ne tongue tell cruell paine ſorowfull man paſſen every torment doune hell ſaw ſhe ne might dwell ſoule hart rent withouten ye chamber went incipit liber quintus prochen gan fatall deſtine ioves hath diſpoſicioun angry parcas ſuſtren thre committeth done execucioun creſeide muſt toun troilus ſhall dwell forth pine till lacheſis threde lenger twine golden treſſed phebus high loft thriſe beames clere snowes molte zephirus oft brought ayen tender leaf grene sen ſonne eccuba quene began love firſt ſorow ſhe depart ſhould morow full redy prime diomede creſeide vnto grekes hoſte lede ſorow ſhe felt hart blede ſhe niſt beſt rede truely men bokes rede men wiſt never woman care ne ſo lothe toune fare troilus withouten rede lore man hath joy eke forlore waiting lady evermore ſhe ſothfaſt croppe luſt joyes tofore troilus farwell thy joie ſhalt thou never ſeen eft troie soth bode manere gan wofull manly hide well vnneth ſeen chere yate ſhe ſhould ride certain folke hoved abide wo bigon would plain horſe vnneth ſate pain ire quoke ſo gan hart gnaw diomede horſe gan dight ſayd vnto himſelfe ilke ſaw ala qd thus foule wretchedneſſe ſuffre nill redreſſe nat bet one die evermore langour thus crie nill make one rich poore inough done er ſhe go nill bring troie vpon roore nill ſlaen diomede alſo nill rather man two steale away woll endure nill helpen mine owne cure nolde done ſo fell deede ſhall ſain liſt ſpare hart alway maner drede leſt creſeide rumour fare ben ſlain lo al care el certain ſayd yore done withouten wordes creſeide ſhe redy ride full ſorowfully ſhe ſighed ſayd ala forth ſhe mote aught y• may betide forth ſhe rideth full ſorowfully apaas remedy caas wonder though ſore ſmart ſhe forgoeth owne ſwete hart troilus giſe curteſie hauke hond huge rout knight rode companie paſſing valey ferre without ferther would ridden doubt full faine wo gone ſo ſone tourne muſt eke done right antenor icome grekes hoſte every wight glad ſayd welcome troilus al nere harte light pained full might hold weping leaſt antenor kiſt made feaſt therewithal muſt leave take caſt iye upon pitouſly nere rode cauſe make take honde al ſoberly lorde ſo ſhe gan wepen tenderly full ſoft ſlighly gan ſele hold day doe deie courſer tourned face pale vnto diomede worde ſpake ne none rout ſonne tideus toke hede kouthe crede ſoche craft rain hent troilus troie homewards went diomede lad ye bridell whan ſaw folke troy away thought labor ſhall idell may ſomewhat ſhall ſay worſt ſhort may way heard ſay eke time twiſe twelve foole woll foryete ſelve natheleſſe thought well inough certainly naught ſpeake love make tought doubtleſſe ſhe thought geſſe may ibrought ſone away ſhall find meane ſhe nat yet wete ſhall meane diomede y• could good done gan fallen forth ſpech aske ſhe ſtood ſoth diſeaſe gan eke beſech encreaſen might ech thing eaſe ſhe ſhould commaunde ſaid done would truely ſwore knight ther na thing wch might pleſe nolde done pain al might done done hart eaſe prayed ſhe would ſorow appeaſe ſayd iwis greekes joy honouren well folke troy ſaid eke thus wot thinketh ſtrange wonder new thacquaintance theſe trojan change folke grece ye never knew would never god true greeke ye ſhould emong u find trojan eke kind bicauſe ſwore right ben frende helply might acquaintaunce eke ſtraunger wight fro forth pray day night commaundeth ſore ſmart done may like unto hart ye wold brother treat taketh frendſhip diſpite thouȝ ſorowes thing gret nat reſpite mine hart hath amend great delite may harmes nat redreſſe right ſory heavineſſe though ye trojan u geeekes wroth many day alway yet parde god love ſothe ſerven bothe love god lady free ſo ye hate beth wroth truely wight ſerve half ſo loth wrath would deſerve nere ſo nere tent calcas ſeen u may would tell mine entent enſealed till day yeve honde ſhall aie god helpe ſo y• life may dure owne aboven every creature thus ſaid never e • woman borne god mine hert wiſely glad ſo loved never woman beforne paramour ne never ſhall mo love god ſo lady dere complain right yet lere wondreth nought mine owne lady bright though y• ſpeake love thus blive heard many wight hath loved thing never ſaw live eke power ſtrive ayenſt god love obay woll alway mercy pray beeth ſo worthy knight place ye ſo faire everiche hem woll pain ſtonden grace might ſo faire grace fall ye ſervant would call lowly ne ſo truely ſerve nill none hem ſhall till ſterve creſeide unto purpoſe lite anſwerde ſhe ſorow oppreſſed ſo effect ſhe naught tale herde word two thought ſorowfull hart breſt two ſhe gan father ferre eſpie well nigh doune hors ſhe gan ſle natheleſſe ſhe thonketh diomede travaile good chere liſt frendſhip bede ſhe accepteth good manere woll fain lefe dere truſten ſhe would well ſhe might ſaied ſhe hors ſhe alight father hath armes nome twenty time kiſt doughter ſwete ſaied dere doughter mine welcome ſaid eke ſhe fain mete ſtode forth muet milde manſuete leave father dwell forth woll troilus tell troy come wofull troilus ſorow ſorowes ſmert felon loke face diſpitous tho ſodainly doune hors ſtert paleis ſwolne hert chamber went nothing toke bede ne none dare ſpeke worde drede ſorowes ſpared yave iſſue large death cride throwes frenetike mad curſeth iuno apollo eke cupide curſeth bachus cere cipride birth himſelfe fate eke nature ſave ladie every creature bed goth welleth turneth furie doeth ixion hell wiſe nigh till day ſojourneth tho began hart alite vnſwell teares y• gonnen vp wel pitiouſly cried vpon creſeide ſelf right thus ſpake ſeide mine owne lady lefe dere white breſt armes iyen clere yeſterday time may wepe alone many teare graſpe may place save pilow find naught embrace ſhal doen ſhal ſhe come ala let go would god tho ſlain hart mine creſeide ſwete fo lady mine love mo ever mine hart vowe see die ye nill reſcowe ſeeth right lodeſterre ſitteth right preſence comforten harte werre gon yeve ye audience ſpeaketh riȝt abſence ala wight care well wote evill ye fare ſhould thus ten day full endure whan firſt night tene ſhall ſhe eke ſorowfull creature tenderneſſe ſhall ſhe ſuſtene soche wo pitous pale grene shall freſhe womanly face langour er ye tourne vnto place whan fill ſlombrings anon begin ſhould grone dreamen dreadfulleſt thing might mete alone place horrible making aie mone meten emonges enemy hondes fall therewithall body ſhould ſtart ſtart ſodainly awake ſoche tremour fele hart feare body ſhould quake therwithall ſhould noiſe make ſeme though ſhould fall depe high alofe would wepe rewen himſelfe ſo pitouſly wonder fantaſie time ſhould mightely comfort himſelfe ſain folie cauſeleſſe ſoche drede drie eft begin aſpre ſorowes new every man might paine rew could tell fully diſcrive wo plaint langour pine nat men han live thou reader mayſt thy ſelf full well devine ſoche wo wit define vnidell write ſhould ſwinke wit werie thinke heaven yet ſterres ſeen although full pale iwoxen mone whiten gan oriſont ſhene eaſtward wont done phebus roſie carte ſone gan dreſſe vp fare troilus ſent pandare pandare day beforne ne might comen troilus ſe although hedde ſworne king priam alday lay nat liberte gon morow went troilus ſent hart could well devine troilus al night ſorow woke would tell pine knew well inough without boke chamber ſtreight ye way toke troilus tho ſoberly grette bedde full ſone gan ſette pandarus qd troilus ſorow drie may long endure trowe ſhall liven till morow would alwaies aventure thee deviſen ſepoulture forme movable thou diſpoen right thee ſemeth beſt doen fire flambe funerall body brennen ſhall glede feaſt play paleſtrall vigile pray thee take good hede well offer mar ſtede ſword mine helme leve brother dere ſhelde pallas yeve ſhineth clere poudre wch min hart ibrend ſhal turn pray thee thou take conſerve veſſell men clepeth vrne gold lady ſerve love thus pitouſly ſterve yeve doe pleaſaunce praien kepe remembraunce well fele maladie dreames yore ago certainly mote nedes die oule eke hight aſcaphilo hath ſhright theſe night two god mercurie wofull wretch ſoule guide thee liſt fetch pandare anſwerde ſaied troilus dere frende told thee yore follie ſorowen thus cauſeleſſe ſo woll trowen rede ne lore ſeen remedie let worchen fantaſie troilus pray thee tell thou trowe er wight hath loved paramour well thou ye god wot fro many worthy knight hath ladie gon fourtenight nat yet made halvendele fare nede maken care sen day day thou maiſt thy ſelven ſee love el wife man mote twinnen neceſſitie ye though love owne life yet nill himſelf thus maken ſtrife well thou woſt leve brother dere alway frendes may ifere done folke yt ſeen love wedded frendes might betideth full oft ſeen hem ſpouſes bedde ibedded god wote take wiſely faire ſoft good hope halt vp hert aloft time ſorow endure time hem hurteth time doth hem cure ſhouldeſt thou endure letten ſlide time fonde glad light ten dayes ni ſo long abide ſens ſhe comen thee hath behight nill heſt breaken wight drede thee ſhe nill finde way come ayen life durſt lay thy ſweuenes eke ſoch fantaſie drive let hem faren miſchaunce procede thy melancolie doth thee fele ſlepe penaunce ſtraw ſweuenes ſignifiaunce god helpe ſo caunt hem bean wot man aright wt dremes mean prieſtes temple tellen dreames reuelacions goddes al well tel iwis infernalles illuſions lech ſaine complections proceden faſt glotonie wot ſothe thus ſignifie eke ſaine impreſſions wight hath faſt thing mind thereof cometh ſoche aviſions ſain bokes find time yere kind men dreme theffect goth ye mone leve dreme nat done wel worth dream aie theſe old wife truly eke augurie theſe foules feare men wenen leſe life raven qualm ſchriching theſe oules trowen bothe falſe foule ala ala ſo noble creature man ſhould drede ſuch ordure al mine hart thee beſeche vnto thy ſelf thou foryeve riſe vp withouten ſpeche let v caſt forth may beſt driven time eke freſhly may liven ſhe cometh ye ſhall right ſone god helpe ſo beſt thus done riſe let v ſpeake luſtie life troy lad forth time drive eke time coming v rejoy bringen ſhall bliſſe ſo blive langour theſe twiſe day five ſhall therewith ſo foryet oppreſſe well vnneth done ſhall v dureſſe toune full lordes al truce laſten meane go plaien v ſome luſtie rout sarpedon hen mile thus thou ſhalt time well beguile drive forth vnto blisfull morow thou ſee cauſe thy ſorow riſe dere brother troilus certes non honour thee wepe thy bedde rouken thus truely thing truſt thou thus ligge day two three folke woll wene yt thou cowardiſe thee faineſt ſick thou darſt riſe troilus anſwerde brother dere folke know iſuffred pain though wepe make ſorowful chere feeleth harme ſmart every vain wonder though ever plain alway wepe nothing blame sen yt loſt ye cauſe game ſens fine force mote ariſe ſhall ariſe ſone ever may god mine hert ſacrifice ſend v haſtely tenthe day never foule ſo faine may ſhall ben yt ſhe cometh troie cauſe tourment joie whider thy rede qd troilus may play v beſt toun god counſaile qd pandarus ride play v king sarpedoun long ſpeaken vp doun till troilus gan laſt aſſent riſe forth sarpedon went sarpedon honourable ever live full hie proweſſe might iſerved table deintie coſte great richeſſe fedde hem day day ſuch nobleſſe ſaiden moſt eke leaſt never er day wiſte feaſt world none inſtrument delicious winde touche corde ferre wight hath ever iwent tonge tell harte may recorde yt feaſt well heard recorde ne lady eke ſo faire companie daunce er tho never iſeen eye availeth troilus ſorrow nothing rought ever one hert pitous full buſily creſeide lady ſought ever al hert thought ſo faſt imagining glad iwis feaſting theſe lady eke feaſt sen ſaw lady away ſorow upon hem ſeen heare inſtrumentes play ſhe hert hath kay abſent lo fantaſie wight ſhulde maken melodie na houre al day night ther man might ne ſayd loveſome lady bright ye faren ſins ye welcome iwis mine owne lady dere welaway na maſe fortune hove entended bet glaſe letter eke ſhe olde time iſent would alone rede hundred ſith atwixt noone prime refiguring ſhape womanhede within hert every worde dede paſſed thus drove end fourth day ſaied wol wend ſaid leve brother pandarus intendeſt thou ſhall bleve til sarpedon woll forth conveyen u yet fairer toke leve goddes love let u ſone eve leave take homeward let u turne trewely nill nat thus ſojourne pandare anſwerde comen hither fetchen fire rennen home againe god helpe ſo nat tellen whither might gone ſhall ſothly ſaine wight u faine sarpedon hence hie thus ſodainly hold vilanie ſaiden would bleve weke thus ſodainly fourth day take leve would wondren trewly let u holden forth purpoſe fermely ſens ye behighten abide hold forward let u ride pandarus pine wo made dwell wekes end sarpedon toke leave tho way ſpeden hem wend qd troilus lorde grace ſend may find mine home comming creſeide comen therwith gan ſing ye haſelwode thought pandare himſelfe ful ſoftly ſeide god wotte refroiden may hotte fare er calcas ſende troilus creſeide natheleſſe yaped thus ſeide ſwore iwis hert wel behight wolde come ſone ever ſhe might unto paleis ycomen troilus doun horſe alight ye chambre way nomen unto time gan night ſpeken creſeide lady bright hem leſt ſpede hem fro ſupper unto reſt morow ſone day began clere troilus gan ſlepe abreide pandarus brother dere loue god full pitouſly ſeide go ſeene paleis creſeide
