ſens yet may feeſt let u ſeine paleis leeſt therewithall meine blende cauſe fonde toune go creſeides houſe gan wende lorde ſely troilus wo thought ſorowful hart braſt atwo ſaw doores ſparred well nigh ſorow adoun gan fall therwith ware gan behold ſhet every window place froſt thought hert gan cold chaunged deedly pale face withouten worde forth gan pace god would gan ſo faſte ride wight countenance aſpide ſaid thus paleis deſolate houſe houſes whilom beſt ihight paleis empty diſconſolate thou lanterne queint light paleis whilom day art night wel oughteſt thou fall die sen ſhe went wont u gie paleis whilom crowne houſes enlumined ſunne bliſſe ring rubie fall cauſe wo cauſe haſt ben bliſſe yet ſens may bet fain would kiſſe thy colde doores durſt rout farewel ſhrine ſaint therwith caſt pandarus eie changed face pitous behold might time aright aſpie aie rode pandarus told new ſorow eke joyes old petouſly ſo deed hew every wight might ſorow rew fro thence forth rideth vp doune every thing came remembraunce rode forth place toune whilom pleaſaunce lo yonder ſaw mine owne lady daunce temple eien clere caught firſt right lady dere yonder herde full luſtely dere hart laugh yonder play saw one eke ful bliſfully yonder one gan ſhe ſay good ſweete love well pray yonde ſo goodly gan ſhe behold death mine hart hold corner yonder houſe herde mine alderleveſt lady dere womanly voice melodiouſe singen ſo wel ſo goodly ſo clere ſoule yet thinketh bliſfull ſowne yonder place lady firſt toke vnto grace thouȝt thus bliſful lord cupide proceſſe memory thou haſt weried every ſide men might booke make like ſtory nede thee ſeeke victory sen thine holly thy joy haſt thou thine owne folke ſpill wel haſt thou lord iwroke thine ire thou mighty god dredful greve mercy lord thou woſt wel deſire thy grace moſt luſtes leve live die wol thy beleve ne aske guerdon bone thou creſeide ayen ſend ſone diſtraine hart faſt returne thou doeſt mine longen ſee wote wel ſhe nil nat ſojourne bliſful lord ſo cruel thou ne vnto blood troy pray thee iuno vnto blode thebane ye folke thebe cauȝt bane yates went creſeide rode full good paas vp doun made many went ſelfe ful oft ſaid ala fro hence rode bliſſe ſolas would bliſful god joie might ſene ayen come troie yonder hil gan guide ala toke leve yonde ſaw father ride ſorow mine hart ſhal cleve hither home come eve dwell caſt joie ſhal til may ſene eft troie ſelfe imagined oft ben defaited pale woxen leſſe wont men ſaiden ſoft may ſothe geſſe troilus hath al hevineſſe al na melancolie ſelfe ſuch fantaſie another time imaginen would every wight went wey routh ſaine ſhould right ſory troilus wol dey thus drove day yet forth twey ye herde ſuch life gan lede ſtode betwixen hope drede liked ſonges ſhewe thencheſon wo beſt might made ſonge wordes fewe somwhat wofull hart light every man ſight ſofte voice lady dere abſent gan ſing ye may ſterre loſt light hart ſore wel ought bewaile ever derke turment night night toward deth winde ſtere ſaile tenth night faile guiding thy bemes bright houre ſhip caribdes woll devoure ſong thus ſongen ſone fel ayen ſighes old every night wont done ſtode bright moone behold al ſorow moone told ſaid iwis whan thou art horned new ſhal glad al world trew ſaw thine horne old eke morow whan hence rode right lady dere cauſe turment ſorow bright lucina clere love god ren faſt thy ſphere whan thine horne new ginnen ſpring ſhall ſhe come may bliſſe bring day lenger every night ben wont thought tho ſunne went courſe vnright lenger way wont go ſaid iwis drede evermo ſunnes ſonne pheton live father cart amiſſe drive vpon wals faſt eke would walke greekes hoſt would ſee himſelfe right thus would talke lo yonder mine owne lady free elſe yonder tent bee thence commeth aire ſo ſoote ſoule fele doth boote hardly wind thus ſtoundmeale encreaſeth face lady deepe ſighes ſore preve thus none ſpace toune ſave place feele wind ſouneth ſo like paine ſaith ala twined twaine long time driveth forth right thus till fully paſſed ninth night aye beſide pandarus buſily full might comfort make hart light yeving hope alway tenth morow ſhe ſhal comen ſtinten ſorow vpon ſide eke creſeide woman among y• grekes ſtrong full oft day ala ſhe ſeide borne well may mine hart long death live long ala ne may amend worſe ever yet wend father nill nothing doe grace gone ayen aught queme ſo terme pace troilus ſhall heart deme falſe ſo may well ſeme thus ſhall vnthonke every ſide borne ſo welaway tide put jeopardie ſteale away night befall caught ſhall hold aſpie el lo drede moſt honds ſome wretch fall nam loſt mine heart trew mightie god thou ſorow rew full pale iwoxen bright face limmes leane ſhe day stode ſhe durſt loked place ſhe borne dwelt aye night weeping ala ſhe lay thus diſpeired cure lad life wofull creature full oft day ſhe ſighed eke diſtreſſe ſelfe ſhe wene aye purtraying troilus great worthineſſe goodly word recording sen firſt day love began ſpring thus ſhe ſet wofull hart afire remembrance y• ſhe gan deſire world ni ſo cruell hart heard complainen ſorow nold wepten pain ſmart tenderly ſhe wept eve morow needed teares borow yet worſt paine ther wight ſhe durſt plain full rewfully ſhe looked vpon troy beheld toures high eke y• hallis ala qd ſhe pleaſaunce joy turned gall oft within yonder wallis troilus doeſt thou ſhe • ide lord whether thou yet thinke vpon creſeide ala ne itrowed lore went ye redde ere ſighed halfe ſo ſore might ſaid done amis ſteale away ſuch one late commeth lectuarie men corſe vnto graue carie late ſpeke matere prudence ala one thine eyen three lacked alway ere came time paſſed well remembred mee preſent time eke would well ſee future time ere ſnare could ſeene cauſeth care natheleſſe betide betide ſhal morow night eaſt weſt hoaſt ſteale ſome ſide gone troilus leſt purpoſe woll hold ye beſt force wicked tongue • onglerie ever love wretch endie ſo woll every word take hede rule hem every wight wit ne ſhall never thriven drede ſome men blamen ever yet lo manner folke commenden ſuch variaunce felicitie clepe ſuff •• aunce withouten word mo troy woll concluſioun god wote ere fully moneths two full ferre fro ententioun troilus troy toun shall knotleſſe throughout hart ſlide ſhe woll take purpoſe abide diomede tell gan goth within himſelfe aye arguing ſleight ever may beſt ſhorteſt tarying nerre creſeides heart bring entent couth never fine fiſhen laid booke line natheleſſe well hart thought ſhe na nat without love troy never ſithen thence brought ne couth ſeene laugh maken joy niſt beſt hart taco • e taſſey ſaid nought ne greveth y• naught aſſaieth naught atcheveth yet ſaid himſelfe vpon night nat foole wote well wo love another wight hereupon gone aſſay may well wete nill nat ben prow wiſe folke bookes expreſſe men ſhall nat wo wight hevineſſe ſo might winnen ſuch floure fro ſhe mourneth night day 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 might ſaine conquerour right anone bold aye thought hart hap hap may ſhould dye woll heart ſeech ſhall leſen ſpeech diomede bookes u declare nedes preſt courageous ſtern voice mighty limmes ſquare hardy teſtife ſtrong chevalrous deedes like father tideus ſome men ſaine tonge large heire calcidony arge creſeide meane ſtature thereto ſhape face eke chere might ben fairer creature oft time manere gone itreſſed haires clere downe colere backe behind thred gold ſhe would bind ſave browes joyneden ifere na lacke aught eſpien ſpeaken eyen clere lo truly written ſeien paradis ſtood formed eien rich beauty evermore strove love aie wch hem ſobre eke ſimple wiſe withall beſt inoriſhed eke might bee goodly ſpeech generall charitable eſtately luſty free ne nevermore ne lacked pitee tender hearted ſliding corage truly cannat tell age troilus well woxen hight complete formed proportioun well y• kind naught amenden might young freſh ſtrong hardy lioun trew ſteele ech conditioun one beſt entetched creature ſhall yt world may dure certainely ſtory fond troilus never unto wight time degree ſecond daring longeth knight might giaunt paſſen might hart aye ye firſt beſt stood peregall dare done leſt tellen forth diomede fill tenthe day sen creſeide city yede diomede freſh braunch may came tent calcas lay fained calcas done ment ſhall tellen ſone creſeide ſhort wordes tell welcommed downe ſette ethe ynough maken dwell withouten long lette ſpices wine men forth hem fette forth ſpeke ifere friend done ſome ſhall ye gan firſt fallen warre ſpeech betwixen hem folke troy toun thaſſiege gan eke beſeech tellen opinioun fro demaund ſo diſcendeth doun asken ſtraunge thought greek giſe werkes yt wrought father tarieth ſo long wedden unto ſome worthy wight creſeide paine ſtrong love troilus owne knight ferforth ſhe cunning might anſwerde tho entent ſeemed nat ſhe wiſte ment natheleſſe ilke diomede gan himſelfe aſſure thus ſeide aright taken hede methinketh thus lady mine creſeide ſens firſt hond bridle leide came troy morrow ne might never ſeene ſorrow nat ſaine may cauſe love ſome trojan right ſore would thinken ye wight dwelleth shoulden ſpill quarter tere pitouſly ſelven ſo begile dredeleſſe nat worth folke troy ſaith ſome priſon ben ye ſelven ſee fro thence ſhall nat one live come gold wixen ſunne ſee truſteth well underſtondeth mee ſhall nat one mercy gone live lord worldes twiſe five wrech hem fetching heleine ſhall take ere hence wend maunes yt goddes ben peine shall ben agaſt grekes wol hem ſhend men ſhall drede unto world end henceforth raviſhen queene cruell ſhall wreche hem ſeene calcas lede u ambage ſaine double wordes ſlie men clepen word two viſages ye ſhall well knowen nat ne lie thing right ſene eie anon ye nill nat trow ſoone taketh hede doone wene ye wiſe father would yeven antenor anone ne wiſt city ſhould deſtroied ben nay ſo mote gone knew full well ſhall nat ſcapen one troian great fere durſt nat ye dwelt lenger woll ye loveſome lady dere let troy troians fro heart paſſe drive y• bitter hope make good chere clepe ayen beautie face ye ſalt teares ſo deface troy brought ſuch ieopardie ſave remedie thinketh well ye ſhall grekes find perfite love ere night troian kind bet ſerven woll done might ye vouchſafe lady bright woll ben ſerven ſelve ye lever lord greces twelve word gan waxen reed ſpeech little quoke caſt aſide little heed ſtint afterward woke ſoberly threw loke ſaid albeit joy gentill man wight troy father tideus ſeide lived ere calcidonie arge king creſeide ſo hope ſhall iwis ſlaine ala harme vnhappily thebe rathe polimite many man ſcathe hart mine ſithe man ben firſt feche grace ſerve heartely ever ſhall live ſpace ere depart place ye woll graunte may morow better laiſer tell ſorow ſhuld tell wordes ſeide ſpake ynough day meſt preveth well ſpake ſo creſeide graunted morrow requeſt ſpeake leaſt nolde ſpeake ſuch matere thus ſhe ſaid ye mowe ſhe hart troilus faſt may none arace ſtraungely ſhe ſpake ſaied thus diomede love ilke place borne ioves thy grace deliver ſoone doth care god thy might ſo leve well fare grekes wold wrath troy wreke might know well iwis ſhall naught befallen ye ſpeke god toforne farther wote father wiſe ready hath bought ye told dere vnto hold grekes ben high conditioun wote eke well certaine men ſhall find worthie folke within troy toun conning perſite kinde ben betwixte orcades inde ye could well lady ſerve trow eke well thonke deſerve ſpeake loue iwis ſhe ſeide lord wedded whole mine hart till deide love helpe pallas mine hart ni ne never ye ben noble high kinrede well herde tellen drede y• doth ſo great wonder ye woll ſcornen woman ſo eke god wote love ben fer aſonder diſpoſed bet ſo mote go vnto death plaine make wo ſhall done ſay truely yet liſt nat play mine hart tribulatioun ye armes buſie day day hereafter ye wonnen toun paraventure ſo happen may ſee never ere ſey woll werke yt never ere wrought word ynough ſuffiſen ought morow eke wol ſpeken faine ye touchen naught matere liſt ye may come againe ere ye gone thus much ſay helpe pallas haires clere ſhould greeke routh ſhulde ſelven trouth ſay nat therefore woll love ne ſay nat nay concluſioun meane well god ſit therewithall ſhe caſt eien doun gan ſigh ſaid troilus troy toun yet bidde god quiet reſt may ſeene mine hart breſt effect ſhortly ſay diomede freſhly new againe gan preaſen faſt mercy pray ſoothe ſaine gloue toke full faine finally woxen eve well roſe tooke leve bright venus folowed aie taught way brode phebus doune alight cithera chare horſe taught whirle lion ſhe might signifer candle ſheweth bright creſeide vnto bed went within father faire bright tent retourning ſoule aye vp doun wordes ſuddaine diomede great eſtate perill toun ſhe alone nede friendes help thus began brede cauſe ſoothe tell tooke fully purpoſe dwell morow came ghoſtly ſpeke diomede come vnto creſeide ſhortly leaſt ye tale breke well himſelfe ſpake ſeide ſighes ſore doune leide finally ſoothe ſaine reſt great paine ſtory telleth v ſhe yave faire bay ſtede ſhe one wan troilus eke brooch little nede troilus ſhe yave diomede eke bet ſorow releve made weare pencell ſleve find eke ſtories elſewhere body hurt diomede troilus tho wept ſhe many tere ſhe ſaw wide wound blede ſhe tooke kepen good hede healen ſmart men ſaine ſhe yave hart truely ſtorie telleth v made never woman wo ſhe ſhe falſed troilus ſaid ala clene ago name trouth love evermo falſed one gentilleſt ever one worthieſt ala vnto worldes end shall neither ben iwritten iſong good word theſe bokes woll ſhend irolled ſhall many • ong throughout world bell ſhall rong woman moſt woll hate ala ſuch caas ſhould fall woll ſaine much hem done diſhonour welaway firſt amis helpeth done blame away ſens ſee better way late rue diomede woll algate true troilus ſens better may ſens thus departen ye yet pray god ſo yeve right good day gentilleſt knight truely ever ſaw ſerven faithfully beſt aye lady honour kepe word ſhe braſt anon wepe certes ne haten ſhall never friendes love ſhall ye good word ſhould liven ever truly would right ſorrie ſeene adverſite guiltleſſe wot well leave ſhall paſſe thus take leave truly long bitwene ſhe forſoke diomede none authour telleth wene take every man bookes hede ſhall terme finden drede though began woe ſone ere wan yet done ne ne liſt ſillie woman chide ferther ſtorie woll de viſe name ala publiſhed ſo wide gilt ought ynough ſuffiſe might excuſe wiſe ſhe ſo ſorrie vntrouth iwis would excuſe yet routh troilus told thus driveth forth wel hath might oft heart hote cold namely ilke ninth night morrow ſhe behight come ayen god wote full little reſt night nothing ſlepe leſt laurer crowned phebus heat gan courſe aie vpward went warmen eaſt ſea wave wete circe doughter ſong freſh entent troilus pandare ſent wals towne pleide looke ſeene aught creſeide till noone ſtooden ſee came every maner wight came fro ferre ſaiden ſhee till coulden knowen aright heart dull light thus beyaped ſtooden ſtare naught troilus pandare pandarus troilus tho ſeide aught wot noone ſikerly toune ne cometh creſeide hath ynough done hardely winnen father ſo trow old father woll yet make dine ere ſhe go god yeve hart pine pandarus anſwerd may well certain thy let v dine thee beſeech noone maiſt thou come home go without ſpeech comen ayen long may ſeech ere find gape fortune hem thinketh yape qd troilus ſee well ſhe taried old father ſo ere ſhe come woll nigh even come forth woll vnto yate go theſe porter ben vnkonning • vermo woll done hem holden vp yate naught ne although ſhe come late day goth faſt came eve yet came nat troilus creſeide looketh forth hedge tree greve ferre head wall leide laſt tourned ſeide god wote meaning pandare almoſt iwis new care doubtleſſe lady good wote ſhe commeth riding prively commend wiſedome mine hood woll nat maken people nicely gaure y• ſhe commeth ſoftely night toune ſhe thinketh ride dere brother thinke nat long abide naught el done iwis pandarus wilt thou trowen trouth ſee yond ſhe heave thine eyen man mayſt thou nat ſee pandare anſwerde nay ſo mote thee al wrong god wt ſaiſt thou man wher art ſee yonde afarre ni cart ala thou ſayſt right ſooth qd troilus hardely nought mine hart rejoyce thus ayenſt ſome good thought nat ſens yt wrought ne felt ſuch comfort dare ſay cometh night life yt durſt lay pandarus anſwerde may well inough held ever ſaied hart thought ſoft lough himſelfe full ſoberly ſaied haſell wood jolly robin plaied shall come thou abideſt ye farwell ſnow ferne yere wardein yates gan call folk yt without yates bad hem driven beaſts night muſt bleven ferre within night many tere troilus gan homeward ride well ſeeth helpeth nat abide natheleſſe gladded thought miſacompted day ſaied underſtand amis thilke night laſt creſeide ſey ſayd ſhall ben may ere moone dere hart ſwete lion paſſe ariete ſhe may yet hold beheſt morrow unto yate went doune weſt eke eaſt vpon wall made many went naught hope alway blent night ſorow ſighes ſore went home withouten hope cleane hart fled ne hath whereon lenger hong y• paine thought hart bled throw ſharp wonder ſtrong ſaw ſhe abode ſo long niſt judgen might sen ſhe hath broken yt ſhe behight third fourth fift ſixt day tho dayes tenne told betwixen hope drede hart ſay yet ſomewhat truſting heſtes old ſaw ſhe nolde terme hold ſeene none remedie ſhape ſoone die therwith wicked ſpirit god u bleſſe men clepen wood jealouſie gan crepe hevineſſe becauſe would ſoone die ne eat ne dronke melancholie eke every company fled life time led ſo defaite manner man vnneth might knowen went leane thereto pale wan feeble walketh potent ire thus himſelfe ſhent ſo asked whereof ſmart ſayd harme hart priam full oft eke mother dere bretherne ſuſtren gan frain ſo ſorrowfull chere thing ye cauſe pain naught nolde cauſe plain ſayd felt grievous maladie hart faine would die day laid ſlepe ſo befell ſlepe thought forreſt faſt walked wepe love ye theſe paine wrought doune forreſt ſought met ſaw bore tuskes great ſlept ayenſt bright sunnes heat bore faſt armes fold lay kiſſing aye lady bright creſeide ſorrow gan behold diſpite ſlepe breide loude cried pandarus ſeide pandarus know crop root nam dead ni none boot lady bright creſeide hath betraied truſted moſt wight elſewhere hath hart apaied bliſfull god great might dreame iſhewed full right thus dreame creſeide behold thing pandarus told creſeide ala ſubtelte new luſt beauty ſcience wrath juſt cauſe ye guilt fell experience hath rafte ala thine advertence truſt faith depe aſſuraunce hath raft creſeide pieaſaunce ala let hence go well nigh wit breide ſhall trow othes mo god wote wend lady bright creſeide every word goſpell ye ſeide may bet beguile liſt men wenen beſt triſt ſhall done pandarus ala fele ſo ſharpe new paine sen remedy caas bet mine honds twaine ſelven ſlow alway thus plaine ye death wo ſhuld end every day life ſelf ſhend pandare anſwerde ſaid ala y• borne nat ſaied er dreames many manner man beguile folke expounden hem amis darſt thou ſaine falſe thy lady dreame right thine drede let thought thou canſt dream rede peraventure thou dremeſt bore may ſo may ſignifie father old eke hore ayen ſunne lieth point die ſhe ſorow ginneth wepe crie kiſſeth lieth ground thus ſhuldeſt thou thy dreme aright expound might doen qd troilus know yea neuer ſo lite ſayſt thou wiſely qd pandarus rede ſens thou canſt well endite haſtily letter thou write wch thou ſhalt well bringen know ſooth thou art dout ſee dare well ſain ſo ſhe untrue cannot trowen ſhe woll write ſhe write thou ſhalt full ſone iſee whether ſhe hath liberte come ayen el ſome clauſe ſhe let ſhe woll aſſigne cauſe thou haſt written ſens ſhe went ſhe thee durſt lay may ſuch cauſe ben entent hardely thou wolt thy ſelven ſay abode beſt tway write thou ſhalt fele ſone ſooth done accorded ben concluſioun anon theſe like lord two haſtely ſate troilus adoun rolleth hart fro may beſt deſcriven wo creſeide owne lady dere wrote right thus ſaid ye may ¶the copy letter right freſh flour whoſe ben ſhall withouten part elſewhere ſerviſe hart body life luſt thought wofull wight every humble wiſe tong tell hart may deviſe oft matter occupieth place recommaund unto noble grace liketh weten ſweete hart ye well know long time agon ye left aſpre paine ſmart ye went yet bote non non ever worſe bigon fro day day ſo mote dwell liſt wele wo well dredefull hart trew write ſorow driveth write wo every houre encreaſeth new complaining dare endite defaced may ye wite teares wch mine eyen rain wulden ſpeke durſt plain firſt beſeech eyen clere looke defouled nat hold ye lady dere woll vouchſafe letter behold cauſe eke care cold ſlaeth wit aught amis ſtart foryeve mine owne ſweet hart ſeruaunt durſt ought right vpon lady pitouſly complaine wene ought wight conſidred ye theſe moneths twaine raried ye ſaiden ſooth ſaine tenne day ye nolde hoſte ſoiourne two moneths yet ye retourne much mote nedes like liſt dare nat plaine humbly ſorowfull ſighes ſike right mine vnreſtie ſorowes ſore fro day day deſiring evermore knowen fully ye fared ye whoſe welfare heale eke god encreaſe honour ſuch vpward degree grow alway ſo never ceaſe right hart aye lady free deviſe pray god ſo mote graunt ſoone vpon rew wiſely inall trew liketh knowen fare whoſe wo ther may wight diſcrive cheſt every care writing letter live redy wofull ghoſt drive delay hold yet hond vpon ſight matter ſond mine eyen two vaine ſee ſorowfull teres ſalt arne woxen wellis ſong plaint mine adverſite good harm mine eaſe eke woxen hell joy wo ſey nought elli tourned life warie every joy eaſe contrarie wch coming home ayen troy ye may redreſſe thouſand ſithe ever encreaſen joy never hart yet ſo blithe ſave life ſhall ben ſwithe ſee though manner routh meuen yet thinketh trouth ſo gilt hath death deſerved liſt vpon ſee guerdon yet ſerved beſeeeh mine owne lady free herevpon ye woulden write love god right lodeſterre death may make end al werre cauſe aught doth dwell letter ye may recomfort though abſence hell patience woll wo comfort letter hope woll diſport writeth ſwete let thus nat plaine hope death delivereth fro paine iwis mine owne dere hert trew wote ye next vpon ſee loſt mine heale eke mine hew creſeide ſhall conne knowen iwis mine herts day lady free thurſteth aye mine hert behold beautie vnneth life hold ſay ſey well tell may whether ye live dey yet pray god ſo yeve right good day fareth well goodly faire freſh may ye life death may commaund trouth aye recomaund heale ſuch ye yeven ſame heale ſhall none heale lieth liſt ſo day clothen ſhall grave life might ſave fro diſeaſe paine ſmart fare well mine owne ſweet hart la voſtre letter forth ſent vnto creſeide anſwere effect full pitouſly ſhe wrote ayen ſeide ſo ſoone ſhe might iwis would come amend amis finally ſhe wrote ſaied would come ye ſhe niſt letter made ſhe ſuch feaſts wonder ſwore ſhe loved beſt found bottomleſſe biheſts troilus thou mayſt eaſt weſt pipe iuie leafe yt thee leſt thus goth world god ſhild v fro miſchaunce every wight yt meaneth trouth avaunce encreaſen gan wo fro day night troilus tarying creſeide leſſen gan hope eke might doun bedde leide ne eat dronke ne ſlept ne word ſeide imagining aye ſhe vnkind wel nigh wext mind dreme wch told eke beforne may never come remembraunce thought aye well lady lorne ioves purveyaunce ſhewed ſleepe ſignifiaunce vntrouth diſaventure bore ſhewed figure sibille ſuffer ſent called caſſandre eke dreame told ere ſtent ſought aſſoilen dout ſtrong bore tuskes ſtout finally within little ſtound caſſandre gan thus dreme expound gan firſt ſmile ſaid brother dere thou ſooth deſireſt know thou muſt old ſtories purpoſe fortune overthrow hath lord old within throw thou ſhalt bore know kind comen men bookes find diane wroth ire greekes nolde done sacrifice ne incens vpon alter ſet fire greekes gon ſo diſpiſe wrake wonder cruell wiſe bore great oxe ſtall made vp frete corne vine ſlea yt bore country raiſed emong came bore maid one world beſt ipraiſed meleager lord countre loved ſo freſh maiden free manhood ere would ſtent bore ſlough hed ſent old bookes tellen v roſe conteke great envie lord diſcended tideus line el old bookes lie meleager gan die mother woll tell long dwell told eke tideus ere ſhe ſtent vnto ſtrong citie thebe claimen kingdome citie went fellawe dan polimites brother dan ethiocles full wrongfully thebe held yt ſtrength told ſhe proeſſe length told eke hemonides affart tideus ſtough fiftie knightes ſtout told eke propheſies hart ſeven king rout beſiegeden citie holy serpent well fury ſhe gan tell aſſociat profugus tideus primo polynicem tidea ligatum docet inſidiaſque ſecundo tertius harmoniam canit vatem latitantem quartus habet reges ineuntes praelia ſeptem lemniadum furiae quinto narrantur anguis archemori buſtum ſexto ludique ſeguuntur dat thebis vatem graiorum ſeptimus umbris octavo cecidit tideus ſpes vita pelaſgum hippomedon nono moritur cum parthenopeo fulmine percuſſus decimo capaneus ſuperatur undecimo perimunt ſeſe per vulnera fratres argivum flentem narrat duodenus ignem archinories burying play amphiorax fill ground tideus ſlaine lord argeis hippomedon little ſtound dreint dead parthenope wound alſo campaneus proud thunder dint ſlaine y• cried loud gan eke tell y• either brother ethiocles polimites alſo ſcarmiſhe eche hem ſlough argiues weeping mo toun brent ſhe told eke tho tho diſcended doun leſtes old diomede thus ſhe ſpake told like bore betokeneth diomede tideus ſon doun deſcended fro meleager made bore blede thy lady ſo ſhe iwis diomede hert hath ſhe weep thou wolt leave dout diomede thou art thou ſayſt ſooth qd thou ſorcereſſe thy falſe ghoſt prophecie thou weneſt great devinereſſe ſeeſt thou nat foole fantaſie painen lady lie away qd ioves yeve ſorow ſhalt fals peraventure yet morow well thou mighteſt lien good alceſte creature men lie ever kindeſt beſt husbond ieopardie die himſelfe ſhe would die cheſe die hell ſtarfe anon v bookes tell caſſandre goeth cruell hart foryate wo anger ſpeech fro bedde ſuddainly ſtart though hole made ſeech day day gan require ſeech ſooth full cure thus driveth forth aventure fortune permutation thing hath committed purveyaunce diſpoſition high iove reignes ſhall ben flitted fro folk folk ſhal ben ſmitted gan pull away feather bright troy fro day day till ben bare joy emong fine ieopardie hector gan approchen wonder blive fate would ſoule ſhould vnbodie ſhapen meane drive ayenſt fate helpeth ſtrive day fighten gan wend ala caught life end wch thinketh every manner wight haunteth armes ought bewaile death yt ſo noble knight drough king thauentaile vnware achilles y• maile bodie gan rive thus worthy knight reft live old bookes tellen u made ſuch wo yt tong may nat tell namely ſorow troilus next worthineſſe ye well wo gan troilus dwell ſorow love unreſt full oft day heart breſt natheleſſe tho gon diſpaire drede aye lady untrue yet aye hart gan repaire theſe lover done ſought aye new get ayen creſeide bright hew hart went excuſing calcas cauſed tarying oft time purpoſe great himſelven like pilgrime diſguiſe ſeene may counterfeat ben unknowen folke wiſe find excuſe aright may ſuffiſe among grekes knowen wept full oft many tere wrote yet oft time new full pitouſly left nat ſlouth beſeeching ſens true ſhe wol come ayen ſhold trouth creſeide upon day routh take ſo touching matere wrote ayen ſaid ye may cupides ſonne enſample goodlihede ſwerde knighthood ſours gentilneſſe might wight turment drede healeleſſe ſend yet gladneſſe heartleſſe ſicke diſtreſſe sen ye may deale neither ſend hart may heale letter full paper iplainted conceived hath mine heart pite eke ſeene teares depainted letter ye requiren come ayen yet ne may leaſt yt letter founden mention ne make fere grevous god wote unreſt haſt goddes ordinaunce ſeemeth nat ye take beſt thing ni remembraunce thinketh pleaſaunce beth wroth beſeech tary wicked ſpeech heard well wend touching u two thinges iſtond ſhall diſſimuſing amend beth nat wroth eke underſtond yene holden hond force nat geſſe trouth gentilneſſe come woll yet ſuch disjoint ſtond wt yere day ſhall nat appoint effect pray may good word friendſhip aye truly life may dure friend ye may aſſure yet pray evill ye ne take ſhort write dare nat well letter make ne never yet ne could well endite eke great effect men write place lite thentent nat letter ſpace fareth well god grace la voſtre c troilus thought letter ſtraunge ſaw ſorowfully ſight thought like kalends eſchaunge finally full ne trowen might ſhe ne would holden yt ſhe hight ful evell liſt leve loveth well ſuch caſe though greve natheleſſe men ſaine laſt thing men ſhall ſoothe ſee ſuch caſe betide faſt troilus well underſtood ſhe na nat ſo kind ought finally wote dout loſt hath ben stood day melancholy troilus ſuſpectioun wend dye ſo befell throughout troy toun yt guiſe iborne doun manner cote armoure ſaith ſtory beforne deiphebe inſigne victory cote telleth lollius deiphebe rent fro diomede ſame dayand troilus ſaw gan taken hede viſing length brede werke gan behold full ſodainly heart gan cold coler found within brooch creſeide yave morow ſhe troy muſt nedes twin remembraunce ſorow ſhe laid ayen faith borow keepe aye full well wiſt lady na longer trift goth home gan full ſoone ſend pandarus newe chaunce broch told word end complaining harte variaunce long love trouth pennaunce death without word full faſt cried reſt reſtore ſpake thus lady mine creſeide faith beheſt love trouth ſeide diomede ye feſt ala would trowed leaſt ſens ye nolde trouthe ſtond ye thus nolde holden hond ſhall trowen othes mo ala never would wend ere ye creſeide could chaunged ſo ne agilt done amis cruell wend nat hart iwis ſlea thus ala name trouth fordone routh none broche liſt lete feaſt new love qd thilke broche teres wete yave remembraunce none cauſe ala ne ye diſpite eke ye ment utterly ſhewen entent wch ſee y• clene mind ye caſt ne may world within mine hart find unloven quarter day curſed time borne welaway done wo endure yet love beſt creature god qd ſend yet grace may meten diomede truely might ſpace yet ſhall make hope ſides blede god qd aughteſt taken hede forthren trouth wronges punice nilt thou vengeance vice pandarus dremes trift blamed haſt wont art oft upbreide mayſt thou ſeen thy ſelf yt thee liſt trew thy niece bright creſeide ſundry formes god wote ſeide god ſhewen joy tene ſlepe dreme ſene certainely withouten ſpeech henceforth ferforth may mine owne death armes woll ſeech retch nat ſoone day truly creſeide ſweet maie might iſerved ye thus done nat deſerved pandarus theſe thing herd wiſt well ſaid ſooth nat word ayen anſwerd ſorrie friend ſorrow ſhamed nece hath done amis ſtant aſtonied theſe cauſes twey ſtill ſtone word ne could ſey laſt thus ſpake ſeide brother dere may thee ſhould ſaine hate iwis creſeide god wote woll hate evermore thou beſoughteſt done yore vnto mine honour ne reſt right regard thee leſt aught might liken thee lefe treaſon god wote ſorrow dredeleſſe heart eaſe right faine would amend wiſt fro world almighty god pray deliver ſoone ſay great ſorow plaint troilus forth courſe fortune aye gan hold creſeide loveth ſonne tideus troilus mote wepe care cold world ſo behold eche eſtate little hart reſt god leve v take beſt many cruell battaile drede troilus ilke noble knight men may theſe old bookes rede ſeen knighthood great might dredeleſſe ire day night full cruelly grekes aye abought alway moſt diomede ſought oft time find mette bloody ſtrokes word great aſſaying ſpeares whette god wote many cruell heat gan troilus vpon helme beat natheleſſe fortune naught ne would others hond either dien ſhould itaken write armes ilke worthy man would battailes endite writen firſt began love ſaid worthy deed ſo liſt hem rede dare tell hem ifere beſeeching every lady bright hew every gentill woman ſhe albeit creſeide vntrew gilt ye nat wroth ye may gilt bookes ſee gladder would write leſt penelope trouth good alceſte ne ſay nat onely theſe men moſt woman betraied throgh fals folk god yeve hem ſorow amen great wit ſubtilte betraien meveth ſpeake effect pray beth ware men herkeneth ſay go little booke go little tregedie god maker yet ere die ſend might make ſome comedie little booke make thou none envie ſubject ben vnto poeſie kiſſe ſteps whereas thou ſeeſt pace vergil ovid homer lucan stace ſo great diverſite engliſh writing tong pray god none miſwrite thee ne thee miſſe metre defaut tong redde ſo thou el ſong thou vnderſtond god beſeech yet purpoſe rather ſpeech wrath began ſey troilus greekes boughten dere thouſands honds maden dey withouten pere save time hector welaway ſave onely goddes diſpitouſly ſlough fierce achill ſlain manere light ghoſt full bliſfully went vp hollowneſſe ſeventh ſphere place leting everiche element ſaw full aviſement erratike ſterres herkening armonie ſownes full heaven melodie doun thence faſt gan aviſe little ſpot earth ſee enbraced fully gan deſpiſe wretched world held vanite reſpect plaine felicite heaven laſt ſlaine looking doun caſt himſelfe lough right wo hem wepten death ſo faſt damned werkes followeth ſo blind luſt may nat laſt ſhoulden hart heaven caſt forth went ſhortly tell mercurie ſorted dwell fine hath lo troilus love fine hath great worthineſſe fine hath eſtate royall fine luſt ſuch fine hath nobleſſe fine hath falſe worldes brotelneſſe thus began loving creſeide told wiſe deide young freſh folkes ſhe yt love vp groweth age repaireth home worldly vanite herts vp caſteth viſage thilke god image made thinketh ni faire world paſſeth ſone floures faire loveth y• right love vpon croſſe ſoules bey firſt ſtarfe roſe ſit heven nill falſen wight dare ſey woll hert wholly ley ſens beſt love moſt meeke needeth fained love ſeeke lo painems curſed old rite lo goddes may availe lo wretched worldes appetite lo fine guerdon travaile iove apollo mar ſuch raskaile lo forme old clerkes ſpeech poetrie ye bookes ſeech morall gower booke direct thee philoſophicall strode vouchſafe need correct benignity zeales good ſoothfaſt chriſt ſtarfe rood mine heart mercy ever pray lord aright thus ſpeake ſay thou one two three eterne live raigneſt aie thre two one vncircumſcript maiſt circumſcrive v viſible inviſible fone defend thy mercy everichone make v ieſus thy mercy digne love maide mother thine benigne ¶thus endeth fifth laſt booke troilus teſtament creſeide doly ſeaſon till carefull dite coreſpond equivolent right ſo began write tragedy weder right fervent aries middes lent showres haile fro north diſcend ſcantly fro cold might defend yet nevertheleſſe within mine orature ſtode titan beames bright withdrawen doun ſcyled vnder cure faire venus beaute night vpraiſe ſette vnto weſte ful right golden face oppoſitioun god phebus directe diſcending doun throughout y• glaſſe beames braſt ſo faire might ſee every ſide northren winde purified aire ſhedde miſty cloudes fro skie froſte freſed blaſtes bitterly fro pole artike come whisking loud ſhrill cauſed remove ayenſt truſted venus love quene ſomtime hight obedience faded hert love ſhe would make grene ther vpon humble reverence thought pray high magnificence great colde letted chambre fire pa though love hote yet man age kindleth nat ſo ſoone youtheed blood flowing rage old corage dull deed fire outward beſt remeed help phiſike nature failed expert aſſailed made fire beaked aboute tooke drinke ſpirites comfort armed wel fro colde theroute cutte winter night make ſhort toke queare left ſport writen worthy chaucer glorious faire creſeide luſty troilus found dioniede received lady bright hewe troilus nere witte abrede wepte ſore viſage pale hewe wanhope teares gan renewe eſperus rejoyſed againe thus joy lived paine beheſt great comforting truſting troy ſhe wold make retour deſired moſt al earthly thing ſhe onely paramour ſaw paſſed day hour gainecome ſorow oppreſſe wofull hart care hevineſſe diſtreſſe needeth nat reherſe worthy chaucer ſame booke goodly termes joly verſe compiled hath care wil looke breke ſleepe another queare tooke founde fatal deſteny faire creſeide ended wretchedly wote al y• chaucer wrate trew wote nat narracion authoriſed forged newe ſome poete invencion made report lamentacion wofull end luſty creſeide diſtreſſe ſhe ſhe deide diomede al appetite fulfilled faire lady vpon another ſette delite ſend libel repudy excluded fro company deſolate ſhe walked downe ſome men ſaine court commune fair creſeide floure per ſe troy grece thou fortunate chaunge filth thy feminite fleſhly luſt ſo maculate go among grekes early late giglotlike taking thy foul pleaſaunce pite thee ſhould fall ſuch miſchaunce yet nevertheleſſe wt ever men deme ſay ſcornfull language thy brutelneſſe ſhal excuſe ferforth may thy womanhed thy wiſedome fairneſſe fortune hath put ſuch diſtreſſe pleaſed nothing gilt thee wicked langage ſpilt faire lady wiſe deſtitute al comfort conſolatioun right prively without felowſhip refute diſheuelde paſſed toun mile two vnto manſioun bilded full gaie wher father calcas among y• grekes dwelling ſaw cauſe gan enquire comming ſhe ſaid ſighing full ſore fro diomede gotten deſire woxe wery would qd calcas doughter weep thou nat therfore paraventure al cometh beſt welcome thou art full dere geſt old calcas law tho keper temple preeſt venus ſonne cupido honoured chambre neſt creſeide bale enewed breſt vſed paſſe praiers ſay laſt vpon ſolemne day cuſtome people ferre nere noone vnto temple went ſacrifice devout manere ſtill creſeide heuie entent church would nat ſelfe preſent giving people deeming expulſe fro diomede king paſſed ſecrete oratore ſhe might wepe wofull deſtinie behind backe ſhe cloſed faſt dore knee bare fel doune hie vpon venus cupide angerly cried ſaied wiſe ala ever made ſacrifice ye gave one divine reſponſaile ſhould floure love troy made vnworthy outwaile al care tranſlated joy ſhal gide ſhal conuoie sith fro diomede noble troilus clene excluded abiect odious falſe cupide none wite thou mother love blind goddace ye cauſed vnderſtand alway trow ſeede love ſowen face aie grew grene ſople grace ala ſeede froſt ſlaine fro lover left forlaine ſaid doun extaſie rauiſhed ſpirite dreame ſhe fell apparaunce herde ſhe lie cupide king tinging ſiluer bell men might fro heven hell whoſe ſound cupide aperes ſeven planet diſcending fro ſperes hath power al thing generable rule ſtere great influence weder winde courſe variable firſt saturne gave ſentence gave cupide litel reverence boiſtous chorle manere came crabbedly auſtrine loke chere face frounſed lere like ye lede teeth chattered ſheuered y• chin eien drouped hole ſonken heed noſe mildrop faſt gan rin lippes blo chekes leane thin iſeickeles fro heer doun hong wonder great ſpeare long attour belte liart locke laie feltred vnfaire fret froſtes hoore garment gate ful gay graie widdred wede fro y• wind wore boiſtous bowe within honde bore vnder girdle faſhe felone flains feddred iſe heeded holſtains iupiter right faire amiable god ſterres firmament norice thing generable fro father saturne farre different burly face browes bright brent vpon heed garlond wonder gaie flour faire maie voice clere criſtal eien golden wier ſo glittering heare garment gite ful gaie grene golden liſtes gilte every geare burly brande middle beare right hand grounden ſpere father y• wrothe fro v bere next came mar y• god ofrei ſtrife debate diſcenſioun chide fight fierſe fire harde harneſſe hewmonde habergioun haunch ruſty fel fauchoun hand ruſty ſword writhing face many angry word shaking brande cupide come reed viſage griſly glowing eien mouth blubber ſtode fome like bore whetting tuskes kene right tulſure like temperaunce tene horne blewe many bouſtous bragge al world war hath made wagge fair phebus lanterne lampe light man beaſt fruit floriſhing tender norice baniſher night world cauſing moving influence life al earthly thing without comfort force nought muſt go die yt worlde hath wrought king royall rode vpon chare phiton ſomtime gided vnright brightneſſe face bare non might behold perſing ſight golden carte firy beames bright foure yoked ſtedes full different hewe bout bait tiring y• ſpheres drewe firſt ſord mane reed roſe called eoye orient ſecond ſtede name hight ethioſe whitely pale ſomdele aſcendent third peroſe right hote eke fervent fourth blacke called phlegone rolleth phebus doun ſee venus preſent goddes gay ſonnes quarrel defend make owne complaint cladde nice aray one half greene thother half ſable blake white heer gold kembet ſhede abake face ſeemed great variaunce parfite truth while inconſtaunce vnder ſmiling ſhe diſſimulate provocative blinkes amorous ſodainly chaunged alterate angry ferpent venomous right pungitive wordes odious thus variaunt ſhe liſte take kepe one eie laugh wepe tokening fleſhly paramour venus hath rule governaunce ſomtime ſwete ſomtime bitter ſour right vnſtable ful variaunce minged careful joy falſe pleaſaunce hote cold blith ful wo grene lefe widred ago boke hand come mercurious right eloquent ful rethorie polite termes delicious penne inke report al redie setting ſonges ſinging merely hode reed hecled attour croun like til poete old faſioun box bare fine electuares ſugred ſiropes digeſtion spice belonging potiquares many holſome ſwete confection doctor phiſike cledde ſcarlet goun furred well ſuch one ought honeſt good nat worde couth lie next come lady sinthia laſt ſwifteſt ſphere colour blake busked horne twa night ſhe liſteth beſt tapere hawe leed colour nothing clere al light ſhe boroweth brother titan ſelf ſhe hath none gite gray ful ſpottes blake breſt chorle painted full even bearing buſhe thornes bake theft miȝt clime ner y• heven thus gadred y• goddes ſeven mercurius choſed one aſſent foreſpeker parliment ben liking faconde tonge termes exquiſite rethorike practike might lere brefe ſermon preignant ſentence write cupide valing cappe lite sper cauſe vocacioun anon ſhewde entencioun lo qd cupide wol blaſpheme y• name owne god either word dede goddes doeth loſſe ſhame ſhould bitter paine mede ſay yonder wretch creſeide ſomtime flour love mother ſhe ſtately reprove saying great infelicite cauſe mother venus called blinde goddes might nat ſe ſclaunder defame injurious thus living vncleane lecherous would retorte mother ſhewde grace al ſithe ye al ſeven deficate perticipant divine ſapience great injury hie eſtate think pain ſhould make recompence never goddes done ſuch violence wel ſelfe ſay therfore go helpe revenge pray mercurius cupide gave anſwere ſaid ſir king counſaile ye referre hieſt planet take loweſt degree paine creſeide modifie god saturne take sinthia content qd take twa thus proceded saturne mone mater ripely degeſt diſpite cupide ſhe done venus open manifeſt lyfe payne opreſt turment ſore ſickeneſſe incurable lover abhominable doleful ſentence saturn toke hand paſſed doun careful creſeide lay heed laide froſty wande lawfully wiſe gan ſay thy great faireneſſe al thy beauty gay thy wanton blood eke thy golden heere exclude fro thee evermeere chaunge thy mirthe melancoly mother penſiveneſſe thy moyſter thy hete colde dry thine inſolence thy play thy wantonneſſe great diſeaſe thy pompe thy richeſſe mortall nede great penurie thou ſuffre ſhalt begger die cruel saturne froward angry harde thy dome malicious faire creſeide haſt thou mercy ſo ſwete gentill amorous withdraw thy ſentence gracious thou never ſo ſheweth thy dede wrekeful ſentence given creſeide sinthia saturne paſt away ſeate diſcended doun blive reed bill creſeide ſhe lay containing ſentence diffinitive fro heale body thee deprive thy ſickneſſe ſhal recure dolour thy dayes endure thy chriſtal iyen menged blood make thy voice ſo clere vnpleaſant heer hace thy luſty lere overſpred ſpots blake lump hawe appering thy face thou comeſt eche man ſhall flie place thus ſhalt thou go begging fro hous hous cuppe clapper like lazarous doolie dreame vgly viſioun brought till end creſeide fro awoke court convocatioun vaniſhed away roſe ſhe vp toke poliſhed glaſſe ſhadow couth loke ſhe ſaw viſage ſo deformate ſhe hart wo ne wite god wate weping full ſore lo qd ſhe froward langage move ſtere crabbed goddes ſo ſeen blaſpheming bought ful dere yearthly joy mirthe ſet arere ala day ala wofull tide began goddes chide ſayd child came fro hall warne creſeide ſupper redie firſt knocked doore eft couth cal madame father biddeth cum hie hath marveile ſo long grofe ye lie ſaith beades bethe long ſomdele goddes wote entent full wele qd ſhe faire child go father dere pray come ſpeake anon ſo ſayd daughter chere ala qd ſhe father mirth gon ſo qd ſhe expon told vengeaunce wrake treſpas cupide couth take looked vgly leper face white lely floure wringing hand oft time ſayd alace lived ſee wofull houre knew well ſocour ſickneſſe doubled pain thus ther care inow betwixt hem twain togider mourned ful lang qd creſeide father would nat kend therfore ſecrete wiſe ye let gang yon hoſpitall tounes end thider ſome meate charite ſend live vpon mirthe yearth fro gone ſuch wicked wearth mantill bever hat cuppe clapper wonder prively opened ſecrete gate thereat conveied man ſhould eſpie village halfe mile thereby delivered spittell hous daily ſent part almous sum knew well ſum knowlege bicauſe ſhe ſo deformate bile blake overſpred viſage fayre colour faded alterate yet preſumed hie regrate ſtil mourning ſhe noble kin bitter tooke day paſſed phebus went reſt cloudes blake overwheled skie god wote creſeide ſorowfull geſt seing vncouth fare herborie meate drinke ſhe dreſſed lie darke corner hous alone wiſe weping ſhe made mone complaint creſeide soppe ſorowe ſonken care caitife creſeide evermare gon thy joy thy mirth yearth blithneſſe art thou blake bare ſalve may helpe thy ſare fell thy fortune wicked thy werth thy bliſſe vaniſhed thy bale vnberde vnder y• great god graven ware men grece ne yet troie miȝt herd thy chamber wantonly beſeen burly bedde banker brouded spice wine thy colatioun cuppes gold ſilver ſhene thy ſwete meates ſerved plate clene ſavery ſauce good faſhioun thy gay garment many goodly goun thy pleſaunt ſaune pinned golden pene arere thy great royall renoun thy gardien thy greces gay freſhe floures quene floray painted pleaſauntly every way thou wont full merily may walke take dewe day heare merle mavile many one lady faire carrolling gone ſee royall renkes ray leper loge take thy goodly boure thy bed take bounche ſtro wailed wine meates thou tho take mouled bread pirate ſider ſoure cuppe clapper ago clere voice courtly carrolling ranke roke full hidous heer hace deformed figure face loke people hath liking ſped ſight ſay ſore ſighing lying emong leper folke ala lady faire troy grece attend freile fortune mine infelicite great miſchief man amend mind mirrour make paraventure ye might may come y• ſame end elſe worſe worſe may beware therefore approches nere end nought fairneſſe fading floure nought famous laude hie honour winde inflate men eares roſing redde rotting ſhall retoure exemple make memore ſuch thing wofull witnes beares al welth yearth wind away weares beware therfore approches nere hour thus chiding drery diſteny weping ſhe woke night fro end end vaine dole carefull cry might remedy ne yet mourning mend leper lady roſe wend ſayd ſpurnes thou y• wall ſlea thy ſelf mende nothing sith y• thy weping doubleth thy wo counſaile thee make vertue nede go learne clappe thy clapper fro learne ye lawe leper lede bote forthwith ſhe yede fro place place cold hunger ſore compelled ranke beggore ſame time troy garniſoun chieftain worthy troilus throuȝ jeopardy warre ſtriken doun knight grece nomber marveilous great triumph laude victorious troy right royally rode way creſeide y• leper ſtode seing company come al ſtevin gave cry ſhoke cupps good ſpede worthy lordes goddes love hevin u ſeper part almoſe dede cry noble troilus toke hede pite nere place gan pa wher creſeide ſat nat weting wt ſhe vpon ſhe keſt vp iyen blinke come til thought ſometime face ſein ſhe ſoch plite knew nought yet loke minde brought ſwete viſage amorous blenking offaire creſeid ſometime owne derling wonder ſuppoſe mind toke figure ſo ſone lo idoll thing caſe may depe enprinted fantaſie deludeth wittes outwardly ſo apereth forme like eſtate within minde figurate ſparke love til hartcouth ſpring kindeled body fire hote feuer ſwette trembling tooke readie exſpire heare ſhield breſt began tire within chaunged many hewe nevertheles nat one knew knightly pite memoriell faire creſeide girdel gan take purſe gold many gaie iewell skirt creſeide doun gan ſhake rode away nat word ſpake penſife hart came toune great care oft ſith almoſt fell doune lepre folke creſeide couth draw ſee equall diſtributioun almoſe gold ſaw ech one priuely roun ſaied yon lord hath affectioun ever vnto yon lazarous v al know almous lord yon qd ſhe ye fele doeth v ſo great humanite yes qd lepre man know wele sir troilus knight gentle free creſeide vnderſtood hee stiffer ſtele ſterte bitter ſtound throughout hert fill doun y• ground ſhe come ſighing ſore ſad many carefull crie cold atone breſt ſtormy ſtoundes ſtad wrapped wo wretchfull one fell ſwoun ful oft ſhe would fone ever ſwouning cried ſhe thus falſe creſeide true knight troilus thy love thy laude thy gentleneſſe counted ſmall proſperite effated wantonneſſe clambe vpon fickell whele ſo hie faith love promitted thee thy ſelfe fekell furious falſe creſeide true knight troilus love thou kept countenaunce honeſt chaſt conuerſacion woman protectour defence thou helped opinion minde fleſhly foule affection enclined luſtes lecherous fie falſe creſeide true knight troilus lover beware take good hede ye love ye ſuffre pain let wit right throughout ye may truſt true love proue ye woll labour vain therefore rede ye take ye find ſad wedercocke wind bicauſe know great vnſtableneſſe brittle glaſſe vnto ſelf ſay truſting great brutelneſſe inconſtaunt vntrue fay though ſome true wot riȝt ar findeth truth let lady ruſe none ſelf woll accuſe ſaid paper ſhe ſat doun maner made teſtament bequethe corſe carioun wormes toodes rent cuppe clapper mine ornament gold theſe lepre folke ſhall dedde bury grave roiall ring ſet rubie redde troilus dowrie ſend leaue dedde make careful death vnto kend thus conclude ſhortly make end ſpirit leave diane ſhe dwels walke waſt wodes welles diomede thou haſt broche belt troilus gaue tokening true love worde ſhe ſwelt ſoone leaper man toke ring buried withouten tarying troilus forthwith ring bare creſeide death gan declare heard great infirmite legacie lamentacioun ſhe ended ſuch poverte ſwelt wo fell doune ſwoun ſorow hart braſt boun sighing full ſadly ſayd vntrue wo therefore ſaith made tombe marble gray wrote name ſuperſcripcioun layd graue whereas ſhe lay golden letter conteining reaſoun lo faire fadies creſeide troie toun somtime counted floure womanhed vnder ſtone late leper lieth dedde worthy woman balade ſhort made worſhip inſtruction charite moniſh exhort minge nat love falſe diſcepcion beare mind ſore concluſion faire creſeide ſayd sith ſhe dedde ſpeake legend good woman ſome lady court took offence chaucer large ſpeeches againſt untruth woman queen enjoyned compile book commendation ſundry maiden wife ſhewed themſelves faithful faithleſs men thouſand time heard men tell joy heaven pain hell accord wele ſo natheleſſe yet wote wele alſo ni non dwelling countre either hath heaven hell ibe ne may none way witten heard ſayd found written aſſay may man preve god forbede men ſhould leve wel thing ſeen iye men ſhall nat • en every thing lie himſelf ſeeth el dooth god wote thing never leſſe ſoth though every wight ne may iſee bernarde monke ne ſaugh parde mote bookes find y• old thing ben mind doctrine old wiſe yeve credence every skilful wiſe tellen old appreued ſtories holines reignes victory love hate ſundry thing may make rehearſings old bookes away ilorne remembraunce kay well ought v honouren beleve theſe bookes han none preve though lite bookes rede delite hem yeve faith full credence mine herte hem reverence hertely game none fro bookes maketh gone ſeldome holy daie save certainly yt month may comen heare foules ſing floures ginnen ſpring farwell booke deuocion eke condicion floures mede love moſt theſe floures white rede soch men callen daiſies toun hem ſo great affectioun ſayd erſt comen maie bedde daweth daie nam vp walking mede ſeen floure ayenſt sunne ſprede vp riſeth early morrow blisfull ſight ſofteneth ſorow glad preſence done reverence ſhe flour floure fulfilled vertue honoure every ilike faire freſh hewe ever love ever ilike newe ever ſhall till mine harte die ſweare woll lie loved wight hotter life eve renne blithe ſone ever sunne ginneth weſt ſeen floure woll go reſt feare night ſo hateth ſhe derkeneſſe chere plainly ſpred brightneſſe sunne woll vncloſe ala ne engliſh rime proſe suffiſaunt floure praiſe aright helpeth ye y• han conning might ye lover make ſentement caſe ought ye diligent forthren ſomewhat labour whether ye ye lefe ye flour well wote ye han beforne making ropen alway corne come glening full glad may find eare goodly worde ye han left though happen rehearſen eft ye han freſhe ſonges ſayd forbeareth beth euill apayd sith ye ſe doe honour love eke ſervice flour ſerve wit might clereneſſe light derke world wint ledeth hart within ſorowfull breſt dredeth loveth ſo ſore ye ben verily maiſtres wit nothing word workes knit ſo bonde harpe obeieth honde make ſoune fingering right ſo mowe ye mine hart bring soch voice right liſt laugh pain ye guide lady ſouerain mine yearthly god call werke ſorowes wherefore ſpake yeve credence old ſtories done hem reverence men muſten thing bileve men may ſeen iye el preve ſhall ſein ſee time may nat atones ſpeake rime buſie ghoſt thurſteth alway new ſeen flour ſo yong ſo freſh hew conſtrained ſo gredy deſire harte fele yet fire made riſe ere day firſt morow maie dreadfull harte glad deuocion reſurrection floure ſhould vncloſe sunne roſe redde roſe breſt beaſt day angenores doughter ladde away doune knee anon right ſette could freſh floure grette kneeling alway till vncloſed vpon ſmall ſoft ſwete gras floures ſwete embrouded ſuch ſweteneſſe ſoch odour ſpeake gomme herbe tree compariſon may imaked ſurmounteth plainly odoures riche beaute floures forgotten yearth poore eſtate winter naked made mate ſword cloud ſo ſore greved hath attempre ſunne al releved naked clad new ſmall foules ſeaſon fain panter net ſcaped vpon fouler hem made awhaped winter deſtroied brood diſpite hem thought hem good ſing ſong diſpiſe foule chorle couetiſe betraied sophiſtrie ſong fouler defie craft ſome ſongen clere lay love joy worſhipping prayſing make new blisfull somers ſake vpon braunches full bloſmes ſoft dilite tourned hem ful oft ſongen bliſſed ſainct valentine day cheſe mine withouten repenting mine harte ſwete therewithall bekes gonnen mete yelding honour humble obeiſaunce love didden obſervaunce longeth vnto love vnto nature conſtre liſt cure tho done vnkindneſſe doeth tidife new fangleneſſe beſought mercy treſpaſing humbly ſong repenting ſworen bloſmes true make would vpon hem rue laſt maden acorde found daunger time lord yet pite ſtrong gentill might foryave made mercy paſſen right innocence ruled curteſie ne cleape nat innocence folie ne falſe pite vertue meane eticke ſayth ſoch maner meane thus theſe foule voide malice acordeden love laften vice hate ſong one acorde welcome sommer governour lorde zephirus flora gentelly yave floures ſoft tenderly ſwote breth made hem ſprede god goddeſſe flourie mede thoughte might day daie dwellen alway joly month maie withouten ſlepe withouten meat drinke adowne full ſoftly gan ſinke leaning elbow ſide long day ſhope abide nothing el ſhall nat lie looke vpon daiſie well reaſon men call may daiſie el iye day empriſe floure floures pray god faire mote ſhe fall loven floures ſake natheleſſe ne wene nat make praiſing floure againe lefe corne againe ſhefe ni lever none ne nam withholden yet never nother ne ſerveth lefe ne floure well brouken ſervice laboure thing another tonne old ſtorie er ſoch thing begonne yt ſunne south gan weſt floure gan cloſe gan reſt derknes night ſhe dred home mine houſe full ſwiftly ſped gone reſt earely riſe ſeene floure ſprede deviſe little herber benched turf freſh igrave bad men ſhoulde couche make deintie newe sommers ſake bad hem ſtrawen floures bedde laid mine iyen hedde fell ſlepe ſlept houre two met lay medow tho ſeen floure love ſo drede ferre came walking mede god love hand quene ſhe clad royall habite grene fret golde ſhe next heere vpon white croune ſhe beare flourouns ſmall ſhall lie world right daiſie icrouned white leaf lite florouns croune white perle fine orientall white croune imaked white croune grene made like daiſie ſeme conſidred eke fret gold iclothed mighty god love ſilke embroided full grene greves fret redde roſe leves freſheſt ſens world firſt begon gilt heere crouned ſon ſtede gold hevineſſe weight therwith thouȝt face ſhone ſo bright well vnnethes might behold hand thought ſaw hold two firie dartes gledes rede angelike winges ſaw ſprede men ſain blind algate thought might ſe ſternely gan behold loking doeth mine hart cold hand held noble queene crouned white clothed al greene womanly ſo benigne ſo meke worlde though yt men wold ſeke halfe beaute ſhould finde creature formed kinde therfore may ſain thinketh ſong praiſing lady fre hide abſolon thy gilte treſſes clere heſter lay thou thy mekeneſſe adoun hide ionathas thy frendly manere penelopee marcia catoun make wifehode compariſoun hide beauty iſoude helein lady cometh may diſtain thy faire body let appere lavine thou lucrece rome toun polixene boughten love ſo dere cleopatra thy paſſioun hide trouthe love renoun thou tisbe haſt love ſoch pain lady cometh may diſtain hero dido laodomia al ifere phillis hanging demophoun canace eſpied thy chere hipſiphile betrayed iaſoun maketh trouth neither boſte ne ſoun hipermiſtre ariadne ye twain lady cometh may diſtain balade may full well iſongen ſayd erſt lady fre certainly theſe mowe ſuffice apperen lady wiſe sunne woll fire diſtain paſſeth lady ſoverain ſo good ſo faire ſo debonaire pray god ever fall faire nad comforte ben preſence ben dead withouten defence drede love wordes chere time hereafter ye ſhall behind god love vpon grene ſaw coming lady ninetene roiall habit full eaſie pace hem came woman ſoch trace ſens y• god adam made yerth third part mankinde ferth ne wende nat poſſibilite ever wide world ibe true love theſe woman echon whether yt wonder thing non right anon gonne eſpie floure clepe daiſie full ſodainly ſtinten one kneled doune none ſongen voice heale honour trouth womanhede flour beareth alderpriſe figuring white croune beareth witneſſing word compas enviroun ſitten hem ful ſoftely adoun firſt ſat god love ſith quene white croune clad grene ſithen al remnaunt eſtate full curteſly ne nat worde ſpoken place mountenance furlong way ſpace kneling floure good entent abode knowen people ment ſtill ſtone till laſt god love iyen caſt ſaid kneleth anſwerde vnto asking herde ſayd ſir come nere ſalued qd doeſt thou nigh mine owne floure ſo boldly better worthy truely worme nighen nere floure thou ſir qd like thou qd art therto nothing able relike digne delitable thou fo folke werrieſt mine old ſervaunts thou miſſaieſt hindreſt hem thy tranſlacion letteſt folke devocion ſerve holdeſt folie ſerve love thou mayſt nat denie plain text withouten nede gloſe thou haſt tranſlated romaunt y• roſe hereſie ayenſt law makeſt wiſe folke fro withdraw creſeide thou haſt ſaid liſt maketh men woman leſſe triſt ben trewe ever ſtele thine anſwere aviſe thee right wele though thou renied haſt lay wretch done many day ſeint venus mother thou live thou ſhalt repenten cruelly ſhall well ſene tho ſpake lady clothed greene ſaied god right curteſie ye mote herken replie ayenſt ye meved god ne ſhulde nat thus agreved deite ſhal ſtable thereto gracious merciable ye nere god knowen might tellen ſhall man may falſely ben accuſed right ought ben excuſed court many loſengeour many queinte totoler accuſour tabouren eares many ſoun right imaginacioun daliaunce envie theſe ben cauſes ſhall nat lie envie lavender court alway ſhe ne parteth neither night ne day houſe ceſar thus ſaith dant ſo goeth algate ſhe wol nat want eke peraunter man nice might done geſſing malice vſeth thinges make recketh nought mater take boden make thilke twey ſome perſone durſt nat withſey repenteth vtterly ne hath nat done ſo grevouſly amis tranſlaten old clerkes writen though malice would enditen diſpite love himſelfe wrought ſhold riȝtwiſe lord thouȝt nat like tiraunts lombardie han reward tyrannie king lorde naturell ought nat tiraunt ne cruell fermour done harme muſt thinke liege man treſour gold cofer ſentence philoſopher king kepe liege iuſtice withouten doute office woll kepe lordes degree right skil bee enhaunſed honoured moſt dere ben halfe goddes world yet mote done right poore riche eſtate nat iliche poore folke compaſſion lo gentill kinde lion flie offendeth biteth taile away flie ſmiteth al eaſily gentrie deineth nat wreke flie doeth curre el another beeſt noble corage ought ben areeſt waien every thing equite ever regard vnto owne degre ſir maiſtrie lord dampne man without anſwere word lorde full foule vſe ſo may nat excuſe asketh mercy dreadfull hert profereth right bare ſherte ben right owne judgement ought god ſhort aviſement conſider owne honour treſpace ſith cauſe death lieth caſe ought ben lightlier merciable letteth ire bethe ſomewhat tretable man hath ſerved conninges forthred well law makinges nat well endite yet hath made leude folke delite ſerve preiſing name made boke yt hight houſe fame eke death blaunche ducheſſe parliament foules geſſe al love palamon arcite thebe though ſtorie knowen li • e many himpne holy day highten balades rondel virelaies ſpeake holineſſe hath proſe tranſlated boece made life alſo ſaint cecile made alſo gone great origenes vpon maudelaine ought leſſe paine hath made many ley many thing ye god eke king alceſte whilom quene trace aske man right grace ye never hurt al live ſhal ſwearen blive ſhal never agilten wiſe ſhal maken ye woll deviſe woman trewe loving al life ſo ye woll maiden wife forthren much miſſeide roſe el creſeide god love anſwerde thus anon madame qd ſo long agon knew ſo charitable trewe never yet ſens world newe ne found better none ye woll ſave degree may woll nat werne requeſt al lieth doth leſt al foryeve withouten lenger ſpace ſo yeveth yefte doth grace betime thanke ſhall demeth ye ye ſhal therfore go thanke lady qd roſe doun ſet knee ſaid thus madame god yelde god love maked wrath foryeve grace ſo long live may know ſothely ye holpen put degre trewly wende caas nought gilte ne done love treſpas trewe man withouten drede hath nat parten theves dede ne trewe lover ought nat blame though y• ſpeke falſe lover ſome ſhame ought rather hold creſeide wrote told roſe ſo mine author ment algate god wotte mine entent forthren trouth love cherice ben ware fro falſeneſſe fro vice enſample mening ſhe anſwerde let thine arguing love ne wol counterpleted right ne wrong lerne thou haſt thy grace hold right thereto woll ſaine wt penance thou ſhalt thy treſpace vnderſtand thou ſhalt yt thou liveſt yere yere moſt partie thy time ſpende making glorious legende good woman maiden wife trewe loving life tell falſe men hem betraien al life ne nat aſſaien many woman may done ſhame world hold game though thee like nat lover speke wel love penance yeve thee god love ſhal ſo pray ſhal charge ſervants way forthren thee wel thy labour quite go thy waie penaunce lite boke made yeve y• quene behalfe eltham shene god love gan ſmile ſaid woſt thou qd wife maid queene counteſſe degree hath ſo littell penaunce yeven thee haſt deſerved ſore ſmart pite renneth ſoone gentle hart maiſt thou ſene ſhe kitheth ſhe anſwerde naie ſir ſo blis ſee well ſhe good trewe tale mine hood qd love thou knoweſt wel parde ſo thou aviſe haſt thou nat booke thy cheſte great goodneſſe quene alceſte turned daieſie husband cheſe die eke gone hell rather hercules reſcued parde brought hel againe blis anſwerde againe ſaid yes know good alceſte daieſie mine owne herts reſte fele well goodneſſe wife death life great bounte doubleth renoun wel hath ſhe quit mine affectioun floure daieſie wonder though iove ſtellifie telleth agaton great goodneſſe white corowne beareth witneſſe ſo many vertues ſhe ſmal florounes corowne remembraunce honour cibilla made daieſie floure crowned al white men may ſe mar yave corowne reed parde ſtede ruby ſet among y• white therewith quene woxe reed ſhame alite ſhe prayſed ſo preſence ſaid love full great negligence thee ilke time thou made hide abſolon thy treſſes balade thou forget thy ſonge ſette sith thou art ſo greatly dette woſt well kalender ſhe woman woll lover ſhe taught craft trewe loving namely wifehode living bondes ſhe ought keepe thy litel witte thilke time ſleepe charge thee vpon thy life thy legende make wife thou haſt ſmale imade fare well charge thee er go thus much tell ne ſhal trewe lover come hell theſe lady ſitting rowe ben balade thou conſt hem know thy bokes al thou ſhalt hem find hem thy legende al mind meane hem ben thy knowing ben twenty thouſand mo ſitting thou knoweſt good woman trewe love ought may befall make metre hem leſt mote gone home ſunne draweth weſt paradis companie ſerve alway freſh daieſie cleopatra woll thou begin ſo forth love ſo ſhalt thou win let ſee man lover wol done ſo ſtrong paine love ſhe wote well thou maiſt nat rime ſuche lover time long reden suffiſeth thou make manere thou reherce al life great theſe old authours liſten treat ſo ſhall ſo many ſtory tell sey ſhortly ſhall long dwell worde bookes gan take right thus legende gan make ¶thus endeth prologue ¶here beginneth legende cleopatra queene egipt ye death ptholome king egipt governing reigned queene cleopatra till time bifel ſuch caas rome ſent ſenatour conqueren realmes honour vnto toune rome vſaunce world obeiſaunce ſoth ſay antonius name fil fortune ought ſhame fallen proſperite rebel vnto toune rome al ſuſter ceſare left falſely er ſhe ware would algates han another wife toke rome ceſar ſtrife natheleſſe forſoth ilke senatour full worthy gentill werriour deth ful great damage love brought man ſuch rage ſo narow bounden laas love cleopatra al world ſet value thouȝt nothing ſo due cleopatra love ſerve thought armes ſterve defence right noble quene eke loved ſo knight deſert chevalrie certainly bokes lie perſon gentilneſſe diſcretion hardineſſe worthy wight liven may ſhe faire roſe maie maken ſhorte beſt woxe wife leſt wedding feaſt deviſe itake ſuch empriſe ſo many ſtorie make long leſt ſhould ſlake thing beareth effect charge men may overlade ſhip barge thy effect woll skippe al remnaunt woll let ſlippe octavian wood dede shope hooſte antony lede al vtterly diſtruction ſtoute romaine cruell lion ſhip went thus let hem faile antonius ware woll nat faile meten theſe romaine may toke eke rede vpon day wife hoſt forth went ſhip anone lenger ne ſtent ſee happed hem mete vp goeth trumpe ſhoute ſhete painen hem ſet ſunne griſly ſown goeth great gunne hertely hurtlen one fro top doune cometh y• great ſtones goeth grapenel ſo full crokes among rope ran ſhering hokes polaxe preaſeth behind maſte beginneth flee againe driveth borde ſticketh vpon ſpeares orde rent ſaile hooke like ſith bringeth cup biddeth hem blith poureth peeſen vpon hatch ſlider pot full lime gone togider thus long day fight ſpend till laſt every thing hath end antony ſhent put flight folke go beſt go might fleeth eke y• quene purple ſaile ſtrokes y• went thicke haile wonder might nat endure antony ſaw aventure ala qd day borne worſhip day thus lorne diſpaire wit ſtart rofe himſelfe anon throughout hart ere ferther went place wife could ceſar grace egipt fled drede diſtreſſe herkeneth ye ſpeken kindneſſe ye men falſely ſwearen many oth ye woll die love wroth may ye ſeene woman ſuch trouth woful cleopatra made ſuch routh ni tong none may tell morow ſhe woll lenger dwell made ſubtill werkmen make ſhrine ruby ſtones fine egipt ſhe could eſpie put full ſhrine ſpicerie let corſe enbaume forth ſhe fette dead corſe ſhrine ſhette next ſhrine pit doth ſhe grave ſerpentes ſhe might put hem grave thus ſhe ſeid love ſorowfull hert obeid ferforthly fro bliſfull hour ſwore ben freely meane antonius knight never waking day night ye nere mine herts remembraunce wele wo carole daunce ſelfe covenaunt made tho right ſuch ye felten wele wo ferforth power lay vnreprovable vnto wifehood aye ſame would felen life death thilke covenaunt laſteth breath woll fulfill ſhall well ſeene never vnto love truer queene y• word naked full good hart among ſerpents pit ſhe ſtart ſhe cheſe burying anone neders gonne ſting ſhe death receiueth good chere love antony ſo dere ſtoriall ſooth fable ere find man thus true ſtable woll love death ſo freely take pray god let hedes never ake ¶the legend tisbe babilon babiloine whylome fill thus toun y• queen simiramus let dichen wals make full hie harde tile well ibake dwelling noble toun two lord y• great renoun woneden ſo nigh vpon grene ther na ſtone wal hem oft great tounes wonne ſothe ſaine one man ſonne lond one luſtieſt doughter faireſt eſtward y• world tho dwelling name everiche gan ſpring woman neighbour aboute countre yet withouten doute maiden ben ikept ielouſie ful ſtraite leſt didden ſome folie yong man cleped piramus thisbe hight maide naſo ſaith thus thus report name iſhove woxe age ſo woxe love certaine reaſon age ther might ben betwixt hem mariage father • olde nat aſſent bothe love ilike ſore brent none friendes might lette prively ſometime yet mette ſleight ſpaken ſome deſire wrie glede hotter fire forbid love ten time ſo wode wal y• bitwixt hem ſtode cloven atwo right fro top adoun old time foundatioun yet clift ſo narrow lite nat ſeene dere inough mite love cannot eſpie ye lover two ſhall lie ye founden firſt little narrow clift ſound ſoft ſhrift let word clift pace tolden ſtoden y• place complaint love wo every time durſt ſo one ſide wall ſtood ſide ſtood tiſbe ſweet ſoune receive thus wardeins would diſceive every day wall would threte wiſh god doun ibete thus wold ſain ala thou wicked wall▪ thine enuie thou v letteſt nilt thou cleave fallen atwo leaſt thou wouldeſt ſo yet wouldeſt thou one let v mete one might kiſſen ſwete cured care cold natheleſſe yet thee hold much thou ſuffreſt gone word thy lime eke thy ſtone yet ought thee ben well apaid theſe idle wordes ſaid cold wall woulden kiſſe ſtone take leave forth wolden gone gladly eventide wonder erly leaſt men eſpide long time wrought manere till day phebus gan clere aurora ſtremes hete dried vp dew herbes wete vnto clift wont come piramus come tisbe plighten trouthe fully faie ilke ſame night ſteale awaie beguile wardeins everychone forth citie gone fieldes ben ſo brode wide mete place tide ſet markes meeting ſhould king ninus grauen vnder tree old painems idolles heried vſeden tho field ben buried faſt grave well ſhortely tale tell couenaunt affirmed wonder faſt long hem thought ſunne laſt nere gone vnder ſee adoun tisbe hath ſo great affectioun ſo great liking piramus ſee ſhe ſaw time might night ſhe ſtale away full prively face iwimpled ſubtelly friend ſave trouth hath forſake ala routh ever woman woulde ſo trew truſten man ſhe bet knew tree ſhe goeth full good pace love made ſo hardy caſe well adoun ſhe gan dreſſe ala commeth wild lioneſſe wood withouten arreſt bloody mouth ſtrangling beaſt drinken well ſhe ſat tisbe eſpied riſt vp full drery hart caue dreadfull foot ſhe ſtart moone ſhe ſaw well withall ſhe ran wimple let ſhe fall toke none hede ſo ſore ſhe whaped eke ſo glad ſhe eſcaped thus ſhe ſat lurketh wonder ſtill lioneſſe hath dronke fill well gan ſhe wind right anon wimple gan ſhe find bloody mouth rent done lenger ſhe ne ſtent y• wood way hath ſhe nome laſt piramus come long ala home hee moone ſhone men might well iſee way come full faſt eyen ground adoun caſt ſonde beheld adoun ſaw ſteppes brode lioun hart ſuddainly agroſe pale wext therwith hart aroſe came found wimple torne ala qd day borne night woll v lover ſlee ſhould asken mercy tisbee ſlaine ala bidding hath ſlaine caas ala bidde woman gone night place thereas perill fallen might ſo ſlow ala ne place furlong way ere ye lion foreſt body mote rente beaſt wild gnawen mote mine hart word wimple ſtart kiſt oft wept full ſore ſaid wimple ala ni thou ſhalt feele well blood thou haſt felt bleeding tisbe word ſmote y• hart blood wound broad ſtart water conduit broken tisbe wiſt nat ſitting drede ſhe thought thus ſo fall piramus comen hither may nat ifind may holden falſe eke vnkind ſhe commeth gan eſpien hart eien thought woll tellen drede lioneſſe dede laſt love hath ſhe found beating heeles ground bloody therewithall abacke ſhe ſtart like wawes quappe gan hart pale boxe ſhe woxe throw aviſed gan well know piramus hart dere could write whiche deadly chere hath tisbe haire ſhe rent ſhe gan ſelfe turment ſhe lieth ſwouneth ground ſhe wept teares full wound medleth ſhe blood complaint blood ſelven gan ſhe paint clippeth ſhe red corſe ala doth wofull tisbe caas kiſſeth ſhe froſty mouth ſo cold hath hath ben ſo bold ſleen lefe ſpeake piramus thy tisbe thee calleth thus therwithall ſhe lifteth vp head wofull man nat fully dead herd y• name tisbe crien caſt heavy deadly eyen doun againe yeeldeth vp ghoſt tisbe riſt vp without noiſe boſt ſaw wimple empty ſheath eke ſwerd yt hath done death ſpake ſhe thus thy woful hand qd ſhe ſtrong ynough ſuch werke love ſhall yeve ſtrength hardineſſe make wound large ynough geſſe woll thee followen dead woll felaw cauſe eke thy death qd ſhe though nothing ſave y• death might thee fro depart trewly thou ſhalt departe fro fro death woll go thee ye wretched jelous father whylome child praien withouten enuie grave moten lie sen love hath brought v pitous end right wiſe god every lover ſend loveth trewly proſperite ever piramus tisbe let gentill woman aſſure putten ſuch aventure god forbid woman ben true loving man part ſhall anon kithe y• word ſwerde ſhe tooke ſwitche warme love blood hote hart ſhe ſelven ſmote thus tisbe piramus ago true men find mo bookes ſave piramus therefore ſpoken thus deintie v men find man love true kind may ye ſeene lover ſo woman dare well ¶the legend dido queene cartage glory honour virgile mantuan thy name ſhall follow thy lanterne thou goeſt beforne eneas dido forſworne thine eneide naſo woll take tenour great effect make troy brought deſtruction grekes ſleight namely sinon faining horſe offred vnto minerue thrugh yt many troian muſt ſterve hector death apered fire ſo wood might nat ben ſtered noble toure ilion citie cheefe dungeon country ſo low ybrought priamus king fordone nought eneas charged venus flien away tooke aſcanius ſon right hand fled backe bare led old father cleped anchiſes way wife creuſa lee mokell ſorrow mind ere coulde fellawſhip find laſt hem found made redy certaine ſtound ſea full faſt gan hie ſaileth forth companie towards itaile would deſtinee aventures ſee ni nat purpoſe ſpeke accordeth nat matere ſaid dido shall tale till long ſailed ſalt ſee till libie vnneth arriued tempeſt ſhake itake knight called achatees fellowſhip chees gone country teſpie tooke companie forth gon left ſhips ride feere withouten guide long walketh wilderneſſe till laſt met huntereſſe bow hond arrowes ſhe clothes cutted vnto knee ſhe yet faireſt creature ever iformed nature eneas achates ſhe gret thus ſhe hem ſpake ſhe hem met saw ye qd ſhe ye han walked wide ſuſtren walke beſide wild bore beaſt hunted forreſt tucked vp arrowes caas nay ſothly lady qd eneas thy beautie thinketh thou mighteſt never yearthly woman phebus ſuſter art thou geſſe ſo thou goddeſſe mercy labour wo nam goddeſſe ſoothly qd ſhe tho maiden walken country arrow bow manere realme libie ye sf dido lady queen ſhortly told occaſion dido came region lifteth nat rime nedeth nat nere loſſe time ſome venus owne mother ſpake thus cartage ſhe bade ſhould dight vaniſhed anon ſight could follow word word vergile would laſten long noble queen cleped dido whylom wife sicheo fairer bright ſunne noble toun carthage hath begunne ſhe reigneth ſo great honour ſhe hold quenes flour gentilleſſe freedome beaute well might one ſe king lordes ſo deſired world beautie ifired ſtood ſo well every wight grace eneas come vnto place vnto maiſter temple toun dido deuotioun full priuely way hath nome large temple come cannot ſaine poſſible venus maked inviſible thus ſayth booke withouten lee eneas achates hadden temple ben found depainted wall troy land deſtroyed ala borne qd eneas world ſhame kid ſo wide painted vpon every ſide proſperite ben diſclaundred ſuch degre lenger liven ne kepe word braſt wepe tenderly routh ſeene freſh lady citie queen stood temple eſtate roiall richely eke ſo faire withall yong ſo luſtie eyen glade god yt heaven yearth made would love beauty goodneſſe womanhede trouth ſemelineſſe ſhould loven lady ſwete ni woman halfe ſo mete fortune hath y• world governaunce hath ſodainly brought ſo new chaunce never yet ſo frened caas company eneas wend lorne ſee arrived nought ferre fro citee greateſt lord ſome aventure ben citie come vnto ſame temple ſeke queene ſocour beſeke renome ther ſprong goodnes tolde diſtreſſe tempeſt hard caas vnto queene appeared eneas openly beknew joy meine hadden found lord governour quene ſaw ſuch honour heard eneas ere tho hart routh wo ever ſuch noble man shall ben diſherited ſuch degre ſaw man like knight ſuffiſaunt perſon might like ben gentilman well word beſet noble viſage none formed well brawne bone venus ſuch faireneſſe man might halfe ſo faire geſſe well lord ſemed ſtraunger ſomewhat ſhe liked bet god doe bote ſome folke often new thing ſote anon hart hath pitee wo pitie love came alſo thus pitie gentilneſſe refreſhed muſt ben diſtreſſe ſaid certes ſhe ſorry hath ſuch perill ſuch caas friendly ſpeech manere ſpake ſayd ye may ye nat venus ſonne anchiſes good faith worſhip encrees may goodly done ye ſhall ſhips meine ſhall ſave many gentle word ſhe ſpake commaunded meſſengers go ſame day withouten faile ſhips ſeeke hem vitaile full many beaſt ſhe ſhips ſent wine ſhe gan hem preſent roiall paleis ſhe ſped eneas ſhe alway led nedeth feaſtes diſcrive never better eaſe live full feaſt deinties richeſſe inſtruments ſong gladneſſe many amorous looking deviſe eneas come paradiſe ſwolowe hell thus joy remembreth eſtate troy dauncing chamber full paraments rich bed pavement eneas ledde meat queene ſeat ſpices parted wine agon vnto chamber lad anon take eaſe reſt folke done ſo leſt na courſer well ibridled none ne ſtede iuſting well gone ne large palfrey eaſie none ne iewell fret full rich ſtones ne ſackes full gold large wight ne rubie none ſhineth night ne gentill hauten faukon hereonere ne hound hart wild bore dere ne cup gold floreins new ibette lond libie may ben gette dido ne hath eneas iſent payed hath ſpent thus honorable quene geſts call ſhe freedome paſſen eneas ſoothly eke without lee hath ſent ſhippe achates ſonne rich thing ſcepter clothes broches eke ring weare ſome preſent theſe noble thing ſent bad ſonne ſhould make preſenting quene take repaired achates againe eneas full blisfull faine ſeene yong ſonne aſcanius reported thus cupido god love prayer mother high likeneſſe child itake noble queene enamoured make eneas ſcripture may make cure ſoth y• queen hath made ſuch chere vnto child wonder preſent father ſent thanked oft good entent thus queen pleaſaunce joy theſe new luſtie folke troy deed hath ſhe enquired eneas ſtory lered troy long day tway entendeden ſpeake play gan breden ſuch fire ſilly dido hath ſuch deſire eneas new gueſt deale ſhe loſt hew eke heale theffect fruit told ſtory tellen ſhall thus begin fell vpon night mone vpreiſed light noble queene vnto reſt went ſighed ſore gon felfe tourment walketh waloweth made many brayd done theſe lover heard ſayd laſt vnto ſuſter anne made mone riȝt thus ſpake ſhe dere ſuſter mine may agaſteth dreme qd ſhe ilke new troian ſo thought thinketh ſo weil iwrought eke ſo likely ben man therwith ſo mikell good love life lieth cure ye
