creature ſuch ſorrow ded full pitous pale nothing red ſaid lay manner ſong without note without ſong full well rehearſe right thus began ſorrow ſo great wone joy get neuer none ſee lady bright haue loved might fro dead agone thus ſorrow left alone ala death eyleth thee thou noldeſt taken thou tooke lady ſwete goodneſſe ſhe none mete ſo faire ſo freſh ſo free good men may well ſee made thus complaint ſorrowfull hart gan faſt faint ſpirits wexen dead blood fled pure dread hert maken warme well feeled heart harme wete eke adrad kind make glad member principall body made hew chaunge wexe greene pale blood ſeene manner limme anon therewith ſaw farde thus euill ſete went ſtood right fete grette ſpake nought argued owne thought wit diſputed faſt life might laſt thought ſorrowes ſo ſmert lay ſo cold vpon heart ſorrow holy thought made heard nought welnigh loſt mind though pan men clepeth god kind ſorrowes never ſo wroth laſt ſaine right ſooth ware ſtood hood ygret beſt coud debonairly nothing loud ſaid pray thee wroth heard thee ſaine ſooth ne ſaw ſir truly ah good ſir force qd right ſorry haue ought diſtroubled thought foryeve haue miſſe take yes thamends light make qd lithe none thereto nothing miſſaide lo goodly ſpake knight another wight made neyther tough ne queint ſaw gan acqueint found ſo tretable right wonder skilfull reaſonable thought bale anon right gan find tale looke might ought haue knowledging thought sir qd game done holde hart gone theſe hunt ſee force thereof qd thought thereon neuer adele lord qd trow wele right ſo thinketh chere ſir thing woll ye thinketh great ſorrow ſee certes ſir ye would aught diſcure wo would wiſe god helpe ſo amend may ye mowe prove aſſay trouth make hole woll power whole telleth ſorrowes ſmart paraunter may eaſe hart ſemeth full ſicke vnder ſide looked aſide ſaith nay nill graunt mercy good friend qd thanke thee thou wouldeſt ſo may neuer rather man may ſorrow glade maketh hew fall fade hath mine vnderſtanding lorne wo borne may nought make ſorrowes ſlide remedy ovide ne orpheus god melodie ne dedalus playes ſlie ne heale may phiſicien nought ipocras ne galien wo liue houres twelue ſo woll aſſay hemſelue whether hert haue pite ſorrow let ſee wretch death hath made naked bliſſe ever maked iwroth werſte wight hate dayes night life▪ luſtes loth fare wroth pure death ſo full fo would die ſo follow flie would nill pain without reed alway dying deed teſiphus lieth hell may ſorrow tell ſo wiſt trouth ſorrow routh pitie ſorrows ſmart man hath fiendly heart whoſo ſeeth firſt morrow may ſaine hath met ſorrow ſorrow ſorrow ala tell thee ſorrow tourned plaining laughter weeping glad thought heauineſſe trauaile mine idleneſſe eke reſt wele wo good harme euermo wrath tourned playing delite ſorrowing mine heale tourned ſickneſſe drede ſikerneſſe derke turned light witte foly day night loue hate ſlepe wakyng mirth meales faſtyng countenaunce nicete abawed ſo peace pleding werre ala might fare werre boldneſſe turned ſhame falſe fortune hath played game cheffe ala traytereſſe falſe full gyle al behoteth nothing halte gothe vpright yet ſhe halte baggeth foule loketh fayre diſpitous debonaire ſcorneth many creature ydole falſe purtraiture ſhe ſhe woll ſone wryen monſtres heed ywryen filth ouer yſtrowed floures moſt worſhip floures lyen nature without faith lawe meſure falſe euer laughing one eye weping brought vp ſhe ſet al downe liken scorpiowne falſe flattering beeſt head maketh feeſt amid flattering taile ſting enuenim ſo ſhe enuious charite aye falſe ſemeth wele turneth ſhe falſe whele nothing ſtable fire table full many one hath ſhe thus yblent play enchauntement ſeemeth one ſo falſe theſe hath ſhe troweſt thou lord thee ſay cheſſe ſhe gan play falſe draughtes full diuers ſtale toke fers ſawe fers away ala couth lenger play ſaid farewell ſweet ywis farewell euer therewith fortune ſaid checke mate mid point checkere paune errant ala full craftier play ſhe athalus made game firſt cheſſe ſo name god wolde one twiſe iconde know jeoperdiſe coude greke pythagores ſhulde haue plaide bet ches kept feers bet thereby though whereto trewly holde wiſhe worthe fire neuer bet fortune ſo many wyle fewe begile eke ſhe laſſe blame ſelfe wolde haue ſame god ſhe ought excuſed ſay yet thereto god might haue ſhe feers caught wolde haue drawe ſame draught alſo wiſe god giue reſte dare well ſwere ſhe toke beſt draught haue ſorne bliſſe ala borne euermore trowe trewly luſt wholly turned ye done lorde die ſone nothing leaue nought liue die right thought ny planet • irmament ne ayre ne erth none element ne yeue yeft echone weping alone aduiſe wele bethinke euerydele lieth rekening ſorrow nothing liueth gladneſſe may glad diſtreſſe haue loſt ſuffiſaunce thereto haue pleaſaunce may ſay haue right nought al falleth thought ala ouercome done come haue ſorrow tantale herde tell tale thus pitouſly tell vnneth might lenger dwell mine herte ſo much wo good ſir qd ſay nat ſo haue ſome pite nature fourmed creature remembreth socrates counted three ſtrees nought fortune coude qd ſo good ſir yes parde qd ne ſay ſo truely though ye loſt feerſes twelus ye ſorrow murdred ſelue ye ſhould dampned caas good right medea ſlough child iaſon phillis alſo demophon hing ſefe ſo welaway broke tearme day come another rage dido queene eke cartage ſlough ſelfe eneas falſe foole ſhe ecquo died narciſſus nolde nat loue right thus hath many another folly done dalida died sampſone ſlough himſelfe pillere man aliue would feeres make wo ſo qd ſo thou woteſt full little thou meneſt haue loſt thou weneſt may qd good ſir tell holly wiſe wherefore ye haue thus bliſſe lore blithely qd come ſit doun tell thee vpon conditioun thou ſhalt holly thy wit doe thine entent hearken yes ſir swere thy trouth thereto gladly hold ſhall right blithely ſo god ſaue holly wit haue well goddes halfe qd began sir qd ſith firſt couth haue manner wit fro youth kindely vnderſtanding comprehend thing loue mine owne wit dredeleſſe haue euer yet tributarie yeue rent loue holly good entent pleaſaunce become thrall good body hart put ſeruage lord homage full deuoutly praide tho ſhould beſet mine heart ſo pleaſaunce worſhip lady dere long many yere ere mine hart ſet thus niſt trowe came kindely paraunter thereto moſt able white wall table ready catch take men therein make whether ſo men portrey paint werkes neuer ſo quaint thilke time fared right ſo able haue learned tho haue conde well better paraunter either art letter loue came firſt thought therefore forgate naught chees loue firſt craft therefore laft tooke ſo yong age mallice courage time turned nothing mokell knowledging time youth maiſtreſſe gouerned idleneſſe firſt youth tho full little good couth werkes flitting time thought varying yliche good knew tho thus ſtood happed came dey place ſey truly faireſt companie lady euer man eie ſeene togither place shall clepe hap either grace brought fortune lien full commune falſe traitereſſe peruerſe god would could clepe werſe ſhe worcheth full wo woll tell ſoone ſo amongs theſe lady thus echone sooth ſaine ſaw one like none rout dare ſwere without dout ſummers ſunne bright fairer clerer hath light plannet heuen moone ſterres ſeuen world ſo ſhe surmounten hem beaute maner comlineſſe ſtature well ſet gladneſſe goodly heed ſo wel beſey shortly ſhall ſey god holowes twelue ſwete right ſelue ſo ſtedfaſt countenaunce noble porte maintenaunce loue well harde bone eſpied thus ſone ſhe full ſoone thought helpe god ſo cought ſodainly ne toke maner counſaile loke mine herte eyen gladly trowe mine herte ſeyne purely tho mine owne thought said better ſerue nought another wele ſoth euery dele anone right tell thee ſawe daunce ſo comely carol ſing ſo ſwetely laugh play ſo womanly looke ſo debonairly goodly ſpeke ſo freendly certes trowe euermore na ſene ſo bliſfull treſore euery heer heed sothe ſay reed ne neither yelowe ne browne na thought moſt like gold eyen lady debonaire good glad ſad simple good mokel wide thereto loke na aſide ne ouertwhart beſet ſo wele drewe tooke vp euerydele gan behold eyen ſemed anone ſhe wold haue mercy folly wenden ſo neuer rather na counterfeted thing owne pure loking goddeſſe dame nature made hem open meaſure cloſe ſhe neuer ſo glad loking foliſh ſprad wildely though ſhe plaid euer thought eyen ſaid god wrath al foryeue therewith liſt ſo well liue dulneſſe adrad na ſobre ne glad thing meaſure neuer trowe creature many one loke ſhe herte ſate full litel herte ſhe knew nothing thought whether ſhe knew knew nought algate ſhe ne rought hem ſtree get loue nere na woned home inde formeſt alway behinde good folke ouer laued man may brother loue ſhe wonder large skilfull place bere charge viſage ſhe thereto ala herte wonder wo ne diſcriuen lacketh engliſh wit vndo full eke ſpirites bene ſo dull great thing deuiſe haue wit ſuffiſe comprehend beaute thus much dare ſaine ſhe white rody freſh lifely hewed euery daie beaute newed nigh face alderbeſt certes nature ſoch leſt make faire truly ſhe chiefe patron beaute chiefe enſample werke monſtre neuer ſo verke thinketh ſee euer mo yet ouer though tho euer liued liue ne would haue found diſcriue al face wicked ſigne ſad ſimple benigne ſoch goodly ſwete ſpech ſwete liues lech frendely ſo well ygrounded vpon reaſon ſo well ifounded ſo tretable good dare ſwere well • ood eloquence neuer fonde ſwete ſowning faconde ne trewer tonged ne ſcorned laſſe ne bet coude heale maſſe durſt ſweare though pope ſonge neuer yet tonge man ne woman greatly harmid harme hid ne laſſe flattering worde purely ſimple recorde found trewe bond trouth man hond ne chide ſhe could neuer dele knoweth world ful wele ſuch faireneſſe necke ſwete bone brecke na none ſeen miſſe ſatte white ſmoth ſtreight pure flatte without hole canel bone ſeming ſhe none throte haue memoire semed round toure yuoire good greatneſſe grete faire white ſhe hete lady name right thereto faire bright name wrong right faire ſhoulders body long armes euer lith fattiſh fleſhy nat great therewith right white hand nailes rede round breſtes good brede lippes ſtreight flatte backe knew none lacke limmes nere pure ſewing ferre knowing thereto ſhe could ſo well play liſt dare ſay like torch bright euery man may take light ynough hath neuer leſſe maner comelineſſe right ſo farde lady dere euery wight manere moght catche ynough wold eyen behold dare ſweare well ſhe among tenne thouſand wolde haue beſte chefe myrrour feſte though ſtonde rowe men eyen could haue knowe ſo men plaide waked thought felowſhip naked without ſaw one crowne without ſtones trewly ſhe mine eye ſolein fenix arabie liueth neuer one ne ſuch ſhe ne know none ſpeake goodneſſe trewly ſhe moch debonairte euer heſter bible poſſible ſoth ſayne therewithall witte ſo generall whole enclined good al witte ſette rood without malice vpon gladneſſe thereto ſawe neuer yet leſſe harmefull ſhe doyng ſay ſhe ne knowyng harme el ſhe could good ſo thinketh trewly ſpeake trouth ſhe routh thereof ſhe ſo moch dele dare ſaine ſwere wele trouth himſelfe ouer al al choſe maner principall reſting place thereto ſhe moſt grace haue ſtedfaſt perſeueraunce eaſy attempre gouernaunce euer knew wiſt yet pure ſuffraunt wit reaſon gladly ſhe vnderſtood folowed wel ſhe could good vſed gladly weſe theſe maners euery dele therewith ſhe loued ſo wel right wrong would wight wight might ſhame loued ſo wel owne name luſt hold wight hond ne thou ſiker ſhe wold fond holde wight balaunce halfe worde ne countenaunce men wold vpon lye ne ſende men walakie pruiſe tartarie allſaundrie ne turkie bidde faſt anon go hoodleſſe drie ſee come home carrenare ſir right ware may ſaine worſhip ye come againe ne vſed ſoch knackes ſmale therfore tell tale right ſame haue ſaid wholly loue laid certes ſhe ſwete wife ſuffiſaunce luſt life mine hope mine heale bleſſe world welfare goddeſſe wholy euery dele lorde qd trowe wele hardly loue wel beſet might haue bet bet ne ſo wel qd trowe ſir qd parde nay leue wel sir ſo leue wel trewly thought ſhe beſt behold alderfaireſt ſo loked eyen mine nay ſeyen said ſwore ſo though ne would tho haue loued beſt lady free though al beaute euer alcibiades al ſtrength hercules thereto worthineſſe aliſaunder al richeſſe euer babiloine cartage macedoine rome niniue thereto alſo hardy hector ſo haue joy achilles ſlough troy therefore ſlayne alſo temple two ſlaine antilegius ſo ſaith dare fregius loue polixena ben wiſe minerua would euer without drede haue loued muſt nede nede nay trewly gabbe nought nede woll tellen good mine herte wold eke loue holde fayreſt heſt good ſo haue reſt euer penelope grece noble wife lucrece beſt telleth thus romane titus liuius good nothing like though ſtories autentike algate ſhe trewe ſhe wherefore tell thee firſt lady ſey right yong ſoth ſey full great need lerne mine herte wolde yerne loue great empriſe wit wolde beſt ſuffiſe yong childely wit without drede beſet loue beſt wiſe wurſhip ſeruiſe coude tho trouth without faining eyther ſlouth wonder faine wolde ſee mokell amended mee ſawe amorowe wariſhed ſorowe day till eue thought nothing might greue ſorowes neuer ſo ſmert yet ſhe ſit ſo mine herte trouth nold nought world thought leaue lady trewly trouth ſir qd thinketh ye haue ſuch chaunce ſhrift without repentaunce repentaunce nay fie qd shuld repent loue nay certes well worſe achitofell antenor ſo haue joy traitour betrayed troy falſe ganelion purchaſed traiſon rouland oliuere nay liue nil foryet never mo good ſir qd tho ye haue well told need reherſe ye ſaw firſt would ye tell manere firſt ſpeche thereof would beſeche ſhe knew firſt thought whether ye loved nought telleth eke ye lore herde tell ye ſaid thou noteſt thou meaneſt loſt thou weeneſt loſſe qd tho nil ſhe love ſo ye ought done amis ſhe hath lefte goddes love tell god qd ſhall ſay right ſaid love laid yet ſhe niſt never dele longe time leve wele right ſiker durſt nought world tell thought ne wolde wrathed trewly woſt thou ſhe lady body herte ſo hath may aſterte keepe fro ydleneſſe trewly buſineſſe make ſonges beſt coude oft time ſong hem loude made ſonges great dele although coude nat make ſo wele songes ne knew arte al coude lamekes ſon tubal found firſt arte ſonge brother hamers ronge vpon anvelt vp downe thereof toke firſt ſowne grekes ſaine pithagoras firſt finder art aurora telleth ſo thereof force hem two algates ſonges thus made feling mine herte glade lo alther firſt werſt lord maketh mine herte light thinke ſwere wight ſo ſemely one ſe wiſh god might ſo ſhe wold hold knight lady ſo fayre bright told thee ſoth ſay firſt ſong vpon day bethought wo ſorowe ſuffred tho yet ſhe wiſt nought ne tell durſt thought ala thought rede tell dede tel ſay right ſoth dradde ſhe woll wroth ala ſhall debate ſo wo thought mine hert braſt twain laſt ſothe ſaine bethought nature ne formed never creature much beauty trewly bounty without mercy hope may tale tolde ſorowe never ſholde nedes maugre mine heed muſt tolde deed well began full yvell reherce eke helpe god withall trow diſmall ten woundes egipt many word overskipt tale pure fere leſt wordes miſſe ſet ſorowfull hert woundes dede softe quaking pure drede ſhame ſtinting tale ferde mine hew al pale full oft wexte pale reed bowing hing heed durſt one loke wit manner gone ſaid mercy na game ſate ſore laſt ſoth ſaine whan mine heart com againe tell ſhortly ſpeech hole harte gan beſeech ſhe wolde lady ſwete ſwore hertely gan hete ever ſtedfaſt trewe love alway freſhly newe never lady worſhip ſave beſt coude ſware ever evermore mine hertſwete never falſe mete nyl wiſe god helpe ſo tale ydo god wote ſhe acompted ſtre tale ſo thought tell ſhortly right trewly anſwere well countrefete wordes grete anſwere ſhe ſaid nay vtterly ala day ſorow ſuffered wo trewly caiſandra ſo bewayled deſtruction troy illyon never ſoch ſorow tho durſt ſay thereto pure feare ſtale away thus lived full many day trewly need ferther beddes heed never day ſeche ſorrow found ready every morrow loved gere befell another yere thought one would fonde doe know vnderſtonde wo ſhe well vnderſtood ne wilned thing good worſhip keepe name thing drede ſhame ſo buſie ſerve pitie ſhould ſterve sith wilned harme iwis lady knew lady yave holly noble yeft mercy saving worſhip way dredeleſſe mene none way therewith ſhe yave ring trowe firſt thing mine harte iwaxe glad need axe helpe god blive raiſed fro death live happes alderbeſt gladdeſt moſt reſt truely ſwete wight wrong ſhe right would alway ſo goodly foryeve ſo debonairly youth chaunce tooke gouernaunce therewith ſhe alway ſo true joy ever iliche newe hertes ſo even paire never na one contraire wo ſothe iliche ſuffred tho bliſſe eke ſorow bothe ilich glad wrothe v one without thus lived full many yere well tell sir qd ſhe qd ſtinte anone therewith woxe dedde ſtone ſaied ala bore loſſe tolde thee lorne bethinke thee ſaid beforne thou woſte full litle thou meneſt loſte thou weneſt god wote ala right ſhe ala ſir may dedde nay yes trouth loſſe god routhe worde right anone gan ſtrake forth done time harte huntyng thought kyng gan homeward ride vnto place beſide v lite long caſtell walles white ſainct iohan rich hill mette thus fill right thus mette tell caſtell bell ſmitte houres twelue therewith awoke ſelue found lying bedde booke redde alcione seis kyng goddes ſleping found mine hond full even thought ſo queint ſweven would proceſſe tyme fond put ſweven ryme beſt anon ſweven done explicit maſter c chriſt king asked troth ſothfaſtneſſe worde anſwerde asking ſaith man true geſſe therefore though hight expreſſe ſorow wo mariage dare writen wickedneſſe leſt ſelfe fall eft ſoche dotage woll ſay chaine sathanas knaweth ever dare ſaine paine would bounden never thilke doted foole eft hath lever ichayned priſon crepe god let never fro woe diſcever ne man hym bewayle though wepe yet leſt thou doe worſe take wife bet wedde brenne worſe wiſe thou ſhalt ſorow thy fleſh thy life ben thy wife thrale ſain theſe wiſe holy writ may ſuffice experience ſhall thee teach ſo may happe take way leuer taken friſe eft fall wedding trappe little writte prouerbes figure ſende take keepe rede vnwiſe wele endure thou ſiker put thee drede wife bathe pray ye rede matter honde god graunt lyfe freely lede fredome foule bonde explicit aſſembly fowl fowl gathered nature valentine day choſe make formell eagle belovd three tercel requireth year reſpite make choice upon trial qui bien aime tard oublie loveth well ſlow forget lyfe ſo ſhort craft ſo long lerne thaſſay ſo hard ſo ſharpy ye conquering dreadful joy alway y• flit ſo yerne mean love yt feeling aſtonieth wonderful werkyng▪ ſore wi think naught wete wel whether flete ſink know love dede ne wot quiteth folke hire yet happeth full oft bookes rede myracles cruell ire rede well woll lorde ſire dare ſay ſtrokes ſore god ſave ſoch lorde vſage luſt lore bookes rede told wherfore ſpeake naught yore agon happed behold vpon booke iwritten letter old vpon certain thing lerne long day full faſt radde yerne old fieldes men ſaith commeth al new corne fro yere yere old bookes good faith commeth new ſcience men lere purpoſe mattere rede forth gan ſo delite day thought lite booke make mencion entitled right thus ſhall tell tullius dreame scipion chapiter ſeven • heaven hell yearth ſoules therein dwell ſhortly treate ſentence woll ſaine greate firſt telleth scipion come affricke meteth maſſiniſſe joy armes hath inome telleth ſpeach bliſſe betwixt hem til day gan miſſe aunceſter affrikan ſo dere gan ſlepe night til appere telleth ſterrie place affrikan hath cartage ſhewed warned grace ſaid man lered eyther leude loveth common profite well itheude ſhould bliſfull place wend joy without end asked folke dede life dwelling another place affrikan ſaid ye without drede preſent life ſpace ment maner death wt way trace rightfull folke ſhull gon die heaven ſhewed galaxie ſhewed ye little yerth yt regard heaven quantite ſhewed hym nine ſperis melodie heard commeth thilke ſperes thriſe three welles muſicke melodie world cauſe armonie ſaid ſens earth ſo lite full tourment hard grace ne ſhould world delite told certain yeres ſpace every ſterre ſhould come place firſt ſhould mind world done mankind prayed scipion tell way come heaven bliſſe ſaid firſt know thy ſelfe immortall loke aie buſely thou werche wiſſe common profite thou ſhalt miſſe come ſwiftly vnto place dere full bliſſe ſoules clere breaker law ſoth ſaine likerous folke dede shall whirle world alway paine till many world paſſed drede foryeven wicked dede ſhullen come yt bliſfull place comen god ſend thee grace day gan failen darke night reveth beaſtes buſineſſe beraft booke lacke light bedde gan dreſſe fulfilled thought buſie heauineſſe thyng nold eke ne thing wold finally ſpirite laſt weary labour day tooke reſt made ſlepe faſt ſleepe met lay affrikan right ſelfe aray scipion ſaw tide come ſtode right bed ſide wearie hunter ſleping bedde wood ayen mind goeth anone iudge dremeth plees ſpedde carter dremeth carte gone rich gold yt knight fight fone ſicke mette drinketh tonne lover mette hath lady wonne ſaine cauſe radde affrikan beforne made mete ſtood thus ſaid thou haſt thee ſo wel borne looking mine old booke torne macrobie raught lite ſome dele thy labour would quite citherea thou bliſfull lady ſwete thy fire brond daunteſt leſt madeſt ſweven mete thou helpe thou maiſt beſt wiſely ſeigh north northweſt began ſweven write yeve might rime endite aforeſaid affrikan hent anone forthwith gate brought right parke walled grene ſtone ye gate letter large iwrought verſe ywritten thought either halfe full great difference ſhall ſay y• playne ſentence men gon ye bliſful place hart heale dedly wound cure men gon ye well grace grene luſty may ſhall ever endure way good auenture glad thou reader thy ſorow caſt open paſſe ſpede thee faſt men gon ſpake ſide vnto mortall ſtrokes ſpeare diſdaine danger gide never tree ſhall fruit ne leaf beare ſtreme ledeth ye ſorowful fiſh pryſon dry eſchewing onely remedy theſe verſes gold aſure ywritten weare gan aſtonied behold one encreaſed feare gan hart bold one het cold wit errour cheſe enter flie ſave leſe right betwene adamant two even weight peece yron ſet ne hath might move ne fro one may hale let fared niſt bet entre leave till affrikan gide hent ſhove gate wide ſaid ſtandeth written thy face thine errour though thou tell dread thee come place writing nothing meant thee ne none love ſervaunt bee thou love haſt loſt thy taſt geſſe ſicke man hath ſwete bitterneſſe natheles although thou dull thou canſt doe yet mayſt thou ſee many man may ſtand pull yet liketh wreſtlyng demeth yet whether doe bet thou haddeſt connyng tendite ſhall thee ſhew matter write yt hand toke anon comfort caught went faſt lord ſo glad well begon ouer mine iyen caſt tree clad leaues yt aie ſhal laſt eche kind colour freſh grene emeraude joy ſene bilder oke eke hardy aſſhe piller elme coffer vnto caraine boxe pipe tree holme whip laſſhe ſailing firre y• cipres death plaine ſhooter ewe aſpe ſhaftes plaine oliue peace eke dronken vine victor palme laurer diuine gardein ſaw full bloſomed bowis vpon river grene mede ſweetneſſe euermore inough floures white blewe yelowe red cold welle ſtreames nothing dede ſwommen full ſmale fiſhes light finnes rede ſcales ſilver bright every bough birdes heard ſing voice angell armonie buſied hem birdes forth bring little pretty cony play gan hie gan eſpie dredful roe ye buck hart hind squirrel beaſts ſmall gentle kind inſtruments ſtringes accord heard ſo play raviſhing ſwetneſſe god maker lorde ne heard never better geſſe therewith wind unneth might leſſe made leaf grene noiſe ſoft accordant foules ſong loft aire place ſo attempre never ther greuance hot ne cold eke every holſome ſpice gras ne man may waxe ſicke ne old yet joy thouſand fold tell ever could might ever clere day never night vnder tree beſide well ſey cupide lorde arrowes forge file feete bowe already lay well doughter tempred heddes well wile couched hem ſhould ſerve ſlea ſome wound carve tho ware pleaſance anon right array luſt beauty curteſie craft hath might done force wight done folie diſfigured ſhe lie himſelfe vnder oke geſſe sawe delite ſtood gentleneſſe ſaw beauty nice attire youth full game jolitee foole hardineſſe flatterie deſire meſſagerie mede three name ſhall tolde vpon pillers great jaſper long ſawe temple braſſe ifounded ſtrong temple daunced alway woman inow ſome faire hemſelf ſome hem gay kirtils diſheueled went office euer fro yere yere temple ſaw white faire dove ſitting many thouſand paire temple doore full ſoberly dame peace ſat curtaine honde beſide wonder diſcretly dame pacience ſitting fonde face pale vpon hill ſonde alther next within without beheſt arte folke rout within temple ſighes hote fire heard ſwough gan ren ſighes engendred deſire made euery harte bren newe flambe well eſpied cauſe ſorowes drie come bitter goddeſs ialouſie god priapus ſaw went within temple ſouerain place ſtond ſoch array aſſe ſhent crie night ſceptre hond full buſilie men gan aſſay fond vpon hedde ſet ſondrie hewe garlandes full freſhe floures newe priuie corner diſport found venus porter richeſſe full noble hauten port darke place lightneſſe ſawe lite vnnethes might leſſe bed golde ſhe lay reſt till hote sunne gan weſt gilte heeres gold threde bound vntreſſed ſhe lay naked breſt vnto hede men might ſee ſothly ſay remnaunt couered well pay right little kerchefe valence thicker clothe defence place gaue thouſand ſauours ſoote bacchus god wine ſate beſide cere next doeth hunger boote ſaid middes lay cupide knee yong folkes cride helpe thus let lie farther temple gan eſpie diſpite diane chaſte full many bowe ibroke hing wall maiden ſoch gone time waſte ſeruice painted ouer many ſtorie touch ſhall fewe calixte athalant many maid ye name want semyramus candace hercules biblis dido tiſ • e piramus triſtram ſoude paris achilles helaine cleopatre troilus sylla eke mother romulus theſe paynted ſide loue plite dide commen ayen place ſpake ſo ſoote grene forth walked tho ſeluen ſolace tho ware ſate quene light sommer ſunne ſhene paſſeth sterre right ſo ouer meaſure fairer creature laund vpon hill floures ſet noble goddeſſe nature branch halle boures wrought craft meaſure ne na foul yt cometh engendure ne preſt preſence take dome yeue audience ſainct valentine day euery foul cometh cheſe make euery kind men thinke may ſo huge noiſe gan make yearth ſea tree euery lake full vnneth ſpace ſtand full place right alaine plaint kind deuiſeth nature ſuch araie face ſoche aray men might find noble empreſſe full grace bad euery foule take owne place wont alway fro yere yere ſainct valentine day ſtanden ſay foules rauine higheſt ſet foules ſmale eaten nature would encline worme thing tell tale water foule ſat loweſt dale foules liueth ſeed ſat y• grene ſo many wonder ſene might men royall egle find ſharpe looke perſeth ſon egles lower kind clerkes well deuiſen con tyrant fethers grene mean goſhauke yt doth pine birdes outragious rauine gentle faucon yt fete diſtreineth king hand hardy sperhauke eke quales foe merlion peineth himſelf full oft larke ſeke doue iyen meke jelous swan ayenſt deth yt ſingeth oul eke deth bode bringeth crane ye geant tromps ſoune theif chough ye chattring pie ſcorning iaie eles foe heroune falſe lapwing full trecherie stare counſaile bewrie tame ruddocke coward kite cocke horiloge thropes lite sparow venus ſon nightingale cleapeth forth freſh leaues new swalow murdrer bee ſmale maken honie floures freſh hew wedded turtell harte true pecocke angel fethers bright feſaunt ſcorner cocke night waker goſe cuckowe euer vnkind popingeie full delicaſie drake ſtroier owne kind stroke wreker aduoutrie hote cormeraunt ful glotonie rauin crowe voyce care troſtell old froſtie feldfare ſhould ſay foul euery kind world haue fethers ſtature men might place aſſembled find noble goddeſs nature eche buſie cure benignely cheſe take accorde formell make poinct nature held hond formell egle ſhape gentilleſt euer ſhe among workes fond moſt benigne eke goodlieſt euery vertue reſt farforth nature ſelfe bliſſe looke oft beeke kiſſe nature vicare almightie lord hote colde heuie light moiſt drie hath knit euen nomber accord eaſie voice began ſpeake ſay foules take hede ſentence pray eaſe fordring need faſt may ſpeak ſpeed ye know wel valentine day ſtatute gouernance ye doe cheſe make flie away hem pricke pleaſaunce natheleſſe rightfull ordinaunce may let world win moſt worthieſt ſhall begin tercell egle ye know full wele foule royall aboue degre wiſe worthie ſecret true ſtele haue formed ye may ſee euery parte beſt liketh mee nedeth ſhape deuiſe ſhall firſt cheſe ſpeaken giſe order ſhall ye cheſe kind euerich liketh hap ſhall ye win leſe loue moſt entriketh god ſende ſoreſt ſiketh therewithall tercell gan ſhe call ſaid ſonne choiſe thee fall natheleſſe condicion muſt choice eueriche ſhe agree election ſo ſhould fere vſage alway fro yere yere ſo may time haue grace inbliſfull time came place hed enclined ful humble chere roial tercell ſpake taried nought vnto ſoueraine lady fere choſe cheſe hart thought formell hand ſo wel iwrought whoſe euer ſerue doe luſte doe liue ſterue beſechyng mercy grace ſhe ladie ſouerain let die preſent place certes long may liue pain harte coruen euery vain hauing regard onely trouth dere harte haue wo ſome routh found vntrue diſobeiſaunt wilfull negligent auauntour proceſſe loue newe pray judgement theſe foules rent ilke day ſhe euer find vntrue gilte vnkind ſith none loueth ſo well although ſhe neuer loue beher ought ſhe mine mercy bonde none knet well wo neuer ſhall let ſerue farre ſo ſhe wende say liſt tale ende right freſh redde roſe newe againſt sommer sunne coloured right ſo ſhame waxen gan hewe formell ſhe heard neither ſhe anſwerde well ne ſaid amis ſore abaſhed ſhe till nature said doughter drede aſſure another tercell egle ſpake anon lower kind ſaid ſhould loue better ye doe ſainct iohn leaſt loue well ye lenger haue ſerued degree ſhe ſhould haue loued long louing alone guerdoning dare eke ſay ſhe finde falſe vnkind jangler rebell wiſe jelous doe hang halfe beare ſeruiſe well wit ſuffiſe fro poinct poinct honour ſaue take ſhe life good haue third tercell egle anſwerde tho ſirs ye ſee little leaſer euery foule crieth ago forth make lady dere▪ eke nature ſelf ne tarying half would ſey ſpeake muſt ſorrow dey long ſeruice auaunt nothing poſſible die day wo hath ſanguiſhing twenty winter wel happen may man may ſerve better pay half year although ſome man doth hath ſerved full yore ne ſay ne ſervice may lady pleaſe dare ſay treweſt man dome faineſt wold pleaſe ſhort wordes till death ceaſe whether wake winke trewe hert may bethinke al life ſith day borne gentle plee love thing ne herde never man beforne ſo leiſer conning rehearſe chere ſpeaking morrow gan ſpech laſt till downward went ſunne wonder faſt noyſe foules deliverd loude rang let v wend well weend y• wood al ſhiverd come cryd ala ye u ſhend ſhal curſed pleding end ſhould iudge either party leue ye nay without preue goo duck cuckow alſo socried keke keke cuckow queke queke hie mine eares noiſe went tho goo ſaid al ny worth flie ſhape hereof remedie ſay verdite faire ſwithe water foule whoſo wroth blithe worm foule ſaid fole cuckow mine authorite common ſpede take charge deliver u great charite ye may abide yet perde qd turtel wight may ſpeak good ſtill ſede foule one vnworthieſt wore well leeſt comming better wight tonge reſt entremete ſuch neither rede ſing ſo doth full foule himſelf acloyeth office vncommitted oft annoyeth nature alway eare murmure lewdeneſſe behind facond voice ſaid hold tongue ſhall ſoone hope counſaile find deliver fro noyſe vnbind charge euery flock ye ſhall one call ſay verdite foules aſſented concluſion birdes foules ravine choſen firſt plaine election tercelet faucon define ſencence luſt termine nature preſent ſhe accepteth glad enrent tercelet ſaid manere full hard preve reaſon loueth beſt gentle formell everich hath ſuch replicatioun skils may none brought adoun cannot ſee argument availe ſeemeth muſt battaſle ready qd theſe eagle tercel tho nay ſirs qd durſt ſay ye wrong tale ydo ſirs taketh nat greefe pray may ye would way voice y• charge hand iudges dome ye muſt ſtand therefore peace ſay wit would thinke worthieſt knighthood lengeſt vſed moſt eſtate blood gentilleſt fitting leſt theſe three ſhe wote ſelfe trow light know water foules head laid togider ſhort aviſement everiche verdite ſaid ſaid ſoothly one aſſent goo facond gent ſo deſireth pronounce nede shal tel tale praid god ſpede theſe water foules tho began gooſe ſpeake cakeling ſaid peace take keepe every man herken reaſon ſhall forth bring witte ſharpe love tarrying ſay rede tho brother ſhe love let love another lo parfite reaſon gooſe qd ſperhauke neuer mote ſhe thee lo ſuch thing tongue loſe parde foole yet better thee haue held thy peace ſhewd thy nicete lieth nat wit ſooth ſaid fool cannot ſtill laughter aroſe gentill foules right anone ſeed foules choſen turtle true gan hem call prayed ſay ſooth ſad matter asked ſhe rad ſhe anſwerd plainly entent would ſhew ſoothly ſhe ment nay god forbede lover ſhould chaunge turtle ſaid wext ſhame red though lady evermore ſtraunge yet let ſerve alway till deed forſooth praiſe gooſes reed tho ſhe died would none make till death take well yhourded qd duck hat men ſhould love alway cauſeleſſe reaſon find wit daunceth merry mirthleſſe ſhould recke retchleſſe ye queke yet qd duck full well fair mo ſterres skie pair fie churle qd gentle tercelet dunghill came word aright thou canſt ſee thing well beſet thou fareſt love dwles light day hem blindeth full well ſee night thy kind ſo low wretchedneſs love thou canſt ſe geſs tho gan y• cuckow put forth preace foule eateth worme ſaid bliue qd may make peace retch long ye ſtrive let ech hem ſoleine live rede ſens may nat accord ſhort ſeſſon needeth record ye glutton filde paunch well ſaid emerlon thou murdrer y• heyſugge braunch brought thee forth thou ruful glutton live thou ſolein wormes corruption force lack thy nature go leud thou world may dure peace qd nature commaund heard opinion effect yet neuer nere finally concluſion ſhe ſelfe ſhall election liſt ſo wrothe blithe ſhe cheſeth ſhall haue ſwithe fith may diſcuſſed loveth beſt ſaid tercelet woll done favour ſhe shall right hert ſet y• hert hath knet iudge nature may lie none eſtate none eye counſaile chuſe make reaſon would counſaile royal tercell take ſaid tercelet full skilfully gentilleſt moſt worthy wroght ſo wel pleſaunce ought ben ſuffiſaunce dredeful voice y• formel anſwerd rightful lady goddeſs nature sooth ever yerd everich creature muſt life may dure therefore graunt firſt boone mine entent woll ſay right ſoone graunt qd ſhe right anone formel eagle ſpake degree almighty quene unto year done aske reſpite aviſen mee choice free ſome would ſpeak ſey ye get although ye dey woll ſeruen venus ne cupide forſooth yet manner way ſens may none way betide qd nature ſay would theſe foules away ech make tarying lenger ſaid hem thus ye ſhall ſpeke ye tercelet qd nature beth good hert ſerveth three yeare ſo long endure ech paine degree well god wote quit ſhe fro year fo befall entremes dreſſed fro werk brought end every foule nature yave make even accord way wend lord bliſſe joy make ech hem gan wing take neckes ech gan wind thanking alway noble goddeſs kind firſt choſen foules ſing yere yere alway vſaunce ſing roundel departing nature honour pleaſaunce note trow maked fraunce word ſuch ye may find next verſe mind qui bien ayme tard oublye welcome ſummer thy ſunnes ſoft haſt winter weather overſhake saint valentine thou art full high loft driueſt away long night blake thus ſingen ſmale foules thy ſake well cauſe gladen oft sen hem recovered hath make full blisful may ſing awake ſhouting ſong foules made flight away woke bookes took rede upon yet rede alway hope ywis rede ſo ſome day ſhall mete ſomething fare bet thus rede nill ſpare explicit floure courteſie made john lidgate book ſet forth rare vertues certain lady made john lidgate ſome think behalf ſome gentlewoman court feuerier froſty moone horned full phebus fiery light y• ſhe gan reyſe ſtreams ſoone saint valentine upon blisful night duty glad every wight foules cheſe void old ſorrow eueriche make vpon next morrow ſame time heard larke ſing full luſtely morrow gray awake ye lover ſlumbring glad morrow haſte ye may obſervaunce doth vnto day choiſe ayen heart renew confirming ever trew ye choſing large luſty day cuſtom nature take vpon blisful holy charge ſerve loue life may dure heart body buſie cure euermore venus cipride diſpoſeth god cupide joy owe plainly obey vnto lord mighty ordinaunce mercileſſe rather dey euer founden variaunce thogh life medled wth greuaunce heart cloſet wound bethe alway one ye bound heard liſted long deuout heart luſty melodie heavenly comfortable ſong agreeable ermonie roſe anone faſt gan hie toward grove way take foules ſeen euerich chooſe make yet full thruſty languiſhing mine ague ſo fervent hete aurora drery complaining diſtill chryſtal teares wete vpon ſoyle ſilver dew ſo ſwete ſhe durſt ſhame appeare vnder light phebus beames clere ſo anguiſh paine kene conſtraint ſighes ſore ſet downe laurer grene full pitouſly alway beheld holts hore gan complain mine inward deadly ſmert aye ſo ſore crampiſh mine hert drery paine sate beheld every tree foules ſit alway twaine twaine thought thus ala may euery foule hath liberte freely chuſe deſire eueriche make thus fro yere yere ſely wren tytemoſe alſo little redbreſt free election flyen yferre together go hem liſt enuiron kind haue inclination nature empreſſe guide euery thing liſt prouide man alone ala hard ſtound full cruelly kind ordinaunce conſtrained ſtatute bound debarred ſuch pleaſaunce meneth purveiaunce god againe right kind without cauſe ſo narrow man bind thus may ſeene plaine ala woful houre diſauenture dulfully ſtond ſame caas ferre behind health cure wound abideth like ſurſanure fortune ſo felly liſt diſpoſe harm hid dare diſcloſe hert ſet ſuch place neuer likely ſpede farre hindred grace ſaue danger haue none mede thus ala ſhall rede ne mine helpe ſhape remedy male bouche falſe envy twaine aye ſ • ondeth wey maliciouſly falſe ſuſpection cauſe alſo dey ginning root deſtruction fele concluſion traines woll ſhend labour death make end yet die hert thought god loue auow make beſt dere bought ſo ſleepe wake boreas doth leaf ſhake hight plainly till ſterue wele wo ſhall ſerve ſake holy time saint valentine ſomewhat ſhall write although ſo nat rime curiouſly craft endite yet leuer haue ſhe put wite vnconning negligence whatever ſay excellence whatever ſay dutee ſoothfaſtneſſe preſumption enſure ſhall ſee vnder correction rehearſe commendation ſhall blive vertues diſcrive right example ſummer ſunne paſſeth ſterre beames ſhene lucifer among sky dunne morrow ſheweth void night tene verily withouten wene lady paſſeth ſo taketh hede tho alive ſpeake womanhede ruby hath ſoveraignty rich ſtones regaly roſe ſweetneſſe beauty freſh floures without lye right ſo ſooth goodly eye paſſeth bounty faireneſſe manner eke gentleneſſe ſhe faireſt beſt reken ſoothfaſtneſſe every vertue reſt furthermore ſpeake ſtedfaſtneſſe root ſeemelineſſe mirrour governaunce example withouten variaunce port benigne wonder glad evermore trew advertence alway reaſon ſo deſire brideled aye wit providence thereto wit high prudence well aye devoid pride vnto vertue ſelven guide dalliaunce lowly ſhe diſcreet wiſe goodly glad attemperaunce every wight high low degree glad heart ſhortly ſhall lye named floure courteſie ſpeake feminity leaſt manniſh compariſon goodly abaſhed aye pity hem ben tribulation ſhe alone conſolation arne miſcheefe nede comfort hem womanhede aye vertue buſie charge sad demure word dredefull alſo rongues ben large eſchowing aye hem liſten hew head word ſhew diſhoneſtly ſpeake wight deadly hateth hem ſight hert ſo honeſt ahd cleane entent ſo faithfull entere ſhe ne may world ſuſtene ſuffer eares word friend foe neither ferre ne nere amiſſe reſowning y• hinder ſhould name ſhe ſhe wexeth red ſhame truly meaning ſhe ſet without chaunging doubleneſſe bounty beauty together knet perſon faithfulneſſe void ſhe newfangleneſſe heart aye one ever perſever ſhe ſette never diſſever rude vertues everychone cunningly diſcrive write well ye wore colour none like diſcretion craftely endite ſay lite wherefore thus excuſe acquainted muſe rhetoricke ſtile gouerne preiſe commendation blind ſo highly diſcerne goodneſſe make deſcription save thus ſay concluſion ſhall ſhortly commend naught nature amend good ſhe like polixene faireneſſe queene helaine stedfaſt heart dorigene wifely trouth ſhall nar faine conſtaunce eke faith ſhe may attaine cleopatra thereto ſetrone troy white antigone heſter meke like iudith prudence kind alceſte marcia catoun griſilde like patience ariadne diſcretioun lucrece rome toun may likened honeſte faith vnto penelope faire phillis hipſiphile innocence womanhede ſeemlineſſe vnto canace ſpeake goodlyhede paſſeth rede word deed ſhe naught ne fall accord vertue werkes though dido wit ſage time ſtedfaſt enee haſtineſſe yet ſhe outrage ſo iaſon alſo medee lady ſo aviſee bounty beauty demaine maketh bounty alway ſoveraine meane bounty goth afore lad prudence hath ſoverainte beauty followeth ruled ſore ſhe ne fende degree one goodly freſh free surmounting withouten good faire one perſone yfere though ignoraunce ne may diſcrive vertues yet day remembraunce onely ſupported mercy quaking hond ſhall full humbly highneſſe rudeneſſe quite little ballade beneath endite ever ſurpriſe mine hert alway feare betwixt drede ſhame leaſt loſe word aſtert mytre make ſeeme lame chaucer dead ſuch name faire making without wene faireſt tongue laurer grene may aſſay countrefete gay ſtile woll well drie licour ſwete clye caliope firſt woll excuſe ground goodlihede thus ſay vntill womanhede ¶ballade ſimple might beſtentent y• faith yt mighty god kind yave ſith hee mee ſoule knowing ſent cheſe bond ever bind love beſt life mind thus heard foules dawning vpon day ſaint valentine ſing yet cheſe ye beginning entent love though mercy find liſt died would aſſent ever twinne quicke line suffiſeth ſeene feather ynde thus heard foules morning vpon day ſaint valentine ſing mine heart luſt bent honour onely wood bind holly yeve never repent joy wo ſo wind tofore cupide eyen blind foules titan ſpring devout heart thought heard ſing ¶lenuoye princeſſe beauty repreſent ſimyle dity rude making heart faithfull mine entent like day foules heard ſing ¶here endeth floure courteſie hereafter followeth pity dead buried gentle heart pity ſought ſo yore ago hert ſore full buſie paine worlde never wight ſo wo without death ſhall nat faine purpoſe pity complaine vpon cruelty tyranny love trouth doth dye length certaine yeres ever one ſought time ſpeake pity ran biſpreint teares prayen cruelty awreake might word breake tell paine ſmert found dead buried hert adowne fell ſaw herſe dead ſtone y• ſwoone laſt vp roſe colour full diverſe pitouſly mine eyen caſt neerer corſe gan preaſen faſt ſoule ſhope pray lorne ſay thus ſlaine ſith pity dead ala day ever ſhould fall maner man dare hold vp head ſhall ſorrowfull hert call cruelty hath caſt ſlee v idle hope folke redeleſſe paine sith ſhe dead ſhal complain yet encreaſeth wonder new wight wore ſhe dead many men time knew yet ſhe died ſo ſuddainly ſought ever full buſily sith firſt wit mind ſhe dead ere coud find herſe ſlooden luſtely withouten mo thought bounty perfitely well armed richely freſh beaute luſt iolite aſſured manner youth honeſte wiſedome eſtate drede governaunce confedred bond alliaunce complaint written hond put pity bill company fond rather would cauſe ſpill doe helpe held plaint ſtill thoſe folke withouten faile without pity may bill availe leave vertues ſave onely pity keeping corſe ye heard ſaine confedred hond vntill cruelty aſſented ſhall ſlaine put complaint vp againe foe bill dare ſhew effect ſaith thus word humbleſt heart higheſt reverence benigne floure croune vertues sheweth vnto royall excellence ſeruaunt durſt ſo call mortall harme ifall nought onely wofull fare renome ſhall declare ſtandeth thus y• contrary crueltie allied ayenſt regallie vnder colour womanly beautie men ſhould know tyrannie bountie gentilleſſe courteſie hath depriued place hie beautie appertenaunt grace kindly heritage right ye annexed euer vnto bountie verely ye ought doe might helpe trouth aduerſitie ye alſo croune beautie certes ye want theſe twaine world lore ſaine eke auaileth manner gentilleſſe without benigne creature shall crueltie gouerneſſe ala heart may long endure wherefore ye rather take cure breake perillous alliaunce ye ſleen hem obeyſaunce ye ſuffer renome fordo throw ſhall man pitie ala euer renome fall ſo low ye alſo fro heritage ithrow crueltie occupieth place diſpaired ſeeken grace haue mercy thou herenus queene haue ſought ſo tenderly ſore let ſome ſtreame light ſeene loue drede euer lenger y• ſoothly ſaine beare ſo ſore though conning plaine god loue haue mercy paine paine ſo deſire haue ne nothing like thereto euer ſetteth deſire mine hart fire eke ſide go maner thing y• may encreaſe wo haue ready vnſought euery lacketh death bere needeth ſhew percell paine sith euery wo hart may bethinke ſuffer yet dare plaine well wore though wake winke ye recke whether flete ſinke natheleſſe yet trouth ſhall ſuſteine vnto death ſhall well ſene ſaine euer though ye ſlea crueltie fo algate ſpirit ſhall neuer diſceuer fro ſeruice paine wo sith ye yet dead ala ſo thus death may wepe plaine hart ſore full buſie paine la belle dame ſans mercie aleyn secretary king france framed dialogue gentleman gentlewoman finding mercy hand dieth ſorrow halſe dreame fully well awaked golden ſleep wrapped vnder wing yet thy roſe well nigh naked ſuddainly ſelfe remembring matter leauing thing muſt doe withouten delay hem durſt diſobay charge tranſlate thing forgiue part pennance book called la bel dame ſans mercy maiſter aleine made remembrance cheefe ſecretarie king france hereupon ſtood muſing ſelfe greatly imagining wiſe ſhould perform ſaid proceſſe conſidering good aduiſement vnconning great ſimpleneſſe ayenward ſtrait commaundement thus mine entent vexed tourned vp doun yet laſt concluſioun caſt clothes went way forſaid charge hauing remembrance till came luſtie greene vallay full floures ſee great pleaſaunce ſo boldly benigne ſuffraunce rede book touching matere thus began pleaſe long agoe riding eaſie paas fell thought joy full deſperate great diſeaſe paine ſo louers moſt vnfortunate sith dart moſt cruell full hate death hath take lady maiſtreſſe left ſole thus diſcomfite mate sore languiſhing way diſtreſſe ſaid thus falleth ceſſe either rime dities make ſurely make full promeſſe laugh wepe clothes blake joifull time ala doeth ſlake ſelfe feele manner eaſe let written ſuch fortune take neither none doth pleaſe ſo mine entent conſtrained joyfull thing write pen coud neuer know ment ſpeak thereof tongue hath delite tho mouth laugh much lite mine eien ſhuld make countenance vntrue heart alſo would haue thereof diſpite weeping teares haue ſo large iſſue theſe ſick louers leue hem longs lead life hope allegeance ſay make ballade ſongs euery hem feel greuaunce ſhe joy pleaſaunce whoſe ſoule pray god mercy ſaue hath mine heart ordinaunce ſieth within tombe ygraue fro time forth time hold pee wearieth matter trete let louers put hemſelfe prees ſeaſon time forgete fortune ſtrength forcer hath vnſhete wherein ſperde worldly richeſſe good haue gete beſt time youth luſtineſſe loue hath kept vnder gouernance miſdid god graunt forgiueneſſe well yet felt pleaſance cauſed neither joy heauineſſe ſhe died maiſtreſſe welfare made ſame purchaſe death hath ſhet bond witneſſe nothingmine hart ſhal neuer paſe great thought ſore troubled mind alone thus rode morrow tide till laſt happed find place wherein caſt abide ride went lodging puruay right ſoone heard little beſide garden minſtrels gan play anon went backer ſelfe thought inow twain y• friend eſpied yet wore came awayward drow somwhat force ſomwhat requeſt wiſe could ſelfe reſcow need muſt come ſee feaſt comming lady euerychone bad welcome god wore right gentilly made • euery one one great deale better worthy grace ſhewed great courteſie good diſport becauſe ſhold mourn day bode ſtill companie gracious ſojourne bords ſpred right little ſpace lady ſat hem ſeemed beſt deadly ſeruants place choſen men right goodlieſt ſome perauenture moſt freſheſt ſaw iudges full demure without ſemblaunt either moſt leſt notwithſtanding hem vnder cure emong one gan eſpy great thought ful often came went one ben rauiſhed vtterly language greatly dilligent countenance kept great turment deſire farre paſſed reaſon euer eye went entent full many time ſeaſon make chere ſore himſelfe pained outwardly fained great gladneſſe ſing alſo force conſtrained pleaſaunce ſhamefaſtneſſe complaint moſt heauineſſe came voice alway without requeſt like ſoune birdes doth expreſſe ſing loud frithe forreſt ſerued hall none like mine aduiſe pale ſomwhat lean withall ſpeech alſo trembled fearefull wiſe euer alone ſeruiſe blacke ware deuiſe plain thought wit could ſuffiſe heart nothing demain feaſt hem dilligence well coud right ſeemed euermore preſence chere done nolde none schoolemaiſter ſuch authorite bode ſtill place speake coud vpon beaute looked ſtill right pitous face head tourned laſt behold lady euerichone euer one ſet eye ſtedfaſt thought moſt vpon eyen ſhot knew anone fearful right humble requeſts ſelf ſaid god alone one ſaw theſe jeſts preaſe went full eaſely make ſtable heauie countenance wote ye well ſighed wonderly ſorrowes wofull remembrance himſelfe made ordinance forthwithall came bring meſſe judge moſt wofull penuance god wote pitous entremeſſe dinner anone hem auanced daunce aboue folke euerichone forthwithall heauy man danced somtime twain ſomtime one vnto hem chere one fell auenture euer among drew alone moſt dread liuing creature mine aduiſe good purueiance choſe mai • reſſe alone hart ſet pleaſance much beauteous perſon ſo euer ſetteth truſt vpon report eyen withouten might dead grauen vnder ſtone euer ſhould heart eaſe reſtore failed nothing coud geſſe one wiſe priuie apert garriſon ſhe goodlineſſe make frontier iouers hert right yong freſh woman full couert aſſured wele port eke chere wele eaſe withouten wo ſmert vnderneath ſtanderd dangere ſee feaſt wearied full ſore heauy joy doth ſore heart trauaile preaſe withdrow therefore ſet downe alone behind traile full leaues ſee great meruaile greene wreath ybounden wonderly leaues ſo thicke withouten faile throughout man might eſpy lady came full courteſly thought time dance trace set herber made full pleaſantly reſted hem fro then little ſpace nigh hem none certain compace onely farre coud ſee saue traile choſe place hem two heard louer ſighing wonder ſore aye ſorer ſought inward paine coud keepe ſtore ſpeake ſo hardie nought leech greater muſed ſore conquer deſire thought man may pennance broght heat bring ye fire hart began ſwell within cheſt ſore ſtrained anguiſh paine peeces almoſt breſt one ſo ſore conſtraine deſire bold ſhame gan refraine one large full cloſe little charge laid certaine keepe ſuch werre haue ſo many foſe full oftentimes ſpeak himſelf pained ſhamefaſtneſſe drede ſaid euer nay yet laſt ſo ſore conſtrained full long put delay lady right thus gan ſay dredeful voice weeping half rage purueyed vnhappy day firſt ſight viſage ſuffer pain god wote full hote brenning cauſe death true ſeruiſe ſee well ye recke thereof nothing take heed kind wiſe ſpeake beſt aduiſe ye ſet nought make thereof game though ſewe ſo great enterpriſe peireth worſhip fame ala ſhould prejudice man doe loue faithfully worſhip eſchewing euery vice verely challenge nought right reaſon hole ſubmit vnto ſeruice right liſt right ſo bind ſelf fraunchiſe lamant though ſo cannot deſerue haue grace alway liue drede yet ſuffer loue ſerue withouten maugre moſt goodlyhede faith trouth giue womanhede ſeruice without calling loue hath bound without wage mede man leue thing la dame lady heardall language gaue anſwere ful ſoft demurely without chaunging colour courage nothing haſt meaſurably thinketh ſir thoght great folly purpoſe ye nought labour ceaſe thinketh while ye liue matter ſet heart peaſe lamant may none make peace ye ground cauſe war eyen letter written defied put farre pleaſaunt looke lodeſtarre made heraud thilke ſame defiaunce vtterly behight barre faithfull truſt mine affiaunce la dame liue wo hath great fantaſie heart alſo ſlipper hold onely beholding eie cannot abide peace reaſon would ye liſt ye may behold eien made look whyſhold ſpare take keepe neither yong ne old feeleth ſmart counſail beware lamant ſo one hurt another ſore defaut feleth greuaunce right man may doe yet reaſon would remembraunce ſith fortune onely chaunce hath cauſed ſuffer paine beautie circumſtaunce liſt ye haue ſo great diſdaine la dame perſon ne haue diſdaine neuer truly ne nought haue right great loue hatred certaine counſail know ſo god ſaue ſuch loue mind igraue little thing may doe diſpleſaunce beguile make raue cauſe ſuch encombraunce lamant euer yt hath thus purchaſed wening hath deceiued certaine feruent loue ſo ſore hath ichaſed vnware caſten chaine ſith ſo fortune lift ordaine welfare hand fall eſchewing miſcheeuous paine ſooneſt dieth care leaſt la dame ſickneſſe right eaſie endure people cauſeth die meane know ſure comfort draw remedie plaining full pitouſly fele god wore alther greateſt pain ſo loue hurt ſo greeuouſly leſte harm one ſorowful twain lamant ala madame might pleaſe much better way gentilneſſe one ſorrie make twaine well eaſe deſtroy liueth diſtreſſe deſire neither leſſe ſeruice doe pleaſaunce eſchewing manner doubleneſſe make two joy ſteed one greuance la dame loue ſeek neither pleaſaunce eaſe haue therein great affiaunce though ye ſick doth nothing pleaſe alſo take heed pleaſaunce cheſe ſo herts aduaunce free free endure ruled man gouernaunce earthly good nay enſure lamant loue joy ſorrow doth depart hath ſet lady ſeruage largely doth graunt hem part lordſhip rule euery manner age poor ſeruant nought hath auauntage may get onely purcheſſe one loue doth homage full oftentimes dere bought richeſſe la dame lady ſo ſimple thus meane dull wit ſo ſotted folly word ſaid ſplene faire language painted full pleaſauntly ye mo hold ſchooles daily make hem great wonder ſuppoſe ſoone away head wrie faire ſpeech lightly eares cloſe lamant man jangleth buſily ſetteth heart mind therefore reaſon may plaine ſo pitouſly hath much heauineſſe ſtore whoſe head hole ſayth ſore fained chere hard keepe mew thought vnfained euermore workes preueth word ſhew la dame loue ſubtill hath great await sharp working gabbing great pleſance venge ſuch deceit would feele know ſecret gouernance maketh hem obey ordinance cherefull way hem ſuppoſed fall repentance rage counſaile diſcloſed lamant sith much god eke nature hath auaunced loue ſo high degree much ſharpe point thus ſure yet greeueth faut euer hath cold heat hath deinte one asked expreſſe pleaſaunce knoweth none certainete one thought heauineſſe la dame pleaſaunce alway one think ſwete think bitter pain ye may conſtrain yet right none luſt loue vaine challenge loue right neuer ſeine hert aſſent bond promiſe ſtrength force may attaine ſtandeth enfeoffed franchiſe lamant right faire lady god neuer pleaſe ſeeke right caſe ſhew plainly diſeaſe mercy abide eke grace purpoſe honour deface euer god fortune ſhend neuer vnrightfully purchaſe one onely joy vnto liues end la dame ye ſweare ſuch othes faſt ſo condemne curſen df ro full ſikerly ye wene othes laſt lenger wordes ben ago god eke ſaints laugh alſo ſuch ſwearing ſtedfaſtneſſe theſe wretch y• haue full truſt thereto weepe wailen diſtreſſe lamant hath courage man truly ſeecheth pleaſaunce worſhip diſpiſe called forth worthy yearth touch aire kind wiſe truſty hert mouth without feintiſe thus ſtrength euery manner name layeth faith little priſe leſeth worſhip fame la dame curſed hert mouth curteiſe full well ye wote according yet fained chere right ſone may hem apeiſe mallice ſet working full falſe ſemblant bere true ſeming name fame tongue fained worſhip hem put forgetting nought repented wiſe complained lamant thinketh ill good may befall god grace grant man deſart loue among thought thinke vpon wofull ſorrowes ſmart paine whether tender hart ſweet pitie therewith agreued grace diſcouart mean ſoon ſhould releued la dame lightſome hert follie pleaſance much better leſſe abide make think bring trance ſickeneſſe ſoone remedide reſpite thought put aſide full good diſport werieth day helpe hurt aplide troweth let paſſe away lamant hath bird faucon hound followeth loue euery place cheriſheth kepeth full ſo • nd ſight enchace ſet wit cace alone withouten chaunge put vnder much farther grace leſſe ſet ſtraunge la dame thogh make chere euery man worſhip mine owne fraunchiſe nill doe ſo withouten doubt eſchewing manner prejudiſe wote ye well loue ſo little wiſe bileue ſo lightly brought taketh owne deuiſe thing god wote yt ſerueth nought lamant loue trew ſeruiſe leſe y• good chere ſtrangers haue alway whereof ſhall ſerue trouth wiſe leſſe y• commeth goeth day holdeth nothing y• nay alſo loſt ſeeming courteſie reaſon ſay loue loue lawfull deſiring la dame courteſie alied wonder nere worſhip loueth tenderly bound praiere gift ſay verely good chere depart full largely liketh conceit fall guerdon conſtrained gift done thankfully theſe twain neuer accord neuer ſhall lamant guerdon ſeeke none cace deſert hie wherefore aſk pardon grace sith behoueth death mercy giue good wanteth truly reaſon courteiſe manere owne much better worthy ſtrangers ſhew hem louely chere la dame call ye good faine would y• wiſt pleaſeth one another ſmerteth ſore owne large liſt giue much leſe good name therefore one ſhould make grant little ne requeſt right well according worſhip kept ſet left little thing lamant world founden neuer none vnder heauen creature ibore neuer ſhall ſaue onely perſone worſhip toucheth half ſo ſore haue ſeaſon leſſe ne youth ne age ſtill ſeruice haue eyen wit mouth ſtore giuen ſame office la dame full great charge hath withouten fail worſhip keepeth ſikerneſſe daunger ſetteth trauail feffeth others buſineſſe longeth honour nobleſſe vpon none ſhould await owne ſo much hath leſſe much followeth conceit lamant eyen hath ſet print y• fele within hert ſo euer go doe thing ſouneth vnto wele need muſt come fro fortune wele wo life endure mercy abiding right thinke alſo worſhip aboue thing la dame worſhip ſee well nede ye ſpend ſeaſon vaine touching mine rede take hede folly put ſelfe paine ouercome good reſtraine heart deceiued follily worſe break bow certaine better bow fall ſodainly lamant faire lady thinke ſith firſt began loue hath ſet mine hart vnder cure neuer might ne truly ne none ſerue ſhall endure moſt free wiſe thereof make ſure may withdraw nay muſt abide manner aduenture may neither put take away la dame hold gift ſoothfaſtneſſe one offereth forſake ſuch gift abandoning expreſſe worſhip ayen may take hath hert full fell liſt make gift lightly put refuſe wiſe ſuch conceit ſlake need neither ſtudy ne muſe lamant ſhould muſe y• hath ſeruice ſpent lady honourable ſpend time entent yet leaſt reprouable fained hert thinke vnable miſtooke made requeſt loue hath enterpriſe notable many herts gotten conqueſt la dame ye liſt counſaile seeche fairer higher fame ſeruice loue preuaile thought according ſame hurteth worſhip name follily twaine himſelf trouble alſo leſeth game ſurely cannot ſet point double lamant counſail ought ſee better ſaid done mine aduiſe though beleeue forgiue mine hart ſuch ſo hole without feintiſe ne may giue credence wiſe thing ſouning vnto truth counſaile ſee fantaſiſe save grace ſhew pity ruth la dame hold wiſe worketh folly liſt leave part therefro conning learne truly would himſelfe conduit cannot ſo counſaile ſute putteth diſperaunce good ſhould fall loſt dead cleane remembraunce lamant yet woll ſhew matter faithfully while live ever chaunce hap truth dye death ſhall diſpleaſaunce hard ſuffraunce shall dye ſo true ſo great paine yet ſhall much leſſe grevaunce live falſe lover certaine la dame get ye right nought fable neither hard ſtreit right man cuſtomable thinke ye ſhould ſure conceit ſeecheth ſorrow receit counſaile feele ſee learne caſt await thereof let aſſay lamant one muſt aſſayed nay ſuch reputation true love right honour pay free hart gotten due raunſome free holdeth opinion great duteſſe diſcomfort keepe hert ſo ſtrait priſon hath one body diſport la dame know ſo many cauſes marvelous muſt need reaſon thinke certaine ſuch aventure wonder perillous yet well y• comming back againe good worſhip thereof ſeldome ſeene ne make ſuch array find pleaſaunce barraine ſhall coſt ſo dere firſt aſſay lamant ye cauſe doubt matter meue ſuch fantaſie put farre ſtraunger goodneſſe thinke well adviſe made apriſe every wiſe truth ſheweth open evidence long abiding true ſervice may well knowen plaine experience la dame right may called true ſo muſt take every place diſcerne let ne knew keepe good may purchaſe y• prayeth ſwereth cace right well ye wote y• trouth preved soch hath ben getten grace leſe ſone acheved lamant truthe cauſe vertue ſoverain ſhewe good love alway find contrary cheriſh y• ſteeth pain lovely adverſary yt pity long ſleep doth • ary hath ſet fine hevineſſe yet comfort moſt neceſſary shall ſet ſure ſtableneſſe la dame wofull wight wt may think ſay contrary joy gladneſſe ſicke body thought alway felen ſore ſickneſſe thus hurtes diver buſineſſe love hath put great hindraunce truth alſo put forgetfulneſſe full ſore begin ſigh askaunce lamant god defend harmeleſſe worſhip good may befall werſt tourneth leudneſſe gift grace thing lady vouchſafe vpon call cheriſheth honourable wiſe defaute ever fall deſerveth death ſuffre twiſe la dame judge yſet ſoch treſpace right love may recovered one curſeth faſt another doth manace yet dyeth none farre ſee kepe courſe alway one degree ever labour doth encreaſe bring lady great ſubteltee others gilte ſorow diſeaſe lamant ſo one doth ſo great offence dedde put juſtice right well wote gayneth defence muſt end full miſchevous wiſe ever ſaid god diſpiſe falſhed full curſedneſſe worſhip may never enterpriſe reigneth hath wilfulneſſe la dame yt great fere adaiſe soch ſay maintain thereto ſtedfaſt truth nothing praiſe hem kepe long wele wo buſie herts paſſen fro ſo well reclaimed lure well learned hem withhold alſo al chaunge love ſhould beſt endure lamant one hath ſet hert ſtable wiſe ſuch place good true ſhould flit doe forth ſervice alway withouten chaunge newe ſoone love beginneth remewe pleaſaunce gothe anone little ſpace party ſhall eſchue ſoule abideth place la dame love truely ought right ye may miſtaken doubtleſſe ye foule diſceived ſight light vnderſtanding geſſe yet may ye well repele buſineſſe reaſon ſome attendaunce moch better abide folie ſimpleneſſe feble ſoccour diſperaunce lamant reaſon counſaile wiſedome good adviſe vnder love areſted everichone accorde every wiſe rebell ſtill ſtone mine medled one therwith bounden ſo ſtrong chain hem departing ſhall none pity breake mighty bonde atwaine la dame ye love ſelfe ever ye bee love ſtand ſubject every place wo ye pitee others pitee bileve purchace fully aſſured cace alway vnder one ordinaunce better truſt grace leveth take pleaſaunce lamant hope ſo ſure ſo ſtedfaſt ſuch lady ſhould lacke pity ala ſhyt vp ſo faſt daunger ſheweth cruelty ſhe ſee vertue fayle true ſervice though ſhe doe faile alſo wonder ſurete muſt ſuffre way ever go la dame leave purpoſe rede y• beſt lenger ye kepe vaine leſſe ye get hertes reſt rejoyce ſhall never attaine ye abide good hope make faine ye ſhall found aſotted dotage end ye ſhall know certaine hope ſhall pay wretch wage lamant ye ſay falleth moſt pleaſaunce power great ſee hope ſhall never remembraunce fele ſo great adverſitee nature hath ſet plentee goodneſſe vertue grace never aſſembled hem ſeemed mee put pity dwellyng place la dame pity right ought reaſonable wight great diſavauntage nede ſhould profitable pitous ſhewing domage lady doe ſo great outrage ſhew pity cauſe owne debate ſoch pity commeth diſpitous rage ſoch love alſo right deadly hate lamant comfort hem live comfortleſſe harm comfort name ye hert ſoch dureſſe faire lady muſt affirme ſame durſt ſay ye winne defame cruelty ſitteth full ill pity may attain high herte may reſt tary ſtill la dame ever ſaith loveth paraventure leve well ſo ought wrothe ſhould blamed though would medled ſoch moe might called pity mercileſſe afterward ſhould live woe repent late geſſe lamant marble herte yet hard parde mercy may perce labour ſtrong bowe mighty tree availeth ſhew ſo great rigour pleaſeth ſee die houre iyen diſport play ſhewe ſome comfort ſoccour reſpite death chaſeth alway la dame diſeaſe ye may allegeaunce mine let ſlake alſo ye ſhall dye pleaſaunce heale ſurety make hurt ſelfe others ſake wepe laugh ſing warrant matter ſo vndertake none hem ſhall make therof avant lamant skill love god alone cauſe wepe preſence well ye wote avauntour none certainly love better ſilence one ſhould love hertes credence ſure kepe ſecretly vauntour reverence tongue moſt enemy la dame male bouch court hath great commaundment eche man ſtudieth ſay worſt may theſe falſe lover time preſent ſerue beſt jangle iay moſt ſecrete iwis yet ſome men ſay miſtruſted ſome partiſe wherfore lady wt ſo men ſpeake ſay ſhould bileved wiſe lamant good ill ſhall alway world ſoch yearth plain good y• profe ſhewth every day otherwiſe great villony certain reaſon though one tong diſtain curſed ſpeech himſelf ſhame ſoch refuce ſhould wrongfully remain vpon good renomed fame la dame soch nought tidings new ech treſpas ſhall lightly pardon purſuen good true ſet none ill diſpoſition continue every good condicion firſt fallen domage full freely hertes habandon little faith ſoft faire language lamant know well certaintee one truely yet ſhall ſhent sith maner iuſtice pitee baniſhed lady entent cannot ſee one ſtent good ill vice eke vertue soch good ſoch haue puniſhment treſpace hem liue untrue la dame power greuaunce puniſh none creature eſchew encombraunce kepe u hold ſure falſe ſemblaunce hath face full demure lightly catch theſe lady wait wherefore muſt endure make right good watch lo conceit lamant sith grace goodly word one may alway kept ſtore appeale god may hear mone dureſſe greueth ſo ſore pitee complaine furthermore forgate ordinaunce el life haue ended ſo ſone put remembraunce la dame hert haue done forfeit ye ſhould complain kind nothyng hurteth conceit iudge ſelf ſo ye ſhall find thus alway let ſinke mind deſire ſhall never recovered ye noye ſore waſting wind haue ſaid ynough ſeemeth lamant woful man roſe vp paine ſo departed weping countenaunce woful herte almoſt braſt twaine full like dye walking forth traunce ſayed death come forth thy ſelf auaunce mine hert forget property make ſhorter woful penaunce poore lyfe full aduerſity fro then went whither wiſt nought part drew ſoothfaſtneſſe lady thought daunce anone ſhe gan dreſſe afterward one tolde thus expreſſe rent heer anguiſh paine himſelf toke ſo great heauineſſe dedde within day twaine lenuoy true louers thus beſeech soch aduentures flye hem euery wiſe people defamed ye hem call truely great prejudice caſtels ſtrong ſtuffed ordinaunce long time office whole countrey loue obeyſaunce ye lady eſtate ye worſhyp hath choyſe dwellyng place goddes loue ſuch cruelty wiſe ne foule trace named rightwiſely reaſon ſeemeth cace may called la belle dame ſans mercy go litle book god ſend thee good paſſage cheſe well thy way ſimple manere looke thy clothing like thy pilgremage ſpecially let thy prayere vnto hem thee rede thou art wrong help call thee correct part pray hem alſo thine humble ſeruice thy boldneſſe pardon cace el thou art able wiſe make thy ſelf appear place furthermore beſeech hem grace favour ſupportacion take gree rude tranſlation god wote ſtandeth ful deſtitute eloquence metre colour like beaſt naked without refute vpon plain abide manner ſhowers ask hem ſocours whoſe requeſt thou made wiſe commanding body ſeruice right thus make end proſſes beſechyng hath balaunce true man vexed cauſeleſſe man wch remembraunce done faithful obſervaunce trouth purpoſe endure pray god ſend hem better auenture explicit queen annelida falſe arcite arcite theban knight forſaketh queen annelida loved intirely taketh new lady whereupon annelida maketh great complaint thou fiers god armes mar rede thy froſty countrey called thrace within thy griſly temple full drede honoured art patrone place bellona pallas full grace preſent ſong continue gie beginning thus thee cry full depe ſonken minde pitous hert engliſh endite old ſtory latine finde queene annelida falſe arcite elde frete bite hath freten many noble ſtory hath nigh devoured memory favourable eke thou polimnia pernaſo hath thy ſiſters glade elicon far cirſa singeſt voice memorial ſhade vnder laurer may fade doe ſhip winne firſt follow stace corinne jamque domos patrias cithiaepoſt aſpera gentis praelia laurigeo ſubeuntem theſea curru laetifici plauſus miſſuſque ad ſidera vulgi c theſeus warres long great aſpre folke cithe ouercome laurer crowned chaire gold beat home country houſes ycome people blisful ſome criden sterres went honouren entent duke ſign victory trompes come baner large image mar token glory men might ſee treaſure many charge many bright helm many ſpere targe many freſh knight many blisful rout horſe foot field ipolita wife hardy queene cithia conquered emely young ſuſter ſhene faire chaire gold lad ye ground chair ſhe ſprad brightneſs beauty face fulfilled largeſſe grace triumph laurer crowned thus floure fortune yeuing lete noble prince theſeus toward athene way riding fonde woll ſhortly bring ſlye way gan write queene annelida falſe arcite mar furious courſe ire old wrath iuno fulfill hath ſet people hertes fire thebe grece euerich kill bloody ſperes reſted neuer ſtill throng among hem euerich ſlue ſo wroth amphiorax tideus ipomedon partinope alſo dedde ſlain proud campaneus wretched theban brother two ſlain king adraſtus home ago deſolate ſtood thebe ſo bare wight could remedy care old creon gan eſpy yt blood royal brought adown held citee tyranny gentils regioun friend dwell toun loue awe noble folke towne ydrawe among theſe annelida queene ermony towne dwelling fairer sonne ſheene throughout ye world ſo gan name ſpring ſee every wight liking trouth none liche woman world riche yong queene twenty yere old middle ſtature ſoch fairneſſe nature ioy behold ſpeaken ſtedfaſtneſſe paſſed hath penelope lucreſſe ſhortly ſhe may ben comprehended might nothing amended theban knight eke ſothe ſain yong thereto withall luſty knight double love nothing plain ſubtill craft ouer wight conning wan lady bright ſo ferforth gan trouth aſſure ſhe truſteth ouer creature ſhould ſain ſhe loueth arcite ſo abſent throw anone thought herte braſt atwo ſight bare low ſhe wende hert yknow falſe na fayned chere nedeth ſoche crafte men lere neuertheleſſe full mikell buſineſſe er might lady winne ſwore would dien diſtreſſe witte ſaid would twinne ala routh ſinne ſhe upon ſorrowes would rue nothing thinketh falſe doth true fredome found arcite ſoch manere ſhe hath moch lite ne creature made ſhe cheer liked arcite lack might wite ſo ferforth yeuen pleaſe liked eaſe na maner letter ſent touched loue maner wight ſhe ne ſhewed brent plain ſhe full might ſhe nyl hide nothing knight leſt vntrouth vpbreyde without bode herte ſhe obeyd eke made ialous ouer man ſayd anon would praien ſwere y• word make yuell apaid wende ſhe witte braid ſleight flatterie without love fained jelouſie tooke ſhe ſo debonairly al thought skilful thing ever lenger ſhe loved tenderly honour king herte wedded ring ſo ferforth vpon trouth entent goth herte went ſhe ſhal eat ſo thought well vnneth meate toke ſhe keepe ſhe reſt brought ſhe thought alway till ſhe ſlepe whan abſent priuely doth ſhe wepe thus liueth faire annelida queene falſe arcite tene falſe arcite newfangleneſſe ſhe ſo lowly trewe tooke leſſe deintee ſtedfaſtneſſe ſaw another lady proude newe right anon clad hewe wote whether white reed grene falſed faire annelida queene nevertheleſſe great wonder none though falſe y• kind man sith lamech ſo long agone love falſe euer firſt father began loven two bigamye found tent firſt men lye falſe arcite ſomewhat muſt faine whan falſe coueren tratoury right horſe yt bite plaine bare honde treachery ſwore coude doubleneſſe eſpye falſeneſſe ſhe ment thus ſwore thefe forth way went ala herte might endure routhe wo ſorrow tell man hath conning wit wt man might within chambre dwell reherſen ſhall hell ſuffreth fayre annelida queene falſe arcite tene wepeth waileth ſwouneth pitouſly ground deed ſhe falleth ſtone crampiſheth limmes crokedly ſpeketh witte agone colour aſhen hath ſhe none ne none word ſpeketh ſhe moch lite mercy cruell herte mine arcite thus endureth til ſhe ſo mate ſhe ne hath foot wch ſhe may ſuſtene forth languiſhyng ever eſtate arcite hath neyther routh ne tene hert el newe grene wo ne deineth think recketh never whether ſhe flete ſinke new lady holdeth ſo narowe vp bridel ſtaues end every word dred arowe daunger made bothe bowe bend luſte made turne wend ſhe ne graunted liuing grace hath ſing droue forth vnneth liſt know ſeruaunt vnto ladyſhip leſt proude ſhe helde lowe thus ſerueth without meate ſip ſent land ſhip ſhe yaue daunger fill therfore ſhe owne enſample ye thrifty woman take hede annelida falſe arcite liſt dere herte call ſo meke therefore loved lite kinde man herte delite thing ſtraunge alſo god ſave may get y• wold turne annelida ayen pyneth day day languiſhing ſhe ſaw ne gate geyn vpon day ſorowfully wepyng caſt make complainyng owne hand ſhe gan write ſent theban knight arcite complaint annelida falſe arcite thir led ye point remembraunce ſwerde ſorowe whette falſe pleaſaunce mine herte bare bliſſe black hew turned quaking daunce ſewerty waped countenaunce sen avayleth nought ben trew ſo trew ſhall rew ſerueth love doth obſervaunce alway one chaungeth new wote ſelfe well wight loved one mine hert might ſelf hundred thouſand ſith called hertes lyfe knight ferre right y• glad blithe diſeaſe death ſwithe ayen trouth hath plight evermore hys lady kithe falſe ala cauſeles wo ſo routhles worde liſt one daine bring ayen ſorowfull herte pee caught vp another lee right liſt laugheth paine ne mine hert • eſtraine loue yet alway ueuertheles plaine ſhuld playne ala hard ſtound vnto foe yaue myne hert wound yet deſireth myne harme certes ferther woll neuer found none helpe ſores ſound deſteny hath ſhaped ſo full yore woll none medecine ne lore woll ben aye one bound haue ſaid ſaid euermore ala become gentilneſſe word full pleaſance humbleſſe obſeruaunce ſo lowe manere awayting beſineſſe ye called maiſtreſſe ſoueraine lady world ala neyther worde ne chere ye vouchſafe vpon myne heuineſſe ala loue bye dere certes ſwete though ye thus cauſeleſſe cauſe deedly aduerſite manly reaſon ought reſpite ſlee frende namely neuer yet degre offended wiſſy wote wo ſoule quite ſo playne arcite workes moch lite ſo beſie delite myne honour ſaue meke kinde fre therefore ye put wite ala ye retche mite though ſwerde ſorow bite wofull hert cruelty ſweet ſo ye ſo ſhame thinke ye furthered name loue newe ben vntrewaye put ſlander blame aduerſitie grame loue moſt god thou woſt alway yet turne ayen yet playne ſome day ſhall y• mi ben game foryeue lyue may lo hert myne al ſaine whether ſhall pray el playne way done trew eyther mote haue chayne deth ye mote depart v twayne bethe none meane wayes new god ſo wiſely ſoule rewe verely ye ſlaine payne mowe ye ſee vnfained mine hewe thus ferforth haue deth ſought ſelfe murder priuie thought ſorow routh vnkindneſſe wepe wayle faſt helpeth naught voide joy ſpeake aught voide company flie gladneſſe may auaunt better heuineffe plite haue ye brought without gilte needeth witneſſe ſhould pray weiuen womanhede nay rather death ſo foule dede aſke mercy giltleſſe nede plaine lyfe lede recketh know drede vnto mine othes bede mine excuſe ſcorne ſhall mede chere floureth woll ſede full long agon might haue taken hede though morow agayne might well hold aprill rayne holde maken ſtedfaſt almighty god trouth ſouerayn ye trouth man hath ſlayn hem loueth ſhall hem find faſt tempeſt rotten maſt tame beeſt aye fayne renne away leſt agaſt mercy ſweete miſſay haue aught ſayd way witte away fare doth ſonge chantepleure plaine pley ſo maſed dey arcite hath borne away key world good auenture world creature walking diſcomfiture ne ſorowe endure ſleepe furlonge way twey thinketh figure ſtante clad aſure efte profre newe aſſure ben trewe mercy prey long night wonder ſight ydrie day ſuch affray die right naught ywis ye retche ne neuermore mine eyen ben drye routh trouth crye well away ferre fetch thus holdeth deſteny wretch rede drede gye ne may wit ſo weake ſtretch end thus ſith may yeue vp euermore ſhall neuer efte putten balaunce ſikerneſſe ne lerne loue lore ſwan haue herde ſay full yore ayenſt deth woll ſing penaunce ſing deſtinie chaunce arcite annelida ſo ſore hath thrilled ye point remembraunce annelida wofull queene hath hand written wiſe face deed betwixt pale greene fell ſwoune ſithe ſhe gan riſe vnto mar au oweth ſacrifiſe within temple ſorowful chere ſhapen ye may plainly explicit aſſembly lady gentlewoman dreameth ſhe ſeeth great number lady put bill complaint judge promiſeth relieve grievance septembre falling lefe freſh ſeaſon altogider done corne gathered ſhefe gardine twaine noone lady walking wone foure nombre mind doth fall fifth ſimpleſt hem gentilwomen fayre alſo diſporting hem euerich giſe croſſe alies walking two two ſome alone fantaſie thus occupied diuerſe wiſe yet trouth alone knight ſquires many one whereof ſerued one hem aſked ſaid ayen fell thought walke maſe certainte woman nothing rought aſked ayen ſought colour ſo pale forſoth qd thereby lithe tale muſt wete qd anone tell let ſee make tarying abide qd ye ben haſtie one let wete litel thing bicauſe ye haue great longing deſire proceſſe ſhall tell plaine matere happed thus noone felawſhip one aſſent beſineſſes doone paſſe time maſe went tooke way eche entent went inward went gon ſtood mid looked ſoth ſay ſome full ferre behind right anon ferforth beſt ſo maſed mind alwaies good hem hoſt eeſt weſt thus went forth little reſt ſome courage hem ſore aſſaile wrath ſtep ouer raiſe ſought hem ſelfe fro gate ſelfe little auantage forweried might go though right gret viage came forth ſtrait paſſage brought herber fair grene made bench full craftie cleane thought might creature deuiſe better dewe proporcioun safe cloſed well enſure maſonry compace enuiroun full ſecretly ſtaires going middes place turning whele certaine vpon pot margelaine margarets growing ordinance ſhew hem ſelfe folke went fro behold great pleaſance accompanied mo ne mombliſneſse ſoneneſſe alſo poure penſes diſloged ne god wote place euery flore bench paued fair ſmoth ſtones ſquare many diuers hew well joyned ſay ſoth ſemed one none knew vnderneth ſtremes new new ſiluer bright ſpringing ſuch wiſe whence came ye coud deuiſe little alone beholding well delectable place felawſhip comming euerychone muſt need abide ſpace remembring many diuers cace time paſſed ſighes depe ſet downe fell aſlepe ſlept thought ther came gentill woman metely ſtature great worſhip ſhe ſeemed atyred well high meaſure countenaunce full ſad demure colour blewe ſhe vpon came mo ſelfe alone gown wel embraudred certainly ſtones owne deuiſe purfill word bien loyalement coud deuiſe praid maner wiſe name might haue remembrance ſaid ſhe called perſeuerance furthermore ſpeake bold
