ſhe dwelled prayed ſay ſhe againe full curteſſy told dwelling hath many day lady lady pray great eſtate thus warne qd ſhe call ye name loyalte office ſtand ye degree qd wold wete right faine qd ſhe vnworthy though bee chambre huſher certaine rodde beare token plaine like ye know rule ſoch ſeruice apertaining ſame office charged commandement warn felawes euerichone ye ſhould come ſhe preſent counſaile ſhall anone ſeuen day commen gone furthermore ſhe bad ſhould ſay excuſe might none delay another thing forget behind wiſe wold ye knew remembre well beare mind felawes ye muſt come blew eueriliche able mater ſew pray thinke vpon word ſelues euerychon abaſhed maner wiſe many ben ſoch high preſence make requeſt ye beſt deuiſe ſhe gladly woll yeue audience grefe maner offence wherein ye fele hert diſpleaſed help right ſone ye ſhal eaſed right glad qd ye tell none v yt knoweth ye way way qd ſhe ſhall mi ye ſhall haue gide day day felawes cannot better ſay soch one ſhall tell way full right diligence gentilwoman hight woman right famous gouernaunce well cheriſhed tell certaine felawſhip ſhall great pleaſaunce porte ſoch maners trew plaine glad chere wold beſie paine bring farwel haue done abide ſaid ye may go ſo ſone ſo qd ſhe haue ferre go yeue warning many diuers place felawes ſo mo well ye wote haue litell ſpace nowe yet qd ye muſt tell cace ſhall men vnto v call one qd ſhe may come amongs one ſaid eigh benedicite haue done pray tell life trowe well qd ſhe euer bilieue ſomewhat ſay trouth queſtions may nothing large meddle charge thus qd vnderſtand place lady dwelling forſoth qd ſhe one ſought land fairer none though king deuiſed well euery thing toures hie full pleaſaunt ſhall ye find phanes freſh turning euery wind chambres parlers ſort thought baie windowes goodly may bee daunſing wiſe diſport galeries right well ywrought well wote ye thider brought take good hede thereof euery wiſe ye woll thinke paradiſe hight ye place qd ſay pleaſaunt regard qd ſhe tell plain trouth qd wote ye may right well called ſo certaine furthermore wold wit right ſain ſhould ſoone come may beſt enquere gentilwoman porter yate ſhall ye find name countenance ye ſo hap ye come early late wer good haue ſome acquaintance tell ye ſhall auance come lady preſence word rede ye geue credence time parte fro good faith haue great buſineſſe wote right well qd ſo thanke great gentilneſſe comfort hath yeuen hardineſſe ſhall bold withouten faile aduice good counſaile thus parted ſhe left alone ſaw beheld aſide woman come goodly one forth withal aſpide thought anone ſhould gide name anone enquere full womanly ſhe yaue anſwere qd ſhe ſimple creature sent court name diligence ſone might come enſure taried licence come preſence looke ſeruice may commaund ſay thanked praied come nere becauſe would ſee ſhe araid gown blew dreſſed good manere deuiſe word alſo ſaid tant que je puis well apaid wiſt withouten full true herde though toke little ſpace full good qd ſhe coud geſſe farre qd haue vnto place day journey qd ſhe littel leſſe wherefore rede outward dreſſe ſuppoſe felawſhip paſt nothing wold laſt departed ye ſpringing ye day forth went ſoft eaſie pace till laſt iourney far outward might ſee ye place let u reſt qd littel ſpace ſay devoutly pater noſter ſaint iulian al herte aſſent good moch better ſhal ſpede done taried ſaid euery dyl day paſt farre none ſaw place thider came ſone round cloſed wall seeming full like hoſpital found one brought al mine aray gentil woman mine acquaintaunce haue meruaile qd maner way ye knowlege al ordenaunce yes yes qd ſhe herde perſeueraunce ſhe warned felawes euerichone aray ye ſhoulde haue upon loue qd pray sith ye haue take upon paine ye would help mine aray wit ye well wold gone right faine praier needeth certaine qd ſhe come hie ſone ye ſhall ſee anone ſhall done dout greatly wote ye felawes paſſed gone warne qd ſhe nat ſhall aſſemble euerichone notwithſtanding counſaile anone make redy tary harme though ye dreſſed mine aray asked whether well right well qd ſhe unto pay ye nede nat care place euer ye go while ſhe debated ſo came diligence ſaw blew siſter qd ſhe right well broke ye new diſcrecion purueiour went forth met auenture yong woman officer ſeeming name qd good creature diſcrecion qd ſhe without leſing qd moſt abiding haue qd ſhe office purchace chiefe purueiour longeth place acquaintance herbyger faire loue qd ordenaunce name herbigere forſoth qd ſhe name acquaintaunce woman right gracious manere thus qd wt ſtrangers haue ye qd ſhe high degree ne low ye firſt ferforth know countenaunce porter thus tale came ſtreight ye yate yong woman departed gone came diligence knocked faſt thereat without qd countenaunce anone truly qd faire ſiſter one one qd ſhe therewithal ſhe lough diligence ye know wel inough opened ſhe gate go wordes faire ſhe ſaid full gentilly ye welcome ywis ye mo nat one qd ſhe ſaue woman qd ſhe pray hertely take chambre reſt till felawes come hold beſt thanked forth go euerichone till chambre without wordes mo came diligence toke leaue anone euer ye liſt qd may ye go thanke right hertely alſo labour god mede ieſu ſpede countenaunce asked anone felawſhip qd ſhe forſoth qd comming euerichone know certainte without may hem window ſe ſtand awaiting euer among well wote long thus ſtode muſing full buſily thought take good hede aray gowne blewe wote verely good facion furred wel gray vpon ſleue worde nay ſaid thus penne endite moy que je voy written letter white forth withal ſhe came ſtreight wordes qd ſhe fain would yt knew forſoth qd ye ſhall well know ſee worde haue none trewe inough clothing blew commaundement ſo right well content largeſſe steward tell pray hertely ſteward ſay wt name hight largeſſe ſay ſurely faire lady right noble fame whan ye ſee ye reporte ſame bid welcome belchier marſhal hall ye fary ſtill mater ye may wel haue mind tel ye brought bill ye ye qd el behind one tell may find yt may ſhew mater plain surely qd ſhe unto chamberlain remembraunce chamberlaine chamberlaine qd ſay ye trewe ye verely ſaid ſhe mine adviſe nat aferde unto lowly ſewe ſhall done qd ye deviſe ye muſt know name wiſe trewly qd ſhe ſhew ſubſtaunce withouten faining name remembraunce secretary ſhe may yet forget ſhe doth right moche every thing wherfore rede ye wtther ymet matere hole tell without faining ye ſhall find full good full loving tell name qd gentleneſſe good ſothe qd ſhe aviſeneſſe qd paſſing good every bill ſedule ſhe muſt ſee good qd come ſtand ſtood felawes comming yonder yape ſay ye ſoth qd ſhe yape nay nay ſay certain se come togither twain twain ye ſay ful ſothe qd ſhe nay ſee comming goodly company ben ſoch folke qd dare ſay liſt love think verely love pray faithfully time upon call ye wol good frende hem frendſhip qd ſhe ſhal miſſe eaſe put thereto paine god yeld qd take ſhal know ye chamberlaine ſhal ye wel know word certaine worde ſiſter pray ſay plus ne pourroye thus writeth ſhe alway thus ſtode togider ſhe euen yate felawes echone met hem thought goodly badde hem welcome one one came forth countenaunce anone full hertely faire ſiſters qd ſhe ye right welcome countre counſaile take litel reſt chambre pleaſaunce ye thinke beſt go cal perſeveraunce bicauſe ſhe acquaintaunce ſhe alſo tell every thing ye ſhal ruled comming felawes one adviſe wel agreed like ſhe ſaid began dreſſe u giſe folke ſhould ſay nat unpurueid good wager among u laid u atired moſt goodleſt u ſhould praiſed beſt porter came brought perſeverance welcomed u curteiſe manere think ye long qd ſhe attendance go ſpeke unto herbigere ſhe purvey lodging go unto chamberlain ſpeke come anone ſhe departed gone ſaw folk comming without wall great people yt nombre coude none lady gentelwomen clothed blewe echone worde withal know word deviſe came ſo thick yt ne might wiſe anone came perſeverance ſtode ſhe came ſtreight ye ben qd ſhe mine old acquaintance enquere bolder would bee word bere eche degree pray tell ſecrete wiſe ſhall keepe cloſe warrantiſe ben five lady qd fere gentlewoman foure company begin open mattere ſhall ye know wordes none verely ſo tolde countenaunce mine array blewe needeth qd ſhe woll go againe ye may knowledge wt ye ſhuld ſoth qd ye wold take paine ye right moch u ye ſo rather ſpeed ſoner may go great coſte alway tarying long ſewe wery thing parted ſhe came anone ye muſt qd ſhe come y• chamberlaine redy qd everychone folow whan euer ye liſt certaine none eloquence tell plaine beſeeching may ſo excuſed trewe meaning refuſed went forth perſeverance ſee prees wonder cace paſſe great combrance people ſtode ſo thick every place ſtand ye ſtill qd ſhe littel ſpace eaſe ſomewhat ſhall aſſay make better way forth ſhe goeth among hem everychone making way yt might thorough paſſe eaſe ſhe ſo done beckend u come ſhe folowed la brought u ſtreight unto ye chamberlain left ſhe u ſhe went ſalued reaſon would ſo full humble beſeching great goodneſſe matter ſhe would good lady maiſtreſſe ye welcome qd ſhe ſothfaſtneſſe ſee pleaſe redy may eaſe folowed vnto chamber dore siſters qd ſhe come ye mee wete ye well paued flore goodlieſt wight might ſee furthermore loked wee eche corner vpon euery wall made burel criſtall wherein grauen ſtories many one firſt phillis womanly pite died piteouſly loue demophone next ſtory tisbe ſhe ſlewe ſelf tree yet ſaw right pitous caas antony ſlaine cleopatra ſide hawes ſhene full untrewly diſceiued baine alſo annelida queene vpon arcite ſore ſhe complaine theſe ſtories graued certaine many mo reherſe long tell fere bicauſe walles ſhone ſo bright fine umple al ouer ſprad entent folke ſhuld hurt ſight ſtories might rad went lad ſawe without faile chaire ſet full rich apparaile fiue ſtages ſet fro ground caſſidony full curiouſly wrought foure pomelles gold round set ſaphirs good coude thought wot ye ſought ſuppoſe fro country inde another ſoch right hard finde wete ye well right nere durſt beholding aboue rich cloth eſtate wrought needle ful ſtraungely worde theron thus ſaid truely endure tell word great letter better hem knew thus ſtode dore opened anone gentilwoman ſemely ſtature bering mace came ſelfe alone sothly thought goodly creature ſpeake nothing lowde enſure haſtely goodly warning make rome qd ſhe lady comming anone ſaw perſeveraunce ſhe helde vp tapet hand ſaw alſo right goodly ordinaunce great lady within tapet ſtand comming outward wol ye vnderſtand noble company coude tell nombre ſikerly name wolde nothing enquere ſoch wolde ſewe vnto save lady chauncellere attemperaunce ſothly name ſo v nedeth moche matter alway ſo forth tell furthermore lady beauty diſcrive conning ſimple verely never yet day live inly faire ſeene none truly eſtate aſſured vtterly wanted nought dare well aſſure longed goodly creature furthermore ſpeake array ſhall tell manner gowne cloth gold full rich nay colour blew right goodly faſhioun taberde wiſe ſleves hanging adoun purfill▪ wiſe ſhall deviſe ſort coller vent like armine made purfeling great pearles full fine orient couched one worching diamond ſteed powdering ſleeves purfell aſſiſe made like every wiſe necke ſort faire ruby white floures right fine enamaile vpon head ſet faireſt wiſe cercle great balais entaile earneſt ſpeake without faile young old every manner age world looken viſage thus comming forth ſit eſtate preſence kneeled everychone preſenting billes ye wote full humbly ſhe tooke hem one one done came anone ſame manere kneeling one riſing fere ſhe ſet place chamberlaine ſhe vnto call ſhe goodly comming vnto apace entent knowing nothing void backe preaſe qd ſhe vp wall make large roome looke ye tary take theſe billes ſecretary chamberlaine commaundment came againe ſhe bid ſecretary preſent billes delivered alſo many mo lady good adviſe againe anone withall called chamberlaine woll qd ſhe firſt thing ye ſecretary ye make come anone billes thus alſo preſence ſhe rede hem everychone may take good adviſe theron lady ben onr counſaile looke done withouten faile chamberlain wiſt entent anone ſhe ſecretary call let billes qd ſhe preſent lady madame qd ſhe ſhall preſence ſhe ye hem call good ready qd ſhe pleaſure ſhe commandeth vpon made ordinaunce came firſt billes ſhould red full gentilly ſaid perſeveraunce reaſon ſooneſt ſped anone withall vpon tapet ſpred ſecretary laid hem downe echone billes firſt ſhe redde one one firſt lady bearing deviſe sans que jamays thus wrote ſhe bill complaining ſore full pitous wiſe promiſe made faithful hert ſo broken ayenſt manner skill without deſert alwaies party matter deſiring remedy next folowing word wiſe un ſans changer thus ſhe complaine though ſhe guerdoned ſervice yet nothing like ſhe tooke paine wherfore ſhe coud wiſe reſtraine caſe ſue vntill preſence reaſon would recompence furthermore ſpeake twaine one hem wrote fantaſie onques puis leuer tell plaine complaint full pitous verely ſhe ſaid great reaſon remember matere ſhall tell proceſſe fere bill made complaining giſe joy comfort gladneſſe ſurety manner wiſe ſaid therein point ſtableneſſe ill wele ſikerneſſe full humbly deſiring high grace soone ſhew remedy caſe fellaw made bill thus ſhe ſaid plaining wiſe ſhe loved beſt whether ſhe wroth wele apaid might ſee ſhe woll faineſt wroth ſhe earneſt tell word ferforth wote entierement voſtre right thus ſhe wrote vpon ſhe made great requeſt hert might done vntill might redreſſe beſt mind might ſhe find ſoone remedy boone rehearſing ſhe ſaid beſeeching might ſo like wiſe done miſfortune ſhe tooke grevouſly one joy ſmert sometime thanke good deſert comfort ſhe wanted none comming ſo vſed greeued nothing deſiring lowly beſeeching ſhe would ſeke better way ſhe ben day living wherfore ſhe mervaile trouth ſomtime wont take availe every matere ago pity ſuffred ſo much wherof ſhe ſhuld complain ſhe thoght great encombraunce much write therfore certain god ſhe put affiaunce vnderſtande well euermore cercle equinoctiall tourneth juſtly fro eaſt weſt haue ſhewed ſphere ſolid ſame cercle cleaped alſo wayer day sunne head aries libra day night like length world therefore theſe two ſignes called equinoctis mooueth within theſe head aries libra ycalled northward mooueth without theſe head meuing cleped southward equinoctiall take kepe latitude north south forget cercle equinoctiall conſidered 24 hour clock euermore ariſing 15 degree equinoctiall maketh hour equall clock equinoctiall cleped mid way firſt meuing el sunne note firſt meuing cleped meuing firſt mouable eighth sphere meuing fro eaſt weſt eaſt alſo cleped girdle firſt meuing departeth firſt meuable ſain ſphere two like party euen diſtant fro pole world wideſt theſe three cercles principall cleped cercle capricorn tourneth euermore concentrike vpon ſame cercle head foreſaid capricorn greateſt declination southward sun therefore cleped solſticium winter ſigne capricorn alſo cleped tropick winter beginneth sun come v ward almicanteras ſignet thine orizont upon foreſaid plate compaſſed certain cercles highten almicanteras ſome hem ſeemen parfit cercles ſome ſeemen imparfit centure ſtandeth amidſt narroweſt cercle cleped ſignet nethereſt cercle deuideth two emiſperies party heuen aboue earth party beneath theſe almicanteras compouned two two ſo diuers aſtrolabies ſome almicanteras deuided one ſome two ſome three quantity aſtrolabie foreſaid ſignet imagined point ouer croune thy head alſo ſignet pole orizont euery region thine azimutes ſignet ſeemeth commen crooked ſtrikes like clawes loppe el like werke woman calle keruing ouerthwart almicanteras theſe ſame ſtrikes diuiſions cleped azimutes deuiden orizonts thine aſtrolaby 24 diuiſions theſe azimutes ſerue know coſtes firmament concluſions know ſignet sunne euery sterre twelve hour planet next theſe azimutes vnder cercle cancer twelve diviſions embolite much like ſhape azimutes ſhewen ſpaces hour planet thy reete elſe thy zodiake thy reete thine aſtrolabye thy zodiake ſhapen manner nette lop webbe old deſcription thou mayeſt tourne doune thy ſelf liketh containeth certaine number sterres fire longitude latitude determinate ſo maker erred name sterres ben written margine thy reete ſit whych sterres ſmall point cleaped centure vnderſtande sterres ſitting within zodiake thine aſtrolaby ben cleped sterres north ariſen northeaſt line remenaunt fixed zodiake ben ycleped sterres south ſay ariſen southeaſt line witneſſe aldeberan alſo algomiſa generally vnderſtond rule thilke ſterres ben cleaped right el ſuperficie line eclipſe sunne moone ſhall declare eke cauſe ſoothly ecliptick line zodiake vttereſt bordure zodiake thy degree ben marked zodiake thy aſtrolabye ſhapen compaſſe contayneth degree latitude ſay enſample well wote latitude oxenford certaine minute leſſe ſo thee thinketh long tarying abide till sun head aries libra wait sun degree zodiake conſider degree declinacion degree bordure betwixe prickes take aſcencion ſigne embolyfe cercle vnderſtand well ſignes zodiake head aries vnto end virgo cleped ſignes north equinoctiall theſe ſignes ariſen betwixe eaſt north orizont generally euer ſigns head libra vnto end piſces cleped ſigns south fro equinoctiall theſe ſigns ariſen euermore betwixe eaſt south orizont alſo euery ſign betwixe head capricorn vnto end gemini ariſeth orizont leſſe two hour equalls theſe ſame ſigns head capricorn vnto end gemini called tortuous ſigns crooked ſigns riſen embolyfe orizont theſe crooked ſigns obedient ſigns right aſcencion theſe ſigns right aſcencion fro head cancer vnto head sagitary theſe ſigns ariſen vpright doth therefore called soueraign ſigns euery hem ariſeth ſpace two hour ſigns gemini obeyeth cancer taurus leo aries virgo piſces libra aquarius scorpio capricorn sagitary thus euermore two ſigns like far head capricorn obeyeth euerich hem know juſtly rhe four quarter world eaſt weſt south north take altitude thy sun thou liſt note well quarter world sun time aſymutes tourne thine aſtrolabie ſet degree sun almicanteras altitude thilke ſide sun ſtandeth manner taking hour lay thy labell degree sun recken many degree sun line meridionall point thy labell note well nombres tourn thine aſtrolabie ſet point thy great rule thou takeſt thine altitude vpon many degree bordure meridional point thy labell line meridionall womb ſide take thine aſtrolabie hand ſadly ſlyly let sun ſhine hole thy rule ſlyly thilke ſhining lay thine aſtrolabie couch adown euen vpon plain ground meridionall line thine aſtrolabie euen south eaſt line lie euen eaſt weſt line weſt north line north ſo thou werke ſoftly auiſely couching thou haſt thus four quarter firmament c know altitude planet way sun whether north south way aforeſaid look planet line meridional altitude ſame height degree sun day planet way sun hath latitude altitude planet higher degree sun planet north way ſign south quantite latitude ſheweth thine almicanteras altitude leſſe degree sun planet south way sun ſoch quantite latitude ſheweth thine almicanteras ſaine way sun euery place zodiake morow sun another degree know signet ariſing sun fain party orizont sun ariſeth thou muſt firſt conſider sun ariſeth eaſt ſignet ſometime north eaſt ſometime south eaſt ſothly sun ariſeth euermore eaſt orizont head aries libra thine orizont departed 24 party thy minute ſignificacion 24 part world though ſo ſhipmen recken party 32 wait minute sun entreth ariſing take ſignet riſing sun manner diviſion thine aſtrolabie thus enjoyned caſe firſt deuided four place principally line commeth fro eaſt weſt another line goeth fro south north deuided ſmall party minute eaſt eaſt south firſt minute aboue eaſt line ſo forth fro party party till thou come eaſt line thus thou might vnderſtand ſignet euery ſterre party ariſeth know party firmament conjunction conſider time conjunction kalender thus many hour conjunction fro midday day ſheweth canon kalender recken nomber bordure thine aſtrolabie thou wont knowing hour day night lay thy labell ouer degree sun point labell ſit vpon hour conjunction look minute degree sun ſitteth party firmament conjunction know signet altitude sun ſay time day take altitude sun minute hee aſcendeth thou might ſee party firmament hee ſame wiſe might thou ſee night ſterre wheder hee ſit eaſt weſt south part betwixe name minute ſterres ſtandeth know ſothly longitude moon planet hath latitude time ecliptike line take altitude moone reken thyne altitude vp among thyne almicanteras ſide moone ſtandeth ſet pricke take anone right upon moones ſide altitude euery ſterre fixe thou knoweſt ſet cercle upon altitude among thyne almicanteras sterre founden waite degree zodiake prick altitude moon take degree moone ſtandeth concluſion ſoth starres thine aſtrolaby ſtandeth trouth treatiſe aſtrolaby maketh none excepcion whether moone altitude none whether ſide moone altitude sterre found note moone ſhewe ſelfe day thou mayeſt woorche ſame concluſion sunne well ſtarre fixe werching concluſions know whether planet direct retrograde take altitude sterre cleped planete note well anone right take altitude ſome ſterre fixe thou knoweſt note well alſo come third fourth night next folowyng thou ſhalt perceyue well meuyng planete whether meue forward backward waite well ſterre fixe ſame altitude ſhe thou tooke firſt altitude foreſaid planet note well truſt well ſo planet right ſide meridional line ſo ſecond altitude leſſe firſt altitude planet direct weſt ſide condicion retrograde ſo planet eaſt ſide altitude take ſo ſecond altitude firſt altitude retrograde weſt ſide lyne meridional direct contrary moving theſe party cours moone ſothly moone moveth contrary fro either planet ecliptike line none maner concluſion equacions houſes aſtrolaby set beginnyng degree aſcendeth upon end viii houre inequall lyne ſecond houſe ſit upon line midnight remeue degree aſcendeth ſet upon end x houre inequale beginning iii houſe ſitte upon midnight lyne bryng againe ſame degree aſcendeth firſt ſet hym upon eaſt orizont beginning iiii hous ſit upon midnight lyne take nadere degree aſcendeth firſt ſet hym vpon end ii houre inequale beginnyng v houſe ſit upon midnight lyne take nadere aſcendent ſet hym upon end iiii hour inequal wil beginning vi houſe ſit vpon midnight line beginning vii houſe nadere aſcendent beginning viii houſe nadere ſecond beginnyng ninth houſe nadere third beginnyng tenth houſe nadere iiii beginning eleuenth houſe nadere fifth beginning xii houſe nadere ſixt houſe another maner equacions houſes aſtrolaby take thyne aſcendent thou haſt fower angle well thou woteſt oppoſite thine aſcent ſay beginning ſeuenth houſe ſit vpon weſt orizont beginning tenth houſe vpon lyne meridional oppoſite vpon line midnight lay thy labell upon degree aſcendeth reken fro point thy labell degree bordure till thou come meridional line departe thilk degree three euen part take euen porcions three houſes lay thy labell ouer euery theſe three party thou might ſee labell zodiake beginning theſe three houſes fro aſcendent ſay twelue next aboue aſcendent eleuenth houſe tenth houſe upon meridional line firſt ſaid ſame wiſe werche fro thy aſcendent line midnight thus thou haſt three houſes ſay beginning ſecond third fourth houſe nadire theſe three houſes beginning theſe three houſes followeth find line meridional dwell fix certain place take round plate metal warpyng border better make upon iuſte compace little within bordure lay round plate vpon euen ground ſome euen ſtone euen ſtock fit thy ground lay euen rule y• centre y• compace ſticke euen pinne wire upright ſmaller better ſet thy pinne thy wire plomme rule end vpright even let pinne lenger quarter thy diameter compace fro ye line wait buſily tenne eleuen clocke y• ſunne ſheweth ſhadow pinne entereth thing within cercle compace one heere brede make prick ynke abide ſtill wayting ſunne one clock til y• ſhadow pinne wire paſſe thyng cercle compace bee never ſo little ſet pricke take compace meaſure even middle betwixt prickes ſet pricke take rule draw ſtrike even fro pinne vnto middle pricke take line meridonall evermore y• ſame place thou draw croſſe ouerthwarte compace juſtly yc line meridionall haſte thou eaſt weſt perconſequens oppoſitife south north deſcription meridional line longitude latitude city town well climate lyne meridional manner diſcription lyne imagined paſſeth vpon pole ye world ſignet hedde cleaped ſignet place man tyme yeere sunne meuyng firmament commeth meridionall place midday cleape noone therefore cleaped lyne midday take heed evermore two citees two townes one approcheth nerer eaſt doth towne truſt well thilk two tounes diver meridian take kepe alſo arche equinoctial conteyned bounded betwene two meridian cleaped longitude toune ſo yt two tounes meridian like one meridian diſtaunce hem bothe like farre maner chaunge meridian ſothly chaunge almicanteras haunſing pole diſtaunce sun longitude climate may cleaped ſpace ye earth fro beginning firſt climate unto laſte end ſame climate even directe againſt pole artike thus ſay ſome auctours ſome clerk ſay men cleap latitude center y• arch meridian yt conteined intercept betwixe ſignet equinoctiall ſay diſtaunce fro equinoctiall unto end climate even ayenſt pole artike longitude climate south know degree zodiack planet aſcendeth orizont latitude north south know thine almanack degree ecliptike ſigne planet rekened bee cleaped degree longitude knowe alſo degree latitude fro ecliptike north south theſe enſamples following eſpeciall thou mayeſt wirche every ſigne zodiake longitude peraventure venus another planet capricorne latitude hem northward degree fro ecliptike line toke ſubtil compas cleaped one point compace f tooke point ſet ecliptike line zodiake degree longitude heddes ſay head capricorne ſet point f upward ſame ſigne becauſe altitude north vpon y• latitude venus ſay degree fro heed capricorne thus degree betwixe two prickes laid doune ſoftly compace ſet degree longitude upon orizont tooke waxed labell maner pair table receive diſtinctly pricke compace tooke forſaid labell layed fix degree longitude tooke compace point waxe labell coud geſſe ecliptike line end yc longitude ſet point endlong y• labell vpon ſpace latitude inward zodiake yt ſay northward fro ecliptike laied doune compace looked well way upon ecliptike f tourned reete till pricke f ſate vpon orizont ſaw well body venus latitude degree ſeptentrionals aſcendeth end degree fro yt heed capricorne note maner thou mighteſt werch latitude ſeptentrional ſignes ſothly latitude meridional planet capricorne may take becauſe little ſpace betwixe ecliptike bordure y• aſtrolabie ſikerly ſignes may take alſo degree peraventure iupiter planet firſt degree piſces longitude latitude degree meridionall tooke point ſet y• firſt degree piſces ecliptike ſet ye point dounward f yt ſame ſign becauſe latitude south degree yt ſay fro heed piſces thus degree betwixt prick ſet degree longitude vpon orizont tooke labell laid fixe vpon y• degree longitude ſet y• point labell even ecliptike line y• end degree y• longitude ſette y• point f endlong labell ſpace degree y• latitude outward fro zodiake ſay southward fro ecliptike toward bordure tourned reete till point f ſate vpon orizont ſaw well yt body iupiter latitude degree meridionall aſcendeth degree piſces horeſcopo maner thou mayeſt wyrch latitude ſaid firſt ſaue capricorn thou wilt ply craft ariſing moone looke thou reken well courſe houre houre ſhe dwelleth degree longitude little thou woſte well neuertheleſſe thou legen well meuing table alter courſe houre houre thou ſhalt well ynough vmbra rectum thou wilt wirche vmbra rectum thou might come baſe toure manner ſhalt thou wirche take altitude toure hole ſo rule lye even point enſample thus ſee poynt fower mete ſpace betwixe toure find twenty foote behold fower twelue find third part twelve right ſo ſpace betwixe thee toure third part altitude toure thriſe twenty foot higheſt toure addition thine body fro thine eye rule fall fiue fiue time twelue higheſt toure vmbra verſae thou mayeſt come baſe toure thou fixe nomber one ſet pricke thy foote go nere toure ſee point two ſet prick behold one hath twelve thou ſhalt find hath twelve ſithes behold two xii thou ſhalt find ſixe ſithes therefore ſpace betwixe two prickes ſixe time thine altitude note firſt altitude one thou ſetteſt pricke afterward thou ſeeſt two thou ſetteſt prick thou findeſt betwene 80 foot thou ſhalt find tenne eight part 80 foote altitude toure fall upon another poynt thus falleth ſixe ſeconde takyng falleth fower ſhalt thou find ſixe ſecond part twelve fower third part twelve third part ſay ſpace betwixe two prickes twiſe height toure difference three wold three time height et ſic de ſingulis maner werchyng vmbra rectum thou mayeſt come baſe toure wirche wiſe sette thy rule upon one till thou ſee altitude ſet thy foote pricke ſet thy rule upon two ſo ſame manner look difference betwixe one two thou ſhalt find one meaſure ſpace betwixe two prickes twelfth part altitude toure ſo vmbra rectum thy rule fall vpon eight point right ſhadowe make figure eight looke much ſpace yt foot betwixe thee tour multiply twelve thou haſte multiplied ſame nomber devide nomber eight keepe reſidue adde thereto thy height vnto thyne iye y• reſidue ſhall height toure thus mayſt thou worche ſame ſide one twelve c vmbra rectum another maner working vpon ſame ſide looke vpon point thy rule falleth thou ſeeſt top toure two hole mete ſpace thy foote baſe toure right nomber point hath himſelf twelve right ſo ye meſure betwixt thee toure hath himſelf ye height ſame toure enſample thus ſet caſe thy rule fall vpon eight eight two third partes twelve ſo ſpace two third partes toure vmbra verſa know height point vmbra verſa thy rule fall vpon 3 thou ſeeſt top toure ſet prick thy foote ſtandeth go nere till thou mayſt ſee ſame toppe point iiii ſette another pricke mete many foote betwixe two prickes height vp thine iye ſhall height toure note iii fowerth part xii iiii third part xii paſſeth iiii nomber iii diſtaunce 1 therfore ſame ſpace thy height thyne eye height toure ſo two three diſtaunce nombers ſo ſhould meaſure betwixe prickes twiſe thriſe height toure vmbra rectum know y• height thou maiſt come y• baſe y• thing ſet thy rule vpon wt point thou wilte ſo y• thou mayſt ſee y• toppe ye thyng two hole make marke thy foote ſtandeth go nere ferther till thou mayſt ſee another point make another marke looke wt difference betwixe two point ſcale right difference hath xii right ſo ſpaces betwix y• two markes hath hym height thyng enſample ſet caſe thou ſeeſt point iiii point iii paſſeth nomber iiii nomber iii diſtaunce one right difference one hath himſelf twelve right ſo meaſure betwixe bothe markes hath height ſame thyng putting thereto height thy ſelfe thine eye thus maieſt thou werke one twelve vmbra verſa ferthermore thou wilt know vmbra verſa crafte vmbra rectum ſuppoſe take thine altitude point four makeſt marke thou goeſt nere till thou haſte point three makeſt another marke muſt thou deuide 144 four nomber yt cometh thereof ſhal 36 deuide 144 three nomber yt cometh thereof 48 looke difference betwixe 36 48 yt ſhalt thou find 12 right 12 hath 12 ſo ſpace betwixe ye two prick hath altitude thyng ¶here endeth concluſions aſtrolabie complaint black knight heavy complaint knight cannot win lady grace may flora ye freſh luſty quene ſoyle hath agone cleare faire morning dewe alſo like ſilver ſhining vpon leaf baume ſwete till firy titan perſant hete dryed vp luſty licour new vpon herbes grene mede floures many diver hew vpon ſtalkes gon ſprede ſplay leves brede againe sunne gold burned ſpere doune hem caſt beam clere river forth gan coſtey water clere birell criſtall till laſt found little wey toward parke encloſed wall compace rounde gate ſmall ſo would frely might gone parke walled grene ſtone went heare birdes ſong branch plaine vale loud ſang wood rong like ſhould ſhiver peeces ſmale thought nightingale ſo great might voice gan wreſt right hert love would breſt ſoile plaine ſmoth wonder ſoft overſprad tapettes nature made ſelfe covered eke aloft bowes greene floures cure beauty may long endure aſſaut phebus fervent fere ſphere ſo hote ſhone clere ayre attempre ſmothe wind zepherus among bloſomes white holſome ſo nouriſhing kind ſmale buddes round bloſomes lite maner gan brethe delite yeve v hope fruite ſhall take ayenſt autumpne redy ſhake ſaw daphene cloſed vnder rinde greene laurer holſome pine mirre alſo wepeth ever kinde cedres hye vpright line filbert eke lowe doth encline bowes grene yearth adoun vnto knight called demophoun ſawe eke freſh hauthorne white motley ſo ſwote doth ſmell aſhe firre oke many yong acorn many tree mo tell beforne ſawe little well courſe gan beholde vnder hill quicke ſtremes colde gravel gold water pure glaſſe bankes round well environyng ſoft velvet yong graſſe therevpon luſtely came ſpringyng ſure tree compaſſyng ſhadow caſt cloſing well round herbes growing ground water holſome ſo vertuous might herbes growyng beſide like welle narciſus ſlaine vengeaunce cupide ſo covertly hide graiue death vpon eche brinke death mote folow y• ever drinke ne like pitte pegace vnder pernaſo poetes ſlept like welle pure chaſtite diane nimphes kept ſhe naked water lepte ſlowe acteon hondes fell onely came ſo nigh well welle rehearſe holſome would aſwage bollen hertes venim pearce penſifehed cruell rage refreſh viſage hem werineſſe great labour fallen diſtreſſe daunger diſdain drye thruſt thought would aſſay taſte draught welle twain bitter langour might alay banke anone doune lay mine hed vnto y• welle raught water dranke good draught wherof thought refreſhed wele brennyng ſate ſo nigh hart verely anone gan fele huge parte releaſed ſmart therewithall anone vp ſtart thought would walke ſee forth parke holtes hore laund yede pace gan faſt behold found anone delectable place belet tree young old whoſs name ſhall told amidde ſtood herber greene benched colour new clene herber full floures gende beholde gan betwixt hulfeere woodbende ware ſaw lay man blacke white colour pale wan wonder deadly alſo hewe hurtes grene freſh woundes new overmore diſtrayned ſickneſſe beſide full grevouſſy vpon hore acceſſe day day ſhooke full pitouſly conſtrayning malady hertely wo thus lying alone death hear grone wherof aſtonied fote gan withdraw greatly wondring might ſo lay felaw ne coud wight ſee wherof routhe eke pite gan anone ſo ſoftly coude among buſhes prively ſhroude might wiſe aſpy cauſe deedly wo ſo pitouſly gan cry fortune vre alſo might layd eare every word marke ſaid ſwough amonge abraid bur firſt ſhould make mencion perſon plainely diſcrive ſothe without excepcion ſpeake manhood one beſt llve may man ayen trouth ſtrive tyme age alſo proved men ſhuld ado one ye beſt therto bread length well ymade good proporcion deliver ſtrength thought ſickneſſe occaſion thus lay lamentacion gruffe ground place deſolate sole himſelfe awhaped amate ſeemeth fitting wordes put remembraunce heard complayning ground wofull chaunce withall may pleaſaunce woll ſo anone lyke ſayd rehearce everichone ſhall helpe complain ſhall ſtile gy lede niobe let thy teeres rain penne helpe eke nede thou wofull myrre yt feleſt hert blede pitous wo mine hand eke quake write mannes ſake vnto wo accordeth complayning dolefull chere vnto heavineſſe ſorow alſo ſighing weping pitous mourning vnto drerineſſe ſhall write diſtreſſe party needeth know feelingly cauſe roote ſoch malady ala witte dull knowing ſoch matere diſcrive write full wofull complaint yt ye ſhall even like doth skriuenere ſhall write maiſter beſide doth endite right ſo fare ſentement say right naught concluſion herde preſent man complaine pitous ſoun even like without addicioun diſencreaſe eyther leſſe reherſe anone woll dreſſe place fele love brenning fervence hindred lady grace falſe tonges peſtilence slea trewe men neuer offence worde deed ne entent ſoch preſent let routh lay audience doleful chere ſobre countenaunce man full hye ſentence mortall wo perturbaunce complayning lying traunce lookes vpcaſt rufull chere theffect ye ſhall thought oppreſſed inward ſighs ſore painful life body languiſhing woful goſt hert rent tore pitous chere pale complayning deedly face like aſhes ſhining ſalte teares mine eyen fall percel declare ground paynes whoſe hert ground blede heuineſſe thought receit wo complaint breſt cheſt dole drerineſſe body eke ſo feeble ſo faint hote colde mine ax ſo maint chiuer default heat hote glede ſodainly ſweat hote fire colde aſhes deed hote cold cold heat againe colde yſe cole reed heate brenne thus betwixe twaine poſſed forecaſt paine heate plainly fele greeuous colde cauſe euery dele colde inward hie diſdayn colde diſpite colde cruell hate colde yt euer doth beſie payn ayenſt trouth fight debate colde fire abate trewe meaning ala harde colde woll begile euer better trouth ment might faithfully ſerue herte diligent leſſe thanke ala deſerue thus trouth danger ſterue one ſhould death mercy let hath made diſpite new ſwerde whet againſt growes file take vengeaunce wilfull cruelte tonges falſe ſleightly wile han gon werre ſtinted falſe enuie wrath enuite haue conſpired againſt right law malice trouth ſhall ſlaw male bouch gan firſt tale tell ſclaunder trouth indignacion falſe reporte ſo loude range bell misbeleefe falſe ſuſpecion haue trouth brought dampnacion ala wrong fully dieth falſeneſſe place occupieth entred trouthes londe hath thereof full poſſeſſion rightfull god firſt trouth fonde may thou ſuffre ſoch oppreſſion falſheed ſhould haue jurisdiction trouthes right ſlee gyltles fraunchiſe may lyue pee falſly accuſed fone forjudged without anſwere abſent damned may excuſed cruelte ſate judgement haſtineſſe without aduiſement badde diſdaine execute anone judgement preſence fone attourney may none admitted excuſe trouth ne worde ſpeke faith othe judge liſt ſeen gaine wreke lord trouth thee call clepe may thou ſee thus thy preſence without mercy murdred innocence god art trouth ſoueraine ſeeſt lie trouth bound ſore knit loues fyrie chaine euen y• death gyrte many wound likely neuer ſound troutham dampned death abyde draw along breath conſider ſee thine eternal right mine herte profeſſed whilom trewe full might onely one ala volunte without treſpas accuſours hath taken vnto grace cheriſheth hem death purchace meaneth wonder vre purueyaunce ſhall call god loue falſe hem ſo aſſure trewe ala downe whele ben fall yet ſothe worſt falſhed wrongfully troth hath y• name trouth yenward falſhed beareth blame blind chaunce ſtormy auenture loue hath moſt experience y• doth trouth moſt cure shall mede finde moſt offence ſerueth loue diligence fayne vnder lowlyhede ne fayleth finde grace ſpede loued one full long ſith agone mine herte body full might deed herte gone heſte hold hath hight though baniſhed ſight mouth dampned ſhall dey vnto heſt yet euer obey euer ſith world began ſo liſte looke ſtory rede ſhall aye find trewe man put abacke whereas falſhede yfurthered loue taketh none hede ſlea trew hath hem charge falſe goeth frely large take record palamydes trewe man noble worthy knight euer loued payne relees notwithſtanding manhood might loue vnto full great vnright aye bet cheualrie hindred enuie aye better euery place knighthood buſie payne ferder lady grace mercy might neuer attayne death coud refrayne daungere aye obey ſerue beſt coude plainly till ſterue fine alſo hercules conqueſt worthineſſe ſtrength alone peerles like bookes liſt expreſſe ſet pillers hye proweſſe away gades ſignifie man might paſſe cheualrie pillers ferre beyond inde ſet gold remembraunce ſet behinde hem loue liſt feebly auaunce ſet laſt vpon daunce againſt helpe may ſtrife trouth loſt life phebus alſo pleaſaunt light went yearth lowe vnto hert venus ſight ywounded cupides bowe yet lady liſt knowe though loue herte blede let go toke hede ſhall ſay yonge piramus trewe triſtram hye renowne achilles antonius arcite palomoune end paſſioune ſorow death graue lo guerdon theſe louers haue falſe iaſon doubleneſſe vntrewe colkos medee theſeus roote vnkindneſſe theſe two eke falſe enee lo thus falſe aye one degree loue luſt ſaue falſhood none skill thebe eke falſe arcite demophon eke ſlouth luſt might delite falſhood great vntrouth thus euer loue ala routh falſe liege forthereth may ſleeth trewe vngoodly day day trewe adon ſlaine bore amidde foreſt grene ſhade venus loue felt ſore vulcanus mercy made foule chorle many night glade mar knight man find mercy comfort none alſo yonge freſhe ipomedes luſtly free corage ſerue hert ches athalant ſo faire viſage loue ala quite ſo wage cruell daunger plainly laſt death guerd • nleſſe paſt lo fine loues ſeruice lo loue ſeruaunts quite lo faithfull men diſpiſe ſlea trewe men falſe reſpite lo doth ſwerde ſorow bite herts ſoch moſt luſt obey ſaue falſe trewe dey faith othe worde ne aſſuraunce trewe meaning awaite buſineſſe still porte ne faithfull attendaunce manhood ne might armes worthineſſe purſute worſhip hie proweſſe ſtraunge land riding ne trauaile full litell nought loue doth auaile perill death ſee ne land hunger ne thruſt ſorow ne ſickneſſe ne great empriſes take hand sheding blood ne manfull hardineſſe ne oft wounding ſautes diſtreſſe parting life death alſo nought loue taketh heed thereto leſings flatterie falſhede doubleneſſe tale new many fained lie falſe ſemblaunt counterſeit humbleſſe vnder colour depaint ſtedfaſtneſſe fraud couered vnder pit • u face accept ratheſt vnto grace himſelfe beſt magnifie fained port preſumption haunce cauſe falſe ſurquidrie vnder meaning double entention thinke one opinion ſay another ſet himſelfe aloft hinder trouth ſcene full oft thing buy deare thanked venus god enpide ſeene mine oppreſſed cheare arrowes ſticken ſide ſaue death nothing abide fro day day ala hard euer dart liſt file wofull hert riue atwo faut mercy lacke pite cauſeth paine wo liſt one grace ſee vnto trouth cruelte moſt complaine ſhe hath joy laugh paine wilfully hath death ſworne guiltleſſe wote cauſe saue trouth aforne alone ſerue faithfully god loue vnto thee cry thy blind double deite great wrong complaine vnto thy ſtormy wilfull variaunce iment change great vnſtableneſſe vp ſo renning thy chance thee truſt may ſikerneſſe wite nothing thy doubleneſſe archer blend marketh nothing ſhooteth wend hath diſcretion without aduiſe let arrow go lacke ſight alſo reaſon ſhooting happeth oft ſo hurt friend rather fo doth god ſharpe flone trew ſleeth letteth falſe gone wounding worſt hurt doeth ſo cruell wretch maketh licke cry call vnto ſoe leche hard man ſeche vpon point death jeoperdie vnto foe find remedie thus fareth euen foe gaue hert wound mote aske grace mercy pite namely none may found ſore leche confound god kind ſo hath ſet mine vre liues foe haue wound cure ala borne euer ſaw bright ſonne ſee full long aforne borne deſteny ſponne parcas ſiſterne ſlea conne death ſhopen ſhert trouth may aſtert mighty goddeſſe alſo nature vnder god hath gouernaunce worldly thing committed cure diſpoſed haue wiſe purueiance giue lady ſo much ſuffiſaunce vertues therewithall puruide murder trouth hath take danger gide bounte beaute ſhape ſeemelihede prudence wit paſſingly faireneſſe benigne port glad chere lowlihede womanhede right plenteous largeneſſe nature fully empreſſe ſhe wrought alther laſt disdain hinder trouth ſhe made chamberlain miſtruſt alſo falſe ſuſpection misbeleue ſhe made cheefe counſaile concluſion exile trouth eke pite court make mercy flee diſpite holdeth forth rein haſty bileue tale men fein thus trouth ala murdred ſlain word ſharp kene guiltleſſe god wote treſpas lie blede vpon cold grene mercy ſwete mercy liues quene grace mercy yet prey ſeruice man may dey ſo ſhall die algate ſhall none mercy haue yet death let date wil broght graue haſtely liſt ſaue ſharpe wound ake ſo blede mercy charme alſo womanhede charme plainly none mercy helpe caſe though wound bleed euer one life death ſtandeth grace though guilt nothing ala aſke mercy beſt entent ready die ye aſſent againſt ſhall neuer ſtriue word ne werke plainely ne may leuer haue aliue die ſoothly pay ye though ſame day euer liſt deuiſe suffiſeth die ſeruiſe god y• knoweſt y• thoght euery wight right euery thing thou maiſt ſee yet ere die full might lowly pray graunt vnto mee ye goodly faire freſh free onely ſlea defaut routh die ye may know trouth ſooth ſufficeth ſhe know euery circumſtaunce well paid ſhe liſt death vengeaunce vnto vnder lygeaunce ſit doome diſobey luſt wilfully dey without grutching rebellion word holy aſſent manner contradiction fully commaundement die teſtament herte ſend ſpirit alſo whatſoeuer ſhe liſt hem alderlaſt womanhede mercy recommaund lie betwixe hope drede abiding plainly ſhe liſt commaund utterly ni demaund welcome laſteth breath right choice life death matter might ſaine sith hand life death joy paine finally heſt hold ſhall till ſpirit deſteny fatall liſt fro body wend haue trouth thus make end word gan ſigh ſore like hert riue would atwaine held peace ſpake word ſee wo mortal paine teares gonne fro mine eyen raine full pitouſly inward roth ſaw ſo long wiſhing troth ſelfe kepte cloſe among bowes ſelfe gonne hide till laſt wofull man aroſe lodge went beſide may cuſtome tabide sole complaine paine kene yere yere bowes grene bicauſe drew night ſunne arke diurnal ypaſſed ſo perſaunt light bright beames ſtreams vvere waues water fall vnder bordure occian chaire gold courſe ſo ſwiftly ran twilight rowes rede phebus light deaurat alite penne tooke gan faſt ſpede wofull plaint man write word word endite like heard coud hem tho report haue ſet hertes diſport ought miſſe lay wite worthy beare blame thing miſſe reported make ditie ſeeme lame mine unconning ſain y• ſame like manne complaint expreſſe aske mercy forgiueneſſe wrote thought ſaw aferre ferre weſt luſtely appere eſperus goodly bright ſterre glad ſo faire ſo perſaunt eke chere mean venus beames clere heauy hertes releue wont cuſtome ſhew eue faſt fell adown knee euen thus gan prey lady venus ſo faire upon ſee let man trouth dey joy thou haddeſt thou ley vvith mar thy knight vulcanus fond chaine unviſible bond togider tway ſame court aboue celeſtiall ſhame gan laugh ſmile ah faire lady welly fond comfort carefull goddeſſe immartall helping thy diligence let ſtreames thine influence deſcend downe forthering y• trouth namely hem lie ſorrow bound shew thy miȝt wo haue routh ere falſe daunger ſlea hem confound ſpecially let thy might found ſo couer ſo thou may true man herber lay true forther ſake glad ſterre lady venus mine cauſe lady grace take herte ſtele mercy ſo encline ere thy bemes go vp decline ere thou go fro u adoun loue thou haddeſt adoun ſhe gone reſt roſe anone home bed went weary thought beſt praying thus beſt entent trew daunger ſhent mercy may releaſe paine recured ere may come eſte againe ne may lenger wake farewell ye louers trew praying god thus leue take ere ſunne morrow riſen new ere haue ayen roſen hew may haue ſuch grace owne lady armes embrace meane thus honeſty without ye may togider ſpeake ſo ye liſt good liberty may heart breke ielouſies onely wreke hath ſo long mallice enuy werred trouth tiranny ¶lenuoye princeſſe pleaſeth benignitie little ditie haue mind womanhede alſo ſee man may mercy find pity eke long hath behind let againe provoked grace trouth againſt kind falſe daunger occupy place go little quaire vnto life queene heart ſoueraine right glad ſhe ſhall thee ſeene thy grace ala paine left behind plaine mercy ruth grace eke pite exiled may attaine recure find mine adverſite explicit praiſe woman altho thee liſt woman evill ſpeak ſain hem worſe deſerve pray god y• neckes break ſom evil death mote tho janglers ſterve every man holden hem ſerve hem worſhip honour ſerviſe every manner beſt coud deviſe ought firſt think wt manere bring v forth wt pain endure firſt birth ſith fro yere yere buſely done buſie cure keepe v fro every miſaventure youth might ſelfe keepe neither day night ala may ſay hem wele foſtred ybore ben ſuccour ever true ſtele ſake full oft ſuffer ſore without woman joy lore wherfore ought woman obey goodneſſe ſay wel knowne hath ben woman ben cauſe lightneſſe knighthood norture eſchuing mallis encreaſe worſhip worthineſſe thereto curteis meke ground goodneſſe glad merry true every wiſe gentill hert thinke deviſe though would truſt vntruth faire word would aught aſſent good faith thinketh wer great ruth woman ſhuld gilt ſhent never knew ne wiſt nouȝt entent ne liſt heare faire word ye write ye paine fro day day tendite may beware tale vntrue ye ſo buſily paint endite ye ſwere ye never knew ne ſaw woman neither much ne lite save ye delite ſerve ever ye ſey love muſt ye need dey ye ſwere y• ye knew never love ne dredfull obſervaunce ye feele wound ſore wherfore ye put governaunce love hath ordeind ſerve pleſance wth al miȝt litle life ſpace endeth ſoone ſhe grace bed ſoone draw ſoone ſicke ye faine ſwere faſt lady hath ſlaw brought ſuddainly inſo high paine yt fro death may man reſtraine daungerous looke eyen two death muſt ye need go thus ye morne thus ye ſigh ſore though hert anon two wold breſt ſwere faſt ye may live mine owne lady might ye leſt bring mine hert ſomedele reſt liſt mercy thus vntrouth ever mercy crave thus woll ye plain tho ye nothing ſmert theſe innocent creature beguile ſwere hem ſo wounded hert love ye may live scarſly ſo long one might go mile hieth death bring end ſoverain lady liſt amend routh ſhe comfort wiſe pity falſe othes ſere y• innocent weneth yt deviſe weneth heart ſhe may thus comfort ſomwhat chere woll theſe janglers deme full ill ſaine ye fully lo ready tonges preſt ſpeake harme woman cauſeleſſe ala might ye well ſay beſt deme hem thus guiltleſſe hert iwis gentilneſſe gilt liſt thus woman fame trouth think ye blame woman cometh worldly wele wherfore ouȝt worſhip hem evermore though miſhap one ought hele falſe lore day night paine v evermore many oth theſe woman beguile falſe tale many wicked wile falſhede ſhould reckened told woman iwis full trouth men thouſand fold fro vice iwis ſtand cleare thing could heare enticing theſe men make hem flatteren connen never ſlake would fain wete euer ye coud without men tiſing wt woman amis forther ye may get hem ye lie fro yere yere many gabbing ye make hem iwis could neuer heare ne knowen ere euer ye coud findin place euer woman beſought grace ye pain ful might heart buſineſſe pleaſen hem day night praying hem grace gentilneſſe haue pitie upon great diſtreſſe yt wold paine haue routh ſlea ſens ye meane trouth thus may ye ſee ben faultleſſe innocent werkes ſlie craft touch falſeneſſe know hem ne may hem eſpie ſweare ye ye muſt need die would womanhead vpon rew ere ye dead lady herts queene ye call hem therewith ye ſighe ſore ſay lady trow ſeene plite haue liued full yore hope ye woll theſe paine ſuffer dwell goodneſſe twis ye well lo painted proceſſe ye make theſe harmleſſe creature beguile ſlepe ye paine wake bethinke many wicked wile ye ſhall ſee day ye ſhal curſe ye ſo buſily entent hem beguile falſhed neuer ment ye know wel though would lie woman trouth ſtedfaſtneſſe good faith neuer hem ſie much worſhip bountie gentilneſſe right comming faire full mekeneſſe good glad lowly enſure goodly angellike creature hap man diſeaſe doeth buſineſſe full paine al might comfort pleaſe fro diſeaſe ſhe might reſtraine word ne deed ywis ſhe woll faine might ſhe doth buſineſſe bring heauineſſe lo gentilleſſe theſe woman haue could know rudeneſſe buſie u keepe ſaue heale alſo ſickneſſe alway right ſorrie diſtreſſe euery manner thus ſhew routh hem goodneſſe trouth ſith find hem gentilneſſe trouth worſhip bountie kindneſſe euermore let neuer gentilleſſe ſlouth kind trouth aught forlore woman hath ben full yore reuerence heauens queene ought worſhip woman yt beene creature yt euer wer get borne wote ye well woman y• beſt recouered y• bliſſe y• lorne y• woman ſhall come reſt ben yſaued ſelfe leſt wherefore thinketh y• grace oughten honour woman every place therefore rede liues end fro time forth yt haue ſpace haue treſpaced purſue amend praying ladie well grace bring u unto blisful place ſhe good woman ſhal fere heauen aboue among angel clere explicit houſe fame book ſhewed deed men woman good bad carried report poſterity god tourne u euery dream good wonder thing rood wit cauſeth ſweuens morrow euens effect followeth ſome ſome ſhal neuer come auiſion reuelation dreame ſweuen euery man liche euen fantome oracle ſo theſe miracle cauſes know bet define certainely ne ran hem ne neuer thinke buſie wit ſwinke know ſignifications gendres ne diſtinctions time hem ne cauſes yeue folkes complexion make hem dreame reflection elſe thus ſaine great feebleneſſe brain abſtinence ſickneſſe priſon ſtrife great diſtreſſe el diſordinaunce natural accuſtomaunce ſome men curious ſtudie melancolius thus ſo inly ful drede man may bote rede el deuotion ſome contemplation cauſen ſuch dreames oft cruell life vnſoft hem loues leden oft hopen much dreden purely impreſſions cauſen hem haue viſions ſpirits han might make folke dreame night ſoule proper kind ſo perfite men find wote come warneth ſome eueriche auentures auiſions figure fleſh hath might vnderſtand aright warned derkely cauſe wote well worth thing clerkes treaten werkes none opinion nill make mention holy rood tourne v euery dreame good neuer ſith borne ne man el beforne mette trow ſtedfaſtly wonderfull dreame tenth day december remember woll tellen euerydele beginning truſteth wele woll make inuocation deuout ſpeciall deuotion vnto god ſleepe anone dwelleth caue ſtone vpon ſtreame commeth fro lete flood hell vnſwete beſide fulke men clepe cimerie ſleepeth aye god vnmerie ſlepie thouſand ſonnis alway ſleepe wonne god rede pray woll ſpede ſweuen tell aright euery dreame ſtand might mouer euer ſhall giue hem joy dreame yere ſtand grace hem leueſt ſtond ſhield hem pouertie ſhond euery vnhappe diſeaſe ſend hem may hem pleaſe taketh well ſcorneth nought ne misdeme thought malicious entention ſo preſumption hate ſcorne enuie diſpite yape fellonie misdeme pray ieſus good dreame barefoot dreame ſhood euery harme man hath ſith world began befall thereof ſterue graunt may deſerue lo right ſuch concluſion auiſion creſus king lide high vpon gibbet dide praier ſhall haue bette charite herken haue ſayd mette abrayd december tenth day night ſlepe lay right wont done fell aſleepe wonder ſone weary forgo pilgrimage mile two corpes ſaint leonard maken lithe erſt hard ſlept mette within temple ymade glas mo image gold ſtanding ſundry ſtages mo rich tabernacle perre mo pinacles mo curious portraiture queint manner figure gold worke ſaw euer certainly niſt neuer well wiſt venus redely temple portreiture ſaw non right figure naked fleeting ſee alſo head parde roſe garland white red combe kembe hed doues dan cupido blind ſonne vulcano face full browne romed vp downe found wall thus written table bra woll ſing armes alſo man firſt came deſtinie fugitife fro troy countrie itaile full much pine vnto ſtronds lauine tho began ſtory anone ſhall tellen echone firſt ſaw deſtruction troy greeke sinon falſe vntrue forſwearings chere leſings made horſe brought troy troyans loſt joy graued ala ilion caſtle aſſailed king priamus ſlaine polites ſonne certaine diſpitouſly dan pirrus next ſaw venus ſhe ſaw caſtle brend downe heauen ſhe gan diſcend bad ſonne eneas flee fled eſcaped prees tooke father old anchiſes bare backe away cry ala welaway anchiſes hand bare tho god land thilke vnbrenned ſaw next fere cruſa dan eneas wife loued life yong ſonne iulo eke aſcanius alſo fledden eke drerie chere pitie forreſt went tourning went cruſa yloſt ala rede ſought ghoſt bad flie greekes hoſt ſaid muſt itaile deſtinie ſauns faile pitie heare ſpirit gan appeare word ſhe ſaied keepe ſonne praied ſaw grauen eke father eke meine ſhips gan ſaile toward countrey itaile ſtreight mighten go ſaw eke cruell iuno art dan iupiters wife haſt yhated thy life troyan blood ren cry thou wood eolus god wind blowen kind loud ſhould drench lord lady groome wench troyans nation without ſaluation ſaw ſuch tempeſt ariſe euery hert might agriſe ſee painted wall ſaw eke grauen withall venus ye lady dere weeping full wofull chere praying iupiter hie ſaue keepe nauie troyan eneas sith ſonne ſaw ioues venus kiſſe graunted tempeſt liſſe ſaw tempeſt ſtent pipe went p • iuely tooke riuage countrey carthage morrow knight height achate metten venus day going queint array ſhe hunter eſſe wind blowing vpon treſſe eneas began plaine knew paine ship dreint el yloſt niſt ſhe gan comfort tho bad cartage go ſhould folke find ſea left behind ſhortly thing pace made eneas ſo grace dido queene countre ſhortly tellen ſhe became loue let wedding longeth ſhould ſpeake quaint paine word paint ſpeake loue woll cannot faculte eke tellen manere firſt acquainted long proceſſe tell ouer long dwell ſaw graue eneas told dido euery caas tidde vpon ſee eſt grauen ſhe made ſhortly word life loue luſt lord reuerence laid diſpence woman might wening ſo ſwore hereby demed good ſuch ſeemed ala harme doth apparence falſe exiſtence traitour wherefore ſhe ſlow ſelfe ala lo woman doth amis loue vnknowen chriſt lo thus fareth gold glareth alſo brouke well mine head may vnder goodlihead couered many ſhreud vice therefore wight ſo nice take loue onely chere ſpeech friendly manere ſhall euery woman find ſome man pure kind woll ſhewen outward faireſt till haue caught leſt woll cauſes find ſwere ſhe vnkind falſe priuie double ſay eneas dido nice leſt loued ſoone gueſt wherefore woll ſay prouerbe fully knoweth herbe may ſafely lay eie withouten drede lie let v ſpeake eneas betraied ala left full vnkindly ſhe ſaw vtterly would trouth faile wenden itaile gan wring handes two ala qd ſhe wo ala euery man thus true euery yere woll haue new ſo long time endure el three parauenture thus one woll haue fame magnifying owne name another friendſhip ſayeth yet ſhall third taken delite lo el ſingular profite ſuch word gan complaine dido great paine mette dreaming readily none authour alledge woll ala qd ſhe ſweet hart haue pitie ſorrowes ſmart ſlea go away wofull dido welaway qd ſhe vnto ſelfe tho eneas woll ye loue ne bond ye ſwore right hond ne cruell death qd ſhe may hold ſtill haue ye death pite iwis mine owne deare hert ye know full well neuer yet farre euer wit agilt thought ne dede haue ye men ſuch goodlihede ſpeech neuer dele trouth ala euer routh woman falſe man ſee well tell wretched woman art certaine part thus ſerued euerichone ſore ye men grone anon receiued certainly deceiued though loue leſt ſeaſon wait vpon concluſion eke ye determine part define welaway borne name lorne mine act redde ſong ouer land euery tong wicked fame ni nothing ſo ſwift lo ſhe ſooth euery thing wiſt though couerde miſt eke though might duren euer haue done recouer neuer ne ſhall ſaid ala ſhamed eneas ſhall thus judged lo right ſhe hath done ſhe woll done eſtſoones hardely thus ſay people priuely done ni done complaint ne mone certaine auailed ſtre ſhe wiſt ſoothly forth ſhip agone chamber went anone called ſuſter anne gan complaine ſaid ſhe cauſe ſhe firſt loued ala firſt counſailed thereto ſaid roft ſeluen hart deide wound ſmart manner ſhe deide word ſhe ſeide ſo know hath purpoſe rede virgile eneidos piſtels ouide ſhe wrote ſhe dide nere long endite god would write welaway harme routh hath betide ſuch vntrouth men may oft bookes rede day ſeene yet dede thinken tene lo demophon duke athenis forſwore falſely traied phillis wickedly king doughter thrace falſely gan tearme pace ſhe wiſt falſe hong ſelfe right halfe done ſuch vntrouth lo wo routh eke looke falſe recheles briſeida achilles paris oenone iaſon hipſiphile eft iaſon medea hercules dianira left iolee made take death parde falſe eke theſeus ſtorie telleth v betraied adriane deuill ſoules bane laughed yloured muſt haue deuoured adriane ne ſhe pite made fro death eſcape made full falſe jape within left ſleeping iſle deſart alone right ſee ſtale away let bee tooke ſuſter phedra tho gan ſhip go yet ſworne euer could ſwere ſo ſhe ſaued life would taken wife ſhe deſired nothing el certain booke v tels excuſe eneas fulliche great treſpas booke ſaith ſauns faile god bad go itaile leauen affrickes regioun faire dido toun tho ſaw graue itaile dan eneas gan ſaile tempeſt began loſt ſtereſman ſterne tooke keepe smote ouer bord ſleepe alſo ſaugh sibile eneas beſide iſle hell went ſee father anchiſes free found palimurus alſo dido deiphebus eueriche tourment eke hell saw long tell paine ſo liſt know muſt rede many row vergile claudian daunt tellen tho ſaw eke ariuaile eneas made itaile king latin treate battailes himſelfe knight iwonne right turnus reft life wan lauina wife maruellous ſignals god celeſtials maugre iuno eneas ſleight compas acheued auenture iupiter tooke cure prayer venus pray alway ſaue v v aye ſorrowes light ſeene ſight noble temple thus hey lord thought madeſt v yet ſaw neuer ſuch nobleſſe image ſuch richeſſe ſee grauen church nought wote hem worch ne ne countree gone ſee right wicket seene ought ſtering man may tellen dore came faſt beheld ſaw large field farre euer might ſee without toune houſe tree buſh graſſe eared land field ſand ſmall men may ſee eye deſart lybye ne manner creature yformed nature ne ſaw rede wiſſe chriſt thought bliſſe fanton illuſion ſaue deuotion mine eyen heauen caſt tho ware lo laſt faſt ſunne hye kenne might mine eye thought ſaw egle ſore ſeemed much egle yſeine ſooth death certaine gold ſhone ſo bright neuer ſaw men ſuch ſight heauen ywonne new god another ſonne ſhone egles fethers bright ſomewhat downward gan light explicit liber primus hearken euery manner man engliſh vnderſtand liſteth dreame nowe erſt ſhall ye lere ſely ſo dredefull viſion ſay neither scipion ne king nabugodonoſore pharao turnus ne alcanore ne metten ſuch dreame faire bliſfull cipris fauour time ye tendite rime helpeth pernaſo dwell beſide elicon clere well thought wrote met treſorie ſet braine ſhall men ſee vertue thee bee tell dreame aright kithe thy engine thy might egle haue told feather ſhone gold ſo high gan ſore gan behold ſeene beauty wonder neuer dent thunder ne thing men call ſendre ſmite ſometime toure poudre ſwift comming brend ſo ſwithe gan downward diſcend foule beheld roume field grim pawes ſtrong within ſharpe nailes long fleyng ſwappe hent ſours againe vp went carying clawes ſtarke lightly ben larke high cannot tellen came vp niſt neuer ſo aſtonied aſweued euery vertue heued ſours dread feeling gan dead great affray thus long clawes lay till laſt ſpake man voice ſaid awake agaſt ſo ſhame called tho name ſhould better abraid awake thus ſaid right ſame voice ſteuin uſeth one neuin voice ſooth ſaine mind came goodly ſaid na neuer wont herewithal gan ſtere foot bere till felt heat felt eke tho mine hart beat tho gan diſport gentle wordes comfort ſaid twice ſaint mary thou art noyous thing cary nothing needeth parde alſo wiſe god helpe thou harme ſhalt haue caſe betiddeth thee thy lore thy prow let ſee darſt thou looke yet full enſured boldely thy friend therewith gan wonder mind god qd madeſt kind shall none otherwiſe die whether ioue ſtellifie thing may ſignifie neither enocke ne helie ne romulus ne ganimede bore men rede heauen dan iupiter made god buteler lo tho fantaſie bare gan aſpie ſo thought ſaid thou deemeſt thy ſelfe amis ioue thereabout dare thee put full doubt make thee yet ſterre ere beare thee much ferre tell aud whider thou ſhalt came ſo thou take good herte feare quake gladly qd well qd firſt foot haue thou haſt feare wonder dwelling god thonder men callen iupiter doth flien full oft fer commaundement cauſe hath ſent thee herke thy trouth certaine hath thee routh thou haſt ſo truely long ſerued ententifely blind new cupido faire venus alſo without guerdon euer yet natheleſſe haſt ſet thy wit although thy head full little make bookes ſongs dities rime el cadence thou beſt canſt reuerence loue ſeruaunts eke haue ſeruice ſought aad ſeke paineſt thee praiſe art although thou haddeſt neuer part wherefore alſo god bleſſe iouis halt great humbleſſe vertue eke thou wilt make might full oft thine head ake thy ſtudy ſo thou writeſt evermore loue enditeſt honour praiſings folkes furtherings matter deuiſeſt ne folke diſpiſeſt although thou maiſt go daunce hem liſt auaunce wherefore ſaid ywis iupiter conſidreth well alſo beauſire thing thou haſte tidings loues folke glade ne nothing el god made onely fro ferre countree tidings commen thee thy neighbour dwellen almoſt thy dores thou heareſt neither ne thy labour done haſt made thy reckenings ſtead reſt new thing thou goeſt home thine houſe anone alſo dombe ſtone thou ſitteſt another booke till fully daſed thy looke liueſt thus hermite although thine abſtinence lite therfore iouis grace beare thee place hight houſe fame ſport game ſome recompenſation thy labour deuotion thou haſt lo cauſeleſſe god cupido recheleſſe thus god merite ſome manner thing thee quite thou wilt good chere truſt well thou ſhalt ben commen ſay mo wonder thing dare lay loues folke mo tidings ſoothſawes leſings mo loues new begon long ſerued till loue mo louers caſuelly ben betide man wote blind man ſtarteth hare jolite welfare find loue ſtele thinke men ouer wele mo diſcords mo iealouſies mo murmures mo nouelries alſo mo diſſimulations eke fained reparation mo berdes two hour without raſour ſiſours ymade graines ſands eke mo holding mo hand alſo mo renouelaunces old forſeten aqueintaunces mo loue day mo accord inſtruments ben cord eke loue mo exchaunges euer corne graunges vnneth maieſt thou trowen qd ſo helpe god wi qd qd impoſſible wit though fame pry realme aſpies yet ſhould heare eſpien yes yes qd preue reaſon worthy leue thou giue thine aduertence underſtand ſentence firſt ſhalt thou ſhe dwelleth right ſo thine owne booke telleth palais ſtandeth ſhall ſay right euen amiddes way betweene heauen earth ſee whatſoeuer theſe three ſpoken priue apert way thereto ſo ouert ſtant eke ſo juſt place euery ſowne mote pace ſo commeth tong rowned red ſong ſpoken ſuertie drede certaine mote thider nede hearken well tellen thee proper skill worthy demonſtration mine imagination geffray thou woteſt well euery kindely thing hath kindely ſtede may beſt conſerued vnto place euery thing kindely enclining meueth come away therefro thus lo thou maiſt al day ſee take thing heauie bee ſtone lead thing weight beare neuer ſo hie height let go thine hand falleth downe right ſo ſay fire ſowne ſmoke thing light alway ſeeke upward height light thing downward charge euerich hem large cauſe thou maiſt well ſee euery riuer unto ſee enclined go kind theſe skilles find haue fiſhes dwelling flood ſee tree eke earth thus euery thing reaſon hath proper manſion ſeeketh repaire ſhould nat appaire lo ſentence knowne couth euery philoſophers mouth ariſtotle dan platone clerkes many one confirme reaſoun thou woſt well ſpeech ſoun el man might herke woll thee lere sowne eyre ybroken euery ſpeech ſpoken loud priue foule faire ſubſtaunce aire flame lighted ſmoke right ſo ſowne eyre ybroke may many wiſe thee deviſe ſowne commeth pipe harpe pipe blowen ſharpe eyre twiſt violence rent lo ſentence eke men harpe ſtrings ſmite wheder much lite lo ſtroke eyre breketh right ſo breaketh men ſpeketh thus woſt thou well thing ſpeach henceforth thee teach euerich ſpeech voice ſoun multiplicatioun though piped mouſe mote need come fame houſe proue thus take heed experience thou threw water ſtone well woſt thou make anone little roundell cercle parauenture broad couercle right anone thou ſhalt ſee wele whele cercle wil cauſe another whele third ſo forth brother euery cercle cauſing broader himſelfe thus roundell compas ech going cauſeth others ſtering multiplying euermo till ſo farre go brinkes bee although thou may ſee aboue yet gothe alway though thou thinke great wonder ſo ſaith trouth vary bid proue contrary right thus euery word iwis loud priuie yſpoken moueth firſt eyre mouing dout another eyre anone moued haue water proued euery cercle cauſeth right ſo eyre leue brother euerich eyre ſtereth ſpeech vp beareth voice noiſe word ſoun aye multiplicatioun till houſe fame take earneſt game told thou haue mind ſpeech ſowne pure kind enclined upward meue maieſt thou fele well preue ſame ſtede iwis euery thing enclined hath kindliche ſtede ſheweth without drede kindely manſioun euerich ſpeeche euery ſoun either foule faire hath kind place aire ſith euery thing iwis kind place iwis moueth thider go away therefro haue proued thee ſheweth euery ſoune parde moueth kindely pace kind place place tell fame liſt dwell ſette amiddes theſe three heauen earth eke ſee moſt conſeruatife ſoun concluſion euery ſpeech euery man thee tell firſt began moueth vp height pace kindly fame place tell faithfully haue proued thus ſimply without ſubtelte ſpeech great prolixite termes philoſophy figure poetry colour rhetorike perde ought thee like hard language hard matere incombrous one woſt thou well anſwered ſaid yes ah ah qd lo ſo leudly unto leud man speke ſhew ſuch skilles may ſhake hem billes palpable ſhoulden tel pray thee thinketh thee concluſioun good perſuaſion qd lyke right ſo thou haſt proued god qd leue thou ſhalt haue eue euery word ſentence profe experience thyne eares hearen well toppe tayle eueridell euery word ſpoken commeth fame houſe ywis haue ſaid wilt thou word upper ſore began ſaid ſaint iame ſpeake game fareſt thou qd well qd ſee qd thy trouth yond adowne thou knoweſt towne houſe thing thou haſt ought knowing looke thou warne anon ſhall tell thee farre thou art therefro adowne gan loken tho beheld field plaines hils mountaines valeis foreſts unneth great beeſts riuers citees townes great tree ſhippes ſayling ſee thus ſoone hee flowen fro ground ſo hye world mine eye ſemed pricke el eyre ſo thicke might diſcerne ſpake ſo yerne ſaid seeſt thou token ought world ſpoken ſaid nay wonder qd neuer halfe ſo hye na alexander macedon king ne rome dan scipion ſaw dreame point deuiſe heauen earth helf paradiſe ne eke wretch dedalus ne childe nice icharus flewe ſo hie hete wyngs molte fell wete midde ſea dreint made great complaint tourne upward qd thy face behold large place eyre looke thou ne bee adrad hem thou ſhalt ſee regioun certayne dwelleth many citezeine ſpeaketh dan plato theſe ben eyriſhe beeſts lo tho ſawe menie gone alſo flie lo qd caſt thyne eye see yonder lo galaxie men clepe milky way white ſome parfay callen watling ſtreete one brent hete sunnes ſonne rede hight pheton would lede algate father cart gie cart horſe gan well aſpie coud gouernaunce gan leape praunce beare doun till ſaw scorpioun heauen ſigne yet fere loſt wit let reynes gone horſe anone soone mount downe diſcende till bothe eyre earth brende till iupiter lo laſt ſlew fro carte caſt lo great miſchaunce let foole haue gouernaunce thing demaine word ſothe ſaine gan alway upper ſore gladded faithfully ſpake tho gan looke beheld eyriſh beeſts cloudes miſtes tempeſts snowes hayles raynes windes thengendring kindes way came god qd made adame moch thy might noble tho thought upon boece writeth thought may flie ſo hie fethers philoſophy paſſen euerich element hath ſo far ywent may ſeen behind backe cloude earth yt ſpake tho gan wexe ſaid wote well whether body gooſt ywis god thou wooſt clere entendement na neuer yet yſent thought marcian eke anticlaudian ſothe deſcripcion heauens region far ſaw preve therefore hem leue egle gan cry let qd thy fantaſie wilt thou learne ſterres ought nay certainly qd right nought qd old el would thee haue told qd ſterres name lo heauens ſigns force qd yes parde qd woſt thou thou redeſt poetry goddes ſtellify birde fiſhe rauin ariones harpe fine caſſor polexe delphine athalantes doughters ſeuen theſe ſet heuen though thou haue hem ofte hand yet noſt thou nat ſtand force qd need well leue ſo god ſpeed hem writen matere though knew place eke ſemen ſo bright ſhould ſhenden ſight looke hem may well qd ſo forth hare tho gan cry neuer herde thing ſo hie hold thine heed well saint iulian lo bonue hoſtell see houſe fame lo mayſt thou qd great ſowne qd rombleth downe fame houſe full tidings fayre ſpeech chiding falſe ſothe compouned herken well rowned hereſt thou great ſwough yes perde qd wel ynough ſowne like qd peter lyke beating ſee qd againſt roches halow tempeſts done ſhippes ſwalow man ſtand doute myle then route el lyke humbling clappe thuiſoring iouis hath eyre ybete doth feare ſwete nay drede thee thereof qd nothing byten thee thou ſhalt haue harme truely worde nigh place arrived men might caſt ſpere niſte ſtrete ſet faire feete ſaid walke forth pace tell thine aduenture caſe thou ſhalt finde fame place qd haue ſpace ſpeake go fro thee loue god tell ſothe thee lere noyſe haue herde thee tell folke done earth dwell commeth ſame wiſe thee herd deuiſe liues body ni houſe yonder maketh loude fare qd ſaint clare alſo wiſſe god rede thing warne thee thou wilt haue wonder lo houſe fame yonder thou woſte commeth euery ſpeach needeth efte reach underſtand right well ſpeach ycomen vp palais anone right wexeth like ſame wight worde earth ſpake clothed reed blake hath ſo likeneſſe ſpake worde thou wilt geſſe ſame body man woman ſhe wonder thing yes qd tho heauen king worde farewell qd abide thee god heauen ſend thee grace good learne place tooke leaue anone gan forth palays gone explicit liber ſecundus god science light apollo thy great might littell laſt booke thou gie maiſtrie art potenciall ſhewde rime light lewde yet make ſomewhat agreable though ſome verſe fayle ſillable diligence ſhewe craft ſentence deuine vertue thou wilt helpe ſhewe heed ymarked lo meanen houſe fame diſcriue thou ſhalt ſee go bliue vnto next laurer ſee kiſſe thy tree entre breſt anone egle gone gan behold vpon place certaine paſſe woll ſhappe deuiſe houſe citee wiſe gan place approch ſtood vpon ſo hie roch hyer ſtandeth none spayne vp clambe moch payne though climbe greued mee yet ententife ſee poren wondre low coude wiſe yknow maner ſtone roche lyke limed glas ſhone full clere congeled matere niſte redely laſt eſpied found euerydele roche yſe ſtele thought ſaint thomas kent feeble foundement builden place hie ought little glorifie hereon bilte god ſo ſaue tho ſawe hall ygraue famous folkes name fele moch wele fame wide yblow well vnneth might know letter rede name drede almoſt thawed ſo letter one two molte away euery name vnfamous wexe fame men ſay may euer laſt tho gan mine hert caſt molte away heate away ſtormes beate ſide ſey hill northward ley written full name folke afore great fame old time yet freſh men written hem ſelf day houre hem gan poure well wiſte made conſerued ſhade writing ſie caſtell ſo ſtoode hie ſtoode eke ſo cold place heate might deface tho gan hill gone found coppe wone men liue ne han conning diſcriue beaute ilke place ne coud caſte compace soch another make might beauty make ne ſo wonderly •• rought aſtonieth yet thought maketh witte ſwinke caſtell thinke great beautie caſte crafte curioſitie ne deuiſe witte ne may ſuffiſe natheleſſe ſubſtaunce haue yet remembraunce thought ſaint gile ſtone berile caſtell toure eke hall euery boure without peeces joynings many ſubtell compaſſings babeuries pinnacle imagery tabernacle ſaw full eke windowes flake fallen great snowes eke pinnacle ſundry habitacles ſtooden withouten full caſtle abouten manner min •• rale ieſtours tellen tale weeping game longeth vnto fame heard play harpe ſouned well ſharpe orpheus full craftely ſide faſt sat harper orion gacides chirion harper many one briton glaskirion ſmale harper glee sate vnder hem diuers ſees gone hem vpward gape counterfeited hem ape craft counterfeit kind tho ſaw ſtanden hem behind farre hem hemſelue many thouſand time twelue made loud minſtralcies cornmuſe shalmies many another pipe craftely began pipe douced rede ben feaſts brede many floite litling horne pipe made greene corne haue theſe little heard gromes keepen beaſts brome ſaw dan citherus athene dan proſerus mercia loſt skinne face body chinne ſhe would enuien lo pipen bette apollo ſaw eke famous old yong piper dutch tong learne loue daunces ſprings reyes ſtraunge thing tho ſaw another place standing large ſpace hem maken bloody ſoun trumpe beme clarioun fight bloodſheddings vſed gladly clarionings heard trumpe meſſenus ſpeaketh vergilius heard ioab trumpe alſo theodomas mo vſed clarion caſteloigne aragon time famous learnen ſaw trumpen ſaw ſit ſees playing vpon ſundry glee cannot neuen mo sterres ben heuen nill rime eaſe loſſe time time yloſt know ye way may recouered ſaw p • aying iogelours magiciens tragetours phetoniſſes charmereſſes old witch sorcereſſes vſen exorſiſations eke subfumigations clerkes eke conne well magicke naturell craftely doe entents maken certaine aſcendents image lo magike maken man ben hole ſike ſaw queene medea circe eke caliophia ſaw hermes ballenus limote eke simon magus ſaw knew name ſuch art done men haue fame ſaw coll tragetour vpon table sicamour play vncouth thing tell ſaw carry wind mell vnder walnote ſhale ſhould make lenger tale people ſey could tell till domiſdey folke behold found looſe hold amuſed long vpon wall berile ſhone lighter glas made well kind thing fame anone gan forth roman till fond caſtell yate right hond ſo well coruen neuer ſuch another na yet auenture ywrought great ſubtill cure needeth tellen make long dwellen theſe yates floriſhings ne compaces ne karuings ne hacking maſonries corbets imagery lord ſo faire ſhewe gold behewe went anone met cry many one large large hold vp well god ſaue lady pell owne gentill lady fame hem willen haue name v thus heard crien faſt commen hall ſhoke noble ſtarlings crowned king crownes wrought full loſinges many ribans many fringe clothes truely tho laſt eſpied purſeuauntes heraudes crien riche folkes laudes euery man hem tell throwe veſture men clepe coate armure embroudred wonderly riche though yliche nought ſo mote thriue diſcriue theſe armes thus coates impoſſible men might make hem bible twenty foote thicke trowe certain ſo coud know might armes ſeen famous folke affrike europe aſie sith firſt began cheualrie lo ſhould tell ne hall eke need tellen euery wall rofe flore plated halfe foote thicke golde na wicke proue wiſe fine ducket veniſe lite pouche ſet thicke ouches fine fineſt ſtones fayre men reden lapidaire graſſes growen mede long rede name therefore pace luſtie riche place fame hall called full moch prees folke na ne crouding moch prees hie aboue dees satte ſee imperiall made rubie royall carbuncle ycalled ſawe perpetually yſtalled feminine creature neuer formed nature ſoch another thing ſaie alther firſt ſoth ſaie thought ſhe ſo lite length cubite lenger ſhe ſeemed thus ſoone ſhe ſelf tho wonderly ſtreight foot ſhe therthe reight hedde ſhe touched heauen ſhineth sterres ſeuen thereto yet wit ſaw great wonder yet vpon iyen behold certainly hem neuer told fele iyen ſhe fethers vpon foules beaſts foure goddes trone honour writeth iohn apocalips heer owndie crips burned gold ſhone ſee ſothe tellen alſo ſhee alſo fele vp ſtanding eares tonges beaſt heares feete woxen ſawe partriche winges redily lord perrie richeſſe ſaw ſitting goddeſſe heauenly melodie ſonges full armonie heard trone yſong palais wall rong ſong mighty muſe ſhe cleped caliope ſeuen ſiſterne eke face ſeemen meke euermore eternally ſong fame tho heard heried thou thy name goddes renoun fame tho ware laſt mine iyen gan vp caſt ilke noble queene ſhoulders gan ſuſtene armes name tho large fame aliſander hercules ſherte life leſe thus found ſitting goddeſſe noble honour richeſſe ſtinte thing tellen tho ſaw ſtande thother ſide streight doune doores wide dees many pillere metall ſhone full clere though richeſſe yet made great nobleſſe hem great ſentence folke hie digne reuerence tell fonde vpon piller ſawe ſtonde alder firſt ſie vpon piller ſtonde hie lede iron fine ſecte saturnine ebraike ioſephus old iewes geſtes told bare ſhulders hie fame vp iurie ſtoden ſeuen wiſe worthy neuen helpen beare vp charge ſo heauy ſo large written battayles well
