maruayles therefore lo pillere tell leade iron iwis iron martes metall god battayle leade withouten fayle lo metall saturne hath full large whele turne ſtand forth either rowe hem could knowe though order hem tell make long dwell theſe gan rede ſaw ſtand drede vpon iron piller ſtrong painted endlong tigres blood euery place tholaſon height stace bare thebe vp name vpon ſhoulders fame alſo cruell achilles ſtode withouten lee full wonder hie vpon piller iron great omer dare titus eke lollius guido eke colempnis engliſh galfride eke iwis ech theſe haue joy buſie heare vp troy heavy thereof fame beare game yet gan full well eſpie betwene hem little enuie one ſaid omer made lie feyning poetry greekes fauourable therefore held fable tho ſaw ſtand pillere tinned iron clere latine poete virgile hath bore vp long fame pius eneas next piller copper venus clerke duide hath ſowen wondrous wide great god loues fame bare vp well name vpon piller alſo hie might ſee mine iye hall whereof rede woxe height length brede well thouſand deale erſt ſaw weale tho ſaw piller iron wrought full ſternely great poet dan lucan ſhoulders bare vp hie might ſee fame iulius pompee ſtoden theſe clerkes write rome mighty werkes would name tell long muſt dwell next piller ſtood sulphure liche wood dan claudian ſothe tell bare vp fame hell pluto proſerpine queene derke pine ſhould tell hall full iwis hem written old jeſtes tree rokes neſtes full confuſe mattere theſe jeſtes write hight beheld ſight herde noiſe approchen bliue fareth bee done hiue ayenſt time flying right ſoch maner murmuring world ſeemed mee tho gan looke ſee come entring hall right great company withall ſondry region kind condicions dwell yearth vnder moone poore riche ſo ſoone come hall gan knee doune fall ilke noble queene ſaid graunt v lady ſheene eche v thy grace bone ſome hem ſhe graunted ſone ſome ſhe warned well faire ſome ſhe graunted contraire asking vtterly ſay truely grace niſt theſe folke full well wiſt good fame eche deſerued although diuerſly ſerued right ſiſter dame fortune wont ſerue commune herken ſhe gan pay hem gan grace pray yet lo companie saiden ſoth lie madame ſaid bee folke beſechen thee thou graunt v good fame let workes haue good name full recompenſacioun good worke giue v good renoun warne qd ſhe anone ye get good fame none god therefore go way ala qd welaway tell v cauſe may liſt qd ſhe wight ſhall ſpeake iwis good ne harme ne ne worde ſhe gan call meſſenger hall bad ſhould faſte gone vpon paine blind anone eolus god winde trace ye ſhall finde bid bring clarioun full diuers ſoun cleped cleare laude wont heraude hem liſt ypraiſed bee alſo bid hee bring eke clarioun height sclaunder euery toun wont diffame hem liſt doe hem ſhame meſſenger gan faſt gone found caue ſtone countree height trace eolus harde grace helde windes diſtreſſe gan hem vnder preſſe gone beres rore bound preſſed hem ſo ſore meſſenger gan faſt crie riſe vp qd faſt thee hie till thou lady bee take thy clarious eke thee ſpeed thee faſt anone tooke one hight tritone clarion bearen tho let certaine winde go blewe ſo hidouſly hie ne left skie welken long brode eolus brode till come fame feete eke man triton heete ſtode ſtill ſtone herewithall came anone another huge companie good folke gan crie lady graunt v good fame let workes haue name honour gentilneſſe alſo god ſoule bleſſe han well deſerued therefore right quit thriue qd ſhe ye ſhall fayle good workes ſhall auayle haue good fame wote ye graunt ye ſhall haue ſhrewd name wicked loo worſe fame though ye good loo haue well deſerued goeth way ſerued thou dan eolus qd ſhe take forth thy trumpe anone let ſee ycleped sclaunder light blow loo euery wight speake hem harme ſhreudneſſe ſtede good worthineſſe thou ſhalt trumpe contraire haue done well faire ala thought auentures haue theſe ſory creature among pres thus ſhamed giltles muſt needes eolus tooke blacke trumpe bra fouler deuill gan trompe blow world ſhould ouerthrow throughout euery regioun went foule trumpes ſoun ſwifte pellet gonne fire pouder ronne ſoch ſmoke gan wende foule trumpes ende blacke blue greniſhe ſwartiſh rede doth men melte lede lo hie tewell thereto one thing ſaw well ferther ranne greater wexen beganne doth riuer well ſtanke pitte hell ala thus ſhame yrong giltleſſe euery tong tho came third companie gone vp dees hie doune knee fell anone ſaiden euerichone folke han full truely deſerued fame rightfully prayed might know right forth blow graunt qd ſhe liſt good workes ſhall wiſt yet ye ſhall haue better loo right diſpite foos worthy anone let qd ſhe thy trumpe gone thou eolus ſo blacke thine trumpe take hight laude blow ſo world fame go eaſely faſt knowen laſt full gladly lady mine ſaied trumpe gold braied anone ſet mouth blewe eaſt weſt south north loude thonder euery wight hath wonder brode ran ſtent certes breath went trumpes mouth ſmelde men potte full baume helde among basket full roſes fauour loſes right gan eſpie came fowerth companie certaine wonder fewe gonne ſtanden rewe ſaiden certes lady bright haue done well might ne keepe haue fame hide workes name goddes loue certes wee haue ſurely done bountee manner thing graunt asking qd ſhe let workes dedde tourned hedde ſawe anone fifth rout lady gan lout doune knee anone fall tho beſoughten hiden good workes eke ſaid yeue leke fame ne ſoch renoun contemplacioun goddes loue wrought ne fame would nought qd ſhe ye wood wene ye good haue fame haue ye diſpite haue name nay ye ſhall lien euerichone blowe thy trumpe anone qd ſhe thou eolus hote ring theſe folkes workes note world may heare gan blowe loo ſo cleare golden clarioun worlde went ſoun alſo kindly eke ſo ſoft fame blowe aloft tho came ſixt companie gan faſt fame crie right verely manere ſaiden mercy lady dere tell certain haue done neither ne idell life hath natheleſſe yet pray may haue good fame great renome knowen name haue noble jeſtes acheued queſtes well loue thing v neuer broche ne ring ne el fro woman ſent ne one hert yment maken v onely frendly chere mought temen v bere yet let v people ſeeme soch world may v deeme woman louen v wood ſhall u moch good harte moch auaile counterpeiſe eaſe trauaile labour dere bought honour regard great eaſe yet ye muſt u pleaſe let u hold eke therto worthy wiſe good alſo rich happy vnto loue goddes loue ſitteth aboue though may body haue woman yet ſo god ſaue let men glewe v name suffiſeth fame graunt qd ſhe trouth eolius withouten ſlouth take thy trumpe gold qd ſhe blowe haue asked euery man wene hem eaſe though go full badde leaſe eolusgan ſo blowe world know tho came ſeuenth route anone fill knee euerichone ſayed lady graunt v ſoone ſame thing ſame boone nexte folke haue done fie qd ſhe euerichone ye maſtie ſwine ye idle wretch full rotten ſlow tetches falſe theeues ye wold famed good nothing nold deſerue ne neuer thought men rather hangen ought ye like ſlepie cat would haue fiſh woſt thou woll nothing weate clawes euil thrifte come iawes myne graunt fauour auaunt eolus thou kyng thrace go blowe folke ſorie grace qd ſhe anone woſt thou ſhall tell thee right say theſe ben would honour haue kin labour ne good yet haue laude men wende belle ſaude ne coude hem loue werne yet ſhe grint querne good eaſe herte eolus anone vp ſterte blacke clarioun gan blaſen ſoun loude belleth winde hell eke therewith ſothe tell ſowne ſo full iapes euer mowes ape went world euery wight gan hem ſhout laugh wood soch game found hood tho came another company ydone trechery harme great wickedneſſe herte couden geſſe prayed haue good fame ſhe nolde hem ſhame giue hem loo good renoun blowe clarioun nay wi qd ſhe vice al b • iuſtice • ſt ne nill graunt tho came leaping rout gan clappen euery man vpon crowne hall gan ſowne ſaid lady lefe dere ben ſoch folkes ye may tell tale aright hen ſhrewes every wight haue delite wickedneſſe good folke haue goodneſſe ioy knowen ſhrewes full vice wicked thewes wherefore pray rowe fame ſoch yknow thing right graunt qd ſhe ywis art thou ſaieſt tale weareſt thy hoſe pale thy tippet ſoch bell madame qd ſothe tell ilke ſhrewe iwis brent temple iſidis athene lo citee wherefore diddeſt thou ſo qd ſhe trouth qd madame wolde faine haue name folke towne although great renowne vertue thewes thought great fame haue ſhrewes though nought ſhrewdneſſe good folke haue goodneſſe ſithen may haue one nyll forgone get fame temple ſet fire done loo blowe ſwithe wiſely thou euer blithe gladly qd ſhe thou eolus hereſſ thou prayen v madame yes full well qd trumpen parde tooke blacke trumpe faſt gan puffen blaſt till world end gan wend one ſtode right backe thought full goodly ſpake ſaid frende thy name arte thou come hider haue fame nay forſothe frende qd come hither graunt mercy ſoch cauſe heed suffiſeth deed wight haue name honde wot ſelfe beſt ſtonde drie thinke woll ſelfe drinke certaine part ferforth mine art doſt thou qd qd woll tell thee cauſe ſtand new tidings lere new thing tidings eyther loue ſuch thing glade certainely made come hyder ſaid mee ſholde bothe heare ſee place wonde • thing theſe ſoch tidings meant qd anſwerde parde well wote euer yet sith firſt wit ſome folke han deſired fame diuerſly loo name certainly niſt ne fame dwelled ne eke deſcripcion ne alſo condicion ne order dome knew till hider come lo theſe tidings thou hether brings thou haſt herde qd mee force well ſee thou deſireſt lere come forth ſtande lenger woll thee without drede ſoch another place lede thou ſhalt many one tho gan forth gone caſtell ſothe ſey tho ſawe ſtand valey vnder caſtell faſt houſe domus dedali laborintus ycleped na made ſo wonderly ywis ne halfe ſo queintly ywrought euermo ſwift thought queint houſe went neuermo ſtill ſtent came ſo great noyſe ſtonde upon dyſe men might haue heard eaſily rome trowe ſikerly noiſe herde world right ſo ferde doth routing ſtone fro thengin letyn gone houſe rede made twigges ſalow rede green eke ſome white men cage twhite maken theſe paniers el hutch doſſers ſwough twigges houſe alſo full gigges alſo full eke chickinges many werkings eke houſe hath entree many leues ben tree ſommer greene rofe yet men may ſeene thouſand hole wel mo letten ſowne go day euery tide bene dores open wide night eche one unſhet ne porter none let maner tidings pace ne neuer reſt place ni filled full tidings eyther loude whiſperings euer houſes angle ful rownings iangles werres peace mariages reſtes labour viages abode death lyfe loue hate accord ſtrife loſſe lore winning heale ſickneſſe leſings faire wether eke tempeſts qualme folke beeſts diuers tranſmutacions eſtates eke region truſt drede iaſouſie witte winning folie plenty great famine chepe derth ruine good miſgouernement fire diuers accident lo houſe write syker ye na lite ſixtie myle length al tymber ſtrength yet founded endure lift auenture mother tidings ſea welles ſprings ſhapen lyke cage certes qd mine age ne ſaw ſoch houſe wondred ywis vpon houſe tho ware mine egle faſt perched hie upon ſtone gan ſtreight gone ſaid thus pray thee thou abide mee goddes loue let ſeene wonder place bene yet paraunter may lere good therein ſomewhat lefe went peter mine entent qd therefore dwell certaine one thing thee tell bryng thee therin ne ſhall thou neuer conne gin come doubt faſte whirleth lo ſith ioues grace haue ſaid ſolace finally theſe thing vncouth ſighes tidings paſſe thine euineſſe soch routh hath thy diſtreſſe thou ſuffredeſt debonairly woſte ſeluen vtterly deſperate bliſſe sith fortune hath made miſſe ſwete thine hertes reſt languiſh eke poynt breſt mighty melite wil thee eaſe al lite gaue expreſſe commaundement obedient fo • ther thee might wiſh teach thee aright thou maiſt moſt tidings thou ſhalt many one lere word right anone hent bytwene tone window brought houſe thought therewithall thought ſtent nothing went ſet floore adoun ſuch great congregacioun folke ſawe rome within ſome without na neuer ſeene ne ſhall efte certes world ni lefte many formed nature ne need ſo many creature wel vnneth place foote brede ſpace euery wight ſawe rowned euerich others cere new tiding priuely el told openly right thus ſaid noſt nat thou betidde lo right qd tell told ſwore thereto ſoth thus hath ſaid thus doth ſhal thus herde ſay ſhal found dare lay folke liue ne haue conning diſcriue tho thinges herde loude eere wonder moſt one herd thing ywis came ſtreight another wight gan tellen anon right ſame told forlong way old gan ſomewhat eche tiding ſpeche euer ſpoken nat ſo ſone departed na tho fro ne mette third erhe ſette ſtound told hym alſe tidings ſothe falſe yet wold tell natheles euermore mo encrees erſt thus north ſouth went euery tiding fro mouth mouth encreaſing euermo fire wont quicken go ſparcle ſprongen amis till citie brent vp full vp ſprong waxen euery tonge euer went anone vp window gone might paſſe gan crepe ſome creuaſſe flewe forth faſt none ſometime ſaw one leaſing ſadde ſothe ſawe gonnen auenture drawe window pace metten place achecked two neyther might go ech gonne ſo croude till ech hem gan crien loude let gone firſt nay let mee woll enſuren thee vowes thou wolt ſo ſhall neuer fro thee go thine owne ſworne brother woll meddle v eche man neuer ſo wrothe shall haue one two bothe one beſide leue come morowe eue cryde ſtill yrowned thus ſaw ſalfe ſoth compowned togider flie tiding thus hole gonne wring euery ridyng ſtreight fame ſhe gan yeue eche name diſpoſicion yeue hem eke duracion wexe wane ſoone doth faire white moone let hem gonne might ſeen winged wonder faſt flien twenty thouſand route eolus hem blewe aboute lord houſe time full ſhipmen pilgrimes ſcrippes brette full leaſings entermelled tidings eke alone hem ſelue many thouſand time twelue saw eke theſe paadoners currours eke meſſaungers box crommed full lie euer veſſell lie alther faſteſt went mine entent playen lere eke tiding herde ſome countree ſhall told mee need redely folke ſing bet al mote late rathe ſheues fathe herde great noiſe withall corner hall men loue tidings told gan thitherward behold ſaw renning euery wight faſt hadden might everich cride thing ſome ſaid neuer hepe tho behind gonne lepe clamben faſte noyſe highen caſte treden faſt others heles ſtampe men done eles laſt ſaw man nought ne ſeemed man great auctorite therewithall abraide ſlepe halfe afraide remembring well ſene hie ferre bene gooſt great wonder god thonder let knowen began write like ye herd endite wherefore ſtudy rede alway purpoſe day day thus dreaming game endeth litell booke fame ¶here endeth booke fame prologue teſtament love many men eres openly ſprad ſo moch ſwalowen deliciouſneſſe ieſtes ryme queint knitting coloures goodneſſe badneſſe ſentence take litle hede el none sothely dull witte thoughtful ſoule ſo ſore haue mined graffed ſpirites ſoch craft enditing woll nat acquaintaunce rude wordes boiſtous percen hart herer inteſt point planten ſentence thinges ſo littel helpe able ſpring booke nothing hath great flood witte ne ſemeliche colour doluen rude wordes boiſtous ſo drawe togider maken catcher therof ben ready hent ſentence men painten colour rich ſome vers red inke ſome cole chalke yet good matter y• leude people thilke chalkie purtreyture hem thinketh time afterward ſight better colour yeuen hem joye firſt leudneſſe ſoothly leude clowdy occupation praiſe leud commenly leude leudneſſe commendeth eke ſhall yeue ſight precious thing ſhall reuerence latin french hath many ſoueraine wit great delite endite haue many noble thing fulfilde certes ſome ſpeaken poiſie mater french ſpeche french men haue good fantaſie haue hearing french men engliſh many term ben engliſh unneth engliſh men connen declare knowledging ſhould french man borne ſuch termes conne iumpere matter iay chatereth engliſh right ſo truly underſtanding engliſh men wol ſtretch priuie termes frenche ſo euer boſten ſtraunge langage let clerk enditen latin haue propertie ſcience knowing facultie lette frenchman french alſo enditen queint termes kindely mouthes let u ſhewe fantaſies ſuch wordes learneden dame tongue although booke little thanke worthy leudneſſe trauaile yet ſuch writing exciten men thilk thing neceſſary euery man thereby may perpetual mirrour ſeene vice vertues thing lightly may conceiued eſcheue peril neceſſaries catch auentures haue fallen people perſons certes ſoueraignſt thing deſire moſt creature reaſonable haue el ſhould haue full appetite perfection unreaſonable beaſts mowen ſith reaſon hath hem working reaſonable woll compariſoned unreaſonable made like hem forſooth moſt ſoueraigne finall perfection man knowing ſooth withouten entent deceiuable loue one god inchaungeable know loue creator nowe principally meane bring knowledging louing creatour y• conſideration thing made ye creatour thilke thynges beene made underſtanding wit arne unſeen priueties god made u ſightfull knowing contemplation underſtonding theſe thing forſooth much bringen u ye full knowledging ſooth yt parfite loue maker heuenly thing lo dauid faith thou haſt delited making ſaith haue delite tune god hath lent conſideration thy making whereof ariſtotle booke de animalibus ſayth naturel philoſophers great liking loue knowing creatour alſo knowing cauſes kindely thing conſidered forſooth formes kindely thynges ſhape great kindely loue ſhould haue werkemen hem made crafte werkeman ſhewed werke herefore truely philoſophers liuely ſtudye many noble thing right precious worthie memorie written great ſwete trauaile u leften cauſes property nature thing therefore philoſophers joy lyking heartie luſt kindely vertues matter reaſon perfection buſie ſtudie know haue treaſour richeſſe vaineglory paſſed emperours prince king hadden therfore name hem booke perpetuall memorie vertue peace arne written ye contrary ſayne styxe foule pitte hell arne thilke preſſed ſuch goodneſſe hated becauſe booke ſhall loue prime cauſes ſtering paſſions diſeaſes wanting deſire booke cleaped teſtament loue thou reader thilke ſcorne laugh heare dwarfe el halfe man ſay wil rend ſwerd hercules handes alſo hee ſhould ſet hercules gades mile yet ferther hee power ſtrength pull ſpeare aliſander noble might never wagge paſſing thing mayſter fraunce might ye noble gracious edward third great proweſſe victory ne might yet conquere certes wote well ſhall made ſcorne iape ſo unworthely clothed togither ye cloudie cloude vnconning putten prees ſpeke loue el ye cauſes yt matter ſithen greateſt clerkes han ynough done laith gathered cleane toforne hem ſharpe ſithes conning mowen made great rekes noble full plenty feed many another enuy forſooth commendeth nought reaſon hath haine neuer ſo truſtie although theſe noble reaper good workman worthy hire han draw bound vp y• ſheues made many ſhockes yet haue enſample gader ſmall crums fullin wallet tho fallen bourde among ſmall hound notwithſtanding trauaile almoigner yt hath drawe vp y• cloth ye remiſſailes trenchours releefe beare almeſſe yet alſo haue leaue yt noble husband boece although ſtranger conning come doctrine theſe great worke men gleane handful y• ſhedding hand faile ought full encreaſe portion yt ſhall draw priuities ſhockes ſlye ſeruaunt owne helpe often muche commended knowyng trouth cauſes thyngs hardier firſt ſeechers ſo ſayth ariſtotle lighter u han followed paſſing ſtudy han freſhed wit vnderſtanding han excited conſideration trouth ſharpneſſe reaſons vtterly theſe thynges dreames ne yapes throwe hogges lifelyche meate child trouth betiden pilgrimaged kithe winter y• weather meaſure boiſtous wylde winde boreas kinde asketh drying cold maked y• wawes decian ſea ſo ariſe vnkindely ouer y• commune bankes point ſpill earth ¶thus endeth prologue hereafter followeth firſt booke teſtament loue teſtament love book imitation boetius de conſolatione philoſophiae firſt part whereof love way legacy doth bequeath follow lore knowledge truth errour whereby may rightly judge cauſes croſs fortune ſuch adverſities befall whether suit love otherwiſe ſo end obtain wiſhed deſires ſecond part ſhe reacheth knowledge one god creatour alſo state grace state glory good thing figured margarite pearl chaucer compile book comfort himſelf great grief conceived ſome raſh attempt common joyned thereby fear loſe favour beſt friend alſo therein ſet end writing commanded venus appeareth gower end eighth book entituled confeſſio amantis ſo one venus clerk even gower made confeſſio amantis laſt work ſhrift former offence ala fortune ala ſometyme delicious houres wont enioy blisfull ſtoundes driue vnhappy heauineſſe bewaile ſundry euils tene truly leue mine herte writte perdurable letter ententions lamentation ynempned manner diſeaſe outward ſobbyng manner ſhe weth ſorowfull yexing within thus comforte ginne ſpill ſith ſhe ſhould ſollace ferre fro preſence certes abſence hell ſteruyng death thus wo myneth endeleſſe care throughout mine heart clenched bliſſe ioy oft murthed tourned gall thinke thing may armes hent mirth chaunged tene ſwinke ther continually reſt wont ſoiourne haue dwelling place thus witleſſe thoughtfull ſightleſſe looking endure pennaunce dark priſon caitiſned fro friendſhip acquaintaunce forſaken worde dare ſpeake straunge hath way intruſion made home ſhould reaſon heard ſhould neuer later yet heartely ladye precyous margarite haue mind thy ſeruaunt thinke diſeaſe lightleſſe liueth ſithe beames brennende loue thyne eyen arne ſo bewet worldes cloud atweene v twey wol ſuffer thought hem enlumined thinke one vertue margarite precious amongs many ſorrowful comfort yet ſorrowful comfort luſte haue nought el time deede ne death ne manner trauyle hath power myne heart ſo much fade ſhould heare twinckling diſeaſe ah god forbede yet let dey let ſterue withouten meaſure pennaunce rather myne hartely thinking comfort ought diſeaſed may ſeruice aueile abſence ſeruice ſhould accept nat endleſſe ſorrow thinke yes yes god wote mine heart breaketh nigh aſunder howe ſhould ground without kindely noriture▪ bringen forth fruit howe ſhould ſhippe withouten ſterne great ſea gouerned ſhould withouten bliſſe heart deſire ioy goodneſſe endure contrarious priſon yt thinke euery houre day hundred winter well may eue ſayne adam ſorrow fallen wealth driuen art thou paradiſe ſweate thy ſuſtenaunce beſwinke deepe pining pitte wo ligge yſtocked chaynes linked care tene ſo high thence lie common yearth ne cable land maked might ſtretch draw bliſſe ne ſteyers ſteye none ſo yt without recouer endleſſe endure wote well purueide art thou friendſhip ſometime laughande chere madeſt face countenaunce wardes truely nowe art thou went towne euer thinketh weareth old clothes ſoule life friendſhip drawne spirit farewell friendſhip farewell felawes thinketh ye han taken • eaue force one lady loue ye wote meane yet thinke thy ſeruaunt thy loue ſpilleth thyngs haue forſake follow en thyne heſtes reward wyth thought though ye doe naught el remembraunce loue lithe ſo ſore vnder breaſt yt thought commeth mynd gladneſſe thinke goodneſſe merry cheare frendes ſorrow thinke wretch daunger whych chriſt ſaue great ioy haue meditation bounty vertues nobley printed ſorrow hell commen one ſuppoſe veined thus care ſorrow tene ſhapt meyne end death make good goodly thinke wretched foole fallen ſo lowe heate brenning tene hathe defaced ſhould ye lady ſet priſe ſo foule filth conning thin witte exiled like foole naturell compariſoned truely lady mercie wote well labour idle mercie paſſeth right god graunt yt propoſition verified ſo y• truſt good hope mow come hauen eaſe ſith impoſſible colour quality chaunge forſooth wote well wemme ne ſpotte may abide ſo noble vertue haboundeth ſo defacing verily imaginable countenance goodneſſe encreſing vertue ſo knit abide neceſſary manner yet riuers might fall ayenſt kind wote well mine herte ne ſhould therfore naught flit ye leaſt point geometrie ſo ſadly fonded yt away ſeruice loue may depart loue ſhall pleaſed charitie ſhall leaſed good goodly ſhall y• dice tourne full vertue doe y• chaunce comfort vpward fall loue wolt thou think thy ſeruaunt outcaſt al welfare abide y• day death el ſee y• ſight might welling ſorrowes voide y• flood make ebb theſe diſeaſes mowen well dureſſe ſorrow make life unbodie ſo die certes ye ladie full perfection loue ſo knitte ſoule death maye thilke knotte unbinde ne depart ſo ye ſaule together endeleſſe bliſſe ſhould dwell ſhall ſoule full eaſed may haue preſence ſhew entent deſires ah dear god ſhall great joy nowe yearthly goddeſſe take regarde thy ſeruaunt though feeble thou art wont prayſe better would conſerue loue full meaner king prince woll haue vertue mind precious margarite thy noble vertue hall drawne loue firſte wenyng thereof haue bliſſe galle aloe ſo muche ſprong ſauour ſweetneſſe may ataſt ala benigne eyen mercie ſeemeth haue noriture nill way tourne cleareneſſe mercie mee ward ala brennande vertues ſhinyng amonges folke enluminyng people haboundance encreaſing ſheweth ſmoake light theſe thynges thinke mine heart maketh euerye daye weepyng myne eyen renne theſe liggen backe ſo ſore importable burden mee ſeemeth backe charged maketh mee backeward meue ſteps common courſe euen foorth pretend theſe thynges alſo ryght ſide left haue mee ſo enuolued care wanuehope helpe throughout mee ronne truely leue graceleſſe fortune whyche euer ſheweth mee ward cloudye diſeaſe ready make ſtormes rene bliſfull ſide halt ſtill awayward woll ſuffer mee ward turne force yet woll beene conquered ala nobley ſo muche among creature commended flowyng ſtreme manner vertues woonderfull whyche let flood come ſoule wherefore purely mated ſorrow ſought ſelfe crie goodneſſe haue pittie captife inreſt degree ſorrowe diſeaſe left without goodly helpe recouery theſe ſorrowes may ſuſteyne forrowe ſhoulde bee tolde ward ſhewed although muche ſpace betweene v twayne yet thynketh ſuche joleinyng wordes diſeaſe ginneth ebbe truely thynketh ſowne lamentation weepyng right nowe flow youre preſence cryeth mercye grace whyche thynge mee ſeemeth thee lift none anſwer yeue deinous cheare ye commaunded auoyd god forbid woord ſhould ſpring haue ſo little ruth parde pitie mercye euery margarite cloſed kinde amongs many vertues quality comfort comfort mee right naught worth withouten mercye pittie alone thynges haſtely god graunt mercye rehearſing theſe thynges many without time moment reſt mee ſeemed anguiſh diſeaſe togither rauiſhed cannot tell holly paſſions feeling weten loſt ſeemed time ſuddainely manner drede light mee one nought ſuch feare folke haue enemie mightye would hem greue dooen hem diſeaſe trowe well knowe many perſons otherwhile man soueraignes preſence manner feardneſſe creepeth heart harme goodly ſubjection namely menne readen aungels aferde sauiour heauen parde ne ne may paſſion diſeaſe meane aungels adradde fiend drede ſithen perfitely bliſſed affection wonderfulneſſe ſervice obedience ſuch ferde alſo han theſe louers preſence loues ſubjects aforne soueraines right ſo ferdneſſe mine hert caught ſuddainely aſtonied entered place lodged lady ſeeme liche moſt goodly ſight euer toforne appeared creature truly bluſtering look ſhe yaue gladneſſe comfort ſuddainly wit right ſo ſhee dooth euery wight commeth preſence ſhe ſo goodly thought mine hert began ſomdeale enbolded wext little hardye ſpeake yet quakingvoice durſt ſalued enquired ſhee ſhe ſo worthie ſight dained enter ſo foul dungeon namely priſon without leaue keeper certes although vertue deed mercy ſtretchen viſiten poor priſoners hem faculty comfort ſeemed ſo ferre fallen miſerie wretched hid caitifeneſſe mee ſhould precious thing neigh alſo tha • ſorrow euery wight ſhould beene heavie wiſh recouerie lady ſomedeale apperceiued well wordes chere thought buſied within good womanly countenance ſhe ſaid theſe word norie neſt thou manner foryet friend ſeruaunts nay qd ſhe full entent viſite comfort friendſhips ally well time perturbation moſt propertie bliſſe mee ſhall vnkindeneſſe neuer bee founden alſo ſithen haue ſo eſpeciall true theſe day wherefore may well leiſar come hem deſeruen comming may thing auail wete well woll come often good lady qd art ſo faire looke ryning honey thy wordes bliſſe paradiſe arne thy looking joy comfort thy mouings thy name ſo mokell werking vertues enpight ſeemeth none creature euer ſaw mine eyen diſciple qd ſhe wondereth thy word thee little diſeaſe haſt foryetten name woſt thou well loue firſt thee brought thy ſeruice good lady qd worſhip thee thyne excellence come ſo foule place parde ſometime tho proſperitie forraine good enuolued mokell doen drawe thee mine hoſtell yet many wernings thou madeſt ere thou lift fully graunt thine home make dwelling place thou commeſt goodly thine owne viſe comfort wordes ſo ginne remember paſſed gladneſſe truly lady ne wote whether ſhall ſay welcome none ſithen thy comming woll much mee tene ſorrow gladneſſe mirth ſee comforteth thinke paſſed gladneſſe anoyeth eft thus thy comming gladdeth teneth cauſe much ſorrow lo lady howe comforted comming gan tear diſtill tenderly weepe certes qd loue ſee well overthinketh wit thee fayleth art point dote truly qd ye maked ever rue woteſt thou wel qd ſhe every ſheepheard ought reaſon ſeeke ſperkeland ſheepe arne ron wilderneſſe among buſhes peril hem paſture ayen bryng take hem privie buſie cure keepping tho unconning sheep ſcattered would loſt renning wilderneſſe deſerts draw el woulden put himſelf ſwallowing wolfe yet ſhall ſhepheard buſineſſe trauaile ſo put forth ſhall let loſt way good ſheepheard putteth rather life loſt ſheepe thou ſhalt wene werſe condicion truly everiche folk tho ward knit condicion woll rather die ſuffer hem errour ſpilt liſt liketh mine shepheardeſſe cleaped woſt thou well failed never wight refuſed would negligently go unkindneſſe yet parde many ſuch holpe releved oft beguiled ever end diſcended neck haſt thou radde kind paris priamus ſon troy iaſon falſed fals beheſt seſars ſonke left tene till troned bliſſe ſervice qd ſhe moſt maked love day betweene god mankinde cheſe maid nompere put quarell end lo travailed haue thanke ſides yet liſt reſt might find ſhould werche truly mine diſciple becauſe thee found aſſayes thy ready mine heſtes followed haſt ben true margarite pearle one thee ſhewed ſhe alway ayenward hath made daungerous chear come proper perſone put thee errours make thee glad wayes reaſon ſo ſorrow ne diſeaſe ſhall hereafter thee amaiſtrie wherethrough hope thou ſhalt lightly come grace thou long haſt deſired thilke iewel haſt thou heard many enſamples comforted releeved ſchollers lore hath worthied king field hath honoured lady houre perpetuall mirror truth ſervice hath cauſed worthy folke void vice ſhame hath hold city realm proſperity thee lift cleape ayen thine olde remembraunce thou coudeſt every poynt declare eſpeciall ſay thy maiſtres cauſe cauſing theſe thing many mo iwis madame qd theſe thyngs know well ſelfe thyne excellence paſſeth underſtanding u beaſts mannes wit yearthly may comprehend thy vertues well qd ſhe ſee thee diſeaſe ſorrow wote well thou art one mine nories may ſuffer thee ſo make ſorrow thine owne ſelfe ſhend ſelf come thy fere thine heavy charge make ſeem leſſe wo alone ſorry moned ſorrowful wight great gladneſſe right ſo ſick friendes ſick ſorry cannot el ſorrow make till hem releeved ſuch wiſe gladneſſe maner counterpaiſing ſhall reſtore mokell joy paſſed heavineſſe beforn tene alſo qd ſhe ſervaunts alone ſolitary place yet ever buſied hem comfort heart taught hem make ſongs plaint bliſſe enditen letter rhethorike queint underſtandings bethinke hem wiſe might beſt lady good ſervice pleaſe alſo learn maner countenaunce word bearing ben meek lowly every wight name fame encreaſe yeue great yefts large renome may ſpringen thee thereof excuſed thy loſſe great coſtages wherethrough thou art needy arne nothing unknowen hope god ſomtime ſhall amended thus ſaied norture taught mine courteſie made hem expert lady heart winne would endeynous proud envious wretch acquaintaunce haſteliche ſuch voided ſchoole vice truly hate vertues worthineſſe power auaunce ah worthy creature qd juſte cauſe name goddeſſe dignely ye mowe beat thee lithe grace creature worlde hath goodneſſe truly manner bliſſe preciouſneſſe vertue thee ſpringen wellen brooke river procceden ſprings like water kind drawen ſea ſo kindly thinges threſt •• full appetite deſire drawe thy ſteppes thy preſence approch kindely perfection howe dare beaſts world aught forfete ayenſt thy divine purueighaunce alſo lady ye knowen privy thoughtes heartes counſayle may hidde knowynge wherefore wate well lady ye knowe ſelfe conſcience willyng ſervice coud never doe ſhould yet forſooth fayned never love otherwiſe myne heart coud made cheare one ythought another many done day afore mine eyen trowe would vailed certes qd ſhe haddeſt thou ſo done would thee viſited ye wete well lady eke qd plaid raket nettle docke weathercocke waved truly ye ſet accord conſcience would fly till ye reaſon apert ſtrength maden mine hert tourne good faith qd ſhe knowe thee ever tho condition ſithen thou wouldeſt much thee made mee privy thy counſaile judge thy conſcience though forſoke tho dayes till ſaw better time would never god yt ſhould faile ever woll ready witneſſing thy ſooth place ever ſhall ayenſt tho woll contrary ſuſteine much naught vnknowen ne hid thy privy heart haſt thou tho thynges made mee open full hath cauſed comming priſon void webbes thyne eyen make thee clearely ſee errours thou haſt becauſe men diver condition ſome adradde ſay ſooth ſome ſooth anone ready fight alſo y• may ſelfe beene place withſay thilke men thee ſpeaken otherwiſe ſooth woll charge thee vertue obedience thou mee dweſt writen wordes ſet hem writing mowe witneſſing beene noted among people bookes written neither dreden ne ſhamen ne ſtrive conne onely ſhewen entent y• w •• ter yeve remembraunce hearer woll thy preſence ſay thing tho writer looke boldly truſt mar anſwere full certes ſhall enforme trouth thy love thy conſcience ſo helpe thou ſhalt vary thy neede trowe ſtrongeſt beſt y• may found woll tranſvers thy word whereof wouldeſt thou dreade greatly tho gladded theſe word ſaith wexen ſomedele light hert authority witneſſe alſo ſikerneſſe helpe foreſayd beheſte ſaid truly lady well gladded comfort wordes nowe liking vnto nobly ſhewe folke diffame ſervants ſith ſervice ought thynges beene commended yet qd ſhe ſee well thy ſoule amaſed cloud thee better heare thing thee might light thine heavy charge knowing thine owne helpe ſtirre ſweet wordes ſuche reaſons heare thoughtfull ſoule namely ſuch one thou art wol yet ſuch thing ſinken come therefore let ſeene thy heavy charge may lightlier thy comfort purveigh certes lady qd y• moſt comfort might haue vtterly w • te bee ſure heart margarite ſerve ſo thinke done might life dureth qd ſhe mayſt thou thereafter ſuch wiſe miſpleaſaunce ne enter good fayth qd ſhall miſpleaſance cauſed treſpace ſide doe thee weten qd ſhe ſet never yet perſone ſerve place hee cauſed y• contrary default treſpaces hee ne ſped ſervice mine owne yearthly lady quod tho yet remember worthineſſe long ſithen many revolving yeares time october leave ginneth take november ſheweth ſight berne ful good qutte every halke good lond tiller ginneth ſhape y• yearth great travayle bring forth corne mannes ſuſtenaunce ayenſt next yeares following ſuch time plenty hee hath home wiſe liſt wander mar vailes ſeech bee conſtrayned excited lothe thyng done excitation mannes opinion whiche woulden fayne myne abiding take heart luſt travayle ſee windyng yearth time winter woodes large ſtreetes ſmall pathes swine hogges hadden made lane ladels maſte ſeech walked thinking alone wonder great whyle great beaſtes wood haunten adorneth maner forreſts heards gone wiſd ere ware neighed ſea bank ferde beaſts ſhipcraft cride lady trow ye wete well ſelf nothing werſe beaſtes ſhould • n beene tame catche wiſdneſſe ginne waxe ramage thus forſooth aferde shippe hied ynow lach mine handes drawe shippe many kn • well name sight firſt luſt another thought y• thirde eke mayſter theſe broughten mee wythin boorde shippe travaile ſayle ſprad ship gan mooue wind water gan riſe ouerthwartly tourn welkin wawes ſeemden kiſt together often vnder colour kiſſing mokell old hate priuely cloſed kept ſtorm ſo ſtrangely deuouring manner gan ſo faſt v aſſail ſuppoſed date death ſhould haue made ginning vnder wawe abouen shippe great ſo mokell dureſſe weather ſtormes great auowing pilgrimage driuen iſle vtterly wend firſt haue reſcowed truly firſt beginning ſeemed ſo perillous hauen catch grace comforted life full deſpaired truly lady ye remember aright manner thing ſelf came haſtely ſeen v ſea driuen weten firſt ye deignous cheare ye gone better alight euer thought ye liued great dreade diſeaſe ſeemed ſo chear certified name y• lenger looked y• goodly dradde euer mine hert opened ſo little time ship minde lady ye lad ware beaſtes fiſhes great number thronging togider among muskle blew ſhell encloſed margarite pearle moſt precious beſt euer toforne came ſight ye tolden ſelf ilke iewel kind ſo good ſo vertuous better ſhould neuer finde ſought thereafter worldes ende yt helde peace great whyle euer ſithen haue bethought man ſought precious margarites founden one liking ſold good buy iewel iwis thought yet ſo thinke haue founden iewel mine herte deſireth whereto ſhould ſeeche truly nowe wol ſtint margarite ſet mee euer alſo ſithen wiſt wel ſhould ſuch ſeruice take ſo deſire thing neuer haue bliſſe liueth none hath diſeaſe might brought ſuch ſeruice cauſe ſorrow ioy wonder word ye ſaine bringen men ioy parde ye wote well default ne treſpace may reaſonable put ward fer conſcience knoweth diſeaſe liſt ſpeak enform manner bliſſe ye haue throng truly wene gladneſſe ioy mirth beſhet vnder lock key throw ſuch place thet may bee found brenning hath altered al hew ſhould ſleep wallow thinke mee diſport thus combred ſeeme folk maſed alſo lady mine deſire hath long dured ſome ſpeaking haue el y• leaſt haue enmoiſed ſight wanting theſe thing mouth would durſt plein right ſore ſithen euils goodneſſe arn manyfold holden wonder lady truly ſaue euermore reuerence ye mow ſhame ſuch thing ſuffer ſeruaunt ſo multiplied wherefore kneelyng low heart pray rue caytife nothing may ſerue good lady liſt help ſhew pryuieſt ſeruauntes aſſays time vnder wynges protection help ward ſhapen ſhall ſtraungers wyſe ſuccour looke ſo pryuie yet helpe doe fayle maye thus priſone abide bondes chaynes holden ladie ye ſee well ſelf reniant foriudged hath half care thus ſighyng ſobbyng waile alone nere comfort preſence ryght would ſterue yet little gladded ſo goodly ſuch grace none happe haue hent graciouſlye finde precyous margarite left menne ſhould buye ſhould therefore ſell ſubſtaunce wo ſo many let game purpoſe breaker beene maked wayters ſuch pryſoners euermore ouerlooke hinder ſuch lettours hard ſuch iewell winne lady honour thy deity thynketh ryght ſuche people ſhoulde haue mayſtry ne ouerlookers ouer none thy ſeruauntes truely leful unto goddes would playne ye rule diuine purueighaunce amonges ſeruauntes nothynge yee ſhoulde alſo ladye moeble inſuffiſaunte counteruayle price iewell el make eſchaunge eke wight worthy ſuch pearl weare king prince el peer iewell vertue woulde adorne make fayre realme nobley vertue ſo much goodneſſe ouer commended would waile might ſuch rich haue vertue thereof priſon may deliuer nought el therethorowe holpen ſee ſelf withouten recouery although might hence void yet would would abide day deſteny hath ordeined ſuppoſe without amendment ſo ſore mine heart bounden may thinken none thus ſtraight lady hath ſir daunger laced ſtocks leue ſee taken ſo little heed thinketh woll maken might vertue mercy margarite ſtretch ſo ye mow well caſe liſt bliſſe mirth arn felde ſickeneſſe ſorrow alway ready cope tene wound body ſtanding mee beſt vnneth may ligge pure miſeaſie ſorrow yet little ynough earneſt ſiluer forward bargain treble fold ſo mokell muſt ſuffer er time come mine eaſe worthie wealth may woe ſuffer certes heauie think theſe thing ſhall yeue water ynough drink leaſt mine eyen drie renning ſtreames teares ſhall waylen mee myne happie heavineſſe ſhall counſayle mee liking tene goodly harſe euer brenne coveit ſorrow thirſt gladneſſe ſhall yeue contrarious drink ſtaunch thurſt bliſfull bitterneſſe lo thus bren drench ſhiuer ſweat reuerſed yuell neuer yet ordained ſalue forſoth lech ben vnconning ſaue margarite alone ſuch remedy puruey theſe word braſt weep euery tear mine eyen greatneſſe ſemed boren ball ſight water outronne thought loue gan litle heauy miſcomfort chear gan ſoberly eaſie manner ſpeak well auiſing ſhe ſaid commonly wiſe ſpeaken eaſily ſoft many skils one wordes better beleeued alſo eaſie ſpeaking auiſement men may catch put forth holden alſo authoritie eaſie wordes eke yeuen vnderſtanding intention matter right ſo ladie eaſily ſoft manere gan ſay theſe wordes meruayle qd ſhe great manner ſemblaunt ferre eſpie thou liſt haue recour euer thou playneſt ſorroweſt way remedy fooliſh wilfulneſſe thee liſt ſeech enquire thy next friend thine inwit mee haue ben thy maiſtreſſe recour fine thy diſeaſe diſeaſe gladneſſe joy full veſſell ſo helded quencheth feeling firſt tenes thou wont theſe thing remember thine heart alſo fool thereof enfourmen adnulling errours deſtroying derk opinion comfort ſear thought canſt thou comfort thine ſoul thinking theſe thing haſt thou ſo long commenſall haſt ſo mikell eaten potage foryetfulneſſe dronken ſo ignoraunce old ſouking thou haddeſt mee arne maiſtred lorne fro manner knowing worthy perſon helpe cannot counſaile himſelf theſe wordes pure ſtrong ſhame wox reed ſhe ſeeing mee ſo aſtonied diver ſtounds ſuddainly thing kind hateth gan deliciouſly comfort ſugred word putting full hope ſhould y• margarite getten followed heſts gan fair cloth wipen tear hingen cheek ſaid wiſe well wiſedom welth withouten thee may nothing ben learned thou beareſt key priuie thing vain trauail men catch ſtedſhip ye lady firſt lock vnſhet ye lady learn v way bypath heauen ye lady maken heauenly body goodly benignely done courſe gouernen v beaſts earth ye armen ſeruaunts ayenſt debate imperciable harneis ye ſetten herts inſuperable blood hardneſſe ye leaden hem parfit good yet thing deſireth ye werne man help wele done lore grant little grace ſorrows ceaſe mine ſeruant qd ſhe truly thou ſitteſt nie mine hert thy bad chere gan ſorely greue among thy plaining word thought thou alledgeſt thing letting thine helping thy grace hinder wherethrough thinketh wanhope crope thine hert god forbid nice vnthriftie thought ſhould come thy mind thy wit trouble ſithen euery thing coming contingent wherefore make thy propoſition impoſſible pray thee rehearſe ayen tho thing thy miſtruſt cauſen thilk thing think reaſon diſtroyen put full hope thine hert vnderſtandeſt thou qd ſhe thou ſaideſt many let game thine ouerlookers alſo thy moeble inſuffiſaunt thou thereof meaneſt truly qd firſt ſay janglers euermore arn ſpeaking rather euil good euery age man rather enclineth wickedneſſe goodneſſe advance alſo falſe word ſpringen ſo wide ſtering falſe lying tongue fame al ſwiftly flieth ear faith many wicked tale ſoon ſhall falſeneſſe ben leued trouth great ſothneſſe qd thinketh thilk jewel ſo precious ſuch wretch would vertue thereof extend alſo feeble worldly joy ſuch jewel countreuail ſuch people worldly joy han ſet higheſt degree moſt reuerence ben accepted falſe wening maketh felicity therein ſuppoſed ſuch caitiues euermore ben hindred certes qd ſhe take good heed ſhall reaſon thee ſhewen theſe thing mow let thy purpoſe leaſt point wight coude prick remembreſt nat qd ſhe enſample one ſtrongeſt maner preue mannes purpoſe nowe enſample enduce thee propoſition nat proued ſtrength yes forſooth qd well qd ſhe raddeſt thou neuer paris troy helaine loued togider yet entrecommuned ſpeech alſo acriſius ſhete dane doughter toure ſuertie wight ſhould haue maiſtrie ſervice yet iupiter ſignes without ſpeech purpoſe ayenſt father many ſuch mo haue knitte trouth yet ſpake neuer togider thyng encloſed vnder ſecretneſſe priuitie twey perſons entremellen herts ſight power knowing ſuch thing ſo preuen ſhall nat vtterly yeuen beaſts many thing ſuch precious matter reſerued iudgement diuine purueyaunce among liuyng people mannes conſideration mowen determined wherefore ſay envye y• iangling welnie people vpon ſeruaunts maken efte rather cauſe eſploite hindering qd ſuffer ye ſuch wrong moun ye liſt lightly ſuch yuels abate ſeeineth great vnworſhip qd ſhe hold thy peace haue founden many han vnkind y• truly woll ſuffer euery wight wiſe haue diſeaſe continue ende well truly hem woll helpen one myne bliſſe wend martial greece ycrowned god nat ſtrongeſt ratheſt come lengeſt abode continued iourney ſpared nat trauayle long play leſt thilke perſons profered nowe ſeruice therein anone voydeth ready another one thinketh nowe another water entreth anone reſpireth ſuche one liſte mee nat parfite bliſſe ſeruice bryng tree oft ſet diuers place woll kinde endure bring forth fruit looke nowe pray thee howe myne olde ſeruauntes time paſſed continued ſeruice follow thou ſteppes myght thou fayle caſe thou worche wiſe certes qd nothing liche worlde time paſſed eke country hath one manner another countrey hath another ſo maye nat man alwaye put eye ſalue hee healed heele ſooth betwyxe two thynges lyche oft diuerſitie required qd ſhe ſoothe diuerſitie nation diuerſitie lawe maked manye reaſons diuerſitie commeth contrarious malice wicked people han envious heartes ayenſt truely lawe ſeruauntes euer hath general whiche may fayle ryght mannes lawe ordeined many determination may knowne good badde till aſſay people han proued end draweth ſheweth neceſſitie thereof el impoſſibilitie right ſo ye law ſeruaunts ſo well hath proued general hitherto hath fayled wiſt thou well lawe kinde lawe god ordayned eſtablyſhed dure kynde reaſoun wherefore lawe mannes wit purveied ought vnderput lawe kinde whych yet hath commune euerye kindely creature ſtatutes lawes kyndely arne generall people old doyngs many turning year vſed people manner proued mowen ſo lightly defaced new doings contrariaunts ſuch old often cauſen diſeaſes breaken many purpoſes yet ſay nat therefore ayen new miſcheef men ſhould ordaine newe remedie alway looke contrary y• old ferther mallice ſtretcheth followeth y• olde doings loue han ben vniuerſal moſt exploit thee vſed wherefore wold yet lawes nothing annulled thy purpoſe ſuch iangelers looker wayters game think ought mowe dere yet loue well alway ſet hem nought let thy port low euery wight preſence readie thine heart maintaine thou haſt begonne little thee fayne meekneſſe wordes thus ſleight ſhalt thou ſurmount dequace yuel herts wiſdome yet ſeme flie otherwhyle man woll fight thus ſuche thyngs tongue euil ſhall ſtilled el fully graunt thy full meaning forſooth euer euer ſhall mine enemy aferde truſt fighting therefore haue thou coward heart ſeruice ſometime thou haddeſt y• contrary thou drede ſuch ianglers thy voyage make vnderſtand well y• dreadeth raine ſow cornes ſhall haue thin berne alſo afearde clothes let daunce naked nothing vndertaketh namely ſeruice nothing atcheueth great ſtormes y• weather often merry ſmooth much clattering mokell rowning thus iangling wordes commeth huiſht peace ſtill good lady qd ſee ſeuen yeare paſſed haue graffed groubed vine wyth way could ſought fede y• grape fruit haue none found alſo haue ſeuen year ſerued laban wedded rachel doughter blear eyed lia brought bed alway engendereth tene full child tribulation care although clippynges kiſſyngs rachell ſhoulde ſeeme ſweet yet ſhe ſo barraine yt gladneſſe ne ioy way wol ſpring ſo yt may weep rachell may counſayled ſollace ſithen iſſue myne heartely deſire fayled pray ſone freedom grace thys eight yeare eyghteth mow kynreſte maſſeday theſe ſeauen werke day trauaile follow chriſten lawe euer ye doe el thilke margarite holden ſo lady pryuye chamber ſhe caſe none perſon committed look qd ſhe caſe none perſon committed look qd ſhe thou perſeuer ſeruice haue thee grounded yt thilke ſcorne thy enemy mowe thus thy perſon ſoothed lo man began edifie foundement bad end may nat bring meekneſſe countenaunce manly heart deed long continuance coniſance livery retinue deliuered weneſt thou yt liſt aduaunce ſuch perſons louen ye firſt ſittings feaſts ye higheſt ſtoles church hall loutings people market fair vnſtedfaſt bide one place together wening wit excellent ſcorning manner device owne nay nay god wote theſe ſhall nothing parten blyſſe truely manner heretoforne hath beene worſhip bliſſe lion field lambes chamber eagle aſſaute maiden hall fox counſaile ſtill deed protection graunted ready bridge banner ar • ered like wolf field thus theſe way ſhull men auaunced enſample david yt keeping ſheepe drawn vp order kingly gouernaunce iupiter bulle beene europe fere iulius ceſar loweſt degree rome maiſter earthly prince eneas hell king countrey rome ſtonding ſo thee ſay thy grace bering thereafter may ſet thee ſuch plight iangling may greeue leaſte tucke thy hem iangles nought counte creſſe thy diſaduantage ever qd ſhe hath people worlde deſired haue great name worthineſſe hated foule beare fame one obiections thou alledgeſt ayen thine hertely deſire ye forſooth qd ſo commonly people woll lie bring ſuch enfame nowe quod ſhe men leaſinges put enfame weneſt thy ſelfe thereby enpeired y• wening wrong ſee much lyen thy merite encreaſeth make thee ben worthy hem knowen thee ſooth thing thou art apeired ſo mokell thou art encreaſed thy beloued friend ſoothly wound thy friend laſſe harm yea ſir better falſe kiſſing deceiuable gloſing thyne enemie aboue well thy friende maketh ſuch enfame ergo thou art encreaſed nat apeired lady qd ſometyme yet man diſeaſe ye eſtimation enuious people ne looketh nothing deſerts men ne ye merites doings auenture fortune thereafter yeuen ſentence ſome looken voluntary heart therafter telleth iudgement taking heed reaſon ne qualitie thus man rich fulfild worldly welefulneſſe ſome commenden ſaine ſo lent iuſt cauſe yt hath aduerſitie ſaine weaked hath deſerued thilke annoy contrary theſe thing ſome men holden alſo ſaine yt rich proſperitie purveied vnto confuſion vpon matter many authority many great witted clearkes allegen ſome menſayne though good eſtimation forſaken folke yt han aduerſitye yet merite encreaſe blyſſe ſo theſe purpoſes arne ſo wonderful vnderſtanding truly mine aduerſitie ſentence ye indifferent people iudgen fame therefore qd ſhe wight ſhould yeue true ſentence ſuch matter ye cauſe diſeaſe mayſt thou ſee well vnderſtand thereupon end draweth yt ſayne good bad ſo ought haue fame goodneſſe enfame badneſſe euery reaſonable perſone namely wiſe man wit ought without reaſon toforne heard ſuddainly matter iudge ye ſaws wiſe thou ſhalt iudge ne deme toforne thou know lady qd ye remember well moſt laud praiſing certain ſaints holy church rehearſen conuerſation bad good ſo reherſed perpetual mirrour remembraunce worſhipping tho ſaintes good enſample misdoers amendment turned roman zedeories fro roman hannibal ayenſt kind nation afterwards ſeeming romaine ye next degree confuſion turned old ally whoſe wit hannibal diſcomfited wherfore enforme lady manner mean ſee youth draw aſſentaunt might helpyng certaine coniurations great matter ruling citezins thilke thynges beene drawer excitours tho matter werne ſo painted coloured prime face ſeemed noble glorious ye people wening mikell merite haue deſerued furthering maintenaunce tho thyngs buſied laboured diligence werkyng thilke matter end truly lady tell ye ſooth rought little hate mighty senatours thilke city ne commune mallice two skilles one comfort ben ſuch plite profite friend another common profit communalty peace tranquility juſt gouernaunce proceden thilke profite ſithen counſail mine inwit thought firſt paynted thynges mallice euill meanyng withouten good avaylyng people tyranny purpoſed ſo pure ſorrow meddling bad infame ronne tho teares laſhed mine eyen thus away waſhe vnderhyd mallice rancour purpoſing envy fornecaſte ymagined deſtruction mokel people ſhewed ſo openly blind myne handes circumſtaunce might well feeled tho perſones ſuch thinges caſt redreſſe wrath firſte meddling ſhopen dwell pynande priſon till lachaſes threade lenger would twyne ever ſought liſt grace life freeneſſe priſon ſhoulde openly confeſſe howe peace might enduced enden y• firſt rancour fully ſuppoſed knowing full tho matter lady thought every man way right rightfully done may helpe commune helpe ſaved thynge keepe thinges holde maintaine namely deſtroying wrong al ſhould therethrough enpeach myne owne fere guilty miſdeed aſſentaunt maiſter ne friend may nought avayle ſoule hym falſeneſſe deyeth alſo nere deſired wrath people ne indignation worthy nothyng ever wrought doings ſelfe el y• mayntenaunce theſe foreſayd errours hidyng privities thereof people heart holdyng errours ſide blind elde ſo ferre forth beguiled yt debate ſtrife maintayned diſtruction ſide whyche cauſe peace moſt communalties ſhould deſired point bee broken annulled alſo city london ſo deare ſweet forth growne kindely love y• place yearth every kindely creature hath full appetite place kindely engendrure wilne reſte peace ſteede abide thilke peace ſhould thus broken wiſe commended deſired know thing men deſiren commen y• parfit peace everlaſting muſt y• peace god commended maintain keepe peace angel voyce confirmed god entring world teſtament left friend retourned place whence came apoſtle admoneſteth holden without man parfitely may none inſight alſo god coming made peace alone heauenly earthly body alſo among u earth ſo peace confirmed one heed love one body ſhoulde perfourm alſo remember well name athens rather god peace battaile ſhewing peace moſt neceſſary communalties city ſo ſtered theſe way toforne nempned declared certain point wiſe firſt thilke perſons hadden mee drawen purpoſes witting privy entent meaning drawen alſo feeble witted people none inſight gubernatife prudence clamure cry matter ſtirred point commune auantage embolded paſſife take active alſo ſtirred innocent conning cry thing qd may ſtand ben executours tho matter authority execution common election u delivered muſt enter ſtrength maintenaunce ſuch degree put oppreſſion theſe old hinderers ſhall agayn ſurmounten putten ſuch ſubjection endleſſe woe ye ſhull complain government qd citie left hand torcencious citizen ſhal bring peſtilence diſtruction good men therefore let u y• commune adminiſtration abate ſuch yuels alſo qd worthy good commend thy guilty deſerts chaſtice citizen many ferd execution ſhall done extortion hem committed evermore ayenſt theſe purpoſes good meaning never latter lady truly meaning theſe word fully appeached mighty senator hadden heavy heart miſgovernaunce ſeen ſo lady fell free election great clamour much people great diſeaſe miſgovernaunce ſo fervently ſtooden election yt hem ſubmitted every manner face rather ſuffred manner rule hated governours notwithſtanding contrary helden much commune meiny conſideration voluntary luſts withouten reaſon thilke governour ſo forſaken fayning ſcorn undoing miſrule time ſhope letted thilke election made newe himſelf choſen mokell rore arered theſe thing lady knowen among prince made open people draweth amendment every degree ſhall ben ordained ſtand ſhould error coming hereafter men may lightly toforn hand puruay remedy wiſe peace reſt furthered hold thing lady thilk perſons broughten anſwere toforne moſt ſoueraigne judge coarted paining dures openly knowledgeden asked thereof grace ſo apertly preveth wordes ſooth without forging leaſings greueth remember theſe diuers ſentences jangling theſe ſheepie people certes thinketh oughten maken joy ſooth may knowe trouth conſcience witneſſe knowing ſoothe haue ſaid harm ne malice tho perſons trouth ſacrament liegeaunce charged king behalf ſee ye lady fellonous thought people couins wicked men conſpiren ayen ſoothfaſt trouth see ye euery wight theſe erronious opinion aſſentaunt help noiſe knewen theſe thing better ſeluen apparailen finden new friend cleapen falſe ſtudien mowen mouthes werſe plite nempne god may thilk folk time maintenance might auayleth ſtretch foreſaid matter tho commended yaue name trouth ſo manifold maners nigh euery wight ear thilk people ſide thilk company ſometime paſſed yeuing name bad loo tho people turned good bad bad good thing wonder knowing ſaying ſoth arn tempted reply old praiſings knowen well doings ben trew ſain openly falſe haue ſaid many thing alleaged nothing falſe vntrew ſaue thilk mater knowledged party hemſelf god wot mater none ye alſo lady know theſe thing trew auaunt prayſing ſelf thereby ſhould leſe precious ſecre conſcience ye ſee well falſe opinion people trouth telling falſe conſpired mater judgment theſe clerk ſhould hide ſooth maner perſon maiſter ne wherefore would drede put conſideracion trew wiſe comer hereafter ſhullen fully denwere ſoth know theſe thing act wern haue put scripture perpetuell remembrance true meaning truly lady ſeemeth ought bear name trouth loue rightwiſeneſſe haue thus ſubmitten falſe fame clerk ſain flieth faſt doth fame trouth ſhall ſo wide ſprede till brought jewell mean ſo ſhall hindred withouten meaſure trouth gan loue ſadly behold ſaid chaunged voice lower ſhe ſpoken time fain would qd ſhe thou holpen haſt thou ſaid thing thou might prouen pardee qd perſons euery thing haue ſaid han knowleged hemſelf yea qd ſhe hadden naied wouldeſt thou haue mainteined soothly qd well wiſt amongſt greateſt realm profered body ſo largely prouing tho thing mar ſhould haue judged thend ſothneſſe word durſt thilk judg truſt certes qd ſhe aboue fame world name marciall doings moſt pleaſen lady lore ſithen thou ready thine aduerſaries thy preſence refuſed thilk thy fame ought ſo born deed take end therefore euery wight drop reaſon hath heareth infame theſe thing hath anſwer ſay trewly thou ſaideſt thine aduerſaries thy word affirmed thou haddeſt lied yet diſcomfited priſe leaned thy ſide ſo fame ſhall hold infame ſhall bring vpon none half greueth thee thine enemy ſain ſhame thus arn diſcomfited yet quarell trew shall loo thy frends ayenward dequace thilk enfame ſay graunted ſooth without ſtroke fighting many men battell diſcomfited ouercome rightfull quarrel goddes priuy judgement heauen yet although party yolden may word ſay quarrell trew yeeld contrary dread death compelled graunted ſtroke hath feled may creep away wiſe none excuſacion indifferent folk ſay ye trew falſe himſelf knowledgeth tho thing thus euery ſide fame ſheweth thee good bad yet qd ſome ſay ne ſhould deth haue diſcouered maiſtreſſe ſo vnkindneſſe woll knet infame purſue thus enemy manifold maner woll ſech priuy ſerpentines queintiſes quench diſtroy venime many buſineſſes light trouth make herts murmour ayenſt perſon haue hain withouten cauſe qd ſhe hear word thou ſhalt fully aunſwered trow thinketh qd ſhe right thy word sacrament ſwearing ſay charging othe one cauſes make thee diſcouer malicious imaginacions tofore nempned euery othe knitting copulation muſt haue theſe lawes trewe iudgment rightwiſeneſſe thyng theſe lacke oth iturned name periury make true ſerment muſt need theſe thing follow ofte tymes man ſay ſoothe iudgement iuſtice folow forſworne enſample herodes holding ſerment dampned alſo ſay trouth rightfullithe judgment whyle forboden ſothes ſaine therefore judgement trouth rightwiſeneſſes euery creature bounden vpon payne periury full knowing make though perſon dread ſinne word better die liue falſe al would peruerted people falſe report make vnkindnes y• entent thy fame reiſe light truth theſe matter forth ſprongen openly publiſhed among common ſhall ſoch dark enfame dare appear pure ſhame falſneſſe ſome men enfame none otherwiſe void el excuſe hindring men fame none cauſe cleapen men falſe falſneſſe mowen avaunſed el falſe ſclaundring word men ſhendin true ſclaunder make ſeem laſſe ſoch men woulden iyen conſcience reuoluen ſhoulden ſeen ſame ſentence legen ſpring ſides ſo many branch impoſſible number therefore may ſaid thing man thou demeſt therein thy ſelf thou condempneſt qd ſhe vnderſtand theſe word thou wene ſay thee worthy ſclander matter tofore written truly would witneſſe contrary ſay beames ſclaundring word may done away till day dome ſhould yet amongs ſo great plenty people many ſhrews ſithen mo eight perſons no ſhip cloſed yet one ſhrew ſcorned father theſe thing qd ſhe trow ſhewen falſe fame drede ne wiſe perſons accept namely thy margarite whoſe wiſedom hereafter think declare wherefore wote well ſoch thing ſhall aſtert vnkindneſſe thine othe hath thee excuſed full thou wouldſt greue liſt thing ſhew say qd ye wol trow ye mean trouth profit time coming truly qd ſhe ſoth ſo thou con well keep theſe word inreſt ſecret chamber thine hert ſo faſt hem cloſe neuer flitt ſhalt thou find hem auailing look people haſt thou ſerued hem time thine exile euer thee refreſhed value leaſt coigned plate walketh money ſory made ruth thy diſeaſe hadden getten purpoſe thy mi • aventure ſet haw lo thou enpriſoned faſt hied help thy deliueraunce wene thy death yeue lite looked thing luſts thou liſt ſay ſothe meinie brigge thee broughten lokeden rather thine help thee haue releued owen yet ſome hem money common paideſt thou ſome diſpences till tourned seland yaue thee euer ought riding thou madeſt yet pardie ſome hem tooken money thy chamber put tho pen pourſe vnweting renter lo company thou medleſt neither thee ne ſelf mighten help vnkindneſſe bear name thou ſuppoſeſt hem haue might thou haue done thou diddeſt thou wouldeſt falſe quarell haue ſtinking martire wene thou fleddeſt long thou might priuitie conceal thing thou heleſt lenger thou ſhouldeſt thilk ought thee money pennie would pay wend thy return impoſſible might thou better haue hem proued thus thy needy diſeaſes haſt thou enſample thou ſhalt meddle truly lore worth many goodes oft gan loue ſtern theſe word think ſpeach truely hereafter woll thee liking ſo euer thou ſee fortune ſhape whele turne meditacion way reuolue certes fortune ſheweth fayreſt ſhe thinketh beguile thought toforne thou ſaideſt thy loo loue thy rightwiſeneſſe ought rayſed ſhould allowed time coming thou might loue ſo thee haue loo fame ſhull ſo rayſed thy freends comfort ſorow thine enemy endleſſe ſhull endure thou one sheep amongs hundred loſt deſert way erred flock art reſtored shepeheard hath thee joy thou ayen forreſt tourn right ſorrow anguiſh great time thine way going right ſo joy gladneſſe ſhall doubled ſeen thee conuerted lothes wife ayen looking hoole counſail sheep folowing graſſe hearbs gader neuer later qd ſhe ſay theſe thing wantruſt haue ſuppoſing thee otherwiſe ſhould truely wote well thou art ſette ſoche purpoſe thee liſt part ſay many men ben knowing men doings ſetten cure lightly deſiren bad clatter rather good haue owne manner amende alſo hate old rancour lightly hauen ſoch thing abideth ſodainly mouth proceedeth haboundance herte word ſtones ſtones throw wherfore counſaile euermore openly apertly place thou ſitte counterplete therrours meaning far thou hem wiſteſt falſe leaue wight make hem know euery body eare alway patient vſe iacobs word ſo euer men thee clappen ſhall ſuſtain lady wrath haue deſerued ſo long margarite hath rightwiſed cauſe certes qd ſhe witneſſe ſelf thou thus conuerted ſorroweſt good meaning thine herte wolt vanity parfitely depart conſolacion al good pleaſaunce margarite thou deſireſt thyne herte manner mother pity ſhul fully accept thee grace right thou renteſt clothes open ſight ſo openly ſow hem worſhyp withouten reproofe commended alſo right thou enſample moch fold error right ſo thou muſt enſample manifold correction ſo good fauour forgoing error deſtroying cauſeth diligent loue many plaited prayſings follow ſhall firſt errours make following worſhips ſeeme hugely encreaſed black white ſet togider euery ſeemeth ſo dothe euery thing contrary kind infame goeth alway tofore prayſing worſhip cauſe following maketh riſe thilk honour double wealth quencheth ſpot firſt enfame weneſt ſay theſe thing hindering thy name nay nay god wot pure encreaſing worſhip thy rightwiſeneſſe commend thy trouth ſeem woſte well thy ſelfe thou inform making paſſeth adam eate apple thou paſſeth ſtedfaſtneſſe noe y• eating grape became dronke thou paſſeth chaſtity lothe lay doughter eke nobly abraham god reproued pryde alſo dauids meekneſſe woman made vry ſlaw alſo hector troy defaut might found yet reproued ne manhood ſuffred warre begon ne paris haue went grece gan ſorow truly lacketh venime priuy conſenting y• openly leaueth wrong withſay lo eke old prouerbe among many ſtill ſeemeth graunted theſe enſamples thou might fully vnderſtand theſe thing writ learning rightwiſenes tho perſones thus euery wight default committed made goodneſſe afterwards done reuerence open ſhewing enſample ſonge holy church lo neceſſary adam ſin dauid king gat salomon king vries wife truly reproof none theſe thing writte right ſo tho rehearſe thy deed repreue thee neuer ne villany thee rehearſed worſhip ſo thou continue well hereafter profite thy ſelf rede thou hem thinke ſaied right thus lady unity accorde enuy wrath lurken thou commeſt place ye weten well ſelue ſo done many y• adminiſtred office common ruling y• eſtabliſhments amongs y• people defouled neuer conſcience maner deede euer wit counſaile wiſeſt matter drawen right endes thus truly lady haue deſired ſoch cure certes ſeruice idle far ſoch cure ſtretcheth thing qd ſhe yt may draw many hertes noble voice common glory fame wretched fickle ala mankind coueteth ſo leud wiſe rewarded good deed ſith glory fame world hindering glory time comming certes qd ſhe yet y• hardeſt ſuch fame heauen yearth centre cercle heuen pricke wonderful little reſpect cercle yet prick may name born manner perſing many obſtacles water wilderneſſe ſtraunge language onely name men ben ſtilled holden knowledging theſe obſtacles alſo city realm proſperity ben letted know reaſon hindred ſo mowe ben perfitely men proper vnderſtanding ſhould name ſinguler londenoys paſſe glorious name london many commended many lacked many mo place earth knowen knowen many countrees little london knowing ſpeach yet among one manner people may ſoch fame goodneſſe come many praiſen commonly many lacken fie ſoch maner fame ſleep ſuffre knoweth priuity hertes deale ſoch fame thilke place nothing ayenſt ſoth ſhall neither ſpeake ne dare appere atturney ne maner many great named many great worthineſſe loſed han tofore time yt memory ſlidden cleanly forgetten defaute writing yet ſcriptures great elde ſo defaſed perpetualty may hem judged thou wolt make compariſon euer wt joy mayſt thou haue yearthly name fair likeneſſe pee one grain wheat thouſand ſhips full corne charged nomber one yet mowe nombred end recknyng haue truely may nombred nothing recken thilke may nombred oft thing ended made compariſon one little great thing haue end end ſoch compariſoun may founden wherefore heauen loſed god hath none end endles endureth thou canſt nothing doen aright thou deſire rumour thereof healed euery wightes eare dureth prick reſpect ſo thou ſeekeſt reward folk ſmall word vain prayſings truly therein thou leſeſt guerdon vertue leſeſt greateſt valour conſcience unhap thy renome euerlaſting therefore boldly renome fame yearth ſhould hated fame death ſhould deſired werks vertue asketh guerdoning ſoul cauſeth vertue y• ſoul deliuered priſon yearth moſt worthy ſoch guerdone among haue euerlaſting fame bodye cauſeth mannes yuils tway thing art thou anſwered thinketh qd loue thing doubt thy ſoul ſhew forth thine ignoraunce clear leaue ſhame certes qd ne body world aught could ſay reaſon ayenſt skils leue wit fele well euil ſpeakers bearer enfame may little greue let purpoſe rather ſoche thing quarel forthered yea qd ſhe proued alſo like jewel keeping ſhall ſtered leſt moment might imagined ſoth qd well qd ſhe leueth declare thy inſuffiſaunce manner letting thus ſhe ſo worthy thou ſhouldeſt climbe ſo high thy moebles thine eſtate arne voided thou thinkeſt fallen ſoch miſery gladneſſe thy purſute woll thee diſcend certes qd ſoth right ſoch thought mine herte commonly ſpoken old prouerb ledged heweth hie chip may leſe ſight wherefore haue euer might ſtudy way remedy one ſide qd ſhe god forbede ere thou ſeek doings ſoch haue learned thee reſting while ſuch hearbes planted garden thou ſhalt well vnderſtand aboue man one god alone qd han men forne time truſted writ chauntements help spirites dwellen air thereby han getten deſires firſt manly power daunced behind qd ſhe fie ſoch matter truely ſacrilege ſhall haue ſort ſeruants mine eyen ſhall ſoch thing looked often commanded theſe paſſed wiſe yt one god ſhall men ſerue two god liſt haue mine help ſhall aske none help foul spirit ala man maked ſemblable god woſte thou well vertue liueliche werking god purueighance vnderput reaſonable creature yerth euery thing thiſhalf god made buxom man contemplacion vnderſtanding heauen earth hell hath man ſtones ſoul wexing tree herb hath ſoul feling beaſts fiſhes foul hath ſoule reaſon vnderſtonding angel ſo yt knit maner liuings reaſonable proporcion alſo man made y• fower element uniuerſity rekened alone hath god principality aboue al thing ſoul thouſand mile hence farre nigh high low farre moment mountenance ten winter al man gouernance diſpoſicion ſheweth men lich vnto god child moſt height ſithen al thing vnderput y• reaſonable creature god forbid man win lordſhip ask help thing lower himſelfe namely foule thing innominable ſhouldeſt thou wene loue high ſithen nothing thee aboue god alone truly wote wel ilk jewel manner euen line degree thou art thy ſelue nought aboue ſaue thus angel vpon angel man vpon man deuil vpon deuil han maner souerainty ſhal ceaſe y• day dome ſo ſay though thou put ſerue thilk jewel thy life yet ſeruage vnderputting maner travailing pleaſance conquere get thou haſt ſet hardeſt ſeruice thou deydeſt ſorrow wanting thy deſires truly heauenly body one voice ſhul come make melody thy comming ſay welcome fere worthy enter iupiters joy thou might haſt ouercome death thou wouldeſt neuer flit thy ſeruice ſhul pray god row row make thilke margarite routh perſon vnkindly without comfort let thee dye ſhall beſet ſelf ſoch wiſe yearth part vengeaunce ſhall ſhe joy haue loues ſeruice ſhe dedde ſhall ſoul brought vp thy preſence whider thou wilt cheſe thilke ſoule ſhall committed el thy death anone foreſaid heauenly body one accorde ſhall nommen thilke perle vertues firſte taken ſhe hath hem forfeyted y• thee ſeruaunt thy liue ſhe would ſuffer worche vertues withdrawen might high body ſhouldeſt thou wene ſo thee liſte looke vpon law kind order ordayned ſoothly none age none ouertourning time hitherto time ne power chaunge wedding ne knotte vnbinde two hertes one aſſent preſence togither accorden enduren till death hem depart troweſt thou euery ideot wot meaning priuy entent theſe thing wene forſoth ſoche accorde may y• roſe maidenhede plucked way way know nothing conſente two hertes alone maketh faſtning ye knot neither law kind ne man low determineth neither y• age ne quality perſons onely accord thilke tway truely time ſuch accorde conſent herte enſealed put treſory amongs priuy thing ginneth name ſpouſaile although breken forward bothe yet ſoch matter enſealed kept remembrance euer ſee ſpouſes haue name anon accord though roſe take aungell bad ioſeph take mary ſpouſe egypt wend lo ſhe cleped ſpouſe yet toforne ne neither hem meant fleſhly luſt know wherfore y• word trouth accorden y• ſeruants ſhoulden forſake father mother adherand ſpouſe two unity one fleſh ſhoulden accorde wiſe two werne firſt little manner diſaccordaunt higher one lower made euenliche gree ſtonde enforme thee y• ye liche goddes theſe clerkes ſain determinacion ſhewen three thing hauen name goddes cleped y• ſaine man deuil image yet one god goodneſſe grace vertue commeth louing true euerlaſting prime cauſe al thing men goddes louing true euerlaſting adoption euerlaſting god deuils goddes ſtirring manner liuing neither true ne euerlaſting name godlihed han vſurpacion prophet ſaieth al goddes gentile ſay painims diuels image goddes nuncupacion neither liuing ne true ne euerlaſting theſe word clepen god image wrought men hand reaſonable creature adoption alone art y• great god euerlaſting therby thou art good cleped let thy father maners ſo entre thy wit yt thou might follow much longeth thee thy father worſhip ſo nothing thy kind decline ne nobley pouerty thus wiſe thou werche thou art aboue thing ſaue ood alone ſay thine herte ſerue hie place fvlly haue declared thine eſtate good ſo thou follow thereafter objection firſt thee alleged worthineſſe thy margarite ſhall thee let ſhall thee increaſe thee declare laſt objection nothing may greue yes certes qd greue let muſt need contrary may beene proued ſee nowe glorious worldly welfulneſſe ſoch goodes wealth maken men riche tho draw compaignies loo priſe name yeuen tho loureden blaſours tho curreiden gloſours tho welcomeden flatteres tho worſhipped thilke deinen looke euery wight ſoch yearthly weale habundaunt hold noble precious benigne wiſe wt ſhall degree menne ſet ſoth yt contrary tho thinges ne neuer ſo well behaue hath vertue habundant manifold maners wealthed ſoch yearthly goodes hold fool ſaid wit ſotted lo falſe euer hold true lo trew cleaped falſe wanting goodes alſo lady dignitees office maken men mikell commended thus ſo good pere ſhould men find truely trowe ſome ſoche ſo praiſed one ſhould make ſo know ſhould wiſe looked onely fool wel wot deſiren ſoch new thing wherefore wonder thilke gouernour alone cauſes proceden gouerneth thing hath ordeined world werkes kindly body ſo gouerned vnſtedfaſt happious thing rule reaſon ſhewen courſe certain thing ſuffreth ſuch ſliding chaunges miſturnen ſoch noble thing men arne faire perſel yearth holden vppereſt degree vnder god benigne thing ye ſaiden right ſelfe ſhoulde neuer man haue ſet ſo worthy place degree ordained noble ala thou knitteſt purueighaunce thing lookeſt thou amenden theſe default ſee ſhrewes han wicked maners ſiten chair dome lambes puniſhen woolues ſhould puniſhed lo vertue ſhined naturelly pouerty lurketh hid vnder cloude moon falſe forſworn know ſelf auer yeftes hath vſurped ſhine day light peynture men prayſings truly thilke forged light foully ſhould fade trouth away colour feyned thus night tourned day day night winter sommer sommer winter deed miſcleapyng fooliſh people qd ſhe weneſt thou theſe thing feleſt thou thine hert governaunce commeth certes qd wote never fortune hath graunt abode lede end men liketh ah ſee qd ſhe entent thy meaning lo bycauſe thy worldly good fullich diſpent thou berafte dignity office thou madeſt thy gathering thilke goodes yet diddeſt office counſayle wiſe thyng ended true unto hem whoſe profite thou ſhouldeſt looke ſeeſt many ilke herueſt made thee mokell gloſing deyneth thee nought forther enhaunſen fals ſhrewes witneſſing truth theſe thinges greeveth thine herte ſeene thy ſelf thus abated frailty mankind ne ſetteth litle leſers ſoch recheſſe never ſo moche vertue ſo thou weneſt thy iewell renne diſpite accepted grace ſhall thee nothing hinder qd ſhe firſt thou woſte well thou loſteſt nothing ever mighteſt thou challenge thyne nature brought thee forth come thou naked thy mother womb thou haddeſt richeſſe thou ſhalte enter ende every fleſhly body ſhalt thou thee every richeſſe thou haſte time thy living ni leant thou might therein chalenge property ſee every thing man may therewith liketh yeue keep richeſſe thou playneſt thee loſt thy might ſtretched ſo ferforth faine thou wouldes hem kept multiplied mo ſo ayenſt thy departed thee wherefore never thine thou laudeſt joyeſt wight ſtuffed ſoche maner richeſſe thou art beleeve beguiled thou weneſt thilk joy ſelineſſe el eaſe hath loſt ſoche hap unſeily ye forſoth qd well qd ſhe woll prove unſely wiſe praiſe ſo tother contrary lacked ſo qd unſely qd ſhe begileth ſheweth entent working et è contra selineſſe begileth proſperity ſhee maketh jape blindneſſe ſhe windeth make ſorow ſhe withdraweth wolte thou qd ſhe praiſe better ſheweth thee hert tho bitande word diſpitous gloſeth thinketh abſence thee many harmes certes qd one commend lack diſpiſe ha qd ſhe right ſo eaſe laſteth gloſeth flattereth lightly voideth ſhe moſt pleaſantly ſheweth ever abſence ſhe dothee tene ſorow hert unſely betande chere ſheweth ſhe ſo doth wherefore unſely doth beguile selineſſe diſceiveth unſely put away doubt one maketh men blind openeth iyen ſhewyng wretchedneſſe one ful drede leſe owne ſober maketh men diſcharged mokel heavineſſe burthen one draweth man good haleth vertue hooke thought weneſt thou thy diſeaſe hath done thee mokell winne ever yet thou loſteſt ever contrary made thee winne great good thy thinking know y• heart thy ſoothfaſt freends parde proved full true diſcevered falſe truely goyng thilke brotell joye yede away ilke thyne proper never y• lightly departed thine owne good therfore leaveth ſtill thee good qd ſhe moch wouldeſt thou ſometime bought knowyng thy frende flattering fly gloſed thou thought thy ſelfe ſely thou y• plaineſt loſſe richeſſe haſte founden y• moſt dere worthy thing thou cleapeſt vnſely hath made moche thing winnen alſo concluſioun frende nowe leaveth heart thine help margarite denieth ſuffre vertues ſhine thee wardes ſpreading beam farre farther thou ſely worldly joy trewly ſay el ſhe ſome deale blame ah peace qd ſpeak mine heart breaketh thou toucheſt ſoche wordes well qd ſhe let v ſingen thou hereſt theſe thing tyme ¶thus endeth firſt booke teſtament love hereafter foloweth ſecond wealth may founden world well ſeene lo moſte comforte wende moſte ſuppoſed full aunſwere contrary thoughtes ſuddainly vaniſhed workes man faren ſame wiſe folke wenen beſt entent willes perfourme anon chaunging lift ſide right halve torneth ſo cleane another kind never ſhall come firſt plite wrongfull ſteering ſo ſoone otherwiſed knowing purpoſe beginning ſo dureth yet failed wolden maiſtries haue thilk ſtounds heauen high aboue saturn ſphere ſeaſonable time lodged come queint counſailours houſe woll ſuffre ſojourn whereof pitee yet ſain ſome haue celler wine ſhet
