maker light winking thine eye ſun queint woſt right well true name never thus herberowed sometime toforn ſun ſeuenth party ſmiten bare croſſe mitre yeue would pope went foot tho worſhipped al holy church king baden crown holden law ſet ſhuld fore judg wel poor durſt ſhew grefe rich money defended tho tailages ready poor pay made great feaſts time noble ſongs maried damoſels gentill feture withouten gold richeſſe poor clerk wit ſchool ſet church made ſoch perſons preach tho ſeruice holy church honeſt deuout pleaſaunce god people leud ſimony auaunted ſhendeth holy church ſteward achates courtior debate eſchetour wrong loſel ſongs perſoner prouendre alone many thrifty ſhould encreaſe yet ſhrew bebind free hert forſake loſengeour take lo accordeth ſuch voluntary luſts haunten court ribaudry till midnight woll play wake church matins behind euill diſpoſicion ſtomake therefore ſhuld eat bean bred ſo ſire eſtate therewith ſtrengthen alter broke low lithe point gone y• yearth horſe muſt eaſie hie hear ouer great water chalice poor hath rich cup towayl ſheet god ſhall handled meat borde ſhall borde clothes towelles many pair maſſe ſerueth clergion fiue ſquiers hall poor chauncel open hole euery ſide bed ſilk tapites going chambre poor maſſe book leud chapelain broken surplice many hole good hound many hunt hart hare feed feeſts poor men haue great care euer craue nothing offren wolden haue hem doluen among legyſtres dare come ſain maken hem needy ne wold nothing haue town tort forth naught worth haw pleaſen men thilk greeuous torcious might theſe thing toforn ſaid mow well men liſt ryme trewly accord nothing moch thing ſhulden right ben gouerned ſory ſee y• gouernance faileth thus ſeen ſmal low gouern hie body aboue certes poliſie nought forbode gouernance treaten enformen right beaſtly wit ſhould ſubject reaſon ſo earthly power ſelf lower ſhould ſubject hier worth thy body gouerned thy ſoul right ſo litel nought worth earthly power regnatife prudence heed gouern ſmal heed ſmal owen obey ſuffre gouernance ſoueraigneſſe ayenward ſhould think wiſe ſeruant theſe creature deliuered lord defendor maiſter enformer poſſeſſor poſſeſſion hem lich tree ſparows ſhullen ſtelen birdes nouriſh foorth bring vnder ſuerty ayenſt reueinous foul beaſts tyrant themſelf ſmal reſt quiet heed well diſpoſed owen ſouerains health proſperite pray doings maintenance thereof perform withouten adminiſtracion rule manner gouernance wit haue hem grace come ſoch thing yet ſhould ceaſe till heed cleaped although profit pleaſance ſhould follow trewly gouernance ne medling ought claim ne heed hem put trewly amongs coſinage dare come richeſſe mean ſoothly ſhe bodily good maketh nigh coſinage neuer propinquite ne aliance liue ne ſhould haue nere medling maners wherefore kindly leged pouert kinred behind richeſſe ſuffreth paſſe truly ſaith come never iaphets child whereof ſory iaphets child pouert linage ben rekened cain child rich maked iaphets heir ala wonder change bitween tho two no child ſithen iaphets offſpring comden knight cain diſcended line ſeruage brother child lo gentileſſe ſeruage coſins diſcended two brethern one body wherfore ſay ſoothnes gentileſſe kinrede maken gentil linage ſucceſſion without deſert man ſelf line aliſaundrie noble el hector troy diſcended right blood line fro king artour parde ſir perdicas king aliſandre made heir greece king blood dame tombiſtere kinred gentils day trow therfore good gentileſſe ſeemeth maner neceſſite input gentilmen ſhoulden varien fro y• vertues anceſters certes maner linage men ben euen lich birth one father maker goodnes enformed hem mortal folk one ſeed greyned wherto auant men linage coſinage eld father loke ginning god maker man perſon clerk ne worthy gentileſſe noriſheth corare vice vnreſonable luſts leaueth kind courſe end brought forth birth trewly vngentil among clerk may nempned therfore y• woll gentil mote daunten fleſh fro vice y• cauſen vngentilnes leaue alſo reign wicked luſts draw vertue place gentilnes gentilmen maketh ſo ſpeak feminine gendre general tho perſons reuerence one euery wight honoureth bounty noblenes ymade god ſo dere moder ſhe became ſhe hath ſo great worſhip y• nill nothing open declare thing ayenſt ſect may ſo wene vertue worthines pleſaunce hem haboundeth although would thing ſpeak truly may find yuell hem maner mater right theſe word ſhe ſtint lamentable melody gan liuely heart pray liking vnto noble grace ſhe would deyn declare mater firſte begonne ſhe lefte ſtinte ſpeake beforne ſhe ganne ſinge qd ſhe newe thing ſeene men deſiren mater ſelfe cauſed void ah good lady qd victory ſtrength proued aboue thing judgement esdram whoſe lordſhip ligne right emperour hem commaundeth whether thilke woman whoſe likeneſſe ye aperen right man halte principalite thing vnder maſculine gender gender maſculine feminine remnant gender grace faculty grammer right ſo feminine woman holden vppereſt degree thing vnder thilk gender contained bringeth forth king lord ſee yearth people woman born nouriſh hem raffen vine maken men comfort glad cheres ſorrow death man heart without woman men impoſſible con ſweetneſſe cruel hert rauiſh make meek buxome benigne without violence meuing beauty eyen el manere fetures men deſires ye gold precious ſtones either richeſſe degree lady ſelf many heart men haue ſo bounden parfit bliſſe womankind men wenen nothing el alſo lady goodneſſe vertue woman property diſcretion ſo well knowen littelneſſe malice deſire good asker way con warn ye woll paſſe kind werching ſects general diſcrecion wot well y woll ſo encline prayer grace requeſt ſhall fully granted certes qd ſhe thus part fareth mankind pray cry woman grace fain many fantaſies make herts encline deſires theſe ſely woman freely kind beleuen word wenen goſpell promiſe beheſts grant herts full fillen luſts liberty maiſterſhip toforn thralled ſo maked soueraine praid firſt ſeruant voice prayer vſed anon filled luſt many ſo trewe littel hede take ye ſoch kindneſſe traiſoun anon ye think hem beguile ſet light thing firſt ye maked wonder dere ſo thing woman loue wight ere ſhe well know haue proued many half euery glittering thing gold vnder colour fair ſpeach many vice may hid concealed therefore rede wight truſt rathe men chere ſpeach right guileful ful oft wherefore without good aſſay worth many truſt truly right kindly euery man y• thinketh woman betray ſhewen outward goodneſſe till haue performed lo bird beguiled y• mery voice foulers whiſtell woman cloſed net woll ye cauſes finden bear vnkindneſſe hand falſety vpon put malicious traiſon ſoch thing excuſe lo han woman none wreche vengeance blober wepe till hem liſt ſtint ſorily miſhap complain put wening y• men ſo vntrew often haue men changed loues litel el failing wil place hem ſet frendſhip ſhal one fame another liſt haue third delite el loſt pack clothes fair nay god wot may nat tel thouſand part y• wrong trechery ſoch falſe people make neuer ſo good bond ſet ye mite hert tourneth wenen ſorrow dey y• pite falſe hert flow town ala therefore y• euer woman wold take wight grace till ſhe know y• full ſhe might aſſays truſt woman con craft queint knowing vnderſtand y• falſe diſceiuable conjectments man beguilings lo fareth though ye men gronen crien certes diſceit y• preueth well thends werking many woman haue lorn ſhame foul ſhent long laſting time thorow men gile haue diſceiued euer fame ſhall dure deed rad ſong many londs han done recoueren ſhall neuer alway deemed lightly ſuch plite ayen ſhould fall ſlanders tenes ye falſe men wicked cauſes right ought theſe ſhames theſe reproues holy diſcend thus arn ye nigh vntrew fair ſpeche hert ful fickel cauſe han ye woman diſpiſe better fruit ne ſweter ſpices behoue mow ye find far worldly body ſtretchen loke forming making perſons god joy paradice goodneſſe man propre body maked ſaws bible rehearſing god word wiſe good mankind make helper lo paradiſe help tree graffed linage man diſcendeth man noble fruit noble fruit ſprongen bliſſe paradiſe men ſory herts yet tree abideth noble help theſe tree gentil jewel ben worſhipped euery good creature hem anoieth doth ſhame comfortable perl ayenſt al tenes euery company mirthed preſent truly wiſt neuer vertue woman therof y• root heauen y• worſe tho sarazins lien faith vntrue tho renogates maken theron leaſings y• fire doth wight bren blame wit put himſelf ſo far y• heat fire gentilleſt moſt element comfortable amongs fire cheef werker forthering ſuſtenance mankind ſhall fire blamed brend fool naturally ſtultie wit ſtering ah wicked fool proper mallice ſhrewdneſſe ſelf ye blame diſpiſe precious thing kind thing among moſt ye deſiren trewly nero child ſhrews y• diſpiſen ſo dame wickedneſſe giling men diſclaundring thilke moſt hath hem gladded pleaſed impoſſible write nempne neuer later yet ſay knoweth way may lightly paſſe eke hearb proued may ſafely ſmertande ſores laid ſo ſay proued nothing ſoch euils geſſe theſe thing haue reherſed warne woman one lightly without good aſſay ye aſſenten man ſpeach sun day light knowen moon ſhineth y• night thee thy ſelf qd ſhe haue oft ſaid know well thine hert thou art none tofore nempned people know well continuance thy ſeruice y• neuer ſithen ſet thee werk might thy margarite pleaſance freendſhip ne fairehede none point moued thine hert wherefore mine houſhold haſtely woll thou entre parfite priuite werking make know thy vnderſtanding one priuy familiers thou deſireſt qd ſhe fain hear tho thing left ye forſooth qd great bliſſe qd ſhe thou ſhalt wene woman condicions fair ſpech ſuch thing belongeth thou ſhalt qd ſhe vnderſtand firſt among thing cure ſeruice parfite bliſſe deſired euery man herte neuer ſo moche wretche euery man trauaileth diuers ſtudy ſeeke thilke bliſſe diuers way endes knitte ſelineſſe deſire parfite bliſſe ſoch joy men haue gotten liueth thing coueited y• deſire ſoch perfection ſeruice kindly ſet louers herts yet erronious opinion miſturn falſeneſſe wening although men vnderſtanding miſturned know ſhoulde beene way vnto perſon whither abideth yet wote loue euery wight weneth thing coueiteth moſt ſhould come thilk loue parfite bliſſe ſeruants full bliſſe may lack thing bliſſe ſide eke followeth muſt haue full bliſſe lack bliſſe loue ſide therefore lady qd tho thilk bliſſe haue deſired ſothe forne ſelf way rich dignite power renome wening tho thrages ben thilk bliſſe ayenſt heer tourneth ſuppoſed beſt thilke bliſſe haue get come full purpoſe ſeruice ſodainly hindred throwen ſo fer abacke thinketh impoſſible come left woll well qd ſhe therefore haſt thou failed thou wenteſt hie way littel miſgoing ginning cauſeth mikell errour end wherefore thilk bliſſe thou failedſt hauing richeſſe ne none thother thing thou nempnedſt mowen make ſoch parfite bliſſe loue ſhall ſhew therefore worthy thilke bliſſe yet ſomewhat muſt cauſe way thilk bliſſe ergo ſome ſoch thing ſome way littel vſage openly iknow feleſt thine hert ſeruice thou art entred weneſt aught thy ſelf yet hie way bliſſe ſhall ſo ſhew thee thou ſhalt con ſay contrary good lady qd altho ſuppoſe hert yet would hear thine word ye meanen matter qd ſhe ſhall good ilke bliſſe deſired ſomedeal ye knowen altho perfitely kindly entencion leadeth thereto three maner liuings ſuch way ſhewed euery wight world haue bliſſe one ilk three way liues muſt proceede opinion great clerk arn name cleaped beaſtiallich reaſonablich vertuous manlich worldlich beaſtialich luſts delitable nothing reſtrained bridle reaſon joyeth yeueth gladneſſe hert ayenſt reaſon likened beſtiall liuing thing followeth luſts delites wherfore ſuch thing may precious bliſs maiſter vertues abide father toforne haue cleaped ſuch luſty liuings fleſh paſſions deſire innominable tofore god man determination ſuch wiſe accorden ſuch paſſions deſire ſhull ben nempned holden abſolute liuings prouings ſo liueth liuings manlich reaſonable declare matter begon make thee fully haue vnderſtanding manlich liuings holden worldlich theſe thing ſo ignorance made letter woll qd ſhe nempn theſe foreſaid way name concluſions firſt rich dignity renome power ſhull work cleaped bodily goodes hem hath great throw man truſt ſillineſs loue rich ſuffiſance haue maintained y• begon worldly cattell dignity honour reuerence hem wern vnderput maiſtry thereby obey renome glory people praiſing luſts heart without heed taking quality manner power trouth lordſhips mainteinance thing proceed forth thing long time man couetiſe commune hath ben greatly grounded come y• bliſs ſeruice truly beguiled principall muſt need fail helping mowe auail see holdeſt poor needy yes parde qd diſhonoured much folk dein reuerence ſooth qd might failen mow helpen certes qd ſeemeth men ſhould holden wretch weneſt qd ſhe little renome rather praiſings mo men ſhame forſooth qd ſhame villany coueiteth renome folke praiſe name praiſe sooth qd ſhe thou ſaiſt ſooth theſe thing followed ſuch manner wenden rich ſuffiſaunce power might dignity worſhip renome glory wherefore diſcended deceiuable wening ſeruice deceit followed thus generall thou ſuch ſo worchen failen bliſſe ye long han deſired wherefore truly life reaſon high way bliſſe think openly declare hereafter neuer latter yet little comfort thy heart ſhewing wt way thou art entred thy ſelf thy margarite may know thee ſet high way woll enform thee wiſe thou haſt failed thy firſt purpoſe becauſe thou wenteſt wrong lefteſt high way thy right ſide thus thou lookedſt worldly liuing thing thee beguiled lightly therefore little aſſay thou ſongedſt turned thy purpoſe ſhewed thee part high way tho thou abode therin death ne ferdneſſe none enemy might thee thilke way reue euer one thine heart come thilk bliſſe thou arreſted firſt time empriſoned thou wer loth change thy way thy heart thou wendeſt haue thou ſhouldeſt ruth ſeen thee miſcaried wiſt well thine ablenes ſeruice encreaſe come ſelf without mean viſit thy perſon comfort thy hert parde coming thou greatly gladded time diſeaſe care tene might moue thy hert yet glad greatly enpited continually thou haddeſt mind good auiſement thy conſcience thy king prince huge word great looked variance thy ſpeech euer thou ready ſake pleaſaunce margarite pearl many mo thy body oblige marces contraried thy ſaws ſtedfaſt way maketh ſtedfaſt heart good hope end truly woll thou well know ſee thee ſo ſet changing heart haddeſt ſeruice made thou haddeſt grace thy king foryeueneſſe mikell misdeed gracious king art thou mikell holden whoſe grace goodneſſe ſometime hereafter think enform ſhew ground moral vertue groweth brought thee werk brought grace made thy heart hardy truly haddeſt thou failed purpoſe neuer taken wiſe therefore ſay thou might well truſt come thy bliſſe ſithen thy ginning hath heard euer graciouſly thy heart deſire hath proceeded siluer fined many heat men known true ſafely men may truſt thee alway werking diſeaſes hath proued way hence forward thou thinkeſt hold good faith lady qd tho ſeemeth high way right yea forſooth qd ſhe woll diſproue thy firſt way many men wenen get thilk bliſſe much euery heart yt hath caught full loue tyed queint knitting thou ſhalt vnderſtand loue thilke foreſaid bliſſe toforn declared proouings ſhall hote knot heart well qd impoſſeſſion woll well vnderſtand alſo qd ſhe knot heart muſt ben one another know thy deſire woll thou vnderſtand theſe matter ſaid thy ſelf diſproouing thy firſt ſeruice ſtrengthening thilk thou haſt vndertake thy margarite pearl godds half qd right well feel caſe poſſible true therefore admitted togither vnderſtanden well qd ſhe theſe term look contradiction thou graunt god woll qd theſe thing woll fail graunt contradiction ſhould graunt impoſſible foul inconuenience fro thing lady iwis hereafter think keep well qd ſhe thou knoweſt euery thing cauſe wherethrough thing hath cleaped cauſed rich cauſen knotte heart thilke rich arne cauſe ilke precious thing ſentence ariſtotle euery cauſe dignity thing cauſed wherethrough followeth rich ben dignity thilke knot richeſſe arn kindly naughty bad needy ilke knot thing kindly good moſt praiſed deſired ergo thing naughty badde needy kindly vnderſtanding worthy thing kindly good moſt deſired praiſed conſequence falſe need antecedent mote ſame condition richeſſes badde naughty needy woll proue wherefore mowe cauſe ſuch thing ſo glorious good richeſſe thou haſt need haſt thou help hem keep ergo thou needeſt richeſſe need thou ſhouldeſt haue thou hem wanteſt muſt rich needy hauing maken thee needy help ſurety thy richeſſe keepen wherethrough followeth richeſſe needy euery thing cauſing euils bad naughty rich one cauſen miſeaſe another mowen euenly ſtretchen whereof commeth plee debate theft begilings rich win thing bad richeſſe arn cauſed ergo ilk richeſſe badde badneſſe need knit rich manner kindly property euery cauſe cauſed accorden ſo followeth ilk richeſſe haue ſame accordaunce badneſſe nede cauſe asketh alſo euery thing hath beeing cauſe cauſe deſtroyed y• cauſed vaniſhed ſo richeſſe cauſen loue richeſſe deſtroyed loue ſhould vaniſh ilke knot true may vaniſh going richeſſe ergo richeſſe cauſe knot many men ſaid ſetten cauſe knot richeſſe ilke knitten richeſſe nothing euill ilke perſons euer wenen richeſſe moſt woorthy make cauſe▪ ſo wene thilke rich better perſone commonly ſuche asken rather quantity quality ſuch wenen well hemſelfe conjunction life ſoul precious mikell hath richeſſe ala may holden ſuch thing precious noble neither han life ne ſoul ne ordinaunce werching limmes ſuch richeſſe woorthy gathering departing ginneth loue mennes prayſing auarice gathering maketh hated needy many help leueth poſſeſſion ſuch good ginne vaniſh entereth ſorrow tene herts bad ſtrait thilke departing maketh men tenefull ſorry gathering hem make menne needy much folk one mowen togither much therof haue good gueſt gladdeth hoſt meiny bad gueſt maketh hoſt needy afeard • ueſts going certes qd wondereth therefore common opinion thus worth hath ca • tell qd ſhe look thou opinion gold money manner rich ſhinen thy ſight whoſe thine tho haue little beauty nothing compariſon kind therefore ye ſhould ſet woorthineſſe thing lower ſelf richeſſe faireneſſe woorthineſſe thilke good ſuch preciouſneſſe hem thine thou madeſt hem ſo neuer come thee ſhull thee wherefore embraceſt thou wight good tho thine kind hath draw hem hemſelf ſooth good yearth ordained food nouriſhing thou wolt hold thee apayed ſufficeth thy kind thou ſhalt danger ſuch rich kind ſufficeth little thing taketh heed thou wolt algates ſuperfluity rich athroted thou ſhalt haſtelich annoyed el euil eaſe fairneſſe field ne habitation ne multitude meiny may rekened rich thine bad great ſclaunder villany occupier good fair matter workman hem made praiſe ſhould otherwiſe bounty counted thine ilke goodneſſe fairneſſe proper tho thing hemſelf thine ſorrow wend ne glad thee pompe pride thou hem haſt bounty beauty cometh kind thine perſon fair hauing thou haſt hem fair thou haſt hem thou haſt getten hem fairneſſe themſelf valance men deemed rich outforth wenen haue proper good themſelf ſeech ſtrange thing truly condition good wening thee miſtourned wene nobleneſſe ſelf good beauty thing parde beaſts han feeling ſouls haue ſuffiſaunce ſelf ye like god ſeken encreaſe ſuffiſance ſo excellent kind ſo low thing ye great wrong yt made ſords ouer yearthly thing ye put worthineſſe vnder number foot lower thing foul ye judge thilke rich worthineſſe put ye ſelf eſtimation vnder thilk foul thing leue ye knowing ſelf▪ ſo ye viler domb beaſt commeth ſhreud vice right ſo thilk perſons louen none euill dear worthineſſe perſon ſtraunge good ſaith adornment knot lieth ſuch thing errour perillous ſhreud wrieth much venime much wealth knot may good hath getten certes thus hath rich flickering light annoied many often throw ſhrew cometh gold precious ſtones mowen founden haue bandon weneth wight worthy haue ſuch thing alone many haſt thou know late time rich ſuppoſed ſuffiſance haue followed failed ye lady qd miſſe meddling wiſe gouerned thilk rich ſhould yea qd ſhe tho flood greatly areiſed throw hemward grauell ſand made meddling right ſea yeueth flood ſo draweth ſea ebbe pulleth ayen vnder wawe firſt throw good pile noble gouernance loue well meaning manner ſadly grounded hold thilk grauel ayen lightly mowe tourn pile ben true grauel ſand wol abide certes full warning loue ſhalt thou neuer hem get ne couer lightly ebbe ere thou beware ayen meue rich many men tenes diſeaſes w ch ſhould haue therof failed declared partly ſhewed rich ſhould knot heart neither cauſed one ne truly knot may knit trow ſtedfaſt loue though richeſſe failed el richeſſe knot heart ſuch knot falſe ſea ebbeth withdraweth grauell ſuche richeſſe voydeth thilke knotte woll vnknit wherefore truſt waye cauſe parfite beeing richeſſe ſuche knotte therefore another way muſt wee haue honour dignity wened yeuen • full knotte ye certes qd opinion ben many ſayne dignity honour reuerence cauſen herts encheinen ſo abled knit togither excellence ſouerainty ſuch degree qd ſhe dignity honour reuerence cauſen thilke knot heart knot good profitable euery cauſe cauſe cauſe thing cauſed thus good thing profitable ben dignity honour reuerence cauſed ergo accorden dignity good reuerences honour contrary mowen accorden wherefore reaſon ſhould dignity reuerence none honor accord ſhrews falſe haue beene cauſe ſhrewes many ſhreudueſſe wyth hem accorden ergo beginning argue ayenward till come laſt concluſion cauſe knot lo day eie arne ſhrewes reuerence honour dignity yes forſooth rather good followeth y• ſhrewes rather good ſhul ben cauſe knot thys contrary louers beleeue ſoth openly determined hold qd faine would heare ſuch dignity accorden ſhrewes qd ſhe woll ſhewe manyfolde wiſe ye wene qd ſhe dignity office city sunne ſhineth bright withouten cloud whyche thyng commen y• hand malicious tyraunts commeth muche harme greuaunce thereof y• wild fire though brende ſtreete certes dignity office y• werks y• occupier ſhewen mallice badneſſe perſone ſhrewes maken manifolde harmes muche people ſhamen often han rancour mallice y• gouernour ſhoulde maintained hath ſuch dignity cauſed debate rumour euils yes god wote ſuch thynges haue truſted make mennes vnderſtandyng encline many queint thyngs thou woteſt wel meane ye qd therefore dignity ſuch thyng tene ywrought ſo ayenwarde ſubſtaunce dignity chaunged relyed bryng ayen good plite doyng waye waye qd ſhe ſo betide y• ſelde y• ſuch dignity betake good mannes gouernaunce thing recken y• dignity goodneſſe parde bounty goodneſſe vſen good gouernaunce therefore commeth honour reuerence ſhould doen dignity becauſe encreaſing vertue y• occupyer ruler becauſe ſoueraignety dignity sithen dignity may vertue cauſe worthy worſhip ſuch goodneſſe dignity perſone maketh goodneſſe dignity ſhine woonder thing qd thinketh perſone dignity worthye honour goodneſſe ſo tho perſone hadneſſe maugre hath deſerued yet dignity le • eth commended let qd ſhe thou erreſt ryght foule dignity hadneſſe helper performe fello • u doyng parde kindely good property kindely vertue hadden hemſelfe ſhrewes ſhould hem neuer haue hem ſhould neuer accord water fire contrarious mowen togider aſſembled kind woll ſuffer ſuch contrary ioyne ſithen eye experience ſeen y• ſhrewes haue hem often good men ſiker mayeſt thou kindely good ſuch thing appropred parde kindly good well one ſhoulden euenlich vertue gouernaunce ben worth one faileth goodneſſe another doth contrary ſo ſheweth kindely goodneſſe dignity grounded ſame reaſon qd ſhe may made generall y• bodily good commen oft throw ſhrewes ſtrong y• hath might haue great burthen light ſwift hath ſoueraignty ronning paſſe right ſo ſhrew ſhreude thinges bad han moſt werching right phyloſophy maketh philoſophiers ſeruice maketh louers ryght ſo dignity good vertuous ſhould maken ſhrewes good tourne mallice make hem vertuous doe prooued cauſen rancour debate ergo good vtterly bad nero neuer emperor ſhould neuer dame haue ſlaine maken open priuity engendrure herodes dignity ſlewe manye child dignity king iohn would haue deſtroyed england therefore mokell wiſedome goodneſſe needeth perſon mallice dignity ſ • ily bridle good bitte areſte withdraw caſe would praunce otherwiſe ſhould truly yee yeue dignity wrongfull name cleping ſhould hete dignity monſter badneſſe mainteiner ſhrewes parde ſhine sunne neuer ſo bright bring forth heat ne ſeaſonably hearbes bring yearth ſuffer froſts cold thearth barraine ligge time compaſſe circuit ye would wonder diſpreiſe sunne moon full ſheweth light darke dimme ſight appereth make deſtruction water woll ye ſuppoſe vnder cloud clip ſome priuy thing vnknown wit cauſe ſuch contrarious clerk y• han full inſight knowing ſuch impediment enform ſooth ideots ye ye yeuen credence thilk clerk word yet dooth te • e ſeen many wretch rejoycen ſuch many planet truly little con philoſophy el lore deſire ſuch lighting planet wiſe ſhew good lady qd tell ye ye mean theſe thing lo qd ſhe dignity citty sunne moone nothing kind ſhew ſhining ſhould sunne made brenning heat loue freſed enuy men heart feeblenes ſhining heat moone vnder old cloud liuings water deſtroy lady qd ſuppoſed ſhined ſhould ye qd ſhe prooued full beauty kindly ſhining failed wherefore dignity himſeluen hath beauty faireneſſe ne driueth away vice encreaſeth ſo cauſe knot ſee good truth hold ye ſuch ſonnes woorthy reuerence dignity woorthy worſhip maketh men harm qd qd ſhe thou ſee wiſe good man goodneſſe wiſeneſſe wolt thou worſhip thereof worthy good skill qd due ſuch reuerence worſhip haue qd ſhe ſhrew ſhreudneſſe altho put forth toforne ferde yet worthy ſhreudneſſe vnworſhipped reuerence part worthy haue contrarious belongeth good skill right beſmiteth dignity thilk ſame thing ayenward ſmiteth el ſhould ſmite ouer thou woſt well qd ſhe fire euery place heateth water maketh wet kindly werking ſo yput hem ſuch thing euery kindly werking ſheweth kind though wight maior city many winter together come ſtrange place known ſhould dignity haue reuerence neither worſhip ne reuerence kindly proper dignity ſithen ſhoulden done kind ſuch reuerence ne worſhip kindly ſette dignity therein ſhewed goodneſſe dignity ſhewed prooueth goodneſſe kindly hem grounded iwis neither worſhip ne reuerence ne goodneſſe dignity done none office kind haue none ſuch property nature falſe opinion people lo ſometime thilk city wern dignity noble thou liſt hem nempne ouertourned worſhip name reuerence wherefore ſuch dignity haue kindely • er • hing worſhip reuerence hath worthyneſſe ſelf riſeth vaniſheth variaunt opinion falſe heartes vnſtable people wherfore thou deſire y• knot jewel el thou wouldeſt ſuppoſe ſhe ſhould ſet knot thee ſuch manner dignity thou weneſt beauty goodneſſe ilk ſomewhat encreaſeth goodneſſe vertue body dignity hemſelf ben good ne yeuen reuerence ne worſhip kind ſhould yeue thing way mowe haue hemſelf ſeen dignity emperor many mo mowe hemſelue keep worſhip ne reuerence little vp vnſtedfaſt heart people bounty mow yeue cloud lightly leaueth ſhining certes occupier mokell apeired ſithen ſuch doth villany may maintain wherefore thilk way knot crooked deſire come knot muſt leaue way left ſide el ſhall neuer come availeth aught qd ſhe power might maintenaunce woorthy come knot parde qd ye herts ben rauiſhed ſuch manner thing certes qd ſhe though fooles hearte thing rauiſhed yet therefore generall cauſe power ne ſiker parfite heart looked nero moſt ſhrew one thilk men rede yet power make senator iuſtices prince many land great power yes certes qd well qd ſhe yet might help himſelf diſeaſe gan fall many enſamples canſt thou remember king great noble huge power holden yet might keep hemſelue wretchedneſſe wretched king henry curtmantill ere died ſo much couer member yet one greateſt king normands offſpring moſt poſſeſſion noble thing clear power founden mighty keep himſelf truly great fool ſuch thing would ſet knot thine heart alſo power realm thilk greateſt power amongs worldly power reckened ſuch power han wretchedneſſe hemſelf followeth power feebler condition wretched wretchedneſſe ſhould ben cauſe ſuch knot euery wight hath reaſon wote well wretchedneſſe way may cauſe none ſuch knot wherefore ſuch power cauſe power haue wretchedneſſe hemſelf may right lightly preued power lacke ſide ſide power power wretchedneſſe ſo y• power emperor king el realm power prince ſtretchen wide broad yet beſides mokel folke hath commandement ne lordſhip lacketh power nonpower entreth vnder ſpringeth y• maketh hem wretch power wretchedneſſe nothing el maner hath king portion wretchedneſſe power truly ſuch power vnmighty foreuer ben drede thilke power leſing may keeped ſorrow ſo drede ſorrily prick euer herts little power whych careth feardeth ſelfe maintaine vnmighty y• wretchedneſſe entered y• feardfull wening wretch himſelf knot ymaked wretchedneſſe betweene wretch wretch thynge bewaylen wherefore knotte ſhould bewayled ſuch parfite bliſſe ſuppoſed ginning ergo power nothyng ſhould cauſe ſuch knottes wretchedneſſe kyndely property ſuch power way drede mowe eſchew ne way liue ſikerneſſe thou woſt well qd ſhe hee nought mightye woulde done hee may done ne perfourme therefore qd theſe king lord han ſuffiſaunte full men thing mowen well ben holden nughty commaundements done neuer denied fool qd ſhe wot himſelf mighty wote nought mighty yt blind might wote footh qd wote muſt need adradde leſen wote might doubt hee mote needes leſe ſo leadeth dreade vnmighty retch le • e little y• worth leſing reaſon retcheth nothing mighty power ſtrength leaſing ſhould ben withſet commeth y• leaſing may withſitte ergo thilke might leud naughty might arne ylike poſts pillar vpright ſtonden great might han beare many charge croke ſide little thyng maketh hem ouerthrow good enſample qd pillers poſtes y• haue ſeen ouerthrowed ſelfe hadden ben vnderput helpes ſo lightly fall holdeſt thou mighty hath many men armed many ſeruaunts euer adradde hem heart gaſteth hem ſometime mote feare haue commonly agaſteth ayenward werchen ſame thus warniſhed mote warniſh y• houre drede little might right leaude ſo taketh heed ſeemeth qd ſuch famulers kinges great lord ſhul great might haue although ſipher augrim haue might ſignification ſelue yet yeueth power ſignification theſe clepe helpes poſt keep falling certes qd ſhe thilke skils • eaud ſhores well grounded helpes ſhullen ſliden ſuffer charge fall myght little auayleth ſo thinketh qd y• poſte alone ſtondyng vpright vpon baſſe may lenger great burthen endure croked pillers helpes ground ſiker ſooth qd ſhe y• blinde bearing lame ginne ſtomble ſhould fall right ſo ſuch pillers ſo enuironned helpes fayling y• ground fayleth togider howe oft ſuch famulers moſt pride proſperity ben ſuddainly • uerthrown thou haſt know many moment ſo ferre ouerthrow recouer might neuer y• heauineſſe ſuch falling cometh caſe fortune mow eſchew might power ſhould ſtrength ſuch thing void weiue ſo lo whyche thing power y• tho men han ben agaſt time full hauing ſiker would weyue drede mowe little worthineſſe fie therefore ſo noughty thyng knot cauſe lo aduerſity thilke foe gloſed ſeemed friend wealth thus arne familiers foe enemy nothyng werſe ne mighty annoy familier enemy theſe thing may weiue ſo truely might worth creſſe ouer thing may withdrawe bridle fleſhlye luſtes wretched complaintes nowe thinke thy ſelfe truly mighty ſeen way lithe knot thilke people y• ſetten heart vpon ſuch might power often ben beguiled parde mighty y• may doe thing another may done ſelue men haue reat power ouer hym ouer juſtice y• deemeth men ayenward hath ben often deemed buſerus ſlewe gueſts ſlayne hercules gueſt hugeſt betraiſhed many menne collo betrayed y• ſwerd ſmiteth ſwerd ſhall ſmitten gan ſtudien theſe thyngs made countenaunce hand manner huiſht let ſeene qd ſhe thinketh ſomewhat within thy ſoule troubleth thy vnderſtanding ſay qd tho thinketh although man power haue ſuch might ouer mee haue ouer diſprooueth might perſone yet may haue power might neuer later see nowe qd ſhe thine leaudneſſe mighty may without wretchedneſſe hee vnmighty may withſitte might ouer thee woll put wretchedneſſe thou might withſitte ergo thou ſeeſt thy ſelfe followeth qd ſhe wouldeſt thou ſcorn thou ſee flye han power done harme another fly thilke haue might ne ayenturning himſelfe defend yes certes qd frayler thyng qd ſhe fleſhly body man ouer whych haue oftentime flyes yet laſſe thyng flye mokell myght greuaunce annoying withouten withſitting thi •• e mannes might ſithen thou ſeeſt thine fleſhly body kindely power fayle howe ſhould accident thyng ſurety ſubſtantiall wherfore thilke thing cleape power accident fleſhly body ſo may haue ſurety might whych wanteth ſubſtantiall body waye knot looketh aright high waye ſhould verely prooued richeſſe dignity power trew way knot rathe ſuch thing knot vnbound wherefore theſe thing rede wight truſt get good knot ſhould ſay renome people mouth ſhuld beene cauſe ſuppoſeſt thou thine heart certes qd yes trow ſlye reaſons dare ſafely ſay qd ſhe woll proue ſhrewes rathe ſhull ben knot good ayenſt kind fayne qd would hear thinketh wonder renome ſhould well knit ſhrewe good perſone renome euery degree hath auaunced yet wiſt neuer contrary ſhould renoume accorde ſhrewe may ſinke ſtomacke till heare qd ſhe haue nat ſaid always ſhrewes ſhull haue knot needeth qd reherſe wote well euery wight kindely reaſon ſhrewes knitting woll eſchewe qd ſhe good ought thilke knot haue el qd great harme qd ſhe good weiued put eſpoire knot deſired qd ala ſuch thing thinke wene heauen weepeth ſee ſuch wrong beene ſuffered yearth good ought haue wight el goodneſſe qd ſhe perſon may know outfoorth renome knower wherefore muſt renomed goodneſſe come knot muſt qd el loſt carpen soothly qd ſhe great harme good man might haue deſires ſeruice thilke knot ſhrewe weined knowen generall lacking prayſing renome ſo conſequence followeth ſhrew prayſed knit good forſake vnknit ah qd tho haue ye lady ben abouten yet wold ſee grace argument better declared good bad accorden lacking prayſing thinketh ayenſt kind nay qd ſhe ſhalte thou ſee yerne theſe element han contrarious quality kinde whych mow accord good bad quality accorde contrary quality accorden quality yearth dry water next earth wete dry wete ben contrary mowen accorde yet diſcordaunce bounde accorde cloud element ben cold right ſo eyre next water wete eke hote eyre heat contrarieth water cold thilke contrariouſly oned moyſture bee moiſt alſo fire next yearth encloſeth dry wherethrough contrarieth eyre wete • e accord hote thus theſe accordaunces diſcordaunts joyned manner accordaunce accorden connection knitting togider accord commeth manner melody right noble right ſo good bad arne contrary doings lacking prayſing good lacked prayſed ſome badde lacked prayſed ſome wherefore contrariouſly accorde lacking prayſing followeth though good neuer ſo mokell prayſed oweth ben knit bad el bad renome hath muſt taken well good oweth forſooth qd well qd ſhe renome way y• knot lo foole qd ſhe clerkes writen ſuch glory renoume glory glory thou art none thing thouſands folke great ſweller eares many one hath full great renome falſe opinion variaunt people fouler folke wrongfully beene prayſed mallice y• people guiltleſſe lacked needes ſhame followeth thereof hem y• wrong prayſeth alſo deſerts praiſed villany reproofe diſclaundreth good child qd ſhe echeth ſuch renome conſcience wiſe man y• looketh meaſureth goodnes ſleueleſſe word people ſoothfaſtneſſe conſcience god nothing faire man name eched much folkes prayſing fouler thing y• mo folke prayſen ſaid thee little beforn folke ſtraunge country nought prayſen ſuche renoume maye commen eares becauſe vnknowing obſtacles ſayed wherefore folke prayſen right foule y• renome deſireth wete leſſe folk prayſen renome enhaunce trow thank people naught worth remembraunce take ne proceedeth wiſe judgement neuer ſtedfaſt perdurable veine ſleyng winde waſteth encreaſeth truly ſuch glory ought hated gentilleſſe cleare thyng renome glorye enhaunce reckening thy linage gentilleſſe thy kinne ſeemeth gentilleſſe thy kinne prayſing renome yt come thyne aunceſtres deſerts ſo prayſing renome deſerts make clear gentileſſe mote need gentil gentle deed thou thy ſelf commeth ſuch manner gentilleſſe prayſing thy deſerts gentilleſſe thyne aunceſters forrain thee maketh thee gentle vngentle reprooued thou continueſt gentilleſſe therefore wiſe man one ſaid better thy kin ben thee gentled thou glorifie thy kin gentilleſſe haſt deſert thereof thy ſelf paſſing ye beauty fleſhly body flittyng mouable flour summer thine eyen good linx yt may ſeen thorow many ſtone wals faire foule entrailes manner hewe ſhould appear thy ſight yt foule ſight fairneſſe feebleſſe eyen kind wherefore thilke ſhould way knot thilke went knot wendeth lo prooues none theſe thyngs mowe parfitly ben vnderſtanding beene way duryng bliſſe knot concluſion theſe matter herkeneth theſe word ſummer know ye winter ſhorter courſe draweth dayes december ye moneth iune ſprings may faden followen october theſe thynges vnbounden old kind haue loſt work proper eſtate men voluntarious withſit yt heuens gouerneth thing ſuffren thinges patiently werche man wt eſtate yet would ben chaunged thus queint thyngs bliſſe deſired fruit commeth theſe ſprings ni anguis bitter although whyle ſweet may withhold haſtely depart thus day fayleth thing yt fooles wend right thus haſt thou fayled thy firſt wening yt thinketh ſayle draw courſe ſtarre de polo antartico ſhall neuer come northward ye contrary ſterre polus articus whyche thing thou take keepe thy firſt outwaye going priſon exile may cleaped ground falſed vnderneath ſo haſte thou fayled wight wene blameth hym ſtinteth miſgoyng ſeecheth ready way bliſſe thinketh qd ſhe ſufficeth ſhewing wayes dignity richeſſe renome power thou looke clearely arne wayes knot every argument lady qd tho ye han maked theſe fore nempned matter mee thinketh hem full witte conceiued ſhall god wil contrary beguyled fayne would bliſſe knot declared might feele better howe hearte myght aſſent purſue end ſeruice hath begon qd ſhe melody heuen whych clerk cleapen armony breaking voyce manner ſweet thyng kindly werching cauſeth ioy nomber recken joined reaſon wiſedome quantity proportion knitting god made thyng reaſon witte proportion melody mow ſuffice ſhew written great clerk wiſe yt earthly thing lightly ſtudy trauayle yt knowing may getten ſuch heauenly melody mokell trauayle woll bring knowing right little sweetneſſe paradice hath raviſhed ſeemeth ye ſlepten reſted diſeaſes ſo kindly heartes therein ygrounded blyſſe two heart full loue knitte may aright imagined euer contemplation ful thoughty ſtudy pleaſaunce matter brynging comforte eueriche therefore earthly thyngs mokell matter lightly commeth learning knowledge vnderſtanding nigh yee ſo nigh ye couetiſe knitting heart ſoueraign deſire hath euery wight little hearing heauenly conning mokell materiall purpoſes yearth right ſo property ſeruaunts yt ben affyched ſtering little thing deſire mokell matter laſſe conſcience bliſſe manner ſowne delicious queint voice touched dinne note none impreſſion breaking labour otherwiſe nempne wanting priuy word paradiſe terreſtre full delicious melody withouten trauayle ſown perpetuel ſeruice full joy coveited endure kind maketh heart vnderſtanding ſo ſleep otherwiſe maye nempned ne manere name likyng ſweetneſſe nat declare ſugar honey withouten wening deceite heauens planet whych thing continually kindly accordaunces foryeteth al contrarious meuings paſſyue diſeaſes may ſowne euermore thriſteth werking theſe thyngs proportion ſo well joyned vndoeth thyng badneſſe way may accompted certes qd thyng precious noble ala falſeneſſe euer wantruſt ſhould euer mainteined joy void ala y• euer wretch ſhould thorow wrath enuy jangling dare make ſhoue melody ſo far aback y• openly dare vſed truely wretch fulfilled enuy wrath wyght el flebring tale ſuch wretch dare appear openly euery wight eare full mouth ſo charged mokell mallice moued many innocent ſhend god would ſoul therewith ſtrangeled lo trouth bliſſe hid ouer al vnder couert hym hideth dare nat come place waiting ſhrewes commonly badneſs goodneſs amaiſtereth ſelf ſoul joy would buy y• goodneſs much y• nobly melody qd ſhe wt goodneſs may accompted material world truly none y• ſhalt thou vnderſtand euery thing good y• contrariaunt deſtroying euill el qd enuy wrath falſeneſſe generall qd ſhe yt wote euery man right mynd y• knot y• whych haue bleſſe contrariaunt diſtroyeth ſuch manner euils ergo good wt hath cauſed wight good dede find good knot cheefe cauſe needes mote good cauſeth ſo many good deed euery cauſe worthier thing cauſed more poſſeſſion thing leſſe compted king people hath poſſeſſion realme right ſo y• knot good thou might recken thing laſſe longeth oweth more cauſes worſhip tourne el rebell more defendyng voyde right ſo euery goodneſſe knot cauſe worſhip oweth tourne truely euery thyng y• hath profitably good nothyng hath profitably knot king maintayneth hem theyr power maintayne maketh miſſe amended good gouernaunce cloſeth herts ſo togider y• rancour outthreſten yt lengeſt keepeth lengeſt gladded trow qd heretikes miſſe meaning people hence forward woll maintain knotte therethrough ſhull maintayned vtterly woll tourne leaue old euill vnderſtanding knit goodneſs profer ſo fer ſeruice yt name ſeruaunts might haue jangle ſhall ceaſe thinketh hem lacketh matter alledge certes qd loue good thus tourned thou ſayeſt wollen truly perform yet ſhull abled party bliſſe haue wol yet ſhull ſervaunts werr wel ſuſteyne mine help maintenaunce end good trauaile ſhullen reward ſo meded y• endleſs joy body ſoul togider ſhullen abiden euer action bliſſe withouten poſſible corruption action perpetuell werke without trauayle euerlaſting paſſyfe withouten labour continuell plite without ceaſing coveited endure toung may tell ne heart may think leaſt poynt bliſſe god bring thider qd continueth well qd ſhe end thou myght fail though thou ſpeed yet ſhall paſſion thy martired life written radde toforne great iupiter yt god routh high hollowneſſe heauen ſit trone euer thou ſhalt forward holden among theſe heuins knight mighteſt pennaunce diſcomfited martir liuingly going gnawn bone certes qd theſe good word comfort little mine heart rejoyced merry wiſe ye qd ſhe y• heauen feeleth joy firſt heard thereof ſpeak qd wiſt ſooth diſeaſe comfort would follow bliſs ſo ye haue often declared would well ſuffer paſſion y• better cheare thoughtful ſorrow endleſs think caſt welfare yet daineth euill none heart none heed meward throw thing would greatly wayes comfort diſport weten ſelfe little ymoned ſorrows peiſen ballaunce ye weight peaſe slinges daunger ſo heauily peiſen drawe cauſes ſo high yt eyen ſemen lite right little qd ſhe heauen sky foul cloud maken dark wether great tempeſts huge maketh merry dayes ſoft ſhining ſonnes alſo year withdraweth floures beauty hearbes yearth ſame year maketh ſpringes jolity vere ſo renouel painted colour earth ſeemed gay heauen see blaſteth wawes throweth ſhippes y• liuing creature great perill hem dreden right ſo ſame ſees maketh ſmooth water golden ſayling comforteth hem noble hauen firſt ſo ferde haſt thou qd ſhe learned thy youth iupiter hath wardrobe garment joy ſorrow woſt thou ſoon woll turne thee garment care clothe thee bliſs parde ferre fro thee lo old prouerb alleadged many wiſe bale greateſt bote nie bore wherof wilt thou diſmay hope well ſerue well ſhall thee ſaue thy good bileue ye ye qd yet ſee reaſon bliſs comming wote contingent may fall another qd ſhe haue mokell done clear thine vnderſtanding void theſe errours thy mind woll proue reaſon thy wo may alway enduren euery thing kindly qd ſhe gouerned ruled ye heuenly body hauen full werching earth courſe theſe body courſe doings gouerned ruled kind thou woſt well courſe planet dayes proceeden euerich ſingular houres enterchaunged ſtoundmele ſubmitted worching naturally ſuffer whyche chaunges cometh theſe tranſitory time maketh reuoluing yeares thus ſtoundmele euery hath full might worching till ſeuen han courſe worchings poſſeſſion hour ye day y• week haue take name denomination theſe ſeuen planet lo ſunday ginneth y• firſt hour noon y• ſaturday hour ſunne ful might worching ſunday taketh name next followeth venus mercurius moon ſo saturnus iouis mar ayen sunne ſo forth xxiiii houres togider hour ginning ii day ſtant moone maiſter y• time rule munday taketh name courſe followeth day generally courſe nature theſe body changing ſtinten certain term limitted firſt kind hem gouernments elemented world proceden ſprings conſtellations engendrures y• followen kind reaſon wherefore courſe followeth ſorrowe joye kindely moten enterchaungen time ſo alway one wele alway one wo may endure thus ſeeſt thou apertly thy ſorow wele mote changed wherfore ſuch caſe better ſide euermore encline thou ſhouldeſt truly next end ſorrow anone entreth joy manner neceſſity woll ne may none betide ſo thy contigence diſproued thou hold opinion thy wit right leud wherefore full concluſion al thilk margarit thou deſireſt hath ben thee dere thy hert haſt thou ſuffered many thoughtfull diſeaſes hereafter ſhall cauſe mokell mirth joy look glad canſt thou beene ceaſe thy paſſed heavineſſe manifold joyes woll blithely thee ſpeaken thy mirth joy haue yheard thy ſorowes thy complaint mowe aught thy joy encreaſe trouth ſide ſhall nat leaued manner trauaile y• might right blithely woll helpe euer ready pleaſe thanked lady goodly manner yt worthely coud truly greatly rejoiced mine heart faire beheſts profered ſlaw yt ſhe would ordain life leſted thinketh qd ye haue right well declared way knot ſhould beene none theſe diſproovyng thing order purpoſe asketh ye ſhould ſhew way thither thilke way ſhould ſo openly may ſey high way full confuſion theſe thing thou ſhalt qd ſhe vnderſtand one three liues firſt ſaid euery creature mankind ſprongen ſo forth proceedeth theſe liues thorow name departed threee manner kind beſtiallich manlich reaſonabliche two vſed fleſhly body third ſoul beſtial among reaſonables forboden euery law euery ſeet chriſten euery wight diſpiſeth hem y• liueth luſts delites thrall bounden ſervaunt thynges ryght foule ſuch beene compted werſe men ſhall nat degree reckened ne ſuch one allowed heriticks ſaine choſen life beſtiall voluptuouſly liuen ſo firſt ſaid thee manly reaſonable liuyngs matter declare manlye life lyving fleſh el fleſhly wayes cheſe may nat bliſſe knot conquered reaſon proved wherefore reaſonable life muſt need haue ſith way knot nat firſt tway liues wherefore need mote third liue fleſh nat fleſh reaſonablich manlych rekened clerkes therefore way commeth woll blithly declare see qd ſhe theſe bodily good manlich liuings yeelden ſorrowfully ſtounds ſmertand hour ſo well remember end worchings ben thoughtfull ſorry right bee y• hath honey anone flight beginneth ſting thilke bodily good laſt mote away ſting going wherethrough entreth clean voideth bliſſe knot forſooth qd thinketh well ſerved ſhewing theſe word although little reſpect among great worthy yet fair parcel thoght y• time forthering ſuſtenaunce dured thought hauyng mokell honey mine eſtate richeſſe ſufficiauntly weiue neede dignity reuerenced worſhip power thought keep fro mine enemy ſeemed ſhine glory renome manhood asketh mean wight mine adminiſtration coud none euils ne trechery ſoth cauſe put lady ſelue weten well y• tho confederacy maked ſoveraigns na ſeruaunt yet mokell meane folke woll fullye ayenſt reaſon thilke matter mainteine maintenaunce glorien themſelf often ye hauen ſaid thereof ought nothing euill laid ward ſithen repentant tourned think neither tho thing ne none ſuch ſuſtene vtterly deſtroy without meddling maner might caſt ſweetneſſe blyſſe miſcheeuouſly ſtongen paſſed joye sorrowfully muſt bewayle liue wretch euery tho joyes turned contrary richeſſe haue pouertye dignity enpriſoned ſteede power wretchedneſſe ſuffer glory renome diſpiſed foulich hated thus hath farne fortune ſuddainly ouerthrowen wealth diſpoyled truly thinketh way entree right hard god graunt better grace ere paſſed y• way lady thought right ſweet certes qd loue liſt chide aileth thy dark dulneſſe woll clereneſſe ſharped haue many reaſons thee ſhewed ſuch bodily good failen yeue bleſſe might ſo ferre fo • th woll ſtretch shame qd ſhe ſay thou lieſt thy word thou ne haſt wiſt right theſe bodily good one commonly dwellen togither plenty hath rich kin aſhamed another linage ryght noble well know pouerty handeleth leuer vnknowe another hath theſe renome people prayſing may haue ouer hated defamed thing right foule another faire ſemely dignity faileth yt hath dignity crooked lame el miſhapen fouly diſpiſed thus partable theſe good dwellen commonly one houſhold • ilde lo wretched truſt thing y• woll accord thinketh thou clepeſt thilke plite thou ſelineſſe fortune thou ſayeſt y• ſilineſſe departed thou art wretch followeth vpon thy word euery ſoul reaſonable man way dye death endeth ſelineſſe maketh wretch needes fortune maketh end ſoules death body wretchedneſſe ſhould lyuen know many han getten bliſſe heauen death may life maken men blisful y• paſſeth yeueth wretchednes many time bliſſe life con liue ſhould wolt thou accompt fortune firſt ſhe hath done thee tene ſorrow thou looke maner glad thing ſorrowful thou maiſt nay yet namely thou ſtandeſt noble plite good ginning good forth going hereafter thou wene wretch ſuch wealth paſſed art thou well fortunate badde thinges anguis wretchednes ben paſſed art thou come firſt hoſtry life el y• world art thou ſuddaine gueſt wretched exile weneſt thyng yearth ſtable thy firſt arreſt paſſed yt brought thee mortal ſorrow ben theſe mortal thing agone ignoraunce beaſtiall wit haſte receiued reaſon knowing vertue comfort thy hert knowyng ſikerly ſeruice grounded woſt thou well ſaid death maketh end fortune ſtandeſt thou noble plite litle heed recking take thou let fortune paſſe ding el ſhe flie ſhe liſt thy liue parde man hath nothing ſo lefe life hold doth cure dilligent trauaile ſay thou art blisful fortunate ſelie thou know thy good yt thou haſt yet loued whych nothing may doubt yt ne ben worthy thy life qd good contemplation qd ſhe well vertue time comming pleſaunce thy margarite pearle haſtely thyne heart full bliſſe ſhall eaſed therefore diſmay thee fortune hate greeuouſly ayenſt thy bodily perſon ne yet great tempeſt hath ſhe ſent thee ſithen holding cable ankers thy life holden knitting ſo faſt yt thou diſcomfort thee nought time ne diſpair thee time come yeuen thee comfort hope well doyng getting double thy leſing encreaſing loue thy margarite pearle thereto hiderto thou haſt full danger ſo thou might amend yt miſſe defaultes yt ſometime thou diddeſt thy time y• ilke margarite full ſeruice lore thine heart hath continued wherefore ſhe ought much y• rather encline fro daungerous ſeat theſe thing ben yet knit y• holding anker thy liue holden mote god pray theſe thing full performed anker holdeth hope thou ſhalt ſafely eſcape thy true meaning ſeruice bring diſpite falſe meaners y• thee new haten true ſeruice thou art entered certes qd among thing asked queſtion whych way knot truely lady ſo tempt queſtions anſweres ſpeaking firſt ſeruice full purpoſe pricke hert thilk ſeruice enpriſonment alway bad naughty manner deſired ne y• getting y• knot may nothing availe wiſe gentill heart looketh vertue none bodily joyes alone becauſe toforne tho wayes ſet wot well ſelfe haue erred bliſſe failed ſo way hugely haue ron certes qd ſhe yt ſooth thou haſt miſwent eſchew yt path hence forward rede wonder truely mortall folke world ſeech theſe way outforth priued ſelf lo ye ben confounded errour folly knowing cauſe way goodneſs vertue thing thee precious thy ſelf thou ſhalt haue thy power y• thou wouldeſt neuer leſe way may taken fro thee thilke thing y• cauſe knot deth mowe reue yearthly creture thilk thing abideth thy ſelf ſoul ſo concluſion make ſuch knot thus getten abideth thing ſoul long laſt ſoul dieth neuer vertue goodneſſe euermore ſoule endureth knot perfite bliſſe ſoule bliſſe endleſſe ſhall enduren thus ſhull herts true knot eaſed thus ſhull ſoules pleaſed thus perpetually joy ſhul ſing good truth qd good beginning yeue v way qd ſhe ſayd thee long ſithen reaſonable life one three thing prooued ſoule euery ſoul reaſon hath two thing ſteryng life one vertue another y• bodily workyng ſoule maiſter ouer body manne maiſter himſelfe man maiſter ouer himſelf liueth vertue goodneſſe reaſon vertue teacheth ſoule body worching vertue togider liuen reaſonable life whiche clearkes clepen felicity liuing therein y• hie way knot theſe old philoſophers hadden knowyng diuine grace kindely reaſon alone wenden pure nature without helpe grace might haue iſhoned liuings reaſonably haue liued thinke hereafter god woll haue ſpace thilke grace leude knowyng declare leaue tyme ſaid foorth looketh wayes knot conning ſhould know way foorth ſleepeth time wherefore woll way know muſt leaue looking falſe way foorth open iyen conſcience vncloſe hearte seeſt y• hath truſt y• bodily life ſo buſie bodily woundes annoint keeping ſmert may healed yt woundes true vnderſtanding taketh heed knowing euen foorth ſleepeth ſo hard anone knowing awake ginneth priuy medicine healing true entent inwards lightly healeth conſcience well handled muſt need theſe wayes come y• ſoule ſteryng lyfe body el may man come perfite bliſſe knot thus way ſhall come knot perfite ſilineſſe y• wende haue bodily good outfoorth ye qd ſhall haue knot rich power dignity renome manner way ye qd ſhe yt ſhall ſhew thee riche yt hath ſuffiſance hath power man may amaiſtrien greate dignity haue worſhippe reuerence hath glory renome whoſe name perpetuall duryng nomber comparacion theſe thing men wenen getten foorth qd ye qd ſhe loken thing y• naught thereof ne party longe mowe gapen ſoth qd therfore qd ſhe yt ſechen gold greene tree wene gader precious ſtones emong vine laine nettes mountaynes fiſhe thinken hunt deepe sea harte hinde ſechen yearth thilke thing ſurmounteth heauen may hem ſay fooliſh ignoraunce miſledeth wandryng wretch vncouth wayes ſhullen forleten maketh hem blinde fro right pathe true way yt ſhould vſed therefore generall errour mankinde departeth thilke goodes miſſe ſeching ſhould haue hole ſought reaſon thus goeth beguiled ſought hode men haue blowe iape qd man vertuous vertue liueth hath theſe thing ſhall prouen qd ſhe power hath man let liuing vertue priſonment diſeaſe take paciently diſcomfiteth tiraunt ouer ſoule power may haue hath yt man ſo tourmented ſoche power yt nill diſcomfite ne ouercome may ſithen pacience ſoule ouercometh ouercommen soch thing may maiſtred hath neede nothyng hath ſuffiſaunce inow helpe himſelf thilke thing thus hath power ſuffiſaunce tiraunt may reue hath dignity ſette naught thynges great dignity death may maiſtry wherefore thilke power ſuffiſaunce ſo encloſed dignity reaſon renome muſt haue thilk rich ſuffiſaunce ye ſhould look thilke worſhipfull dignity ye ſhould coueit thilke power might yee ſhuld truſt thilke renome glory y• endleſſe endureth ni ſubſtaunce vertuous liuing certes qd ſothe ſo ſee well y• vertue full gripe encloſeth theſe thing wherefore ſooth may ſay trouth vertue margarite brought firſt ſeruice haue knitting jewell ſodaine longynges ne folkes ſmall wordes onely conuerſacion togider ſeeyng thentent true meanyng flouriſhing vertue pacience yt ſhe vſed nothing euill quite y• wicked leaſings falſe tongue oft haue laid haue ſey ſelfe goodly foryeueneſſe hath ſprong hert vnity accorde aboue thing ſhe deſireth good meeke maner ſuffreth many wicked tale truely lady great worſhip ſoch thing due chaſtiſement amended ye qd ſhe haue thee excuſed ſoch thing yet mow redreſſed thy margarites vertue commend well paciently ſoche annoies ſuffreth dauid king meeke ſuffred mokell hate many euill ſpeaches diſpite ne ſhame enemy deden might moue pacience hert euer one plite mercy vſed wherefore god himſelf toke reward thing thereon ſoch puniſhment let fall truly reaſon ought enſample drede manner people mirth man vengeable wrath gouernance puniſhment ought haue plato cauſe ſeruaunt ſcourge yet cleped neighbour perform himſelf would leaſt wrath maiſtred ſo might haue laid moch euermore grounded vertue ſheweth entent fro within truly wot well goodneſſe vertue thou haſt deſired ſeruice pleaſaunt well thy ſelfe thereto fully haſt profered good lady qd vertue hie way knot long haue ihandled ye forſooth qd ſhe without vertue goodly knot may gotten ah ſee qd vertue faileth ſere tree without burioning fruit alway welk ſo ſtond diſpair noble knot vertue hath manner working wide haue traveiled peace qd ſhe thy firſt way thy trauail idel touching ſecond way ſee well thy meaning thou wouldeſt conclude thou coudeſt bicauſe brought thee ſeruice euery ſervants help come bliſs ſaid beforn thou ſaideſt thy ſelf thou mighteſt holpen thou weneſt bicauſe y• vertue thee faileth bliſs perfitly without vertue may gotten thou weneſt theſe word contradiccion follow parde hardeſt haue ſervant vertuous deed thought brought thee ſeruice yet art thou ſeruant ſay thou might ſo werch vertue hereafter ſhalt thou ſeruant ſeruant accompted habit maketh monke ne wearing guilt ſpurs maketh knight neuer later comfort thine hert yet woll otherwiſe anſwer certes lady qd tho ſo ye muſt need el nigh caught ſoch cordiacle ſorrow wot well ſhould neuer haue recouered therefore pray enform el hold without recouery may long eudure till leſſon learned miſchief remedy knowen qd ſhe wrothe man liue may come precious thing long coveited ſometime ſuffre tenefull diſeaſes weneſt thy ſelf vnlich may ſorrow thing getten hath joy ilk thing afterwards kepe fareth child schole learning arn beaten leſſon foryetten commonly good diſciplining yerde keep right well doctrine schole right theſe woords lady threw vp mine iyen ſee countenaunce cheare ſhe apperceiuing fantaſie mine hert gan ſemblaunt goodly caſt ſaid wiſe well know reaſon experience euery actiue woorcheth paſſiue togither actiue paſſiue icleaped theſe philoſophers fire place chafing thing able chafed heat ilk thing ſette ſoche diſtaunce one may werche ſhall ſuffre ilk margarite thou deſireſt full vertue able actiue goodneſſe euery hearb ſheweth vertue outfoorth within sunne yeueth light thing may ſey euery fire heateth like thing neighed able heat vertue margarit outforth wrethe nothing able ſuffer woorching woorke catche actife paſſife ſame actife paſſife vertues margarite thee donet find ſo vertue muſt need thee werche place euer thou within diſtaunce woorthineſſe paſſife thou art cloſed vertue may thee nothing profit thy deſire perfourmed thy ſorrows ceaſed ergo werching vertue thou ſhalt eaſely holpen driven care welcome long thee deſired lady qd good leſſon ginning joy wete ye well forſooth though ſuppoſe ſhe haue moch vertue would ſpouſale prooued may liue doubt rejoyce greatly thinking tho vertues ſo ſhewed hearde thee ſay qd ſhe beginning receiued thee firſt ferue yt thy jewell thilk margarite thou deſireſt cloſed musk blew ſhell ye forſoth qd ſo ſaid ſo wel qd ſhe euery thing kindly ſheweth ſelf jewell cloſed blew ſhell excellence colour ſheweth vertue within ſo euery wight ſhould rather look proper vertue thing forrain good thing engendered good matter commonly part followeth congelement vertue firſt matter corrupt vice proceede encreaſe good vertues eke right ſo fareth bad truly great excellence vertue linage part diſcendeth kind ſucceſſion vertues follow wherfore ſay colour euery margarite ſheweth within fineneſſe vertue kindely heauen mery weather lofte appeareth man iye colour blewe ſtedfaſtneſſe peace betokening within without margarite engendred heauenly dewe ſheweth ſelf fineneſſe colour whether engendrure maked morrow eue thus ſaith kind perle precious margarite thou ſerueſt ſheweth ſelf diſcended nobley vertue heauenlich dew nouriſhed congeled meekneſſe mother vertues werks men ſeen withouten ſignification colour ſhewed mercy pitty hert peace icloſed muskle ſo readily theſe vertues loken thing hath ſoule reduced good meane thing thus god manne reduced ſoules reaſonable ſo foorth beaſts body mow mouen place reduced man beaſts meue mouen place place ſo thilke body han feeling ſoules moue place holden loweſt degree ſoling thinges feeling ſoche reduced man mean followeth muskle mother vertues halt place meekneſſe loweſt degree diſcendeth doun heauen manner virgin engendrure arn theſe margarites engendred afterward congeled made meekeneſſe ſo low hie heauen encloſe catch therof ſo noble dew congelement margarite endleſſe vertue euerlaſting joy full veſſell grace yeuen euery creature goodly would receiue certes qd theſe thing right noble haue ere heard ſame ſaws qd ſhe thou woſt well theſe thing ſothe ye foreſothe qd full qd ſhe margarite ful vertue well proued wherefore ſome grace ſome mercy emong vertues wot right well thee ſhall diſcend ye qd yet would haue better declared vertues margarite kindly grounded ſhall ſhew thee qd ſhe thou wouldeſt learn learne qd needeth ſoche wordes ye well lady ſelf cure diligence might haue tourned counſail pleaſaunce perle thought ſtudy help deſireth worſhip thilke iewell encreaſe trauail buſineſſe ſeruice margarite glad ſomhalue leuer honour pleaſaunce good chear thorow maintained kept ſoch thing liking cauſe wealth bodily good ye could reeken would neuer god put ſelf great jeopardy would life alone rather ſhould ſuffer thilk jewell poinct blemiſhed far may ſuffre might ſtretch soch thing qd ſhe may mokell thy grace thee ſervice auance qd loue wilt thou graunt thilke margarite good good good qd tempt ye tene ſoch maner ſpeach would grant though ſhould anon die trouth fight quarel wight would counterplead ſo moch lighter qd loue proue entent ye qd yet would hear ye would proue ſhe good reaſonable skill mowe denied although know ſo doth many manifold goodneſſe vertue margarite printed yet ſome men goodneſſe ſpeaken euer word heard reaſons ſhewed ſoch euil ſpeakers lady aucthority excellence ſhullen ſtopped aſhamed han none acquaintance perſon yet mowe know vertues enformed wiſe mow ſet herts hem liſt ſeruice entree make truly begin wote well ſelf thilk jewell ſo precious pearl womanly woman kind goodneſſe vertue alſo anſwering ſhape limmes fetures ſo well poincts according nothing faileth leue kinde made great ſtudy kind perſon nothing hath foryet yt well ſeen euery good wight herte ſhe hath grace commending vertuous praiſing ala euer kind made deadly ſaue onely wot well nature forming nothing hath erred certes qd loue thou haſt well begonne ask thee queſtion generall euery thing good qd qd ſhe ſaue god euery thing made wern right good wonder qd euill thing commen place ſithen thing right good thus qd ſhe woll declare eueriche quality euery accion euery thing hath manner god god made goodneſſe badneſſe badde naught good ſomewhat therefore good one vnderſtanding may qd often han ſhrews aſſailed mokell badneſſe therein haue founden ſo ſeemeth bad ſomewhat kind thou ſhalt qd ſhe vnderſtand ſoch maner badneſſe vſed purifie wrong doer ſomewhat god made hath good badneſſe hath vtterly negatiue ſomewhat naught nothing party eſſenciall arne ſaid double wiſe theſe party ben found euery creature thing half firſt participation taking party ſo euery creature difference right euery good maner ſo good naught euery thing though good himſelf good good ordinable great goodneſſe duality clerk determiſſion founden euery creature neuer ſo ſingle onhed ye qd iſaid god ſaw euery thing making right good ſelf ſaid long time ſithen ask whether euery creature iſaid good goodnes vnformed either el formed afterward accept vtterly good ſhall ſay thee qd ſhe theſe great paſſed clerk han deuided good good alone nothing good nothing good wiſe god alſo good participacion icleaped good farre fette repreſentatiue goodly goodneſſe manifold good ſaid ſay good kind good gendre good grace good joy good kind auguſtine ſaith good peraunter thou wouldſt wete whether hemſelf bee good el others goodneſſe naturell goodneſſe euery ſubſtaunce nothing el ſubſtaunciall icleaped goodnes compariſon hath firſt goodneſſe ſo inductatife meanes firſt goodneſſe boece ſheweth thing full name good generall name kind compariſoned generally principal end god knot goodneſſe euery creature crieth god v made ſo han full appetite thilk god affection ſoch belongeth wiſe thing good great god good alone wonder thing qd ye haue many reaſons proued firſt way error miſgoing cauſe badneſſe feeble meaning y• ground ye alledged rooted whence ſoch badneſſe hath ſpringes ſithen thing thus generall good badneſſe hath ye haue declared wene thing good might firſt way good haue ended ſo goodneſſe haue commen bliſſe ſeruice deſired thing qd ſhe good participacion firſt goodneſſe goodneſſe corrupt badneſſe bad meaning maners god hath good thing good euell abſence rightful loue badneſſe nothing onely euill vſer guilt y• doer wherfore ginning world euery thing himſelf good vniuerſall wern right good iye hand fairer better body ſette kindly place y• body diſceuered euery thing kindly place kindly good doth werch y• place voided diſſolueth defouled ſelue noble god gliterand wiſe armony world ordeined purtreitures ſtoried colour medled blacke dark colour commenden golden aſſured painture euery put kindly place one beſide glittereth right ſo little fair maketh right fair glorious right ſo goodneſſe thing vertue wherfore bad ſo good pearl margarite han matter yeuen air little goodneſſe little vertue right mokell goodneſſe vertue thy margarite prooued ſhining wiſe found ſhewed ſhold euer goodneſs peace haue know vnpeace ſometime reign mokell euill wroth ſhould mercy proued treſpaſs due juſtification puniſhed therefore grace goodneſs wight found ſorrowful herts good meaning endure comforted vnite accord herts knit joy abide weneſt thou rejoyce el accompt emong ſeruants pleaſeth pallas vndoing mercury pallas knitte title law according reaſonable conſcience mercury haue grace ſuffered el weneth moon fairneſs eue sterre lo otherwhile night light moon greatly comforteth darke thought blinde vnderſtanding loue yeueth great gladneſs ſo liſt bileue ſooth tale ſhewed adew adew bliſs name entred wiſe folk worthy gentilleſſe vertue liuing yeuen full credence ſoothneſſe loue good herte good euidence experience ſheweth contrary thus mightſt thou haue full prefe thy margarites goodneſſe commendment jewel badneſſe iuelneſſe stoundmele diſeaſes yeueth ſeueral hour joy trouth qd well declared margarite good ſithen good ſhe paſſeth many goodnes vertue wherethrough maner neceſſary ſhe muſt good goodnes margarite nothing el vertue wherefore ſhe vertuous failed vertue ſide lack vertue bad nothing el ne may lack want good goodnes ſo ſhould ſhe haue ſame lack ſain bad may ſhe good good thinketh good ſo conſequence ſeemeth vertuous lack vertue haue sun know ſhine ne vertues herbes haue kinde werchyng ne vertue ſtretch goodnes profite another vertue wayes reaſon ſithen mercy pity ben moſt commended among vertues might neuer ſhewed refreſhment helpe comforte moſt need kind werking theſe vertues trewly wene ſhall vary theſe helpes fyre yeue none heat fire deemed sunne ſhyne ſunne accompted water wete y• name ſhal chaunged vertue werch goodnes doth fail contrary ye name ſhall reverſed theſe impoſſible wherefore contradictory neceſſary need muſt leue certes qd ſhe thy perſon thy mouth theſe word lien well ſaid thine vnderſtanding leued entent margarite alone ſpech concluſion theſe word theſe thynges qd ſhe liſt ſhewe openly ſhall founde matter thy ſickneſſe ſhall medecine may thy ſorrowes liſte comforte well thee amiſſe erred way walked ſo droppe good amendement dwelled theyr heartes prouerbes salomon openly teacheth ſometime innocent walked way blindneſſe darke night whome mette woman lefelly ſay ſtrumpet arayed redily purueyed turning thought vein janglings reſt impacient diſſimulacion term ſaying wiſe come dronken ſweet pappes vſe coueitous collinges thus drawen innocent oxe larder lady qd queint thing vnderſtand pray parable declare entent innocente qd ſhe ſcholer learning lore ſeching bliſſe thing day thought turning enclineth eue sonne light fayling maketh darke night conning thus darkneſſe many douts walketh blindenes vnderſtandyng ne wote wt way forſoth ſoch one may lightly begiled came loue fained clothed liuery vnlefull luſty habite ſofte ſpech mery faire honied word heretikes mi meaning people skleren wimplen errours auſten witneſſeth heretike firſt beginning man right expert reaſons ſweet word y• werkes miſcorden thus fareth fayned loue firſt werchinges thou knoweſt theſe thing trew thou haſt hem proued experience sometime doyng thine perſon thing thou haſt found matter mokell diſeaſe fained loue redily purueyed thy wittes catch tourne thy good thought trewly ſhe hath wounded conſcience many floriſhing mokell jangling word good worthe thanked gloſe glad prudence thou haſt ſo manly veined art thou moche holden y• thy kind courſe good meaning returne thy minde trow ne ſhewed thee thy margarite thou haddeſt neuer returned firſt good parfite joy euer fayned loue impacient water syloe whiche euermore floweth ſtilneſs priuy noyſe till come nygh brink ginneth ſo meaſure bolne nouelleries chaungyng ſtorms courſe euery rennyng point ſpill circuit bank thus fayned loue priuely fulleſt flowyng new ſtorms debate arayſe y• mercurius often hole vnderſtandyng knowen ſoch perillous matter yet veneriens ſo luſty ſo leude theyr wit y• ſoch thing right litell naught done fele wryten cryen fellow bliſſe joy thus one ſame errour mokel folk drawen come ſayne dronken pappes y• falla lying gloſe mowe ſouke milke health deadly venym poyſon corruption ſorrow mylke falla venym diſceite milke lying gloſe venym corrupcion lo thing commeth theſe pappes vſe coueited collinges deſire meddle falſe wordes ſote ſote falſe truely y• ſorineſſe fayned loue need theſe ſurfets ſickneſſe muſt follow thus ox thy langoryng death wert thou drawn y• ſote ſmoke hath thee defaſed euer ye deeper thou ſometime wadeſt y• ſooner thou found thee killed littell wonder y• ſide trew ſeruants faynen ne diſceyue conne ſoothly doyng open foundement endureth ye burthen neuer ſo great euer one laſteth yeueth lyfe blisfull goodneſſe laſte end though ginnings ſharp thus two contrary contrary ben effect ſo thilke margarite thou ſerueſt ſhall ſeen thee ſeruice perillous tribulacion delyuered bycauſe ſeruice new diſeaſe fallen hope amendment laſt end joy gladded wherefore kinde pure mercy grace good helpe ſhall ſhe graunt el ſhall ſo ſtraine pity ſhall ſhe ben amaiſtred remembre thine heart horrible ſometime thyne margarite thou treſpaſſeſt great wyſe ayenſt thou forfeiteſt cleape ayen thy mind know thyne owne guiltes goodneſſe thyne guiltes goodneſſe bounty mokell followyng pity found thou time wert thou goodly accepted grace plucking ſhe foryeueneſſe enclined ſtired draw thee houſe yet wendeſt thou vtterly euer haue ben refuſed well thou woſte ſithen yt ſoche ſharp diſeaſe might ſo greatly auayle wt thinkeſt thy witte ferre may wit ſtretch thou lach thy ſide woll make knotte certes thy good bering woll accorde pſauter haue found david ſeruice true holy oyle peace reſt long deſired vtterly ſhall annointed truſt well woll thee fayle lening firſt way good hert continuaunce yt ſee grounded purpoſe parfourme draweth maner conſtrayning needes muſt thine helper although mirthe taried ſhal come ſoch ſeaſon thy thought ſhall joyed would neuer god ſithen thyne hert reaſons arne aſſented openly haſte confeſſed thine amiſſe going crieſt mercy mercy followed thy bliſſe ſhall ready ywis thou ne woſt ſone good childe rede kind vertues thy margarite rehearſed ſtrength thy perſon ſhull werch comfort thee thou maiſt miſcary theſe word ſaid ſhe ſtreight length reſted ¶thus endeth ſecond book hereafter followeth third booke nombre ſain theſe clerk naturell ſome diſcrete thinges telling one two three ſo forth among nombres three determined moſt certaine wherfore nombre certain werke beſie leudenes think end parfourme enſample worlde three time deuided y• firſt cleped dematian ſay going true way tho dieden hell thy puniſhed man ſinne till grace mercy fet hem thence ended firſt time ſecond time laſteth coming merciable grace vntill end tranſitory time ſhewed y• true way fordoing y• badde ycleped time grace thing yeuen deſert yelding one benefite another onely goodneſſe ye yeuer grace thilke tyme ſo well vnderſtand ſhapen ſaued ſouled bliſſe third time ſhal gin tranſitory thing worldes han made end ſhall joy glory red body ſoule well han deſerued tyme grace thus y• heauen togither ſhull dwell perpetuelly without ymaginatife yuel halue theſe time figured tho three dayes god cloſed yearth third aroſe ſhewyng reſurrection joy bliſſe tho yt deſeruen merciable grace leude booke three matter accordaunt tho time lightely good inſeer may vnderſtande y• firſt errour miſſe goyng ſhewed ſorrowful pine puniſhed cried mercy ſecond grace good way proued fayling without deſert thilk firſt miſſe amending correction tho errours euen way bryng comforte welfare amendement wexing third joye bliſſe graunted well deſerue hath ſauour vnderſtandyng tyme grace thus joye third booke ſhall matter till end ſpeciall cauſe haue heart make proceſſe margarit pearl ſo precious gem cleere littell ſtones iewel tongue v engliſh people tourneth right name clepeth hem non certayne hidde men knowledging parfite reaſon fully declared thus ſonne ſo mokel men wenen el ye earth ſoothneſſe y• certaine quantity planet vnknowen erthly dweller yet opinion ſome men holden middle erth firſt ſpece philoſophy naturel kindely thing treaten ſheweth cauſes heauen ſtrength kindly courſe arſmetrike geometry muſike aſtronomy techeth way courſe heauens planetes sterres heauen voideth aduerſities aliche euen temperaunce diſtroyeth beſtiall liuing eaſie bearyng iuſtice rightfully judgeth judging departeth euery wight third ſpece tourneth reaſon vnderſtanding al thing ſaid ſothe diſcuſſed two thing deuided one art another rhetorique two lawes man reaſon grounded elles maintayned book loue thereafter beareth name philoſophy law muſt hereto accorden clergial diſcripcions philoſophy loue wiſedom declared law maintaynaunce peace holden theſe loue muſt need accorden therefore hem place haue touched order homely thing honeſt manner lyuing vertue rightful judgement cauſes profitable adminiſtracion communalties realm city euenhede profitably rayne nat ſinguler auantage ne priuy enuy ne ſolein purpoſe couetiſe worſhip good ben diſpoſed open rule ſhewed loue philoſophy
