philoſophy y• three ſpeces matter euer twey accordant bodily reaſon third ſoule concluſion book margarit pearle knittyng togider law three ſondry manner ſhal lykened yt ſay law right cuſtom woll declare law commeth god ordinaunce kindely worchyng thilke thing ordayned man wittes arne icleped right ordayned many maners conſtitution written cuſtome thing y• • cepted right law law right faylen difference whether come scripture reaſon wherefore ſheweth law kindly governaunce right commeth mannes probable reaſon cuſtome commen vſage length time vſed cuſtom nat write vſage writte conſtitution iwritten ycleped law kinde commen euery nation conjunction man woman loue ſucceſſion child heritaunce reſtitucion thing ſtrength taken leant lawe among halte ſouerayneſt gree wurſhip lawe beganne y• beginnyng reaſonable creature varied yet neuer chaunging time cauſe forſooth ordainyng law conſtrain men hardines peace withdrawing yuell turning malice goodneſſe y• innocence ſikerly withouten teneful anoy among ſhrews ſafely might inhabite protection ſafe conduct ſo ſhrewes harm harm brydle feardeneſſe ſhoulden reſtrayn forſothe kindely lawe nothing commended ſoche god hath confirmed ne nothing denied contraryouſtie god heauen eke lawes cuſtome el conſtitution vſage writing yt contrarien law kinde vtterly repugnant aduerſary god heauen trewly lawe kinde goddes luſty verily mayntaine vnder law vnworthy profeſſe reguler arn obediencer bounden margarit pearl knot loues ſtatutes ſtabliſhment kind y• goodly may ben withſetten lo vnder bonde conſtrained abide man vnder liuyng lawe ruled yt law oweth deſertes rewarded paine mede mercy weiue pain ſo parte reaſonfully may ſey mercy right lawe paſſeth thentent theſe matter leſt cleere vnderſtanding weten end third boke ful knowyng thorow god grace thinke make neuerthelater yet theſe thing han good ſleght inſeer ſouke hony hard ſtone oyle y• dry rock may lightly feele nobly matter leude imaginacion cloſed booke ſhal joy ſaid ſo ferre ſet fro thilke place fro whens gladneſs ſhould come corde ſhort let boket ought catch y• water men abouten corde ech many full purpoſe ready ſhorter make encloſe thenter y• boket joy nothing ſhould catch empty returne carefull ſorrowes encreaſe die payne y• gladneſſe heart good lord ſend water cop theſe mountain ſhall drink thereof thruſtes ſtanch ſey theſe comfortable welles health goodnes ſauiour holpen yet ſay houſe joy opened dare ſorrowful gooſt matter gladneſs thynken trete euer ſobbings complaint ready refrete meditacions werbles manyfold ſtoundes comming therefore maner joy coude endite yet dore ſhall knock y• key dauid would ye lock unſhyt bring childrens tonges openeth cloſeth whoſe ſpirite well worcheth departing goodly liketh god laude reuerence profite ye reader amendment maners ye herers encreaſing worſhip among loues ſeruaunts releuing hert grace jewel frendſhip pleaſance pearle ſtered making nothing el good thing men likyng ſcripture found thanketh ye maiſter grace y• good authour principal doer thing inſufficient el miſlikyng y• y• lewdneſs mine vnable conning body diſeaſe annoyeth vnderſtanding ſoule diſeſely habitation leteth wit many thinges namely ſorow cuſtome neuer later loue long tyme ſeruice termes thinke purſue beene liuely yeue vnderſtanding thinges nowe enforme thee margarites goodneſs may halfe prayſe wherefore ſhe book book worthy commended tho book leude right thinges nat place place thing ought deſired prayſed qd loue truely thy word haue well vnderſtond certes thinketh hem right good wondreth thou ſo lightly paſſeſt law sothly qd wit leude right blind mater deepe ſhuld haue waded lightly might haue drenched ſpilt ſelf yea qd ſhe ſhal help thee ſwim right law puniſheth brekers precept contrary doer ye writen conſtitucions right ſo ayenward law rewardeth yeueth mede hem law ſtrengthen one law rebel puniſhed innocent mede ye ſhrew empriſoned rightful corowned ſame law joyneth wedlock without forſaking y• ſame law yeueth libel departicion bycauſe deuorſe deemed declared ye ye qd find law mede reward goodnes gilty deſerts fool qd ſhe gilty conuerted law mykel merite deſerueth alſo pauly rome corowned yt y• mainteiners pompeus known diſtroyed yet toforn paulin chiefe pompeus counſaile law rome hath yet name meſuring mede ye bewraying y• conſpiracy ordained tho ſenatours ye death iulius ceſar accompted catons rightwiſneſſe euer trouth floriſheth name among ye knower reaſon perdicas crowned y• heritage alexander great telling priuy hate y• king porrus alexander wherefore euery wight reaſon law rightwiſenes apertly mede may chalenge ſo thou y• maintaineſt law kind therefore diſeaſe haſt ſuffred y• law reward worthy rewarded ordayned apertly thy mede might thou chalenge certes qd haue well lerned euer henceforward ſhal draw thereafter one hed abide law maintain kepe ſo hope beſt entre grace well deſeruing worſhip wight without needful compulſion ought medefully rewarded truly qd loue ſoth tho conſtitucion good ſeruice profite auauntage ſtretch vtterly many men demen haue deſert mede good wil nat compelled se qd may men holden contrary wt good ſeruice wold queſtion declared ſhall ſay thee qd ſhe word reſonable working pleſaunce profite thy ſoueraine ſhuld perform qd right wel qd ſhe litell hardly qd ſhe vnderſtand right mater due ouerchaungings followeth perfection form right ſo euery man rightfull werkings ought follow y• lefull deſires heart ſee toforne wt end deſerueth many time y• loketh thendes vtterly thereof vnknown befalleth often many yuels done wherethrough er ware ſhamefully confounded thende thereof neden looked euery deſire ſuch foreſight good ſeruice three thing ſpecially needeth ruler work firſt y• good next yt election hert third godly withouten ſurquedry thought werkes ſhulden good ſeruice act authorites many may alledged neuer latter reaſon thus may ſhewed work cleped ſecond mouen vertue ye firſt wercher good work wrought proceed right ſo werks mouen vertue y• laſt end right y• firſt working nat man ſhould y• ſecond werch right ſo ye feled wt end ſen goodneſſe cloſed ye ſhould retch wt ye wrought ye ginning gan good ſhall ceafe laſt end well conſidred wherfore y• midle way draw accordaunt thends ſtinteth courſe good another manner courſe entreth ſo party ſelue euery part accordaunt foule ought eſchewed wherefore euery thing y• wrought nat good nat accordaunt thendes hole foul ought withdraw thus perſons neither done good ne harme ſhamen foule making wherefore without working good act good ſeruice may man bene accepted trewlye thlike han might good done crown worſhip ſhal take hem ſhame ſhul anulled ſo make one werke accordaunt endes euery good ſeruaunt reaſon conſequence muſt good need certes ſuffiſeth alone good goodly withal follows y• thank goodnes el nought deſerueth right beyng come greateſt good goodneſs cloſed right ſo end direct y• ſame good ariſtotel determineth y• end good one conuertible vnderſtanding y• wil doth away good y• loketh thend loketh good y• doth good doth goodly draweth away thy direction end goodly muſt need bad lo bad nothing el abſence negatiue good darkneſſe abſence negatiue light doth goodly directeth thilke good thend badde muſt thing good follow eke badnes ſuch folk oft followeth thus contrariaunt worker thend good worthy y• contrary thend good haue qd may good deed done goodly helpe yes qd loue deuill doth many good deed goodly leueth behind euen badly deſceiuable wiſe worketh wherefore y• contrary thend followeth never ſo many good dedes bycauſe goodly away goodnes rekened lo tho man good good goodly thend goodneſſe wol folow thus good ſeruice good deed goodly done muſten joyne togider done free choyſe heart el deſerueth nat merite goodes woll proue thou thing good chaunce hap thing art thou thereof worthy commended nothing reaſon turneth thy praiſing ne lacking lo thilke thing done hap thy nat cauſed thereby ſhould thanke lack deſerue ſithen y• faileth thend y• wel ſhould reward muſt need faile clerkes ſaine man willing bleſſed good deed y• hath done done free choyſe willing without bliſſednes may nat follow ergo nether thanke goodneſſe ne ſeruice contrary y• good end ſo good ſeruice longeth good deed goodly done thorow free choiſe heart truely qd haue well vnderſtand well qd ſhe euery thing thus done ſufficient lawe cleped iuſtice reward claime law iuſtice ordained wiſe ſoch deſerts goodnes quantite mede reward neceſſite ſoch iuſtice y• ſay rightwiſenes free choiſe deſeruing well euil graunted reaſonable creature euery man hath free arbitrement choſe good iuell perform qd tho good deſerue margarit pearle thereto compelled haue free choiſe wt liketh holden thinketh reward thentent good goddes forbode el qd loue wight meneth otherwiſe trow free good hert mede deſerueth hath euery man qd fre choice neceſſary maner euery doings y• liketh god proper purueyaunce wold ſee yt well declared leud vnderſtanding neceſſary neceſſite ben word mokel intencion cloſing ſay ſo mote need otherwiſe may nat betide ſhalt thou learn qd ſhe ſo thou take hede ſpech nat man liberte free good bad y• one tied bond god preordinaunce neuer ſo well needful compulcion thilk bond free choiſe whereby nothing deſireth neuer ſo yuell man wite onelich ſoch thing ordained hem wherfore ne ought bad puniſhed ne good deed rewarded neceſſite rightwiſnes therefore free choice arbitrement put man proper diſpoſition truely otherwiſe contraried god charity y• badneſs goodneſs rewardeth deſert paine mede thinketh wonder qd god neceſſity forwote thing comming ſo mote need thilk thing yt ben done free choice comen nothing neceſſity onely wil may ſtand togider ſo thinketh truely y• free choice fully repugneth god forweting truely lady ſeemeth mowe ſtand together gan loue nigh neere noble countenance viſage limmes dreſſed nighe ſittyng place take forth qd ſhe thy penne redily write theſe word god woll ſhal hem ſo enforme thee thy leudneſs haue vnderſtand y• matter ſhall openly clered thy ſight full loking therein amended firſt thou think y• god preſcience repugne liberty arbetrie arbitrement impoſſible y• ſhould accord onehed ſoth vnderſtanding ye qd forſoth ſo conceiue well qd ſhe thilke impoſſible away repugnaunce ſeemeth therein vtterly remoued shew thabſence yt impoſſibility qd qd ſhe ſhall ſuppoſe mowe ſtande togyther preſcience god followeth neceſſity thing coming liberty arbitrement thou beleeueſt many thyngs without neceſſity theſe proporcions ſoothe qd well mow ſtand togider wherefore caſe poſſible admit truely qd ſhe caſe impoſſible ſo qd hereof qd ſhe followeth wexeth impoſſible proue qd ſhall qd ſhe ſomething comming without neceſſity god wote toforne thyng commyng wote beforne wot neceſſity commyng beforne wot caſe neceſſary maner el thorowe neceſſity ſomething without neceſſity whiderto euery wight hath good vnderſtandyng ſeene theſe thing repugnaunt preſcience god followeth neceſſity liberty arbitrement fro remoued neceſſity truly neceſſary god haue forweting thing withouten neceſſity comming ye qd yet remeue ye away fro mine vnderſtanding neceſſity following god weting thus god beforn wote ſeruice loue bounden margarite pearl therefore neceſſity thus loue bound loved neceſſity kept loue deed certes qd loue bicauſe matter good neceſſary declare think herein well abide lightly paſs thou ſhalt qd ſhe ſay god beforn wote louer louer thus god beforn wote louer without neceſſity ſo followeth whither thou loue loue euery hem ſhal thou ſeeſt impoſſibility y• caſe poſſibility thilk thou wendeſt impoſſible wherfore repugnance adnulled ye qd yet ye away ſtrength neceſſity ſaid though neceſſity loue abide loue without neceſſity god beforn wote maner neceſſity forſoth ſeemeth ſome men coaccion ſain conſtraining el prohibicion defending wherfore neceſſity loue vnderſtand conſtrained ſome priuy ſtrength ye louing loue defended loving ſo neceſſity ſeemeth loue loue el loue loue wherethrough neither thanke ne maugre tho thing may deſerue qd ſhe thou ſhalt well vnderſtand often ſain thing neceſſity ſtrength neither coacted ne conſtrained thorow neceſſity defending removed ſain thorow neceſſity god immortal nought dedlich neceſſity god rightful ſtrength violent manner conſtraineth immortal defendeth vnrightful nothing may make dedly vnrightful right ſo ſay neceſſity thee louer el none thorow god beforn wete vnderſtand thing defendeth forbit thee thy ſhall el conſtraineth ſhall ſame thing forſooth god wot beforne ſeeth thing commend onely neither conſtrained ne defended thinge ſo liberty arbitrement done truly good child theſe thing well vnderſtand wene none inconuenient ſhalt thou find goddes forweting liberty arbitrement wherefore wote well may ſtand togider alſo farthermore vnderſtanding preſcience properlich conſidereth ſame wiſe thing afore wiſt ſaid comming pronounced nothing toforne wiſt thing comming fore wetting trouth doubt may wiſt wherefore ſey god toforn wot thing neceſſity thilke thing comming one ſey ſhall neceſſity neither conſtraineth ne defendeth thing therefore ſoothly loue put ſaid neceſſity el put affirmed neceſſity neceſſity conſtraineth defendeth loue ſay loue ſhal neceſſity ſhall followeth neceſſity thing toforn put much ſay thus pronounced yt thing ſhall none thing ſignifieth neceſſity onely thus ſhall may togider euenlich alſo ſooth loue ſhall neceſſity need haue needfull coming ſhall y• ſame ſay loue paſſed loue paſſed paſſed loue preſent preſent loue preſent el loue comming loue comming comming diuerſity ſetting word maketh diuerſity vnderſtanding altho ſame ſentence accorden ſignification right one loue ſweet ſweet loue ſweet much loue bitter ſorrowfull ere heart eaſed yet gladdeth thilke ſorrowfull hert ſoch loue think forſooth qd otherwhile haue mokell bliſſe hert loue ſtoundmele hath ſorily annoied certes lady ſee ſelf thus knit margarite pearl bond ſeruice liberty heart accord ſeruice loue deemin ſelf none otherwiſe neceſſity conſtrained ſeruice abide ala needfull compulſion maugre withhold little thank great trauail haue deſerued qd lady ſay ſaid liketh matter declare full many men haue diuers fantaſies reaſons one ſide thereof right ſoon trow thou wilt vnderſtand thou ſhalt con yeue ſentence party probable reaſon ſooth knowing haue matter maked end certes qd theſe thing long haue great luſt learned yet wene god preſcience accordeth ſeruice louing precious margarite pearl euer heart thurſting deſire wete doe bren vnwaſting langour fade day deſteny death joy vnbide yet end comforted ſuppoſail bliſſe joy determine deſires thing qd loue haſtely thee neigh god grant grace mercy ſhall prayer till thou likened heart thine enform thee matter qd lady thou woſt far toforn may ſhall coming thing forſooth coming needful coming may comming ſhall comming right haue ſaid preſent future time ſame ſentence ſoothneſſe preterit ſay time paſſed thing paſſed muſt need need way may man man togither neceſſity ſay needfull thing coming coming ſome thing coming coming impoſſible right theſe term needfull neceſſity neceſſary betoken ſignifying need may otherwiſe right theſe term impoſſible ſignifieth thing way may throgh pert neceſſity al thing coming coming neceſſity followeth nothing conſtrained lo coming ſaid thing alway thing neceſſity altho coming ſay morrow loue coming margarites heart therfore neceſſity ſhall thilk loue yet may yt ſhall altho coming neuer later ſometime ſooth ſome thing neceſſity ſaid come ſay morrow coming riſing y• sun therefore neceſſity pronounce coming thing come maner loue morn coming thine margarite thee ward neceſſity comming el riſinge sunne morne comming neceſſity comming loue ſoothly may neceſſity alone following neceſſity coming made certain future future ſaid ſaine coming coming ſaid morrow coming neceſſity coming ariſing sun two neceſſities coming vnderſtand one forgoing neceſſity maketh thing therefore ſhall needful another following neceſſity nothing conſtraineth ſo neceſſity come come ſaine god beforne wote thing coming needfull coming yet therefore make certain euermore thing neceſſity comming soothly thing comming may coming way ſame ſentence vnderſtanding ſay thus god beforn wote thing needfull coming yet therefore followeth preſcience god thing neceſſity comming altho god toforn wote thing coming yet therefore beforn wote euery thing coming thorow neceſſity thing beforne wote coming free reaſonable creature certes qd theſe term need neceſſity haue queint manner vnderſtanding woulden dullen many men wit therefore qd ſhe woll hem openly declare clearly haue toforne ere depart hence matter qd ſhe thou ſhalt vnderſtand right needful god wiln y• many thing needful man wiln woll euer right needful god woll right ſo needful man woll tho thing god hath put man ſubjection willing man woll loue loue ne woll loue loue ſuch thing man diſpoſition god woll may woll man thorow neceſſity conſtrained el defended wiln woll effect follow needful man free alſo y• woll maner ſooth thorow neceſſity man werke louing woll altho woll neceſſity qd ſtant loue thilk ſithen men louen willing free choiſe heart wherefore thorow neceſſity pray lady anſwer queſtion aſſoil woll qd ſhe anſwer thee bliuely right men thorow neceſſity right ſo loue thorow neceſſity ne thorow neceſſity wrought thilk ſame would good ſhould haue wrought altho y• doth needful done man ſin nothing el yt ſhould right ſo ſin manner necſſary done neceſſary neuer y• later ſooth man woll ſin neceſſary ſin though thilk neceſſity nothing conſtrained ne defended right ſo thilk thing free woll may may wiln needfull wilne may wilne thilke wilne needfull impoſſible one thing ſame wiln may wiln thilk wiln needful impoſſible one thing ſame wiln wiln werke forſooth yeue hath woll voluntary ſpontany ſpontany ſay good conſtrained conſtrained conſtrained may together neceſſity maketh liberty aforn might haue eſchued ſhunned god knoweth truth nothing truth theſe thing arn ſpontany neceſſary ſight ſeeth ſo ben ſo theſe thing well conſidered open full without manner repugnance god beforn wote manner thing ben done free aforn might haue neuer ſhould yet thorow manner neceſſity free diſcendeth hereby may qd ſhe lightly ben know thing neceſſity though god haue hem preſcience ſome thing liberty make thee haue full knowing god beforne weting hear qd ſhe ſhall ſay blithly lady qd liſt matter entirely vnderſtand thou ſhalt qd ſhe vnderſtand yt heauen god although ouer power yet abiding diuine perſon heauen euerlaſting preſence withouten mouable time fool haue ſaid toforn time hurteth right ſo ayenward time healeth rewardeth tree oft failed hold deinty fruit forth bringeth marchaunt one leſing sea auenture thinketh ſhall neuer auenture come richeſs ſo oft muſt men oke ſmite till happy dent haue entred okes ſway maketh come one oft falleth lethy water hard rock till haue pierced euen draught wier drawer maketh wier ben euen ſupple werching ſtinted draught wier breaketh aſunder euery tree well ſpringeth wel grounded often remoued ſhall fruit qd ginneth ripe grace qd ſhe parfite joy endure therewith thou begon grace qd thinketh ſhould haue reward long trauail ſhall tell thee qd ſhe retribution thy good wils haue thy margarite pearl beareth name mede good grace cometh thy deſert thy margarites goodneſs vertue alone quod ſhould long trauail haue reward grace ſometime ſeluen ſaid rightwiſeneſs euenlich rewardeth quite one benefit another ſooth qd loue euer ſaid doth good done neither holden ne yet conſtrained ſooth qd truly qd ſhe euer thou doſt thine margarite pearl loue reaſon thou oweſt done yet nothing el yeelding thy debt quiting thy grace ſhe thee lent ye firſt met wene qd right little grace ſhe deliuered certes hard grace hath nigh aſtrangled good grace wote well thou wilt graunt ere thou depart hence man yeue another wight ought himſelf nothing may haue garment coat tho wear coat el thilk clothing put naked cauſe clothing yeuer garment wherfore ſay thou y• naked loue thy ſelf none haue mightſt put thine perſon ſithen thy loue came thy margarite pearle ergo ſhe yeuer loue although thou vſe ſent ſhe thee grace thy ſeruice begin worthy thank grace ſhe yeuer thought buſie doings pleaſaunce thy might thy word thou canſt deuiſe right little quiting thy debt ſhe ſuch thing ſtudied theſe matter kindly drawn homeward margarite pearl thence borrowed holly wit loue thou haueſt thus quiteſt thou thy debt thou ſtedfaſtly ſerueſt keep well loue thee rede thou haſt borrowed vſe ſeruice thy debt quite art thou able right ſoon haue grace wherefore mede none halue maiſt thou look thus thy ginning ending grace alone thy good deſeruing thy debt thou acquiteſt without grace nothing worth whatſoeuer thou werch thank thy margarite great grace hitherto thee hath guided pray continuance forth thy werks hereafter miſhap thy grace ouerthwartly tourn grace glory joy comming good folk deſerts getting grace therein ſhullen end glory joy wiſedom loue parfite charity god hath graunted tho well deſerue lady one ſtart mine heart woll onbide qd ſhe euer neuer woll gone hence woll keep thee medling liſt onbide thine entremeting manner ſtedfaſtneſſe ſhullen chaunged soberliche tho threwe vp mine eyen hugely tho aſtonied ſuddain aduenture faine would haue learned howe vertues ſhoulden known thinges hope god hereafter ſhe ſhall enformen namely ſithen reſting place ſo nigh anone theſe thinges lady ſaid remembred ſelf reuolued liues mine vnderſtanding wit tho found fully theſe matter perfitely written miſſe rule fained loue realm citties hath gouerned great throw lightly might fault eſpy rule loue ſhould vſed ſometime fained loue foul rightfull ſelue alſo louing woll loue woll loue louing one louing louings poſſeſſion haue right ſo woll loue loue hath party yet deny louing wiln loue haue hath would hath ſay may loue wiln loue haue thilk loue ſhuld wiln haue louing may man himſelf onely grace toforn going right ſo may man keep grace following conſider euery man aright let ſen wight himſelf mowe louing well get thereof firſt nothing haue ſhould himſelf ſpring either muſt willing willing willing himſelf may haue ſithen faileth y• matter ſhould forth bring matter faileth may thereof haue knowing till grace put heart thus willing himſelf may haue willing may haue parde euery conceit euery reaſonable creature otherwiſe grant affirmatife willing way mow accord although louing woll come mine hert freeneſſe arbitrement book fully ſhewed yet owe therfore much allow free grace margarite leaned neither might without grace toforn going afterward following thilk grace get ne keep leſe ſhall neuer free make willing otherwiſe grace hath granted right perſon taketh willing ſober throweth away willing dronk el taketh drinking meaſure thing anone done maketh guilt free y• leſeth grace thing therefore vpon nobley grace mote truſten buſie cure ſet thilke grace keep free otherwiſe reaſon ſhould werch cauſe grace void thus muſt look free grace right naturel vſage engendering child may ben without father ne alſo mother neither father ne mother begetting may lack right ſo grace free accorden without hem maye louing party getten yet free getting thing ſo mokell thank worthy grace ne keeping therof ſo much thank deſerueth yet getting keeping done accord truly oftentime grace free helpeth fordoing contrary thing y• willing loue accorden ſtrength aduerſities withſit wherfore together grace oweth accepted willing deſerueth free louing wiſe accorded remember well booke ſo heed taketh conſidereth thing werchings mankind euenly accordeth tourning word loue trouth el rightwiſeneſſe whether y• like thing rightwiſeneſſe rightfull yet therefore feel conſcience rightful behoten y• bliſſe euerlaſting hem rightful withouten vnrightfulneſſe man ſome degree may rightfully ben accompted chaſt men living yet janglers full enuy preſſed hem ſhall bliſſe neuer ben deliuered right bliſſe without maner need right ſo man ſhall yeuen rightful void maner vnrightfulneſſe found ſo man bliſſe ſhall followed rightful vnrightfulneſſe bound degree fully know rightfulneſſe much himſelf none euil cauſe manner goodneſſe truly mother helpeth ſpirit withſit leude luſts fleſhly liking ſtrengtheth mainteineth ye law kind otherwhile weneth harm precious thing follow ther nothing cauſe ſomewhat el commeth ſo taketh heed rightfulneſſe forſooth werne many holye saintes good ſauour ſweetneſſe god almighty ſome folk ſauour death deadly end come ſaints rightwiſeneſſe wicked men badneſſe hath proceeded truly thilke lady loue learned affection nempne willing profitable thing euill fleſhly luſts conſenteth ayenſt reaſon god thilk maked vicious firſt father adam eue vicious appetite vicious ſuch appetite conſenting one thing kind thing done firſt man firſt aſſented hold profitable ſhew firſt condition reaſonable creature woll conſidered apertly looked lightly cauſe ſuch may ſhewed intention god rightfully bleſſed ſhould reaſonable nature ben maked himſelf keep neither bliſfull ne rightfull might withouten rightfulneſſe thilk ſame rightfulneſſe heretoforn ſhewed bliſſe thilk bliſſe euery manne hath thilke bliſs thereof abiding bliſs euery vnderſtanding ſuffiſaunce couenable commodity without manner need whether bliſs angel el thilk grace firſt paradice ſuffered adam haue although angel bliſs adam paradice yet may denied adam paradice ne ſuffiſaunce bliſs right great heart without manner coldneſs yet may another hearte heat haue right ſo nothing defended adam paradice bliſſed without manner need although angel bliſs much forſooth followeth laſs another haue therefore needeth want thing behoueth may need cleaped adam firſt ginning god margarite weten mean forſooth need wretchedneſs god without cauſe toforn going made reaſonable creature wretched vnderſtand loue firſt maked god made therefore man bliſſed without manner indigence togither one tooke reaſonable creature bliſs bliſſedneſs rightfulneſs rightfulneſs ſelue liberty arbitrement free thilke rightfulneſs may keep leſe wiſe ordained thilke two inſtrument cleaped heretoforn mention maked ſhould vſe thilk rightfulneſſe teaching ſoul good manner gouernaunce thought word ſhould vſe bliſſe obedient manner withouten incommodity bliſſe forſooth man profit rightwiſeneſſe worſhip god deliuered one rightfulnes ſo yeven man might leſe loſt continuelly haue kept ſhould haue deſerued aduancement fellowſhip angel thing loſt neuer himſelf forward ſhould mow ayenward recouer well bliſſe angel bliſſe himwards comming ſhould nome one depriued thus fill man vnto likeneſſe vnreaſonable beaſts hem corruption vnluſts appetite vnder throwen yet bliſſe dwelleth indigence good loſt great wretchednes right ſhould ben puniſhed thus weiued rightfulnes loſt hath bliſſe fail deſire commodity may commodity reaſonable nature hath loſt may haue falſe luſts beſtial appetite tourned folly vnconning hath beguiled wening thilk commodity owen ben deſired affection liberty arbitrement enduced wiln thus thing ſhould ſo maked evil vnrightful abſence rightfulnes thing reaſon euer ſhould haue freenes arbitrement may wiln haueth thilke help keepe ſo without grace may ben recouered commodity much vnrightfull maked willing euil luſts willing goodneſſe may wiln inſtrument affection thralled ſithen thing may wiln inſtrument affection deſireth yet cleaped inſtrument woll affection wilneth affection deſireth thilk thing whereto inſtrument leadeth ſo free vnluſty affection full ſeruant maked vnrightfulnes may releeue without rightfulnes full freedom may neuer haue kindly liberty arbitrement without vein idle forſooth wherefore yet ſay often haue ſaid y• ſame inſtrument loſt hath rightfulnes manner grace may ayen retourn rightfulneſſe wiln ſithen nothing rightfulneſſe alone ſhould wiln y• euer wilneth without rightfulneſſe vnrightfully wilneth theſe vnrightful appetite vnthrifty luſts fly deſireth mokel ben kind ben bad ben • nrightf • l bad ben reaſonable creature way ſhould ſuffred vnreaſonable beaſts neither ben euil ne vnrightfull kind knowne may well ben theſe thinges toforne declared man hath alway thilke rightfulneſſe duty right euermore hauen ſhould waye himſelfe may get ne keepe hath leſe recouer ſhall neuer without eſpeciall grace wherefore commune ſentence people opinion euery thing deſtiny ruled falſe wicked beleue tho predeſtination well good bad ſithen ſaid god hadneſt made neuer ne wrought ſuffereth hem maked hardeth nought miſſayeth led temptation deliuereth wherfore none inconuenient maner ſaid god toforn haue deſtenied bad bad werks hem ne euil deed neither amendeth ne thereto hem grace leveth ſpeciallich predeſtination goodneſſe alone ſaid theſe great clerk god doth goodneſſe werchen negatife hereof badneſſe holden y• lady loue hath learned ſo aright book looketh vtterly predeſtination properly god may demed befornweting chapitre god befornweting loue rehearſed theſe matter apertly may founden thing god ben togither preſence truly preſence predeſtination nothing diſaccorden wherefore learned god weting free choice mowe ſtonden together thinketh ſame reaſon leadeth deſtiny free accorden ſo neither hem nothing contrarieth reaſonablich may deemed often thing falleth free werching man another man wrongfully annoyeth wherefore ſleeth conſtrained end mokel folk crieth ſaith lo deſtenied god toforn know ſo thorow neceſſity fall otherwiſe might betide truely neither wrong wrought ne himſelf venged none thilk thing neceſſity wrought free willed neither wrought perfourmed ſo vtterly grace free goodnes bringeth keepet • fro badnes tourneth thinge moſt thanke deſerueth grace maketh ſentence vertue abide wherfore body ſoul full plenty conning good deſeruing euerlaſting joy y• day dome ſhull endleſſe dwell ſhull ben learned kingdom ſo mokell affect loue grace y• leaſt joy ſhall greateſt glory rejoyce gladded ſame joy wonder ſith god greateſt loue thee ne ought look thing reaſoning proue ſo inſtrument yet varieth effect vſing affection alſo cleaped varieth inſtrument manner wiſe name lich commeth mind anon right willing deſired negatife thereof willing may accord cloſed hert though vſage inſtrument ſlepe ſleepeth inſtrument v waken ſuch manner affection truly ſome man hath ſome man leſſe certes trew louers wenen euer thereof little haue falſe louers little wenen haue right mokel lo inſtrument falſe true euenlich proportioned affection ſome place ſome becauſe goodneſſe followeth think hereafter declare vſe inſtrument taketh name wilned thing vtterly grace catch thy bliſſe deſired rewarded thou muſt haue affection y• full vſe time asketh wiſely governed soothly diſciple without feruent affection wil may man ſaued affection good ſeruice good loue may grounded without feruent deſire thing coueited neuer retcheth haue haue affection hath reſting place thing cometh mind taken heed commin come therfore place affection faileth thilk affection ſo little thorow goodnes ſhould come grace littlenes wil ſuffer • ail way help certes grace reaſon thilk affection followeth affection reaſon knit dureth euerich true heart euermore encreaſing feardneſſe ſtrength may remoue truth heart abideth soothly falſhede ginneth entre truth draweth away grace joy thilk falſhed truth hath thus voided hath vnknit bond vnder ſtanding reaſon hert ſo bond vndoth vnknitteth purpoſe firſt accord knitteth contrary reaſon vnreaſon lo vnreaſon bringeth man bliſſe grace thing pure kind euery man ought ſhun eſchew knot reaſon confirm thinketh qd ſhe thy ſtudient look thou weneſt theſe word contrarien ſayings heretoforn place thou ſometime affection thing han brought thee diſeaſe haue thee counſailed void thine hert diſcouer made thy wil ben changed thou weneſt argue withhold keepe shortly ſay reuers theſe word may ben found though dronkennes forboden men ſhul alway ben drinkeleſſe trow right thou thy reaſon ſhould tourn thy one reaſon ſhould vnbind ſay thy thy firſt purpoſe unreaſon cloſed conſtrue forth remnaunt thee good liketh truly reaſon ſhould bee knit together free reaſon time thine hearte aſſentaunt thou might chaunge thou rule reaſon vary whych variaunce come thilke bliſſe deſired contrariouſly thou wercheſt nothing may know reaſon loue alone thou void loue weueſt bond knitteth ſo need el right lightly gonne ſondry wherefore thou ſeeſt apertly yt loue holdeth knot amaiſtreth hem bound theſe thing ring circuit wreth ben knit thy ſoule without departing ah let let qd needeth reherſail make ſoul yet parfit blyſs thinking yt knot truly lady haue ground well vnderſtonde thing thilke ſpire yt tree ſhuld wexe expoune yt thyng ye thereof mean ſhall qd ſhe blithly take good heed ye word thee rede continuaunce thy good ſervice long proceſſe time full hope abiding without change wilne thine heart ye ſpire whych well kept gouerned ſhal ſo hugely ſpring till fruit grace plenteouſly ſprongen although thy good yet may therfore thilk bliſſe deſired haſtely thee diſcenden muſt abide ſeſonable time ſo proceſſe growing thy good travail ſhall wex till found ſo mighty wind euil ſpeech ne ſcornes enuy make nat trauail ouerthrow ne froſts miſtruſt ne hailes jelouſie right little might haue harming ſuch ſprings euery yong ſetling lightly ſmal ſtorms apeired woxen ſomdele greatneſſe han great blaſtes weather little might diſauantage hem werch mine owne ſoueraigne lady qd welth mine hert liking vnto noble grace therethrough nat diſpleaſed ſuppoſe ye erren ye maken jelouſie envy diſtourbour hem yt ben ſeruaunts haue learned oft toforn time yt euery louers hert great plenty jelouſies greeues ben ſow wherefore thinketh ye ne ought manner accompt thilk thing among theſe welked winers venomous ſerpents enuy miſtruſt euil ſpeech fool qd ſhe miſtruſt foly euil wil medled engendreth ye welked padde truly deſtroyed jelouſie vndone euer yet ſome manner jelouſie wot well euer redy heart trew ſeruaunts thus jealous ouer himſelf leaſt cauſe diſeaſe jealouſie full thought euer ſhould kept ferdneſſe leſe loue miskeping thorow leudnes el thus leaſt ſhe thou ſerueſt ſo feruently beſet better liketh yt thy good ſeruice ſhe counteth nat creſſe theſe jealouſies heart acceptable quality ben deemed theſe oughten euery true louer kindly euermore hauen mind till fully yt grace bliſſe ſeruice diſcended yt jelouſie catcheth el wening fooliſh wilfulneſs miſtruſteth truly fantaſie venime foule beguiled euil wil hath grounded thilk matter ſorrow leud ſoul yet nat euery wight ſhuld truſt ne euery wight ſhould truſt ne euery wightfully misbeleeue ye mean theſe thing owen vſed soothly withouten cauſeful euidence miſtruſt jealouſie ſhould wened wiſe perſon commonly ſuch leud wickednes ſhould nat find yt wiſe euil nat acomered abide wel time til grace bliſs ſeruice following haue ſo mokel eaſed abiding tofore hand hath diſeaſed certes lady qd tho nothing wondreth ſithen thilk bliſs ſo precious kindly good well worthy kind medled loue reaſon ye toforn haue declared anon hie one ſprong ſpringeth ye tother anone ye one commeth receiueth ye euery thing yt kindly place full appetite euer commeth thiderward kindly draw kindly thereto conſtraineth ye kindly ſtede bliſs ſuch medled vnbide need yt ſhould haue kindely wherfore thinketh anon yt wil ſhewed kind profereth thilk bliſs ſhuld hie thilk receiue el kind goodnes worchen hem ſhuld lo ſun neuer ſo ferre euer hath kind werching earth great weight hye loft caried ſtinteth neuer till come reſting place water ye ſeaward euer ben drawing thing yt light blithely ſink euer aſcendeth upward draweth thus kind euery thing kindly courſe place ſheweth wherfore kind good anone ſprong bliſſe ſhould thereon diſcend kind would dwelleden togider ſo haue ye ſaid ſelf certes qd ſhe thine heart ſitteth wonder ſore bliſs haue thine heart ſore agreeued yt tarrieth ſo long thou durſteſt thinketh thine word bliſſe wouldeſt thou blame yet ſay thilke bliſſe kindly good kindly place ye vnbide neuer ye later comming togider kind ordinaunce nat ſodainly may betide muſt abide time kind yeueth leue man medled gon ſhew thilke bliſſe haſt folowed ſo lightly coming ſhould lightly cauſe going long time thruſting cauſeth drink delicious ataſted qd ſo many bliſſes ſee day mine eye firſt moment ſight ſuch accord yea yet aſſenteth ſingularly himſelf reaſon faileth trauail none ſeruice time queint manner thing ſuch commeth qd ſhe thus earth kindely ſeaſons time year bringeth forth innumerable herb tree profitable ſuch men might leaue tho nought nouriſhing man kind ſeruen el ſuch tournen ſoone vnto men confuſion eaſe thereof ataſt commen foorth earth kind withouten man cure buſineſſe traueil thilk herb y• men liuelode neceſſarily ſeruen without goodly life creature mowen enduren moſt ben nouriſhen mankind without great trauail great tilth long abiding time commen earth ſeed toforn ordained ſuch herb make ſpring forth grow right ſo parfit bliſſe y• haue meaning time abide may nat come ſo lightly great traueile right buſie tilth yet good ſeed ſow oft crop faileth bad ſeed neuer ſo well traueiled thilk bliſſe thou ſpoke ſo lightly comming truly nat neceſſary ne abiding better ſtamped venomous jeuſe wrongen likely enpoyſonen tho thereof taſten certes right bitter herb ſhewen firſt year kind well harueſt yeeldeſt many grain tho long ſore hath trauailed woldeſt thou demen man wold yeue three quarter noble gold precious gift ye certes qd qd ſhe three quarter full pearl certes qd rich gift qd ſhe mokell azure qd precious gift full qd ſhe noble gift theſe one good faith qd wanting engliſh naming ſo noble word cannot preciouſneſſe yeue name rightfully qd ſhe haſt thou deemed yet loue knit vertue paſſeth al y• gold earth good accordant reaſon manner property may counteruailed azure world account reſpect reaſon loue good wil reaſon accordeth none earthly rich may ben amended yeft haſt thou yeuen know ſelf thy margarite thilke gift hath receiued thing reward ſhe hath ſelf bound thy gift ſaid maner rich may amended wherefore thing may nat amended thou ſhalt thy margarites rightwiſeneſſe rewarded right ſuffred yet neuer euery good deed ſometime yold would thy margarite reward thee quite right neuer dieth thy mede merite woll puruey certes ſuch ſuddain bliſſe thou firſt nempneſt right hem reward well worthy tho thine eye ſeemeth reward deſert paſſe right ſend ſuch bitterneſſe euenly reward ſo ſuddain bliſſe always reſon great goodneſſe may accompted bliſſe long long abideth endleſſe woll laſt see thy wil endles thou lovedſt euer thy euer tabide neuer change euen head reward muſt ben done right muſt need thy grace bliſſe endleſſe joy vnbide euenlich diſeaſe asketh euenlich joy haſtly thou ſhalt haue qd ſufficeth alone good neuer ſo well reaſon medled good ſeruice long trauailed ſo ſeruice ſhould men come joy thinketh ſhould wexing tree ye firſt meued trouth qd ſhe haſt thou conceiued theſe thing thine heart haſtely ſhalt thou bee able verye joye parfite bliſſe receiue wote well thou deſireſt knowe manner braunches tree ſhould ſpring thereof lady qd heartely pray leue woll right ſoone ſhall ataſte fruite ſo longe haue deſired thou haſte hearde qd ſhe wt wiſe tree toforn haue declared ground ſtock wexing firſt ye ground ſhould thy free full thine heart ſtock ſaid ſhould continuance good ſeruice long time trauail till greatneſſe right well woxen tree ſuch greatneſſe hath caught haue reherſed y• branch yt ye fruit ſhould foorth bring ſpeech muſt need voice prayer complaining wiſe vſed ala qd tha ſorrowfully wounded hideth ſpeech ſpareth complaint make ſhall ſpeke care pain euen like hell ſore hath aſſailed ſo ferforth pain throng leue tree ſer neuer ſhall fruit forth bring certes greatly eaſed dare preuy mone diſcouer true fellow conning hath might wherethrough pleint thing may amended mokel joied y• heart hardines dare complain lady care ſuffreth hope mercy grace auanced truly ſay ſith came margarite ſerue durſt neuer diſcouer manner diſeaſe well later hath mine heart hardied ſuch thing done great bounty worthy refreſhments ſhe grace goodly without deſert halue oft hath rekened nere goodneſſe grace mercy medled paſſen deſerts trauels ſeruings degree might endite would wene ſhould without recouer getting bliſſe euer thus haue ſtilled diſeaſe thus haue couered care y• bren ſorrowfull annoy gledes coal waſten fire vnder dead aſhen well hoter fire aſhen ouerlein right long wo haue ſuffred lo qd loue thou fareſt thinketh palſie euil hath acomered thy wit faſt thou higheſt forward anon ſuddainly backward thou moueſt shal nat yet thy leaudneſſe thy brain dull ben thy skilful vnderſtandings thy wil hath thy wit ſo amaiſtred woſt thou well qd ſhe euery tree ſeaſonable time bourioning ſhew blomes fro within ſign wt fruit ſhould ſpring el ye fruit yt year men halt deliuered ye ground neuer ſo good tho ſtock mighty ye full branch ſeer burions ſhew farewel gardiner may pipe yuy leaf fruit failed wherfore thy branch muſt burionen preſence thy lady thou deſire fruit thy lady grace beware thy life thou wo delay vſe asking thing y• ſtretchen ſhame might thou ſpeed way y• eſpy vertue woll ſuffer villanye himſelfe ſpring thy word may queint ne ſubtel manner vnderſtanding freel witted people ſuppoſen ſuch poeſies beguiled open vnderſtanding muſt euery word vſed voice wthout clere vnderſtanding ſentence ſaith ariſtotle right nought printeth hert thy word abide hert cleane full ſentence true mening platly muſt thou ſhew euer obedient heſts wils perform thou ſet ſuch wit wete look euermore wt ſhe meaneth y• liſt nat ſpeak ſtilly diſeaſe ſuffer wt wonder tho neuer come bliſſe y• trauaileth vnwiſt coueiteth thing vnknow vnweting ſhall quited vnknow thing rewarded good lady qd hath oft ſeen weather ſtorms ſo hugely haue fall burioning time pert dureſſe han beaten ſprings ſo clean wherethrough y• fruit thilk year hath failed great grace burions han good wether fruit foorth bring ala ſuch ſtorms hard auoid till eft wedring year han maked circuit cours ere fruit able taſted ſhent ſhame y• foul rebuked ſpeech fire brenning ſore ſmarteth diſeaſe thinketh full long er y• water come y• ſhould y• fire quench men gon leche body buried lo ſeemly fruit wexeth thinketh y• tho fruit may man ataſt pure bitterneſſe favor wiſe fruit y• tree waſten away togider tho mokell buſie occupation haue ſpent bring ſo fer forth y• able ſpring litle ſpeech hath maked labour idle qd ſhe wherof ſerueth thy queſtion aſſoil thinketh thee duller wit thee firſt met although man leaud commonly fool demed good woll learn ſots fool let lightly mind good men teacheth hem ſaid therfore thy ſtock muſt ſtrong greatnes well herted tree full feble firſt dent faileth although fruit faileth one yere two yet ſhall ſuch ſeaſon come one time ſhall bring fruit nothing preterit ne paſſed nothing future ne coming thing togider yt place preſent euerlaſting without meuing wherefore god thing though thing nat kindly nature thing yet ſhould hereafter yet euermore ſhull ſay god maketh time preſent future ne preterit may found wherefore weting weting one vnderſtanding weting weting god putteth neceſſity thing wote wote ne thing eternity el time woll doth liberty neceſſity thing thou wene ayenſt reaſon nat thorow neceſſity nat thing y• god wote wote nat yet nothing defendeth thing wiſt wiſt wils doings done el coming free arbitrement thou haſt theſe declaration well vnderſtand ſhalt thou find reaſonable proue yt many thing nat thorow neceſſity thorow liberty ſaue neceſſity free tofore ſaid thinketh vtterly declared thinketh lady qd ſo ſhould nat diſpleaſe euermore reuerence keep yt theſe thing contrarien vnderſtanding ye ſain ſometime thorow liberty alſo thorow neceſſity haue yet ſauour without better declaration wonder qd ſhe theſe thing ſithen day thou ſhalt ſee thine eye many thing receiuen hemſelf reuers thorow diuers reaſons thus pray thee qd ſhe thing ben reuers commen gone bid thee come thou come bid thee go thou go thou reuerſeſt fro thy firſt coming ſoth qd yet qd ſhe thy firſt alone diuers reaſon full reuerſing vnderſtand qd ſhall ſhew thee qd ſhe enſample thing yt haue kindly mouing thing yt meueth kindly doth y• heuens eie clepe sun soothly qd ſemeth moſt kindly moue thou ſaiſt ſoth qd ſhe thou look sun part vnder heauen euermore heigheth mouing fro thilk place heigheth meuing toward thilk ſame place thilk place goth heigheth comming without ceaſing y• place heigheth chaunged withdraw theſe thing diuerſity reaſon reuers one thing may ſey without repugnaunce wherfore ye ſame wiſe without repugnaunce reaſons tofore maked one beleeue ſomethyng thorow neceſſity comming comming yet neceſſity conſtrayned comming neceſſity y• commeth free haue ſaid tho liſt little ſpeak gan ſtint pen writing ſaid wiſe truly lady thinketh alleadge authority great y• contrarien ſayings iob ſayeth man perſon thou haſt put tearm thou might nat paſſe ſay ye man may ſhort ne length y• day ordayned doyng altho ſomtime v ſemeth ſome man thyng free wherethrough death henteth nay forſooth qd ſhe nothing ayenſt ſaying god nat beguiled ne ſeeth nothing wheder ſhal come liberty el neceſſity yet ſaid ordained god immouable man done may chaunged thing alſo y• poul ye apoſtle ſayeth hem y• toforne werne purpoſed saint thus whych god wiſt hath predeſtined conformes image ſon ſhould y• firſt begeten y• ſay amongs many brother hath predeſtined hath cleaped hath cleaped hem hath juſtified hath juſtified hem hath magnified purpoſe cleped saint holy y• euerlaſting preſent neither time paſſed ne time commyng euer onely preſent mokell moment ſeuen thouſand winter ſo ayenward withouten meuing nothing liche temporel preſence thing y• euer preſent yet emongs men ere preſence moouable liberty arbitrement right y• euerlaſting preſent manner thyng ne ſhal temporell tyme ſomethyng ſhall mouing ſtounds maner repugnaunce right ſo euerlaſting preſence nothing may chaunged temporell time otherwhile prooued mouable liberty withouten inconuenience thereof follow temporell time ſuch preſence y• preſent done paſſed come ginnen entre time amongs euerich eaſily followeth y• preſent euerlaſting dureth one head withouten imaginable changing euer preſent truly courſe y• planet ouerwhelmings y• sun dayes night new ginning circuit ended yt ſayn one yere follow another theſe maken tranſitory time chaunging liues mutation people right temporell preſence coueiteth euery place thing euery time contained ſey wiſt god knowing qd wondreth poule ſpake theſe word voice ſignification time paſſed god ſaints wiſt hath predeſtined hath cleaped hath juſtified hath magnified thinketh ſhould haue ſaid tho word time preſent accordaunt ye euerlaſting preſent haue ſpoke preterit voice paſſed vnderſtanding qd loue theſe word ſee well thou haſt little vnderſtanding y• euerlaſting preſence el ſpoken word neuer thing tho thou haſt nempned tofore ons euenlich ye god ben togider euerlaſting preſent vnderſtanding eternal preſence ſaid hath incloſe togider one time whyche cloſe one thing y• diuers time diuers place temporell without poſteriority priority cloſed therein perpetuell maked dwell preſent ſight thou ſaieſt yt poule ſhould haue ſpoke thilke foreſaid preſence thilke neuer mowe preſent ſo thing time paſſed ne mowe wiſe paſſed thing temporall preſence y• paſſen little ſhullen preſent ſimilitude euerlaſting preſence ſignification time paſſed time temporall preſent ſo accordaunce maner thing theſe ben doen free arbitrement el neceſſary holy writ pronounceth eternity ſpeaketh preſence euerlaſting ſooth nothyng ſoth immouable time whych naught alway wils act right needful hem ſo oft needful y• ſomtime ſhould qd yet muſt lerned ſome enſample loue qd ſhe woll enſample make ſithen know head knot y• yelke lo ſomtime thou writeſt art ne art write right thou writeſt el wolt write needful thee write el wilne write make thee know vtterly thing otherwiſe euerlaſting preſence temporal time ſee good child ſomething euerlaſting preſence temporall time eternite time eterne preſence ſhal reaſon defendeth y• ſomething ne may time temporel mouing etern immouable forſoth contrary ne reuers mouable time temporell mouable eternity time alway eternity haue el come time temporell haue ne nought comming eternity yet neuer latter ſay ſame thyng neuer tyme temporell y• euer eternity onely ſome time ſay thy loue morne time day alone deny ne yet neuer later alway eternity alſo qd ſeemeth y• commyng thyng el paſſed temporall time eternity euer preſent oweth demed yet followeth thilke thyng el ſhall manner thereto paſſed el comming vtterly ſhull deny without reaſing preſent manner qd ſhe mine diſciple ginneſt thou able haue name ſeruaunt thy wit clered away errour cloud vnconning away blindneſſe loue away thoughtfull ſtudy medling manner haſtly ſhalt thou entre joy thine maiſtres thou haſt qd ſhe word well clerely concluded mokell matter right reuers ne contrariouſty tho thing right ſo withouten repugnance ſaid ſome thing mouable time temporell eternity dwelleth immouable afore y• without ceſſing right naught time y• ſame euerlaſting y• temporallich ſometime ni toforne may haue ſaid ſothly qd haue well vnderſtand ſo y• thinketh preſcience god free arbitrement withouten repugnaunce accorden maketh ſtrength eternity encloſeth preſence time thing han ſhull time would qd little vnderſtand ſithen y• thing thus beforne wote whether thilke weting bee tho thing el thilke thing god weting ſo god nothing euery thing god weting therof take ſhould god maker authour bad werks ſo ſhould rightfully puniſh euill doings mankind qd loue ſhall tell thee leſſon learne mine true ſeruaunt noble phyloſophical poete engliſh euermore buſieth trauaileth right ſore name encreaſe wherfore willen good owe doe hym worſhip reuerence truely better ne pere ſchoole rule coud neuer find qd ſhe treatiſe made ſeruant troylus hath matter touched full queſtion aſſoiled certainly noble ſayings amend goodneſſe gentle manliche ſpeech wythout manner nicety flarieres imagination wit good reaſon ſentence paſſeth maker book troylus anſwer thy queſtion mayſt thou learne neuer y• later yet may lightly thyne vnderſtanding ſomedele learned thou haue knowyng theſe toforne ſaid thynges thou haue vnderſtandyng two laſt chapiter ſecond book ſay good ſome thing bad want manner bad nothyng el abſence good y• god good maketh good deed good euill maketh ben naught y• bad nothyng badneſſe haue qd tho ynough knowing therein needeth thing hear ſay ſhal come bliſſe ſo long deſired matter toforne declared qd loue haue well ſhewed euery man hath free arbitrement thynges power undo liketh ground muſt come spire proceſſe time ſhall greatneſſe ſprede haue braunches bloſſomes waxing fruit grace whych taſte ſauour endleſſe bliſſe joy euer onbide lady qd tree ſette faine would learn thou ſhalt qd ſhe ere thou depart hence firſt thyng thou muſt ſet thy werke ground ſiker good accordaunt thy ſprings thou deſire grape thou goeſt haſell ne tetchen roſes thou ſekeſt okes thou ſhalt haue honey ſoukles thou leaueſt fruit y• ſoure dock wherfore thou deſire blyſs parfite joy thou muſt ſet thy purpoſe vertue followeth look bodily good ſayed thou writyng thy ſecond book thou haſt ſet thy ſelf ſo noble place vtterly lowed thyne heart miſgoyng thy firſt purpoſe ſetteles y• eaſier ſpryng lighter thy ſoul grace liſſed truely thy deſire ſay thy algates mote ben ſtedfaſt matter without chaungyng ſtedfaſt man may void yes parde qd may tourned friend diſeaſe manace threatening leſing life limmes many wiſe commeth mynd alſo mote oft thought remembraunce may hold one thyng continuelly heart neuer ſo luſty deſired ſee qd ſhe thou thy ſhall follow thy free grounded continuelly abide thy free y• thou loueſt haſt loued yet ſhalt louen margarite pearle thy thou thinkeſt hold thy knitte loue chaunge new luſt beſide wyll teacheth thine hert manner varying although thou threatened death el wiſe yet thyne arbitrement chuſe thy loue voyd el hold thilk arbitrement maner judgement deſire thy heart thou deeme loue thy good fayleth art thou worthy bliſſe good ſhould deſerue thou chuſe continuance thy good ſeruice thy good abideth need bliſſe following thy good wil muſt come ſtrength thilke judgement thy firſt taught thyne heart abide halt eſchange thy reaſon accorded truly maner thus ſhall abide impoſſible tourne thy heart true euery man dilligently meanyngs conſider ſhall well vnderſtande good knitte reaſon falſe heart neuer voided power might keepyng good liberty arbitrement heart good keep may nat fayle eke fail ſheweth ſelfe good keeping thus falſe putteth good anone conſtraineth heart accord louing thy good accordaunce falſe thyne heart falſity likened togither yet little woll ſay thee good wil thy good wils raiſe ſtrength take heed qd ſhe thy willes thou ſhalt vnderſtand right ye han body diuers member fiue ſundry wittes euerich apart owne thing inſtruments ye vſen hand apart handle foot go tongue ſpeak eye ſee right ſo ſoule hath hym certayne ſteryngs ſtrengths whyche vſeth inſtruments certain doyngs reaſon ſoule whych vſeth thynges know proue whych vſeth wilne yet neyther ne reaſon ſoule eueryche hem thyng himſelf ſoul right euerich hath thus ſingular inſtruments hemſelfe han well diuers aptes diuers manner vſings thilke aptes mowen cleaped affection affection inſtrument willing appetite wherfore mokell folke ſaine reaſonable creature ſoul thing feruently wilneth affectuouſly wilneth thus may tearm equiuocas three wayes vnderſtand one inſtrument wylling another affection inſtrument third vſe ſetteth werke inſtrument willyng ilke ſtrength ſoul thee conſtraineth wilne right reaſon inſtrument reaſons ye vſen ye looken affection inſtrument thyng ye draw deſirouſly thyng wilne coueitous manner y• time mind come thought thilke thing remember anon ye ben willing thilke done el haue thus inſtrument affection alſo wilne thing ſaid wilne health nothyng thereon thinketh anone commeth memory ſo affection wilne ſleepe mynde anone remembred wilneth ſleep time commeth doyng affection neuer accordeth ſickneſs ne alway wake right ſo true louers affection willing inſtrument wiln truth ſeruice affection alway abideth although ſleping threatned el thereon thinkyng anone commeth mind anone ſtedfaſt y• abide vſe inſtrument forſooth another thing himſelf haue ye ye willed thing affect inſtrument purpoſed deſired manner vſage ſeruice wiſely needeth ruled waiter enuye cloſed ſpeakers full jangeling wordes proud folke hautaine lambes innocent ſcornen diſpiſen thus varieth act willing euerich yet ben cleped name vtterly owen inſtrument ye turn purpoſe thing done ſit ſtand ſuch thing el inſtrument may although affect vſage left right ye haue ſight reaſon yet alway vſe yee greateſt wiſedome hem ſhall god falſe folke aſhamed whych wenen beſtialty yerthly thing ſweeter better body heuenly ſoul grace y• fruit y• long haue deſired dooth good ſauour ſmell chriſt thee cry mercy grace graunt thy goodneſs euery maner reader ful vnderſtanding leud pamphlet haue let man wene cauſe werke verily y• ſooth enuy euer ready innocent ſhend wherfore would y• good ſpeech enuy euermore hinder man wene werke ſufficiently maked god werke paſſeth man man wit parfite werke may way puruay end ſhould ſo leaude aught wene perfection end get neuer later grace glory laude yeelde put worſhipfull reuerence ſoothfaſt god three vnitye cloſed heauy langour ſickneſſe hath tourned myrthe health recover right ſorrowed glotton cloude manyfolde ſickly ſorow ſo mirth ayen commyng health hath gladded greatly comforted beſeech pray therefore crie god great pite mokell mercye preſent ſcourges fleſh mow make medicine leech craft inner man health ſo paſſed treſpas tenes weepyng myne eye waſhe voided manner diſeaſe weep hereafter kept thorow god grace ſo god hand merciablye mee hath ſcourged hereafter good plite thence merciably mee keepe defend booke many priuye thing wimpled fold vnneth ſhul leaud men plites vnwinde wherefore praye holy ghoſte lene oyntmentes men wittes cleere god loue man wonder queſtion cum minde grate luſtie deſire ladie enformed lewdneſſe amende certes know men wittes ſhould aske aunſwere ſhuld ſay ſo leude ſelf mokell learnyng yet mee behoueth haue made therefore could ſufficiently would matter yaue ſentence dull witte hindred ſtepmother foryetyng cloude vnconnyng ſtoppeth light margarite pearle wherefore may ſhine ſhould deſire good reader alſo coueite pray good booke amender correction word ſentence mede coueit trauayle euery inſeer hearer leud fautaſie deuout horiſons prayer god dread iudge yelden praien wiſe dome ſins mow releaſed foryeuen praieth himſelfe trauayleth alſo pray euery man parfitely mow knowe intencion hert treatiſe haue draw ſightful manna deſert child iſrael ſpirituel meate bodily alſo men body nouriſhed yet neuer later chriſt ſignified right ſo iewell betokeneth gemine ſtone vertuous el pearle margarite woman betokeneth grace learning wiſedome god el holy church bread vertue made holy fleſh god ſaith ſpirite yeueth life fleſh nothyng profiteth fleſh fleſhly vnderſtanding fleſh without grace loue naught worth letter ſleeth ſpirite yeueth lifelich vnderſtanding charitie loue loue charity god graunt v therein frended thus teſtament loue ended ¶here endeth teſtament loue lamentation mary magdalen treatiſe taken origen wherein mary magdalen lamenteth cruel death saviour chriſt plonged wawe mortal diſtreſſe ala wo ſhall complain ſhal deuoid great heuineſſe fro woful mary woful magdalen lord gon ala wrought tein ſodain chance perſeth hert ſo depe nothing waile wepe lord gone y• graue laied great paſſion death cruell hath thus betraied man tell become prince iſrael ieſus nazareth ghoſtly ſuccour parfite love hope honour creature hath hence caried might ſo ſodainly befall would taried ſo ſhould haue purpoſe bought ointment full precious royal wherewith hoped corp anointed thus gone mind diſpointed therefore aduertiſe behold pitous chaunce preſence full little maruaile though hert cold conſidring lo lordes abſence ala ſo full negligence sould found becauſe come ſo late men may ſay infortunate cauſe ſorow may vnderſtand quia tulerunt dominum meum ne may fonde wote nere ubi poſuerunt eum thus muſt bewayle dolorem meum hartie weping better deſerue till death approch hert kerue hert oppreſt ſodaine auenture feruent anguiſh wrapped ſo long lyfe may endure soch paine ſoch mortall wo neuertheleſſe party ſhall go hope find myne owne turtill true liues ioy ſouerain lorde ieſu sith ioy call preſence thus remoued full mone ala made prouidence miſhap wherefore ſigh grone succour find place might gon fain would ſome man hert breake may complaine ſpeake alone ſtand full ſory full ſad hoped haue ſeen lord king small cauſe haue merie glad remembryng bitterfull departing world creature liuing ſo good gracious loue alſo gold precious full ſore ſigh without comfort cure ſaluacion brenning loue hert ſo doth conſtrain ala wofull permutacion whereof find joy conſolacion therefore payne onely confeſſe death feare woll end heauineſſe wo anguiſh intollerable bide life ſuſtaine go hence paine vncurable find know place certain thus theſe thing twaine may take may refuſe hert wounded hereon think muſe ſhall ſtand mournyng hope viſion would appere loue might tell ſome good tidyng joy might chaunge wepyng chere truſt grace mercy dere leaſt though therewith kill ſhall ſpare waile wepe fill die ſoch auenture welcome chaunce bone ſhall reſt ſepulture lyfe death ordinaunce ſhal told euerlaſtyng remembraunce thus departe ſhame alſo thereof nothyng blame hope againſt hath courſe ytake thus ſhall die ſee right well lorde hath forſake conceipt cauſe know none though farre hence nothyng nye yet wofull hert hym doth ſeeke cauſeth teares ren doun cheeke thinkyng ala haue loſt preſence world ſuſtenance cry call herty diligence wight giueth attendance certifie myne enquirance wherefore world wray lord ſlaine borne away though mourne great wonder sithe joy ſpeciall thinke ſo farre aſonder ſee feare neuer ſhall helpeth call ne enquire coſte ala thus gone loſte iewes thinke full miſery set malice buſie cure force might gileful trechery hath entermined lordes ſepulture borne away precious figure leauing nothing haue done ſo marred ala ſhall vengeaunce inſaciable haue entreated ſo reporte lamentable beate body toppe toe neuer man borne felt ſoch woe wounded ala greuance blood doun reiled moſt habundance bloody rowes ſtremed doune ouer aſſayled ſo maliciouſly ſcourges ſtrokes beſtiall ſpared ſmote inceſſantly ſatiſfie malice full buſie ſpit face ſmote groned full ſore ſweate many tere crouned thorn ſharp kene veines rent blood ran doun apace blood ouercome iyen bolne ſtrokes bleſſed face entreated men without grace kneeled made many ſcorne like hellhound haue torne vpon mighty croſſe length brede theſe turmentors ſhewed curſedneſſe nailed without pitie drede precious blood braſt largeneſſe ſtrained along men mercileſſe jointes mine apparence riued aſonder great violence beholding mine iyen twain stode beſide rufull attendaunce euer thought pain loked deadly countenaunce ſaid ſpeciall remembraunce farwel magdalen depart muſt need hen hert tanquam cera liqueſcens rufull ſight gan behold witte almoſt deſtraught tare heere hand wrang fold y• ſight hert drank ſoch draught many fall ſwouning caught bruſed body falling ground whereof fele many greuous wound theſe wretch ful al frowardneſſe gaue drinke eiſel tempred gall ala poiſon full bitterneſſe loues chere cauſed appall yet thereof might drinke ſpake theſe wordes thought beſt father heauen conſummatum eſt kneeled doune paine outrage clipping y• croſſe within mine armes twain blood diſtilled doune viſage clothes eke droppes diſtain haue died would full fain ſhould auayle ſo sith suſpenſus patibulo thus lord full dere diſguiſed blood pain wound many one veines braſt joynts riued partyng aſonder fleſh fro bone ſaw hing alone cum inquis deputatus eſt like man like leprous beeſt blind knight men called longias ſpeare aproched vnto ſouerain launſing ſide full pitouſly ala precious hert claue twain purple blood eke fro herts vain doune railed right faſt moſt rufull wiſe chriſtal water brought paradiſe beheld wofull paſſion wote ſodain auenture hert peerſed compaſſion remayned life nature stroke death felt without meaſure death wound caught wo oppreſt brought point hert ſhuld breſt wound hert blood darling shall neuer ſlide fro memoriall bitter paine alſo tourmenting within ſoule grauen principall ſpeare ala ſo ſharpe withall thrilled hert felyng body ſoule departyng ſoone might releued vp againe breth coude well reſtore felyng ſelfe drowned ſo great paine body ſoul thought al tore violent falles greeued right ſore wept bledde ſelfe fared one life nothing cared lokyng vp rufull roode saw firſt viſage pale figure ſo pitous ſight ſpotted bloode saw neuer yet liuyng creature exceeded bound meaſure man mind wit fiue nothing able paine diſcriue gan mine armes vnbrace vp liftyng handes full mourningly ſighed ſore ſobbed place heuen earth might haue herd cry weping ſaid ala inceſſauntly ah ſweet hert ghoſtly paramour ala may nat thy body ſocour bleſſed lord fierſe cruell theſe curſed wight hath thee ſlaine keruing ala thy body eueridell wound within wound full bitter thy pain wold might thee attaine nayle body faſt vnto thy tree payne thou might go free report ne make reherſaile demening circumſtaunce well wote ſpeare euery naile thirled ſoule inward reſemblaunce neuer ſhall remembraunce lyfe woll cauſe waile oft remembre bataile ah ye iewes worſe dogges rabiate • ued thus cruelly aray neuer diſpleaſed cauſed debate loue true herts coueyted aye preched teched ſhewed y• right way wherefore ye like tyrant wood wayward haue thus ſlaine reward ye ought haue remembred one thing ſpecial fauour grace magnificence prince borne lord ouer ye toke ſmall reuerence full meke ſuffring offence neuertheles ye deuoured one aſſent hungry wolf doth y• lamb innocent pite people mercileſſe arming ſelf falſheed treaſon lord ye haue ſhewed woodneſſe like men beeſtes without reaſon malice ſuffred ſeaſon payn woll come thinke ſlack man without mercy mercy ſhall lack ye traitours maintainer madneſſe vnto folly aſcribe paine ye haue depriued joy gladneſſe dealing lord ſoueraine nothing ſhuld need thus complaine liued peace tranquillite ye haue ſlaine iniquite farewel nobleneſſe y• ſomtime rain farewel worſhip glory fame hereafter liue hate disdaine maruaile ye treſpace blame vnto ſhame tourned good name vpon woll wonder euery nation people moſt vile reputation theſe wicked wretch theſe hound hell haue told playne ſentence content dere loue thus quel yet muſt embeſile preſence perceyue couert violence haue conueyed diſpleaſure lafte naked ſepulture wherefore trouth rightful judgment malice againe may acquited verdite auiſement falſe murdre ſhall endited theft alſo ſhall reſpited haſt ſhall hanged draw woll ſelfe plede cauſe law ala trewe attendaunce ſtill abidden lordes corſe kept ſtill trewe perſeueraunce befal wofull deuorſe paine welcome force ſhal ſonge ſo euer go departing ground wo ſee right well paine ſmart wound ſo greuous dolour wound carefull hart sith haue loſt thus paramour ſweetneſſe tourned ſour mirth heart nothing may conuey beareth thereof loke key ioy excellent bliſſed paradiſe may ala wiſe comforte song angel nothing may ſuffiſe min harte make diſporte al refuſe might reſorte vnto loue well goodliheed whoſe longing trowe ſhal deed painful labour tourment corporal make thereof none exception paine hell wol paſſe ouer loue find mine affection great delectacion thouſand time martred would bee bleſſed body one might ſee world ſo large compaſſe ſhal ſpare renne life foot alſo ſhall reſt one place til loue may heare ſome tiding whoſe abſence hand wring thinke ceaſe ſhall neuer mind gentil ieſu ſhall thee find ieruſalem wol ſerch place fro place sion vale ioſaphat alſo find ſpace mount oliuet bethany wol go theſe wayes wol wander many mo nazareth bethleem mountana iude trauaile ſhall paine ſee bleſſed face might ſee finde serch would euery coſte countrey fardeſt part egipt hote inde shulde little iourney thus gone taken away knew full trouth certente yet care releaſed might wilderneſſe thinke beſt go sith tydings may life lede fro may dwel man apere towne ne village woll come nere alone wood rockes caues deep may mine wil waile weep mine eyen twaine withouten variaunce shall neuer ceaſe promiſe faithfully weepe great aboundaunce bitter teares renning inceſſauntly teares medled full petouſly blood euer ſhall renne alſo expreſſing mine hart greeuous wo worldly fode ſuſtenaunce deſire none liuing find ſoch woll take rootes growen craggy ſtone shall ſuffice water lake thus may ſay lord ſake fuerunt mihi lachrymae meae deſerto pane die ac nocte body clothe maketh force mourning mantel ſhal ſufficient greuous woundes pirous corſe shal full royal garnement departed thus beſt content croſſe nailes ſcourges withall shal thought paine ſpeciall thus wol liue haue told may long tyme endure fere death ouer ſo bold purpoſe ſure paynes encreaſe without meaſure long lyfe lay reaſon thing mortal hath ſeaſon ſigh full ſore ferre yfet mine herte feele bledeth inwardly blody teares may wiſe let sith paine find remedie thanke god die perfourmed hold content ſoule let haue hath lent lenger endure intollerable woful harte inflamed ſo huge ſorow myne comparable sith mind finde refuge yet require rightful iudge deuoide fro inwarde ſorow leſt liue next morow within mine hart impreſſed full ſore royal forme ſhape ſemelines porte chere goodnes euermore noble perſone gentilnes well part fitnes redemer mankind loue beſt hart ſoule mind abſence paynes full bitter right well may fele inwardly wonder though hurte ſlee cauſe crie ſo rufully mine hart oppreſſed ſo wonderfully onely ſo bright blee ala trowe ſhall neuer ſee ioy tranſlate full farre exile mirth chaunged paynes cold lyfe thinke endureth anguiſh payne behold wherfore hand thus wring fold graue loke call pray death remaineth life borne away muſt walke wander god wot partes ſhall dreſſe quaking hart weepyng many tere ſeek loue ſweetnes wolde wiſt mortall heuines mine hart reneweth wold nat keepe pite long ſtore without may long endure loue ſo ſore worketh within breſt euer wepe ſepulture sighing full ſore mine harte ſhould breſt lyfe ſhall obtayne reſt mourne wepe euer go making complaint al mortall wo faſt crie audience comming hider pleaſe ſoule oppreſt abſence ala liſt ſet mine harte eaſe wherefore payne ſelf al diſeaſe ſhal ſpare till take grace el ſhall ſterue place one might ſpeake al ioy parfite pleaſaunce might herte breake ſhuld anone deuoid al greuaunce bliſſe recreaunce ala nothing ſo ſteed ioy naught haue wo noble corſe within mine hart rote deep graued ſhall neuer ſlake gone place ne wote mourne wepe al ſake sith paſt vowe make hartely promiſe thereto bind neuer ceaſe till may find vnto mother thinke go haply ſome comfort may take one thing yet feareth mo mencion make wordes ſhe wold trimble quake coud blame ſhe hauing one ſon borne away y• mother wol mone sorowes many hath ſhe ſuffred trewly sith ſhe firſt conceiued bare ſeuen thing moſt ſpecially drowneth hert ſorrow care yet lo wiſe may compare one ſhe knew wold paine euerichone renew great ſorrow mennes ſaying whan temple simeon iuſtus shewing theſe word propheſiyng tuam animam pertranſibit gladius alſo herode tyrant furious childe purſued euery place life went neither mercy ne grace mourned ſhe knew gone full long ſhe ſought ſhe found ayen whan went death croſſe vpon ſight rewful paine whan hong thereon theues twaine ſpeare vnto herte thruſt right ſwouned ground pight whan deed bloody lappe lay bleſſed body hand fete tore cried ſaid wel away thus araide neuer man whan haſt made body bore vnto ſepulture remaine vnnethes wo ſhe coude ſuſtaine theſe ſorowes ſeuen like ſwerds euery one mother herte wounded fro ſyde ſyde ſhe knew ſonne thus gone world ſhe ſhuld death ride care ſhe coude lenger abide hauing joy conſolacioun ſtanding ſtacioun wherefore ſee dare nat preſume fro preſence wol ſelfe refraine yet leuer die conſume mother ſhould haue pain neuertheles ſonne would ſee ful fain preſence ioy ſweetnes abſence ſorrow heauines ſith may nat mete deſire aboue thing nede muſt take ſour ſwete noble corſe tiding full oft cry hand wring myne herte ala relenteth paine braſt ſenew vaine ala vnhappie woful hour wherein thus miſpended ſeruice mine intent eke true labour none effect may come wiſe ala thinke doe diſpiſe liſt take ſimple obſeruaunce death finaunce haue called sed non reſpondet mihi wherfore mirth tourned mourning dere lord quid mali feci tibi comfort find erthly thing ala haue compaſſion cry yf fro faciem tuam abſcondis conſumere vi within myne herte grounded thy figure world horrible tourment may aſwage ſo without meaſure ſo brenning ſo feruent remember lord haue bin diligent euer thee pleaſe onely mo myne herte thee ſo euer go therefore dere darling trahe poſt te let ſtand thus deſolate quia non eſt qui conſoletur myne herte thee diſconſolate paine alſo nothing moderate liſt thee ſpeake aliue come haſt herte aſonder riue thee profer lo poore ſeruice thee pleaſe mine owne entent offer deuout ſacrifice boxe replete pretious oyntment myne eyen twaine weeping ſufficient myne herte anguiſh fulfilled ala ſoule eke redy loue pa naught el haue thee pleaſe pay mine herte gold pretious ſtone ſhould thine without delay hertely chere thou ſhuld haue anone ſuffreſt thou ſtand alone thou haſt trow weeping disdaine el thou knoweſt nat paine thou withdraw thy noble daliaunce ought euer diſpleaſed thee thou knoweſt right wel ignorance knowledge certainte haue offended lord forgiue glad make full repentaunce thing hath bin thy greuaunce myne herte ala ſwelleth within breſt ſore oppreſt anguiſh paine peeces forſooth woll breſt ſee thy bleſſed corſe againe life ne death nat refraine thou make delay thou maiſt ſure myne hert woll leape ſepulture ala lord fareſt thou thus tribulation yet haue mind thy mercy thy pite euer truſted thee find sometime thou good kind let pleaſe thee prayer accept teares haue bewept thou oughteſt haue routh sith thee mourning ſith thee yplighted firſt trouth neuer varied diſcording knoweſt thou beſt owne darling conſtraineſt thou thus waile wo forſooth thee nothing availe haue endured without variaunce right thou knoweſt thy louer iuſt trew hert thought aye thine ordinance like ſaphire alway one hew neuer chaunged thee new withdraweſt thou preſence sith thought thine abſence hert intier ſweet lord crie thee encline thine ear petition come voliciter exaudi remember mine herts diſpoſitioun may endure conditioun therefore theſe paine libera thou art pone juxta te let behold ieſu thy bliſſed face thy faire glorious angellike viſage bow thine eares complaint ala conuey rage ala lord take fro dommage deſire mercy condiſcend none thou may greuance amend yet good lord thee beſeech pray thou raiſed brother lazarous death life fourth day came ayen body ſoule precious great thing maiſt thou ſhew vnto v thy ſelfe power thy godhead thou lying graue dead mine hert wounded thy charite brenneth flameth inceſſauntly come dear lord ad adjuvandum long paine multiplie leaſt mean time depart die thy grace put hope confidence pleaſeth thy high magnificence flood death tribulatioun ſoule feele entred full deepe ala conſolatioun euer waile euer mourne weepe ſorowhath wounded mine hert ful deepe deare loue maruaile though die sagittae tuae infixae ſunt mihi wandring place wilderneſſe comfort haue ne yet aſſuraunce deſolate ioy replete faintneſſe anſwere receiuing mine enquiraunce mine herte alſo greued diſpleaſaunce wherefore may ſay deus deus non eſt dolor ſicut dolor meus mine herte expreſſeth quod dilexi multum may endure though would faine solum ſupereſt sepulchrum know right well huge paine thus loue may life ſuſtaine god muſe ayleth thee quod ſic repente praecipitas ala ſee wol none otherwiſe muſt take leaue euermore bitter paine hath almoſt diſcomfite loues corſe wiſe reſtore ala wo euer bore tombe muſt die ſtarue death heart carue teſtament woll begin make god father ſoule commend ieſu loue died ſake heart giue ſend whoſe loue life maketh end body alſo monument bequeath boxe ointment will lo make laſt right place within ſepulture woll buried dead paſt vpon graue woll haue ſcripture within reſteth ghoſtly creature chriſts true louer mary magdalaine whoſe hart loue brake peeces twaine ye vertuous woman tender nature full pitie compaſſion reſort pray vnto ſepulture ſing dirige great deuotion shew charitie condition sing pitie let herts weepe remembring dead layd ſleepe ye begin part fro ended haue mourning obſeruance remember whereſoeuer ye go alway ſearch make due enqueraunce loue mine herts ſuſtenaunce euery towne euery village ye may noble image happe grace laſt ye true loue find coſt say magdaleine dead paſt pure loue hath yeelded vp ghoſt say thing loued moſt might death eſchew may paine ſo ſore euer renew token loue perpetual buried place preſent take mine hert root al cloſe within boxe ointment deare loue make thereof preſent kneeling downe word lamentable meſſage ſpeake faire tretable say ſelfe commend thouſand time herte ſo free poore token ſay ſend pleaſeth goodneſſe take gree right fee asked ſaid long giue thy heart deſire adue lord loue ſo faire face adue turtle doue ſo freſh hew adue mirth adue ſollace adue ala ſauiour lord ieſu adue gentilleſt euer knew adue moſt excellent paramour fairer roſe ſweeter lilly flour adue hope pleaſure eternall life wealth proſperitie mine heart gold perle orientall mine adamant perfite charitie cheefe refuge felicitie comfort recreatioun farewell perpetuall ſaluatioun farewell mine emperour celeſtiall moſt beautifull prince mankind adue lord heart moſt liberall farewell ſweeteſt ſoule mind louing ſpouſe ſhall neuer find adue ſoueraine gentilman farewell dere heart hertely thy word eloquent flowing ſweetneſſe shal ala mind recomfort wherfore life muſt end bitterneſſe world ſhall neuer reſort thee mine heauenly diſport ſee ala woll none farewell ground dignitie adue faireſt euer bore ala may ſee bleſſed face welaway ſhall ſee thy bleſſed viſage ſo replete grace wherein printed perfite ſollace adue mine hertes root euer farewell muſt thee diſceuer ſoule anguiſh full thurſty faint right ſore heauineſſe lord ſpouſe cur dereliquiſti sith thee ſuffer diſtreſſe cauſeth thee ſeeme thus mercileſſe sith thee pleaſeth make end manus tuas ſpirit commend ¶finis prologue remedy love seeing manifolde inconuenience falling vnbrideled proſperitie tempred mortal prudence nothing wealthy youth freeltie moued right equitie youth wele ſomewhat write whereby may himſelfe safecondite firſt note thing moſt noyous vnto youth greeuous maladie among u called loue encombrous vexing yong people ſtraungelie oft force cauſeth hem die age eke turmented loue bineath girdle aboue wherfore werk right laborous age need nat hond take youth oweth obſequious begin thus worke ſake may feruence loue aſlake louer mitigatiue none preſeruatiue mighty lord gouerneth youth meane meaſure pace euery matter concerneth firſt behouefull woll aske grace forthwithall ſame place ere begin woll kneel ſa theſe word helpe pray flouring youth haſt auauntage ſtrength body luſt beaute alſo precelling haſt aboue age many ſingular commodite howbeit one thing hath beyond thee thy moſt profite greateſt auaile ſhuld conduit mean ſad counſaile yet good lord preſumption nill depraue thy might deitie liue vnder thy protection thy ſubiect weare thy liuerie thou art ground proſperitie freſheſt floure garland ſingular aid well vnderſtand oweth lord beſt ſeruiſe entire faith honour ſupport right ſo ſpeake none wiſe knowledge ſelfe one leaſt ſort thy ſeruannts elder comfort draw ſad counſaile thee thou liſt thee thy power may reſiſt fie age vnder word erronious opinion ſpekeſt ſaith moſt vntrue youth ill diſpoſitioun dampneth v without exceptioun colerable auauntage ſaith reſteth counſaile ſage well may ſad counſaile reſt yet deed ben ferre therefro may ſay pariſh prieſt ſay ſelfe know one two well ſtriken age neighbourhed woll neighbour wiues bed preſence young man clippe kiſſe ye doune lay bleare eye thus ſaieth ſuffer ye old morel play haue doen may thus ſaieth husband queme man ſhould miſdeme word deed nedeth coy impoſſible doe amiſſe yong man ſpeake anone ſaith boy rebuke age beſeemeth thee iwis thus old face aye warrant ſleight ſubtiltee ferre reaſon tell thee ſhortly age aboue age impotent reſiſtence age vnweldie may fight flee age without defence sad counſaile ſaiſt thou giueth aſſiſtence reaſon freſheſt wherefore thy ſaying thou art blame sith reaſon rather accompanied vnto age whith opinion euery wiſe man denied ſith ſad counſaile proceedeth reaſon sad counſaile hath cheef manſion nay end thy ſuaſion doeſt entend age compare vnto thine excellence nill preſume ſo dignifie ye egall howbeit experience auauntageth ſhe moſt certainly teacheth thing contrary oft foreſee warely eſchew thou neuer aſſaideſt yet knew experience maketh man moſt certaine thing yearthly neceſſite sad counſaile requireth certaintie plaine ferre moue thus whereto need purpoſe thou commandeſt shortly mine entent thus none vnder thy licenſe counſaile brother ſhuldeſt thou giue counſail ſo yong lacking experience vnto thine owne ſpeach report wote well thy tong wil ſerue thee right wel teach doubt leſt thy wit woll reach youth experience thou ſaiſt conuert ſhouldeſt thou teach well vnexpert scripture witneſſeth yt god oft ſhitte fro hie witted man ſhew y• child meane witte preſumeth debonaire mild counſaile entend vertue bild mine elder part haue borowed part experience wch haue ſorowed wel thou letteſt fare shew forth thy doctrine agaſt woll thee ſupport looke thou ſpare maugre age though frete gnaſt aske age counſaile herein waſt boldely begin go forth proceſſe feare ſith thou art ſuch ſureneſſe graunt mercie lord ſith thee doeth like licenſe woll dare boldly aſſail purpoſe ſcriptures autentike werke woll ground vnderſet fortefie aſpire beginning thou wood furie alecto thy ſuſters eſpeciall mother ielouſie iuno call explicit prologus remedy love book drawn moſt part proverb solomon warning take heed deceitful company
