woman werke ſo ſhall ſee rede incongruitie impeche ordinately behoueth firſt procede deduction thereof manner leche patient ſikneſſe oweth firſt ſeche known medicin ſhould applie ſhortly ſhape remedie right ſo counſaile willing thee exhort yong man proſperous doth abound thy floures luſt belongeth thee ſort firſt conſider root ground thy miſcheefe plainly found woman farced fraud deceit thy confuſion moſt allectiue bait fly miſwoman leaſt ſhe thee deceiue thus ſaith salomon tauȝt fully falſhed woman day conceiue lip ſtrumpet ben ſweeter hony throte ſaith ſoupled oil flatery howbeit end effect bitterer wormwood gall fly miſwoman louing thy life ware ſtraungers bland eloquence straunge call thy wife beauty haue concupiſcence countenaunce pretending beneuolence beware ſignes eye ſo amiable hold ferme ben deceiuable lo enſample woman ſignes countenaunce ſhortly woll ſhew thee louers three loued one woman right entirely ech knew others maladie wherefore daily labour coud approch next fauour ſundry ſeaſons fortune requireth seuerally came ſee welfare one happened loue ſo fireth ſee lady would ſpare others coming none ware till mette whereas place lady ſaw deſired face ſupper ſet full ſmally eat full ſober demure countenaunce taried none hem meat lady giue attendaunce ſecret wiſe ſome ſignifiaunce loue haue perceiuing ſhe fetely executed thus properte due ſeaſon ſhe alway eſpied euery thing execute conueniently one louer firſt friendly ſhe eied ſecond ſhe offred cup courteſly third ſhe gaue token ſecretly vnderneath bord ſhe trade foot entrailes tikled hert root leaue might ask queſtion maiſters ſelve loues trace likely belongeth ſolution theſe three ſtood grace clerely anſwere ye would ask long ſpace matter doubtfull opinable acertaine woll ſelfe enable foreſaid three ſelfe one man anſwere better hertely v beloued none wattes packe bare laſt ſelfe gan aſpie time thought left y• daunce thoughtfull hert great thy greuaunce hence fro hence endite halpe aye afore ye muſes nine whilom ye wont mine • light penne direct braine illumine lenger ala may ſewe doctrine freſh luſtie metre wont make haue afore vtterly forſake come hither thou hermes ye fury fer ben vnder v nigh y• nether pole pluto reigneth king infernall send thine arpies ſend anguiſh dole miſerie wo leaue ye ſole right preſent muſt pain eke turment pale death beſeemeth abſent call lothſome ſort pain tencreaſe ſorows augment worthie bare comfort thus ſith haue conſumed miſpent day 5 fold talent lord committed cant recompence may derely abie negligence path penaunce yet woll reuert well grace mercy fetch deſpiſeſt god meeke contrite hert cock crow ala y• would retch yet late ſecond wetch mercy ſhall purchaſe inceſſaunt cry mercy lord euer ſhall ſing well maiſt thou wail wicked woman thou ſhuldeſt deceiue thus innocent recompence ſinne ſo al men wol make leue monument ſhewing part thy falſhed mine entent much cannot well wote cauſe ſheweth plainly yt thus wrote ye yearth parchment ſcribable speedie hand manner wood hewed proportioned pen able water inke damme flood euery man parfit scribe good curſedneſſe yet deceit woman coud ſhewed meane pen flie odious reſemblaunces deuils brond call woman might whereby man encenſed miſchaunces ſtinking roſe faire ſight deadly empoyſon like y• ſugar white ſweetneſſe cauſeth man taſt ſodainly ſleeth bringeth laſt manner vſe ſuch language doctrine may lawfully woll holly ground authoritie ſage willing wiſedome vertue edifie wine woman apoſtaſie cauſe wiſemen fall ſay wiſedome cauſe forget way wherefore wiſeman doth thee aduiſe whoſe word found leaſing ſtraunger ſit wiſe thy wife fall clipping beware eke kiſſing keep wine altercation leaſt thine hert fall inclination may man thinkeſt hide ſafe lay fire boſome without empairement brenning clothes whider may walke hote cole foot brent ſaith nay whereby ment foreſaid prouerbe ſimilitude thou ridde thee plainly denude flatterer forgetting gide gide youth mean ſhamefaſtnes ſhuld cauſe maidenhead abide god beheſt eke ſhe full recheles retching committeth forgetfulnes neither god ne ſhame hauing place need muſt ſuch woman lacke grace neigh way ſinne tourne grace ſhall lacke influence pathes life come wherefore firſt friend thee sapience remembring god prudence thine owne weale thee keepe vnto thine hert leaſt word creepe book take moſt ground prouerbes ſage salomon telleth tale plainly found fifth chapiter whider deed meekely feined inſtruction let clerkes determine ſure much like thing haue vre window ſaith looked fair yong people ſaw many among hem looked yong man fortuned lent mine eye eſtraunged mind likely ſtreet corner nigh hous went eye right curious day light gan withdraw night approched twilight woman came met ſaw talking vnder ſhade night bleſſed god qd ſhe might hath fulfilled mine heart deſire aſſaked paine hote fire yet mine authour skill follow muſt tell arrayment full nice ſoules like ſpill nice countenaunce yet garment jangling ſhe reſt impatient wandring ſtill place ſhe ſtode reſtleſſe ſhe yode houſe ſtrete corner ſhe ſtandeth await inceſſauntly buſie pray gete bring lure ſhe doth lait left vnto matter ſtrait woll tourne againe ſhe mette sweetly kiſſed friendly hem grette word curteſie many diuerſe right part haue told purpoſe reherſe ſhe flattering ſaid viſage bold haue made vowes offering manifold thy ſake mine hert loue dere day thanke god performed therefore came made thus aſtart deſirous welfare ſee haue ſeene pleaſed mine hert faith ſhall none haue loue ye true pray hertely dere hert come home man ſhould ſo welcome good faith ſooth ſay comming ran thought herke eare bed freſh gay haue behanged tapettes new bought egipt far country brought steined many luſtie freſh hue exceeding gold iaſper value chamber ſtrowed mirre inſence ſote ſauoring aloe ſinamome breathing aromatike redolence surmounting olibane man dome ye ſhall betweene breaſts reſt ye come let v haue deſired halſing may ſafe till morning mine husband home went forth journey farre way hence bagge money hath hent thought needfull expence vnto word giue faith credence moone yong light dull ere come home woll full thus craftely hath ſhe beſette lime roddes panter ſnare ſelie ſoule caught nette ſugred mouth ala nothing ware thus left graceleſſe bare helpe comfort ghoſtly ſuccour furthermore ſaith mine authour beaſt led death doth pant yong man followeth ſtound wanton lambe full ignorant pulled drawen bound vnto time hath death wound like bird haſteth grin knowing perill life therein gentle ſonne ſaith salomon take hede word thy breaſt keepe make faſt let thy mind way miſlede deceiued leſe thy taſt many hath ſhe wounded many doune caſt many ſtrong hath loſt breath way way hell leading death little narration precedent woman manifold gilt attend yong man ala ſhe hath ſhent deceiued husband next friend theſe god ſhe doth offend break ſpouſail weight furdermore ſhew woman craft ſleight woman dore ſate ſtall ſee folke paſſe ſtreets cite eye countenance eke ſhe gan call prety one come nere come hither ye piggeſnye ye little babe laſt ſhe ſaid yong man hartleſſe deceit vnware defenceleſſe much ſweeter ſhe ſaith acceptable drinke ſtollen priuely tha taken forme auowable bread hid gotten jeoperdouſly muſt need ſweet ſemblably veniſon ſtolne aye ſweeter ferther narrower fet better woman ſaith salom feſtes yong man woteth ſhe doth fede dark deepneſſe hell ben gheſts beware yong man therefore thee rede cheefly thy good ſpede werk compile haue take charge muſt pity charity enlarge ſelie man thus begiled husband mean woll wepe waile painfull infortune whereby reuiled cauſeleſſe neuer conuaile euery man yong old woll aſſaile word occaſion loth name ala good ſoule nothing blame ſhe coud ſo ill wold blame demerite leaue opprobrous name cokold aproper diſpite ranſake yet would might worde true ortographie diſcent ethimologie well ground firſt inuencion know ortographie muſt deriue coke cold compoſicion reaſon nigh contriue written know beliue yet lo reaſon ground theſe two wordes compound one cauſe giue judgement themilogie let v firſt behold eche letter hole word doth repreſent c put colde old k knaue thus diuers men hold firſt parte name haue found let v ethimologiſe ſecond firſt finder ment ſure c calot haue l leude demeanure craft enuentour ye may ſee lo one name ſignifieth perſones two colde old knaue cokold himſelfe wening eke calot leude demeaning ſecond cauſe thimpoſicion foreſaid name jealouſie jelouſe greateſt occaſion cokold men aſpie though paſſion firie continuell feruence heete pacient aye ſuffreth cold feete jelous aye drede full melancolie gallie ire wiues noſe ſhe miſſe trede woll cut ye conſpire death woll deſire ſhe perceiuing braſteth gall anone great woodneſſe doth fall ſoone ſhe hath knit knot tame ſo ramagious mekely ſitteth doune taketh lot layed lookes ſo furious late cocke bataylous hote quarell auenge bold called coke cold ſaying curteſie diſſonant ſeemeth malice grewe rude treatiſe woll plant parcell thereof onely ſhewe opinion talcatife ſhrewe ill ſaying euer merie man thereof ſo werie parcell booke woll graffe ſome ſad counſaile whereby wedded man daigne looke better ſhall mowe gie prouide ſaid infortunie haue ſaid complaine woll partener great paine moſt expedient weale would jelouſie abject jelous conceale labour circumſpect know wayes ſeeme ſuſpect breake one word broken woll miſſe ſhe woll wroken forbid thou noldeſt haue looke thing ſhe forbod thing ſhe moſt prone namely ill good till executed ſhe nigh wood soch woman ſoch feat craft craft labour defeat thou hereafter ſingle man shouldeſt jelous thou haddeſt wife wedde thou truſt woman el ſhouldeſt lede carefull life thou moſt lotheſt ſhould full rife yet nill gaineſay matrimonie melius eſt nubere quam uri ſay better wedlocke wife take church doth kenne vnder fleſhes yoke fleſhly luſt alway brenne ſaid jelous menne liue chaſte hold laſſe ill wedde ſelf ſpill ſingle man yet wedde wedded man thus rede warne farre ſpedde late forbedde let take owne need soch counſaile told theſe word folowing eke behold thy water keep wiſeman doth teach thou wiſe let haue iſſue narow rifte way woll ſeach ſemblably woman vntrue giue free walke al wiſe eſchue ſhe large thine hand walke woll thee ſhame thou ſhalt balke wedded ſingle thus ſaith wiſeman day night euermore lithe thy boſome wife yet lemman loue hote leaſt thou repent ſore leaſt ſhe thee bring ſome ill lore thy wife loue yet nill ſupport thou dote thus thee exhort lo thou loue loue eke thine honeſtie ſhe idell woll betide ſhe ſit idell neceſſitie mind woll ſearch ferre eke wide namely ſhe accompanide accompanied yong men maiden meane woman maiden ſeruants right conuenient houſe helpe doe ſeruice ſhe may vſe commaundement ſeaſon owne deuice teach hem good yeue thine aduice make huſwiues thus buſineſſe may yet refraine idleneſſe bide thou wolt haue thine entent might letting craftely encourage thereto meanes commending moch duely menging praiſe blame thy reaſon firſt praiſe wiſely place ſeaſon faithfull hert full tender one thing call remembraunce though wit ſlender power ſuffiſaunce purpoſe make purueyaunce sith woman nature vnchaungeable freale ware alſo diſceiuable thy wife excellently good none better diſpoſicion proceſſe time ſhe might turn mood ſome miſſe liuers inſtigacion diuers men thilke occupacion aplien daily minde eke hert goodneſſe woman peruert thou aſpie ſuſpect perſon draw thy wife beware wiſe thy ſuſpeccion breake one worde though thine herte agriſe kindle fire ſmoke woll ariſe though corrupt entent perauenture aſſent explicit complaint mar venus gladeth ye louers morowe graie lo venus riſen among row rede floures freſhe honour ye daie y• ſun vpriſt wold ſprede ye louers lie drede flieth leaſt wicked tongue aſpie lo yonde sun candell jelouſie tear blew wounded hert taketh leue ſaint iohn borow apeſeth ſomewhat paine ſmert time cometh eft yt ceſſen ſhall ſorow glad night worth heauy morow saint valentine foule thus heard ſing vpon thy day sun gan vp ſpring yet ſang foule rede awake ye haue choſen humble wiſe without repenting cheſeth make yet leaſt renoueleth ſeruice ye haue full choſen deuiſe confermeth perpetually dure paciently taketh auenture worſhip high feaſt yet woll briddes wiſe ſing ſentence complaint leaſt wofull mar made departing fro freſh venus morowning phebus firie torch rede ranſaked hath euery louer drede whilome three heauens lorde aboue well heauenlich reuolucion deſert hath wonne venus loue ſhe hath take ſubiection maiſtreſſe taught leſſon commaunding neuer ſeruice ſo bold louer diſpiſe ſhe forbade iealouſie cruelty boſte tyranny made luſt ſo humble tall ſhe dained caſt iye tooke patience liue die thus ſhe bridleth maner nothing ſcorning chere reigneth bliſſe venus hath worthy knight gouernance ſingeth mar y• ſerueth thus faire venus cauſer pleaſaunce bint perpetuel obeyſaunce ſhe binte loue euer ſo treſpace diſceuer thus kint reignen heuen loking moſt fell tide aſſent ſet ſteuen mar ſhall entre faſt may glide next palais abide walking courſe till ſhe ytake prayed haſt ſake ſaid thus mine herts lady ſweete ye know well miſchief place ſikerly till meete life ſtante auenture grace ſee beaute face drede death may ſmert luſts eaſe mine hert hath ſo great compaſſion knight dwelleth ſolitude till ſhe come ſtode ſo ilke time wight counſailed ne ſaid welcome nigh wit ſorow ouercome wherfore ſhe ſpedded faſt way almoſt one day tway great ioy betwix hem two mette may tong tel unto bedde go thus ioy bliſſe let hem dwell worthy mar yt knighthood well floure fairneſſe happeth arm venus kiſſeth mar god arm soiourned hath mar rede chambre amidde palais priuely certaine time till fell drede phebus yt commen haſtely within palais yates ſturdely torch hond yt ſtremes bright venus chambre knockeden ful light chambre lay freſh queene depainted white bole grete light ſhe knew ſhon ſo ſhene phebus cam bren hem hete ſilly venus ny dreint teares wete enbraſeth mar ſaid ala die torch come y• al world wol wrie vp ſterte mar liſt ſleepe lady herde ſo complaine nature weepe inſtede teares eyen twaine firy ſparcles ſprongen paine hente hauberke lay beſide flie wold nought ne might himſelf hide throweth helme huge weight girt ſwerde honde mighty ſpeare wont feight ſhoketh ſo almoſt wonde full heuy walken ouer londe may hold venus company flie leaſt phebus eſpy woful mar ala maiſt thou ſain palais thy diſturbaunce art left behind peril ſlain yet double thy penaunce ſhe hath thine hert gouernance paſſed halfe ſtremes thine eyen thou nere ſwift wel maiſt thou wepe crien flieth nenus ciclinius tour void corſe fear phebus light ala hath ſhe ſocour ſhe ne found ne ſey maner wight eke ſhe littel might wherefore ſelven hide ſaue within gate ſhe fledde caue darke caue ſmoking hell nat two paas within yate ſtood naturel day darke let dwell wol ſpeake mar furious wood ſorow wold haue ſeene hert blood sith yt might haue done company ne rought mite die feble wext hete wo nigh ſwelt might vnneth endure paſſeth ſterre day two neuertheles al hevy armure foloweth liues cure whoſe departing tooke greater yre brenning fire walketh ſoftly paas complayning pitie ſaide lady bright venus ala euer ſo wide compas ſphere ala ſhall mete hert dere twelve dayes april endure ielous phebus miſauenture god helpe ſely venus alone god wold happed y• weping venus made mone ciclinius riding chyuanche fro venus valanus might palais ſee venus ſalueth maketh chere receiueth frende full dere mar dwelleth forth aduerſite complayning ever departing wt complaint remembreth therefore luſty morowning beſt wol ſaine ſing woll leaue take god yeue euery wight ioy make complaint mar order complaint requireth skilfully wight ſhal plain pitouſly mote cauſe wherfore yt men plain men may deme plaineth folily cauſeles ala wherfore ground cauſe al pain troubled witte may attain wol reherſe haue redreſſe declare ground heuineſſe firſt time ala wrought certain effect hider brought lorded intelligence yaue trew ſeruice thought euermo dere haue bought ſo great excellence wight yt ſheweth firſt offence ſhe wroth taketh cure may long ioy love endure fained mater tell lady ſours well beaute luſte fredome gentilneſſe rich array dere men ſell diſport frendly dwell loue play benigne humbleſſe ſowne inſtruments al ſweetneſſe thereto ſo well fortuned thewed yeworld goodnes ſhewed wonder though ſet ſeruice ſoch one may knet wele wo ſith lithe might therfore myne hert euer hette ne trewly death ſhall lette ben treweſt ſeruaunt knight flatter nat may wete euery wight day ſeruice ſhall dye grace ſee neuer eye ſhall plaine diſtreſſe may help may hert redreſſe shall complaine vnto lady free nay certes ſhe hath ſoch heauineſſe feare eke wo geſſe littel time would bane bee ſhe ſafe force mee ala euer louers endure loue ſo many perilous auenture though ſo louers trewe metal forged newe many caſe hem tideth oft ſorowe somtime lady woll nat hem rewe somtime ielouſie knewe might lightly lay heed borow somtime enuious folk tongs horow deprauen hem ala may pleaſe befalſe louer hath eaſe auaileth ſoch long ſermonun auentures loue vp doun wol retourne ſpeaken paine point diſtructioun right lady ſaluacioun affray plaine herte ſweete lady ſoueraine diſeaſe ought wel ſwoun ſwelt though none harme ne drede felt fine made god ſit ſo hie beneth loue companie ſtraineth folke loue mauger heed ioy aught eſpie ne laſteth twinckling eye ſome haue neuer ioy till deed meaneth miſtiheed wherto conſtraineth folke ſo faſt thing deſire ſhould laſt though made louer loue thing maketh ſeem ſtedfaſt yet putteth ſoch miſauenture reſt ni yeuing wonder ſo iuſt king doth ſuch hardneſſe creature thus whether loue breake el dure algates hath loue done hath wo chaunged moone ſeemeth hath louers enmite like fiſher men may day ſe baited angle hoke ſome pleaſance til many fiſh wood till ceaſed therwith erſt hath deſire therwith miſchaunce though line breke hath penance hoke wounded ſo ſore wage hath euermore broche thebe ſoch kinde full ruby ſtones inde euery wight ſet eye wende anone worth mind ſore beaute wold hert bind till thought muſt die ſhould dry soch wo drede aye welnigh feare ſhould mad fro poſſeſſion double wo paſſion ſo faire jewell hath forgo yet broche concluſion cauſe confuſion wrought enfortuned ſo euery wight ſhold haue wo therfore worcher vice coueitour ſo nice fareth louers though lady haue ſo great beaute mad till gette grace cauſe mine aduerſite wrought mote thee put ſoch beaute face made coueiten purchaſe mine owne death wite die mine vnwit ever clambe ſo hie hardy knight renowne sith ye deviſtowne al worthy ſo great name yet ſaine theſe clerkes patrone therfore ye ought haue ſome compaſſion diſeaſe take nat game proudeſt may made ful tame wherfore pray gentileſſe ye complaine mine heauineſſe ye lady true ſtable way kind ye ought ben able haue pite folke paine haue ye cauſe cloth ſable sith empres honorable deſolate wel ought plaine ſhould holy teares fall raine ala honour emprice nigh deed drede ne cheuice complaineth eke ye louers fere unfained humble chere euer redy ſocour complaineth yt euer hath dere complaineth beaute freedome manere complaineth endeth labour complaineth thilke enſample al honour neuer gentilneſſe kytheth therfore ſome kindneſſe complaint venus ni ſo high comfort pleaſance heauineſſe haue • ayſer remembraunce vpon manhood worthineſſe vpon trouth ſtedfaſtneſſe whoſe al may dure ought blame creature euery wight praiſeth gentilleſſe bounte wiſdome gouernaunce wel man witte geſſe grace hath wolde ſo ferforth auance knighthood parſite richeſſe honour honoureth nobleſſe thereto ſo well hath fourmed nature foreuer enſure euery wight praiſeth gentilleſſe nat withſtanding ſuffiſaunce gentil herte ſo great humbleſſe word werke countenance ſerue beſineſſe ſette ſikerneſſe thus ought bliſſe well mine auentour sith liſt ſernen honour euery wight praiſeth gentilleſſe certes loue right couenable men ful dere abie thy noble thing wake bedde faſten table weping laugh ſing complainings downe caſt viſage looking often chaunge viſage countenaunce play ſleeping dremen daunce reuers glad feeling ielouſie hanged cable wold al know eſpying doth wight nothing ſo reaſonable al ni harme imagining thus dere loue yeuing oft yeueth without ordinaunce ſorow ynough little pleſaunce reuers glad feeling little time yeft greable full accombrous vſing ſubtel ielouſie diſceiuable full often time cauſeth diſtourbing thus ben euer drede ſuffring certaine languiſhen penaunce haue wel oft many hard miſchance reuers glad feling certes loue ſay ſoch wiſe ſcape • ace ment ſo long haue ſeruice lete neuer aſſent force though ielouſie tourment suffiſeth ſee may therfore certes ending day loue beſt ſhal neuer repent certes loue well aduiſe eſtate yt man may repreſent haue ye made franchiſe thefe beſt euer earth went loue well hert look thou neuer ſtent lette iealous put aſſay paine woll ſay nay loue beſt ſhall neuer repent herte thee ought ynough ſuffice loue ſo high grace ſent choſe worthy wi • e moſt agreable vnto mine entent seek ferther neither way ne went sith ye haue ſuffiſaunce vnto pay thus wol end complaining lay loue beſt ſhall neuer repent ¶lenuoy prince receiueth complaining gree vnto excellent benignite direct litel ſuffiſaunce elde ſpirite dulleth mee hath enditing ſubtelte welnigh berafte remembraunce eke great penaunce sith rime engliſh hath ſoch ſcarcite folow word word curioſite granſonflour hem y• make fraunce explicit letter cupid letter made thomas occleve office privy seale chaucer scholar termed treatiſe converſation men woman little iſland albion got ſuch hatred among gentlewoman court inforced recant book called planctas proprius cvpid vnto whoſe commaundement gentill kinrede goddes hie people infernal obedient mortall folke ſeruen buſely goddeſſe ſonne cythera onely tho deite ſubjects hertely greeting ſend general woll ye know lady honour reuerence gentilwomen hauen ſowe soch ſeed complaint audience men hem outrage offence eares grieueth pitous theffect matere paſſing londes litell yle cleped albion moſt complaine ſay crop rote guile con tho men diſſimule faine ſtanding dropes eyen twaine hertes feeleth diſtreſſe blinden woman doubleneſſe word ſpoken ſo ſighingly ſo pitous chere countenaunce euery wight meaneth trewly deemeth herte haue ſuch greuaunce ſay ſo importable penaunce lady luſt ſhew hem grace right anone muſt ſteruen place ah lady mine ſay enſure doth grace ſhall euer life may laſt endure humble low ech degre poſſible keep thing ſecre right ſelfe liſt el mine herte mote braſt two ful hard know man herte outward may man trouth deme word mouth may none ſterte reſon ſemed euery wight queme ſaid herte would ſeme faithful woman full innocence thou art diſceiued falſe apparence proceſſe moueth oft woman pite wening thing theſe men ſey graunt hem grace benignite men ſhould ſake dey good hert ſette hem wey blisfull loue keepe conne thus otherwhile woman bethe ywonne man y• pan hath y• ſtele fully poſſeſſioun y• woman keepeth dele may finde toun woman blind affectioun vnto beſtow yuel mote preue man othes hard beleeue euery falſe man hath make unto euery wight light know traitour woman hath forſake faſt ſpedeth unto felow til herte low falſe diſceit may ſuffiſe traiſon telleth wiſe faire auaunt honour man himſelf accuſe thus diffame good confeſſe himſelf traitour bring woman ſclandrous name tell body hath ſhame worſhip may thus conquer great diſclaunder vnto nay yet reprefe vertue ſhe wrought brewed hath miſchefe ſpake ſo faire faſ • inward thought ſclaunder reſon ought vnto thanke perpetuell ſoch need help ſo well although men ſleight ſubtilty ſely ſimple innocent woman betraied wonder ſith city troy ſ • orie tell betrayed diſceit man ſet fyre downe ouerthrowe finally deſtroied men knowe betray nat men city great king wight ſhape remedy ayenſt theſe falſely purpoſed thing crafte ſoch craftes eſpy man whoſe witt ever redy taply thing ſowning falſhede woman bethe ware falſe men rede farthermore theſe men vſage nat likely ſpeed soch ben double viſage procuren purſewe need prayeth cauſe proceed largely guerdoneth travaile litel wote woman men hem aſſaile another wretch vnto felow ſaith thou fiſheſt faire ſhe thee hath fired falſe inconſtaunt hath faith rode folke ſo deſired horſe fro day day ſhe hired thou twinneſt fro company commeth another blered thine eye pricke faſt ride thy journey thou art ſhe behind thy back liberall ſhe woll nothing withſey ſmattly another take ſmack thus fare theſe woman pack ſo hem truſteth hanged mote bee ever deſire chaunge nolveltee whereof proceedeth envy himſelfe ne winne may ſpeaketh reprefe villany man blabbing tonge wont alway thus diver men full oft make aſſay diſtourbe folke ſondry wiſe may obtaine empriſe many one eke would good hath love time ſpent vſed men wiſh lady asking withſtood ere plainly refuſed waſte vaine muſed wherefore none remedy lady ſhaperh ly cvery woman ſaith light gete none ſay nay ſhe well yſought ſo may leiſer trete purpoſe ſhall fayle nought madneſſe ſo depe brought ſhende open homelyneſſe loven woman doten geſſe ſlaunder woman thus may profite gentilleſſe namely hem arme ſhould defence woman hem delite ordre gentilleſſe wold man liſt gentill hold muſt eſchewe y• thereto contrary ſclaundrous tonge great adverſary foule vice tonge light ſo moch clappeth gabbeth oft tonge man ſo ſwift ſo wight reiſed vp loft reaſon ſhewed ſo ſlowly ſoft never ouertake may lord ſo theſe men truſty aſſay albeit men find one woman nice inconſtaunt rechleſſe variable deignous proude fulfilled mallice without faith love diſceivable sly queint falſe vntruſt coulpable wicked feirſe full cruelte yet followeth ſoch woman y• high god aungels fourmed among hem none founden malicious bad yet men wote many one pride fill fro heven anone shuld men thy yeve al angel proud name nay thee ſuſteineth blame twelve apoſtles one traitour remnant yet good trew hap men find percaas woman falſe ſoch good eſchew deme yt therfore vntrewe ſee well men owne falſeneſſe hem cauſeth woman truſt leſſe every man ought herte tendre vnto woman deeme honorable ſhape thicke ſlendre good badde fable every wight wote wit hath reſonable woman diſcended ſhame ſpeake amiſſe wicked tree good fruite may none forth bring ſoch fruite tree take heed thou toke thy beginning let thy mother mirrour vnto thee honour thou wolte honoured bee diſpiſe manere leſt thereby thy wickedneſſe appere old proverbe ſayd engliſh bird foule full diſhoneſt hold full churliſh vſeth defoule owne neſt men ſay well woman beſt naught diſpiſe hem ne depraue woll honour keep ſaue lady ever complain hem clerk made bookes diffame diſpiſe woman werks ſpeak hem great reprofe ſhame cauſeleſſe yeve hem wicked name thus diſpiſed every ſide diſclaundred blowen full wide tho ſory bookes maken mencion woman betraide eſpeciall adam david sampſon salomon many one mo may reherſe hem treaſon ſhall world malice may comprehend clerkes ſaine hath none end ouide boke called remedy loue great reprofe woman writeth wherein trowe great foly euery wight yt ſoch caſe deliteth clerkes cuſtome enditeth woman proſe time vers say wicked know reuers y• boke ſcholers lerned childhede woman beware ſhould age loue hem euer drede sith diſceiue ſet corage ſay perel men ſhould caſt thauauntage namely ſoch men haue bewrapped many man woman hath miſhapped charge ſo theſe clerkes ſaine writing doe cure labour trauayle vaine betweene lady nature shall ſuffred y• world may dure thus theſe clerkes cruell tyranny ſelie woman kithen maiſtry whilom many hem cheine tied vnwedly age vnluſt may loue atteine ſaine loue dotage thus hemſelfe lacken courage folke excite wicked ſawes rebell ayenſt lawes mauger hem blame woman moſt force mine impreſſion ſodainly fell boſte wrong imagination ſhall election fouleſt • lutte toune refuſe luſt con muſe herte brenningly deſire though ſhe ducheſſe queene folkes hertes ſet ſire liſt ſend hem joy teene woman whet ſo kene ſharpe perſing ſtrokes ſmite shul fele know kerue bite parde clerke ſubtill ouide many another diſceiued haue woman know full wide men great deinty excellent clerke mo couden full well preach betrapped aught yt coud teach truſteth well maruaile woman knowen plainly entent wiſt ſoftly coud aſſaile hem falſhede hert mente thus clerkes daunger hente venime another deſtroied thus theſe clerkes oft anoied theſe lady ne theſe gentile neuertheleſſe none tho wrought wiſe ſoch vertuleſſe quitten thus theſe old clerkes wiſe clerkes leſſe ought ſuffiſe diſpraue woman generally worſhip ſhull none gette thereby theſe men louers hem pretend woman faithfull good true dredde hem diſceiue offend woman loue hem would eſchue euery day hath man herte newe one abide forſe ſuch wight beguile men beare eke woman vpon hond lightly without paine wonen wight withſtond diſeaſe liſt hem complaine ſo freele may hem refraine ſo liketh hem may lightly haue hertes eaſie graue maiſter iohan de moone ſuppoſe leude occupacioun making romante roſe many ſigh imaginacioun perilies rollen vp doun long proceſſe ſo many ſlight cautell diſceiue ſely damoſell nought ſay ne wit comprehend art pain ſubtilty ſhould ſaile conquere ſone make end men feble place ſhall aſſaile ſone alſo vanquiſh battaile wight may make reſiſtence ne herte hath none make defence mote follow neceſſitee sith art asketh ſo great engine paine woman diſceiue ſo ſhe bee conſtaunce ſo baraine ſome theſe clarkes ſaine woman ought bee sadde conſtant fulfilled pitee frendly medea iaſon conquering flece gold falſly quit true affection victory gate wold may man ſhame ſo bold falſen fro death ſhame kept gate ſo great priſe name troy alſo traitour eneas faithleſſe wretch forſwore dido queene cartage releued ſmertes ſore gentilleſſe might ſhe haue ſhe herte vnfained kidde miſchief therof betidde legend nature may men find ſo liketh therein rede othe ne beheſt may man bind reprouable ſhame haue drede mannes herte trouth hath ſtede ſoil naught may trouth grow woman namely vnknow clerkes ſaine alſo malice vnto woman wicked crabbidneſſe woman ſhalt thou thy ſelf cheuice sith men thee ſoch harme witneſſe beth ware woman ſikelneſſe kepe thine owne men clappe crake ſome hem ſhall ſmart vndertake malice woman drede ſlea man deſtroy citees ne oppreſſe folke ne ouerlede betray empire realmes duchees ne bireuen men land ne mees enpoiſon folke ne houſes ſet fire ne falſe contract make hire truſt parfite loue entire charitee feruent entalented corage thewes good ſitteth well bee haue woman euer cuſtome vſage well conne man ire aſſwage ſoft word diſcrete benigne inward ſhew outward ſigne woman herte vnto cruelty enclined charitable pitous deuoute full humility shame faſt debonaire amiable dredefull wordes meaſurable woman theſe haue parauenture followeth way nature men ſaine firſt mother natheleſſe made mankind leſe libertee naked joy doubtleſſe goddes heſte diſobeyed ſhe ſhe preſumed taſte tree god forbad ſhe eate therof ſhould ne deuill ſhe would enuious ſwelling y• fend foe vnto man herte wealth sent ſerpent made goe diſceiue eue thus man wealth birafte fende ſtealth woman knowing diſceipt god wote full ferre conceipt wherfore ſay good woman eue father adam diſceiued nought may man diſceipt preue properly ſhe herte thought compaſſed firſt ſhe wrought ſoch impreſſion men may call diſceipt reaſon ne wight diſceiueth purpoſe fend diſceipt caſt nothing ſhe wrong deeme ſuppoſe harme ſhe ſhould cauſe wyte fende maugre excuſed haue innocence saue onely ſhe brake obedience touching full fewe men vnnethes dare ſafely ſay fro day day men may day ſee heſte god diſobay haue mind ſirs pray ye diſcrete reaſonable ye woll hold excuſable men ſay man ſtedfaſtneſſe woman courage vnſtable may adam beare ſoch witneſſe telleth chaungeable caſe ſemblable saue willing fende diſceiued eue ſo ſhe adam leue yet ſinne happy mankind fende diſceiued ſleight aught coud ſleights wind treſpace came fro heauen height god diſcharge man weight fleſh blood tooke virgine ſuffred death deliuer pine god may nothing hid woman knowen ſoch malice men recorde hem generalte lady life reperatrice nolde haue borne ſhe vice voide full vertue well wiſt endowed borne liſt heaped vertue hath ſoch excellence leane man faculte declare therefore ſuſpence due prayſing put need muſt thus ſay verely ſhe next god beſt frend man longeth key mercy girdle hongeth mercy hath euery man ſoch need reſing farewell joy man power taketh right good heed mercy may well purchaſe diſpleaſeth honoureth woman woman ſake ye doe ſorow ſhall awake booke alſo ye find werkes death life ieſu ſpelleth maketh mind woman forſoke wo ſtrife wight ſo ententife woman proued none apoſtles forſoken euerichone woman forſoke fayth holy church woman left onely lee thus holy writ ſayth looke ye ſhall ſo finde hardely therefore may well preue thereby woman reigneth ſtable conſtaunce men chaunge variaunce thou precious gem martirs margarite thy blood dredeſt none effuſion thou louer true thou maiden manſuete thou conſtant woman thy paſſion ouercame fendes temptacion many wight converted thy doctrine vnto faith holy god thou virgine vnderſtandeth onely commend nought encheſon virginity truſteth came never thought ever werre ayenſt chaſtity ever ſhall lo meveth loving herte conſtant lay drive remembraunce ne may holdeth ferme ly true juſt commendacion woman tel flattery ne bicauſe pride elacion onely lo entencion yeve hem courage perſe veraunce vertue honour avaunce vertue laſſe pride vertue ſo digne ſo noble kind vice woll fere abide putteth vice cleane mind flieth fro hem leaveth hem behind woman vertue art hoſtreſſe great thy honour thy worthineſſe woll thus conclude define commaund miniſters echone ready ye heſtes encline theſe falſe men rebell fone ye puniſhment anone voide hem court baniſh hem ever therein come never fulfilled ceaſing delay looke none excuſacion written luſty moneth may paleis many million lover true habitation yere grace joyfull jocond thouſand foure hundred ſecond explicit ballade commendation lady thouſand ſtories coud mo rehearce old poetes touching matere cupide hertes gan ſo pearce ſervauntes ſetting hem fere lo fyne therrour fere lo love guerdon greuaunce ever wth wo ſeruaunts auaunce wherfore plainly wol ſtile dreſſe one ſpeake need woll faile ala dole ne ne may expreſſe paſſing priſe mervaile winde grace blowe unto ſaile auriate licour cleo write penne euſpire woll endite ala unworthy unable love ſoch one woman ſurmounting ſhe benigne merciable pity well eke ſpring wherefore laude praiſing ſupported grace right thus ſay kneeling tofore face ſterre ſterres thy ſtreames clere sterre ſea ſhipmen light gide luſty living moſt pleaſaunt appere whoſe bright beam y• cloudes may hide way life go ride hauen tempeſt ſureſt vp riue haue mercy thy joyes fiue rightful rule bote holineſſe lightſome line pity plain original beginning grace goodneſſe cleaneſt conduit vertue moſt ſouerain mother mercy trouble reſtrain chamber cloſet clenneſt chaſtity named brough deity cloſet garden void weedes wicke criſtallin welle clereneſſe clere conſigned fructified oliue oiles faire thick redolent cedre moſt dere worthy digned remember ſinners yt thee aſſigned wicked fendes wrath hem wreche lanterne light thou liues leche paradiſe pleaſaunce gladſome al good benigne braunchelet pine tree vinary enuermailed refreſher blood licour ayen al langour y• palled may blisful blomy bloſome biding bountee thy mantel mercy miſery ſprede er wo awake wrap v vnder thy wede rody roſier flouring without ſpine fountain filthleſſe byrel currant clere som drop thy graceful dew v propine light without nebule ſhining thy ſphere medicine miſcheues pucel without pere flame doun y• doleful light thine influence remembring thy ſeruants thy magnificence chriſten protectrice tutele retourne exiled put proſcripcion hem yt erren pathe ſequele wery forwandred tent pauilion faint freſh pauſacion vnto vnreſty reſt remedy fruitful tho affie hem rennen thou art itenerary blisfull brauy knight thy warre wery werkmen ſhe diourne denary mede vnto mariner haue ſailed farre laureate croune ſtreming ſtarre hem yt put hem palaſtre thy ſake cours conqueſt thou white lake mirth martyr ſweter sitole confeſſours alſo richeſt donatife vnto virgines eternal lauriole afore woman hauing prerogarife mother maide widow wife world none thou alone ſith thou may ſuccour mone truſtie turtle truefaſteſt true curteyſe columbe replete mekeneſſe nightingale thy note newe popiniay pured clenneſſe laueroke loue ſinging ſweetneſſe phebus awaiting till thy breſt light vnder thy wing domeſday v dight ruby rubified paſſion thy ſonne v haue among mind ſtedfaſt diametre duracion feres time might thou find none founden half ſo kind hardy herte louing creature loue y• made thee ſo endure semely ſaphre depe loupe blew ewage stable loupe ewage pitee ſay freſheſt viſage thou loueſt unchaunged hem y• ſeruen thee offence varying hem bee thou art ay redy vpon wo rue hem receiueſt herte full true goodly gladded gabriell joy thee grette y• may nombred half bliſſe coude write tell holy ghoſt thee obumbred wherthrough fends biterly encombred wemleſſe maide embeliſhed birth man angell thereof hadden mirth lo bloſme budde glory prophet ſo long ſpake beforne lo fame memory eſay ſo long ſhe borne lo dauid delicious corne lo ground life builde becomming man ranſome yelde glorious viole vite inuiolate firy titan perſing thy bemes whoſe vertuous briȝtnes breſt vibrat al world embeliſhed y• leams conſeruatrice king duke realm iſaies ſeede ſweet sunamite meſure mourning mine margarite ſoueraigneſt ſought sion cockle gold dewe aboue berained dew buſh vnbrent fireleſſe fire ſet flaming feruence heat pained daiſie weather ſtained fleece vndefouled gentileſt gedion fructifying faireſt yerd aaron mighty arch probatiſe piſ • ine laughing aurore peace oliue columpne baſe vp bearing abym nere conning diſcriue choſen ioſeph took wiue vnknowing childing miracle manly figure tabernacle haue none engliſh conuenient digne mine heart heale lady thee honour iuory clean therefore reſigne thine hand till thou liſt ſoccour helpe making floriſh flour ſhould ſhew loue brend ſongs making thy name commend coud thine excellence singen loue would fele euer ſtanden lady thy preſence ſhew open loue wele ſith although hert made ſtele withouten diſceueraunce jay vous toute fiance might loue euer better beſet lilly liking behold lace loue bond ſo well thou knit may ſee thee mine hert cold paſſe day old tofore ſinging euermore vtterly eyen two wol ſlea ſodainly loue langour bliſſed ſoch ſicknes sith hertily ſuffiſaunce el ſay diſtreſſe faire one hath mine herte gouernance begin eſperaunce feble entune though thine hert perce yet thy ſake letter reherce god wote muſike geſſe ala ſo might ſay ſing loue mine ſouerain maiſtreſſe euer ſhall without departing mirrour beauty ſhould ring remembraunce eke eyen clere thus fer ſouerain lady dere would god loue would ſ • sith ſake ſing day day herte nilt thou breake atwo sith lady dwell ne may thus many roundell many virelay freſh engliſh laiſer find record haue mind lady mine ſith loue drede vnchaunged euer find degree whoſe grace ne may fly fro womanhede disdaineth remember mine herte bleedeth may ſee ſith ye wote meaning deſirous plores pour moy sil vous plaiſt amoureus maruaile though pain departed ſoueraine fortune ala dont vient la deſtenie wiſe ne may attaine ſee beauty eyen twain wherefore ſay triſteſſe doth grame tant fait mal departir de dame nere wiſſing brought ſuch eſploit might ſay joy preſence mon coeur ce quae voulloit mon coeur higheſt excellence euer wight ſith mine aduertence reweth paine ſmert ſo ſore wounded herte liue well merry two louers yfere may ſay withouten blame man wild coud teach tame let go loue ſee game bridled vnto ſoberneſſe woman cheef princeſſe euer thought hert ſhuld enbrace vnto beſt remedy look goodly freſh face merry mirrour coud neuer eſpy coud would magnifie neuer none ſo faire ifound reken hem alſo roſamound finally mouth preſent double eye without repentaunce mine hert yeue lady entent ye ſhall holly therof haue gouernaunce taking leaue herts obeyſaunce salve regina ſinging laſt helpe thee call loue idleneſſe saue loue alone might thereto attaine ſo woll haue name gentilleſſe coun ••• le loue faine thou ſweet lady refute euery paine whoſe mercy moſt auaileth gie grace fortune faileth nought may told withouten fable high renome womanly beaute gouernaunce worſhip able putteth euery herte eaſe degree violet floure deſiree sith ſo amerous eſtreignes moy de coeur joyeus feruent herte breſt hath broſt fire lardant eſpoer en mon coeur point eſt mort dauoir lamour de celle que je deſire meane ſweet moſt pleaſaunt port et je ſay bien que ce neſt pa mon tort ſing ſo may mone departing alone liue alone though might would none cheſe ſeruice would founden ſadde therefore loue labour ye leſe longing foreſt ye ſtadde look vp louers right gladde ayenſt ſaint valentine day haue cheſe neuer forſake may explicit john gower unto noble king henry fourth noble worthy king henry ferthe gladde fortune befall people gouern vpon earthe god hath thee choſen comfort v worſhip land doun fall ſtant vpright grace thy goodneſſe euery man holde bleſſe high god juſtice alone right longeth thy regaly declared hath ſtand thy perſone god may man juſtifie thy title know vpon thine aunceſtrie land folke hath eke thy right affirmed ſtant thy reign god man confirmed man may ſay otherwiſe god himſelf ne hath y• right declared whereof land bound thy ſeruice defaut helpe hath long cared man hert ſpared loue ſerue worch thy pleaſaunce god purueiaunce thing god begonne followeth grace well gouerned thus tellen old book conne wherof lord wote well thou art lerned ask thy god ſo ſhalt thou warned requeſt reaſonable god vnto good fauourable king salomon asking god thing leueſt craue chaſe wiſdome vnto gouerning god folke would ſaue chaſe fill haue wit yt reign laſt gate peace reſt laſt alexander telleth ſtory vnto god beſought way world win victory vnder ſwerd might obay warre would pray mighty god behight beheſt world wanne conqueſt though fill thilke time ſo alexander asking hath atcheued ſinful worlde painem tho none hath y• high god beleued wonder though thilk world greued though tirant purpoſe might win vengeaunce infortune ſin faith chriſt come place among prince yearth ſitte hem well pity grace yet muſt tempored manere finden cauſe mattere vpon point afterward betide law right ſhall laid aſide may king warre voyage ordaine take thereto hold claime ask rightful heritage place withhold otherwiſe god himſelf wold affirme loue peace king peace y• beſt aboue earthly thing good eſchew war nathelees king may make war vpon right battaile final end pee thus ſtant law worthy knight vpon trouth may go fight ſo might cheſe better y• peace may man leſe ſtere peace ought euerich liue firſt ſette leige lord reſt eke theſe men ne ſtriue ſo land may ſtand beſt king would worthieſt might deadly war ceaſe ſhould worthineſſe increaſe peace chiefe world welth heauen leadeth eke way peace ſoul life mannes health peſtilence doth war away liege lord take heed ſay war may left take peace hand may without goddes ſand peace ſtant euery creature reſt without peace may life glad aboue good peace beſt peace hath himſelf werre al beſtad peace ſafe warre euer drad peace charity kay hath life ſoule way liege lord thee liſt ſeech ſoth enſamples wt war hath wrought thou ſhalt well wiſe mennes ſpeech deadly warre turneth nought theſe old book well yſought miȝt thou ſe thing y• war hath conqueſt conquerour alſo vain honour world good whilome ſtrong war made wher bethink well thy mood day gone night derke fade cruelty made hem glade ſorrowen yet haue nauȝt y• blood ſhad man mayreſtore warre mother wrong ſleeth prieſt holy church maſſe forlith maid doth flour fall warre maketh great city laſſe doth law rule ouerpaſſe ther nothing wherof miſcheef may grow cauſed warre trow war bringeth pouerty heel whereof commen people ſore greued war hath ſet cart thilk wheles fortune may nat beleued men wene beſt haue atcheued full oft new begin warre hath nothing ſiker tho win thy worthy prince chriſts halue part whoſe faith thou haſt guide ley old ſore new ſaue warre away ſo betide purchaſe peace ſet thy ſide ſuffer nat thy people deuoured ſhal thy name euer ſtand honoured man euer ayen peace thy preuy counſailour let god thy counſaile caas put away cruel warriour god man creatour would men ſlough creature without cauſe deadly forfaiture needeth moſt behoueth moſt looke lord ſo thy war without time paſſed heed tooke good home ſee right well euermore worſt dout thou mighteſt parfite peace attaine ſhould cauſe plaine king good counſaile preiſe aboue thing moſt vailable yet king within himſelf ſhall peiſe ſeene thing reaſonable upon ſhall wit ſtable among men ſet peace euin loue y• king heuin well ſhed neuer blood cauſe rightwiſeneſſe king peril vnderſtood ſlee people geſſe deadly warres heauineſſe whereof peace diſtourbed full oft ſome time ceaſe ſoft king fulfilled grace knighthode remember vpon point chriſts ſake peace profered vnto thy manhode thine honour ſaue let forſake though thou y• war darſt well vndertake reaſon yet temper thy courage like peace none auauntage worthy lord think well ſo befall thilke lore holy book ſaine chriſt head member well ſubject ſoueraigne ſitte well charity plaine vnto god himſelf moſt accordeth lore chriſts word recordeth old law chriſt himſelfe bore among ten commaundements rede manſlaughter ſhould forbore wil time godhede afterward chriſt toke manhede peace y• firſt thing let cry ayenſt world rancour enuy chriſt went earth ſtighed heuin made teſtament bequeath diſciples yaue peace y• foundement charity without whoſe aſſent world peace may neuer well tried ne loue kept ne law iuſtified iews y• painims hadden werre among hemſelf ſtode euer peace ſhould peace ſtand erre chriſt hath choſe vnto encreſe chriſt moyſes chriſt hath ſet parfite law ſhould wiſe withdraw yeue v peace cauſe chriſt dide without peace may nothing ſtond auailed man may ſee euery ſide chriſts faith euery day aſſailed painims deſtroyed ſo batailed defaut helpe defence vnneth hath chriſt due reuerence right faith keepe holy church firſt point named knighthode euery man hold worch vpon point ſtant manhode ala fame ſpred ſo brode euery man thing complaineth yet man helpe ordaineth world cauſe waited ouer warres ready full chriſts cauſe ſpeciall ben ſwerds ſpeares dull ſentence pope bull done folke paine obay church tourned another way wonder aboue man wit without war chriſts faith vpon earth yet ne keepe nat firſt begon euery creature vnder ſonne chriſt bad himſelfe ſhould preach folke euangely teach light keep make founden made tofore hond keepe let lightly ſlake peace chriſt hath al broke bond reſt ſelfe ſuffren euery lond ſlee thing vndefended ſtant war peace amended though head holy church aboue ne hole buſineſſe among people ſet peace loue theſe king oughten rightwiſeneſſe owne cauſe among hemſelfe redreſſe tho peter ſhip hath loſt ſtere lithe hem barge ſtere holy church duty chriſts word ne nat auiſed make peace accord vnity among king deuiſed yet natheles law ſtant aſſiſed man wit ſo reaſonable without ſtand himſelfe ſtable holy church ben child euery child hold bow vnto mother ever fall el muſt reaſon diſallow cauſe knight ſhall firſt auow right holy church defend man ſhall priuiledge offend thus good ſet euin world prince prelate loue king heuin men ſhould algate wexen wroth ſarazins vnto chriſt ben loth let men armed ayenſt hem fight may knight deed armes right vpon iii point ſtant chriſts peace oppreſſed firſt holy church ſelfe deuided ought reaſon firſt redreſſed yet ſo high cauſe decided thus humble patience prided remenaunt ſhould rule wonder though ſtand rule head ſicke limmes aken theſe reign chriſts peace belongen world good theſe deadly war maken helpeleſſe balaunce hongen head aboue hem hath nat vnderfongen ſet peace euery man ſleeth wiſe hath charity brother two defauts bringen third miſcreants ſeene debate two fallen amid day find open gate lo thus deadly warre ſtant algate euer hope king henry grace ſhall peace embrace worthy noble prince king annoint god hath grace ſo preſerued behold ſee world vpon point thy part chriſts peace ſerued ſhall thy high mede deſerued ſhall quite laſt life may laſt see alexander hector iulius see machabeus dauid ioſue see charlemaiue godefray arthus fulfilled warre mortality fame abitte vanity death hath warres vnder foot hath made end boot many man ſoth wete know peace good euery king haue fortune warre euer vnknow peace y• march ſaue vp morrow vnder graue mighty god hath grace hand without men may long ſtand tennes win leſe chaſe may life wete ball ronne al ſtant god wt thing men ſhal purchaſe end begonne men ſaine woll well ſponne doth cloth ſtrong profitable el may neuer durable world chaunces vpon auenture ben euer ſet thilke chaunce pee ſo behouely creature aboue peerlees may beget nathelees among men laſt hert plaine without guile peace ſacrament tofore god ſhall word plaine without double entendement treated trouth cannot faine men within himſelfe ben vaine ſubſtaunce peace may trew euery day chaungeth vpon new charity parfite voideth ſleights ferre away ſet word vpon ſame plite hert hath found ſiker way thus conſcience truly way theſe ben handled wiſe ſhall abide ſtand wiſe apoſtle ſaith ther may life good grounded vpon charity charity ne ſhed neuer blood hath warre property thilke vertue ſaid pity charity ſo ferforth acquainted may falſe ſemblant painted caſſodore whoſe writing authoriſed saith pity reigneth grace y• peace hath al welth aſſiſed warre dredeth manace pity dwelleth ſame place may deadly cruelty ſojourne wherof mercy ſhould way tourne ſee pity forthwith mercy doth cronique rome thilke empire conſtantine tale ſooth leuer owne death deſire yong child martire cruelty left quarele pity wrought pity hele thilke man pity dede god pitous made hole silueſter came ſame ſtede yaue baptiſme firſt ſpeciall away ſinne originall lepre hath ſo purified pity euer magnified pity cauſe emperour hole body ſoule rome alſo ſet thilke honour chriſts faith ſo leue loth hadden chriſt tofore wroth receiued vnto chriſts lore thus ſhall pity praiſed euermore worthy liege lord henry name england haſt gouerne right men ought well thy pity proclaime openliche world ſight ſhewed helpe god almight yeue v peace long hath debated whereof thy priſe ſhall neuer abated lord whome hath euer yet found pity without ſpot violence keepe thilke peace alway within bound god hath planted thy conſcience ſhall cronique thy patience among ſaints taken memory legend perdurable glory thine earthly priſe ſo euery man hold commend gower thy liege man letter vnto thine excellence ſend euer vnto liues end woll pray ſtate thy perſone worſhip thy ſcepter thy throne onely king peace write theſe prince chriſten ech hem owne hert endite ſeaſe warre miſcheefe fall set eke rightfull pope vpon ſtall keepe charity draw pity hand maintaine law ſo peace ſhall ſtand explicit carmen de pacis commendatione quod ad laudem memoriam ſeremſſimi principis domini regis henrici quarti ſuus humilis orator johannes gower compoſuit electus chriſti pie rex henrici fuiſti qui bene veniſti cum propria regna petiſti tu mala viciſtique bonis bona reſtituiſti et populo triſti nova gaudia contribuiſti eſt mihi ſpes lata quod adhuc per te renovata succedent fata veteri probitare beata eſt tibi nam grata gratia ſponte data henrici quarti primus regni fuit annus quo mihi defecit viſus ad acta mea omnia tempus habent finem natura miniſtrat quem virtute ſua frangere nemo poteſt ultra poſſe nihil quamvis mihi velle remanſit amplius ut ſcribam non mihi poſſe manet dum potui ſcripſi ſed nunc quia curva ſenectus turbavit ſenſus ſcripta relinquo ſcholis scribat qui veniet poſt diſcretior alter ammodo namque manus mea penna ſilent hoc tamen fine verborum queſo meorum proſpera quod ſtatuat regna futura deus explicit ¶a saying dan iohn foure thinges maketh man foole honour firſt putteth outrage alder next ſolitary ſoole ſecond unweldy crooked age woman alſo bring men dotage mighty wine many diuers wiſe diſtempren folke holden wiſe ¶yet ſame ben four thing cauſing great foly honour firſt vnwildy age woman wine dare eke ſpecifie make wiſe men fallen dotage wherfore counſail philoſophers ſage great honour learne thine eſtate humilite balade de bon conſail befall god thee liſt viſite tourment adverſite thanke firſte lord thy ſelfe quite vpon ſuffraunce humilite found thou thy quarell ever make thy defence thou ſhalt loſſe remembrance chriſt croſſe explicit cuckow nightingale chaucer dreameth heareth cuckow nightingale contend excellency ſinging god love benedicite mighty howe great lord make low herts hy high low like dy hard herts maken free make within little ſtound ſicke folke hole freſh ſound hole make ſeeke bind vnbinden eke woll bounden vnbound tell might wit may ſuffice make wiſe folke full nice may woll device lithy folke deſtroyen vice proud herts make agriſe shortly ever woll may againſt dare wight ſay nay glad greve liketh woll lougheth ſiketh moſt might ſhedeth ever may every true gentle heart free thinketh againe may ſhall ſome ſtering joy el ſome mourning ſeaſon ſo much thinketh may bird ſing ſee floures leaf ſpring bringeth remembraunce manner eaſe medled grevaunce luſtie thought full great longing longing commeth hevineſſe thereof groweth great ſickneſſe lacke deſire thus may ben herts ſet fire brennen forth great diſtreſſe ſpeake feeling truly old vnluſty yet felt ſickneſſe may hote cold ax every day ſore ywis wote wight ſo ſhaken fever white may ſleepe lite alſo like heart ſhould ſleepy love firy dart woll ſmite lay night waking thought lover tokening among hem commune tale good nightingale rather leud cuckow ſing thought anon day would go ſome aſſay might nightingale yet none heard yere tho third night may anone day aſpide lenger would bed abide vnto wood faſt went forth alone boldely held way downe brooke ſide till came laund white green faire one never ground green ypoudred daiſie floures greues like hy greene white nothing el ſeene ſate downe among y• faire flour ſaw bird trip bours reſted hem night ſo joyfull dayes light began may done hour coud ſeruice rote many louely note ſong loud plained ſome manner voice yfained ſome full throte proyned hem made hem right gay daunceden lepten ſpray euermore two two fere right ſo choſen hem yere feuerere vpon ſaint valentine day riuer ſate vpon made ſuch noiſe ron accordaunt bird armony thought beſt melody might ben yheard mon delite wote neuer fell ſuch ſlomber ſwow nat aſleepe ne fully waking ſwow thought heard ſing ſorry bird leaud cuckow tree right faſt euill apaid god qd died crois yeue ſorrow thee thy leaud vois full little joy haue thy cry cuckow thus gan chide heard next buſh beſide nightingale ſo luſtely ſing clere voice ſhe made ring greene wood wide ah good nightingale qd little haſt thou ben ſong hen hath ben leaud cuckow ſongen ſongs rather haſt thou pray god euill fire bren woll tell wonder thing long lay ſwouning thought wiſt bird ment ſaid entent ſpeech good knowing heard nightingale ſay good cuckow go ſomewhere away let v ſingen dwellen euery wight eſcheueth thee thy ſongs ſo elenge good fay qd ſhe may thee aylen thinketh ſing well thou ſong true plaine though cannot crakell ſo vaine thou doſt thy throte wot neuer euery wight may vnderſtand mee nightingale ſo may done thee thou haſt many nice queint cry haue thee heard ſaine ocy ocy might know ſhould ah foole qd ſhe woſt thou ſay ocy ocy ywis meane would wonder faine ſhamefully yſlaine meanen ought againe loue amis alſo would tho dede thinke loue life lede ſo y• wol god loue ſerue dare well ſay worthy ſterue skill ocy ocy grede eye qd cuckow queint law euery wight ſhall loue draw forſake ſuch companie mine entent die ne neuer liue loues yoke draw louers ben folke ben liue moſt diſeaſe haue moſt vnthriue moſt endure ſorrow wo care leaſt feelen welfare needeth ayenſt trouth ſtriue qd ſhe thou art thy mind might thou thy churleneſſe find ſpeake loues ſeruaunts wiſe world none ſo good ſeruiſe euery wight gentle kind thereof truly commeth goodneſſe honour gentleneſſe worſhip eaſe heart luſt parfite joy full aſſured truſt iolitie pleaſaunce freſhneſſe lowlyhead largeſſe curteſie semelyhead true companie drede ſhame done amis truly loues ſeruaunt lother ſhamed die ſooth ſey beleeue liue dey cuckow ſo rede thou ywis qd let neuer haue bliſſe euer vnto counſaile obey nightingale thou ſpeakeſt wonder faire ſooth contraire loue yong folke rage old folke great dotage moſt vſeth moſt ſhall enpaire thereof cometh diſeaſe heuineſſe ſorow care many great ſickneſſe deſpite debate anger enuie deprauing ſhame vntruſt jelouſie pride miſcheefe pouerty woodneſſe louing office deſpaire one thing therein faire getteth loue little bliſſe alway therewith ywis may full ſoone age haue haire nightingale therefore hold thee ny leue well thy queint cry thou ferre long fro thy make thou ſhalt forſake thou ſhalt hoten doe fie qd ſhe thy name thee god loue ne let thee neuer ythee thou art worſe thouſandfold wood many one full worthy full good naught ne loue ybee euermore loue ſeruants amendeth euill tach hem defendeth maketh hem brenne right fire trouth worſhipfull deſire liketh joy inough hem ſendeth thou nightingale ſaid ſtill loue hath reaſon oft time vntrue folke eaſeth true folke ſo bitterly diſpleaſeth defaut courage let hem ſpill tooke nightingale keepe ſhe caſt ſigh deepe ſaid ala euer bore tene ſay one word right y• word ſhe braſt weepe ala qd ſhe hert woll breake hearen thus leaud bird ſpeake loue worſhipfull ſeruiſe god loue thou help ſome wiſe may cuckow awreake thought ſtert vp anone glad agone euermore cuckow flay said farewell farewell popingay though ſcorned alone came nightingale mee ſaid friend forſooth thanke thee thou haſt liked reſcow one auow loue make may woll thy ſinger thanked right well apaied ye qd ſhe thou diſmaied tho thou haue herd y• cuckow erſt liue ſhall amended next may affraied one thing woll rede thee alſo ne leue thou y• cuckow ne loues ſo hath ſaid ſtrong leaſing nay qd thereto ſhall nothing bring loue hath doe much wo ye vſe qd ſhe medicine euery day may thou dine go looke vpon freſh daiſie though thou wo point die ſhall full greatly • eſſen thee thy pine looke alway thou good trew woll ſing one ſongs new loue thee loud may crie ſhe began ſong full hie ſhrew hem loue vntrue ſhe ſong end farewell qd ſhe mote wend god loue right well may much joy ſend thee day yet louer euer ſend thus taketh y• nightingale leaue pray god alway joy loue ſend euermore ſhilde v fro cuckow lore ſo falſe bird forth ſhe flew gentle nightingale bird dale gate hem place fere beſoughten hem would diſeaſe thus began tale cuckow well hide cuckow faſt haue chide euer ſithen day light pray ye doe right foule falſe vnkind bridde ſpake bird one aſſent matter asketh good auiſement birdes fere ſooth cuckow therefore woll haue parliment thereat ſhall egle lord peres record cuckow ſhall ſent ſhall yeue judgement el ſhall finally make accord ſhall without nay morrow ſaint valentine day vnder maple faire grene chamber window quene woodſtocke vpon grene lay thanked hem leaue toke hauthorne broke ſhe ſate ſong vpon tree terme life loue hath withhold loud ſong awoke explicit leud book thy foule rudeneſſe sith thou haſte neither beauty ne eloquence hath thee cauſed yeue thee hardineſſe appeare lady preſence full ſiker thou knoweſt beneuolence full agreeable abying good ſhe beſt liuing ala thou ne haddeſt worthineſſe ſhew ſome pleaſaunt ſentence sith ſhe hath gentilleſſe accepted ſeruant digne reuerence repenteth ne ſcience leiſer al make thee floriſhing good ſhe beſt liuing beſeech meekely lowlineſſe though ferre abſence think trouth ſtedfaſtneſſe abridge ſorrowes violence cauſed wherof knoweth ſapience like among notifie liking good ſhe beſt liuing lenuoye vrore gladneſſe day luſtineſſe lucern night heauenly influence illumined root beauty goodneſſe suſpires effunde ſilence grace beſeech alledge let writing good ſith ye beſt liuing explicit scogan unto lord gentleman king houſe written copy title hereof thus followeth moral ballad prince duke clarence duke bedford duke glouceſter king son henry scogan supper among merchant vintry london houſe lewis john noble ſonnes eke lord dere father called vnworthely send vnto little treatiſe written mine owne hand full rudely although reuerently haue written eſtates pray mine vnconning taketh benignely god ſake herken ſay complain ſore remember ſuddaine age vpon fall complain miſpent juuentute impoſſible ayen call certainly moſt complaint thinke haue ſo nice ne would vertues call youth vice aye cherice aske mercy lord art almighty god majeſty beſeking make ſo euen accord betwixt thee ſoule vanity worldly luſt ne blind proſperity haue lordſhip ouer fleſh ſo frele thou lord reſt parfite vnity put fro vice kepe ſoule hele yeue might haue life ſpace confirme fully thy pleaſaunce shew abundaunce thy grace good werks grant perſeueraunce youth forget ignoraunce yeue good ſerue thee ay queme set life thine ordinaunce able mercy thou deme lord dere complaint write loue moſt entirely warne endite time loſt youth folily greueth wight bodily ghoſtly meane luſt vice entend wherefore lord pray ſpecially youth vertue ſhapeth diſpend plant root youth ſuch wiſe vertue growing alway looke alway goodneſſe exerciſe ſhall mighty make aſſay fiend withſtand affray paſſeth wiſely perillous pilgrimage think word werke euery day ſhall yeue parfite floured age taketh alſo hede y• theſe noble clerkes writen bookes great ſaprence saying faith ded withouten werkes right ſo eſtate negligence vertue therefore diligence shapeth vertue ſo plant root ye thereof haue full experience worſhip life ſoules boot taketh alſo hede lordſhip ne eſtate without vertue may long endure thinketh eke vice vertue debate haue ben ſhall world may dure euer vicious auenture ouerthrow thinketh euermore god lord vertue figure goodneſſe therfore follow lore maiſter chaucer god ſoule ſaue language ſo curious ſaid ye father dead graue biqueth nothing vertue hous vnto child therefore labourous ought ye beſeeking god grace yeue might vertuous whichye miȝt haue part place may ye ſee vertuous nobleſſe commeth way aunceſtry commeth lefull buſineſſe honeſt life ſlogardry wherefore youth rede ediſie houſe vertue ſuch manere age may keepe gie fro tempeſt world wawes thinketh betwixe vertue eſtate parfite bleſſed mariage vertue cauſe peace vice debate man ſoule full courage cheriſheth vertue vice outrage driueth hem away let hem haue wonning ſoules leſeth heritage god hath yeue vertuous liuing take heed alſo men poore degree vertue haue beſet great honour euer haue liued great proſperity cheriſhing vertuous labour thinketh alſo many gouernour called eſtate hath ſet full low miſuſing right errour therefore couſaile vertue know thus anceſters ye may nothing claim maiſter chaucer ſaith expreſſe temporal thing men may hurt maime god ſtocke vertuous nobleſſe ſith lord bleſſedneſſe made u u deide followeth vertue full buſineſſe thing herke maiſter ſeide firſt ſtocke father gentilneſſe man claimeth gentill muſt follow trace wit dreſſe vertue looke vice fly unto vertue longeth dignity reuers ſafely dare deme weare mitre corowne diademe firſt ſtocke full rightwiſeneſſe true word ſobre pitous free cleane ghoſt loued buſineſſe ayenſt vice ſloth honeſty heire loue vertue gentill though rich ſeme weare mitre croune diademe vice may heire old richeſſe may man men may ſee biqueth heire vertuous nobleſſe appropried vnto degree firſt father majeſty maketh heires hem queme weare mitre croune diademe lo heare noble poete brittaine lightly vertuous ſentence loſſe youth vertue complaine therefore pray diligence profite god reuerence tempereth fully vertue mind ye come judge preſence ye vertuleſſe behind many lord haue manner adayes though one ſhew vertuous mattere feruent youth ſo falſe alayes art haue joy ſhip without ſtere driueth vp doun without gouernaunce wening calme would laſt yere yere right ſo fare ignoraunce ſhame know reaſon ebb ther cometh flood ful rage ye ſame wiſe youth paſſeth ſeaſon commeth crooked unweldy palied age ſone comen kalends dotage y• youth haue vertue provided men woll ſay fie vaſſalage thus hath ſloth fro worſhip hem deuided boecius clerk men may rede ſee saith booke conſolation man deſ • reth vine tree plenteous fruit reaping ſeaſon muſt euer eſchue doe oppreſſion vnto root yong grene thus may ye ſee well incluſion youth vertuleſſe doeth much tene ſeeth ayenſt vertuous nobleneſſe rooted youth good perſeueraunce driueth away vice wretchedneſſe ſlogardry riot diſtaunce seeth eke vertue cauſeth ſuffiſaunce seeth eke vertue voideth vice ſo hath vertue hath habundaunce wele farre reaſon deuiſe take heed tullius hoſtilius fro pouert came high degree vertue redeth eke iulius conquerour poore man yet vertue humility many countrey gouernaunce thus vertue bringeth man great degree eche wight luſt entendaunce rede ayenſt nero vertulees taketh heed alſo proud balthaſare hated vertue equity pee looke antiochus fill fro chare skin bone tare look miſchance vice ſo woll theſe ſignes beware dare well ſay infortunate nice ſay hereby may ye ſee vertue cauſeth parfite ſikerneſſe vice exilen proſperity beſt ech man choſe geſſe doeth liſt excuſe expreſſe would right ſorry ye miſcheſe god confirme vertuous nobleſſe negligence ye leſe explicit sometime world ſo ſtedfaſt ſtable man word obligatioun ſo falſe deceivable word deed concluſioun nothing like tourned vp ſo doun world mede fikelneſſe loſt lack ſtedfaſtneſſe maketh world ſo variable luſt men haue diſſenſion among v man hold vnable ſome colluſion doe neighbour wrong oppreſſion cauſeth wilfull wretchedneſſe loſt lack ſtedfaſtneſſe trouth put downe reaſon hold fable vertue hath domination pity exiled man merciable couetiſe blent diſcretion world hath made permutation fro right wrong fro trouth fikelneſſe loſt lacke ſtedfaſtneſſe lenvoye prince deſire honourable cheriſh thy folke hate extortion suffer nothing may reprouable thine eſtate done thy region shew forth yerd caſtigation drede god law loue trouth worthineſſe wed thy folke ayen ſtedfaſtneſſe explicit good counſail chaucer fly fro preaſe dwell ſoothfaſtneſſe suffiſe vnto thy good though ſmall horde hath hate climbing tikelneſſe preaſe hath enuy wele blent ouer sauour thee behoue ſhall rede well thy ſelfe y• folke canſt rede trouth thee ſhall deliuer drede paine thee ech crooked redreſſe truſt tourneth ball great reſt ſtandeth little buſineſſe beware alſo ſpurn againe nall striue doth crocke wall deme thy ſelfe demeſt others dede trouth thee ſhall deliuer drede thee ſent receiue buxomneſſe wraſtling world asketh fall home wilderneſſe forth pilgrime forth beaſt thy ſtall looke vp high thanke god weiue thy luſts let thy ghoſt thee lede trouth thee ſhall deliuer drede explicit ballade village without painting plaintife fortune wretched worldes tranſmutation wele wo poor honour without order due diſcretion gouerned fortune errour natheleſſe lacke fauour ne may doe ſing though die lay tout pardu mon temp labour finally fortune defie yet left ſight reaſoun know friend fro foe thy mirrour much hath yet thy tourning vp doun ytaught knowen hou • r truly force thy reddour ouer himſelfe hath maiſtre ſuffiſaunce ſhall ſuccour finally fortune defie socrates thou ſtedfaſt champion might neuer thy turmentour thou neuer dredeſt oppreſſion ne chere found thou fauour thou knew deceit colour moſt worſhip lie know eke falſe diſſimulour finally fortune defie anſwer fortune man wretched himſelfe wene ne hath himſelfe ſuffiſaunce ſaiſt thou thee ſo kene haſt thy ſelfe gouernance say thus graunt mercy thine habundance thou haſt lent thou ſhalt ſtriue woſt thou yet thee woll auance eke thou haſt thy beſt friend aliue haue thee taught deuiſion betweene friend effect friend countenaunce thee needeth gall hine cureth eyen darke pennaunce ſeeſt thou clere ignoraunce yet holt thine anker yet thou maiſtarriue bounty beareth y• key ſubſtance eke thou haſt thy beſt friend aliue many haue refuſed ſuſtene sith haue thee foſtred thy pleaſaunce wolt thou make ſtatute thy quene ſhall aye thine ordinaunce thou born art reigne variaunce whele muſt thou driue lore bet wicke thy greuaunce eke thou haſt thy beſt friend aliue anſwer fortune thy lore dampne aduerſity frend maiſt thou reue blind goddeſſe thy friend know thanke thee take hem againe let hem go lie preſſe niggardes keeping richeſſe pronoſlike thou wolt toure aſſaile wicke appetite commeth aye ſickneſſe general rule may faile fortune thou pincheſt mutability thee lent droppe richeſſe liketh withdraw ſhouldeſt thou royalty oppreſſe ſea may ebbe flow leſſe welken hath might ſhine rain hail right ſo muſt kithe brotilneſſe generall rule may fail plaintife lo execution majeſty purueigheth rightwiſeneſſe ſame thing fortune clepen ye ye blind beaſts full leaudneſſe heauen hath property ſikerneſſe world hath euer reſtleſſe trauaile laſt day end mine entreſſe generall rule may faile thenuoye fortune prince pray gentilneſſe let man thus cry plain ſhall quite buſineſſe ye liſte releue pain pray ye beſt frende nobleſſe ſome better ſtate may attain lenuoy broken ſtatutes hie heauen create eternally tendure sithe ſee bright goddes ſeuen mowe wepe waile paſſion endure may yearth mortall creature ala fro whens may thing procede errour die almoſt drede word eterne whilom ſhape fro fifth cercle manere ne might teares doune eſcape ſo weepeth venus ſphere teares ſhe wol drench v ala scogan thine offence thou cauſeſt deluge peſtilence haſt thou ſaid blaſpheme y• goddis pride thy gret rekelnes thing law loue forbode thy lady ſaw thy diſtreſſe therfore thou yaue vp mighelmeſſe ala scogan olde folke ne yong neuer erſt scogan blamed tong thou drew ſcorne cupide eke record thilke rebell word thou haſt ſpoken woll lenger thy lord scogan though bow broken woll arowes ywroken thee ne ne none figure ſhall haue neither hurte ne cure certes frend drede thine vnhape leſt thy gilte wreche loue procede hem hore round ſhape ſo likely folke ſpede ſhall labour haue mede well wot thou wolt anſwere ſay lo old griſell liſt renne play nay scogan ſay ſo excuſe god helpe ſo rime doubtles ne thinke neuer ſleepe wake muſe ruſteth ſheath ſtill pee yong put forth prees ſhall paſſe men proſe time take euery man tourne time scogan thou kneleſt ye ſtremes hedde grace honour worthineſs thende dull dedde forgotten ſolitary wilderneſſe yet scogan thinke tullius kindneſs mind thy frende may fructifie farewel looke thou neuer eft loue defie explicit go forth king rule thee sapience biſhop able miniſter doctrine lorde true counſaile yeue audience womanhode chaſtity euer encline knight let thy deedes worſhip determine righteous iudge ſauing thy name rich almoſe leſt thou leſe bliſs ſhame people obey king law age ruled good religion true ſeruant dredful kepe thee vnder aw thou poore fie preſumpcion inobedience youth vtter deſtruction remember god hath ſet lo doe part ye ordeined th occleve empty purſe purſe none wight complaine ye lady dere ſorry ye light certes ye make heauy chere lefe laid vpon bere vnto mercy thus crie heauy againe el mote die vouchſafe day night bliſsful ſowne may ſee colour like ſunne bright yelowneſs neuer pere ye life ye hertes ſtere queene comfort good companie heauy againe el mote die purſe art liues light ſauiour downe world towne helpe might sith woll treaſure ſhaue nere frere pray vnto curteſie heauy againe el mote die explicit occleve unto king conquerour brute albion line free election king ſend ye may harmes amend haue minde vpon ſupplicacion explicit ballad good counſail tranſlated latin verſes engliſh dan john lidgate cleped monk bury conſider well every circumſtaunce eſtate ever thou bee riche ſtrong mighty puiſſance prudent wiſe diſcrete beſie dome folkes ſoch thou may fly ever thou doeſt truſt well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis thy porte apparaile thou cladde honeſtly ſaine anone people malice woll faile without advice reaſon ſain thine array made wrought vain suffer hem ſpeake truſt right wel wicked tonge wol alway deme amis thou king equipolent great lordes evin peregall thou torne rent woll ſay jangle thou art ſlougarde never thrive ſhall suffre hem ſpeke truſt right well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis befall thou take wife woll falſly ſay entent thou art likely ever live ſtrife voide reſt without aledgment wife ben maiſtres judgment suffren ſpech truſt right well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis thou faire excellent beaute yet woll ſay thou art amourous thou foule vgly ſee woll affirme thou art vicious people language ſo diſpitous suffre ſpech truſt right well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis ſo parfiteneſſe thou haſt vowed live chaſtitee woll folke thy perſon expreſſe thou art impotent tengendre thy degree thus thou chaſte deſ • avy suffre hem ſpeake truſt right well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis thou fatte corpolent wol ſain thou art great gloton devourer el vinolent thou leane megre faſhion call thee nigard opinion suffre ſpeake truſt right wel wicked tonge woll alway deme amis thou rich ſome woll yeve thee laude ſay commeth prudent governaunce ſome wol ſaine commeth fraude ſleight falſe cheviſaunce ſain worſt folke ſo great pleaſaunce ſuffre hem ſay truſt right wei wicked tonge woll alway deme amis thou ſadde ſobre countenaunce men woll ſain thou thinkeſt ſome treaſon thou glad daliaunce men woll deme deſolution call faire ſpeach adulacion yet let hem ſpeake truſt right well wicked tonge wol alway deme amis holy perfection men malice woll clip ypocrite mery clene entention men ſain riot doth delite mourn blacke ſome love clothes white suffre men ſpeake truſt right well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis honeſt aray men deme pompe pride goeth poore men call waſter goeth ſtill men mark ye ſide seine ſpy agiler waſteth men ſain hath treaſour whereof conclude truſt right well wicked tonge alway deme amis ſpeketh moch men clepeth prudent debateth men ſaine yt hardy ſaith litel great ſentement folke yet wol wite foly trouth put vp goth flattery yt liſt plainly know cauſe wicked tonge woll alway deme amis though man pacient david throw humilite salomon wiſedome prudent knighthode egall ioſue manly proved iudas machabe yet al truſt right well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis though man proweſſe worthy hector troy champioun love troylus kindneſſe ceſar famous high renoun alexaunders dominacioun yet truſt right well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis though man high low degree tullius ſugred eloquence seneca moralitee caton forſight providence conqueſt charles artures magnificence yet truſt right well wicked tonge woll alway deme amis touching woman ye parfit innocence though heſter ye nobleneſſe greſilde humble pacience iudith preuid ſtableneſſe polixcenes virginall clenneſſe yet dare ſeiue truſt right wel wicked tong would deme amis wifely trouth penelope though poſſeſſion helenes beauty kindneſſe medee loue vnfayned martia caton alceſtes trewe affection yet dare ſaine truſt right well wicked tonge wol alway deme amis ſooth man may eſchew ſwerd tonges kerve bite full hard man remew daunger aquite wo tonges hemſelfe delite hinder ſlaunder ſet ſtudy pleaſaunces deme alway amis moſt noble prince cheriſhers vertue remembreth high diſcretion firſt vertue moſt pleaſing ieſu writing ſentence caton good tonge opinion chaſtiſe reverſe wiſedome voideth hearing al y• deme amis ballad praiſe commendation maſter geffery chaucer golden eloquence maiſter geffray chaucer lithe grave noble rhetoricion poet great britaine worthy y• laurer poetry labour palme attain firſt made diſtil rein gold dewe dropes ſpech eloquence engliſh tonge excellence explicit followeth certain work geffrey gentil bee muſt followe trace wittes dreis vertue love vice flee vnto vertue longeth dignitee revers falſly dare deme weare miter crowne diademe firſt ſtocke full rightwiſnes trew worde ſober pitous free clene goſte loved beſineffe againſt vice ſlouth honeſte eyre love vertue gentill though rich ſeme weare miter crowne diademe viceſſe may well heir old richeſſe may man men may wel ſee byquethe eyre vertues nobleneſſe appropried vnto degree firſt father majeſtee maketh eyre queme weare miter crowne diademe explicit proverb againſt covetiſe negligence ſhall theſe clothes manifold lo hote ſomers day great heat commeth cold man caſt pilch away world large compaſſe mine armes twaine ſo mokel woll enbrace litel thereof ſhall diſtraine explicit ballad chaucer made againſt woman unconſtant madame new fangleneſs many ſervaunt put grace take leave unſtedfaſtneſs well wote ye live haue ſpace ye cannot love full half yere place new thing luſt ever kene ſtede blew thus may ye wear grene right mirrour y• nothing may enpreſſe lightly cometh ſo mote paſſe fare love work bear witnes faith may hert enbrace wedercocke turneth face euery wind ye fare ſeene ſtede blew thus may ye weare grene ye might ſhrined brothilnes better dalyda creſſeide candace ever changing ſtondeth ſikernes catche may wight hert race ye loſe one ye wel twein purchace al light ſomar ye wot well wt meene ſtede blew thus may ye weare grene explicit followeth ballad chaucer made praiſe rather diſpraiſe woman doubleneſs world full variaunce euery thing taketh hede faith truſt conſtance exiled drede ſaue onely womanhede ſee ſekerneſs yet rede beware alway doubleneſs alſo freſhe ſomer floures white rede blewe greene ſodenly winter ſhoures made feinte fade without wene truſt none ye may ſeene thing ſtedfaſtneſs except woman thus meene yet aye beware doubleneſs croked mone tale yſhene bright hewe full derke pale euery moneth chaungeth newe veray ſoth knewe thing bilt brotleneſs saue woman aye trewe yet aye beware doubleneſs luſty freſhe ſommers day phebus beames clere towards night drawe away none lenger liſt appere preſent life nothing abideth faireneſs saue woman aye found intere deuoide doubleneſs ſea eke ſterne wawes eche day floweth new againe concours lawes ebbe floweth certaine grete drought cometh raine farewel ſtabelneſs saue woman hole plaine yet aye beware doubleneſs fortune whele goeth round thouſand time day night whoſe courſe ſtandeth euer doubt tranſmew ſhe ſo light aduerteth ſight vntruſt worldy fikelneſs saue woman kindly right ne hath teche doubleneſs man may wind reſtraine hold ſnake taile ſlipper ele conſtraine voide without faile driue ſo naile make ſure new fongleneſs saue woman gie ſaile row boote doubleneſs euery hauen ariue wote good paſſage innocence ſtriue wawes rockes rage happy lodemanage needle ſtone courſe dreſs salomon ſo ſage find doubleneſs therefore ſo accuſe double entencion ſpeake rowne muſe pinch condicion falſe colluſion dare rightwell ſothe expreſs haue better protection ſhrowd vnder doubleneſs well fortuned chaunce dice turne vp ſo doune ſiſe ſincke auaunce reuolucion ſet fell concluſion • ombes ſoothfaſtneſs though clerkes make mencion kinde fret doubleneſs sampſon experience woman full trew yfound dalyda innocence ſheeres gan heere round ſpeake alſo roſamound cleopatris faithfulneſs ſtories plainly confound men apeche doubleneſs single thing ne praiſed old renoun balaunce peiſed lacke waight bore doun cauſe juſt reaſon theſe woman rightwiſeneſs choiſe free election moſte loue eſchaunge doubleneſs lenuoye ye woman enclined influence nature pure gold yfined truth endure arme ſelfe ſtrong armure leaſt men aſſaile ſikerneſs set breſt ſelfe aſſure mighty ſhield doubleneſs explicit work following compiled chaucer called craft lover moral ſimilitude liſte balades ſewe craft loues curious argument ſome falſe ſome founden trewe ſome double entendements thus louers morall document eloquent langage
