deſpite maker lacketh maner endite loues commandment x number afterward ſhall rudely rehearſed louers wiſe depart aſunder obſerued redreſſed daunger vnkindneſſe oppreſſed commaunded make owne forſake loue hath ſought diſcrecion dealing euer diſcrete set loue ſhall loſed aduertiſe mind whether mete vnto hert may diſcloſed find diſpoſed point diſcretion hour time place conueniently meting arm embrace pacience theſe commandment iv pacience tho irous corage louer meued ſoft wordes humble obedience wrath may ſone ſwaged releued thus loue obteined acheued roote greater diligence bicauſe meke iii may keep counſel twain away prudence let prudence gouernor bridel reine set loue ſo feruent wiſe goodly haſt ye may refreine louer liſt diſpiſe romaunce mine auctour wold aduiſe ſlacke loue ye ſo take vaine great diſdaine remembraunce yet full faine would complaine abſtaine penance ſubſtaunce none allegeaunce greuaunce finde right ſo chaunce diſpleſaunce doth auaunce thus end explicit ballad y• ſnow bringeth forth flour whoſe inuencion ye louers may glad bring kalends may ye countenaunce demure meke ſad owe worſhip luſty floures alway eſpeciall one called ſee day daiſee floure white rede french called la bele margarete commendable floure moſt mind floure ſo gracious excellence amiable margarite exalted natife kind vnto muſt reſort diligence hert wil thouȝt moſt lowly obedience ey ſeruant ye regent life ne death neuer repent proceſſe forth proceed happeth great disdaine time thereof take leſt heed vnto brought ſore pain therfore cauſe complain yet vnto greuaunce leſſe ſo nigh lady maiſtreſſe ſhe preſent place hauing herte great aduerſitee except onely fortune good grace whoſe releeued mee great dures vnlaſed hath ſhee brought fearful greuance eaſe pleaſance wo endure pleaſaunt pain seing faire creature lady ſouerain whoſe preſence reſt would fain wiſt pleaſure ſhe diſtaunce protectour though vnto dredful chance maner gentilnes oweth blame leuer ſuffer death penance ſheſhuld haue diſhonor ſhame wiſe loſe drop good name wiſely god endleſſe mercy grant euery true loue haue joy lady explicit ballad mercifull merciable king kinges father pitee whoſe might mercy incomperable prince eterne mighty lord ſay mercy giuen property thy ſeruaunt lieth priſon bound haue thou mercy hert wound y• thou wilt graunt thy priſoner free liberty loſe pain deſires heauy chere gladneſſe reſtored thy high vengeance ſhold thou refrain ſhew mercy ſith penitent helpe lord let ſhent ſith ſo treſpaſſe done vnto mercy let yeeld treſpaſſour office redreſſe ſone treſpaſſe mercy mirrour like ſwete hath price • treſpaſſe mercy hath might without treſpaſſe mercy hath lacke light ſhold phiſike ſikenes nedeth ſalue ſore nedeth drink wher thirſt hath power ſhould mercy treſpas go afore treſpas mercy woll little ſtore without treſpas neuer execucion may mercy haue ne chiefe perfection cauſe time writing touching mercy make mone feare leſt ſoueraigne ſweting meane louerlier none diſpleaſed cauſes one cauſes y• knoweth god ſhe ſo ala forthinketh ſee ſhe defaut offence haue ſhe disdain might doe come preſence tell complaint whereof fain drede looke ſpeake complain hath herte euery deale help god wold al thing wer weale caſe came neuer loues daunce ſo farre hold trace mine eaſe ſcape ne mow daunger except good grace though countenaunce mery face ſemeth word chere yet good grace ſitteth mine hert ful nere y• ſoueraine haue meruaile afore haue wrote may well thinke great trauaile loue brought ſo hote ſimple tree yt falleth one ſtroke mean though y• ſouerain toforn hath denied yet grace may come morn maiſtres good haue ought euermore ſhal long life dureth pity ſeruant keep thouȝt giue ſom comfort medicin cureth feruent ague encreaſeth y• renueth greuous ben pain ſighs ſore without mercy dayes forlore go little bill go forth hie thee faſt recommand excuſe thou feebleneſſe thus laſt pen woren hew pale wan iyen ſonken diſfigured like man till death dart cauſeth ſmart corp haue conſumed farwel ſweet hart doughter phebus vertuous apparence loue elect remembrance careful hert diſtreined cauſe abſence till ye empriſe releaſe greuance vpon ſet life mine attendance without recure wi vntill ye graunt true herte haue thus dere ſweting traunce lie ſhal til ſum drop pity ſpring meane mercy lieth hert may rejoyce cauſe ſing theſe term loue lo haue ring goodly maſtres thus good grace god grant blis heauen haue place explicit followeth mercury pallas venus minerva appeared paris troy ſleeping fountain pallas loquitur ad pariſum de troiae sonne priamus gentil paris troie wake thy ſleep behold v godds three haue brought thee encreaſe joye thy diſcrecion reporting beauty take apple well deuiſe thee v faireſt thy ſight giue thou pray thee gentil knight pallas loquitur primo ſo thou giue vnto pariſe ſhall giue vnto thy worthineſſe honour conqueſt nobley loſe priſe victory courage force hardineſſe good auenture famous manlineſſe apple giue thee conſider pariſe giue vnto mee venus loquitur ad pariſum nay giue ſhall giue glad aſpect fauour faireneſſe loue lady alſo ye liue famous ſtature princely ſeemelineſſe according natife gentilneſſe vnderſtande gift well aduiſe giue hardly pariſe minerva loquitur ad pariſum ye ye paris take heed vnto thou art prince borne diſcent rule thy royall dignity ſhall thee giue firſt intendement diſcretion prudence right judgement prince thing moſt couenable giue haue able explicit ballad pleaſant haue lady ſo ſhe bee ſeldome ſhe ſoueraine thought whoſe beauty behold ſee remembring well ſhe wrought thank fortune y• grace brought faire ſhe nothing angelike beauty none like hardly ſhe made braſſe face ſhe hath enough faireneſſe eyen holow greene graſſe rauiniſh yelow ſounitreſſe thereto ſhe hath euery comelineſſe quantity giuen nature leaſt ſhe ſtature bolt browes ybent betill browed ſhe alſo withall wit ſimple innocent child good thicke ſtature ſmall finger little nothing long skin ſmooth ox tong thereto ſhe ſo wiſe daliaunce beſet word ſo womanly heare doth diſpleaſaunce ſhe ſaith ſaid ſo conningly mo ſhe leuer ſhe talking ſtill ſhe ſhould ſo goodly ſpeach ſpill ſloth none ſhall ye haue entreſſe diligent ſhe vertuleſſe ſo buſie aye good vndreſſe ſhe ape ſhe harmeleſſe harnet meke pitileſſe ſhe ſo wiſe circumſpect prudence none folly infect joy ſuch one age within bound ſo great tenderneſſe werke ſo ſadde ſage wedding ſawe nobleſſe queene iane tho geſſe age yeeres ten fiue trowe many ſuch aliue ieſu ſinfull ſoule ſaue ni creature world liuing like vnto would gladly haue pleaſeth mine hert yt goodly ſwete thing whoſe ſoule haſt vnto bliſſe bring firſt formed creature ſhe well cure explicit diſcriuing faire lady another ballad moſſie quince hanging ſtalke whiche man dare plucke away take folke paſſe forth walke floures freſh fallen away ſhake right ſorry maiſtreſſe ſake ye ſeem thing men haue forgotten ye ſo ripe ye wa • e almoſt rotten vgly cheare deinous froward greene eyen frowning glad chekes enbolned like mellow c • ſtard colour orenge breſtes satournad gilt vpon warrantiſe colour wil fade bawſin buttocked bellied like tonn men cry barbary loſing gonn louely leud maiſtres take conſideration ſo ſorrowfull ye abſent flour ye barkfat y• fouleſt y• nation loue little mine entent ſwert hath yſwent y• ſmoke hath ſhent trow ye haue ben laid vpon ſome kell dry ſo much worſhip ye preſent woman loue beſt time fie explicit ballad warning men beware deceitful woman looke well yee louers bee let luſts lead • age enamoured thing ye ſee sampſon fort salomon ſage deceiued great courage men deme right ſee e • e beware therfore ye blind eateth many flie mean woman cheres queint truſt much truth geaſon faireſt outward well paint ſtedfaſtneſſe endureth ſeaſon fain frendlines worchen treaſon chaungeable naturally beware therfore blind eateth many flie wight liue truſſeth cheres shal haue laſt guerdon mede woman ſhaue neerer raſors ſheres al gold y• ſhineth men take hede gall hid vnder ſugred wede full queint fantaſie aſpie beware therfore blind eateth many flie though world doe buſie cure make woman ſtand ſtableneſſe would againſt nature world lack doublenes laugh loue expres truſt fantaſie beware therfore blind eateth many flie woman kind hath condition three firſt full diſceit ſpinne alſo property woman haue wonder full conceit weepe oft ſleit euer liſt tear eie beware therfore blind eateth many flie ſooth ſay though erth ſo wanne parchment ſmooth white ſcribabell great ſea called ociane tourned ink blacker sabell euery ſtick pen man ſcriuener abell coud write woman trechery beware therfore blind eateth many flie explicit theſe verſes next following compiled geffrey chaucer written copy follow end complaint pity long night euery creature haue reſt ſomewhat kind el ne may life long endure falleth moſt wofull mind ſo farre haue brought ſelf behind ſafe deth ther may nothing liſſe diſpaired kin bliſſe ſame thought laſteth till y• morow morow forth till eue needeth care borrow haue good laiſer good leue wight wo bireue weepe ynough wailen fill ſore ſpark pein doth ſpill ti loue hath ſet ſuch place deſier neuer fulfill neither pity mercy neither grace find yet ſorrowful hart dede arace loue ſhe doth ſmart thorow ſee without remedy death may wiſe aſtart ſothly ſhe hight woll reherſe name bounty ſet womanhede sadnes youth beauty prideleſſe pleſaunce vnder gouernance drede ſurname eke faire rutheleſſe wiſe eknit vnto good auenture loue ſhe ſleeth guiltleſſe loue beſt ſhall may dure bet ſelf hundred thouſand dele world rich creature hath loue beſtowed wele loue neuer ſhal haue part ala right thus turned wheele thus ſlaine loues furious dart loue beſt ſweteſt ſo loue hath taught art ſerue alway ſtinten wo true carefull hert much wo ſo little bliſſe wo euer bore thing deſire miſſe euer would wiſſe find ready euermore plaine ſhe might bring ne recheth nought whether weep ſing little ruth hath ſhe vpon paine ala ſleeping time lo wake ſhould daunce fere lo quake heauy life lede lo ſake though ye thereof wiſe heed take mine herts lady hole liues quene truly durſt ſay fele ſeemeth ſweet heart ſtele whetted againſt kene dere hert beſt beloued fo liketh wo haue done greueth ſaid ſerue loue mo whileſt liue euer ſo therefore ſwete ne bethe euill apaid ſo good ſo faire ye right great wonder ye ſeruaunts good bad beſt worthy neuertheleſſe right lady ſwete though vnkonning vnmete ſerue coud beſt aye highneſs yet none fairer would hete eaſe elſe bete ſo wiſt highneſs might good haue ſhould ye fele ſo none world liuing none fainer would herts fulfill loue eke drede ſo ſore algates mote haue done full yore better loued none ne neuer ſhall yet would beſeech leueth well wroth therefore let ſerue forth lo nought ſo hardy ne ſo wood deſire ye ſhould louen well wote ala may ſo little worthy ye ſo good ye one worthieſt liue moſt vnlikely thriue yet weteth ye right well ye ne ſhould ſeruice driue ne aye wit fiue serue truly wo ſo fele ſet ſo hic upon wheele though ye neuer upon rew muſt loue euer trew man may liue love goodly free laſſe find ye loue ala ſhall hard wit amend womanly pite gentleneſſe debonairte ye nothing thereof upon ſpend ſo hole ſweet ſo great haue ſerue certes ye let thus ſterue yet haue ye wonne thereon ſmall knowing nought thus beſeech heartely euer ye find while ye liue truer ſeruant leueth ſleeth hardely death forgiue ye find truer verely woll ye ſuffer thus ſpill manner gilt good good vntrue true explicit ballad declaring woman chaſtity doth much excell treaſure worldly womanhede auctours write moſt thing commended honeſty thing moſt ſlaunderous noble atwite woman haſty fraelty ex • eeden bond wifely chaſtity auaileth linage royall blood liuing report good holy bed defoyled marriage one defoiled may recouered vice goeth forth froward language many realme many great cite sclaunder hath cuſtome great true fals contrarious ſoune one areiſed goeth lightly downe lechour force maiſtry defouled hath virgines cleaneſſe widdowes oppreſſed lie aduoutry aſſailed wiues ſtood ſtableneſſe may ſlaundrous harme redreſſe good name hurt ſuch report fame loſt one neuer haue reſort thefe may rob man richeſſe ſome meane make reſtitucion ſome man may diſherite oppreſſe poore man poſſeſſion make againe ſatiſfaction man may reſtore degree maid robbed virginite man may alſo beat caſtell doun built freſh ſight exile man regioun reuoke whether wrong right man hath power ne might reſtore palais virginall chaſtity broken wall men may alſo putten ſeruice officer remeue place day fortune liſt deuiſe may reſtored grace ni time nother ſet ne ſpace neuer ſtory neither rad ne ſaine maidenhed loſt recouered againe men ſhould haue conſcience rewen heart repent ſore remorſe ſuch great offence rauiſh thing may reſtore ſaid hath ſaid full yore emeraud greene parfite chaſtite stole one away may recouered hard rauiſh treaſour nature recuparable lordſhip may king emperour reforme thing nat reformable ruſt defame inſeperable maidenhede loſt new yore man liue may againe reſtore romanes old thorough patience suffered tyraunts tyranny city great violence people oppreſſe robbery puniſh ſet great eſpies falſe auouterers well couth widowes rauiſh maiden youth explicit court love book imitation romaunt roſe ſhewing ſubject love impediment ſoever contrary containing alſo thoſe twenty statute obſerved court love timerous heart trembling hand drede cunning naked bare eloquence vnto floure porte womanhede write none intelligence metre hath ne floures ſentence saufe liſt writing conuey pleaſe high nobley bloſomes freſh tullius gardein ſoot preſent matter born poemes virgil taken root ne craft galfride may ſojourn nam cunning well may mourn lacke ſcience cannat write vnto prince life aright tearmes digne vnto excellence ſhe ſprong noble ſtirpe high world honour reuerence teſtifie caliope thou ſuſter wiſe ſlie thou minerua guide thy grace language rude matter deface thy ſuger dropes ſweet helicon diſtill thou gentle muſe pray thee melpomene call anone ignoraunce miſt chaſe away giue grace ſo write ſay ſhe lady worthineſſe accept gree little ſhort treateſſe entituled thus court loue ye ben metriciens excuſe beſeech venus ſake aboue mean ye need muſe ſo lady refuſe lacke ornate ſpeech would wo preſume writen ſo entent buſie cure write treateſſe vnto lady ſtable true ſure faithfull kind ſith firſt ſhe began accept ſeruice man pleaſure book like ſhe may rede look young eighteene yeare age luſty light deſirous pleaſaunce approching full ſadde ripe courage loue arted obſeruaunce eſtate done obeiſaunce commaunding y• court loue ſee alite beſide mount citharee citherea goddeſſe quene honoured highly majeſte eke ſonne mighty god wene cupide blind dignite louers worſhip kne bid paine death pere mercury winged meſſengere went ſtrange fer countrees enquiring aye coaſt drew court loue thiderward bee laſt ſee people gan purſue thoght ſome wight yt knew y• court holden ferre nie full faſt gan hie anone ouertooke ſaid heile friend whither purpoſe ye wend forſooth qd ofte anſwered liche maid loues court go gentle friend place qd fellow hend citheron ſir ſaid without dout king loue noble rout dwelleth within caſtle rially apace journed forth among ſaid ſo fond truly beheld toures high ſtrong high pinacles large hight long plate gold beſpred euery ſide precious ſtones y• ſtone werke hide saphire inde rube rich price lacked emeraud ſo grene bale turkes ne thing deuice may caſtle maken ſhene bright ſterres winter bene phebus ſhone make peace ageine treſpas done high eſtates tweine venus mar god goddeſſe clere found armes cheined faſt venus full ſad hert chere phebus beam ſtreight maſt vpon caſtle ginneth caſt pleaſe lady prince place ſigne looketh loues grace ni god heauen hell ywis hath ben right ſoget vnto loue ioue pluto whatſoeuer ne creature yearth yet aboue theſe reuers may wight approue furthermore caſtle deſcrie yet ſaw neuer none ſo large hie vnto heauen ſtretcheth ſuppoſe within depeinted wonderly many thouſand daiſie rede roſe white alſo ſaw verely tho daiſies might ſignifie tell ſafe quenes floure alceſte kept ſojoure vnder venus lady quene admete king ſoueraine place obeied lady good ninetene many thouſand bright face yong men fele came forth luſty pace aged eke homage diſpoſe coud well diſcloſe yet nere nere forth gan dreſs hall noble apparaile arras ſpred cloth gold geſſe ſilke eſyer auaile vnder cloth eſtate ſauns faile king quene ſat beheld paſſed joy heliſe field ſaints haue comming reſort ſeene king ſo rially beſeine purple clad eke quene ſort head ſaw crownes tweine ſtones fret ſo paine withouten meat drink ſtand ſee king honour rialtee treat ſtates king ben councel cheef quene king danger nere ſtanding quene loue diſdain ſene faith ſhall god wene neuer ſtraunger none degree quene caſting eye ſtood perceiuing apart eke beames ſhining eyen thought ſhapen lich dart sharp perſing ſmal ſtreight line haire ſhone gold ſo fine diſhiuil criſpe hanging backe yard length ſoothly ſpake bright regina made thee ſo faire made thy colour vermelet white wher wonneth y• god far aboue ye aire great craft great delite maruell nothing ye hight quene loue occupie place cithare ſweet lady thy grace mewet ſpake ſo nought aſtart condition word might hard inward thought gan aduert oft ſaid wit dull hard beauty thus god wot ferde doth man yrauiſhed ſight beheld criſtall eyen ſo bright reſpect hauing beſt done till right anone beholding ſpied friend mine full ſone gentlewoman chamberere vnto quene hote ye ſhall philobone loued life ſhe ſey ſhe led forth blife demanded wiſe thither come errand ſeen court qd guiſe eke ſue pardon grace mercy aske great treſpas none erſt come court loue foryeue ye god aboue well ſaid qd philobone indede ye aſſomoned appere mercurius drede yes gentill feire qd ye yet tho though true dere free ye ſhould haue come vnſent ye deme ye ſhent ye reigne youth luſtineſſe pampired eaſe jalous age duty farre geſſe loues court dreſſen viage ſoone nature maketh ſo ſage ye may know woman ſwan foot growen halfe ſpan ſith ye wilfull negligence xviii year hath kept ſelf large greater treſpas offence neck mote bere y• charge better ye ben withouten barge amidde ſea tempeſt raine biden receiuing wo paine ordained ſuch abſent fro loues court yeres long fele ley life ye ſhall full ſoone repent loue r • iue colour luſt hele eke ye muſt bait many heauy mele force ywis ſtirred long agone draw court qd little philobone ye ſhall well ſee rough angry face king loue ſhew ye ſe mine aduiſe kneel ask grace eſchewing perill aduerſite well wote woll none comfort none ne counſell eaſe ye king loue diſpleaſe mercy god qd iche repent caitife wretch hert thought ſhall mine hole entent ſerue pleaſe dere yt loue bought yet ſith haue mine pennance yſought humble ſprite ſhall receiue though ye king loue life bereiue though feruent loues qualite neuer wortch truly yet obeiſaunce humilite benigne hert ſhall ſerue till die lord might great hie right liſt chaſtice correct puniſh treſpace thus infect theſe word ſaid ſhe caught lap led forth till temple round large wide bleſſed hap good auenture right ſoone found tabernacle reiſed ground venus ſat cupide ſide yet halfe drede viſage hide eft againe looked beheld seeing full ſundry people place miſter folk ſome might weld lims wele thought wonder caſe temple ſhone window glaſs bright day many fair image ſee freſh queene cartage dido brent beauty loue falſe eneas weimenting annelida true turtle doue arcite fals peinting many prince many doughty king whoſe martirdom ſhewed y• wals fele loue ſuffred fals ſore abaſhed aſtonied tho folke tide asked wonned diuers court qd ſhe beſide ſundry clothing mantill wiſe full wide arraied ſacrifiſe vnto god goddeſſe guiſe lo yonder folk qd ſhe y• kneele blew weare colour aye euer ſhall ſigne euer trew withouten chaunge ſoothly yonder ben black mourning cry call vnto god loues bene som ſick ſome dede ſom ſharp kene yea qd wt done theſe prieſts nonnes hermites freres tho ſit white ruſſet grene forſooth qd ſhe waylen wo mercy lord may ſo come go freely court haue ſuch liberty yea men condition degre woman eke truly none exception made ne neuer ne may court ope free euerichone king loue ſay nay taketh poore rich array meekely ſew vnto excellence hert reuerence walking thus philobone ſee come meſſengere hie streight king let command anone throughout court make ho cry new come folke abide wote ye king luſt ſeene ſone come nere let ſee mote need done gan preſent tofore king trembling fere viſage pale hew many louer kneeling abaſhed ſore till vnto time knew ſentence yeue entent full trew laſt king hath behold ſterne viſage ſeid doth old thus ferre yſtope yeres come ſo late vnto court forſooth liege qd hundred time haue ben gate afore time yet coud neuer eſpie mine acqueintaunce mine eie ſhame faſtneſſe away gan chace ſubmit vnto grace well pardoned condition thou true henceforth thy might ſeruen loue thine entention sweare ferre right thou ſhalt haue grace thy quenes ſight yes y• faith owe croun ſwere though death therefore thir • th ſpere y• king hod ſeene v euerychone let commaund officer hie take faith ſhew v one one ſtatutes court full buſily anon booke leid eie rede ſee thing muſt obſerue loues court till die ſterue lettred red ſtatutes hole loues court hall firſt ſtatute booke ſpred true thought deed vnto king loue lord ryall quene faithfull kind coud thinke hert mind second ſtatute ſecretly kepe councell loue blowing euery know let ſinke flete may ſowne euery wight ere exiling ſlaunder aye drede fere lady loue ſerue true kind grace deſerue third ſtatute clerely writ alſo withouten chaunge liue die ſame none loue take wele ne wo blind delite erneſt game without repent laughing grame biden ſtill full perſeueraunce hole king ordinaunce fourth ſtatute purchaſe ever ſtirren folke loue beten fire venus auter preach loue hote deſire tell loue quiten well hire muſt kept loth diſpleaſe loue wroth paſſe eaſe fift ſtatute daungerous thought would reue ſlepe ſight ouer ſquemous ſo verely ſtatute kepe turne wallow bed wepe lady cruelty would heart exilen pity sixt ſtatute vſe alone wander void company lady beauty muſe thinke force liue die eft againe thinke remedie grace might anone attaine tell wo vnto ſoueraine seuenth ſtatute patient whether lady joyfull wroth word glad heauy diligent wheder ſhe helden lefe loth hereupon put mine oth ſerue lowly obey ſhewing chere ye xx ſith aday eight ſtatute remembraunce ſpeaken pray lady dere hourely labour great entendaunce loue hert entere deſire make joyfull chere right ſhe ſurmouning euery faire beauty well gentle debonaire ninth ſtatute letter writ gold ſentence euer dread ouerbold diſpleaſe truely ſo ſhall ben content thing may fall meekely take chaſtiſement yerd offend euer ben aferd tenth ſtatute egally diſcerne betwene lady thine ability thinke thy ſelfe art neuer like yerne right mercy equity grace womanly pity though thy ſelfe noble thy ſtrene thouſand fold noble thy quene thy liues lady thy ſoueraine hath thine hert al hole gouernaunce thou mayeſt wiſe taken diſdaine put thee humbly ordinaunce giue free reine pleſaunce liberty thyng woman looke truly el matter crooke xi ſtatute thy ſignes know eye finger ſmiles ſoft low couch alway ſhow drede ſpies winken oft ſecretly bring ſigh aloft ſtill beware ouermuch reſort parauenture ſpilleth thy ſport xii ſtatute remember obſerue paine thou haſt loue wo lite mercy deſerue thou muſten think whereuer thou ride go mortall wound ſuffer thou alſo ſake thinke well beſette vpon thy loue may bette xiii ſtatute whylome thinke thing may beſt thy lady like pleaſe thine herts bottome let ſinke thing deuiſe take thine eaſe ſend may hert appeaſe hert ring letter deuice precious ſtone ſpare price xiiii ſtatute eke thou ſhalt aſſay formely keepe moſt part thy life wiſh yt thy lady thine armes lay nightly dreme thou haſt thy night herts wife sweetly armes ſtrayning blife thou ſeeſt fantaſie see thou ſing ouer merely much joy hath oft wofull end longeth eke ſtatute hold deme thy lady euermore thy friend thinke thy ſelfe wiſe cokold euery thing ſhe doth ſhe ſhould conſtrue beſt beleeue tale new many lye told y• ſeemeth full trew think ſhe ſo bounteous faire coud falſe imagine algate think y• tonges wicked would appair sclandering name worſhipfull eſtate louers true ſetten debate though thou ſeeſt faut right thine eye excuſe bliue gloſe pretily xv ſtatute vſe ſwere ſtare counterfeit leſing hardely ſaue thy lady honour euery put thy ſelfe fight boldely say ſhe good vertuous ghoſtly clere entent heart yea thought argue reaſon ne ſkill againe thy lady pleaſure ne entent loue countrepleted indede say ſhe ſaith ſhalt thou ſhent crow white ye truly ſo rede aye wt thing ſhe thee forbede eſchew giue ſoueraintee appetite follow degree xvi ſtatute keepe thou may seuen ſith night thy lady pleaſe ſeuen midnight ſeuen morrow day drinke caudle earely thine eaſe keep thine head diſeaſe win garland louers euer came court euer ſhall full think ſtatute hold keep truely reaſon giueth fele ſome louers ſhould rather fall aſleepe take hand pleaſe ſo oft wele lay none oth ſtatute adele keep might gaue corage get garland luſty folke age win may ye luſty folke youth garland freſh floures red white purple blew colour fell vncouth ſhall croune king delite court ſight louer true ne adrede expreſſe hath heard ſtatute rede xvii ſtatute age approcheth luſt laied fire queint freſhly thou ſhalt begin fonne dote loue image paint thy remembraunce till thou begin faint firſt ſeaſon thine hert began deſire though thou ne may ne performe thy liuing actuell luſt regeſter thine remembraunce ruſt eke thou maiſt keep thy thing yet ſpeake talke pleaſaunt daliaunce yt ſhall make thine hert rejoice daunce thou maiſt y• game aſſay ſtatute bid thee pray may xviii ſtatute holy commend pleaſe thy lady thou eſchew ſluttiſhneſſe thy ſelfe offend jollife freſh fete thing new courtly manner thy due gentill port louing cleanlineſſe thing liketh thy maiſtreſſe wander liche dulled aſſe ragged torne diſguiſed array ribaud ſpeech meaſure paſſe thy bound exceeding thinke alway woman tender heart aye lightly ſet pleaſure place miſthinke lightly let paſſe xix ſtatute meat drinke forgete ech day ſee thou faſt loue court liue withouten mete saue ſuch cometh venus aboue take none hede pain great reproue meat drinke vaine onely liue ſight ſoueraine xx ſtatute laſt euerychone enroll thyne herts priuitee wring waile turne ſigh grone thy lady abſent thee eke renew word ſhe twain hath ſaid chere thee hath made thy liues lady dere ſee thine hert quiet ne reſt sojourne till time thou ſeene thy lady eft ſhe ſouth eaſt weſt thy force ſee left diligent till time thy life reft thou mayeſt thy lady ſee ſtatute old antiquitee officer high authority cleped rigour made v ſwere anone na corrupt partiality fauour prayer ne gold clerely ſhone ye ſhall qd ſweren echone yong old kepe may ſtatutes truly day god thought hard make oth power ſhall obſerue world na matter halfe ſo loth ſweare though body ſterue might hole obſerue herken caſe befell oth made troth tell tourned leaues looking booke ſtatutes woman ſhene right forthwith rigour gan looke full angerly ſayed vnto queene traitour charged let may man qd ſtarute know long woman hie degree ne low ſecret wiſe kepten full cloſe ſoune echone liberty friend pleaſaunt owne purpoſe wote wight god fiend ne naught ſhall wit vnto world end queen hath yeue charge pain die neuer rede ne ſeene myne eie men ſhall ſo nere counſaile bene womanhood ne knowen guiſe ne wt think ne wit giue report salomon wiſe mighty sampſon beguiled thriſe dalida wote throw may man ſtatute woman know perauenture may right ſo befall bound nature deceiue ſpinne weep ſugre ſtrew gall hert man rauiſh reiue whet tongue ſharp ſwerde gleue may betide ordinance muſt lowly doen obſeruaunce keepe ſtatute yeuen kind ſuch loue hath yeue hem life men may wete turneth euery wind waxen wiſe inquiſitife know ſecret maid widow wife theytheir ſtatutes haue reſerued neuer man know hath deſerued dreſſe forth god loue guide qd rigour ſeek temple bright cithera goddeſſe beſide beſeech influence might vertue teach aright ſerue lady pleaſe ye ſped ſet hert eaſe ye ben vnpurueyed pray eke comfort ſoone grace deſtiny ye may ſet hert ye may like ſuch place loue may honour worſhip felicity aye goeth one aſſent graunt mercy ſir qd forth went deuoutly ſoft eaſie pace ſee venus goddeſſe image gold found thouſand knee freſh faire ſome deadly behold ſundry mantils new ſome old painted flame red fire outward ſhew inward hote deſire dolefull chere ful fell complaint cried lady venus rew vpon ſore receiue bils teares bedreint may weepe ſtore wo pain v fretteth thou bliſſeful planet louers ſterre ſo ſhene haue routh v ſigh carefull bene puniſh lady greuouſly pray falſe vntrue counterfeit pleaſaunce made oth true liue dey chere aſſured countenaunce falſely footen loues daunce barraine routh vntrue ſaied luſt pleaſure alaied yet eft againe thouſand million rejoycing loue leading life bliſſe ſayd venus redreſſe diuiſion goddeſſe eternell thy name ihired loues bond knit thing iwis beaſt vnto beaſt yearth water wan bird vnto bird woman vnto man life joy reſembling life heauenly paradiſe loue exiler aye vice ſinne loue maketh herts luſty deuiſe honour grace haue euery wiſe loues law obedient loue maketh folke benigne diligent aye ſtering drede vice ſhame degree maketh honourable ſweet loue beare name loue faithfull true ſtable loue pruneth ſemen amiable loue hath faut ererciſed ſole yt loue diſpiſed honour thee celeſtiall clere goddeſſe loue thy celſitude yeueſt v light ſo fer doun thy ſpere piercing heart thy pulcritude compariſon none ſimilitude may thy grace made degree haſt v ſet loue vnitie great cauſe haue praiſe thy name thee thorough thee liue joy bliſſe bleſſed thou moſt ſoueraine ſee thy holy court gladneſſe may miſſe thouſand ſith may rejoyce ben thine hert yfere enflamed thy grace heauenly fere muſing tho ſpaken wiſe bethought remembraunce mine orizon right goodly deuiſe pleaſauntly herts obeiſaunce beſeech goddeſſe voiden greuaunce loued eke ſaufe yt wiſt yet downe ſet ſayd ye ſhall faireſt euer bee licour light penſife creature mine hole affiaunce lady free goddeſſe bright fortune vre yeue yeeld hert thee full ſure humbly beſeeching lady thy grace beſtow ſome bleſſed place vow faithful true kind without offence mutabilitie humbly ſerue haue wit mind mine hole affiaunce lady free thilke place ye ſigne ſith thing new yeue aye loue ſerue needly muſt obey merciable thy fire grace fix mine hert beauty routh hote loue determine place saufe onely god trouth troubled ſlumber ſlepe ſlouth night viſioun ſee woman roman vp doun meane ſtature ſemely behold luſtie freſh demure countenaunce yong well ſhape hair ſhone gold eyen criſtal ferced pleaſaunce ſhe gan ſtirre mine hert lite daunce ſuddainly ſhe vaniſh gan right thus may ſay loue wote ſhe ne dwelling yet fele loue diſtreineth might iche know would faine god wot serue obey benignitie deſtinie wiſe ſhall neuer ſee graunt beſt may liken glad rejoyce liue parfite hele deuoid wrath repent variaunce able doe may wele vnto lady herts hie pleaſaunce mighty goddes thy purueiaunce wit thoght luſt loue ſo guide thine honor may prouide ſet mine hert place may like gladly ſerue affection great paine mine heart doth ſticke till ſped thine election helpe lady goddeſſe poſſeſſion might haue life clepen ſhall quene heart wife court loue dwell aye done thee sacrifice daily diane eke fight fraye holden werre might ſuffice goddeſſe chaſt keepen wiſe ſerue figge chaſtity law religiouſity thus gan finiſh prayer laud preice youe venus knee mine hert ponder peice gan anone image freſh beautie heile figure ſweet heile thee cupide qd roſe yede wey temple yede ſey ſhrine ſurmounting ſtones rich y• force pleaſaunce mine ey diamond saphire neuer liche haue none ſeene ne wrought ſo wonderly met philobone hie gan demaund ſepulture forſooth qd ſhe tender creature ſhrined pity name ſaw egle wreke flie pluck wing eke game tender hert hath made die eke ſhe would weep mourn right pitouſly ſeene louer ſi • ffer great diſtreſſe court na none geſſe coud louer halfe ſo well auaile ne wo torment rage asken ſure withouten faile greef ſhe coud heat aſſuage ſteed pity ſpeedeth hote courage matter court ſhe dead report womanhead weil weep cry ſpeak pray woman would haue pity thy plaint ne mean eaſe thine hert conuay thee receiuen owne talent ſay pity cauſeth thee conſent reuth take thy ſeruice thy paine thou maiſt pleaſe thy ſoueraine counſaile keepe ſecretly qd ſhe nolde world queene loue wiſt wite ye matter ſpringen court lenger ſhould dout dwellen ſhame life endry keepe cloſe qd ſhe hardely well well ſhall ye ſeen ſhe ſaid faireſt lady vnder sunne come demean lich maid ſhamefaſt drede ye ſhall ſpeak ywis mirrour joy bliſſe ſomewhat ſtrange ſad demean beware countenaunce ſeen ouer light ne recheleſſe ne bold ne malapert ne renning tong ſhe obeiſen behold demand ye hence ſo long court without reſort among roſiall name hote aright whoſe heart yet yeuen wight ye alſo vnderſtond loue light auanced word might ye hap freedom maken bond fall grace wele accord well might ye thank ye god loue lord ſhe ye ſaw dreame appere loue ſuch one nere yet wote ye remembraunce yeueth ye faine ye ſay ye loue neuer acquaintaunce saue dream riȝt late day yes parde life durſt lay ye caught vpon heath saw complain ſigh full pitouſly within herber gardein faire flower grow herbes vertuous ſauour ſwete aire ſelf full hote amorous iwis ye nice daungerous would ye repent loue ſome new nay troth ſaid neuer knew goodly wight whoſe ſhal aye guide lord loue hath made forth went chamber gay roſiall womanly ſee whoſe ſtreames ſotell piercing eye mine hert gan thrill beauty ſtound ala qd hath yeue wound drede ſpeake till laſt grete lady reuerently wele ſigh gone ouerpaſt doun keen ful humbly gan knele beſeeching feruent wo kele tooke full purpoſe mind vnto grace painfull hert bind ſhall fully diſcriue head round compaſſe nature haire gold ſhe paſſed liue lilly forehed creature liueliche browes flawe colour pure betwene ye meane diſceueraunce euery brow ſhew due diſtaunce noſe directed ſtreight euen line forme ſhape thereto conuenient goddes milk white path doth ſhine eke eyen ben bright orient smaragde vnto judgement yet theſe ſterres heauenly ſmall bright viſage louely rede white mouth ſhort ſhit little ſpace flaming ſomedeale ouer redde mean pregnant lip thick kiſſe percace lippes thinne fat euer lene ſerue nauȝt worth bean baſſe full delite maximian truly thus doth write purpoſe ſay white ſnow teeth order ſtond one ſtature eke breath trow surmounteth odour euer found ſweetneſſe body face hond ſharpely ſlender ſo head vnto foot womanhead hold peace thing hidde ſhall ſoule tong bewray ſhe arraied ye bidde ſhall well diſcouer ſay bend gold ſilke full freſh gay intreſſe broudered full wele right ſmoothly kept ſhining euerydele necke flower freſh deuiſe ruby ſet luſty ſene ſhe goun light ſummer wiſe shapen full wele colour grene aureat ſent ſides clene diuers ſtones precious rich thus ſhe rayed yet ſaw neuer lich ioue lady ſeine tho calixto ne yet alemenia neuer hadden armes leine ne loued faire euroſa ye ne yet dane ne antiopa beauty ſtood roſiall ſeemed lich thing celeſtiall bounty fauour port ſeemelineſſe pleaſaunt figure mirrour delite gracious ſeene root gentilneſſe angell viſage iuſty redde white lack ſaufe daunger alite goodly freſh rule gouernaunce ſomdele ſtrange ſhe pleaſaunce truly ſone took leaue went ſhe enquired impreſſen gan dent loues dart beheld face eft againe come ſeeken grace vp put bill ſentence clere followeth rede ye ſhall ye freſh beauty root nature hath formed ſo wele made prince quene ye yt may boot langour word glad ye wounded ye made wo beſtad grace redreſſe mortall greefe ye harme cauſer caught vnware ſuddainly perſaunt ſtreames eye ſo clere subject ſeruen mekely man iwis lady dere abiding grace require mercileſſe ye cauſe ſterue guerdon liche may deſerue troth day breath hert patient meeke ſuffer death require rue vpon ſmart ſwere neuer ſhall ſtart loues court none aduerſitie ye would rue diſtreſſe deſteny fate houre bliſſe haue ſet obedient onely floure iwis truſt venus neuer repent euer redy glad diligent ye ſhall find ſeruice grace till death life body race humble vnto excellence ſo digne enforcing aye wit delite ſerue pleaſe glad hert benigne troylus troyes knight antonie cleopatre bright neuer thinkes renay ſhall keepe vnto mine ending day enprint ſpeech memoriall sadly prince ſalue ſore think y• would becommen thrall owne haue ſayd ye muſt pity cheriſh man tender deſert giue courage expert y• one hath ſet hert fire findeth neither refute ne pleaſaunce ne word comfort death quite hire ala none allegeaunce wo ala great greuaunce loue vnloued ye lady dere wiſe may gouerne matere truly gramercy friend good profer humble wiſe ſeruice take keep ſtill ye ſay ought well cheriſe greefe remedy deuiſe know nam acquainted well ne wot ſothly ye dwell art loue write ſongs make may ſong honour king quene loue vndertake ſadde ſhall tull merry ſing daungerous ben euery thing beſeech ſeene rede let anſwere put drede name rehearſe pray whence condition ye let ſee come ſay faine would know diſpoſition ye haue put old entention ye meane ſerue ne wote saufe ye ſay ye loue wonder hote name ala hert make thou ſtraunge philogenet calld fer nere cambrige clerk y• neuer think chaunge fro y• heuenly ſtremes clere rauiſh mine hert ghoſt infere since firſt write bill grace thinke ſee ſome mercy face wt mene god y• al hath wrought bill maketh ſmall mention ye lady mine inward thought mine hert withouten offencion beſt loue ſith begon draw court lo might ſay yeeld vnto nobley offend wilfully pompe hert precept diſobay done againe unskilfully greuen earneſt play correct ye right ſharply pray ſeene vnto womanhede rew el nam dede nay god forbede feſſe ſo grace word ſugred eloquence haue compaſſion ſo little ſpace time yt ſome v hen ye ſhall find ſuch inſolence eye may ye ſuffre ſight may ye looke vpon candle light clerer hotter mine eie yet ye ſayd beames perſe frete ſhall ye candle light endrie well wote ye hath ſharper hete ye bid correct bete ye offend nay may done come yt ſpeden ſo ſone withdraw eie withdraw preſens eke hurt ſelfe foly look would ſorry ſo make ſicke woman ſhould beware eke ſhe took ye beth clerke go ſerchen well book woman ben ſo light winne nay bide tho ye kinne ſone ye may win mine hert truth guiſe court ſeen ſtedfaſtneſſe done haue vpon reuth owne deſert lowly gentilneſſe reward joy heauineſſe tho ye waxen pale grene dede ye muſt vſe withouten drede accept grutchen wiſe ye heartely deſire lene loue thinke ye wiſe ceaſe language ceaſe require hath twenty yeare ben may obtaine maruaile ye ſo bold loue treat ah mercy hert lady loue rightwiſe princeſſe liues guide may plain venus aboue ruthleſſe ye gaue wound ſo wide haue done may betide trouth may receiued ala daunger cruelte wofull houre got welaway wofull houre foſtred ifedde wofull houre iborne ne may ſupplication ſweetly haue ſpedde froſty graue cold muſt bedde without ye liſt grace mercy ſhewe death axe ſo faſt doth hewe great diſeaſe ſo littell littel joy felte neuer yet wo fortune ginneth ſmile neuer earſt felt ſo harde fit confounden ben ſpirites wit till lady take cure loue beſte erthly creature like may come plain haue habondaunce sorrow thought ſit wonder nie withhold might pleaſance yet turne againe worldly ſuffiſaunce lady bright ſaufe faithfull true die yet one vpon rewe fell ſound dede ſtone colour ſlaine wanne aſſhe pale hand ſhe caught vp anon ariſe qd ſhe haue ye dronken dwale ſlepen ye nitertale mercy ſweete qd iwis affraied thing qd ſhe hath made ſo diſmaied wote well ye louer hew witneſſe thing ſhe ſaid ye ſecret ye might know qd ſhe curteiſe kind ſhuld alaid mine hert al haue miſſaid ſhall amend ſet hert eaſe word qd doth pleaſe charge yt ye ſtents keepe breke ſlouth ignoraunce ſhe gan ſmile laughen depe iwis qd pleaſaunce xvi ſtatute doth great greuaunce ye muſt releaſſe modifie graunt qd ſhe ſo truly ſoftly colour gan appere roſe ſo red throughout viſage wherefore thinke accordyng ſhe right cleped roſiall thus haue word great ſmall goodly worde loue beſt truſt ſhe ſhall yet ſette mine hert reſt goth ſhe ſaid philobone take man lede within court ſhewe sake louers dwell within rout officer ſhew dout ſtraunger yet come qd philobone philogenet muſt ye gon ſtalkyng ſoft eaſie pace ſaw kyng ſtonden enuiron attendaunce diligence felow fortherer aſperaunce many one dred offend ſtood alone eke cruell aduerſair louers foe cleped diſpair vnto ſpake angrely fell ſaid lady diſſeiue ne ſhall troweſt thou qd ſhe yt ſhe tell true nay nay vnder hony gall thy birth nothing egall caſt thine hert word white good faith ſhe loueth thee alite eke remembre thine habilite may compare well thou wot ye came hope ſaid frend let beleue diſpaire ginneth dote ala qd cold hote one biddeth loue toder nay thus wote beſt ſay well wote lady graunted truly woundes remedie gentilneſſe may infected doubleneſſe thus truſt till die caſt voide diſpaires company taken hope councel friend yea keep well qd philobone mind beſide within bay window stod one grene ful large bread length beard black fethers crow name luſt wonder might ſtrength delite argue thinkth opinion loue ſinne ſo hath begon reaſon faſt ledge auctoritie nay qd delite loue vertue clere ſoule progreſſe holdeth blind apetite luſt doth often ſtere y• ſinne reaſon lacketh thou doſt think thy neighbour wife win yet thinke well loue may ſinne god ſeint loue right verely void ſinne viſe know well affection fleſh ſinne truly verray loue vertue fele loue may thy freill deſire ackele verray loue loue withouten ſinne ſtint qd luſt thou ſpekeſt worth pinne left arguing roming ferther caſtell wide corner lier ſtode talking leſings faſt flatery beſide ſaid woman weare attire pride men found nature variaunt could falſe ſhewen beaw ſemblaunt flatery beſpake ſaid ywis see ſo ſhe goth patens faire fete doth right well prety man rometh truly drink ne mete nede haue mine hert joy doth bete behold ſo goodly freſh ſemeth loue hert tender neſh court luſty folke glad well becommeth abite array ſome ſo ſory ſo ſad complaining thus blacke white gray freres ben monkes good fay ala routh great dole ſeene ſee thus bewaile ſory see cry wring hand white ſo ſone went religion eke nonnes vayle wimple plight thought ben confuſion ala ſain fain perfection clothes wide lacke libertie ſinne mote frends venus wote wold faine ye bene attyred welbeſene deſiren man ſoue degre ferm faithful right wold quene frends wick tender youth grene ayenſt made v religious cauſe mourn wa • len thus ſaid monk freres tide wel may curſe abbe place ſtatutes ſharpe ſing cope wide chaſtely keepe v loues grace neuer fele comfort ne ſolace yet ſuffre heate loues fire ſome haply deſire fortune curſed wherefore haſt thou ſaid berafte v libertie sithe nature yaue v inſtrument ſtore appetite loue louers mote ſuffer ſoch aduerſite diane ſerue venus refuſe ful often ſithe matter doth v muſe ſerue honour ſore ayenſt chaſtite goddes queene v leefer venus biden ſtill haue reward loue ſoget bene vnto theſe woman courtly freſh ſhene fortune curſe thy wheele variance well thou reuiſt pleſance thus leaue voice plaint care raging wo cry full petouſly yede full naked full bare behold looking diſpitouſly pouerty dedly caſt eye welaway cried faine ne might glad deſire attaine lacke richeſſe worldly good banne curſe weep ſain ala pouerty hath v hent yt whilom ſtood herts eaſe free good caſe dare ſhew ſelf place ne v embold dwell company hert wold loue right faithfully yet againward ſhriked euery nonne pange loue ſo ſtraineth crie wo time qd boun hatefull ordre niſe done v die ſighe ſobbe bleden inwardly freting ſelf wth thoght hard complaint nie loue waxen wood faint ſtood beholding ware ſort full languiſhing sauage wild loking chere mantelles clothes ey tering oft nature complaining member lacked foo • hand viſage wry blind vnderſtand lacked ſhape beauty preferre themſelf loue ſaid god kind hath forged worſhippen ſterre venus bright leften behind werkes clene mind full ſhape beauty qd deformity nie company haue ſuſters waried miſſaide meane three fatal deſtiny worker ſodenly abraide gan cry affraide curſe qd euer hath nature iformed v wofull life endure eke contrite gan repent confeſſing hole wound cithere hath darte hote deſire ſent loue muſt ſubject held skornes vanity ſaid louers held blisful life yong men old widow maid wife bereue goddeſſe qd thy might skornes skoffes haue power moken wight thy ſeruice dwell raue know well right ſo god ſaue ſhal chief poſt thy faith loue uphold reuers ſo ſaith diſſemble ſtode ferre troth party mantil party hode hoſe ſaid vpon lady routh aud thus wound gan gloſe entent ful double ſuppoſe world ſaid loued wele ay thought loued nere dele eke ſhamfaſtneſſe tooke hede bluſhed rede durſt nat ben aknow louer thereof ſhe drede ſtode hing viſage downe alow ſuch ſight ſeene trow theſe roſes rody ſtalke coud wight ſpy ſpeak talk loues art ſo gan ſhe abaſhe ne durſt vtter al preuity many ſtripe many greuous laſhe gauen wolden louers hindered ſore ſimple cominalty wiſe durſt grace mercy craue ſhe need ask haue aprochein ſpeke ſhamefaſtneſſe returneth thinke ſecrets counſel breke lady wil haue ſcorn v certein perauenture thinken great disdein thus ſhame faſtneſſe may bringe • diſpeire ſhe dede toder heire come forth vaunter ring thy bel ſpied ſone god make vowe loked blacke fendes doth hell firſt qd euer wowe within worde ſhe come wotte armes lady free ſo hath ben thouſand mo ſhe england britain spain picardy artois fraunce vp hie holand burgoine naples italy nauerne grece vp hethen lond neuer woman yet wold withſtond ben commaundement wold lacked neyther ſiluer coigne ne gold met eſtate broched trow lo goeth one mine wotte ye freſh attired haue laid full lowe ſoch one yonder eke right well know kept ſtatute lay ifere yet yon ſame hath made right good chere thus hath vaunter blowen euery al knoweth thouſand fold aunceſtry kinne lier firſt maketh promiſe hold lady councel vnfold wherfore y• ſecret doth vnſhitte lieth world may witte falſing ſo promiſe beheſt wounder ſore hath ſuch fantaſie lacketh wit trow beaſt bet himſelf reaſon gie mine aduiſe loue ſhall contrary auaile eke diſhonour court ſhall ſojour take heed qd ſhe little philobone enuy rocketh corner yond ſitteth dirke ye ſhall ſee anone leane body fading face hond himſelfe fretteth vnderſtond witneſſe ouid methamorphoſoſe louers fo gloſe louer thinketh promote enuy grutch repining wele ſwelleth ſore herts rote wiſe cannot liue hele faithful lady ſtele enuy noiſe ring round ſey much worſe done dout priuy thought rejoyſing himſelfe stood ferre thence abite maruellous yon thought ſome ſpirit ſome elfe ſubtill image ſo curious qd ſhaded thus yonder cloth colour nere went gan lere pore framed queſtion full hard qd thing thou loueſt beſt bote vnto thy paine hard thinke thou liueſt great vnreſt thou wandreſt aye ſouth eaſt weſt eaſt north ferre ſee place court may holden thee followeſt thou thy hertiſet demaund aſoile thee require thought qd creature may let ben deſire abſence hath done y• fire mery thought kindeleth yet againe bodely thinke ſoueraine ſtand ſpeake laugh kiſſe halſe thought comforteth ful oft think god wote though al y• world falſe true thinke alſo ſoft lady ſpeach loft bringeth min hert joy great gladnes priuy thought alayeth mine heauines wt thinke man earth tell iwis eke ni ſwalow ſwift ne ſwan wight wing ne half ſo yerne flie bene right ſodenly heuen hell paradiſe lady deſire counſell ferre wide wote lorde lady theyr preuitie wotte colde hote ſhall ſpeake without licence mine ſoch ſeaſonable firſt thing thought within yt hart er word mouth aſtart y• word thought bad farewel yede eke forth went ſeene court guiſe doore came ſo god ſpede twenty courteours age aſſiſe liche high brode aduiſe golden loue leden loue hight tone ſad toder glad light yes draw heart force might luſtineſſe benas ye haue ſeid thinke drope fauour hight ne neuer vnto deſire obeid till ſodenly thought affraied ſeene ware ſo dede countenaunce pite bade done ſome pleaſaunce ſhrine ſhe roſe death liue mine care full priuely ſhe ſpake doth ſeruaunt hen away driue roſial qd ſhe mine hert drake tenderich found moch lacke perſon ſelfe bethought ſaide man myne hearte hath ſought gramercy pity might ſuffiſe yeue due laude vnto thy ſhrine gold god wotte would ſith y• thou riſe death liue behold thanken thouſand time told eke lady roſial ſhene hath comfort ſet mine hert iwene make mine proteſtacion depely ſwere mine power bene faithful deuoide variacion forbeare anger tene ſeruiceable worldes quene al reaſon intelligence done honour high reuerence ſpoke ſo ſone worde ſhe ſouerain thanke hertely ſaid abide ye ſhall dwell ſtill till ſeaſon come may truly king loue company shall hold feſte full rially well bode till ſeaſon fell may day y• larke began riſe matens went luſty nightingale within temple ſhapen hauthorn wiſe might ſlepe nightertale domine labium gan cry gale lippes open lord loue cry let mouth thy preiſing bewry egle ſang venite body let v joy loue health deske anon gan fall came late preced ſtealth ſayd ye faucon herts wealth domine dominus noſter wote ye god y• done v brenne thus hote coeli enarrant ſaid popingay might told heauen firmament came y• gold finch freſhe gay ſaid pſalme hertily glad intent domini eſt terra laten intent god loue hath yerth gouernaunce ye wren gan ſcippen daunce jube domino lord loue pray commaund well leſſon rede legende woulden dey marters loue god yet ſouls ſpede thee venus ſing drede influence thy vertue great beſechyng thee keepe v heat ſecond leſſon robin redebreſt ſang haile god goddes lay lectorn amorouſly ſprong haile qd eke freſh ſeaſon may moneth glad ſingen ſpray haile floures rede white blewe vertue maketh luſt new third leſſon turtil doue toke thereat lough maui ſcorne ſaid god mote dine ſuppe foliſh doue giue u al horne ben right better borne rede leſſon well eke hote loue degree turtil doue ſaid welcom welcom may gladſom light louers ben trew thanke thee lord loue doth puruey rede leſſon al dewe good ſoth corage purſue ſerue make till death v muſt depart tu autem ſang apart te deum amoris ſang thruſtel cocke tuball himſelfe firſt muſician key armony coude locke ſwete tewne thruſtel lorde loue prayſen qd ſo done al foules great lite honour may fals louers diſpite dominus regnauit ſaid pecocke lord loue mighty prince iwis receyued euery iubilate ſing meaneth said linet welcome lord bliſſe ſtert owle benedicite meaneth mery fare qd laudate ſang larke voice ful ſhril eke kight admirabile quere wil thorow mine ear pers thril welcome may ſeaſon qd honour lord loue mote hath feſte ſo ſolempne ſo hie amen ſaid al ſo ſaid eke pie forth cockow gan procede anon benedictus thanking god haſt may would viſite echon gladden feaſt ſhal laſt therewithal laughter braſt thanke god ſhuld end ſong seruice hath ben ſo long thus ſang ſeruice feſt done right erly dome forth goth y• court moſt leſt fetch y• floures freſh braunch blome namely hauthorn brought page grome wth freſh garlants party blew white rejoyſen great delite eke ech threw floures bright primeroſe violete gold beheld royall fight lady gan ſodenly behold trewe loue plited many fold ſmote y• heart bliue venus yet thanke aliue explicit chaucer dream never printed year 1597 heretofore hath gone name dream book dutcheſs death blanch dutcheſs lancaſter dream deviſed chaucer ſeemeth covert report marriage john gaunt king son blanch daughter henry duke lancaſter long love time whereof poet feigneth dead end conſent friend happily married figured bird bringing bill herb reſtored life alſo ſhewed chaucer match certain gentlewoman although ſhe stranger notwithſtanding ſo well liked loved lady blanch lord chaucer himſelf alſo gladly concluded marriage flora queen pleaſaunce whole achieued thobeyſaunce freſh new ſeaſon thorow euery region mantle whole couert winter made diſcouert auenture without light may lay vpon night alone lady thought lord wrought couth well entayle imagery ſhewed great maiſtry ſo little ſpace made ſuch body face great beauty ſwich feature creature thought lay lodge way beſide well foreſt hunting tooke reſt nature kind ſo wrought halfe ſleepe brought gan dreame thinking mind knowliche like making dreamed thought ſaw ſlept nought wherefore yet full beleeue ſome good ſpirit eue meane ſome curious port bare ſaw payne ſport whether woke ſlept well wot lough wept wherefore woll remembraunce put whole payne pleaſaunce axen hele would god ye wiſt euery dele leaſt ye might night ſuch another haue ſight although payne yet morow ye would fayne wiſh might long dure might ye ſay ye good cure dreames wenes ſee much better yet may hee wit eke laſſe woll hindere thinke ſee mine eene iwis may dreame kene ſigne ſignifiaunce haſty thing ſouning pleaſaunce wiſe vpon night ye haue heard without light wakyng ne full ſleepe ſuch houre louers weepe cry lady grace befell wonder cace ye ſhall heare wiſe wholly deuiſe playne engliſh euill written ſleepe writer well ye witten excuſed though mi one waking wherefore gentilneſſe requyre boiſtouſneſſe ye let paſſe thing rude heareth woll conclude endityng taketh heed ne tearmes ſo god ſpeed let paſſe nothing thus befell ſhall within yle thought wall yate glaſſe ſo cloſed round leaueleſſe none come ne vncouth ſtraunge behold euery yate fine gold thouſand fanes aie turning entuned briddes ſinging diuers fane paire open mouth thaire ſute toures subtily coruen floures vncouth colour aye neuer none ſeene may many ſmall turret hie man liue could non ſie ne creature ſaue lady play ſuch theyr array thought goodlihead paſſeden womanhead behold daunce ſing ſeemed like none earthly thing vncouth countinaunce euery play right vſaunce one age euerichone ſeemed ſaue onely one vvhich yeeres ſuffiſaunce ſhe might neyther ſing ne daunce yet countenaunce ſo glad ſhe ſo fewe yeeres lady little dere luſtines laugh tale ſhe full ſtuffed male diſports new playes fayre ſhe day maiſtreſſe ſeemed well luſty companie ſo ſhe might enſure one conningeſt creature ſo ſaid euerichone euer knew fayled none ſhe ſober well auiſed euery fault diſguiſed nothing vſed faith truth ſhe na young great ruth euery ech place gouerned grace ſtode alway poore riche word none liche ne halfe ſo able maiſtres ſuch luſty companie befell ſo auiſed yle ſuffiſed whole ſtate euery luſty yle wonder deuiſe ioieux paradiſe dare well ſay floure ne tree ne thing wherein pleaſaunce might bee fayled none euery wight deſired day night rich heale beauty eaſe euery thing might pleaſe thinke haue coſt ſuch country bene ne heard tell life creature might dwell thus yle auiſed throughout ſtate arayed heart wexe well payed ſelfe aſſured body well vred sith might haue ſuch grace ſee lady place ſo faire enſure dome though nature would euer ſtriue paine ſhould con ne mowattaine leaſt feature amend though ſhe would conning ſpend beauty might auaile paine loſt trauaile part natiuity alarged beauty eke thing notable vnto death ay durable beauty ſhould dure neuer ſeene creature saue onely trow hath wiſt ne know wherefore praiſe conning beauty rich thing liues certaine quite euery paine wend thus haue ſeene ſtate rich might beene thought impoſſible ſee one thing beauty glad conning serue auaile might thing ſodainly ſtood lady couth ſo much good vnto came ſmiling chere ſaid benedicite yere saw neuer man tell ye come hider name ye dwell ye ſeeke eke mote ye tell ye come place ſoth well told may cauſe grace el ye mote priſoner vnto lady haue gouernaunce yle word ſhe gan ſmile ſo luſty rout lady ſtood madame qd night paſt lodged ſlept faſt foreſt beſide well ſhould tell vvot whoſe ordinance onely fortune purueiance vvhich put many geſſe trauaile paine buſineſſe lettes nothing truth ſome ſleeth eke ruth wherefore doubt brittilnes variance vnſteadfaſtnes yet afraid beyng amaid wonder thing ſeemeth thus many freſh lady ſee faire ſo cunning ſo yong man dwelling among hider come madame qd ſome ſhould faine long proceſſe ſeeme ſuch princeſſe pleaſe commaund ſay obay power fulfill priſoner bide till duly enformed euery thing ye aske lady right well apaid hand tooke ſaid welcome priſoner aduenturus right glad ye haue ſaid thus ye doubt diſpleaſe aſſay eaſe word ye anon lady euerichon aſſembled counſaile went ſoone ſent ſaid manere word word ye ſhall ſee v thinke maruaile without bote ſaile ſubtilty wyle ye get haue entre yle yet ſhall ye ſee gentill woman bee loth diſpleaſe wight notwithſtanding great right ye ſhall well vnderſtond old cuſtome lond hath continued many yere ye ſhall well wete v ye may bide cauſes twaine purpoſed ſaine thone ordinance long continuance woll ſothly tell man among v dwell wherefore ye mote need retourne wiſe may ſojourne thother eke queene realme ye may ſeene may v charge let goe large cauſe doubt doe fault ſhe ſuffer may noyſaunce againe old accuſtomaunce theſe cauſes twaine heard god paine ſodainly mine hart came one ſmart creeping ſoft ſhould ſteale doe robbe mine heale made thought ſo fraid courage ſtode diſmaid ſtanding thus grace lady came apace huge preaſe told queene without ariued would come well thider might twin hied ſo would abide bridling horſe ride fiue ſixe two three one abode queene meet euerichone went bode one ſoft paſe imagining purchaſe grace queene bide till good fortune ſome happy guide ſend might would bring borne wonning way ne foot knew none ne witherward niſt gone ſea yle wonder though liſt ſmile seeing caſe vncouth ſtraunge ſo like perilous chaunge imagining thus walking alone ſaw lady euerichone might ſomwhat offer sone drew nere tho ware queene lady kneene joyous word gladly aduiſed welcomed ſo ſuffiſed though ſhe prince hole enuironed ſee thus auiſing chere ſad ſodainly glad greater joy mote thriue trow neuer man liue tho ne heart light lady ſight queene come one clothing knight alſo well beſeene ſaw come queene whome lady yle huge wonder long till laſt right ſoberly queene ſelfe full cunningly ſoft word good wiſe said lady young niſe ſiſters hath befall trow ye know one long time haue beene within yle biding queene liuing eaſe neuer wight parfit joy haue ne might gouernance found whole pleaſance euery thing ye know cuſtome low firſt found trow ye wote manere queene yle haue long ech ſeuen yeeres vſage viſit heauenly armitage rocke ſo high ſtonds ſtrange ſea londs make pilgrimage called long perillous viage wind good frend journey dures end vndertakes twenty thouſand one ſcapes vpon rock growth tree certaine yeeres beares apple three vvhich three apple may haue diſpleaſaunce ſaue ſeuen yeere may fall wote well one firſt apple bext growth vnto next hath three vertues notable keepeth youth aie durable beauty looke euer one beſt euerichone ſecond apple red grene onely lookes yene nouriſhes pleaſaunce better partidge feſaunce feed euery liues wight pleaſantly ſight third apple three groweth loweſt tree beares may faile pleaſaunce may auaile pleaſure beauty rich youth euer liche truth cunning weale hath aye floured good heale without ſicknes diſpleaſaunce thing noyſaunce haue goddeſſes liued aboue princeſſes befall ye may ſee gather theſe ſaid apple three haue failed againe day thitherward take way wening ſpeed oft come find aloft ſiſter ſtands hauing thoſe apple hand auiſing nothing ſaid looked ſhe well paid ſtood behold thinking joyes cold sith thoſe apple haue ne might euen ſo came knight armes aware tooke ſhip bare ſaid though neuer ſeen yet long lady vvherefore ſhould wend would liues end ſeruant gan ſing one wonne rich thing tho ſpirits fro gone ſodainly euerichone appeared death felt neither life ne breath ne good ne harme none knew ſodaine paine ſo new haſty grace lady fro tree gentilneſſe ſo hied comfort died three apple one mine hand put anone vvhich brought againe mind breath recouered death vvherefore ſo hold thing wold ſhe lech ſmart great paine ſo quite mine hart god wote right ye heare comfort friendly cheare proweſſe might truly eke ſo knight couth oft ſaid wo ill paid curſed ſhip brought maſt maſter wrought ech thing mote haue end ſiſter brother frend con word ſo womanly knight entreat conningly mine honour alſo ſaid ſhould go ſhip ſhe brought vvhich ſo wonderfully wrought cleane ſo rich ſo araid content paid comfort pleaſe mine heart put eaſe toke great paine little thus hath brought v yle ye may ſee wherfore echone pray thanke one one heartily ye deuiſe imagine wiſe tho men might ſeen world lady fall kneen lady vvas left none ſtanding rout altogither went one kneele ſpared ſtones ne eſtate ne blood well ſhewed couth much good lady made ſuch feaſt ſuch word leaſt friendly ſo faithfully said ſo cunningly wonder ſeing youth language couth wholly gouerned thanking lady ſaid maundement commaundement great joy winning towne troy hardy greekes ſtrong wan ſlege long ſee lady ſuch place receiued ſhe talked yle lady lady altogither queene ſelfe began play aged lady ſay ſeemeth good sith altogither ordaine deuiſe beſt ſet knight reſt woman feble wight rere warre againſt knight ſith place lift danger grace great vi •• • tiranny faine would ye owne country peace eaſe way v pleaſe might beſeech hereof fall ſpeech lady tho began ſmile auiſing little glad chere ſhe ſaid anone madam vnto gone ſpeake fele deſires euery dele ſoberly lady tho ſelfe lady two tooke ſad chere said knight manere sir prince yle pleaſance many mile ye ſought haue vnderſtond till laſt ye haue fond ſent hath lady twaine heare thing ye ſaine cauſe ye haue ſought faine would ſhe wote whol thouȝt wo cauſe ſo euery wight vnware force ye ſhip bare ſhe ſo nigh agone mind ne ſpeech ſhe none painfull creature dying abode aduenture ſee indure paine weell ſay vnto plaine right ſelfe ye amiſſe seing ſhe prince knight cowth good right truth meued blood pale woxe lead lookt would dead blood none nother cheke worldleſſe ſemed ſicke ſo proued well without mouing paas ſodainely thing dying fell downe ſowning wo lady fraid vnto queene hyed ſaid cometh anon haue bliſſe ye wiſe thing amiſſe knight dead ſoone lo lyeth ſwoone without word anſwering haue ſaid thing wherefore doubt blame might hindering name floured hath ſo many yere long nothing would wiſe dyed wherefore good ye hyed life ſaue leaſt wo ceaſt commaund void dwell wiſe dare mell thing wherein ſuch perill like fall queene right tho full great feare lady preſent vnto knight came lay made lady ſay lo queene awake ſhame doe good game lye mind well ſeene wit blind ſee ſo many lady ye make none chere ye ſet nought ariſe loue bought ſhe ſaid word one ſpake ne anſwere gaue none queene pitty tho worſhip like alſo ſaue ſhe paine quoke feare gan ſaine woe ala ſhall doe ſhall ſay man vnto die loſt name ſhal play perillous game thing amiſſe ſhall ſaid rigour whereby name impayre might like die eke knight word band ſhe laid vpon breſt ſaid awake knight lo ſpeake tell ye fare thus paine endure seing ye country ſure among ſuch friend would heale heart eaſe eke weale wiſt might eaſe know thing might pleaſe enſure ſhould faile heale might auaile wherefore heart pray ye riſe let v talke play ſee many lady comen make good chere nought ſtill ſtone lay word ſpoke none long might braid queene ſaid wiſt word laſt mercy twiſe cried faſt pitty voice heare behold painefull cheare fained well ſein viſage eyn queene caſt ſighed would braſt ſhright ſo wonder ſee wo ſith paine firſt named neuer wofull paine attained voice dead gan plaine himſelfe theſe word ſaine wofull wight full malure worſe dead yet dure maugre paine death againſt fell breath nam dead ſith ne ſerue ſith lady ſterue art thou death art thou agaſt well ſhall meete yet laſt though thou thee hide nought thou dwelſt thou ſhalt ſought maugre thy ſubtill double face die right place thy diſhonour mine eaſe thy manner wight pleaſe need thee ſith thee ſeche thee hide paine eche well woſt thou liue would world giue haue cowardiſe loſt joy heale ſeruiſe made ſoueraigne lady ſo ſhe liues trow fo euer end thus haue neither joy ne frend wote whether haſt ſloth hath cauſed troth hermitage full hie ſaw firſt mine iye hied till aloft made pace ſmall ſoft till mine armes faſt ſhip bare laſt whereof ſhe diſpleaſed ſo endleſſe ſeemed wo thereof ſo great fere repent come haſt trow gan diſpleaſe cauſe diſeaſe word gan cry death death twy thry motred wot ſlouth euen queene routh armes tooke ſaid mine owne knight euill apaid lady ſent haue knowledge entent good faith meant well would ye wiſt euery dele ywis word ſhe gan kiſſe prayed riſe ſaid ſhe would welfare truth told ſhe diſeaſe right ſory faine would pleaſe life ſaue theſe word tho ſaid many mo comforting paine would deliuered faine knight tho vp caſt een ſaw queen theſe word ſaid right wo gan braid vp dreſſes knele queene auſſing wonder wele roſe ouerthrew wherefore queene yet eft anew armes anon tooke pitiouſly gan looke nothing ſhe ſaid ne ſpake like ſhe well paid ne chere made ſad ne light one euery wight ſeene conning eſtate without noiſe debate ſaue onely looke piteous womanhead vndiſpiteous ſhe ſhowed countenance ſeemed heart obeiſance ſhe reine recure peine heart put large entent barge bring againſt eue certaine lady take leue pray gentilneſſe ſuffer thenceforth peace prince thence forth euermore would worſhip wiſe gentilneſſe might deuiſe paine wholly fulfill honour pleaſure thus knight wo preſent queene mo lady many another wight ten thouſand ſhips ſight ſaw come ouer wawy flood ſaile ore ſ • ood behold gan maruaile might come ſo many ſaile ſith time bore nauy ſeene ne ſo arayed ſight heart played fro within breſt joy long would reſt ſailes full floures caſtels huge toures seeming full armes bright wonder luſty ſight large toppes maſtes long richly depeint rear among certaine time gan repaire small bird downe thaire ſhips bound sate ſong voice full ballade layes right joyouſly cowth harmony write ſee mine excuſe may matter long name bird write ſong whereof anon riding vnto queene ſoone brought many ala many doubt shewing ſhips without tho gan aged lady weepe ſaid ala joy ſleepe soone ſhall brought ye long night diſcried knight certes may none yond companie come ſeche word failed ſpeche vvithout remedy deſtroid full oft ſaid gan conclude holy laſt beſt ſhit yates faſt arme good langage done old vſage fayre wordes make ſhot counſaile knot purpoſe tooke none armed thus forth gone toward walles yle come long met great lord boue called god loue auiſed ſuch chere right angry auailed wall glaſſe mighty lord let paſſe ſhutting yates faſt ordained waſt ſhips found land lord anon bow hand yle huge preaſe hied faſt would ceaſe till came knight lay queene ne lady way tooke heed forth paſt yet followed laſt came lay knight well ſhewed great might forth queene called anone lady euerichone ſaid thus routh ſee ſeruaunt trouth thus leane thus ſicke paine wot vnto plaine saue onely one without mo might heale fo word heauy brow ſhewed queene looked row mighty lord forth tho anone looke fault echone ſhew little ſpeech commaunding leech withouten ſhortly ſay thought queene ſoone ſhould obay hond ſhoke bow ſaid right ſoone would know ſhe ſo long refuſed ſeruice lawes vſed let wit wroth bent bow forth goth pace two euen large draught vp eare drew arrow ground sharpe new queene wound gaue pierſed vnto hart afterward full ſore gan ſmart whole many yeare euen good cheare knight qd thee hele thee reſtore parfite wele paine thou haſt endured haue two joy thou art cured forth paſt rout ſober cheare walking ſaid thought heare well wiſt ſeruaunts paſſed anon fond lady tooke hond made chere goddes beaute called prince bounty eke gaue name ſaid nothing blame ſhe vertuous sauing ſhe would pity vſe cauſe ſought put far thought ſith ſhe whole richeſſe womanhead friendlineſſe ſaid nothing fitting void pity owne legging gan preach play beauty told aie ſaid ſhe creature name ſhould endure bookes full pleaſaunce put euer remembraunce thought friendly vnto lady goodlely ſpake appuls trow ſhe poſſeſſion wherefore long proceſſion many pace arme vnder welke ſo none would commaund ſay forthwith need muſt obay deſired leſt lady requeſt long together beene brought lady queene ſaid ſo god ſpeed shew grace conſent need lady tho full conningly right well auiſed womanly downe gan kneele vpon floures vvhich aprill nouriſhed ſhoures mighty lord gan ſay pleaſeth woll obay reſtraine thought ye woll thyng ſhall wrought word kneeling ſhe quoke mighty lord armes tooke ſaid haue ſeruaunt one truer liuing none vvherefore good ſeeing trouth paine ye routh purpoſe heare ſpeech fully auiſed leech one thyng ye may ſure may dure word right game thought lough told name vvhich maruaile fere niſt ne whether bet none abide thus gone well wend lady wold imagen deme told counſaile whole made complaint vnto lord mighty ſaint verily thyng vnſought ſaid knowne thought told trouth mine vneaſe bet couth haue mine eaſe though ſtudied weke well wiſt lord ſeke would leched wonder faine man blame mine paine lord ſaid long lady plaid gan ſmile ſpirit glade anſwere ſhe made put double peine ne ſeine wiſt ne beſt ferre heart fro reſt thought ſmiling ſigne token heart encline would requeſts reaſonable becauſe ſmiling fauorable euery thing ſhall thriue thought tho anon bliue wordleſſe anſwere toun tane obligatioun ne called ſurety wiſe amongſt called wiſe thus joyous dout sure vnſureſt rout right mine heart thought leſſe wexe fere one thought made wele another ſhent euery dele till laſt couth purpoſed ſerue truly liues ſpace awaiting euer yeare grace vvhich may fall yet ſterue pleaſe ſerue ſerued haue woll euer thyng none leuer ſeruice whoſe preſence mine heauen whole abſence hell full diuers paine vvhych death full oft ſtraines thus thought ſtood vnneth felt harme ne good ſaw queene little paas come mighty lord kneeled downe preſence lady vvith ſober countenaunce auiſed word well ſuffiſed lord anon preſent bill wherein whole entent vvas written ſhe beſought knew euery thought godhead grace would forgyue old treſpace vndiſpleaſed time paſt ſhe would euer ſtedfaſt ſeruice death vſe euery thought ſhe breath ſight wept ſaid vvithin written ſore whych bill lord gan ſmyle ſaid would within yle lord ſyre eaſt weſt cald new conqueſt great councell tooke queene long tale betweene ouer bill read thriſe wonder gladly gan deuiſe feature faire viſage bad good thrift image ſayd trowed compleint cauſe corſeint ſleeue put bill none knew forth walke apace beholding luſty rout halfe thought ſmiling chere till laſt ye ſhall turned vnto queene ageine ſaid morne pleine woll ye purpoſed ben weare flour luſty colour vſe may excuſe ne none wiſe able ſeruiſe ſaid haue lord euermore yle haue ſhall ioy peace eaſe pleaſaunce liues vſe without noyſaunce ſtate ſeene turned viſage queene giue knowledge full anſwere bill nay ne word none obeiſaunt ſeemed echone queene vvell ſeemed great fere tooke lodging euery night vvas none departed night ſome read old romance occupied pleaſances make verelaies lay ſome diuerſe play romance tooke reading booke thought ſphere ſo run riſing sun ſuch prees piaine aſſemble gone great paine one might go ne ſtand ne none take hand vvithouten diſtourbed huge great prees within two houres mighty lord floures diuers colour many paire eſtate vp aire vvell two fathom hight ſet ſight queene knight lady euery wight haſt ſent ſo neuer one vvas abſent come echone thus aſſembled ye haue heard ſay vvithout tarrying hight ſeene euery wight vp ſtood among prees aboue counſayler ſeruaunt loue vvhich ſeemed well great eſtate ſhewed debate owe ne goodly might vſed gentilneſſe excuſed vvherefore ſaid lord vvas euery wight ſhould ſtill pee one accord thus commaunded word tongue ſwiche language turne yet mine age heard neuer ſo conningly man ſpeake ne halfe ſo faithfully euery thing ſaid seemed inſealed approued trew swiche cunning language new well according chere thinke yet alway mine one place may alone firſt con luſty yle thaſtate little rehearſe wholly euery thing cauſed lord comming euery wele euery wo cauſe ech thing ſo vvell ſhewed eaſie ſpeech ſicke need leech whole grace told plainly thing laſt con conclude voided euery language rude ſaid prince mighty lord departing would accord party preſent fine entent vvitneſſe preſence ſight vvhich ſits among might kneeled downe withouten word ſpake tho gan mighty lord dreſſe vvith cheare auiſed largeſſe ſaid vnto knight ye ſhall joy reſtored ye haue ben true ye twaine graunt euery paine thouſand joy euery weeke looke ye lenger ſeeke lady lo hem take ech beeth good chere happy day new begun sith riſing ſun place graunt wholly ſtand grace ſerueth truely without ſlouth auaunced trouth tho knight downe kneele vvening doe wonder wele seeing lord great mrrcy v hath enriched ſo openly deſerue may neuer leaſt part euermore vvith ſoule body truely ſerue till ſterue lady ſtood knight couth ſo mikel good vvent haſt alſo ioyous glad tho alſo rich euery thought hath ought nought beſought humble wiſe v taccept ſeruice ſhew v friendly cheares vvhich treaſure many yeares kept v great paine told ſeruants twaine vvere would ſo euer death chaunge would neuer ne doe offence ne thinke like ill fill ordinance made othes freſh new old ſeruice renew wholly euermore vve become might well awaiting ſlouth vve made ne fault ne trouth ne thought enſure vvith may dure ſeaſon paſt againe eue lord queene tooke leue ſaid would haſtely returne good leiſure ſojourne honour eaſe commaunding faſt knight pleaſe gaue ſtatutes paper ordent diuers officer forth ſhip ſame night went ſoone ſight morrow aire attempred wonder faire early riſing ſun night away run playing v riuage lady ſpake voyage ſaid ſhe made ſmall journies held ſtraunge country forthwith queene went ſhewed wholly entent tooke leaue cheare weeping pitty ſee parting queene paine martyr new yſſaine woe ſhe ſo tender yet weepe oft remember offerd reſigne lady eight time nine thaſtate yle ſhortly tell might pleaſe dwell ſaid euer linage lady doe homage hole withouten ye euermore nay god forbid lady oft many conning word ſoft said euer ſuch thing ſhould beene conſent ſhould queene eſtate ſo well named wiſe ſhould attamed would faine hert ſo befell ſmert doe thing might pleaſe wiſe eaſe kiſſed bad good night leue wept many wight might men lady praiſed ſuch name araiſed cunning friendlineſſe beauty gentilneſſe glad friendly cheare •• ſhe vſed yeares wonder euery wight ſay well might prees vpon morrow ſhip brought ſorrow made ſhe ſhould vnder ſaile ye wiſt ye would meruaile forth goeth ſhip goeth fond wood man vnbond doubt behind ſea withouten fere anon ran till waw ſodenly ouerthraw water fro backward forward trauailed ſo mind breath nigh gone good ne harme knew none til laſt hooke tweine men ſhip mikel peine ſaue life ſuch trauaile ye wiſt ye would meruaile ſhip drew hie ſaiden would die laid long downe maſt clothes caſt made teſtament wiſt ſelfe ment ſaid would maſt wo told tane leaue euery wight cloſed mine eyen loſt ſight auiſed die without ſpeech remedy ſeech grace new great need lady paine tooke heed bethought trouth ſee die great routh came ſober wiſe ſoftly ſaid pray riſe come let fare ſhall wel haue ye care obey ye fulfill holy lord long ago liſt commaunded ſo againe reſiſtence may without great offence therefore ſay friendly aye riſe vp behold auauntage graunt inheritage peaceably without ſtriue day liue apple ſleue one ſhe put took leue word ſaid good hele made ſend wele wherewith paine one tooke ſuch leaue bone new durenſe pleaſaunce couth deſired daunce whole wight vp roſe joyous heart light hole vnſicke right wele eaſe forget diſeaſe lady ſhe plaid went anone ſaid joy perſons pleaſe firſt ordained parfite eaſe euery pleaſure depart send madame large part good ſuch plenty done beauty hele may thought ſend wrought madame quoth ſeruaunt trew haue ben long yet new without chaunge repentaunce wiſe variaunce ſo thriue euer thing none leuer pleaſe euer fare mine heart lady welfare life mine hele lech alſo euery thing doth wo helpe need ſurete euery joy longs ſuccours whole wiſe may thought man deuiſe grace madame ſuch haue found need bound euer ſo chriſt ſaue heale liue haue wherefore reaſoun ſerue due obeiſaunce till ſterue dead quicke euer late early hour tho came lady ſmall alite plaine engliſh con conſite word whole entent ſhewed ſhe ment meward euery wiſe wholly ſhe came deuiſe without proceſſe long trauell charging keepe counſell would grace attaine commaundement faine wherefore paſſe ouer time counſell cord well rime eke oth haue ſwore breake better vnbore untrue euermore ſhould hold neuermore place ſhould report thing auaile might comfort mewards wiſe andech wight would diſpiſe couth repreeue thing ſore greeue wherefore hereof mencion make ne long ſermon ſhortly thus excuſe rime councell refuſe sailing thus two dayes three lady towards countrie ouer waues high greene large deepe betweene vpon time called ſaid hele ſhe well paid queene yle talked long ſhe ſeene ſtate queene lady name name two houres mo game till laſt wind gan riſe blew ſo faſt ſuch wiſe ſhip euery wight ſay madame er eue day god tofore ye ſhall ye would faineſt ye doubt within ſixe hour ye ſhall word ſhe gan ſmile ſaid long ſet vp ſhe roſe ſhip ſhe goſe made good cheare euery wight till land ſhe ſight ſight glad god wot abaſhed aboot aud forth goeth ſhortly tell ſhe accuſtomed dwell receiued good right joyous cheere heart light glad new auenture pleaſaunt euery creature landing tho woke found chamber full ſmoke cheekes eke vnto eares body weat teares ſo feeble ſuch wiſe vnneth might riſe fare trauailed ſo faint neither knew kirke ne ſaint ne ne ne auiſed way would go venturous grace riſe walkt ſought pace pace till winding ſtaire found held vice aye hond vpward ſoftly ſo gan creepe till came thought ſleepe mine eaſe preace good leiſure peace till ſomewhat recomfort trauell great feare endured thought without wight witleſſe faint without chamber paint full ſtories old diuers rehearſe vnto bed full ſoberly might full ſothly pace nothing ſaid till laſt downe laid mind would giue leue dreamed eue rehearſe right child ſchoole verſe doth thinketh thriue right ſo liue thought haue remembraunce paine pleaſaunce dreame whole befell ye tell thus thought lay happy unhappy day wot ſo haue blame two name befell ſo thought proceſſe new ſleepe brought gouerned ſo againe within yle thought whereof knight lady ſight aſſembled greene knight lady queene aſſembly ſaid content paid wholly thing knight ſhould king would ſure witneſſe wedded leſſe remembraunce without thus conſent euermore concluded knight depart ſhould ſame night forthwith tooke voiage journey marriage returne ſuch hoſt wedded might leaſt moſt concluded written ſealed might repealed wiſe aie firme ſhould within tearme without excuſation feaſt coronation knight thereof charge anon little barge brought late againſt eue tooke leaue barge man thought pleaſure brought queene ſelfe accuſtomed aye ſame barge play needeth neither maſt ne rother haue heard ſuch another maiſter gouernaunce hie ſayled thought pleaſaunce vvithout labour eaſt vveſt one calme tempeſt went requeſt firſt prayed feſt vvhen came countree paſſed wauy ſee hauen deepe large left rich noble barge court ſhortly tell went wont dwell receiued good right heire worthy knight vvith ſtates lond vvhich came anon firſt ſond vvith glad ſpirits full trouth loth fault ſlouth attaint wiſe rich old ſeruiſe vvhich euer trew fond sith firſt inhabit lond ſo receiued king forgotten thing owe done ne might pleaſe ne ſoueraine lord eaſe ſo ſhortly ſay cuſtome done aye ſeuen yere paſt father old wiſe hore king land tooke leue baron eue told dayes paſt vvere comen laſt hertily prayed hem remember ſonne yong tender borne prince returne countree might aduenture
