grace vvithin time ſpace true friendly aye bene alway thus prayd without tooke leaue euermore knowen tender age young prince great viage vncouth ſtraung honour ſeche tooke hond little ſpeeche vvhich ſeeke prince deſired rich great name floured ſo time mo eſtate ne ſo well named borne none euer blamed prince ſomewhat haue ſpoke ſome thus befell ye ſhall heare vnto lord made ſuch cheare joy preſent ſee troth ment glad ech one among one deſired rich lord ſuch prince might pleaſe faire faſt deſired heire ſaid great ſurety ywis ſpeaking prince himſelfe auiſed plaine engliſh vndiſguiſed ſhewed hole journey counſell gan prey told enſured day might paſſe vvithout diffame great blame euer ſhame counſell auiſe prayth twiſe would within ten day auiſe ordaine ſuch way diſpleaſaunce ne realme ouer great grieuaunce haue might feaſt sixty thouſand leaſt intent within ſhort returne vnto yle came fro kepe day nothing would away counſaile tho lord anon chamber euerychone togither went deuiſe might beſt wiſe puruey lord pleaſaunce realmes continuaunce honor continued euermore laſt found way within next ten day might paine diligence done caſt diſpence might draw concluſion made ech thing prouiſion done wholly tofore prince lord come ſhewed done couth reaſon find within ten day might depart way would fifteene leaſt returne might feaſt ſhewed euery reaſon might ſo haſtily deſired ne day might keepe way diuers cauſes wonder great vvhich heard ſuch heat fell ſorow ſeke still bed whole weke nigh tother ſhame doubt blame might aret oft vpon breſt ſaid ala mine honour aye haue loſt cleane day dead would ala name shall aye henceforth ſhame diſhonoured repreued neuer ſhall beleeued made ſwich ſorow trouth behold great routh ſo endured dayes fiftene till lord euen come told ready ſhewed word wiſe purueyd eſtate ſaid twenty thouſand knight name fourty thouſand without blame come noble ligine togider compane vvere lodged riuers ſide pleaſure tabide prince tho joy vp roſe lodged go vvithout ſame night theſe ſupper made right bode till dey forthwith take journey leuing ſtreight holding large till came noble barge prince luſty knight vvith people armes bright vvas comen thought pa knew well none abiding behind preſent forthwith anon intent told made cry ofte day twiſe commaunding euery liues wight preſent ſight morow riuage vvhere begin would viage morrow come cry kept night ſlept truſſed purueied morrow fault ſhips ſorrow ſaue barge two ſhips ſaw mo thus douths ſtood waxing ſea comming flood cried ſhip goe euery wight hie hie might barge thought echone went without left one horſe male truſſe ne bagage salad ſpeare gard brace ne page lodged roome ynough ſhipping thought lough gan maruaile thought euer ſuch ſhip wrought people encreaſe ne neuer ſo thicke might preaſe roome one lodged ill trow ſelfe laſt one lodged maſt looked ſaw ſuch rome lodged towne forth goth ſhip ſaid creed knee good ſpeed downe kneeled euery wight praied faſt yle might come ſafety prince company worſhip without blame diſclaunder name promiſe ſhould retourne within time ſojourne lond biding hoſt prayer leaſt moſt keepe day might appointed queen returne without ſlouth ſo aſſured trouth fault prince knight time ſlept night wo diſeaſe doubt ſhould queene diſpleaſe forth goeth ſhip ſuch ſpeed right prince great need deſire would thought till vnto yle brought haſt vpon ſand people tooke land herts glad chere light weening heauen night paſſed entring toward yle clad blacke chere piteous lady neuer diſpiteous life tofore ſory chere hert tore vnto prince gan ride come ſaid abide abide haue haſt faſt retourne reaſon ye ſojourne vntruth hath v diſcried vvo worth time v allied vvith ſo ſoone vntrew ala day knew ala time ye bore lond lore accurſed hider brought joy turnd nought acquaintance may complaine vvhich cauſe paine ala madame quoth tho knight horſe light vvith colour pale cheekes lene ala mene vvhat haue ye ſaid ye wroth diſpleaſe would loth know ye well promeſſe made haue princeſſe vvhich perfourme mine intent mote ſpeed haue ment trew without change thought new alſo fully ſeruand creature man liuand may lady princeſſe ſhe mine heauen whole richeſſe lady mine heale world joy weale may whence coms ſpeech tell madame beſeech fith firſt liuing ſo fearfull nothing heare ſpeake doubt feele mine heart breake say madame tell remnaunt good ill ala qd ſhe ye bore loue land lore queene dead ruth ſorrow great vntruth two partes luſty rout lady wont talke play dead cleane away vnder earth tane lodging new ala euer ye vntrew time ye ſet paſt queene counſaile ſone haſt doe ſaid great blame acquaintaunce cauſe would ſhame lady auiſe prayed need wiſe eſchewing tale ſongs make would ill tongs ſey lightly conqueſt prayed poore feaſt foule worſhip weiued ſo vnwiſely conceiued rich treaſour heale famous name weale put ſuch auenture ſclaunder euer dure like without helpe appele wherefore need counſele euery wight would ſay cloſed yle open way become euery wight well appreued knight ala without payſaunce ſoone acheued thobeiſaunce moued counſell thriſe concluded daily twiſe bet die without blame loſe rich name wherefore death acquaintaunce cheſe left haue pleaſaunce doubt liue repreued ſo ſoone beleeued made othes one accord eat ne drinke ne ſpeake word ſhould neuer euer weping bide place without parting vſe dayes penaunce without deſire allegeaunce truth anon con preue queen forth leue toke preſent defauts fully repent died withouten thus loſt euermore ſhould hereof reherſe comen within come ſee herſe ye ſhall ſee piteous ſight euer yet ſhewen knight ye ſhall ſee lady ſtond ech great rod bond clad black viſage white ready ſmite wepe make countenaunce ſlepe ſo bet ſo blew cloth died new parfite repentance thus keepe ordinance euer death▪ endures breath knight tho armes twaine lady tooke gan ſaine ala birth wo worth life euen drew knife gowne doublet ſhert made blood come hert ſet downe vpon greene full repent cloſed eene ſaue one drew breath vvithout thus tooke death cauſe luſty hoaſt vvhich battaile coaſt ſorrow ſuch cry gan rere thorow company heauen heard ſowne vnder therth al fer adowne wild beaſts feare ſodainly afrayed doubt might dure ran liues vnſure wood vnto plaine valley high mountaine ſought ran beaſts blind cleane forgotten kind wo ceaſed counſaile went theſe lord lady ſent auiſe done beſought ſhe ſay would ſone vveeping full ſore clad blake lady ſoftly ſpake ſaid lord trouth miſchiefe flouth ye judge would right prince knight ye ben aſtate echone die fault ſhould one one hold promeſſe done longs gentilneſſe fulfilled prince beheſt haſty farme bene feaſt vnrecouerable v ſlaunder aye durable vvherefore ſay counſaile none may auaile ye liſt remembraunce puruey make ſuch ordinaunce queene ſo meke woman dede ſeke might land chappell haue ſome remembraunce graue shewing end pity ſome notable old city nigh unto high way euery wight might pray haue ben trew euen ſhe changed hew twiſe wiſhed death ſight thus paſſed breath ſaid lord hoſt ſo conclude leaſt moſt would euer houſes thacke liues lead weare blacke forſake pleaſaunces turn joy penaunces beare dead prince barge named ſhould haue charge hearſe lay queen remnaunt went kneen holding honds high gon crie mercy mercy eueriſh thrie curſed time euer ſlouth haue ſuch maſterdome trouth barge long mile hare forth lady one one company brought echone paſt ſea tooke land new herſes ſand put brought anon vnto city cloſed ſtone vſed aye king land lay raigned honour writ conquerours abbey nunnes blake accuſtomed wake vſage riſe ech night pray euery liues wight ſo befell guiſe ordeint ſaid ſeruiſe prince queen deuoutly might herſes many oriſons verſes without note full ſoftely said full heartily night till day people church con pray vnto holy trinity thoſe ſoules haue pity night paſt ronne new day begonne yong morrow rayes red sunne ouer con ſpred atempered clere faire made time wholſome aire befell wonder caſe ſtrange among people gan change soone word euery woo vnto joy ſome two bird fedred blew greene bright rayes like gold betweene ſmall thred ouer euery joynt full colour ſtrange coint vncouth wonderfull ſight vpon queen herſe con light ſong full low ſoftely three ſongs harmony vnletted euery wight till laſt aged knight ſeemed man great thought like ſet thing nought viſage ein forwept pale man long vnſlept herſes ſtood haſty hondling hood vnto prince paſt made bridde ſomewhat agaſt wherefore ſhe roſe left ſong depart u among ſpread wing paſſe place entred haſt ſhortly tell hurt backeward downe fell window richly peint liues many diuers ſeint bet wing bled faſt hurt thus died paſt lay well houre till laſt briddes ſcore come ſembled place window broken made ſwiche wamentacioun pity heare ſoun warble throtes complaint note joy cleane reuerſed one glas ſoone perſed beke colour nine herbe brought floureleſſe grene full ſmall leaues plaine swart long many vaine fellow lay thus dede hearbe laid hede dreſſed full ſoftily hong head ſtood thereby hearb leſſe halfe houre gan ouer knit floure full wexe ripe ſeed right one another feed would beake tooke graine fellowes beake certaine put thus within third vp ſtood pruned bird dead ſight togither forth flight tooke ſinging v leue none diſturb hem would ne greue parted gone thabbeſſe ſeeds ſoone echone gadred hand herb ſhe tooke well auiſand leafe ſeed ſtalke floure ſaid good ſauour common herb find well approued vncouth kind vertuouſe vvho ſo haue might vſe need flowre leafe graine heale might certaine laid downe vpon herſe vvhere lay queene gan reherſe echone ſeene taling thus ſede wex greene dry herſe gan ſpring vvhich thought wondrous thing floure new ſeed people tooke heed ſaid ſome great miracle medicine fine triacle well done aſſay might eaſe way corſes torch light waked night soone lord conſent people thereto content eaſie word little fare made queenes viſage bare ſhewed wherefore ſwoone fell whole rout ſo ſorry moſt leaſt long weping ceaſt lord remembraunce vnto ſuch diſpleaſaunce liue called paine true plaine good abbeſſe graine gan theſe dreſſe three finger cleane ſmall queenes mouth tale one full eaſily put full conningly ſhewed ſoone ſuch vertue preued medicine true ſmiling countenaunce queene vproſe vſaunce ſhe wont euery wight made good cheere ſight people kneeling ſtones thought heauen ſoule bone prince lay went make ſame aſſay queene vnderſtood medicine good prayed ſhe might haue graines releue paine ſhe endured went ſo cured within little ſpace luſty freſh liue good hele hole ſpeech lough ſaid gramercy leech joy throughout town great bel ſown afraied people journay city euery way come asked cauſe rongen ſo ſtately queene thabbeſſe made diligence would ceſſe lady ſoone rout sewing queene called name echone told none forgetten young ne old might men ſee joyes new medicine fine trew thus reſtored euery wight well queene knight vnto perfit joy hele fleting ſuch wele folke would wiſe deſire perfit paradiſe thus paſſed ſorrow mikle joy ſoone morrow king queene euery lord lady one accord generall aſſembly great cry country intent turned parliament ordained auiſed euery thing deuiſed pleaſe might moſt leaſt concluded feaſt within yle hold full conſent young old ſame wiſe thing ſhould withouten ſhipped thither went ſtraunge realmes ſent king queenes ducheſſes diuers prince princeſſes linage pray might like day mariage ſport come ſee yle diſport ſhould jouſts turnaies armes done way signifying ouer day aprill within may auiſed lady tweine good eſtate well beſeine certaine knight ſquiers queenes officer manner embaſſade certain letter cloſed made take barge depart ſeeke lady euery part till found thing charged haue queene king lady maiſtres beſeke gentilnes day oft recommaund queen prayes loues haſt ſhe come woll waſt feaſt buſineſſe without joy luſtineſſe tooke token good ſpeed praid god ſend need forth went lady knight fourteene day night brought lady barge well ſped done charge whereof queene ſo hartily glad ſoth ſuch joy ſhe ſhip approched lond ſhe lady ſond met armes ſo conſtraine wonder behold twaine dome twelue houres neither heat ne watry ſhoures departed company sauing themſelfe none gaue layſour eaſe rehearſe joy diſeaſe pleaſure courage young tender age many knight brought night parted pleaſaunce content hert countenaunce queene maiſtreſſe night buſineſſe morrow huge rout prince lord come lady ſaid comming glad well apaid full commingly thanked full heartily lough ſmiled ſaid ywis doubt ſafety commaunded diligence ſpare neither gold ne ſpence make ready morow wedded ſaint iohn borow would withouten let wite leſe morow come ſeruice mariage ſuch wiſe said honour neuer prince ne conquerour wedde ne ſuch company gentilneſſe chiualry ne lady ſo great rout ne ſo beſeen abouts certifie life withouten lie feaſt hold tentis tell mine entent rome large plaine vnder wood champaine betwixt riuer well neuer abbay ne ſell ben ne kirke houſe ne village time man age dured three month feaſt one eſtate neuer ceaſt early riſing ſonne till day ſpent yronne juſting dauncing luſtineſſe ſowned gentilneſſe thought ſecond morrow ended old ſorrow ſurety euery wight lady ſlept night prince queene reſt vnto lady made requeſt beſought oft praied mewards well apaied conſider mine old trouth paine haue routh accept ſeruiſe ſuch forme ſuch wiſe might one thus prayed queene euerichone ſhould nay ſtint juſting day pray lady requere content fere good heart make friendly cheare ſaid happy yeare ſhe ſmiled ſaid ywis trow well ſeruaunt would welfare triſt would would wiſt knew trouth continue would without ſlouth ſuch ye report reſtraining courage ſport couth conſent requeſt named feſt vſaunce obeying pleaſaunce requeſt conſent pleaſe entent eke ſoueraine aboue commanded hath loue prefer againſt prince may wer power ouer raigneth would nought paineth ſith one contrary ſhall none tho thought promiſe marriage meſe deſired euery wight made ſame night put away maner douts euery wight thereabouts ſo morrow euery thought euery ſorrow diſlodged mine hert euery wo euery ſmert vnto tent prince prince thought brought maiſtres ſaid full age conclude marriage lady knight ſquiers great hoſt miniſters inſtruments ſounes diuerſe long rehearſe tent church perochiall ordaint eſpeciall feaſt ſacre archbiſhop archdiacre song full ſeruiſe cuſtome guiſe church ordinaunce dine daunce brought diuers playes ſpeed ech prayes merry moſt leaſt ſaid amended feaſt right glad lady lord marriage thaccord wiſhed v heart pleaſaunce ioy hele continuaunce minſtrils made requeſt encreaſing feſt would touch cord ſome new joyeux accord mooue people gladneſſe praiden gentilneſſe ech paine day ſhew cunning play tho began ſownes meruelous entuned accord joyous round tent vvith thouſands inſtruments euery wight daunce pained merry none fained vvhich ſowne troubled ſleepe fro bed forth lepe vvening feaſt woke ſeaſt na lady ne creature saue wals old portraiture horſmen haukes hound hurt deere full wound like bitten ſome hurt ſhot dreame ſeemed wake knew trouth ye ſeen routh trow ye would haue wept weke neuer man yet halfe ſo ſeke went eſcaped life fault ſword ne knife find ne might life tabridge de thing kerued ne edge vvherewith might wofull pain haue voided bleeding vains lo bliſſe lo paine vvhich lady complaine grace mercy require end wo buſie feare accept ſeruiſe ſeruice ſuch auiſe dreame ſubſtaunce might turne cogniſaunce cogniſaunce preue full conſent good leue el without pray night day mote vnto dreame returne ſleeping ſo forth aie ſojourne yle pleaſaunce vnder lady obeiſaunce ſeruice ſuch wiſe pleaſe may deuiſe grace one accept like dreamed ſlept dure thouſand yeare ten good amen amen faireſt faire goodlieſt liue ſecret plaine ſhriue requiring grace complaint healed martyred ſaint trouth ſweare booke ye may heale ſlea looke go forth mine owne true hert innocent humbleſſe thine obſeruaunce thy lady thy knee preſent thy ſeruice new think great pleaſance liue vnder thobeiſance may look ſoft giue thee bliſſe thou deſireſt oft diligent awake obey drede wild thy countenaunce meeke glad thy nature feed thing yt may pleaſance vvhen thou ſhalt ſleep haue aie remembrance thimage may lookes ſoft giue thee bliſſe thou deſireſt oft ſo thou name find written booke el vpon wall looke thou ſeruaunt true kind thine obeiſaunce ſhe therewithall faining loue breeding fall grace whoſe lookes ſoft may giue bliſſe thou deſireſt oft ye ballade read ſhall pray keepe fall flower leaf gentlewoman arbor grove ſeeth great company knight lady dance upon green graſs ended kneel honour daiſie ſome flower ſome leaf afterward gentlewoman learneth one theſe lady meaning hereof honour flower thing fading every blaſt ſuch look beauty worldly pleaſure honour leaf abideth root notwithſtanding froſts winter ſtorms follow vertue quality without regard worldly reſpects phebus chaire gold ſo hie whirled vp ſterry sky aloft boole entred certainely ſhoures ſweet raine diſcended oft cauſing ground fele time oft vp giue many wholeſome aire euery plaine clothed faire new green maketh ſmall floures ſpringen field mede good wholeſom ſhoures renueth old dede winter time euery ſede springeth hearbe ſo euery wight ſeaſon wexeth glad light ſo glad ſeaſon ſwete happed thus vpon certaine night lay bed ſleepe full vnmete vnto ne might reſt ne wiſt na earthly wight ſuppoſe heart eaſe nad ſickneſſe diſeaſe wherefore meruail greatly ſelfe ſo long withouten ſleepe lay vp roſe three houres twelfe ſpringing day put geare mine array pleaſaunt groue gan paſſe long bright ſonne vp riſen okes great ſtreight line vnder graſſe ſo freſh hew newly ſprong eight foot nine euery tree well fro fellow grew branch brode lade leues new ſprongen ayen ſunne ſhene red ſome glad light grene thought right pleaſant ſight eke briddes ſong would haue rejoyced earthly wight couth yet manere heare nightingale yeare ful buſily herkened hert eare voice perceiue coud laſt path little bread found greatly vſed forgrowne graſſe weed well vnneth wight might ſe thoght path ſome whider goth parde ſo followed till brought right pleaſaunt herber well ywrought benched turfes new freſhly turued whereof grene gras ſmall ſo thicke ſo ſhort ſo freſh hew moſt like vnto green well wot hegge alſo yede compas cloſed greene herbere ſicamour ſet eglatere wrethen fere ſo well cunningly euery branch leaf grew meſure plaine bord height ſee neuer thing enſure well done tooke cure make ytrow peine make paſſe tho men haue ſeine ſhapen herber roofe prety parlour alſo hegge thicke caſtle wall liſt without ſtond go though would day prien fro ſhould ſee wight within one within well might perceiue tho yeden without field euery ſide couered corn graſſe y• doubt though one would ſeeke world wide rich field coud eſpide coaſt quantity good thing plenty pleaſaunt ſight ſie thought ſodainly felt ſo ſweet aire eglentere certainely heart deme ſuch diſpaire ne thought froward contraire ouerlaid ſhould ſoone haue bote one felt ſauour ſote ſtood caſt aſide mine eie ware faireſt medle tree euer yet life ſie full bloſſomes might therein goldfinch leaping pretile fro bough bough liſt eet bud floures ſweet herber ſide joyning faire tree haue told laſt brid began ſing eaten eat wold paſſing ſweetly manifold pleaſaunt coud deuiſe ſong ended wiſe nightingale ſo merry note anſwered wood rong ſodainly ſote ſtood aſtonied ſo ſong thorow rauiſhed till late long ne wiſt place ne ayen thought ſhe ſong euen mine ere wherefore waited buſily euery ſide might ſee laſt gan full well aſpie ſhe ſat freſh grene laurer tree ſide euen right gaue ſo paſſing delicious ſmell according eglentere full well whereof ſo inly great pleaſure thought ſurely rauiſhed paradice deſire ferther paſſe day ſote graſſe ſat downe mine entent bird ſong conuenient pleaſaunt manifold meat drinke thing thereto herber ſo freſh cold wholeſome fauours eke ſo comforting demed ſith beginning world neuer ſeene pleaſaunt ground none earthly man ſat bird harkening thus thought heard voice ſodainly moſt ſweeteſt moſt delicious euer wight trow truly heard life armony ſweet accord ſo good muſike voice angel moſt like laſt groue euen right goodly pleaſant ſight ſie came ſinging luſtily world lady tell aright great beauty lieth might ne array neuertheleſſe ſhall tell part though ſpeake ſurcotes white veluet wele ſitting clad ſemes echone manner garniſhing ſet emerauds one one many rich ſtone ſet purfles dout color ſleues traines round great pearles round orient diamond fine ruby red many another ſtone went name euerich head rich fret gold without dread full ſtately rich ſtones ſet euery lady chapelet head freſh greene wele wrought ſo meruellouſly noble ſight ſeene laurer ſome full pleaſantly chapelets woodbind ſadly agnus caſtus alſo chapelets freſh many tho daunced eke ſong full ſoberly yede manner compace one yede mid company soole ſelfe followed pace ſhe kept whoſe heauenly figured face pleaſant wele ſhape perſon beauty ſhe paſt hem euerichone richly beſeene manifold alſo euery manner thing head full pleaſaunt behold crowne gold rich king braunch agnus caſtus eke bearing hand ſight truly lady company ſhe began roundell luſtely suſe le foyle de vert moy men call seen mon ioly cuer en dormy company anſwered voice ſweet entuned ſo ſmall thought ſweeteſt melody euer heard life ſoothly thus came dauncing ſinging middeſt mede echone herber ſitting god wot thought wel bigone might auiſe hem one one faireſt coud beſt dance ſing moſt womanly thing daunced little throw heard ferre ſodainly great noiſe thundring trump blow though ſhould haue departed skie within ſie ye ſame groue ye lady come men armes comming ſuch rout men earth ben aſſembled place wele horſed none stering ſo faſt earth trembled ſpeake rich ſtones men horſe trow large wones pretir iohn ne treſory might vnneth haue boght ye tenth party array ſo liſt heare ſhall rehearſe ſo alite groue ſpake ſie come firſt clokes white company ware delite chapelets freſh okes ſeriall newly ſprong trumpet euery trumpe hanging broad banere fine tartarium full richely bete euery trumpet lord armes neckes great pearles ſete collers brode coſt would lete would ſeem ſchochones echone ſet many precious ſtone horſe harneis white alſo next one company came king armes mo clokes white cloth gold richly chapelets greene head hie crown yt ſcochones bere ſet pearle ruby ſaphere eke great diamond many one horſe harneis geare ſute according euerychone ye haue heard ye foreſaid trumpet ſeeming nothing lere guiding ſo manerly hem came great company herauds purſeuaunts eke arrayed clothes white veluet hardily thing ſeke hem ſhould harneis ſet euery man chapelet scochones eke horſe harneis indede ſute hem hem yede next hem came armour bright ſaue head ſeemely knight nine euery claſpe naile ſight harneis red gold fine cloth gold furred ermine trappors ſtedes ſtrong wide large ground hong euery boſſe bridle paitrell worth would wene thouſand pound head well dreſſed crownes laurer grene beſt made euer ſene euery knight riding three henſhmen awaiting euery ſhort tron • houn lord helme bare ſo richly dight worſt worth ranſoun king ſecond ſhield bright bare necke thred bare vpright mighty ſpere full ſharpe ground kene euery child ware leaues grene freſh chapelet vpon haires bright clokes white fine veluet ſteeds trapped raied right without difference lord hem many freſh corſere came armed knight ſuch rout beſprad large field ware degree chaplet new made laurer grene oke ſome tree honds bare bough ſhene laurer ſome okes kene hauthorne ſome woodbind many mo mind ſo came horſes freſhly ſtering bloody ſownes trompes loud ſie many vncouth diſguiſing array theſe knight proud laſt euenly coud took place middes mede euery knight turned horſe hede fellow lightly laid ſpere reſt ſo juſtes began euery part brake ſpere ſome drew hors man field aſtray ſteeds ran behold rule gouernaunce enſure great pleaſaunce ſo juſts laſt houre tho crowned laurer grene wan priſe dint ſo ſore none ayenſt hem might ſuſtene juſting left clene fro horſe ninth alight anone ſo remnant euerichone forth yede togider twain twain behold worthy ſight toward lady greene plaine ſong daunced ſaid right lady ſoone goodly might brake ſong dance yede meet hem ful glad ſemblance euery lady tooke full womanly hond knight forth yede vnto faire laurer ſtood faſt leues lade boughes great brede dome neuer indede man ſeene halfe ſo faire tree vnderneath might well haue hundred perſons owne pleſance shadowed fro heat phebus bright ſhould haue felt greuance raine ne haile hem hurt might ſauour eke rejoice would wight ſicke melancolius ſo good vertuous great reuerence enclining low tree ſo ſoot faire hew within little throw began ſing daunce new ſong loue ſome plaining vntrew enuironning tree ſtood vpright euer yede lady knight laſt caſt mine eye aſide waxe luſty company came roming field wide hond hond knight lady lady ſurcotes richely purfiled many rich ſtone euery knight green ware mantle embrouded well ſo ſurcotes euerich chapelet hed right well vpon ſhining made goodly floures white red knight eke hond led ſute hem ware chapelets euerychone hem went minſtrels many one harpes pipe lute sautry greene head bare diuers floures made full craftely ſute goodly chapelets ware ſo dauncing mede fare mid found tuft ouerſprad floures compas whereto enclined euerychone great reuerence full humbly laſt began anone lady ſing right womanly bargaret praiſing daiſie thought among note ſwete ſaid si douſet la margarete anſwered fere paſſingly well ſo pleaſauntly blisful noiſe happed ſuddainly noone ſonne ſo feruently waxe hote prety tender floures loſt beauty freſh colour ſhronke heat lady eke brent yt ne wiſt hem might beſtow knight ſwelt lack ſhade nie ſhent within little throw wind began ſo ſturdily blow goeth floures euerichone mede laft one leues save ſuch ſuccoured among fro euery ſtorme might hem aſſaile growing vnder hedge thicke greues came ſtorme haile raine fere ſo withouten faile lady ne knight nade threed drie ſo dropping weed ye ſtorm cleane paſſed away tho white ſtood vnder tree felt nothing great affray greene without ybe yede routh pite comfort great diſeaſe faine helpleſſe eaſe ware one hem grene crowne rich well ſitting wherefore demed well ſhe quene tho greene awaiting lady white comming toward knight fere began comfort hem make hem chere queen white great beauty took hond queen yt grene ſaid ſuſter haue right great pitie annoy troublous tene wherein ye company haue bene long ala pleaſe go ſhall eaſe pleaſure may whereof tother humbly ſhe might thanked right ill array ſtorm heat behight euery lady anone right white one took grene hond ye knight ſene likewiſe ech tooke knight clad greene forth hem fare hegge anon right make juſts would ſpare boughes hew eke tree ſquare wherwith made hem ſtately fire great dry clothes y• wringing weat hearbs grew made bliſters ye ſunne brenning good wholeſome ointment new yt yede ſick faſt anointing yede gadering pleaſaunt ſalades made hem eat refreſh great vnkindly heat lady leafe began pray floure ſo ſeeming ſhould array ſoupe eke thing ſhe ſhould people bring ſhe ayen right goodly manere thanketh moſt friendly cheare saying plainely ſhe would obay hert commaundement anon without lenger delay lady leafe hath one yſent palfray intent arrayed well faire harneis gold nothing lacked long ſhold company made puruey horſe euery thing needed full luſtily euen herber ſitting paſſed ſo pleaſantly ſ • nging would haue comforted wight ſie paſſing wonder ſight nightingale day laurer ſete might whole ſeruice ſing longing may ſodainly gan take flight lady leafe forthright flew ſet hond ſoftly thing marueled greatly goldfinch eke fro medle tree fled heat buſhes cold vnto lady flower gan flee hond ſet wold pleaſauntly wing gan fold ſing pained hem ſore day ſo theſe lady rode forth great pace rout knight eke fere ſeen wonder caſe thought would aſſay ſome manere know fully trouth matere rode ſo pleaſantly herber paſſed dreſt forth happed mete anone right faire lady enſure ſhe come riding ſelf alone white ſemblance ful demure ſaluted bad good auenture might befall coud moſt humbly ſhe anſwered doughter gramercy madame qd durſt enquere would faine company wit paſt arbere ſhe ayen anſwered right friendly faire doughter tho y• paſſed white clothing ſeruaunts euerichone vnto leafe ſelfe one see ye crowned qd ſhe white madame qd yes diane goddeſſe chaſtite becauſe ſhe maiden hond braunch ſhe beareth agnus caſtus men call properly lady company ye ſe hearb chaplet weare ſuch han kept alway maidenheed laurer chaplet beare ſuch hardy manly indeed victorious name neuer may dede ſo worthy hond time none might hem withſtond tho weare chaplet hede freſh woodbind ſuch neuer loue vntrue word thought ne dede aye ſtedfaſt ne pleaſance ne fere thogh ſhuld herts tere would neuer flit euer ſtedfaſt till liues aſunder braſt faire madame qd yet would pray ladiſhip might might know ſome maner way sith hath liked beaute trouth theſe lady tell theſe knight rich armour tho grene weare flour ſome reuerence ye tre ſome vnto plot floures faire right good fair doghter qd ſhe sith deſire good debonaire tho nine crowned exemplaire honour longing chiualry thoſe certaine called nine worthy ye may ſee riding time many noble dede worthineſſe full oft haue bore crowne laurer leaues hede ye may old bookes rede conquerour laurer alway moſt honour tho beare bowes hond precious laurer ſo notable ſuch woll ye vnderſtond noble knight round table eke douſeperis honourable beare ſigne victory witneſſe deed mightily eke knight old garter time right worthily honour laurer haue laud wholly triumph eke marſhall glory vnto parfit richeſſe wight imagine geſſe one leafe giuen noble tree wight hath done worthily done ſo ought honour thing earthly witneſſe rome founder truly knighthood deed maruelous record take titus liuius crowned greene flora theſe floures goddeſſe awaiting beene ſuch loued idleneſſe delite buſineſſe hunt hauke pley medes many ſuch idle dedes great delite pleaſaunce haue floure ſo reuerently vnto ſuch obeiſaunce ye may ſee faire madame qd durſt aske cauſe knight haue ſigne honour rather leafe flour soothly doughter qd ſhe trouth knight euer ſhould perſeuering ſeeke honour without feintiſe ſlouth fro wele better manner thing ſigne leaues aye laſting rewarded degree whoſe luſty green may may appaired aie keping beautie freſh greene ni ſtorme may hem deface haile ſnow wind froſts kene wherfore haue property grace floure within little ſpace woll loſt ſo ſimple nature greeuance may endure euery ſtorme blow ſoone away ne laſt ſeaſon cauſe trouth ſay may way reaſon put ſuch occupation madame qd mine whole ſeruiſe thanke moſt humble wiſe acertained throughly euery thing deſired know right glad haue ſaid ſoothly ought pleaſure ye trow qd ſhe ayen ye owe ſeruice ye honour tel pray yere ye leafe ye flour madame qd though leaſt worthy vnto leafe owe mine obſeruaunce qd ſhe right well done certainly pray god honour auaunce kepe fro wicked remembraunce male bouch crueltie good well conditioned may lenger abide muſt follow great company ye may ſee yonder ride forth couth moſt humbly tooke leue ſhe gan hie faſt euer ſhe might drow homeward nigh night put ſeene writing vnder ſupport luſt rede little booke thou art ſo vnconning darſt thou put thy ſelf prees drede wonder thou wexeſt rede sith yt thou woſt full lite ſhall behold thy rude language full boiſtouſly vnfold explicit chaucer b c called la priere de noſtre dame chaucer b c called la priere de noſtre dame made ſome ſay requeſt blanch dutcheſs lancaſter prayer private uſe woman religion devout almighty merciable queene world fleeth ſuccour haue releaſe ſinne ſorrow tene glorious virgine flouris flour thee flee confounded errour helpe releeue almighty debonaire haue mercy mine perillous langour venquiſt hath cruell aduerſaire b bounty ſo fixe hath heart tent well wote thou ſuccour thou canſt warn good entent axith thine helpe thine heart aye ſo free thou art largeſſe plaine felicite hauen refute quiete reſt lo theuis ſeuen chaſen helpe lady bright mine ſhip breſt c comfort none lady dere lo mine ſinne mine confuſioun wch ought thine preſence apere han taken greeuous actioun veray right diſperatioun right mighten well ſuſtene worthy mine damnatioun nere mercy bliſful quene dout none queen miſericord thou nart cauſe grace mercy god vouchedſafe thee v accord certis chriſt bliſful modir dere bow bent ſwiche manere firſt juſtice ire rightfull god would mercy thee han grace deſire e euer hath mine hope refute thee beforne full oft many wiſe vnto mercy haſt thou receiued mercy lady great aſſiſe ſhall come high iuſtiſe little freut ſhall ben found thou day correct right mine werk confound f flying flee ſuccour thine tent hide fro tempeſt full drede beſeking ye abſent though wick help yet nede haue beaſt wit dede yet lady thou mee cloſe thine grace thine enemy mine lady take hede vnto mine death point chaſe g gracious maid modir neuer bitter earth ſee full ſweetneſſe mercy euer help mine fader wroth speake thou ne dare ſee haue done earth ala certes thou mine ſuccour ſinke eterne mine ghoſt exile h vouchedefafe tell become man alliaunce blood wrote bliſfull bill vpon croſſe generall acquetaunce euery penitent full criaunce therefore lady bright thou v prey ſhalt thou ſtent greeuaunce maken foe failen prey wote well thou wilt ſuccour thou art ſo full bounty certaine ſoule falleth errour thine pity goeth haleth againe makeſt thou peace wch ſouerain bringeſt crooked ſtrete ſo thee loueth ſhall loue vaine ſhall find life ſhall lete k kalenderis enlumined world lighted thine name ſo goith thee right wey drede ſoule lame queen comfort ſith thou art ye ſame ſeech medicine let mine fo mine woundentame mine hele thine hond reſine l lady thine ſorrow portrey vnder y• croſſe ne greeuous pennaunce bothis peine prey let alder fo make boſtaunce hath leſtis miſchaunce conuict ye han bought ſo dere ſaid erſt thou ground ſubſtaunce continue v thine pitous eyen clere moyſes ſaw boſh flambis rede brenning neuer ſtickebrend ſign thine vnwemmed maidenhede thou art boſh deſcend holyghoſt moyſes weend fire figure lady fire v defend hell eternally ſhall dure n noble princeſſe neuer haddeſt pere certes comfort v bee commeth thee chriſtis moder dere han none melody ne glee v rejoyce aduerſite ne aduocat none dare ſo prey v little hire ye helpen auemary twey light eyen tho blind luſt labour diſtreſſe treaſorere bounty mankind god cheſe moder humbleſſe ancelle made thee maiſtreſſe heauen earth bill vp bede world awaiteth euer thine goodnes thou ne failedeſt neuer wight nede p purpoſe haue ſometime enquere wherefore holy ghoſt thee ſought gabrielis voice come thine ere werre v ſwich wonder wrought ſave v ſithen bought needeth v weapon v ſaue onely v ought penitence mercy aske haue q queen comfort right bethink agilt haue thee mine ſoule worthy ſinke ala caitife wheder ſhall flee vvho ſhall vnto thine ſonne mine mean vvho thine ſelfe art pity well thou haſt routh aduerſitie world might tongue tell r redreſſe moder eke chaſtiſe certainly faders chaſtiſing ne dare abiden wiſe hideous full reckening moder joy gan ſpring ye mine judge eke ſoules leech euer pity abounding pity beſeech sooth ne graunteth pity vvithout thee god goodneſſe forgiueth none like vnto thee hath thee made • icaire maiſtreſſe world eke gouernereſſe heauen repreſſeth juſtiſe thine therefore witneſſe hath thee crowned ſo royal wiſe temple deuout ther god cheſe wonning theſe misbeleeued depriued mine ſoule penitent bring receiue ferther fleen thornis venemous heauen queen erth accurſed ful ſore ſo wounded ye may well ſeene loſt almoſt ſmert ſo ſore v virgine art ſo noble apparaile leadeſt v high toure paradiſe thou wiſh counſaile may haue thy grace thy ſuccour haue filth errour lady countrey thou adjourne cleaped thine bench freſh flour mercy euer ſhall ſojourne x xpen thine ſonne world alight vpon croſſe ſuffer paſſioun ſuffred eke longeus hart pight made heart blood renne adoun ſaluatioun fals eke unkind yet mine dompnatioun thanke ſuccour mankind yſaac figure death certaine ſo ferre forth fader would obey ne rought nothing ſlain right ſo thy ſonne liſt lambe dey lady full mercy prey sith mercy ſured ſo large ye ſcant ſing ſay ye fro vengeaunce aye targe z zacharie clepith open well wiſht ſinfull ſoule guilt therefore leſſon tell nere thine tender heart ſpilt lady bright ſith thou canſt wilt ſeed adam merciable bring v paleis built penitentis ben mercie able explicit jack upland treatiſe ſet forth blind ignorance variable diſcord church • men rude unskilful matter principle chriſtian inſtitution thought crede pellican ſpeaketh plowman tale theſe word freers haue told making crede yet could tell worſe men would werrien rede iack vpland make mone god true chriſt antichriſt diſciples colour holines walking deceiuing chriſts church many falſe figure wherethrough antichriſt many vertues tranſpoſed vice fellieſt folke euer antichriſt found laſt brought church wonder wiſe diuerſe ſects antichriſt ſown diuerſe country kindredes men knowne well obedient biſhops ne legemen king neither tellen ne ſowen weden ne reapen wood corn ne graſſe neither nothing man ſhould helpe themſelues liues ſuſtein theſe men han manner power god ſein heauen yearth ſell heauen hell hem liketh theſe wretch weet neuer themſelues therefore freer thine order rule grounded goddis law tell thou iack vpland aske thee thou thinkeſt chriſtes ſide keepe thy paciens sant paule teacheth deedes ſhould charitie el nought worth diſpleaſing god harme ſouls freers challenge greateſt clerkes church next following chriſt liuing men ſhould charitie aske ſome queſtions pray ground anſweres reaſon holy writ elſe anſwer would nought woorth flouriſhed neuer ſo faire thinke men might skilfully aske thus freer 1 freer many order earth perfecteſt order order art thou made thine order thy rule perfecter rule chriſt himſelf made chriſts rule moſt perfect ruleſt thou thee thereafter without ſhall freer puniſhed break rule patron made break heſts god himſelf made 2 approoueth chriſt religion one iames ſpeaketh approueth haſt thou left rule takeſt another freer apoſtata leueth order taketh another ſect ſith one religion chriſt 3 ye wedded faſter habit man wife man may leaue wife year two many men done leaue habit quarter year ye ſhould holden apoſtataes 4 maketh habit men religion doe euer weareth religion weareth habit better religion better ye haue liggen beſide lig ye religion beſide apoſtataes buy ye ſo precious clothes ſith man ſeeketh ſuch vaine glory gregorie ſayth betokeneth great hood ſcaplerie knotted girdle wide cope 5 uſe ye one colour chriſtian men betokeneth ye clothed one manner clothing ye ſay betokeneth loue charitie certes ye oft hypocrite hateth another ye wol ſaid holy clothing may freer weare clothing another ſect freers ſith holineſſe ſtondeth cloth 6 hold ye ſilence one houſe another ſith men ought ouer ſpeake good leaue euil eat fleſh one houſe another rule order perfect patron made 7 get ye diſpenſations haue eaſie certes either ſeemeth ye vnperfect made ſo hard ye may hold ſiker ye hold rule patron ye freers ſo ye lie vpon ſelues 8 make dede men yee profeſſed yet ye dede quicke beggar ſeemeth euil dede man go beg 9 ye ſuffer nouiſes hear councels chapter houſe ere haue ben profeſſed councels true god law 10 make yee ſo coſtly houſes dwell ſith chriſt ſo dede men ſhould haue graues falleth dede men yet ye haue court many lord england ye wenden realme ech night lig court ſo mow right lord doe 11 heire ferme limitors giuing therefore yeare certain rent ſuffer one anothers limitation right yee ſelues lord country ye vnder biſhops viſitations ſeegemen king aske ye letter bretherheads men praiers ye deſire men ſhould aske letter letter good grant ye generally manner men charitie 12 mowe ye make man perfect brether prayer god hath beleeue baptiſme owne grant ye mow certes ye aboue god make ye men beleeue golden trentall ſung take therefore ten ſhillings leaſt fiue ſhillings woll bring ſouls hell purgatorie ſooth certes ye might bring ſouls paine woll ye nought ye charitie 13 make ye men beleeue buried habit ſhall neuer come hell ye weet ſelfe whether ye ſhall hell ſooth ye ſhould ſell high houſes make many habites ſaue many men ſoules 14 ſteal ye men child make hem ſect ſith theft againſt god heſts ſith ſect perfect yee know whether rule ye bind beſt worſt 15 vnderneme ye brother treſpaſſe law goſpel ſith vnderneming beſt may ye put priſon oft god law auguſtines rule doe amiſſe would amend ye ſhould put 16 coueit ye ſhrift burying men pariſhens none ſacrament falleth chriſtian folke buſie ye heare ſhrift poor folke well rich lord lady ſith mow haue plenty ſhrift father poor folke mow ſay ye goſpel houſes bedred men ye rich men mow goe church heare goſpell couet bury poor folk among ſith moſt holy ye ſaine ye pouerty 17 ye diriges ye haue rich men ſith god praiſeth hem doth men thy prayer worth ſith thou wilt take therefore chapman yee need bee moſt wiſe dread ſimony cauſe haſt thou thou wilt preach goſpel god ſaith thou ſhouldſt ſith beſt lore alſo beleeue vvhy ye euill apaid ſecular prieſtes ſhould preach goſpell ſith god himſelfe hath bodden hem 18 vvhy hate ye goſpell preached ſith ye ſo much hold therto ye win yeare principio rule euer patrones made minſtrels better ye contrarien mirth maken ye contrarien goſpell word deed 19 freer thou receiueſt peny ſay maſſe whether ſelleſt thou god body peny thy prayer el thy travell thou ſaiſt thou wolt trauell ſay maſſe peny certes ſooth thou loueſt little meed thy ſoule thou ſelleſt god body thy prayer ſimony art become chapman worſe iudas ſold thirty penny 20 vvhy writeſt thou hir name thy table yeueth thee mony ſith god knoweth thing ſemeth thy writing god would reward thou writeſt thy table god would el forgotten vvhy beareſt thou god hand ſlandereſt begged meat ſith lord ouer vnwiſe haue begged haue need thereto freer lawe ruleſt thou thee findeſt thou god lawe thou ſhouldeſt thus beg 21 vvhat maner men needeth beg oweth ſuch men beg vvhy beggeſt thou ſo thy brother thou ſaiſt haue need thou doſt perfection el leaſt el meane moſt perfection ſhould thy brother ſo man needed beg himſelf ſo ſhould man beg needed leaſt perfection loueſt thou men thy ſelfe ſo thou art well charity ſith thou ſhouldeſt ſeek perfection thy power liuing thy ſelf moſt god thus leauing imperfection thou ſhouldſt ſo beg good mean thus beg thou doſt ſhould man ſo good mean yet ſuch mean granted may neuer grounded god law lerid leaud mean degree world ſhould go beg ye ſhould ſo certes well nigh world ſhould go beg ye done ſo ſhould ten beggers againſt one yeuer vvhy procureſt thou men yeue thee almes ſaiſt ſo needful thou wilt thy ſelfe win thee meed 22 vvhy wilt thou beg poor bedred men poorer ſect liggen mow go help himſelfes ſith brother god bretherhed paſſeth ye man could make moſt need moſt perfection either el ye hold pure brother worſe ye vnperfect begging vvhy make ye ſo many maiſters among ſith againſt teaching chriſt apoſtles 23 vvhoſe rich court ye han rich jewel ſith ye ſeen ye han nought ne proper ne common ye ſaine pope gather ye poore men lord ſo much king hand make pope rich ſith ye ſain great perfection haue nought proper common ye ſo faſt make pope father rich put imperfection ſithen ye ſaine good ſhould reaſon moſt perfect man ſemeth openlich ye curſed child ſo ſlander father make imperfect ye ſaine good ye ayenſt rule ayenſt rule might ye haue plough cart labour good men done ſo beg loſengery idle ye done ye ſay perfection beg trauell worch hand preach ye openly teach men ſo ſith beſt moſt perfect life ye help ſouls ye make child beg ye might haue rich heir make ye feaſts poor men yeueth hem yefts ye done rich ſith poor men han need rich betokeneth ye goe tweine tweine togither ye charity ye accord ſoule beg ye take ſalaries therto prieſts ſith moſt taketh moſt charge hath 24 hold ye francis rule teſtament ſith francis ſaith god ſhewed liuing rule certes god pope might fordo el francis lier ſaied wiſe teſtament made accord god el erred lier charitie law ſaith accurſed letteth rightful laſt wil dead man teſtament laſt francis dead man ſeemeth therefore freers curſed 25 ye touch coined money croſſe ne king head ye done jewel gold ſiluer certes ye deſpiſe croſſe king head ye worthy deſpiſed god king ſith ye receiue mony heart hand ſeemeth yee hold holineſſe hand heart falſe god 26 haue ye exempt king law viſiting biſhops chriſten men liuen realm ye guiltie traitorie realme treſpaſſers biſhops ye king law treſpaſſe doe ye haue power biſhops prieſts alſo haue leaue priſon brother lord court folk han ben king leegemen 27 ſhall ſome ſect freers pay eche yere certaine generall prouincial miniſter el ſouereines ſteale certaine number child ſome men ſaine certes ben ſooth yee conſtreined upon certein pain theft againſt god commaundement non furtum facies 28 ye ſo hardie grant letter fraternitie men woman ſhall haue part merite good deed ye weten neuer whether god apayed deed becauſe ſin alſo yee witten neuer whether man woman ſtate ſaved damned ſhall haue merit heauen owne deed ne none man ſo ſhold haue part good deed yet ſhould haue god would giue obedience miniſters ye ſain ſtandeth moſt perfection merit order thus ye faren phariſees ſain one contrary name ye patron order confiteor ye begin maſſe saint apoſtles martyr holy church hold glorious hem clepe hem patron auowries freer whether francis making rule ſet thine order foole liar elſe wiſe true ye ſain foole wiſe ne liar true ſhew contrary ſuggeſtion pope ye ſaid rule francis made ſo hard ye mow liue hold without declaration diſpenſation pope ſo deed ne let patron foole made rule ſo hard man may well keepe eke deed prooueth liar ſaith rule tooke learned holy ghoſt might ye ſhame pray pope vndo holy ghoſt bit ye prayed diſpenſe hardneſſe order freer foure order frier beſt man knoweth beſt would faine enter beſt none thou ſaieſt thine beſt ſaieſt thou none good thine ech freer three order wooll ſay thou lieſt ſelfſame maner ech freer wooll ſay order beſt thus ech foure order bin three contrary point ſay ſooth one alone may one beſt foure followeth ech theſe order anſwered queſtion thou doeſt three falſe one true yet man ſhould wite thus ſeemeth moſt part freers bin ſhould liar point ſhould anſwere thereto ſay another order freers better thine good tooke ye rather thereto better thou mightſt haue choſe beginning eke ſhouldſt thou apoſtata leaue thine order take thee better ſo goeſt thou thine order freer perfecter rule religion chriſt godds ſonne gaue goſpel brother religion iames epiſtle maketh mention ſay yes putteſt thou chriſt wiſedome god father vnkunning vnpower euill could make rule ſo good ſo vnkunning might ſo make rule ſo good man might ſo vnmighty god would make rule ſo perfect ſo bin euill willed namely himſelfe might could would haue made rule perfect without default god ſonne almighty rule perfecter chriſtes muſt chriſtes rule lacke perfection much perfecter ſo default chriſt failed making rule put default failing god blaſphemie thou ſay chriſtes rule religion iames maketh mention perfecteſt holdeſt thou thilke rule without clepeſt thou rather francis dominiks rule religion order chriſtes rule chriſtes order freer canſt thou default aſſigne chriſtes rule goſpell taught men likerly ſaued kept ending thou ſay hard ſaieſt thou chriſt lied ſaid rule yoke ſoft burden light thou ſay chriſtes rule light may aſſigned default better may kept thou ſaiſt default chriſtes rule goſpell ſith chriſt himſelf ſaith light eaſie need patron freers adde thereto ſo make harder religion ſaue freers religion chriſtes apoſtles diſciples helden ſaued woulden freers ſaten aboue apoſtles heauen harder religion keepen ſo would ſitten heauen aboue chriſt himſelfe ſtrict obſeruations ſo ſhould better chriſt himſelf miſchance go foorth fraine clerk ground ye god law gif iacke anſwer ye han aſſoiled haue ſaid ſadly truth ſhall ſoile thee thine order ſaue thee heauen freers kun mow excuſe hem theſe queſtions asked hem ſeemeth horrible gilty againſt god hir euen chriſtian gilt default worthy order call order fordone woonder men ſuſteine hem ſuffer hir liue ſuch maner holy write biddeth thou well meeke giue wicked forbed giue hem bread leaſt made thereby mightier chaucer word unto scrivener adam scriuener euer thee befall boece troiles write new vnder thy long lock thou maiſt haue ſcall making thou write trew oft day mote thy werke renew correct eke rubbe ſcrape thorow thy negligence rape et ſic eſt finis thus endeth mind alway freſh mine memory youe priſe honour glory well ſeeing firſt language cheef regiſtrer pilgrimage told foryeting nought feined tale thing hiſtoriall many prouerbes diuers vncouth rehearſaile
