euerychone tabarde aſſembled one one fro southwerke ſoothly ſey canterbury riding wey telling tale rehearſe liche hoſt aſſigned euery man none ſo hardy bidding diſobey thus pilgrimes ley canterbury well lodged one ſooth may call hap fortune concluſioun befell enter toun holy ſaint plainely viſite ſickeneſſe vowes acquite cope blacke grene palfray ſlender long lene ruſty bridle made ſale man toforne void male fortune tooke mine inne anone y• pilgrim lodged euerychone ſame time gouernour hoſt stonding hall full wind boſt liche man wonder ſterne fers ſpake ſaied anon dan pers dan dominike dan godfray clement ye welcome newly kent thogh bridle haue nother boo ne bell beſeeching ye tell firſt name countre without ſhortly ye looke ſo pale deuoid blood vpon head wonder thredbare hood well arrayed ride late anſwered name lidgate monke bury nie fifty yeare age come toune doe pilgrimage haue hight haue thereof ſhame dan iohn qd well brouke ye name thogh ye ſole beeth right glad light praying ſoupe v night ye ſhall haue made deuis great pudding round hagis franche moile tanſe froiſe monke ſlender coiſe ye haue ſicke dare mine head aſſure let feed faint paſture lift vp head glad take ſorrow ye ſhould home ride v morrow ſay ye reſted haue fill ſupper ſleepe done none ill wrap well head clothes round strong nottie ale make rout take pillow ye lie low need ſpare blow hold wind mine opinion engender colles paſſion make men greuen rops haue filled maw crop toward night eat ſome fennell rede annis commin coriander ſede like power haue might charge riſe midnight though ſo moone ſhine clere ſelfe orlogere morrow earely ſee time forth parcell afore prime accompany parde ſhall doe good looke vp monke cockes blood thou ſhalt merry ſo ſay nay morrow anone day ginne eaſt daw thou ſhalt bound new law going canterbury toun lien aſide thy profeſſioun thou ſhalt cheſe thy ſelfe withdraw mirth found thy maw like cuſtome company none ſo proud dare deny knight knaue chanon prieſt ne nonne tell tale plainely conne aſſigne ſee time oportune purpoſe woll contune homeward ſame cuſtome vſe thou ſhalt plainely thee excuſe well ware ſtudy well night heart light thy wit ſhall ſharper bet anon ſupper ſet ſerued well vnto pleaſance ſoone good gouernance vnto bed goeth euery manner wight toward morrow ſoon light euery pilgrime bet wors bad hoſt tooke anone hors sunne roſe eaſt full clere fully purpoſe come dinere vnto oſpring breake faſt werne fro canterbury paſt nought ſpace bowe draught hoſt haſt hath bridle raught ſaied game come forth dan iohn chriſten name let v make ſome manner mirth play shete port twenty deuill way diſport ſo patere ſay woll make lip wonder dray tell ſome tale make thereof jape rouncie thou ſhalt eſcape preach none holineſſe ginne ſome tale mirth gladneſſe nodde thine heauy becke tell v ſome thing draweth effect onely joy make lenger let ſaw would bet obeyed vnto bidding law bound thing coud pale cheare tale gan anone ye ſhall heare finitur prologus de thebe et ſequitur quoque par prima libri beginneth hiſtory deſtruction city thebe sir qd ſith courteſie entred companie admitted tale tell hath power compell meane hoſt gouernour guide echone riding beſide though wit barrain dull rehearſe ſtory wonderfull touching ſiege deſtruction worthy thebe mighty royal toun built begonne old antiquitie vpon time worthy ioſue diligence king amphion cheefe cauſe firſt foundation fame neuer ſhall away honour floureth yet vnto day ſtory remembred preiſed wals height reiſed wonder marueile liſt ſhall platly lere manner hole platly ſentence vnder ſupport patience write mine author bochas two rede bookes ye ſhall find ſo king prudent amphion ſweetneſſe melodious ſoun city built whylome ſo ſtrong armonie ſweet ſong vertue onely werbles ſharpe made mercury harpe ſtrengs touched ſoft whereby wals reiſed aloft without craft man hand full yore ago midde greekes land thing poet told neuer yſeine nother yong old bocchas liſt ſpecifie cleare expouning darke poeſie sith mercury god eloquence yafe might heauenly influence vnto king nativite glad aſpects ſhould moſt excellent craft rhetorike world none like ſignifieth hem ben prudent muſical luſty inſtrument mean harpe moſt melodious yove king mercurious ſong author teach nothing crafty ſpeech king ycalled amphion whereby made country environ ſuch luſt word ſweet ſo pleaſant favourable meet eares ſhortly none diſobeiſaunt king gone whereſoeuer liſt aſſigne chere port eft ſo benigne ſtering exhortatioun went firſt build toun forſooke ech man country one aſſent make city royall rich liche none thus wals made lime ſtone reiſed firſt ſinging king liche poetes feine writing paſſing rich royall entaile may ye ſee much may availe goodlihede lowlineſſe king ſpecially cheare ſpeaking liege bearen faire apport ſhew debonaire ſtrange ne ſolein countenaunce outward ne disdein cauſeth oft advert great hatred people hert therevpon prively woll rowne prince doth vpon hem frowne shortly deme excellence emong hemſelfe preſence everiche conclude liche fantaſie thus full oft gendred enuy folkes heartes ſoleinte pride ſuch liſt one looke aſide reward hem low loute againe kind doute head record wiſe foot disdaine deſpiſe beareth vp ſo take heed ſuſteineth moſt need piller ſupportaile finally ne pooraile bearer vp ſupportation farewell lordſhip domination throughout land every high eſtate wherefore ſeemeth fortunate mercury ſoote ſugred harpe mar ſwerd whetted kene ſharpe accepted aſpects good god lookes wood goodlihead prince availeth win heart people humble ſpeech glad countenance may prince ſoothly aduance emong people heart win inward love twin gold richeſſe pride tyranny diſdaine daunger ſurquedy lord clerkes report loue crowne doe ſupport fine concluſion take record king amphion example good king amphion built thebe eloquence pride violence noble rich like none thus wals made lime ſtone reiſed firſt ſinging king like poet feinen writing opinion ſome authours king cadmus built firſt city thebe ſoothly yet ſome expoſitours grounding hem upon old authours saine cadmus famous old man full long afore city firſt began ground building ſette bound compaſſe mette thong kerue buls ſide enuiron ſtretch might wide get land full large ſpace vvhereupon build dwelling place country boece took firſt name bull skin called thebe king cadmus exiled thebe proweſs king amphion called ſoile thus getten vvhylome boece buls skin name thebe tourned cadmus hath long ſojourned like ſtory compiled ſhortly fro thence exiled never dwell toun knighthood amphioun vvhich vp perfourmeth rich none city thebe mighty ſquare ſtones told lite heretoforne cadmus thus kingdome hath lorne scepter crowne power roiall told vnto ground ye well know information clerely pith expoſition matter clerkes tell vaine lenger dwell tarry mattere sith tale ye ſhall vpon way laſt long ſpace ſooth ſuppoſe vii mile ye know firſt amphion built began city toun reigning long rede procede purpoſe firſt began telling line ran line amphion deſcent conveyed king laius fro king king ſucceſſion conveying downe ſtock amphion seriouſly line diſcent leaue plainly intent tell forth bookes rede laius proceſſe gan ſuccede beginneth story king laius iocaſta wife beare ye crowne mighty land holding ſcepter thebe hand manly wiſe life iocaſta called wife full womanly ſtory ſaith certaine time though ſhe barraine till laius full humble wiſe child ſacrifice firſt apollo chaire ſo bright iupiter hath ſo great might beſeeching hem devout reuerence graunt influence requeſt executed may ſpecially goddeſſes three beſought pallas iuno diane help alſo defrauded boon prayer accepted full ſoone finally rite old even like heart would queen iocaſta hath anone conceived king fully hath perceived made haſte liſt abide kingdome meſſengers ride fro coaſt coaſt ſtory deuiſe divinours philoſophers wiſe ſuch famous phiſiciens well expert aſtronomiens come haſt vnto preſence find ſhortly ſentence craft onely calculation child fate diſpoſition aſtronomiens philoſophers thebe calcled fate edippus thereupon yeue iudgement root take aſcendent truly ſought minute degre ſelfe houre natiuite foryet heauenly manſions clearely ſearched ſmale fraction firſt ſeconds terce eke quartes augrime ſtones white carte ipriued diligent labour table correct deuoid errour iuſtly ſought found two yeares collect expanſe alſo conſidred eke good inſpection euery houre conſtellation aſpect looke eke diuers good alſo peruers toward debate happy wilfull iufortunate curſed conſtellation diſpoſition heaven nativity edippus finally concluſion found saturne scorpion heauie chered melancolike loth wood mar furious wroth holding ſceptre capricorne ſame houre child borne venus direct contrarious depreſſed mercurious hous dome judgement finall theſe clerkes ſpeake ſpeciall fatall ſort may withdraw ſwerd father ſhall ſlaw fate edippus diſpoſed ſhould ſlea father may man helpe ne excuſe thing king gan ſore muſe caſt would ſide againe dome himſelfe prouide shape away remedy toforne bidding quene child wer borne without mercy moderly pite dead may none haſt like hath ſent obeied commaundement wofull heart pitous looke face pale yong ſonne ſhe tooke tender grene fleſh bone certaine men ordained none fro point point manner thing execute bidding king durſt delay abide foreſt ſtood beſide tooken way faſt gan ſpeed king performe indeed hauing thereof paſſing heauineſſe beheld faireneſſe child excellent beautie heart great pitie plainly caſt emong hem ſtrife child ſhould haue life anone high upon tree place man might ſee heng vp ſtory reherce firſt foot gan perce bowes tender tough ſmale knitte vp ſhortly tale preſerue beaſts wild rage tooken voyage toward thebe haſt may fortune thilke ſame day hound ſearching vp doun hunt went king polibon forreſt gan find aforne ſome come behind gan ſearch ſeeke wonder ſore emong hill holts hore rengen trench heard noiſe pitous cry hunt king polibon found child forreſt preſented unto king child honging tree one drough hem ſee left till haue found tooke doune foot vnbound bare home vnto polibon king archadie famous region child firſt ſee wound great pitee behold tender foot ſo blede called edippus rede ſaine platly fage bored foot language firſt king royall hall made men norice call young child foſter keepe milke mought ne weepe leech charged eke alſo till whole deuoir fully purpoſe child feire day maken heire cauſe onely ſo taketh heed sonne none line ſucceed wife none find therefore let gone proceſſe day yeres edippus emong playing feares port paſſing full pride none might peace abide heart ſo inly ſurquidous melancolike contrarious full deſpite high disdaine wight durſt ſhortly withſaine till day gan one debate ſpecially great hate rancour haſty tene might pride ſuſtene gan vpon cruelly braid vnto felly thus ſaid whereto qd art thou ſo proud port contraire alſo euer diſport froward fell laſting euer one thou lord v euerichone preſumeſt fully werking like thou ſonne vnto king deſcended royall blood whether ſo thou wroth wood thou art nothing thee liſt take hede appertaining vnto kinrede forreſt founden vnknow thou wer yong therfore bear thee low vtterly remember thee thee liſt thy birth blood two vntwiſt fine ſhortly tale wherewith edippus gan wexe pale chaunge alſo cheare countenaunce gan apeint remembraunce word word forgat right nought felly muſed aboue thought caſt would without tarrying trouth enquire polibon king ſaw oportune ſpace king ſecret place ſought lowly knee requeſt benignely ſee requeſt edippus unto king polibon would plainly ſpare birth true ground declare make ſure thing anone ſonne none polibon onely gentilleſſe beheld great heauineſſe edippus wofull paine gan diſſimule manner faine liche ben verely heire falleth diſpeire downe ayen knee gan fall conjuring god tell trouth nothing hide affirming eke abide lenger riden enquere till time may ſooth lere part hap fortune ſo importune deſire king without abode curiouſly told ſtode anſwer king unto edippus forreſt firſt found vpon tree foot ybound caſt concluſion make king region day ſhortly tell edippus would lenger dwell tooke leaue haſt gan ride temple faſt beſide apollo ſtory told whoſe ſtatute ſtood chaire gold wheeles foure burned bright ſhene within ſpirit full vncleane fraud onely fals illuſion anſwere yafe euery queſtion bringing people full great errour falſe honour rite vſed old dawes cuſtome paganims lawes edippus full humble chiere apollo made priere beſeeching knee low ſome ſigne might know euidence ſhortly comprehended kinred diſcended edippus great deuotion finiſhed fully oriſon fiend anon within inuiſible voice dredefull horrible bad haſt take voyage toward thebe linage hearen ſhall certified way anone hath hied haſty journey ſo horſe conſtrained day day till hath attained vnto caſtle pilotes ycalled rich ſtrong wele aboue ywalled adjacent ſite country apertinent thebe city king laius preſent hold manner turnement knight yong couragious folke deſirous preue hemſelfe ſhortly tell force might excell get name proweſſe euerich hem buſineſſe horſebacke eke foot ſome found full vnſoot rather play warre peace vvhere edippus put himſelfe preace aie ready debate enforcing enter gate maugre tho would let preace auenture met edippus ſlough father ignorance caſtle pilotes king laius cruelly ſlough though ſtory telleth hough ne wight company ſigne verily aſpy whoſe hond king ſlaw edippus gan haſt withdraw kept coy entencioun great noiſe pitous ſoun caſtell ſlaughter king dole complaint ſorrow weeping ſaw heauines thought ayenſt death auaileth lite nought ordaine rite full royall feaſt called funerall eke cuſtome day old corp brent aſhes cold veſſell round made ball cloſed gold metall buſie cure thebe make sepulture richly hem liſt lenger let aſhes encloſe ſhet matter ſayen edippus retourne ayen enhaſteth aie day day toward thebe euer may brenning hert whote fire fine know fatall deſire failed guide way went fer aſide wild waſt countree mountaine ſtood vpon ſee edippus paſſed hill monſter lay called sphinx monſters many diuers kind conuerſant ſtory find among ſoothly one inly cruell man durſt gone dread death forth paſſage monſter ſo mortall rage alſo diſcripcion body foot fierce lion like maid ſoth head face deſtruction foul monſter fell looke cruell manace odious countenaunce ſight rede sphinx monſter hight worſe tigre dragon serpent ſuppoſe enchauntement ordained hill tabide ſlea tho paſſeden beſide ſpecially faile expoune miſty deuinaile probleme eke word plaine bare without auiſe fully declare life might eſcape ſooth plainly jape declaration yaue thereupon cleare expoſicion ſhould haſt none mene slaen monſter cruell tene may mercy none graunt edippus ignoraunt dreadful hill ſtonding roch ware ful nigh gan approch perillous platly wend ſodainly monſter gan deſcend ſtoppen way letten paſſage thus abreding fell courage word foul monſter said haue hert inly great diſport fortune hath brought thee fort make preefe thou may endure fatall end auenture set fine ſoothly day old caſe told charging well ware wiſe get palme beare away priſe touching thing ſet atweene v tweine life death ſhall dreine monſter diſpitous cheare probleme gan thus ye ſhull heare probleme sphinx put edippus beaſt merueilous ſee ſooth natiuitee might ſo tender ſo grene may himſelfe ſuſtene vpon foot though ſworne moder borne afterward proceſſe age foure foot maketh paſſage vpon three ſhall faine alder laſt goeth vpright twaine diuers port wonderfull cheares till length many ſondry yeares naturally goeth ayen three ſithen foure may none bee finally trouth plein recouereth kindly ayein matter came fro lo probleme ido muſe hereupon without warre ſtrife declare el leſe thy life edippus thing aduert vvell aſſured manly hert gan herte ſerch vp doun prudence caſt reaſoun great auiſe thing may bee seing alſo may flee counſaile non ne rede tell trouth el dede full good deliberacion thus anſwered concluſion thou sphinx qd falſe fraudolent thou foul monſtre thou dragon thou ſerpent hill like conceiue lieſt waite folkes deceiue truſt well thy ſleghty witt thy falſe fraude ſhall anon quitt liſte whiſpre neither roune thy probleme ſhall anon expoune openly thou ſhalt go therefro lo take good heed thereto edippus expounded probleme sphinx put thilke beaſt thou ſpake toforne euery man world iborne may go limmes ſo ſoft moder beareth aloft armes doeth crie weepe ginneth creepe fower foot tender youth experience ofte couth aforne irekened hand two proceſſe thou maieſt conſider alſo two feete thy fell tene hath ſtaffe himſelfe ſuſteine goeth ſhortly vpon three alderlaſt muſt need bee voidyng ſtaffe walketh vpon tweine till ſo age attaine luſte youth waſted ſpent hand taketh potent three feete thus goeth ayen dare affirme thou mayſt withſein ſone vnweldy might influence nature right experience euery man may know like child fower crepeth low may ſojourne yearth ayen muſt haſt retourne came fro may remew world man may eſchew ſothe ſhortly doubt whele kind cometh naturally hath cours ironne circuite doeth ſhere ſonne man child high low eſtate gaineth make debate time iſette muſt fine atropos malice doeth vntwine liues thred cloto firſt compouned lo thy probleme expouned af euery metyng toke honde law thou muſt need ſtonde haſte mine honds deie reaſon thou canſt withſeie sphinx awaped amate stood diſmayed diſconſolate chere doun caſt heauy ledde edippus anone ſmote hedde fende ſtinking vnſwete countree ſet holly quiete whereby hath ſoch price wonne fame euery coaſt ronne al y• lond y• monſtre ſlaw line right thebe gan draw well receiued worthineſſe manhood proweſſe ſeigh ſeemely knight well fauoured euery man ſight ſaw alſo thebe mighty toun onely regioun deſtitute gouernour ayen foon hauing ſuccour hem defend queene alone emong hemſelfe making full great mone none bookes ſpecifie sceptre croune occupie lordes one aſſent within toune ſet parlement shortly concluding might prudently treate queen namely held hem ſelfe moſt ſage condeſcend way mariage joyned manly knight paſſing prudent famous eke might moſt holle man diſcerne worthy citee keepe gouerne counſail lord deſire plainly ſhe fall accorded without tarying thebe edippus ſhall king full aſſent none ſayed nay time ſet ayein certain day emong hem ſelfe finally deuiſed wedding thebe ſolempnized full rially need muſt vnthriue onely moder tooke wiue vnwiſt blood ignoraunt ſhortly ſtood toforne father ſlaw wedding againſt law tofore god neither faire ne good acceptable blood touch blood cauſe hath great confuſion many lond many region ground root vnhap miſchaunce fine concluding alway vengeaunce men haue ſein clere experience holy writ recordeth ſentence herode falſly life violence tooke brother wife ſhe fayre pleaſaunt ſight kept ſtill force might although title non ſake holy man ſainct iohn trouth priſon loſt hedde wherefore rede euery man take hede vvhether ſo lord prince king beware eſchue ſoch wedding ere y• ſwerde vengeance manace leſt leſe hap fortune grace taking enſample maner thing edippus thebe crouned king wrought ignoraunce full derke blind wofull chaunce vnwiſt innocence ye haue herde fell ſoch offence puniſhed brought low worthy errour know knot liſt abſteine ſuch ſpouſaile god man vnclene ſem ne thereof deuiſe demeth ſelf prudent wiſe eke edippus haueth emong mind wedding like ye may find vnhappy paſſing odious infortunate eke vngracious werie thereof write hatefull proceſſe alſo endite paſſe ouer fully entent imeneus preſent lucina liſt ſhine ne none muſes nine one accord maken melody ſong heauenly armony neyther clio caliope none ſuſtren nomber thriſe three philolaie aſcended vp high aboue skie wedded lady vertuous vnto lord god mercurius matrician inamed de copelle booke wedding tell concluding marriage poete whilom ſo ſage lady called sapience iwedded vnto eloquence ſat well heauenly purueiaunce hem joyned knot alliaunce two ſoothly entent wedding thebe abſent cauſed great aduerſity finall end ſolempnity ſorrow wo deſtruction vtter ruine roiall toun may man helpe ne ſuccour time joy though floure name people wedding king edippus jocaſta queen wedding plainly tell cerberus chief porter hell herebus fader hatred preſent holle kinred wife alſo browes blacke doughters ſorow make hidouſly chered vgly ſee megera theſiphonee alecto eke labour enuie drede fraude falſe tretcherie treaſon pouert indigence nede cruell death rent wede wretchedneſſe compleint eke rage fearfull pale dronkeneſſe croked age cruell mar many tigre wood brenning ire vnkind blood fraternall hate deepe ſet roote saufe onely death na boote aſſured othes fine vntrew theſe folke weddyng new make toune deſolate bare ſtory ſhall declare aie thebe walles ſtrong edippus reigneth many day long mine aucthor write word plain iocaſta ſonnes twain ethiocles alſo polimite bookes ſondry clerkes write doughters two full goodly ſee one hight antigonee called imein beauty inly ſouerein edippus aie deuoid warre ſtrife iocaſta ledde mery life till fortune iniquity enuy proſperity ſhone moſt rich renoun whele ſhe plunged adoun joy ſodein wo ſhe wont frowardly namely hem ſetten affiaunce hartely truſt variaunce king paſſing great might sat quene vpon certain night caſuelly folke echone chamber ſodeinly gone ere ware iocaſta gan behold carectes wound old vpon foot emprented wonder depe tournyng face breſt wepe ſecrely might eſpie ſhe anon fell fantaſie aie thing muſing bedde gan ſighen ſore king conceiueth diſtreſſe gan enquere heauineſſe fully cauſe thoccaſion wite concluſion eileth ſhe fared ſo lord qd ſhe without wordes mo percell cauſe ſodein rage tender age lord inamed laius king toune man right vertuous ſonne right wonder feire likely ſucceſſour heire bicauſe diuinours told birth ſothly ſhould life fatall deſtinee slaen fader might none king fate eſchue bad men haſt thought due ſlea child haue thereof roth anon bad without ſloth certain men vp pein judgement execute commaundement king yaue hem charge forth gone foreſt large adjacent vnto countree perſing foot heng tree performyng thexecution ſuch compaſſion left reſorted home ayen beyng doubt vncertein repeire tolden child afterward befall saufe ſaid huntes found ladden forth foot vnbound coaſt coud declare percel mine euil fare ground cauſe mine heauy chere conſidered eke woundes appere vpon foot wot mene thing aie mine hart greene lord ala new date king laius ſlaine late caſtell nigh countree vpon comming citee yweied rekened one maketh mine hart heauie ſtone counſell none ne red word king lift vp hed abreid ſharpe ſighes ſmert thing order aduert curiouſly good auiſement ſignes clere euident conceiueth well ſore gan repent himſelf iocaſta ment king ſigh maners pleine goddes ſhe gan conſtreine ſhew cauſe affray expoune make delay croppe roote ſhortly entred firſt countre whens came region put deluſion doen none till laſt braſt one vnto queene gan proceſſe make firſt foreſt take wounded foot ſo forth euery thing cheriſhing polibon king holle cauſe forſooke wiſe way tooke toward thebe apollo bad fortune lad sphinx kept mounteine alſo ſlowe certeine king laius caſtell gate toward night full late thebe gan ſpede find ſtocke kinrede vnto gan wexe couth proceſſe greene youth found wele rekening life ſhe moder wife night ſuyng morow betweene hem two began new ſorrow vnto pitous tell thereupon yif ſhould dwell long ſpace would occupy ye may read tragedy tragediae senecae de egypto reg thebax morall senek fully ending dooll miſchief compleining ſorrow vnweldie age edippus fell dotage loſt witte worldly delite ſonnes deſpite diſdaine tooke keepe eke bookes ſaine iyen wepe mine aucthour liketh deuiſe ſonnes rebuke deſpiſe vpon day certaine place hedde iyen gan race caſt hem boote malice trade vnder foote fully deuoid loue dread edippus miſchief thus ded within pitt made earth low cruelty ſonnes gan throw worſe serpent tigre wood curſed ſtock commeth vnkind blood ſtorie ye may rede heretoforne although roſe grow thorne thus edippus blind old wretched end haue plainly told ſhortly man child rede wele ware take hede kindly right conſcience doe honour due renerence every man ought duty reverence father mother elſe fall vengeance father moder eſtate bee certaine el ſhull neuer thee hem debonaire ſpeach porte treat hem faire hem obey honeſty drede hem cheriſh nede dare affirme excepting none eſtate ſhall firſt infortunate werke sea lond thing take hond time froward contraire waſt good plainly appaire finde plenty conteke warre ſtrife vnhappy end ſhortneſſe life graceleſſe hath hatred god man alſo therefore man thereof recheles make mirrour ethiocles brother called polimite ſoch thing greatly wite ye ſhall hem fill deſcended doun hill paſſed lowe vaile ſhall begin remnaunt tale explicit prima par iſtius codialli immediate ſequitur ſecunda par ejuſdem paſſed y• thrope broughton blee kalender gan anon ſee sunne full clere gan ſhine clocke drew nine ſawe alſo ſiluer dropes ſhene dewe like perles grene vapoured vp aire aloft zepherus blowing ſoft weder made luſtie ſmooth faire right attempre holſome aire ſame houre holle route pilgrimes riding round aboute tale gan procede rehearſing forth dede edippus buried graue ſonnes kingdome haue son edippus debated crown emong hemſelfe full mortall hate croune gonne debate hem juſtly ſhall ſuccede scepter toune poſſede auerting nought neither right ne wrong eche hem make partie ſtrong querele proudly ſuſteine whoſe herts deuoided clene brotherhood faithfull aliaunce falſe couetiſe ſo made hem diſtaunce fully werching deſtruction ruine noble toun hote brent hatred enuy two pompous ſurquedy neither would pleinly poinct forbeare ſtode ſoch diſjoinct like birth foreins till toune noble citezeins knight baron many worthy lord shope way make hem accord ſet hem quiete pee part ethiocles alledge gan firſt borne ought reaſon go toforne citee crouned king sith law letting vnto longeth heritage diſcent title age controverſie two brother polimite full high diſdaine openly gan reply againe part ſaid eſpeciall reaſon none ſhould haue regaly dominatioun lordſhip wholly toun right nought city liue ſile pouerty concluding without fere drede rather ſuffer would dede thus ala enuious ſtrife ende euerich loſt life great miſchief ye ſhall thilke time lord fere full beſily diligence great auiſe full high prudence ſet hem quiet reſt counſailyng hem plainly beſt leue ſtrife wiſedome reaſon condeſcend ſome concluſion might moſt auaile finally gouernaile common union theſe two brother lordes tho preſent haue hem brought one aſſent one hert brother vnto brother euerich hem reigne yeere yeere commeth toun ſhall abſent fully yeere himſelf gie manhood chiualrie haunt himſelf deed marciall brother see riall holdeth sceptre citee gouerne yeere cours hath run yerne come ſhall haue repeire reigne thebe like lord heire receiue fully dignitee voideth citee paciently taking auenture till ayen honour may recure thus enterchange euery yeere ſhall one aſcendeth hath fall muſt obey hert take well like one reſorteth wele holle compoſicion betwene brother conuencion fully knit vp great auiſement tofore goddes othe sacrament neuer grutche ne varie accompliſh ſhortly tarie like thaccord enrolled toun poinct poinct made mencioun alder firſt reaſon age ethiocles auantage reigne aforne weare croune polimite haſting toune yere may none while brother ſatte rialte full richely vpon fortune whele rode forth armed bright ſtele polimite ſothly rede himſelfe alone riall ſtede without guide long day aferde keepe high way hert hauing ſuſpecion brother malice treaſon leſt purſue fals vnkind blood haue dedde couetiſe good alone might haue poſſeſſioun life fully toune haſt hauing felaw polimite aſide gan withdraw foreſt joyning see knowing right nought ſite y• countre full hilles high mounteines craggie roches pleines wondre dreadfull lothſome paſſage therewithall full beaſts rage holding way hert nothing light mate wery till draweth night day beholding enuiron neither ſaw caſtel toure ne toun thing greueth ful ſore ſodenly ſee began rore winde tempeſt hidiouſly tariſe raine doun bete full griſly wiſe many beaſt therof adrad nigh fere gan wexe madd ſempte wofull ſownes tigres beres bore liones refute hem ſelfe ſaue euerich haſt draweth vnto caue polymite tempeſt huge ala findeth refuge ne ſhrowde ſaw nowhere ſuccour till paſſed almoſt midnight hour large ſpace ſterres clere cloudes voided heauen appere knight foreſt large gan approch londe arge polimite firſt came lond arge seing palaice mighty building adraſtus called king luſty man rich wondre ſage yronne ſomdel age borne iſle called chifon ſomtime sonne king cholon witte ſtory couth choſen tendre youth arge crouned king thiefe greece record writing deſcente ſucceſſion alonely free election held arge sceptre hand moſt worthy greekes land loued drade wiſdome iuſtice ſtory plainly deuiſe worthy king doughters two paſſing faire right good alſo long beaute deſcriue argiue deiphile doughters tweine king adraſtus eldeſt called argiue deiphile ynamed ſecond adraſtus like found worthy king ſonne none ſuccede gone life triſte hert add paſſingly penſife holy truſt hope ſtood alliance ſome worthy blood brought mene doughters twein ſhal releſſed peine recomfort ſome high mariage ſothly yet full oft courage troubled occaſion ſweuene viſion dream king adraſtus wild boar fers lion shewed vpon certein night thought inward ſight ſlept clere inſpection wild boore fers lion poſſede ſhul theſe beſtes rage doughters two bond mariage ſhort time within certein day brought hert full great affray thing ſoth deſtine hath ſhape world ful hard teſcape marueilous man eſchue fate polimite ſpake late tempeſt bete bereined grate onely citie hath atteined adraſtus full ſtately degree thilke time held roiall ſee troubled might merke obſcure hath brought knight auenture citie encloſed wall vnto palaice chief principall king chambre aloft lay bed ſlept wonder ſoft eke al folke chambres take like fortune parauenture ſhape ſelfe time becauſe ſo late caſuely porter gate right none porch built ſquare ſtones full mightely enarched enuiroun dome ples toun executed lawes king knight without tarying wery mate ſtede alight hanging reine haſt might vpon arme ſure keepe leid doun gan anon ſlepe ſemed time beſt lay thus reſt auenture came knight riding one worthieſt world liuing curteis lowly right vertuous ſaith mine auctour called tideus virous armes manly werking birth sonne vnto king callidoine lond great renoun ala regioun exiled brother ſlow ſtage thebe writ manere al malice ment day hunting went foreſt harte hind ſtood great lind caſuely lete arow ſlippe ſlough brother called menelippe mortall ſort hand begiled baniſhed exiled law narow ſette charge caas came firſt arge porch polimite ſlepe auenture ere toke kepe ſame night hidouſly beſein tempeſt thondre rein felt alſo anoy great damage foreſt holding paſſage polimite toforne perrell oft likely lorne beſtes rage ſet euery ſide till grace without guide rode arge great mighty toun streght vnto palaice chief dongeon like told polimite lay comming made great affray blind derkeneſſe night guie ne fond light vvhen came priket ne torche till vnwarely entred porche would haue take herbergage polimite ſterte vp rage sodenly awaked rede nying proud ſtede firſt beheld knight armed breſt ſheld gan manere ray aduerte veray ire vpon horſe ſterte cruelly gan tideus enquere whens come bad haſt anſwere deuiſe tideus full humble wiſe anſwered ayen verray gentilleſſe ſaid ſoth high diſtreſſe tempeſt derke night driuen like errant knight need onely great neceſſity conſtrained great aduerſity take lodging ſo might court therfore alight without thinking none outrage ne wight meaning damage polimite malice pride told ſhortly ſhould abide ne lodge though ſworne qd toke vp beforne keepe al night ſey thee platly maugre thy might qd tideus curteſie deuoid rather villenie yef ye take hede ſeeme gentil knight ſuppoſe ye haue title right lodging way heritage haue fell rage parde yet ſhal diſeaſe till morow though ye eaſe gentilleſſe onely leue ſuffre ſhall litel greue aye tideus ſpake faire polimite froward contraire ſhortly ſaith geineth ſtriue force ſhall deuoid bliue vtterly atwene hem two thing try muſt haue tideus ſeing better mene ful like knight ſtele armed clene without abode faſt gan ſpede wondre liuely ſtride ſtede thus theſe knight pompous elate litel cauſe fellen debate tideus polimite ſtriuen lodging ronne togider horſebacke either firſt ſpere brake full ſurquedous pride ſharpe ſwerdes togider ride full irouſly theſe mighty champion fury like tygres lion hurtel al palaice ſhooke king adraſtus ſleepe wooke made haſt chambreleins call y• court worthy knight al commaunding hem deſcend ſee report might bee wonderful noice court night ſeigh two ſtrang knight fight plate thicke bright maile without iudge great meruaile diſmaied vncouth thing found told king adraſtus darkneſſe night chambre many torch light court deſcended downe meine ſtonding enuiron theſe knight hauing great wondre manhode put hem firſt aſondre hem commanding like gentill king leuen ſtrife ceſſen fighting entred knightly looke firſt hem ſwerdes tooke affirming eke fantaſie rage great folie wilfully liues jeopart withouten iudge quarel depart ſpecially derke night neither might haue ſight charging hem vp peine life diſſeuere ſtinten ſtrife tho tideus haſt might full humbly ſteed alight right mekely chere countenance put holly gouernance adraſtus manere thing polimite eke made tarying high alſo would withſey king bidding lowly obey ought due reuerence ſtood preſence gan enquere firſt eſtate cauſe alſo debate countrees ſothly age asked hem eke touching linage deſcent ſtocke born tideus anſwere yaue beforn told plainly made leſing ſonne vnto king calcidoine rightfull heire thereto exile cauſe told alſo ye haue herd ſtory rad polimite chere face ſad vnto king touching countree said borne thebe citee iocaſte great famous queene moder without wene father whilom king lord ſhame ſpake neuer word onely yif ſhall feine fader brother tweine ſoth full loth tell eke king would compell gentilleſſe bad without blame birth haue ſhame holly caas knew euery dele touching kin knew y• ground fulwele like full cleere report enforcing comfort might beſie peine manly king theſe knight tweine hem ſaid ſtood wiſt well full woorthy blood deſcended touching kinred made haſt officer lede ſtraunge knight debate palaice chambre eſtate ech himſelf take eaſe euery thing ſoth y• might hem pleaſe offred hem like eſtates diſarmed plate cuſhens greues sabaton harneis voided habergeon two mantel vnto hem brought frette perle rich ſtones wrought cloth gold violet crimſin full richely • urred ermin lap hem ayens cold morrow rage night ſorrow take reſt till ſonne ariſe king full prudent wiſe firſt al rekeles knight herts ſette pee euer dare 〈◊〉 wele ech trew ſtele life word dede vndre knotte bound brotherhede adraſtus worthy king famous feaſt made rich plenteous theſe knight himſelfe thereat preſent mete full goodly hath ſent noble king doughters dere gentilleſſe make chere knight come fro ſo ferre like ſoth lucifer ſterre gladeth morrow vpriſing lady comming ſtremes eyen clere goodly apport womanly manere countenance excellent faireneſſe court broughten gladneſſe freſhneſſe heauenly cheres agreable vnto ſtraungeres entree eſpecial hem thought like thing celeſtial enhaſting hem full knightly wiſe ayenſt hem goodly ariſe met humble countenaunce ful conningly obſeruaunce hem conueying ſitting place ſothely haue leiſer none ne ſpace reherſe put remembraunce holly manere daliaunce long abide well wot god cupide influence mighty hond feruence firy brond meeting firſt fortuned hath ſo wele arowes gold ſtele yperced han knight herts tweine breſt ſuch luſty peine ther abode ſharpe ſpere launce depe yficched point remembraunce may lightly raſed away thus joy driue forth day pley reuel knight ſake toward night chambre take • ue time fader bad weie knight hem lad reuerently vp many ſtaire taking leue gan anon repaire lodging ful ſtately toure aſſigned hem herbeiour ipices plenty wine cuppes great wrought gold full fine without tarying bedde ſtraight gon touching reſt wheder ſleepe non demeth ye louers ſuch maner thing experience haue fully knowledging declared booke find king night wooke thoughtfull hert ſtory ſpecifies muſing ſore full fantaſies firſt aduerting great worthineſſe theſe knight ſemelineſſe luſty youth force manhode come roial blode gan reuolue hert hauing maner doubt atwene two hanging balance wheder ſhould make aliance atween doughters knight tweine one thing ay heart gan conſtreine remembraunce auiſion aforne made amencion touching lion wild bore nedeth reherſe caſting alway fantaſie might clerely ſignifie darke dreame hid cloſe morow adraſtus vp aroſe temple right way tooke gan pray deuoutly booke goddes dreme ſpecifie bede homward hie behold knight ſheeldes fell beaſts painted field ſhall cleere inſpection full plainly making declaracion dreme night adraſtus enhaſted full right ſheelds wiſely behold ſaw goddes told ſheelds hanging vpon hooke beaſts rage mortall crookes purpos like write bochas polimite ful ſtreite enbraced hide fierce lioun tideus aboue habergeoun gipoun hidous ſharpe hoor wrought briſtels wild boore beaſts ſtory leres wrought bete vpon baneres diſplaide brode whan ſhould fight wherefore king whan ſight repayre hert full glad face full demure ſad lord temple knight lad whan circumſtaunces rite old done obſeruaunces home court retourne ayein hall rich well beſein worthy king hert liberall made feaſt ſolempne riall deintees ſurely excell vein euery cours tell ſtraunge ſewes ſoteltees ne ſat like degree lacke time let ouerſlide meate adraſtus took aſide knight two like prudent man ſecree wiſe thus tale gan adraſtus ſpake knight ſecret touching marriage daughter sir qd ne doubt nought freſh grene ay thought firſt goddes ordinaunce next fate purueiance werking fortune hond ye brought lond tweine laſt night who comming full glad light firſt ſelfe ſhortly expreſſe conſider ſee likelineſſe perſons circumſtaunces holle maner gouernaunces seing full well whereto ſhould feigne yee likely hereafter atteigne great eſtate habundance good birth rial blood ye may faile ye haue wrong ye manly right ſtrong ſet hertes reſt purpoſe hope beſt variance make knot alliance atwene doughters two yf herts accord wele thereto fully deſpeire ſuccede haue heire therefore ye ſhall haue poſſeſſion life halfe region forth hond day man thereto ſhal ſay nay ſothly graue ech ſhall part haue kingdome haue prouided ſay ſhall diuided atwene two euerich crouned property equite compouned egaly euery man ſight ech enjoy ſhall right witte ye ſhall lond amend manhood knightly defend ayens enemy mortall foon dayes paſſed goon deſires luſty youth full ſet make couth ye ſhall haue like mine opinioun gouernaunce regioun entent ſeemeth beſt ye gouerne liue reſt fully follow luſt deſires hunte hauke wood riuers ſo euer haue thereto pleaſance haue none attendance vnto nothing mine eaſe ſhortly yif agree pleaſe haue ſaid ben ſo wiſe according vnto auiſe delayeth wordes plein ſeemeth yeue anſwere ayen adraſtus tale fined tideus hed full low enclined veray gentill knight power full might full humbly thanked king touching profre ſo high thing party ſaid would aſſent fully hert neuer repent euer king hath ſaid polimite alſo appaid ſtory comprehended euery part fully holle deſcended king fulfill dede point point vpon procede whether ſo euer winne leſe tideus made brother cheſe gentilneſſe curteſie moſt fantaſie siſters haue wiue ſoth choſen hath argiue eldeſt full womanly ſe tideus tooke deiphile beaute moſt ſouereigne excellent adraſtus throughout lond hath ſent lord baronage preſent mariage knight make letting ech one come bidding goodly wiſe meke full benigne ayein day aſſigne thidre come full many luſty knight full wele beſein many lady bright euery coſte many freſh ſquier ſtory ſeith many communer behold great rialte manere ſolempnite tell circumſtaunces juſt reuel diuers daunces feaſts riche yeftes great peinfull ſighes feruent heat loues folke brenning glede deuiſe many ſolein wede touch ſtole amorous lokes ſotell craft leide line hokes ielous folke traien begile awaites many ſondry wile ſoth deſcriuen ne wele newe fame ranne meane ſome ſwift paſſage vnto thebe marriage report trew fained tho thereof eares hath attained mine auctour writ ethiocles touching honour great encres polimite highly magnified newly allied adraſtus lond arge thing greatly gan charge dreading inly marriage shall time turne dammage sore muſing caſting vp doun great power high renoun adraſtus greek lond power ſoget hond leaſt polimites ſake would vpon new warre make like conuentioun time ſet deliuer vp toun brother bond oth ſworne couenaunt aſſured toforne ye remember late told purpoſe hold beſt caſt vary thereupon liſt lenger tary liche deſires ſhape remedy firſt ſent next ally moſt affiaunce lord gouernaunce kingdome come anon preſent euerichon ſaid plainly wening beſt hert ſhall neuer reſt ſorrow maner dread till brother vtterly dead thebe roiall ſete might alone reigne quiete meant himſelfe ſhortly none vnpertourbed polimite brother counſell diuerſe entent find written thre folkes preſent ſoth faithfull trew ſome alſo change new eke betwene tweine couertly could vndre colour feine commendation trouth firſt ſeid aboue thing trouth ſhould long vnto king worde variable plein hool contre ſtable trouth preferred book eſdre aforne king woman wine trouth firſt without wene chief piller may king ſuſteine joy honour lede life trouth ſometime prerogatife esdre booke ſpecifie record take prudent neemie worthy king great pride wine woman eke ſet aſide power dominacion hauing reward compariſon trouths might trouths worthineſſe eſdre pleinly expreſſe ſo taketh hede ſame place influence ſothly grace trouth alone old neemie gat licence reedifie walles new hieruſalem treaſure chief euery realme salomon write y• thing tweine trouth mercy linked cheine trouth mercy preſerven king adverſity preſerue king like decree al miſchiefe al aduerſitee ala therefore doubleneſſe variaunce elles vnſikerneſſe chaunge doubleneſs ſhould king change word mutabilite fraud diſceite inſtabilite king haue domination cauſen deſtruction king redeth ſtory doun rowe ſeeth many haue ben ouertrowe falſhod fortune whele vnto god pleaſeth neuer adele king double entent may happe world went ful oft ſith ſleight werking thus truth god ſeeth euery thing right may cloude toforne ſight trouth ſhroude may clipſed derked deceipt falſe engine ligging aweite ſerpent vndermine laſt cleerly ſhine y• ſaith nay ſhew bright beames ſoth kingdomes realmes bearer vp conſervatrice al miſchief ſothfaſt mediatrice god aboue ſo liſt ſe keepe king proſperite euery ſide afferme dar ye king lord beeth wele war beheſts juſtly hold thinketh thebe walles old deſtroied platly le doubleneſſe ethiocles people ſore bought onely nat conſeil wrought hem trew wiſe liſt werke auiſe left trouth ſet fantaſie gouerned falſe flatterie counſell falſe flatterer bad thinke knight hold force right life lordſhip toun leſe poſſeſſion bonde heſtes made toforn let brother blowe horne liſt pipe rede counſeil platly rede ſoch liſt ſay ſoth falſly flatre word ſmoth whan hadde holle tale fined ethiocles fully enclined whoſoeuer therat laugh weepe like counſeil poſſeſſion keepe ſaith nay grutcheth ayein contraire thought vein year come ethiocles reigned thebe ſheene ſonne xii ſignes round ronne sith ethiocles juſt rekening thebe crouned lord king holding sceptre diademe reaſon would ſeeme time full complete ſpace couenant ſhould void place polimite eke journey make toward thebe poſſeſſion take due title wrong thought ſoth yere wondre long exile come hert maner doubt leaſt brother falſehed found acquite himſelfe like bound adraſtus gan declare herte beſeching matter aduert therevpon yeue counſell ſone touching right beſt done whether beſt go abide like knight manly ride himſelf alone make meſſage chalenge rightfull heritage within thebe either pee ſtrife thereupon jeoperd life thus ſet fers brother adraſtus ſothly thought another bet ſend himſelf gone leſt trapped among mortal fone hauing brother ſuſpect caas fraude ſome falla would werke deſtructioun hardy entre toun prudently take heed fully concluding ſpeed ſome thebe ſent perceiue fully thentent ethiocles inward ſome ſigne crowne reſigne thilke yeere like made oth whan knew purpoſe goth thereupon werken procede thus adraſtus wiſely gan rede tideus took upon meſſage polimite brother treat vpon mattere tideus manly chere said vtterly brother ſake meſſage would vndertake whole thempriſe thenbaſſiate welefull infortunate ſpare whatſoeuer betide adraſtus ſide polimite concluſion contraire opinion ſaid ſoothly hem thought right sith ſo well proued knight diſcended ſo worthy blood nold none yearthly good thebe regalty put body ſuch jeopardy al thing auaileth right nought wil forth deare bought taking leaue firſt eſtates armed maile ſure plate ſhope forth vpon journie made ſorrow deiphile ſorrow deiphile tideus went toward thebe city bitter teares dewed face full oft ſithes ſwouning place triſt mourning blacke wede ſhe ſaw tooke ſtede inwardly encreaſed gan mone seeing lord ſo riding forth alone vpon way worthy tideus haſt ſtory telleth v ſpeedeth ſo making delay ſpace day high toures thebe gan ſee entred citee wiſely enquiring pallaice ſtode like knight thider ſtreight rode marked full well many man ſight like mar himſelfe ſtele armed bright till attained hath cheefe dongeon king held manſion throgh palaice knightly looke hall right way tooke ſtede light adoun aferde hardy lioun king lord great rout hall ſitting round entred moſt manfull courage execute fine meſſage thought conuenient due full cunningly gan king ſalue requiring kingly excellence goodly wiſe yeue audience disdaine neither port ne chere sith come meſſangere polimite owne brother dere ginning tale thus ye ſhall wiſely knightly tideus meſſage qvod vnto worthineſſe purpoſe breefly expreſſe effect holly ſentement meſſage ſent long proceſſe make mattere ground take eſchuing prolixity void away ſuperfluity sith ſelfe beſt ought vnderſtond cauſe fully haue hond eke conceiue entent meaning rightwiſeneſſe longing king firſt conſidered ye take hede edippus old king dede ſelfe brother bliue crowne contagiouſly gan ſtriue mortall foen full great hatrede two ſhould firſt ſuccede till ye meanes reconciled ye reigne exiled toune yeares ſpace ayeine reſort place reigne king ye voiden tourn proceſſe cometh eueriche patiently tendure thentrechaunging auenture put ſtood eſtate thereupon make debate liche couenaunt conuentioun enrolled vp lord toun reaſon may denied sithen ye haue yeare occupied requeſt tideus made name polimite title convention polimite requireth right acquite true knight eſchuing mortall warre ſtrife sith ye prerogatife eldeſt brother reigne aforne thinketh ye arne ſworne oth keepe make tarrying holly aduerting liche prudent king trouth compariſon treaſour region acceptable vnto god man richeſſe ye reken wherefore haſt let ſlouth quiteth ſelfe juſtely trouth vnto brother auoiding citee let reigne royall ſee crowne thebe yeare occupie greece praiſe magnifie high renoun may ſay none ye acquite juſtly brother whole theffect ſain anſwer expectant ye ſend ayain whan tideus told tale ethiocles triſte wonder pale conceit firſt maner hath refreined diſſimuling vnder colour feined shewing chere maner debonaire intent wonderly contraire inward hert wood furious tourning face towards tideus gan abreid laſt ſpake euen thus vnto ſpake anſwer king ethiocles haue great marueile qd thought meſſage thou haſt brought brother thou haſt expouned deſireth ſo thebe crowned hauing regard abundaunce great plenty ſuffiſaunce hath king arge ſeemeth ſhould little charge haue lordſhip dominioun bound little toun sith reigneth ſo freſhly flour surmounting predeceſſours new encreaſe fortune might wherfore heart right glad light fully truſting nede helpe without drede like brother ſhould find ward faithfull true kind suppoſing plainely euermore reigne ſet little ſtore caſteth ſo ſhort yeare brother exile liue pouerry great diſtreſſe ſuffer high nobleſſe token brother hede ſigne rather hatrede interrupt poſſeſſion little poore region ſpake ſo coud aduert ſcorne rooted hert hem ſeempt ſtory teach ſurplus ſoothly ſpeach might lenger reſtreine plainely ſaid betwene v tweine meane thus polimite bond ſurete ne faith ymade may auaile claimeth yeue gouernaile city neither yeare ne day ſhall let ſoothly may ſhall title bond enjoy thebe halfe foot lond let keepe hath wonne purpoſe haue begonne reigne thebe henceforth liue maugre hem thereayen ſtriue deſpite friend counſaile liſt call let ſure know right wele manacing drede neuer dele ſikerly deuiſe ſheweth well thou art wiſe ſuppreſſed manere rage take thee ſurquedous meſſage preſumeſt doe ſo high offence boldely ſpeake preſence fere auaile ſhall right nought tithings thou haſt brought shall vnto diſencreace better haue peace folly preſumption ayenſt ſeech occaſion liue thereto mine hond ſaid erſt winneth lond wall toune may ſtond plainely doe thee vnderſtond ſhull firſt beat full low toures earth ythrow ere thebe haue thing ado lo retourne ſay ſo tideus ſaw feruent ire king anger ſet fire full deſpite melancolie conceiuing eke great fellonie apport like wood worthy knight little ſtood sad demure ere would ought ſeine laſt thus ſaid ayeine knightly anſwer tideus yaue ayeine king certes qd conceiue new thee thy counſaile vntrew dare ſaine vow beſt ne thou art faithfull thy beheſt stable thy word yt thou haſt ſaid toforne deceiuable falſely eke forſworne eke perjurate thine aſſured oth whether ſo thou lefe wroth ſay thee ſhortly hold fage ſhall tourne vnto thy damage triſt well full cruell wiſe greekes lond ſhall vpon thee ariſe auenged manly redreſſe great vntrouth high falſeneſſe y• thou haſt ayen thy brother wrought ſhall full deare bought verily indeed thou ſhalt lere king adraſtus meddle matere lord enuiron bounden ſubjection prince duke many noble knight ſuſteining thy brother right shall day ſpere ſhield ayenſt thee gadred field knightly preue one aſſent thou art fals double entent thy promiſe atteint eke outrayed leue well ſhall delayed haſt execute deede like thy deſert thou ſhalt haue thy meede god aboue rightwiſeneſſe open wrong ſhall haſt redreſſe might ſuch colluſion reforme ayeine extortion fine falſhood ſhall vaile ayenſt trouth field holden battaile wrong crooked halt lame anone brother name next allie querele ſhortly defie fully auiſed mine hole entent ye lord preſent require worthineſſe ſay trouth beare witneſſe time commeth juſtly record king falſely gan diſcord heſt falſe variaunce thinke ye faith ligeaunce bound echone ye may go therefro obey ſerue two next yeare anon following lord true king polimite though abſent juſt accord made parliament deuiſe ſitten row engroſſed vp well know enrolled onely witneſſe regiſters void falſeneſſe none vary may new ſay vnt • ew rede ſelfe acquite let time lenger lie reſpite one without tarrying manly force fet home king maugre fone like ye bound let ſlouth found put juſtly poſſeſſion counſaile concluſion manly tideus departed king tideus meſſage ſaied like charge ſaied liſt lenger ſojourne fro king gan face tourne aſtonied heart aferde full proudely layed hond ſwerde diſpite lefe loth ſterne pace hall goth court manly toke ſtede thebe faſt gan ſpede enhaſting till large ſped forth toward lond arge thus leaue riding forth while retourne ayeine ſtile vnto king hall ſtood emong lord furious wood heart wroth euill apaied word tideus ſaied specially hauing remembrance proud diſpitous defiance while fat royall see vpon would auenged bee full cruelly euer befall ire gan call cheefe conſtable chiualrie charging faſt hie worthy choſe houſhold knew moſt manfull bold haſt tideus ſue tofore lond remue vp peine life leſing head without mercy anon dead falſely ethiocles laid ambuſhment way ſlain tideus repair knight fifty number mine author ſaith vnwarely comber armed echone maile thicke ſtele therewithall yhorſed wonder wele poſterne forth gonne ride gein path lay aſide secretly man hem aſpy onely treaſon fellony haſt hem forth long day cruell mallice ſtop way foreſt one aſſent full couertly tolay buſhment vnder hill ſtrait paſſage fallen auauntage ſame way tideus gan draw thilke mount y• sphinx ſlaw nothing ware opinion compaſſed conſpiration innocent like gentle knight rode aye forth till drow night sole himſelf without companie hauing man wiſe gie laſt lifting vp hede toward eue gan take hede mid way right line thought ſaw ayenſt moone ſhine shield freſh plate burned bright enuiron caſt great light imagining fantaſie treaſon conſpiracie wrought y• king journey lette nothing ſette well aſſured manly hert liſt one aſide diuert kept way ſhield vpon breſt caſt ſpere manly reſt worthy tideus outrayed fifty knight lying await ſlaen firſt platly mette body proudly ſmette fell dead cheefe maiſter hem one vpon fall euery paas compaſſe enuiron tideus high renoun bloody ſwerde let glide ſleeth killeth vpon euery ſide ire mortall tene meruell might ſo ſuſtene ayenſt hem euery halfe beſet ſwerde ſo ſharpe whet fomen found full vnſoot ala made light foot force grounded full great diſtreſſe knighthood high proweſſe vp roſe maugre fone came ſlough hem one one like lion rampant rage hill found narrow paſſage tooke full high prudence liche bore ſtonding defence fomen proudely aſſaile vpon plein blood made raile enuiron ſoile waxe redde fellen dedde lay one lay two three mercileſſe crueltee thilke day vpon hem found one enemy confound ſtood mighty champion beſide ſaw water tourned doun huge ſtone large round ſquare ſodainly ere ware lien none vpon foen rolled one ten hem wenten vnto wracke remenaunt amaſed drew abacke one one went miſchaunce thus finally brought outrance hem euerychone tideus bliue none one left hem aliue himſelfe yhurt ywounded kene harneis bleeding grene theban knight compas round valley ſlaine whole rout pitouſly againe moone gape none hem ſhortly might eſcape dead echone haue deſerued saue one except reſerued tideus entention king make relation knight haue journey ſped euerich hem life left wed meeting haue hem borne tellen aſſured ſworne tideus full lowly knee enſample openly ye may ſee truth little multitude hath ever fine victory falſhood ayens trouth falſhood hath might figh querels grounded vpon right without may victory euery man haue memory great power ſhortly conclude plenty good great multitude sleight engine force fellony arne feeble hold champarty ayenſt trouth liſt take heed end falſhood may ſpeed tendure long ye ſhall find thus record take worthy tideus arted hond throgh troth excellence fifty knight ſlough defence one except late told sworne aſſured hand vphold king tenforme atteint tideus bleeding wonder feint mate weary great diſtreſſe ouerlayd feebleneſſe might tho himſelfe ſuſtene tooke horſe ſtonding grene worthed vp forth gan ride eaſie paas wound wide ſoothly yet opinion alway aferde treaſon anguiſhous full buſie peine rode forth till atteine bound ligurgus lond worthy king manly hond tideus wounded came ligurgus lond full pale onely lacke blood tideus ſaw caſtle ſtood strong mighty built vpon roche toward faſt gan approche conueighed thider cleareneſſe ſtone night ayens moone ſhone high toures creſtes marciall joyning almoſt wall gardein little beſide tideus gan ride aduenture gate ſmall found reken luſty erber vnto deuiſe sweet freſh like paradiſe heauenly inſpectioun firſt alight adoun goodly place beheld necke voided hath ſheld drew bridle horſe hede let go tooke manner hede garden encloſed paſture ſoot gras tideus heauy ledde vpon hearbes greene white redde thought time beſt layd downe take reſt wearineſſe deſirous ſleepe none await body keepe dreames grudged euer emong lay till larke ſong note new high vp aire glad morrow rody right faire phebus alſo caſting vp beames high hils gilt ſtreames ſiluer dew vpon hearbes round tideus lay vpon cold ground vpriſt ſhene sunne ſtoundmeale greene wound runne round ſoile depeint greene red meint ligurgus doughter found tideus ſleeping herber forwounded euery morrow holeſomnes aire ligurgus doughter make repaire cuſtome aye emong floures new garden many diuers hew joy ſhe take hede ſtalkes ſeene hem ſprede alures walking fro ſhe little go ſelfe alone caſting vp ſight beheld armed knight lay reſt hearbes cold beſide ſhe gan eke behold mighty ſtede walking ſhe anon fell manner fere specially ſhe ſaw blood sprad greene ſhe ſtood laſt ſhe caught hardineſſe womanly gan dreſſe toward knight hauing manner drede great doubt leaſt dede ſoothly chiefe ſhe thought make priefe ſtood man full oft forth ſhe goeth toucheth ſoft lay honds ſmale face deadly bleike pale liche man adawed ſwough vp ſtert ſwerde drought fully put vp ayeine anone hath lady ſeine beſeeching onely grace haue pity treſpace rew womanhede fray fall drede leaſt aſſayled new thebanes preued full vntrue drede ſo rechlees full humbly yeelding pee triſt himſelfe y• paſſed bound ſhe ſaw mortall wound routh gentilleſſe diſeaſe diſtreſſe ſhould nothing diſmaied heart ſorrifull affraied diſcomfort manner thing qd ſhe doughter king called ligurge greatly delite euery morrow garden viſite ſo paſſingly diſport wherefore qd ſhe beth good comfort womanly lady acquit tideus diſeaſe wight touching voyage shall hinder ne doe damage ye liſt auenture plaine trouth vnto diſcure ſooth doe buſineſſe reforme greeuous heauineſſe might whole diligence hope great offence ye ſhall haue helpe aduerſite ferreforth lieth truſteth right well ye ſhall faut find ſaw ſhe ſo kind womanly ſo goodly benigne port many diuers ſigne vnto order ſpare auentures fully declare thebe firſt touching meſſage hill woody rage wound hurt ſore vaine rehearſe told euerydele ſooth ſhe liked neuer adele routh compaſſion miſcheefe wrought falſe treaſon riding haſt ſhould ſue womanly thought due chamber ſhe led vp aloft full well beſeine bed right ſoft richly abouten apparrailed cloth gold floure irailed ſame length brede firſt lady womanhede woman bid goodly attendant vnto wounded man vnarmed ſhert made firſt waſh wound ſmert tideus refreſhed caſtle lady ſerch hem well diuers inſtruments made fette ſundry ointment leech eke beſt ſhe coud find full craftely ſtaunch bind euery thing may done eaſe ſuage peine wo tapeaſe court caſtle ſought bidding chamber wrought ſake ſhe hath ſent ſuch deinties conuenient moſt nutritife phiſickes lore hem ſeke wounded reſtore making woman eke taken keepe await night ſleepe well ware nothing aſtart might luſty hart ſhe prayed abide till ſtrong mighty ride caſtle play diſport leiſer home ayeine reſort might welde large nought home arge tooke leaue next day without abode haſt way lowly thanking vnto goodneſſe freedome bounteous largeſſe womanly liſt take heed refreſh great need behoting full might would ſeruant true knight liueth ſhe charge forth rode till come arge tideus repeired home arge full great haſt would dwell ſhould rehearſe either tell repaire coaſts pleines great roches high mounteines manere home comming meeting welcomming joy adraſtus made ſuſter wife glade whereto ſhould write enbraced armes white gadering prees ſorrow polimites made himſelfe ſee ſore wounded greeuous hurt ſores eke vnſounded deadly looke face pale ginne new tale ſooth manner idleneſſe himſelfe order expreſſe firſt thebe hath borne ne king falſely forſworne thawait treaſon ſette fifty knight way mette ye haue heard manere without tale long ynow adraſtus made men ſeach euery coaſt many diuers leach come haſt make tarrying vpon peine bidding king done craft recured force euery part aſſured echone ſo cunning ſhew ſpace dayes whole made ſickneſſe tho joy ther gladneſſe throughout court al y• toun euery man hath ſuch opinioun tideus gentilleſſe manhood lowlineſſe hold moſt famous knight beſt beloued euery mannes ſight throughout greece euery region muſt make digreſſion tell ſhortly ſentement thilke knight tideus hath ſent thebe onely declare great miſcheefe euill fare vnto king befall open trouth knight tideus hath ſlaine hem euerychone ſaue himſelfe eſcaped none reſerued ſheding blood king tell plainely ſtood rehearſed euery poynt ethiocles ſtood ſuch diſjoynt ethiocles ſore aſtonied heard death knight hatefull ire wext nigh wood teene fell mood cruell mallice knight ſpake felly ſeid lacke manhode cowardiſe flaine ſo mortall wiſe hanged high neck death ſlaughter reck compleine eyther one miſcheefe befall doe force none aſtert ſigh vpon falſe coward hert knight hath renoun brought confuſioun full graceleſſe full vnhappy nay qd knight nothing ſo thine vnhap plainly ſo many worthy warriours life neuer ſhame except querele taken thy name grounded rooted falſeneſſe cauſe ſoothneſſe vnhap wot wele none thine vntrouth done vnto thy brother thou ſo openly forſworne percell cauſe lorne fals breaking thine aſſured oth tho king mad almoſt wroth purpoſe ſlea knight onely ſaid vnto right ala eue morrow suppreſſed deadly ſorrow renning aye remembraunce pitous vnhappy chaunce great miſcheefe miſauenture touching death diſcomfiture fieres himſelfe alſo ſhamefaſt importable wo ſuch mortall ſtrife weary owne life hent hath ſwerd aſide ſtert roue himſelf euen hert king himſelfe tho preſent rumour noiſe went thebe wood rage ſuch joyned linage knight ſlaine hill one one heart wold haue ariſen throughout y• citie vpon king auenged death cheefe occaſioun baron lord toun ful buſie rumour diſeaſe high prudence ſtint appeaſe quiete euery thing ſette body home fette knight like ye haue herd afore yſlaine bloody ſwerd tideus full ſharpe whet ground field ſo hem found onely loue affectioun solemnely brought hem toun like manere rite old firſt brent aſhes cold one yburied like degre lo kalends aduerſite sorrow vpon ſorrow deſtruction firſt king region lacke onely like told beheſts truly hold firſt ground root ruine ſtory clearely ſhall determine tale hereafter ſhall lere liſt remnaunt finitur par ſecunda ſequitur par tertia cruell mar full melancoly thy kind hote combuſt dry ſparkles ſhewen ſo ferre ſtreames red ſterre thy sphere goth cauſe thou ſo wroth wth hem thebe throgh who feruent ire city brent ſet fire bookes old well rehearſe conne cruell hate rooted begonne engendred ſtory maketh mind onely blood corrupt vnkind infection called originall cauſing ſtrife dredefull mortall miſcheef al grece ran king adraſtus alderfirſt began hath caſt conqueſt make vpon thebe polimites ſake knightly wiſe preue might full entent recure right firſt ſette parlement hath letter meſſengers ſent greece many ſundry king hem enhaſt make letting round made mention ſent alſo many region prince duke earles baron taken vp city tounes cheſen moſt likelieſt ſuch preued beſt manhood ſend hem vp ech one hond receiue pay anone adraſtus thebe ride tho lord abide great purveyaunce king adraſtus toward city thebe houſhold ſtill haue leaue take riden home retourne make country degre ſuſtene hem take vp meine make hem ſtrong knight ſqueres ſperes bow arbalaſteres haſt poſſible may returne beſt array tearme ſet full manly ſeine toforne arge mouſtren pleine king prince come adraſtus rede full worthy degre thider come firſt prothonolope record writing archade ſonne vnto king full prudent found warre pee came alſo king gilmichenes find full famous renoun thider come eke king ipomedoun paſſing knighthood name excelling worthineſſe fame noble king called campaneus came eke arge ſtory telleth thus proued full wele riden fer thider come king meleager king genor eke held royall ſee mine author ſaith lond greece king locris king pirrus eke king called tortolonus renouned many region come king called palenon oft aſſayed found manly knight broght ſtele armed bright full many worthy countre tideus moſt knightly ſee noble man worthy werriour worthineſſe flour maſter mirrour prowes hond hath ſent alſo mighty lond calcedoine heire kingdome rich feire charging counſaile officer alſo haſt may ſeeken beſt werriours famous knight proued ſouldeours al ye lond leid hem charge without abode come arge obey full lowly bidding enhaſting hem made letting ſped hem faſt vpon journy thebe mighty ſtrong city came doun knight wth many another man maugre king helpe conſidred firſt falſhood treaſon ymeued onely trouth reaſon polimites ſworne yore crowne juſtly reſtore large toun vnto arge deſcended doun like oth aſſurance bound ligeance come full lowly wiſe lowly done liſt deuiſe trouth full conceiued hath grace goodly hem receiued aſſigning hem place amid hoaſt aſſembled many diuerſe coaſt finally company ygadred floure cheualry ychoſen greekes lond moſt knightly manfull hond trow ſith world began ſeene ſo many manly man wele horſed ſpere ſhield togider ſembled ſoothly field men might ſee many ſtrange guiſes arming new vncouth deuiſes euery man fantaſie ſhould order ſpecifie euery peece longing armure thereupon doe buſie cure ſooth almoſt dayes werke tearmes alſo ſo derke rehearſe hem clearely rime paſſe ouer lacke time tell forth lodging adraſtus noble worthy king hath euery lord like degree receiued wele within citee like pleaſaunce needeth fulſome habundance men horſe plenty vitaile commaunding nothing ne faile theſe noble worthy werriours high low poore ſouldiours yſerued haue need adraſtus preſently tooke heed availeth king pay people truely fond full lich king touching tearme day toforne ſerued pay ſo free liſt nothing reſtraine man cauſe complaine hunger thruſt ne indigence thing ready vnto preſence prince ful great repriefe ſuffer people liue miſchiefe ful heauy greuous thought habound haue right nought may poſſede body hart rich ſeene people ſmart may body power wel conſtraine heart hath full long raine maugre might louen large may king heart ſet charge ne hem coarten libertee men ſaine ful often thought free ech prince lord gouernour ſpecially ech great injury importable wrong vnto ſonne next allie ye forne haue heard ſpecifie while greekes reſt time pee reſort vnto ethiocles thebe warely hath eſpied friend certified greekes wholly ordinaunce purpoſe eke purueyaunce thereof heart manner drede firſt tooke counſaile rede ethiocles made ſtrong ayenſt coming greek lord baron toun wiſeſt regioun might maken reſiſtence manly ſtonden defence ſo ſtrong dout country adjacent eke alſo forreine region hath withhold champion thereupon ſent eſpies friend next ally worthy dwelling enuiroun young freſh luſty gadred toun maskewed wals toures ſtuffed good finally greekes entent drede haue biſhop ſent wife amphiorax conſcience ſave oath diſcured husband ſoughten ſo long ere might find cauſe wife ſo kind ſo ſurely hath locked vp corp ſhe manner remors ſelfe greuing conſcience dreding fall great offence leaſt ſoule perill lorne ſhe oth compelled ſworne requiring ſhe coud tell lord biſhop ſhould dwell diſcure heart full loth till time ſhe gan
