foole jeoparde life diſcure counſaile wife yet ſhe full ſorry ſake ſpecially ſhe ſaw take hope heauineſſe gan taſſuage full ſoone proceſſe ſhort time gone tempeſt may leſt euer one biſhop force might vnto greekes conueyed full right hore grey chaire ſitting full glad comming hauing triſt full opinion cauſe occaſion wiſdome ſapience vertue high preſcience ſhould eſchue aduerſity poſſible fall journy ſtory fully hath deuiſed full circumſpect right wele auiſed hath pronounced parlement tofore lord preſident cleare conceit ſikerneſſe entriked doubleneſſe diſmall dayes fatall houres auentures ſharpe ſhoures froward ſort vnhappy ſtounds complaint deadly wound wofull wrath contrarioſty fell mar cruelty meane grey mood ſhall ſhed worthy blood greekes may eſchued purpoſe execute ſued ſhall fine high nobleſſe ſhall draw decline grekes blood miſcheefe ſorrow wo ſelfe alſo fate hath diſpoſed deepe ground ſhall encloſed locked vp derke vale cruell death lo tale biſhop adraſtus told counſailing purpoſe withhold eſcheuing miſcheefe ſorrow god tooke borrow theban greekes meet fine thereof ſhall ſo vnſweet greece ſhall rew warning hem miſcheefe knew ſhall follow man may lette would abſtaine ſiege ſette vnto thebe purpoſe leue whoſe word y• lord gan hem greue therein full ſmall delite euerich heartely high deſpite abreide ſe • vntrew contreuer prophecy new eke alſo long berd old dotard coward aferd rancour gonne defie calcling aſtronomie ſhortely ſaid took therof none hede ne thing gouerne hem rede clamour noiſe euery coaſt high low throughout hoaſt ſpecially poore ſouldiours lordes reigning flour eſtates effectuelly mene age tender grene haue marces influence werre great experience ye liſt ye may conſider ſee coueiting great aduerſitee youth perill caſt aforne till miſcheefe ſuddainly lorne age prouideth euery thing ere begin caſten ending age youth diverſe opinion youth gouerned large reine ſtert forth refreine head ſet one hurteleth ayenſt hard ſtones broſeth himſelfe vnwarely perbraketh age expert nothing vndertaketh toforne good diſcretion make due examination tourne either bad good youth faſt ſtirred blood taketh empriſes haſty wilfulneſſe ioy ginning end wretchedneſſe old prudent gouernaunce full long aforne maketh purueyaunce youth ala counſeil werke full oft ſtumbleth derke thus ſelde ſeene trouth termine age youth draw line folly hath domination wiſdome put ſubjection wiſdom without supportation availeth little nought like biſhop al high prudence cauſe might haue none audience wiſedome prophecy greekes holden folly though plato wiſe socrates morall seneke diogenes albumaſer prudent theolonee tullius ſoueraintee whylome rome eloquence though theſe ſhortly ſentence aliue moſt cunning expert man liſt counſaile aduert ſawes taken heed might auaile come need prudence find ſuccour prouidence hath fauour farewell wiſedome farewell diſcretion lacke onely ſupportation vnſupported locke hore amphiorax ſighen gan full ſore hed enclined many heuy thought y• ſaw counſail ſ • ood nought vtterly greekes told haue fully caſt journey yhold made hem ready gonne hoſtey toward thebe city werrey greece lenger tarry forth hem amphiorax carry set chaire dolefull hert wiſt might aſtert fate diſpoſition hoſteying region ligurge greekes approche ſundry lond many craggy roche way ſoothly gone horſe ne man water none dry valleyes pleines yeare reines full great drought made mention lond ſearching enuiron great miſchief greek default water nother found well ne riuere hem refreſh water clere ala refute ne conne importable ſhene sonne hote hem foulds ley miſcheefe men horſe dey gaping full dry vpward south ſome putten ſwerdes mouth ſpeare head ſtory told taſſuage thurſt yron cold life full many one deſpeired miſcheefe home ageine repeired till day worthy tideus eke king campaneus purpoſe rode throughout countree might water ſee coaſt coaſt ferre nere till fortune entred herbere tree ſhadowed fro ſunne ſhene full floures hearbes grene wonder holeſome ſight aire therein lady paſſingly faire sitting tho vnder laurer tree armes little child ſhe full gracious looke viſage alſo wonder tender age sonne king borne ſuccede called ligurgus ſtory rede whoſe heart joy worldly eke diſport mirth eke pleaſance comfort child excellent faireneſſe lady mirrour ſemelineſſe ſodainly ſhe caſt vp ſight vpon ſtede ſaw armed knight greatly abaſhed gan anon remue tideus gan faſt ſue tideus complained lady herber water ſaid ſuſter beth nothing diſmaied ſelfe diſpleaſed affraied come onely place beſeech mercy grace v ſuccour great need declaring ſtand indeed faſt almoſt hond worthieſt greek lond king prince lodged field many polax ſhield miſcheef perill great drede want water likely dede none high ne low degree hoaſt paſſed dayes three dranke ala except none eſtate fate ſo infortunate praying womanly pitee benignely graciouſly ſee greece cheualry liues ſtonds ieopardy ye would womanhood tell ye know riuer ſpring well specially care gentilleſſe vnto v declare lo ye luſt heare ſeine mine ſuſter deare lady inly vertuous complaint heard worthy tideus pity chaungeth chere hew heart vpon wo gan rew full goodly ſeeing diſtreſſe said vnto heauineſſe lady courteouſly taught tideus well certes qd ſhe large touching child haue charge ſhould haſt doth greue power helpe releue onely routh compaſſion leue occupation conuey true guide riuer little beſide dare ſo much aſſure little child put aduenture ſo fearefull depart ſake yet ſhall doe part life death true affection prouide ſaluation tooke child leid lap richely clothes gan wrap couched among herbes ſote leid many holeſome rote floures eke blew rede ſuppriſed manere drede tideus forth anon ſhe went ſhe trouth treaſon ment wey would neuer dwell till ſhe brought right faire well riuer water full habound glad tho jocound tideus ſeeing riuer haſt ſent meſſanger adraſtus abide downe deſcend riuer ſide hoaſt licour haue riuer liues ſaue enhaſted hem making none abode one riuer rode drinke ſo great luſt appetite ſtaunch thurſt ſome dranke found hem good ſome ſo feruent ſo wood vpon water ſikerneſſe vndiſcreet haſty greedineſſe meaſure water ſo drinke fell dead euen vpon brinke ſome naked riuer runne heat summer sunne bathen hem water ſo cold ſome alſo haue told meane tho prudent wiſe water dranke meaſurable wiſe thurſt haue endured refreſhed fully recured greekes high low degree profite commoditee compaſſe riuer chriſtalin ſight one accord tent pight reſt hem reles peine onely ſpace day tweine while grekes vpon riuer lay tideus vpon ſame day full knightly hath done diligence yong lady great reuerence adraſtus goodly preſent whoſe comming king himſelfe went ſhe falling doun knee theſtates tho preſent degree grekes lond abſent one armes tooke vp anon thanking beſineſſe labour kindneſſe behoting like hold thing pleinly ſhe wold may ſhe ſhould redy find alſo greekes ſtory maketh mind theſtates tho preſent thanked holle entent freſhing done many greke part behight eke body good two liſt commaund hem redy partly faile auctour maketh reherſaile lady ſo faire vpon ſe name iſiphile adraſtus told ye may rede lineally ſtocke kinrede sometime ſhe king doughter reherſing hal • e caas firſt ſhe countree went shortly ſhe wol nat aſſent execute conſpiracion made woman region thing contrary agein right ech hem vpon certein night one accord ſhall warely take kepe fader brother husband ſlepe kniues ſharp raſours kene kitte thortes mortall rene vnto fi • e • bochas tell land found man ſlaine echoue concluſion woman might haue dominacion kingdome reigne liberte party interrupted lady paſſing debonaire matere froward contraire kept fader ſlawe death preſerued withdraw ala ſhe fled countree pirat taken see king ligurgus brought dred trouth womanhed tooke yong child keepe herber ſhe left alone ſlepe tideus ſhe brought well • aſon ſome bookes tell lady ſonnes two hercules alſo toward colchos countree came raccompliſh conqueſt kam liſt ſee ſtory holle iſophilee fadres name alſo write though ſome ſein named thorite ſome bookes vermos eke call know auentures lady iſophile faire faithfull aye inly debonaire loke boke iohn bachas made whilom woman rhetoriques glade direct full ſouereigne ſtile faire iane queene ceſile rede r • brike iſophile trouth bounte full craftly compiled ſake ſhe leue hath take adraſtus homeward wey tideus gan conuey gardein till ſhe repeyred ala matere deſpeired joy wilfulneſſe deſtitute mirth gladneſſe w • begin ſharpe houres lady hath found among floures child ſlain foul serpent herber litel childe turned vp face slain serpent ſelfe place taile hurled ſcales ſiluer ſhene venim ſo perſing ſo kene mortall eke perilous violence cauſed ala long abſence ſlow homeward hie ſhe wepe waile crie ſhe nought ſigh compleine wofully wring honds tweine dedly looke pale face chere gan rende gilt treſſes clere oft ſithe gan ſay ala wofull wretch vnhappy caas ſhall whider ſhall tourne fine ſojourne wote right well may eſcape piteous fa • e ſhape soccour none ne none rede liche deſert mote dede ſlouth negligence haue ala done great offence guilte may excuſe shal king treaſon accuſe offence ſlouth two ſonne ded heire alſo loued al good treaſour none ſo nigh hert ſtood ſo depe graue courage likely fallen rage ſo mine odious offence reported vnto audience importable ſhall heauineſſe well wot verray ſothfaſtneiſe y• queen hath thing aſpied mine excute may denied doubt nat geineth pite without reſpite ſhe auenged ala haue deſerued death may preſerued nother bill ſupplication rage tranſgreſſion requireth death none mede thus ala ſhe quaking drede none helpe ne remedy dreint ſorow grekes ſhe ran hertely woo face chere diſtreined cheekes weping albereined hie affray diſtraught furious tofore al thoſte ſhe came tideus fell knee gan compleint make told pleinly grekes ſake muſt ded ſhortly ſubſtaunce reherſing y• ground greuaunce firſt traines falſe ſerpent child flaine ſhe abſent miſchief vnderſtood disjoint perill ſhe ſtood vnto full knightly behight helpe euer might pitious woo ſtinten appeaſe find vnto diſeaſe haſty comfort went full great paas adraſtus told caas vnhappy wofull auenture beſeeching doon beſy cure bound equite right eke aduertiſe haue ſight ſhe quitte grekes toforne likely haue ben lorne ſuccour void womanhede muſt knighthood take hede remedien vnhappy thing adraſtus like worthy king taquite himſelfe ſtory maketh mind lady found vnkind neither coſte ne trauaile beſy might auaile ſuccour conſidred thing thauife al worthy king grekes lond ben accorded thus prince duke hem tideus hold way one ride ligurgus dwelling beſide one entent may purchace wiſe get grace lady called iſophilee would aſſay might palaice full roially built ſtone worthy grekes came riding euerichone euery lord full freſhly ſtede ligurgus example manlyhede anon knew comming tacquite himſelfe like gentill king agein hem went mete hem way ful wel beſein good aray receiuing hem full knightly chere adraſtus ſaid ye ſhall coſin qd gan embrace ye welcome owne place thanking hertely high nobleſſe ſo goodly gentilleſſe towards ye liſt acquite ſelfe day coſin viſite caſtell take lodging neuer yet ſo glad thing life thereto trouth euermore ſhall ſlouth chambres large toures shall deliuered herberioures euery lord degree vnto lodging aſſigned ſhall bee officer let hem ſelfe deuiſe yf houſing largely may ſuffiſe ſtretchen atteine none eſtate haue cauſe compleine hoſt lodged beſide ententifely vpon abide let hem fet auctority vitaile inough city al may hem ſuccour ſaue word al euer haue full holle commaundement adraſtus ſtates grekes preiden ligurgus life iſophile qd adraſtus entent part cauſe comming come another thing certein gift requere benignely ye liſt may grekes paſſingly auaile requeſt faile dare openly expreſſe withouten ye gentilleſſe graunt affirme conferme ratifie bold ſpecifie qd ligurgus thing euer excepted onely thing three firſt touche life yong ſonne pleinly wife take good ye liſt pro • ide treaſour ſet theſe thing aſide ſurplus compt nat mite adraſtus aſtomed lite ligurgus concluſion ſonne made exception while treat thus fere came forth one wofull chere face looke pale nothing red loud crieth king ſonne ded ala whilom ſo feire ligurgus borne ben heire ala hath yolden vp breath serpent ſtong vnto death wound new freſh greene herber lieth pity ſeene hath ſo lien almoſt day ligurgus heard affray wiſt child dead mo little wonder though wo ſodainly importable ſmart ran anon hent hart ſorow king ligurgus made death child lamentation queen conſtreint deadly peine throughout felt coruen euery veine rage gan mine ſo depe could ſobbe ſigh wepe noiſe lamentacioun quene diſtraught deſcended doun ſhe knew ground ſorrow needed teares borow twenty time vpon row aſwound ſhe fell earth low ſtoundmell miſchaunce still ſtone ſhe lieth traunce child court brought tofore ligurgus ala wite nought vpon corp mortall face fell atones gan embrace sore griſpe agein vp ſert adraſtus thing aduert kingly routh compaſſioun eyen teares fell adoun eke king duke ſtood onely pity gentill blood power teares reſtreine cheekes doune began reine day would ſuffiſe ſorowes order deuiſe firſt king queene alſo tellen al ſhould neuer haue ſpace almoſt houre ſtormes teary ſhoure weping ſomewhat ouergone litel corp grauen vnder ſtone adraſtus ſame tide ligurgus toke litel ſide full wiſely prudent ſpech queene preſent gan tech ſo ſorow auaile may right nought murdre himſelf owne thought ayeinſt death may recure though wo perpetually endure al helpeth ſoule go life thus taketh heed thereto exile pilgrimage ful turment bitter rage liche see renning fro suing ebbe flood litel ſpace abiding full whoſe ſojourne pope yeueth bull king none duke ne emperour may ſhroud ayenſt fatal ſhour cruel death liſt manace marke man mortall mace geineth ſaluation neither franchiſe ne protection littel nought may helpen caas sauf • ondir eyther ſuperſedeas world ſo loketh aright none ſo great power might none ſo rich ſhortly ſo bold muſt die either yong old youth paſſeth paſſage eſcaped wood rage ſorrow trouble preſent life repleniſhed conteke warre ſtrife ſelde neuer ſtondeth ſurete wherefore beſt ſeemeth man grutch high prudence ſonde god taketh patience ye ſo wiſe manly ſelfe drowne torment wo loſſe thing ye liſt ſee wiſe may recured bee great folly vndiſcretioun thus adraſtus hath conueyed doun ſubſtance whole would ſay till found ti • pray conuement iſophilee beſeching haue pite ſhe hath offended highneſſe wilfully reckeleſneſſe firſt would dome ſo diuide mercy preferre ſet right aſide requeſt prayer hem vnhap miſcheefe fall haſty rigour doe vengeaunce thinke aforne purueyaunce wretch doth mercy drede shall mercy find hath moſt nede ſith hath power might ſpace let take lady grace lacke routh ſhe nat thus die tho quene gan replie queen algate serpent dead platly ſaid matere auaileth neither requeſt prayere pite mercy remiſſion condicion serpent cauſe ſorow labour lay hed borow finall vtter recompence find grace great offence elles ſhortly ſhede blood blood greekes anſwere vnderſtood one actord beſt wiſe toke hem auenturous empriſe loue onely iſophile gon ride enuiron contre hilles valeis roches caues diches darke old graues euery coſt ſerching vp doun till laſt full famous renoun worthy knight parthonolope firſt happed ſe hidous serpent riuer ſide great horrible ſterne full pride vnder roch banke lowe haſt bent ſturdy bowe therein ſet arowe filed kene body ſpotted blew grene parthonolope ſlew serpent full mightely made glide hent ſwerde hanging ſide smote hed anon hent therwithal gan queene preſent wherethrough parcel ſhe gan taſſwage thus proweſſe high corage manly man parthonolope hath reconciled faire iſophile vnto grace fully queene ire voided old tene adraſtus mediacion king ligurgus graunted pardon lady daunger fre reſtored liberte palaice al life dwell though iohn bochas contrary tell auctour affirmeth drede child y• ſerpent dede durſt great offence neuer come preſence ligurgus entention fled anon region hert ſhe tooke childes death ſo ſore felle find ye haue herde aforne ſpecifie kingdome bookes lie nota de ligurgo rege traceae licurgus called trace rede place ſame mighty champion athene came palamon ayenſt brother called arcite yled chaire iiii bolles white vpon hed wreth gold full fine find eke bachus god wine baccus deus vini king whilom debate onely pompous elate deſtruction vine firſt ſet alay wine meint water ſtrong bacchus great wrong brake lims dreint ſee ligurgus ye get trouth ye liſt verifie rede goddes genealogie nota de duodecim arboribus libra bochacii de genealogia deorum lineally kinred degree ybranched vpon xii tree made bocchas decertaldo called among poetes itaile ſtalled next fraunceis petrarke ſuing certein vnto grekes retourne agein tell forth ſhortly con journey haue begon adraſtus hath leaue take ligurgus browes blake departing ſeint ihon borow made wardes next morow wel beſein ſo mighty ſo ſtrong wondre early larke ſong trompet warned euery man ready haſt remue letting make ſo haue right wey take toward thebe grekes euerichone ſuch nombre gadred one worthy knight neuer aforn ſein feere mouſtred plein ne ſtint none occaſioun till comen euen afore toun pight tent prowdely rede vnder walles grene mede theban beſette manly knight would haue priked haue ſcarmiſhed haſty pride fomen ou ſide bidding ethiocles thilke night kept hemſelfe pee becauſe onely ſo late great wait ſet euery gate men armes night walking walles bidding king leſt traine treaſon toures chief dongeon ſet men make mortall ſownes braſen horne loud clariounes full entent watch kepe warde man ne ſlepe grekes proudly long night kindled fire made full great light set vp lodging vpon euery ſide like ſhould euer abide compas toun voide ſpace ſet fomen manace while tofore cite ley euery coaſt ſent forreie forrey greek made countrey thebe bren townes thropes vilages great rauing making pilages spoile robbe brought home vitaile manere ſortes beſtaile shepe nete cruell rage houndes ſlaine ſauage herte hind bucke blacke bere wild ro fat swine tusky bore carrying home grekes ſtore wheate wine auantage hay otes foddre forage kalendes hem thought due grekes gan theban ſalue miniſtring hem occaſions fell ſiege ſet ſhortly tell full entent hateful pride life death thereupon tabide ſo euer thereat agreued till fully purpos haue acheued may thereof made reles ful ware ethiocles gan party greatly merueile ſaw great apparaile grekes citee round himſelfe manner dout point beſt thilke time ſtode ſo ſome abiding toun hert great ſuſpecion leſt toward vnſtable brother party fauorable variaunce thebe among hemſelfe cite variaunce vnto great miſchance nede ſhortly ne wiſt vpon might triſt nat one entent wherfore hath counſeil ſent lord old queene soch dempte pure clene holle one heart variable old expert alwey found ſtable requering hem becauſe wiſe openly tellen auiſe better pleinly ſight brother treaten fight ſome gaue full blunt ſentence werre none experience said beſt ben aferde try right manly ſwerde ſome alſo prudent spake vnto good auiſement liſt ſpare conceite told beſt couenant hold perfourme heſt made toforn brother lich ſworn y• word wors make ſpede found variant dede none hatred rancour ne pride tho queene toke aſide word worthy queen jocaſta unto ethiocles told pleinly full vnfitting soch doubleneſſe finden king ſaid eke although ſtrong vnto brother wrong towne record dede bere witneſſe come nede wherefore let v ſhape mene mattere grene ere querele thus gon volunte turne fine aduerſite darreyned battaile truſteth moſt may full lightly faile folie ſhort auiſement put ſtrife martes judgement hard judge wood treate aforne without loſſe blood put mater holle marte ſwerd law doth coarte may hap ye glad wroth thou thy brother ſhull repent many another preſent treſpas ben innocent many thouſand perca ſhall complein debate onely tweine ſtrife ſhall find full vnſwote thou art ginner ground rote injury great vnright goddes hereof han ſight thou ſhall accompts rekning make tho periſhen thy ſake cauſe driuen ſo ferre sodeinly pee either haſty werre mot folow anon fatall chaunce life death dependeth balaunce thou ne maiſt craft reſtreine vpon one platly tweine ſort mote fall ilke doth tourn ſo euer thereat either laugh mourn thou art driuen ſo narow ſtake thou maiſt mo delay make fight treat vtter fine none engin thou canſt decline haſty caas folke ſain ben wiſe redreſſe requereth full ſhort auiſe trete long auaileth nought point ſothly thou art brought either keepe thy poſſeſſioun haſt deuoid toun wher thou therwith wroth wel appaid note well haue ſaid counſell wiſely condeſcend wrong wrought old newly amend time come may none wherefore haſt treate thy brother make reſiſtence thy lordes fully yeue credence whoſe counſeill • ithe ſo ſage let polimite enjoy heritage ſhall tourne moſt thine auaill loo holle fine counſail treaty ethiocles ſent unto brother ſhortly tho ire wroth though hereto froward loth according hearing prees algate ſhall treate pee muſt condicion haue dominacion firſt chiefe himſelfe reſerued thought well deſerued ſaue holle ſouereintee vnder thebe citee graunt right good chere polimite reigne yeere tauoide reſort agein claime vein would done onely ſake otherwiſe none end make greekes fortune euer befall finally emong lord na one high low eſtate would gone ambaſſiat towne ne bet ne wors till iocaſta made ſadle hors caſt ſelf gon treate make end would done morow right time vpon howre drew prime went yonge doughters tweine antigone faire imeine meine full many one gate ſhe conueied purpoſe ſhe made firſt went horſebacke king adraſtus tent lord fere receiue right glad chere shewing like degree euery halfe full great humanite polimitie riſing place humbly moder gan embraee kiſſed antigone eke imeine excellent beaute paſſingly faire great pres concours repaire lady haue ſight iocaſta proceedeth anon right adraſtus matere propoſe gan openly diſcloſe entent ethiocles meane deſireth pee reſerue ſhe gan ſpecifie honour whole regalie ſceptre crown diuided whole hath prouided polimite conditioun vnder reigne toun ſoget ſuffrance brother grekes thoughten another knightly anſwer worthy tideus ſpecially worthy tideus pleiuly affirming ſhould nat thus haue condition ſet aſide excepcions nothing reſerue ſpeciall hole lordſhip regally polimites fully poſſede thebe crouned verely dede rightfull king put poſſeſſion like couenaunts convencion ymade old aſſured enſealed ſhall new repealed ſtable holle ſtrength ſtond let platly ſo vnderſtond firſt deuoid toune deliuere sceptre croune brother make therof ſhortly elles ſhall bought full ſore matere brought end greekes none ſhul hen wend er right v denied life death darreined tried erſt toun remewe liſt thing eſchue miſchiefe ſtinten appeſe either part may great eſe thus meane auauntage deliuer vp hool trew heritage brother heire endure greekes ſhall fully aſſure bond liſt deuiſe yere complete beſt wiſe deliuer ayen poſſeſſion without ſtrife contradicion fine juſtly hold v fall ſo let wait onely werre houre come deferre lo thus ye may report ayein ye reſort appointment caſt v nat vary yet amphiorax y• contrary full pleinly ſaid concluſion fine ſhall cauſe deſtruction hem echone forth procede performed execute dede thilke time eloquence ſoth litell audience whether ſo ment good ill king adraſtus bad ſtill tho iocaſta wiſedome tech humble port full ſoft ſpech gan ſech meanes fantaſie ſhe might ire modifie greekes make hem encline wiſe rancour fine deuour beſie cure befell wonder auenture cauſe ground great confuſioun greekes perturbing eke toun tell may aſſert ſtile mote aduert tame tygre dwelling thebe ſhortly tell deſcriptioun tygre dwelling toun kingdome beſiden adjacent egipt thebe ſent beaſt record ſcripture moſt ſwift nature kind alſo moſt ſauage moſt cruell rage clerkes maken mention body reſembleth lion like greyhound moſell hed eyen fire red eke skin written finde like panther conuerſant inde manner hue colour ful ofte deceiued mirrours fraude huntes falſe apparance shewed glas withouten exiſtence kindeles ſleights take deſtreined may reſcus make like lambe tigre tame ayenſt kind mine auctour writ ſame beaſt merueilous ſee ſent imeine antigone vnto hem great comfort coud pley make good diſport like whelpe yong age wight damage ſoth doth litell hound worth many hundred pound vnto king ay greuaunce ther nothing y• pleſaunce treſour might bought penſife thought put heauineſſe thilke time ſtory doth expreſſe iocaſte treated pee tame tigre party rekeles gate ſight many man field wildly ran caſuelly renning fro doth tame ro greekes weening yong age tigre ſauage cruelly beſetting place round gan enchace till ded ſlaine field ſlaughter y• beheld proud theban y• wals ſtood ran doun furious wood wening ſlaine deſpite taking hors without reſpite fully purpoſed greekes fight tigres death tauenge might forth rode without gouernaile full proudly greekes gon aſſaile hatred full high deſdain fellen hem han tigre ſlein cruelly quitten hem mede many greeke grene mede force great might fomen lay ſlain fight tigres death ſo ſore abought mortally theban hem wrought hoſt field ligging aſtonied ſodein thing wiſe rancour rekeles thebe rode ethiocles eke worthy king tremour hond noble werriour made grekes forſake place tent gan hem enchace midde field togider mette horſebacke ſperes ſharply whette hate enuious pride full many one dead either ſide thing tideus eſpieth wood lion horſebacke hieth neuer deal aferd ran hem met • e hem berd maugre hem cruelty made hem flee home city hem purſuing full deadly hate many one lay ſlain gate gaping vpright wound wide vtterly durſt abide tofore ſwerd tideus hem ſo paſſing furious many theban rofe hert iocaſta ſlaughter aduert polimite ſhe prey gan full faire make greekes home repaire woulden ſtint aſſaile thilke time ceaſſen battaile who requeſt plainly preire reuerence moder dere polimite hert comfort greekes made home ayein reſort tideus ſtinten chace thebe haſting great pace ful triſt heauy ben entred toun tigre concluſioun ye haue herd firſt began ſtrife many theban day loſt life recureles hath yeuen vp breath thauenging tiger death al duely ſhe ought queen iocaſta humbly beſought king adraſtus holly grace meane wey wiſely purchaſe make pee betwene brother twein tretee ſo prudently ordein either part blood ſhad thus adraſtus auiſed right ſad grekes party anſwere yaue anon end ſhortly gate ſhe non lich lordes fully ben auiſed tideus forn hath deuiſed ſhe ſaw may none leue toke home cite repaired hauing guide polimite riding ſide tideus led antigone archade protonolope worthy king belie peine attendant vpon faire imeine who hert ſhe hath ſeruice lured ayein hath portreied figured mid breſt lightly may paſſe holly fetures treſhly face thought ſhe ſo faire creature though durſt diſcure yet hert ferforth hath aluowed true man vnwiſt plainly vnknow marked cupides bow arrow ſodainly werreied yares lady conueied entred drew eue grekes hem taking tho leue though ſome hem loth depart yet wiſedome durſt 〈◊〉 vnder conduct enter toun leſt tourned confuſioun though ſome bookes contraire ſain mine aucthour plaine affermeth opinion tideus high diſcrecion wilfulneſſe foly ne would tho put jeopardy neither himſelf ne none feres lady heauenly cheres angelike looke countenaunce liche put remembraunce entring grekes toun polimite great affectioun queene beſought yt thilke night fine taſſay ſhe might encline ethiocles conſcience right kepe couenaunt hath behight full yore agone ſurpluſage leſt contraire come damage firſt himſelf many another mo thus thebe greek ben ago tent reſt hem night lucina moone ſhone full bright within thebe depe dongeon iocaſta made relacion vnto king told giſe greekes vtterly deſpiſe profer made falſe concluſion onely except conuencion old engroſſed great purueiance enrolled put remembrance vpon finally reſt counſailing thought beſt conforme bound leſt fine falſneſſe confound counſaile ſet price dempt himſelf ſo prudent ſo wiſe wilfull indurate hert malice obſtinate vtterly auiſed thought within thebe brother get right noght errour thus emong hem toun day day plaieth lion cruelly ſo rode theban non aforne face abode made hem high renoun great ſlaughter occiſioun death ſwerd fled came next laid life wedde quit himſelf ſo like manly counteſſes lady graece arrayed hem toward thebe lady woman degree aſſembled arge citee like rede clothes blake behold ſorrow make death man aliue ſhould diſcriue tender weeping woful ſouns complaint worthy knight duke athene cheualry repaired home feminy led full faire vpon ſeene manhood ipolita queene ſiſter called emely theſe woman firſt gan eſpy worthy duke came riding king adraſtus hem heard toforne well rehearſed depford vale beginning knight tale final deſtruction thebe compendiouſly rehearſed knight tale firſt herd hem ſpeke routh felt heart breke ſorrowes gan aduart courſer malles great labour beat downe walles writing alſo ſaine campaneus wals ſlaine caſt ſtones ſo ouerlade adraſtus ſuch ſorrow made man may releaſe paine iocaſta doughters twaine full wilfully oppreſſed richeſſe duke theſeus hem forſooke athene right way tooke laurer crowned ſigne victory palme conqueſt glory honour duly vnto marte woman wept parte king adraſtus lady repaired home ayen arge king adraſtus home ayein arge tellen great charge eke alſo ye ſhall vnderſtand ginning tooke hand promiſe concluſion rehearſe deſtruction mighty thebe thus adraſtus locke hore still abode arge citee vnto end ye get sauf mine authour liketh compile liued old ere ſiege began thought ſorrow ſo vpon ran ſooth ſhorted hath day time ſet death maketh delay joy paſſed gone lord aliue one ſlaine thebe ye known caas king arge buried full royally great ſolemnitee accounted bookes ye may ſee four hundred year tofore foundation rome city thebe deſtroyed cccc yeare made mention tofore building foundation great rome ſo royal ſo large lady departed arge country full triſt deſolate lo fine conteke debate lo might mar y• froward ſterre lo beginne werre concludeth enſample ye may ſee firſt y• grekes ſith theban cite eyther part hath matter complaine ſtrife ye may ſee thing twaine worthy blood greece deſtroyed ſiege city brought nought final loſs party worthy blood greece ſpilt thebe eke amphion firſt built without recure brought ruine ſoile made plaine line wilderneſſe tourned deſerte grekes eke fall pouerte men alſo good finally gentill blood ſhed wound wer ſo wide loſſe finall vnto either ſide warre none exception high eſtate ne low condition fate fortune fere liſt diſpoſe double chere bellona goddeſſe battaile bellona y• goddeſſe chare aforn prouideth wherfore euery man beware vnauiſed warre beginne man wote ſhall leſe winne hard either part leſeth doubtleſſe neither hem cheſeth muſt ſuch mortall rage maugre luſt feelen great damage may mannes might reſtreined warre ſooth neuer ordeined ſinfull folkes chaſtiſe bible truly deuiſe war firſt began heaven high pride surquedy lucifer high heauen pride ſurquedy lucifer fader enuy old serpent leuiathan firſt euer warre began michael heauenly champion feres venquiſhed dragon hell caſt downe full low serpent hath coccle ſow earth enuy debate vnneths none eſtate without ſtrife liue charitee euery man high low degree enuieth ſhould thriue ground cauſe men ſo ſtriue couetiſe falſe ambition eueriche would haue domination ouer trede vnderfoot ſorrow ginning root chriſt recordeth rede looke ye may ſe lacke loue wt miſcheef ſhall surget gen contra gentem luc xxi people doth deuiſe ayenſt another hate ſhall ariſe telleth diuiſions ſhall betweene region eueriche buſie oppreſſe ſuch ſtrife beareth witneſſe kalends take word borrow ginning miſcheefe ſorrow men haue found experience venim violence ſtrife warre conteke debate maketh londs bare deſolate shall proſcript voided place martes ſwerdes ſhall manace ſpere greeuous vnitee one two three eke three one ſoueraine lord pee exile ſake chees loue onely trouble termine borne pure virgine let v pray moſt good mankind ſhadde heart blood beſeeching heauenly quene wife moder maiden clene ſend v peace life preſent ſinnes perfite amendement joy eternall hence wend tale thus make end endeth ye may ſee deſtruction thebe citee old obſcure word chaucer explained whereof
